comment: Super simple to setup and easy to use. I was up and running in less than 15 minutes. The app is easy to use and the instructions are very simple. It's essentially 4 steps.1) Stick sensor on garage door. I was worried this would be a two-part sensor like the little lasers at the bottom that detect if someone walks through the beam while it's closing. It's not. It's a small puck, about half the size of a deck of cards, that sticks on your door with supplied fastening tape. This device communicated with the base to tell the base whether the door is open or closed.

I could have dealt with just not spending the money monthly to get the additional services that some ppl complained about, but this thing just did not work at all. I spent a couple of hours on ladders and waiting for the app to respond, factory resetting, repeating again and again. In the end, it never worked. Even those few times where the device would show up in my device list, the control didn't work and it didn't report the right status. Then it would stop responding. Wifi signal was great, it just didn't work. There's just no excuse in 2018 for an app to be that bad for a consumer product.Perhaps the biggest clue that this product is bad is that the instructions state to mount the unit 4-6 ft away from the garage door motor. So I dutifully measure 6ft and go to plug it in, only to realize that the cord it comes with is 5ft. A frustrating waste of time and energy.

These work, but the whole system is greatly flawed. I have cats that have access to the garage and they like to play "beat the door," to see if they can get in or out before the door closes. If something causes the door closure to fail 3 times, you can only reactivate the controller by manually closing the door while at home and pressing the link button on the sensor. Sometimes, the sensor just disappears from the myQ app or website altogether, until you delete everything and re-add it all. There is no excuse for a device whose use is critical when you are away from home to ever stop working and require your physical presence at the house to reconnect. It should let me try to close the door as many times as I want. I have cameras that allow me to see if the doors are closed or not. I don't need this blind device to tell me I can't try to close the door again until I'm back home. If I take a week's vacation and it stops working on day 2, my garage is just going to be open for 5 more days? Ridiculous and terribly disappointing, but when it wants to work, it's awesome.

The MyQ hub is very easy to install.  I couldn't get my iPhone to connect to the hub (was using Bluetooth, I think I was supposed to connect with WiFi maybe?) but I used the WPS feature on my router and it connected almost right away.Installation in the garage was very simple with a cordless drill, and the unit immediately 'learned' my Craftsman garage door signal.  I now get notifications on my iPhone when the door opens and closes and if it stays open longer than I want I have the ability to close it remotely.  I'm very happy with the unit and would recommend to anyone who wants to have remote access and information for a Chamberlain brand garage door opener.

The package arrived on time and it only took 15 minutes to install.  It actually let's you open and close the garage from your phone and it shows how long the door is open or closed.  I was also able to connect it to my Nest camera and my Xfinity system, so that was a bonus.  Works great and does what it says.

This is one of the worst products I've ever used.1. The device immediately closed my garage door every time I opened it manually! I could not open my garage door with the device installed. See attached video. For this reason I returned it. I'm not interested in trying to fix a problem that could lock me out of my house.

UPDATED REVIEW - 5/14/2019:I originally gave this thing one star, only because I couldn’t give it 0.25 stars. I’m updating to 4 stars only because it was a rocky start. It started off extremely frustrating.  You can read the saga, below. Both Chamberlain and Amazon Key customer service have been fantastic. Above and beyond. Unbelievable. Because it’s in Amazon’s best interest that their in-garage delivery program succeed. It took some time to get things right, but in the end I think I finally got it and it works flawlessly. Here’s hoping my internet or electricity never goes out so I don’t have to go through and reprogram this silly thing.Do these things and nobody will get hurt. Position your Chamberlain hub (the thing on the ceiling in your garage) away from any LED lights. This includes any LED lights that might be screwed into your garage door motor. (I know it’s 2019; there aren’t many choices when it comes to lightbulbs.) And I have some extremely bright LED shop lights on my ceiling as well. I moved my box (see the picture) 90 degrees away from the garage door motor and the LED lights. I think this is what did the trick. It seems to be outside the influence of LED electromagnetic fields. It does need to be at a minimum 4’ from the garage door motor, but the cable is only about 5’ so you won’t be going far. I also positioned the door sensor in direct line-of-sight of the Chamberlain hub. Whether this makes a difference or not, I don’t know. But after all I’d gone through, I was willing to try anything.

Installation was really easy. One hub can control two garage doors if you buy a second sensor. The app works to control operations of the doors. However the Google integration is absolutely terrible. It was a pain in the butt to set up and every time you use it you have to ask to talk to myQ. Then this annoying guy's voice shows up and explains what you can do EVERYTIME.  Then you ask it to open the garage door 1 and it asked which one.  You tell it which one again and it says it is closed and then exits out. Thanks for nothing annoying MyQ!  Why can't these stupid smart internet of things be smarter?

First off, II have lots of smart home equipment and experience (e.g. Smart Home Alarm, Alexa, Hue hub and bulbs, Smart Cameras).  Installation of this "smart" garage door opener was easy.  It worked as expected for about one day.Then the garage door sensor would get out of sync if the garage was activated using a remote instead of the app and think the garage was open when it was in fact closed or vice versa.  I verified that this was not due to batteries in the garage door sensor.  The hub regularly times out and looses sync.  The iOS application (MyQ)  is very poor written.  Many of the submenus have no back button, so if you go into them, you have to kill the application and restart.  The application lost my Chamberlin hub from its settings several times and I had to reenter it by scanning the included QR code.

Several hours on the phone with a rude and condescending Chamberlain tech services person I am returning this and will be unable to have Amazon deliver in my garage. I have a Lift Master 1250LM opener made in May of 1995 (information stamped in metal on the opener) which is supposed to work with this but does not. Keypad outside and buttons inside work flawlessly.Adding this device did not work despite following directions exactly. Called tech services May 1, 2019 mid morning. Tech services person kept telling me that I was not following directions. That it needed to be 4 to 6 feet from the opener when I told her it was a measured 5.5 feet. Moved it to 4 feet then moved it to 6 feet with no success. Then she told me I was skipping steps on the app which I was not. Started over numerous times and told her each time the app wanted something or the screen changed and asked if it was Ok to go to the next step.

I bought this device to replace my existing Wemo Maker garage door opener, because I wanted to be able to use Alexa with it. Boy, was I wrong!First, I discovered that MyQ does not integrate with other smart home hubs like Alexa or Smartthings. The only way to do so is to use IFTTT. But to do that, Chamberlain demands $1/month! When I ordered this device, I missed the bullet (or it got inserted after I bought it) saying "SMART COLLABORATIONS – Linking your myQ account to Google Assistant and IFTTT requires a $1 monthly or $10 annual subscription fee." Even if I had seen it, I don't use Google Assistant, so I would not have cared.

They have subscription fee for connecting to Google home or IFTTT!!!After spending hours to set  and install this device I noticed that Chamberlain has monthly or yearly subscription fee for connecting to google home or IFTTT !!! While Google and other company provide their service for free for all smart devices this company is charging for this interface, I haven't heard of any other company to have subscription fee for connecting to Google or Amazon.

It's really a simple device and easy to install. I installed it and got it up and running in less than an hour. No hubs or anything else is needed -- other that a wi-fi signal. Works as expected and I will buy the second sensor, soon.When you open or close the door remotely, the unit beeps pretty loud and the light flashes about 5 seconds before it actually moves. That's a bit annoying. But if you think about it, that makes sense in the scenario where someone is in the garage and they have no idea the door is about to move. Besides, you're rarely activating it while inside the garage.

This has to be one of the biggest wastes of money I have unfortunately paid for.  Less than 2 months into owning it and the garage sensor has already died.  I have also had the same issue as other people where the garage door opens on its' own and no one has initiated the action.  This happened several times a week, so I had to disconnect the device.  I tried all of the items in the support pages to stop it.  Reading the reviews, I figured these issues were only a vocal minority but it turns out they both happened to me.I tried emailing Chamberlain 5 days ago and still have not heard back from them.  Unfortunately, the customer service of Chamberlain is on par with the quality of the product.  I had to disconnect due to my garage door opening randomly.  I was afraid that something would get stolen.

Before purchasing the myQ Hub to monitor my two overhead car doors, I reviewed probably 200 customer feedback postings.  While I noticed a number of negative claims that the MYQ-G0301 didn't work well I was hesitant to take those comments at face value as I had previously installed a myQ Chamberland opener on a 3rd overhead garage bay for my golf cart bay and had no issues at all in the last year with it.The G0301 installation went smoothly and flawlessly, but repeating the words of a number of posters in this blog YOU HAVE TO CAREFULLY FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS for a number of reasons. !!!

This is a product with much potential hampered by poor execution. There is no way to automate door opening. The excuse of security assumes the customer is clueless. I have been doing home automation longer than Chamberlain. The “connection” between hubs like Wink and this device are very unreliable.The opener has no recover function when shutting the door and something interrupts the door sensor  This could be as simple as attempting a close 15 seconds after an interrupt.  There is no way to trap for an error in logic.

First of all, it is a beast to set up. The app doesn't recognize (forgets?) the door opener after you have just set it up, over 10 times initially. Then it works for two or three times and will not operate after that. It is seeing the door sensor, because it accurately tells me that the door is up or down after controlling it with the remote (local) or the hardwired opener. It just refuses to work. Look it up on line and see all of the frustration that this product causes its buyers. The suggestions from Chamberlain on those pages JUST DO NOT WORK. If I do not hear from a rep from this review very quickly with a software/firmware update in the next day or two, I will return this thing. What a disappointment. This is my first negative review on Amazon...

In concept, a great product to make sure your garage door is closed and secure when it needs to be. I have a detached garage and live alone, so this purchase was more about piece of mind vs. allowing access in/out remotely. I installed very quickly the day it arrived (5/31), opened and closed as it should...alerts came in immediately. It is all about the alerts.On 6/2 I was in the garage and opened the door from the internal opener switch, no alert! Closed it and that alert came through. Opened and closed again later in the day, both alerts came through. An anomaly?? I hope so!

This is my second sensor besides the one for the main garage door that comes with the MyQ hub. The main garage sensor has worked flawlessly till now. But the additional sensor reports that the door is open when in fact it is closed. It takes some effort to get the door and the app/hub back in sync and one has to use the hardwired buttons to do this.It is annoying when you leave the house to get an alert that the door is still open, turn back and find out that the sensor lied. Not to mention spending another 10-15 minutes getting everything back in sync.

I was a little skeptical about this after reading some of the negative reviews but went ahead and ordered the kit and an additional door sensor to cover the two doors in my three-car garage.  The pieces are small and light, and installation was very easy following the directions in the quick-start guide.  After about 30 minutes I had everything in place and working.  The app was easy to install and set up as well.  Some of the app features are really neat, like the ability to have the doors shut automatically at a certain time every night, or to get alerts every time a door is operated.  For the price, I feel like it was a great value and it's working very well.  Recommended!

I have a home full of connected devices including Nest, Wink, Google Home, smart outlets, Chromecasts, connected lights, water sensors, etc, most of which are connected directly or via IFTTT.  Never, ever have I been required to pay a subscription to connect to any service from any other service.  Not only is Chamberlain wanting to you to pay a subscription, but they are wanting a fee for each different service you want to use!!!  On top of that, they are entirely unclear on what that subscription will provide you.  For example, the Google assistant connection only allows you to check door status and close it and they want you to pay monthly for that!  One of the only reasons I bought this device was to be able to use my phone to control the garage door since the remotes are aging and not working very well.  I thought I would be able to use Google assistant to open my garage door hands free.  Nope...I have to log into my phone, open an app and navigate it to open the door.  Not exactly safe or convenient.  The device itself does work well and the integration with Wink is nice, but Chamberlain highly overrates the value of the connections and they will not be getting any addition money from me nor any recommendations.

In two days, the app has failed multiple times including erroneously opening the garage while I was away.Chamberlain charges a premium fee for each integration, and this hub does not work at all with the google Home integration after hours of attempts to resolve their redirecting error that they are aware of for months.

It's 2019 and this thing still does not support Alexa? Be warned, this device claims to be smart but is about as dumb as they get. Half the time it thinks it's open when it is closed, and vice versa. Make sure you have a security camera in your garage to check it is closed. It does not support Amazon Alexa, and never will. It's a shame they sell this on Amazon but don't want to support the amazon ecosystem! The app frequently hangs. Setup is tricky and it can get stuck in endless loops during the setup process. I finally got the setup to complete on attempt EIGHT. The google, Wink, and Nest integration don't really do anything. If you want to do anything cool (and they really limit what you can do!), you have to pay lifetime fees for as long as you own the device. Not much, but as a matter of principle, a customer should not have to pay fees on something for this when the competition is free and they already PAID for the device. Customer service is unresponsive and they throw shade and attitude when you ask about enhancements to the product which require simple software changes. This will last until I move but will not buy their other wifi product such as Chamberlain  Belt Drive Garage Door Opener because I know they won't stand behind the product in the long run. I will be surprised if they support the next version of iOS and android after they stop selling this version of the device.

I purchased and installed this unit today in my garage. I followed the quick setup guide as well as the youtube video step by step like others have noted. I was all ready to connect the device using the MyQ app and all I get is the "Connecting to device..." screen on my android phone. For some reason this device will not connect to the device. The light on the unit above my garage is still blue. The device was located via the app but it will not connect and it just keeps trying to load and connect without success for some odd reason. It had stayed that way for almost a full hour until I finally just got tired of waiting and simply closed the app before my battery on my phone was completely dead. As of right now, I give this product a 1 star. I'll try to connect my device again tomorrow. If I can't i'll send it back and get a full refund and my rating will remain the same. As of right now I'm very disappointed in this product and I wouldn't recommend it at all.

This device is either poorly designed, poorly constructed, or both. I installed the first one, and despite getting a solid green light, the app said it couldn’t connect to WiFi (even though green light means it has connected). Kept resetting the device and re-trying, finally got the app to recognize that the device had connected. Similar problems connecting the sensor to the hub. Eventually, got it to connect. The app would open the door, but only close it one out of every 3-4 times. Most times it would require me to manually close the garage door. I figured it was defective, so got a replacement from Amazon. This one had similar problems recognizing WiFi connection, but installation was a little easier. However, it still will open the door, but not close it consistently. There’s nothing blocking any sensors. I give up. I notified when searching for fixes that Chamberlain has deleted all the threads from frustrated uses, and now only publishes a few of their own articles in the support area. This piece of junk is going back.

I read another review stating that it took the reviewer "hours" to install this device. I had to chuckle. It takes no more than 20 minutes to install, and this includes mounting the bracket, installing the MyQ hub onto the bracket and attaching the garage door sensor onto the top panel of your garage door. SMH.With that out of the way, it works as it should and as advertised. My iOS, v11.3, gets instant notification when the door is opened or closed. It is absolutely convenient and breathtaking to be able to check the garage door status, and to open or close it with a phone! No more entering the garage door from the side door (for us folks with detached or attached but not connected garages).
Until they stop jerking customers around and charging for integration with IFTTT/Google home/Alexa (which they continually promise but never deliver) I can't recommend this product to anyone.

We have had MyQ "Smart" opener for about a year or so, and it has continued to consistently fail us.The service is horrible, the app is incredibly glitchy, and about 25% of the time it actually gives you the wrong reading (i.e. says door is closed when it is open). Other times it creates errors and refuses to close the door, even when nothing is blocking the path of the door. this has caused us to go back and check whether or not our door is actually closed more than before we had the product.

Updated review: I had my first Amazon Key deliver this week. The hub device failed, creating a dangerous situation where the deliveryperson was unable to close the door, leaving the contents of my garage vulnerable to theft. When I got home to troubleshoot, the device was basically "bricked" - completely unresponsive, even after a reboot.Fed up, I returned the MyQ hub, and uninstalled the iPhone app.
***Google assistant users BEWARE***it's a damn garage door Chamberlain. Open, Close, Check status. that's all we need and you cant even do that for a monthly fee?

Easy to install, works fantastic!  A little networking knowledge is helpful to install, but with the peace knowing your garage door is closed when it is supposed to be from anywhere in the internet world, this product is well worth the price! I have had many people tell me they have turned around mid trip to make sure their garage is closed, but they don't see the need for this product.  This is a solid solution people!  It is so simple and works so well that it really is a no-brainer!  I find myself checking the app often, and with the push notification that my garage door opened, I always know when family arrives home or leaves.  I had to let a dryer repairman into the garage before I could arrive and he was amazed I opened my garage remotely.  If I could geek out a little more, I would like to see a geo fence added to this so when I entered the fence....my garage would open.  I also set it up to automatically close my garage at 10:30p.m. nightly if I happened to forget to do it manually.  There is no worse feeling to going into your garage in the morning and realizing you left your garage door open all night!  Come on now....., you have all done that right?  I totally recommend this and I absolutely love it!  It took me under 30 minutes to install!  It has dropped from my network one time, but I was able to reset my router and it came back just fine!  Enjoy!

I really like this device - it works well with my older opener.  Phone app has useful controls and alerts, letting me know if the door is up or down, left up for an extended period, etc.  It was easy to connect, about an hour, and has a good range to connect to my router.My only issue is that it doesn't connect to Alexa.  To me the reliable phone app is most important, but Alexa connectivity would make it ideal.  It seems like such an easy thing to do. I guess this smart device isn't all that smart.

This is the worst device I have ever purchased.  I went through the set up, to everything was fine.  I even installed a WiFi booster just to add a little more range.  Everything worked fine for about a week.  It started not accurately stating the the status of my door.  Several times while I was away it said it was open, I had my daughter verify it was closed but the app still showed open.  This would correct itself when I got home and pressed the button on the door sensor.  This would be correct for about a week then start the issue again.  I reset the system and it continued this intermittent correct status/incorrect status issue.  This last time when I tried to reset the system again, it failed to reset completely.  I have tried to contact Chamberlain and NO ONE has responded!  DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!

Bought this to add a second remote garage functionality to my IQ remote garage opener.  It is compact and attached easily to the garage door panel and its very easy to program.  My only concern is cost.  While a full controller and sensor costs $49; this sensor alone was $39! I took a star off of the overall rating because of that issue!

Here is my experience installing the MyQ hub and sensors. Upon making the decision to purchase this product I read a lot of the reviews and took note of those individuals that had issues and were able to solve the issues on their own or with tech support help. After opening boxes and making sure everything is there, I first downloaded the MyQ app on my cellphone. From there I followed the prompts within the app. I didn’t have to enter the serial number I just scanned the QR code and it was recognized. Then I entered my network password and I was ready to connect the door sensors. Mind you I was not in the garage at the time I did this but in the house relatively close to the router about 30 feet.I moved into the garage and placed the sensors on the very top panel of the garage doors (I have two doors). Had no issues with connecting sensors to hub, took about a minute for each sensor. At this point I pulled up the instructions for my garage door opener motor (Genie 2028 professional line) to located program button. Once that was located I activated the programing activity and followed the prompts in MyQ app. It took a couple of tries on the first garage door opener but it finally paired, when this happens your garage door will open. I was able to get the second opener paired on the first try, it takes about a minute. If you have this model opener, it’s the large square raised button, hold it until the purple light flashes, and then hit pair button in app.

DO NOT BUY. THIS PRODUCT CAN NOT BE TRUSTED TO WORK CORRECTLY. IT OPENED OUR GARAGE DOOR TO THE WORLD WHILE WE WERE 3+ HOURS AWAY AND WOULD NOT SHUT.I have been using the MyQ Smart Garage Door Opener Chamberlain MYQ-G0301 - Wireless & Wi-Fi enabled Garage Hub with Smartphone Control that I bought off Amazon on July 16, 2019.  It has worked fine until recently. Naturally it stopped working correctly while we were away.  We were 3+ hours from home for the weekend and I kept getting alerts that my garage door is opening and closing multiple  times throughout the day. I thought it was an error with the app, false alerts......until my neighbor alerted me that my garage door was in fact open at 9:30pm, way past dark. I want an answer on how this happens, how does this product just start working on its own to open and close (multiple times and then won't shut through the app) the garage door while we are 3 hours away with nobody other than me having the app installed on my phone.  I can't trust this device to keep my garage shut and locked.  How is Chamberlin going to fix this situation?

Set-up was a breeze.  We needed this because the kids kept leaving the garage door open. Now we don't have that problem. Also, I had packs of woodland creatures in my yard that are sometimes rascally with my cats or the garbage can or they just noodle around in the yard without my express permission. So now I put a pile of warm ham in the middle of my garage and wait by the back window until I see one or more woodland creatures, for instance, rabbits, mice, raccoons, fox, and/or possums (not bobcats or similar), enter, then I click the autoclose feature on my smart phone and trap one or more of them inside. When they finish the ham, I enter through the side door with a large blanket and humanely trap them in a corner. Then I drive them to the forest preserve and release them in the area opposite my house (and closer to other houses) and then they don't bother me any more. I wear a large woolen jacket and sturdy work gloves so they don't bite me with their fangs or teeth. I will say that most small mammals make a disproportionately loud noise relative to their body size when you ensnare them in a large blanket. Don't be alarmed.

+ Easy install and setup.  From the time I opened the box until it was fully installed and setup was about 1 hour.  (i.e. skimmed the quick start guide, downloaded the app, programmed the hub, mounted the hub to the ceiling, mounted the sensor to the door, programmed my garage door opener, cleaned up).+ Intuitive app. Walks you through hub setup, sensor testing, garage door opener programming. Once setup up, easy to navigate between different devices and settings.  Options to setup alerts for each time the garage is opened or close, schedule the door to open/close at a specific time of the day.  Displays elapsed time door has been opened or closed.

I greatly enjoyed this product for about a week. That all changed when I suddenly got a garage door left open alert, despite watching it close fully when I left. Great, exactly why I bought this! Wrong. First, the remote close failed to close the door despite doing so several times before. It just sat there trying to close the door with a perfect internet connection for a minute and failed to produce so much as an error message. It just says the door is still open after it got tuckered out. Luckily, I had family at home to go close it. Several times after we have watched the door fully close (and for enough after to make sure it really closed) only to get a left open alert and walk out into the garage to see the door sitting open. We tinkered a couple times to try to use the app to close it after this and it always failed to do so regardless of where I was or how good the internet was. This is completely unacceptable. I don't know if it's garbage software or garbage hardware, but frankly, it doesn't matter. Having this in your home poses a massive security risk. Not to mention the google home connectivity is a joke. Don't waste your money.

I was looking for an easier option for my kids to be able to open the garage with their phones instead of the keypad. After all the mixed reviews I decided to give it a try. First, the instructions included are garbage. Impossible to setup with those instructions. After several google hits, I finally found the correct way to setup the device. For those of you that have issues. When they popup asked you to allow to switch to the mobile network, DO NOT ALLOW IT, or you will regret it. My cellular service in my area is bad so completing the setup via mobile data network was impossible. But once you allow it, it will automatically switch back to the mobile network and you will never complete the setup.The device worked fine for the first week or so. The first issue was waking up to an open garage. I had no schedules so; the garage shouldn’t open during the night. Now the device just wont work. I do the setup daily. Not kidding, when I say daily. Some days it works for me, but it won’t work for my kids’ phones. Keep in mind we have the same phones and I did not add new users on the app. They are using my user and password information.
WARNING - there is an issue I didn't know would be an issue.I like being able to control the doors but I've experienced an issue twice and have simply gotten lucky.

Installation to my Craftsman garage door opener went pretty slick. It opens pretty quick from the app, longer to close (8 seconds).  Went to link it to Google Assistant and what do you know - I missed the small print at the bottom that says it costs $1 per month to subscribe to their premium service in order to use Google Assistant. In this day and age this is reprehensible. My bad, but it has ruined the whole purchase for me. A quick look shows that other devices do have compatibility with Google Assistant and Alexa. For $99 you would think you would get all the features . . .

I bought this when it went on sale for $50. I also bought a second receiver for $40, so all in $90 to operate two doors. An OK  price. There is a subscription option for $10 a year if you want to use it with Google Home but it doesn't really work well. .  I'll get to that in a bit.  Install is easy but the base needs to be located relatively close to the garage door or it will not work well... I'd estimate within 10 feet. Having two doors I had to locate the transmitter between the two openers to get it to operate reliably.  App works well-ish. Obviously if you have a weak cell or wifi signal it might not work well but that is to be expect and not a knock to this device.Now the bad stuff.

You’re looking for a solution to open your garage door from a remote location. Package deliveries, the housekeeper, your tool-hoarding neighbor. This is one of several products out there that will do the trick.If you’re a garage door tech, move along. You know this already. If your a DIY homeowner with grand plans, you must read on - This is what Chamberlain should tell you about their system but doesn’t.
-Very easy to install hardware-Connection to OverheadDoor went seamlessly

Installed it so I could easily confirm whether my garage door was shut-avoiding that middle of the night trip downstairs. or the U-turn to do a drive by to ensure that yes, I did close the door.  Well, it's useful for the former-not at all for the latter.  The hub doesn't recognize the opener when initiated by the remotes-at all.  So one can close the door and the app will show it as open.  Speaking of which, when one uses the app to close the door this REALLY annoying LOUD beeping goes off-and stays on even after the door is definitely down.  AFAIK there's NO way to turn this functionality off.  I also have failed to get the Alexa App on my Android phone to work with the hub either.  Sooo, it has a little usefulness but is definitely NOT as helpful and practical as it could've been.

I purchased this unit to have control via my phone and to be able to control my garage door from a remote location and take advantage of in garage Amazon delivery. Twice in three days during the night I have found my garage door wide open without using the software. If I had not had to go to my garage to put away some tools I would never had known the door was open. I have started the return process and would never trust this product. Your taking a chance with all of your stuff in your garage and you life in allowing someone to get into your house. As a side note, it’s impossible to connect to Alexa and you have to use a hub to connect to Siri. A true O star rating.

I'm getting pretty into the idea of automating my home with Google Assistant, and NEVER have I heard of a smart device charging a subscription fee to use the functionality. I guess it's partially my fault for not reading this product's fine print before purchasing, but who would ever think a company would be so crazy to charge a subscription for something so basic. On top of that, it isn't even true Google integration--you have to ask for "MyQ" every time--this is not actually "linking" as described in the description--not even close! Easiest return decision I ever made, and a huge blow to my trust in Chamberlain if I'm in the market for garage door products in the future. What a waste of my morning.

Let me start with a few words of caution.  First, their explanation of what is compatible and what isn't, on Amazon, and even on their own website, is vague.  Second, the support that they have for Google assistant is not quite what you think it is.  I'll explain a little bit.First, the compatibility, they say that this is compatible with a lot of units, specifically for me, they say "Genie units manufactured after 1996".  Great I thought, mine was, so I should be good.  What they should say is "all Genie units with a 'learn' feature to add remotes" or "only Genie units with Intellicode and learn functionality" or something similar.  My Genie Blue Max, does not have the "learn" function, it still uses the old DIP switch method for remotes (any remote with the same switch settings will open the garage door) and the MyQ is NOT compatible with those systems because of how their remote is designed.  As it turns out, there is an upgrade kit for older garage door openers like mine, which retrofits this functionality and makes your system compatible.  If you search "GIRUD-1T" you should find it on Amazon.  So with that, my system was finally compatible with the MyQ
I really wanted to love this product but alas, it was not meant to be.Installation is very straight forward and pretty darn easy, I had it connected, up and running in under 10 minutes.

There's a subscription fee after the first 30 days, right after the returning window closes. I have automated everything else except my garage door so I decided to purchase my Q by Chamberlain and integrate it with google assistant. I wasn't able to get it work with google assistant. Out of all my smart products, smartplugs, smartlights, vacuum, harmony hub, blind shades, thermostats, fan, cameras etc etc this is the only product requires a subscription fee to be able to use it, also it's the only one it's not working.

They really advertise the MyQ Smart Garage Door opener around the holiday's and we just moved into a new house that only came with 1 garage door remote..So I figured the MyQ would work good for the 3 other people in the house with all different schudules going in and out of our house instead of going out and buying 3 universal remotes instead. So the installation process is pretty simple, the set-up and connection from my phone to get the garage open process, pretty easy. But....after I got the set up on my phone all done, I tried to set up my wife's phone. Could not connect to hers. Then I tried my daughter's phone. Wouldn't let me. Wellonly until reading reviews from other people online who just like me found out after buying the the MyQ that the The MyQ "only" allows 1 phone to connect to your garage door opener and they're still working on the multiple features for more than 1 phone at a time. So why would I want to spend $60.00 on a product just so I could be the only one in my house that can open my garage door with my phone? Yea thanks but no thanks!

Do not get this product.  I install smart homes for a living and this thing is not only junk that doesn't work, takes hours to setup and the Mfrs don't know anything about it or troubleshooting it.  Between myself a paid employee, and Chamberlain tech support - we spent 11 hours trying to get 2 garage doors to open and we could ultimately only get one door to work leaving the 2nd garage door disconnected from the system, we thought.  This was a 2nd home and the owners were back at their primary house.  I got a call from the Real Estate agent who received a call from the neighbor telling her the garage door was wide open and had been for 2 days.  The house was empty, no one was there and I was the only one with the app on my phone.  In addition, the 2nd garage door opened!!!  The one that wasn't connected to the system, or so we thought.  In short, they couldn't get their product to work as advertised because it wouldn't open the 2nd door no matter what we tried.  Then, magically without any actions, the door opened itself revealing a brand new Porsche.  And of course it didn't alert us that the door was opened because that door isn't on the system!!  WTF??  I left Chamberlain messages and emails stating that this was an absolute emergency that needed to be addressed and no one got back to me.  They don't care.  Stay away unless you want your garage doors opening randomly without notifications.  What could be worse, really?

Very cool! Got it today and installed it. Took about 25 min, but I took my time through the instructions. Had to use the separate instruction sheet for Apple phones. Looks like it was a process to join the hubs wifi in order to enter my wifi router's info. I was going to give it 4 stars since it was $100, but then I started playing with the app and it has some pretty cool settings. I like the warning beeps and light flashing to warn anyone the door is closing - smart. Learned I have a Lift Master door opener -  5 years in the house and never looked up to notice.UPDATE: So this is what I set up in the app after a some playing around -

So I tried to buy this used from Amazon Warehouse, bad idea. Really bad idea. Until a future update is pushed out these are locked to one account forever and can't be reset for a new user. Kind of pissed Amazon even wasted my time by selling it to me.Chamberlain's customer service was really kind and understanding but didn't mince words about me not being able to use my used unit in the immediate future. So I got a new one and had it set up and working in under an hour.
Pros:Works for showing if your garage door is open/closed.

POS randomly opens my garage door instead of closing it at the scheduled time. When it does this the app gives an error message: "The door cannot be controlled because of too many failed attempts.  Please operate the door locally to reset and allow unattended operation." I've done that and also completely reset the device several times under the instruction of their tech support. It works a couple of weeks and then it happens again - and of course, I don't find out until the next day that my garage door has been open all night!!!

This is a very simple product and it should be a breeze to install.  However, the product as designed and manufactured is VERY idiosyncratic.  Specifically, the location of the MyQ hub is both critical to the operation of the product and impossible to discern except by trial and error.  The installation guides give you some ideas, but its still a guessing game.  I tried several locations on the garage ceiling and finally hit on one that works.  However, I have no idea why.Further, the error messages that the software gives you have nothing whatsoever to do with the real solution to the problem.  Chamberlain should be ashamed for shipping a product that is this unreliable.
Very satisfied with this product.1. I had no issues setting up the app or connecting the hub with the internet.

I had woken up more than once to find my garage door open the next morning. We have a set of cameras so I knew it was human error each time it happened. So I bought this to help be a reminder.I had  no issue installing this. I have strong WiFi near my garage. Very easy. For about 3 days it worked flawlessly than the sensor got confused if it was closed or open and things began to spiral. The notifications sent by the MyQ thought the door was open when it was actually closed. Had to turn off alerts after a few days, but the scariest thing was I had set a schedule to auto close the door every day at 945p and last night the device thought the garage door was open and tried to close it. Instead the door was already closed and the signal opened the door. Luckily I got the notification and was home. Surprised it had run, I went out to look and the garage was wide open at 950p.  Too dangerous to rely on.

Initial setup was fairly simple, the MyQ App on my iPhone guided the entire procedure which took under 15 minutes.  With some Apple Shortcuts I found online, I can now ask Siri the status of my garage door, and ask her to open or close it (no monthly fee needed for siri shortcut integration).  I have now taken the old garage door remote out of my car and will use my phone exclusively, with the garage door's outdoor keypad as a backup if the phone battery is dead.After the initial setup it was not always closing the door (open commands always worked), so I found online how to do a factory reset; however, re-configuring it in the app didn't work; so I called Chamberlain support, and had a very helpful customer service agent get me back up and running in about 1/2 hour. (There seems to be a different procedure needed if setting up one from a factory reset vs. new out of box??).

I bought it because I assume it worked with Alexa, since it had Alexa crap on the add. Didn’t read close enough and turns out it’s only Alex key - which is barely available anywhere yet. So, I cannot from my car echo ask for the garage door to be opened. So back in the box it goes for a return.

ScamYou have to pay a subscription fee to use with IFTTT or Google Home.  When you pay, the integration is terrible. You instead of "hey google close the garage" you have to say, "hey google tell myq to close the garage" .

This is a very cool gadget to an existing garage door!The reason I give it a 4-stars and not 5 is because the installation guide and instructional video are missing a crucial step that slowed me down...

Awesome wifi garage opener and very easy to setup! I was up and running in 15 minutes hooking this up to my 15 year old Craftsman garage door opener. The package contains one hub and one sensor to control one garage door. The hub can control 2 doors, so if you have 2 doors, you will have to buy an additional sensor(https://www.amazon.com/Chamberlain-G821LMB-Sensor-Garage-Sensor-Myq-G0301/dp/B078C95181). If you have more than 2 garage doors, you will have to purchase an additional kit with a hub and sensor(https://www.amazon.com/dp/B075H7Z5L8). Few pointers:1. Make sure the location of the hub will have a good wifi signal. This is extremely critical and I feel like this is one of the main reasons for many peoples' frustration with the kit

I purchased this for peace of mind. We’ve had the camper hooked up and driven off  and forget to shut the garage door 🤦🏽‍♀️ Thank goodness for great neighbors. I installed a keyless entry pad and it works great but I wanted something that I could open and shut from my phone, so I can double check the door. This garage door opener never works, it says it’s connected to wi-fi and I can see that the door is opened or closed but it will never allow me to open or close from my phone. I can be in the house or at work and it won’t  work. If I try it more then three times it will kick the app off-line. My $30 keyless entry pad works all the time, this $100 smart app system never works. Please don’t waste your money, I’m researching for something better.

If you hate your eardrums, you will love this product.  For the rest of us who like to avoid annoying ourselves, our neighbors, and the dog down the street, you will want to disable the alarm on this.It's not anywhere convenient, like in the app or something smart like that, no.  They require you to void your warranty in order to peacefully close your garage door.  Even after disabling the speaker, you'll still have a flashing light, which, while annoying, is far more acceptable.

Frankly I'm sorry I bought this, and if I hadn't mounted it already I'd probably return it.  Chamberlain charges for Google Home integration and IFTTT integration (separately), and has no Alexa integration.  They withdrew the support that they recently had.  Even through Google Home or IFTTT, you can close but not open the door.  Apparently they don't trust their own product to provide security for my home, so why should I?  I'm accumulating the parts to implement my own solution as an effective alternative to the MyQ, but will spend less than what I spent on the MyQ on sale.  I wish I had reviews (like this one) more thoroughly in advance.

I was a bit skeptical about purchasing this after reading all of the problems setting this unit up in prior reviews.  However, with the apparent addition of an addendum sheet for iOS users, the set up was completely painless and only took about five minutes. It is very clear and concise and, if you follow directions, trouble free. The entire process, from unboxing to completing the install took  about 15 minutes. I don’t know if using this with a chamberlain garage door opener made it any easier,  but its’ operation is easy, fast and dependable. I too, am one of those people who questions if I shut the garage door after getting a mile or so away from the house. This makes it easy to check. Also, I can let my neighbor in if there is an issue in the house, or with our pets.

Let me start off this review by saying, from an IoT/smart home point of view, this was a very simple add on to our existing “dumb” liftmaster garage door and brought some app-based control that I had long been after—the garage door! This thing was a breeze to install, the new app walks through all of the steps in great detail. The interface is also great. We are on gig/fiber internet and an Orbi WiFi mesh at the house, so zero issues getting this thing a fast, reliable connection. Overall, it does exactly what I wanted, which was to have anywhere-Control and status check for our garage door.So....with all of the above 5 star commentary, why the 2 star rating? This thing has the most ANNOYING warning beeps that go off...every...single...time you close the door. Look; I understand it’s a safety precaution and Chamberlain is covering their ass...but seriously, these warning beeps last for the entire time the garage door is closing (about 10 seconds) and then about 6-8 seconds after the door has already closed. It feels like it will never end to be honest...like a smoke detector going off when you burn the thanksgiving turkey and are desperately fanning to make it stop. It’s only been installed for 2.5 days now and my wife is already complaining, which anyone that’s married knows...this thing is on the chopping block. Why on earth Chamberlain wouldn’t have worked in the option to disable the beep from the app is beyond me. Have a “release of liability” pop up that lets the customer sign away the safety for some damn peace and quiet. I’d like to close my garage door and not have my neighbors think there’s a 4 alarm fire going on.

Beware! This product is difficult to setup, has continuous issues, and they charge you to connect to Google Assistant or IFTTT. Nest support is discontinued August despite packaging. This product is not worth the hassle or not-adequately-disclosed extortion. 0/10!I am extremely regretting my purchase of the MyQ Smart Garage Hub. It took me 6 hours to set up this product because of wifi connectivity issues, door sensor connectivity issues, and garage door opener pairing issues. All of the support links on Google results have been taken away with non-helpful articles left in its place. The only help I actually got in setting up this product was from the product reviews on Amazon. I was under the impression in purchasing this product that it would work with my Nest account, Google Assistant, or IFTTT, but after finally setting the device up, I find out that is wrong. The Nest support is going to be discontinued August and the other 2 options require $10/yr or $1/mo. I really wish this was made clearer before buying and/or the product was easier to set up. I find it extremely disappointing that you are charging for something that is traditionally free to customers (both IFTTT and Google Assistant). I hope that you guys will reconsider this horrible decision to hold a supposed smart device at ransom.

The garage door opener works as expected in an isolated manner, meaning that using the myQ app you can close and open the garage door easily with the push of a button. The issue here is that I bought this with Google home integration in mind which they state is supported. Apparently in June of 2019 they stopped requiring a subscription fee to even support this functionality (a fee for telling Google to open your garage door is ridiculous).I quickly found out after installation that the linking of the service to Google home is horrendous. The service does not show on my Google home application and even when I did get the account linked this is how the interaction plays out:
There are so many reasons why this device is inferior to others, even though it might be cheaper.First about the install:

The good:  It works with most door openers.  It doesn't have to be a Chamberlain/Liftmaster door opener.  But do check their compatibility list... it does not work with every door opener.  I use mine with a pair of Genie door openers and it does work with my particular model.The bad:  I use this in conjunction with the Chamberlain "Home Bridge" (not to be confused with this "Home Hub") and there are several limitations.

I cannot believe I missed this when I was researching a smart garage option. First of all, it MyQ integrates with Alexa if you use IFTTT - easy and free to set up an account and to get a "subscription" (right now they are free but I hear MyQ (AKA Chamberlain) does charge for it from time to time) from MyQ to connect to IFTTT. But the only thing you can do is "close" your garage door. Agent told me it is a security violation to allow anyone else to open your door but them. Which isn't true. If you sign up for the Chamberlain/Amazon, leave it in your garage, option, then Amazon drivers can open your garage. But you, who owns the opener, the MyQ hubs, the Amazon devices, aren't considered worthy enough to open their door. So. When you get home you can get your lights turned on, set your thermostat then open another app to open your garage door. Picking nits? Sure. But this is just ignorant.The other things like ease of installation and getting it to work, easy peasy. Everything worked 100% out of the box. Connected and installed as the book said. Tells me how long the garage door has been opened or closed. We like to keep the door open about 4" for the draft effect and to suck out the heat in the summer time. The MyQ app will even tell you that the door is "stopped" so I know it is partially open.

I have this scheduled to shut every day after I leave for work to ensure it's always closed.Yes. I'm able to do everything it claims. However , sometimes it randomly says there's an error and I'm notified via email and push notification within the app.

So . . . This thing.  . . It could be so awesome. Unfortunately its not really what i thought i was buying. It works great untill it gets to the part where all i really want it to do is operate my garage door via voice commands. When linked to google home (idk about alexa) instead of simply running off a simple command it rerouts you to talking to this crappy myQ program. So it goes like this:Me, excited, "hey google, open my garage door."

don't fall for it, this thing is no smart garage door opener. it even asked you to pay for subscription fee in order to link up IFTTT or ALEXA which neither of them do anything smart at all.  it can tell you if garage door is open/close but pretty much it, otherwise you will need to take out the phone and open the app in order to control it, seems more troublesome than pressing the remote control button.  and it doesn't support Google Home / Google Assistant, what a shame.... There much better product out there like Tailwind iQ3 which can open / close the garage AUTOMATICALLY as well as integrate with Alexa and Google Assistant without a fee.  bottom line.. you get what you will pay for and i learned it the hard way, this thing is going back to amazon.

I needed something to monitor my garage door via WiFi. Instead of replacing a good-functioning motor, I decided to give the MyQ a try. I ordered it from Amazon and I will say that the setup is pretty straight forward, and easy to follow. Their app instruction mimic the Ring devices step-by-step setup. My only caveat was that it took a while to get the Door Sensor to sync to the hub. It wasn't doing it after several tries of the push button. Through a miracle, it worked and I got the BEEP!! confirmation. I tested the device several times throughout the day. It's essentially an additional remote control, sync'd to a hub that connects to your WiFi that connects to your app. My down expectations is that just like every cloud device, if their servers go DOWN then your device won't work in the app until Chamberlain fixes their cloud servers. Happened on June 7 2018 according to my research. I did had a problem were after setting it up, I went up to unplug the hub from the floor outlet to hook it up to the ceiling outlet. The app couldn't find the hub so I had to re-set it again. This tells me that if there's a power outage, will I have to do the setup again every time? Time will tell if the investment was worth it or not. As of a 24 hour period, I'm satisfied. CAUTION: pressing on the DOOR picture on your app will trigger the door to open/close. So make sure you maybe play with it while your in front of the garage door, not away from your home. And you can even use their website http address but with the same caution: Don't click on the garage door image if you don't want it to open if you're not home. The app/website doesn't give you an "are you sure?" warning. Pressing means open sesame.

I sort of regret buying this.  The install is simple and easy, the MyQ app works well once you configure everything.  It allows you to open and close the garage door from within the app, and gives you notifications in Android when the door opens and closes.This is where the good stops though.  There is a free trial for Google Assistant and IFTTT integration, then $10/year fee after the 30 days.  Good thing I tried the trials first...
Pros:-Could control your garage door(s), send alerts and give peace of mind

Already some great reviews for this product, I'm going to provide additional tips and items I've realized beyond what I've read.1. Hub Location - while the videos and instructions tell you to put the HUB about 4-5 feet away from motor on CEILING, that did not work out for me.  Opening worked, closing did not for some reason that I can't fully explain.  I do know my Chamberlain model and antenna doesn't have the greatest reception and I've read some folks have said subjectively the motor and LED lights interfere with reception.  In the end I put it on a side wall near AC power and all is well for my usage.

This is a good way to see if your garage door is open and also can open and close the door remotely. It works just fine but it is a little hard to set up because the software is a little clunky and the instructions pretty bad. It's worth getting but here are some tips:It works like the door opener button that is built into your newer model cars and you have to program it to your current garage door opener.

Added MyQ Smart Garage Hub to a 20 year old Overhead Door Phantom opener.  Installing and adding devices through the iOs app is buggy at best.  Eventually, I was able to get it working using their web portal, which is fine - just don't send me down the rabbit hole of a first time installation through the app.  Very hard time getting Alerts to work.  Each time, after adding an alert and testing, it would fail.  Going back in to look at  the settings for the alert, it would be deselected, despite the fact that I had turned it on repeatedley (and selected "save").  Finally got alerts to work, again, only through the web portal.  Then tried to add a second door without a sensor.  Their setup process asks if you have a sensor or not, selecting "not" continues the setup process, but never successfully.  After 1.5 hours of repeated tries, called Chamberlain.  Rep says no you can't add a second door without a sensor.  OK, fine - but why not mention in the setup process when you answer "no" to the question about a sensor, that you can't add a second door without a second sensor.  Very poor documentation and a buggy app.  If I hadn't already installed the device on my garage ceiling, I'd be boxing it up and sending it back..  I do not recommend.

UPDATE:After multiple attempts to make this work, I could never achieve the magical combination of the hub staying connected to both my garage door opener and the door sensor at the same time - it would always lose connection to one or the other. I’m returning this device.
I had a 5star review but giving it 1 now because of a major incident:UPDATE (with the following issues):

I completed the installation and set-up in about 20 mins.  If it matters I already have a Chamberlain Door Openner, so maybe that helped ease the process.  For all the folks having major trouble I wonder what they are doing wrong, or what their situation was.  If you have an iPhone, be sure to follow the supplemental instructions for connecting the hub to your WiFi.  Again, I had no issues.  However, if you want to add additional phones/devices to control the hub/door, you simply use the same account on subsequent devices as the original one.  Seems odd and counterintuitive, but that is the way it is.  And this bit took me a while to figure out, and only through reading a review, not guidance from the manufacturer, so that is something they could do better.  I guess for the uninitiated the directions are a bit thin, but therein't a whole lot going on here.  The unexpected bit was connecting to the hub as its own WiFi network, then using a web address to configure/attach the hub to my home WiFi.  Which went smoothly following the menus and prompts.I am able to control the door from my iPhone or the wife's (using the same account), set up custom alerts that appear to be working, and have not had any issues or complaints with the operation.  The most important part is knowing the status of the door from our phones.  That mean selling feature for us, also seems to be working as advertised.

UPDATE: Lowered to one star from three. Both garage door sensors continue to give out false readings, showing garage doors are open when they are closed. The MyQ troubleshooting tips on the support website did not help. And e-mail to support has gone unanswered after a week. Worse, the main garage door will not close remotely. The hub sounds a siren and displays a warning light, but nothing happens. I have not tried repairing my Overhead Door garage door to the hub again. Quite frankly, I don't have time for such a flaky system. Perhaps these bugs will get ironed. If so, I'll update my review again.Installation was easy. The hardest part for me was the ladder work because I have tall garage ceilings. Still, the included bracket made attachment simple. The app has a decent installation walk-through for pairing, naming, testing. There's also detailed help on the website. Now, for the details:

This is an excellent idea, but that's where the good part ends. After 4 hours following the "easy" step by step directions, I finally gave up and started the return and refund the same day I received it. Both my garage door openers "should" have been compatible, and one of them actually has the MyQ logo, but I couldn't get the hub to connect to either one of them.

Here is my experience installing the MyQ hub and sensors. Upon making the decision to purchase this product I read a lot of the reviews and took note of those individuals that had issues and were able to solve the issues on their own or with tech support help. After opening boxes and making sure everything is there, I first downloaded the MyQ app on my cellphone. From there I followed the prompts within the app. I didn’t have to enter the serial number I just scanned the QR code and it was recognized. Then I entered my network password and I was ready to connect the door sensors. Mind you I was not in the garage at the time I did this but in the house relatively close to the router about 30 feet.I moved into the garage and placed the sensors on the very top panel of the garage doors (I have two doors). Had no issues with connecting sensors to hub, took about a minute for each sensor. At this point I pulled up the instructions for my garage door opener motor (Genie 2028 professional line) to located program button. Once that was located I activated the programing activity and followed the prompts in MyQ app. It took a couple of tries on the first garage door opener but it finally paired, when this happens your garage door will open. I was able to get the second opener paired on the first try, it takes about a minute. If you have this model opener, it’s the large square raised button, hold it until the purple light flashes, and then hit pair button in app.

I returned a product I ordered that didn't do notifications, but setup worked on that unit perfectly. For this one, and being in the technology industry, setup was 10 minutes. Seriously, that easy. But it failed to work. Setup was smooth, click the app, and nothing happened. After some user error in trying to delete and restart the process (4 times), I figured it out and got it to work. Hurray!An hour later, my garage opened and shut. BY ITSELF. I unplugged it. Was sending it back. But decided to give it the old college try (I'm stubborn). It worked overnight. This morning, my girlfriend opened and closed it, I saw the notifications while at work, and then she text me when she got home. Garage was OPEN. Not good. I've read reviews and some FAQs online and after contacting support, the same thing. They said to delete all my programming (the two vehicles and the keypad remote) to start over because "I must have allowed ANOTHER REMOTE to gain access while in learning mode." Wow. Seriously? First of all, what are even the odds of this happening? Secondly, are you joking me? So you're telling me someone else is opening my garage?

I like this product when it works.  When it doesn’t be prepared to pull hair out.  VERY difficult to figure it out.  Reviews will bear this out.  MyQ lacks a lot of plug and play.  However, when it;s working, it;s wonderful.  I had system in about 14mos before it went offline and simply couldn’t get it to work.  So bought a new one (this is where expense comes in).  OH the new hub won;t work with the ;old; sensor... so irritating.  BUT again, now that it;s working, I love it!  I know when pet sitter is coming in and out, how long they are there.  I know 3 blocks away if I left door open and if so? I can close it.  Those make it worth while but if someone else comes up with an easier to install product, I’ll try it in a minute next time I go offline with MyQ. This doesn’t feel like rocket science, so I expect someone will fix this soon.  I don’t like how I can’t have separate accounts for MY garage and rental garages for example, they all have to go on the same account so constant alerts.

One fine product!  Had it installed in no time.  I have included pictures of what you need to do to install this.  First I want to say there is NO wiring to do!  None!When I wanted this item I did not understand the parts included in the pictures.  Also did not know how hard it was going to be to install.

I purchased this unit and a 2nd door sensor back in late March 2020, and everything installed easily.  The first thing I noticed is when you close your garage door, the unit emits an obnoxious flashing strobe light and a very loud piercing beep.  PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, PUT IN A DISABLE FUNCTION.In addition to the obnoxious flashing strobe light and very loud screeching sound, my other complaints are:

I thought this was the perfect solution for those times that I "can't remember if I closed the garage door".  Easy to do on a hectic morning.  The reviews and recommendations coupled with the low cost made this an easy choice.  First, the installation was fairly simple.  The app was easy to setup.  To my dismay however, Amazon Echo integration is not easy.  I gave up after a few frustrating tries.  I decided to just use the app to interfacing with the device.  It seemed to work fine in the beginning.  Opening and closing as expected.  But after a few weeks, I started to get reports that the door was open.  Even when I was at home and able to verify that it wasn't.  I checked the sensor and found no problem with its position.  If the door is closed and the app reports that it is open and you issue the close command, the app reports back after a a minute to visually confirm that it is closed.  The final straw for me came when I received a call from my wife one morning and she said she couldn't remember if she closed the garage door.  I checked the app, and sure enough, the app reported that it was open.  I attempted to close the door from the app, and got the "check to see if it closed" message.  Can't do that when you are away.  Well guess what?  When she arrived home later that day, the garage was open.  I am done!  I expect better reliability and communication.  I have numerous wifi devices at home that have no problem reporting their state.  Not worth the money, even at $40.  I am going to look for something more reliable.  Any suggestions welcome.

Works very well to update our older Chamberlain openers. We travel a lot, and it's nice to get a notification if the door gets opened, whether intentionally by the girl who brings in our mail, or by some bad guys.I purchased one extra transmitter (the main set can use up to 2) so I could cover both our garage doors.

This setup is very easy to install.  The app works great for controlling the door and it integrated smoothly with my garage door opener (mine is Chamberlain brand).  However, there are a couple of drawbacks to this system.  One, it is not directly compatible with Alexa if you're looking for that feature.  I assumed it would given that it works with Amazon Key, however, this is not the case.......at least not easily.  Using third party software you can get it to work with Alexa but this takes a bit of time to set up as there is no native skill.  The second drawback, in my opinion, is the loud beeping when the garage door closes.  This is a security feature that Chamberlain feels that all users must have and not be able to deactivate.  The most simple solution to this involves unscrewing the back of the unit, grasping the speaker cover with a pair of pliers and twisting it off, then cutting the wires to the speaker for good measure (see attached photo) .  This will disable the speaker completely rendering the safety beep useless and permanently subjecting yourself and your family to the crushing strength of the garage door.....which will not drop completely if you're under it anyway due to the IR sensors that were installed with the door opener.  But I digress..... The end result from my experience and a few hours time is an Alexa compatible garage door opening system that doesn't deafen you when it closes.  Good luck!

Garbage, would not recommend.First one wouldn't even go into wifi paring mode (none of the LEDs would stay on). Replacement paired right away. Install was a breeze. WiFi signal is strong yet it has issues on a daily basis. One day it's offline. The other it states it is opening the door when it is doing nothing. Power resets only work sometimes. Only reason I gave it two stars it's because I picked it up when it was on sale. Even then, I'll be returning it. Completely unreliable.

Plugged it in and synced it to my existing garage door. It worked great to open and close the garage. Drilled the holes and mounted it. It would reliably open the garage door but not close it. I'd push the button and it would beep but the door wouldn't close. I'd push it again and I would get an error that  the close function was pushed too many times and I had to manually push the button on the wall to clear the error. This happened repeatedly. Totally unreliable and a big security risk. Does not function as designed. When it does reliably close, it beeps like a smoke detector for 30 seconds. Loud and pointless.Now the Google integration...you have to subscribe to the MyQ premium service. Currently there is no charge. This allows the Google assistant to talk to MyQ to initiate commands. Like a game of telephone. Google starts a conversation with MyQ. Ten MyQ service can't reliably tell you if the door was open or closed. It would tell me that the door was closed when it was open. And opening the garage isn't an option. Just an a around disappointment. I don't know why they're even allowed to sell this.

I got another brand garage opener for the internet and it was directly wired, still the device didn't work well.  This device uses the way method as your car remote, and works better.  It has never been down while it was up, and visa versa.  It has worked flawlessly.  I admit I don't use it much.  I do have car remotes and the other brand work good with HomeKit.  But the other brand did mess up here and there and opened when you wanted to close (scheduled closing), while this one didn't.  The biggest flaw with it, is that you have to buy another device just to get it to work with it.  It makes no sense why something already getting out to the internet (so it has wifi and communicate to servers), can't get a firmware up date and get it working.  It's so cheap right now, I'm going to use it til I get tired of using an app or my wife wants to use HomeKit to open it.  I'll probably get a iSmartGate Pro because one device can handle 2 doors and do HomeKit.

The primary reason I wanted this was so that I can automatically open/close the door.  For example, I want my door to automatically open as I approach the house and close as I leave.  While this does integrate with IFTTT you can't actually automate anything because of "security".  This type of integration used to work, and why else would you even make this product if it weren't to enable smarts like this.  But every bit of functionality has been stripped to make it "secure".  This is why they stopped charging for the service as the don't really offer any services of use anymore.  This is such a complete failure that even at $18 it's not worth it.  I have to imagine the number of good comments were all written before this functionality was stripped out.What's even more incredible is that I can actually automate opening the door when I leave, but I can't close it.  In what scenario would any person consider that to be a "safe" thing to do.  Is that so you don't trap the burglars you just let into the house?  This is definitely a case of the lawyers defining the product capabilities.

It says you can connect to Google Home but you can't actually control the door!  You can only ask  the status of the door.  The whole reason I wanted this was to be able to voice control and it won't do that.  Also, the "free for a limited time" means you'll have to pay $1/month or $10/yr for the luxury of asking Google if your door is open.  I went with another controller and I love it.  The functions I need and it prevents someone from yelling in the window to operate it by requiring a PIN number.

I've got it working, but I can't give this a very high rating.  The first door was lightning fast and easy to connect to the MyQ hub and web site.  The second door gave me some trouble because the programming mode on the opener kept time out before the hub figured out how to control the door.The second sensor synced up fine, just like the first one.  It seems to be just as durable and sensitive as the first one once you get it working.

Setup seemed easy until it came to "finding your wifi networks" where the app would stop working and suggest to reset your hub and then contact support. Support emailed me the manual wifi pairing instructions and I am passing them on to you (after wasting a hour trying multiple devices and resetting the hub numerous times):You will start with your hub flashing blue
Positives:Easy to remove loud speaker (after disassembled)

Revising my review for this product. It was great, when it worked. However it works less and less and become exceedingly frustrating. I'd been left sitting in my driveway trying to log back into this app more times than I care to count. Today it completely fails to log in to the server "There was an error connecting to the server. Please check your internet connection and try again." My internet connection is fine, I have other devices in my home that are connected and they are all working perfectly.  It's this crappy app. Oh, and there is literally nothing you can do if you can't log into the app. You also get no customer support. This wasn't just a waste of money, it was a completely frustrating waste of money. I'm tossing this in the trash, save yourself the trouble and stay away from this terrible product.

My original review follows this update: the original still accurately states my feelings about MyQ.I contacted Chamberlain twice on my issues with the MyQ. They replaced the unit on the second call. I don’t ding a product because of an initial failure; however, judging from the reviews there does seem to be a lot of initial failures.
This review has been made on July of 2018, for the MyQ Hub.At the time I was using the red icon version of the Android app.

I've gone through setup twice on this, following every one of their simple instructions just to have the product not work... sure it'll open the door once or twice when you're still on the ladder under the unit, but as soon as any time passes the unit just stops working, and will report incorrect door states, and generally either blink and beep for ages and never close the door, or just never do anything  leaving your door exactly where it was.The most pathetic smart home device I've ever seen.

The basic Open/Close functions from the app are fine.  But I wanted the auto-scheduling option as my main feature.Sometimes our garage gets left open  :(  So I have scheduled MyQ to "Close every night at 9:00". It does not work.  However, I do receive a text telling me that it tried to close the door but failed and to manually close the door... So I just go and press the button to close the door when left open.  The door gets closed, but that is not really how I thought it should work.

Once installed, this has been working great.  Installation was a pain due to problems in the Chamberlain instructions.  Knocking off 1 star for that.During install, you're asked to specify brand (LiftMaster for me) and color of the 'learn' button on the garage door opener.  The instructions printed right on the garage door opener call the button on my unit an 'orange' button.  So, I went through the install process 30+ times trying to get the MYQ-G0301 to pair with the garage door opener, always telling the install program i have an orange button.  After spending 30 minutes on hold with tech support, I spent 60 more minutes with tech support troubleshooting, during which the the MYQ-G0301 was restarted multiple times and even factory reset twice, my home wifi router was restarted, and both the android and computer desktop browser interface were tried.  Finally - tech support offered this gem "Try telling the install program you have a "purple" button on your garage door opener".  Everything then started working perfectly.

Bad product. Just about as basic as could be. There’s a several seconds delay to open/close the garage door thru the app. I could live with this.But the reason I’m sending this piece of junk back in because there’s a loud, obnoxious beeping from the device whenever it’s activated.

Don’t waste your money. This sort of worked for us at first, but as the weeks went on, it went totally haywire. We had to reset the system repeatedly because it would randomly open our garage door, or wouldn’t allow us to open/close it. It was just too much of a security hazard to have our house unlocked without our knowledge in the middle of the night or when out of town. We threw the thing in the trash after about two months of fighting with it. Sounded like a good idea but it’s not.

Very VERY disappointed. The Chamberlain website makes it clear that this unit will support multiple users with different roles. Unfortunately, this is not the case. If you want to give others access to your garage opener, you must give them your sign in credentials. They will have the same access and permissions as you have. I am returning my unit and ordering a different model from another manufacturer.

I will start with the good. It was very easy to install. The mounting, the setup, linking it to an old Chamberlain garage opener - it was all a breeze. It doesn't come with instructions, all of the steps are through the initial set up in the app. The app has a bug where even if you decide you don't want to watch the video it keeps the audio on even if you lock your phone.
