I contacted support and they were helpful...although they didn’t know you had to wait for one to finish before operating another..but unfortunately that seems to be how it works.  While it seems silly to complain about this, it’s kind of a waste of time to stand and wait 20 seconds for the door to finish and the app to read that’s its complete.  I seem to have to force stop the app a lot and reopen it.  Even signing in seems to take a lot longer then you would expect...all in all it works but feels clunky.

Update to my initial review. Both myself and my friend 30 miles away have had random garage door openings - my friend in the middle of the day and myself at 11PM (good thing I was awake and noticed it) and also one time in the morning while I was away on a trip. If you search, you will find others that have the same problem. FOR YOUR SAFETY, I can no longer recommend this product or ANY Chamberlain opener with MyQ controls.I have an older Sears garage door opener and this was a super easy addition for my smart home.  I use Samsung Smartthings.  It doesn't integrate with Smartthings natively, but adding it as a device is easy.  My only dissatisfaction is that there is no native support for Smartthings AND Chamberlain charges $10/year to allow IFTTT integration.  However, it is easy to add a tilt sensor and a Smart App to avoid this charge.  There were other alternatives that worked natively with SmartThings, but they had terrible reviews - both in reliability and actually charging for tech support - and they were actually more expensive than Chamberlain.  I now have routines that will ensure the garage door is closed every night and also close automatically when I leave.  Plus, I have confirmation that the door is actually closed (or open), and I can open it for someone from any place in the world.

I installed the MyQ hub and two garage door sensors for my daughter. The installation was straightforward and so far everything is working well. She has the MyQ app on her phone and can check the status of the doors remotely. She shared access with her husband so he can do the same.I installed the MyQ hub and a single door sensor in my own home. It also works well for me even though I received a low WiFi signal alert during installation. The only problem I've noticed is when I use a doorbell button next to my garage door to open or close the door. The MyQ app has the door status wrong after using the doorbell button once. It does however recognize the correct status after I use the app to open or close the garage door.

If I had it to do over again, I think I'd just replace the entire garage door opener.  That said, this unit CAN be figured out, but it wasn't the easiest process for me.  I've looked all over, and for the life of me, can't seem to find any documentation that mentions a brown learn button on a Chamberlain opener.  For about a month, I gave up on being able to control the unit with MyQ, and was monitoring only.  Fearing that my opener had exhausted it's allowable number of remotes, I erased all of the codes and reprogrammed all of my remotes.  THAT DID NOT FIX MY ISSUE.  Having only 5 color choices in the programming mode, I decided that I'd run through all of them before boxing this thing up and sending it back.I don't know if it was coincidence or not, but when I tried to program as a purple learn button, it worked like a charm, and it just so happens that my antenna wire was purple.

This was amazingly easy to install, and the instructions were nearly exactly what you need to install everything quickly and seamlessly.We use iPhones and the only thing that was not correct / the instructions were not clear on us before you press the purple button on your garage door opener, you must move the device relatively close to the opener to continue. I didn’t and the programming “failed” (even though the door moved) until it was moved closer.

I really like the product but users are faced with discovering how it operates.  I would have given 5 stars but the documentation is so poor that I have to drop the score.To see what I mean, look at the photo and product description and see if you can figure out what the LED light on the unit is for.  It appears that the light may turn on when the door operates. Partly true.  The light does NOT turn on when opening the door.  Nor does the light turn on when pushing the light button on the hub.  However, the light DOES flash to alert that the door is about to close and then an annoying audible alarm sounds as the door moves and for about 10 more seconds AFTER the door has closed. Seeing the light and the corresponding button, I thought the unit would provide light to the garage upon operation and thus I mounted the hub in a spot to take advantage of the anticipated extra lighting.  There is zero mention of an audible alarm upon closing the door, thus I thought something was seriously wrong when my wife closed the door and the alarm remained on.

I have 4 issues with the product.The hub has a very loud warning alarm when the app is used to close the Garage. It seems to be a issue with other people on the web also. There is no volume control and alarm is integrated on the motherboard with no sound holes to cover. I have a single story house with a attached Garage. Some bedrooms have a  common wall with the Garage. Therefore I can't use at night. Update: Made a enclosed box with soundproof material from a Hillshire farm 33 oz cold cut container. Works well.

MyQ smart garage opener works with my garage opener, so I am quit happy with this.  No more having to run down stairs to open the garage door for the water softener rental people.  The setup for of the physical devices was pretty simple. However software setup was a total mess.  The MyQ app didn't recognize the MyQ opener and I had to go through numerous tries and resetting the MyQ opener to finally get the app to find the MyQ opener.  Once that was complete the rest of the setup was pretty straight forward.  I didn't find any documentation in the package to instruct how to setup the MyQ opener.  The only instruction was to download the MyQ app.  So there was a lot of confusion on what I need to do to setup the MyQ opener with my garage opener.  In the end, I had to google how to setup the MyQ opener to find instructions on how to set it up.  I like the product, but the setup process was a frustrating experience.

I read a lot of reviews but I don't write many. After reading the reviews for this product I was very skeptical. I love the idea of monitoring and controlling my garage doors from anywhere, but it seemed that other users were having a lot of issues in the installation or usage of this product. After some careful thought and a great deal on black Friday, I decided to give it a shot.The other reviews suggested to follow the instructions very carefully and make sure you have a strong wifi signal in your garage, so that's what I did too. In downloading the app (which is easy to use and is packed with features), the app instructed me through the install process step by step. I'm a pretty handy guy and somewhat technical about smart home devices, but by no means an expert. In sticking closely to the instructions, the install went easily and without incident, and this product is now working perfectly for my garage doors.

I wanted a way to ensure that my garage door was closed when I’m away. This device does that. But setting it up was not easy, requiring several factory resets after which the device/app would skip entire steps of the setup. I’m a fairly experienced connected home user, and this is the worst I’ve seen as far as consistent performance and ease of set-up. It’s also rather pricey for what it provides- meaning that this device could also work with Apple HomeKit, but instead requires another pricey device added to this one. No thanks.Once it was connected and working and installed, a power outage caused it to go offline and then it refused to connect properly, even after several resets. Finally I uninstalled the device from the ceiling and tried again. Lo and behold it connected! So I installed it permanently on the wall near my kitchen door. No trouble since then. Sometimes the instructions aren’t all that helpful.

I had high hopes, but it turns out that this remote is not compatible with my opener. This boggles my mind because how hard would it have been to have terminals on it for contact closure? If it had contact closure, it would be compatible with literally every opener ever made by including 3' of wire in the box.The biggest disappointment isn't in the fact that they couldn't put a couple of sets of dry contacts in it, which I could wire into my opener in parallel with the button on the wall. The biggest disappointment is that despite the fact that it can notify me that my door is opened or closed, it cannot use either of those states to trigger an Alexa routine. I found this surprising because it is supposed to work with Alexa.

For 30 bucks it's hard to knock this product, especially if you have good reception from your router in the garage and don't need to spend extra for devices designed to boost it. It took 15 minutes to install next to my compatible opener (a 10-year old Liftmaster) and it works well and reliably  through the MyQ app installed on my Android phone. I also found the step-by-step install instructions on the app to be very detailed - they worked for me without any hiccups.Yes, integration outside of the Chamberlain proprietary ecosystem is pretty much non-existent out of the box (I use Amazon's Echo / Alexa, so no can do even if I were willing to pay an extra fee, which I am not.) For $30 however, you can open and close your garage from almost anywhere in the world, get useful push notifications if you forget the door open, set it to close automatically at certain times of day or night... All things my dumb garage opener couldn't do before.

I installed the MyQ hub on my main garage door, but I needed a second door sensor so I could control both doors.Since the hub was already installed and configured in the app, this add on sensor only took about 5 minutes to install and configure. This door is on a Genie opener, and the MyQ was able to program it first try.

I had this working with 20 min. You connect to WiFi, train it with your training settings on your unit like you would a remote. Then stick the small box on the top most part of your door and it works. I programmed the app to check for my door being opened at regular times in the evening. It alerts me and closes the door at those times on its own. It also notifies me throughout the day if it’s open. It’s unfortunate that this doesn’t work with Alexa, but I like it better than the other unit I purchased for my other door that can.  Overall, this unit is easy to install (because of that little box you stick on the door that lets you know if it’s open or not) and just does what I want it to.  Wish I would have gotten this on the other door too! The other Alexa enabled unit requires bracket installation for two parts that come together to see if the door is open instead of  to this nice box) I’m still having to mess with it. This unit with its little box is much easier!  Also if you are still hung up on Alexa, the units that work with it require you to say a passcode to get it to close. I get it, but it’s silly.

I installed the sensor on the top panel of our multiple panel garage door, as instructed. When the door is fully closed and fully opened, the app correctly understands the door is closed or opened.  However, when the door is opened a foot or two, the app thinks the door is still closed. In this instance, I can see that the sensor is no longer fully vertical (like when the door is fully closed, and when door is fully opened the sensor is fully horizontal).  Shouldn't the sensor being off-vertical (maybe by 30-40 degrees) tell the hub that the door is opened?UPDATE August 5, 2019

I really really wanted to like this & was looking forward to a smart garage door opener. Installation was not too difficult (took less than an hour). With a two car garage, we installed in the middle of the two so there was not one side that worked better than the other.  While it technically "worked"... it was not as expected. It was very inconsistent on if it was going to work or not. When it did, there was a very significant delay - plus it wasn't clear when it was "thinking" or being delayed vs when it just simply wasn't going to work.Great concept for a product, just did not work for us & ended up returning.

Why  do you buy a remote access controller for your garage door when you can push a button in your car or on your garage wall? Well you have some ability to remotely open and close the door from miles away via the web. Exactly why I bought this unit for my 8  year old "LIFT-MASTER" garage door openers. The simple install took about 30 minutes for 2 doors,  connection to my home network was almost instantaneous and went flawlessly. Now I am able to open the garage door from anywhere in the world. Why would I do that? Good question and I'm not sure it would happen very often,  but I can if I need to. I also know that my garage doors are closed or open and if my wife is approaching the house so I can surprise her with an adult beverage when she walks in.

I needed an app to open my garage for deliveries. They would leave packages on my front door and anyone that drove by could see them sitting by my front door. This product works great for me. I read that some had issues installing it. Follow the instructions and it's done in 20 min. This works great for deliveries and also tells me if I left the door open. Then I can close it from accross town. I also read that the door would open by itself. Not once has that happened to me. I am very happy with what I purchased and highly recommend it. The only issue I ran into was it is not completely universal. It has a list on the instructions as to which openers it does work with. Mine was not on the list but works great. I have a precision opener.

I installed this unit yesterday. Very easy install. I'm VERY disappointed with it though. On Amazon I searched for "alexa garage door opener ". This was among the items that came up. The price was good, so thinking it was Alexa compatible I ordered. There is nothing in the Amazon listing clearly stating it is not Alexa compatible! Only after the installation did I realize it can not work with Alexa. The listing is very misleading and not being compatible with Alexa is not clearly noted - but it is sort of implied. Amazon have other brands and units that are Alexa compatible. I got ripped off on this one! Especially since it came up on my Amazon search for an Alexa compatible units!

I always have this fear that I might have driven off in a hurry and forgotten to close the garage door (been there and done that)...or walked into the house after going to the mail box and forgotten to close the door (been there and done that as well). With this device I can easily look at the app and tell whether it is closed or open and how long it has been in that state. I can then easily close it if necessary or when my son comes over I can open the door from wherever I am. The laser is great in making sure I don't pull my car in to far and hit some of my tools or other stuff that sits near the front of the car. I have not done Alexa integration yet. It can also be tied into my house security system which I have not had done yet. I currently have a dedicated door sensor to let me confirm that the door is closed before I go to sleep at night.

I almost returned this device. Set up was a breeze however the hub and door sensor do not seem to communicate unless within a couple feet of each other. I at first had the hub right where they show it on the installation guide, app couldn’t tell if door was open or closed. Moved it around 3 times until finally it was within a foot or so when garage door was open and 4 feet or so when closed. Seems to work. Will give it a cpl weeks if more issues arise it’s going back. Will update if sent back.Update: 2 weeks in what I was worried about happened. My wife left for a couple hours and came back and the garage door was wide open. She said she watched it close when she left (because we still didn’t trust this thing 100%). I checked the app and it was totally frozen on the “close error” screen which is what I was getting when I was setting it up and trying to get the hub as close to the door sensor as possible (instructions said 6-8 feet, yeah right!). It worked for a cpl weeks because the hub is literally a cpl feet away but even with that the hub and sensor failed to communicate. Due to the fact that the garage being open is basically a welcome to our empty house sign I can not use this device with confidence. Too bad I would have payed double if they would have used better Bluetooth connectivity technology. I’m sending back.
Me: Runs and ride bikes a lot, wanting an easy way to get in/out of my garage without a clicker.Him: Always forgetting if he closed the garage door.

Just received, and installed in 30 minutes. Folks, the most important thing is to do your homework by reading the most recent reviews here, and especially hunting down and watching the YouTube installation videos. This way there are no surprises and you are prepared to do the install. Some tips: A strong WiFi signal is a must and when you pair DO NOT try to pair it to your 5G network! The 2.4 only! A full fan icon or down one bar is ok. You do not have to mount the hub in it’s to be permanent location YET.  Not until the end. I paired my hub in my home office where the router was within 5 ft. Next ensure you’re garage door opener is compatible, the vast majority are, and if any questions, call Chamberlain. I had heard you can pair only five remotes at a time and I already had five paired, the cars, the original visor remotes, and a keypad. So I emailed Chamberlain support and found out that my opener, a LiftMaster Professional 1/3hp, dated 2007 can support up to 8 remotes. No problem, I lucked out. Note that Craftsman, and LiftMasters are made by Chamberlain. Download the app first. Set up your new account and password if necessary. Then go through the terrific setup process using your phone app. I’m a bit of a handyman, so using my cordless drill and the hardware supplied, and my 6’ garage ladder, I finished the installation with no glitches. Then I tested everything, the app, the car, the keypad, and the indoor wired button. No issues. Yes, there is a really annoying beep that goes off when closing the door USING THE APP ONLY.  There is more than one way to go at disconnecting the speaker by looking on the web. Or take a piece of black wiring tape and put it over the speaker holes to diminish the volume. It’s not as loud as I thought it would be, but I’ve already told neighbors it is NOT a smoke alarm going off. There should be a way to control the volume in the app, but there are probably a lot of CYA’s in play here. I have a very smart home that is anchored by Alexa and the Smart Life non-hub app with a ton of bulbs and plugs, routines, and skills. The Chamberlain IS NOT Alexa compatible, at least not yet. It is compatible with Google and the Internet of Things, and there is NO LONGER a subscription required to use the two aforementioned items. If you have  Home, you will need to buy an additional hub called Bridge that runs the opener. I have  everything but never bought into ’s smart hub and devices. Because sometimes I am dumb enough to have left the house with the door left open, I will get warning notifications and be able to remotely close the door from anywhere in the world. From my iPhone or iPad. Don’t need Alexa for that. But, the brick and mortar Amazon stores do sell this product, I guess becausethey can be setup with Amazon Key to allow deliveries to the inside of your garage. No thanks on that one. I’ll let my Ring doorbell take care of my Amazon front stoop deliveries. Hope this was helpful! If this product screws up down the road, I’ll let you know!

The hardware and the App itself are very easy to install and navigate.  If you have some basic tech knowledge, then you should not have any issues with this setup.  I use Google assistant in my home which was the primary motivator for me to get this system.  But be forewarned this system will NOT open the garage door by using google assistant/home.  It will only close the door.  Which I have read has to do with security measures, but for me, the lack of this feature has been very frustrating.  I have considered returning the system for the lack of this feature.  I'm hopeful that Chamberlain and Google can fix this issue because as more homes transition to higher degrees of integrated Smart Home features this should be a no-brainer.

It was easy to install and works just fine.I wish the app would let me add other household members as primary users. Instead, I have my wife's phone app logged into the same account as mine.  Not sure if that will cause any problems.

It works, but the wifi reception is terrible.  I mounted it  according to the instructions and pairing took about 10 minute to complete due to quite a few retries.  Once completed I found it to be intermittent due to the wifi reception.  While my phone had very good reception  to both my router and repeater  from the opener, the MyQ didn't.  I removed the MyQ from the garage ceiling and brought it into the house.  From there it worked, but I then found that when you activate the MyQ, it flashes and does a loud series of beeps as an alert. This was not going to work inside the house.  I relocated it to the far end of the garage and the reception there is working.  All is well now, except I need to fill in the holes in the ceiling from the first install.  I suggest you do the pairing, and try using the app, before you attach this to your ceiling.

I've been wanting one of these forever. Finally broke down after a night of drinking and bought it. After the hangover the next morning I went out and installed it. Super easy!! Few touch of some buttons, and this thing pretty much programed itself. Took about 10 minutes after watching a YouTube video.  I have a lot stuff in my garage that I I use for rental properties, and I back in a lot to load my truck. I' m always driving off leaving the door open. I installed  a camera in the garage so I could see if I left it open after I got across town, which I do all the time. Now I can shut it from anywhere and don't have to drive home and close it. Best investment in a long in a long time.

Ever get that feeling after you left home that you're not sure if you closed the garage door.  What do you do, turn around and check to be sure.  Well I started to solve this problem by installing a Wyze cam in the garage.  That was great but what if the garage door was open.  Drive back, call a neighbor or instead use this device along with the app and close the door from where you are at.  You can also use Amazon Key app to have packages delivered inside your garage instead of the front door, I didn't connect to it so do not know how well it works.  Set up is very easy, there is a You Tube video if you need help but the instructions will suffice for most people.  The device is simplistic and inexpensive and does what it is intended for.  Did I leave my garage door open?  Yes.  Hit the close button on the app. on your phone. Done. Beautiful.

This product was fairly easy to install so that is not the problem. The problem is how often the product goes offline and require a manual reset. Because it sits on top of the door, it requires that I have to put a ladder up to do a hard reset because the wifi would lose connection and the product goes offline which means it becomes useless and a brick. I think that if it is more consistent it can be a useful product. For now, it seems gimmicky at best and unreliable.

I have youngsters live in house that forgot to close garage door several times, I want to install smart garage opener that can detect and close the door remotely.  I come cross with MyQ Smart Garage Door Opener.  Installation is straight forward and youtube video help in that process step by step.  It took me about 30 minutes to install.  So far so good.  Then the next step is to connect to the WiFi.  The instruction is not very clear but I manage to get it connected and work.  The next one is to program the opener with my garage door opener unit.  It went successfully in the first try.  I think I am done.  Then my come home but can't open the garage door with her opener in the car.  I try every remote in other cars, keypad and spare one.  Nope, nothing works.  I think OK, let;s re-program them all.  So I did and verify all remotes work, except this smart garage door opener though phone App.  It lost the programming.  I re-program it again and verify it works again.  And then was shocked other remotes were stop working again.  After I re-program all other remotes, this one lost the program again.  It does sense the door status so I just leave it like that and just use it as monitor.  Come on, how can you have a product will cause other remotes not pairing any more?

Works as advertised. No issues, I can only speculate that others who are having problems are actually dealing with weak WiFi issues and/or interference from LED lighting in their garage(s) which is not the fault of Amazon or Chamberlain.One thing that was not clear until I started installing the garage door sensor is that it also has the option to be directly screwed into the door versus adhensive tape on a Velcro strip. Sticky tape of any kind never works long term in my climate, too much hot/cold extremes certain times of the year. I screwed my garage door sensor onto one of the metal flanges that connects the door panels together instead of mounting it directly on the door. This flange is offset from the door a bit so if you want to screw the garage door sensor on the door instead of using adhesive Velcro strips you do not have to worry about putting a hole thru the door.

I wrote a review on the hub previously, this is on the second door sensor.  The disappointment with the hub is that it does not work with Google Home (even though it says it works with Google), that the integration with Google Assistant is awkward and incomplete, and that there is no integration with Alexa, except maybe with IFTT, which would also be incomplete.  The second door sensor at first failed to pair with the second garage door motor.  The only way to try again was to clear the hub and reinstall both door sensors.  Then, in order to control the doors, I had to delete the app, turn off my phone, turn the phone back on and reinstall the app.  Then, when I ordered one door to close, the other one opened.  Tech support said this was "cross-talk" and to wipe out the memory on the hub and both motors and reinstall everything, meaning that the cars, handheld remotes and outside pin pads all had to be reprogrammed too. All of the issues were immediately and correctly flagged by tech support, but there were no answers in the written troubleshooting FAQs. Now, everything works but Alexa and Google home are still not allowed to open the doors, and the seemingly simple option of closing all doors is a multistep process that should be a one step process. It seems that there must be a better solution out there.

Product was fairly easy to install. Took a couple of attempts to get the software/application to work but once it linked properly it was since worked. Had this product for several months and works great! Thought I left my garage door open after leaving home and simply checked myq garage application which indicated that my garage door had been closed. Such a nice comfort to know I can check the status of my garage remotely. Love this product. Did have to replace the hub battery that attaches to the garage door once but I do use the product quite frequently. Highly recommend this product to anyone who uses Amazon because now I get all my Amazon purchases “in home” delivered. Never again do I have to worry about package thiefs thanks to Amazon key working with myq product. Such peace of mind!!!

In a nutshell - it was east to install, works as expected, and two neighbors want to buy some now too.My setup included an older - yet still supported - Chamberlain garage door opener, Orbi network, and a Pixel Phone 3. My skills are average and it took less than 20 mins to install.

I was looking for the best device to monitor my garage door opener. I spend many days going through reviews and reading online articles.  Since we are huge Amazon fans and based on the reviews, we purchased the MyQ. The initial set up is very straight forward and easy. It did take me two tries to pair the MyQ with my garage door opener but after that is was smooth sailing.  Once you set up the app on your phone you can monitor and get alerts for when your garage door is open and closed. Once you have it set up you just look on your phone if you are unsure if the door is open or closed. Have not had any issues with door opening or closing by itself.  This device is great for kids as well so they can come and go as they want without a key. You can also set this up for a guest to use if you want.We have not used the in garage delivery available with Amazon but if you have a problem with packages disappearing you may want to give it a try.

The main problem with this product is the enclosed documentation is insufficient in providing you with setup instructions.  I fortunately learned you needed the bridge unit to enable interaction with a smart phone, before making the purchase.  So, I ordered both and my first problem was getting the two units to talk to each other, although I had all four Wi-Fi bars showing in the garage.  This precipitated my having to contact customer support.  My first attempt ended up with me asking the agent to call me back as I was talking to her on my iPhone and also needed it to perform the setup actions.  She never called me back.  The 2d attempt ended with the agent disconnecting just when I was telling him the unit is now working but my car and garage door keypad had stopped.  Not a problem, I was able to get everything working but then it didn't work :-)  So, I called the 3d time and was almost there but the agent said they were doing about to do system maintenance and to give the system time to reboot.  Well....at this point I had spent about 6 hours on this - taking leave from work to do it.  My wife came and in said "Honey, I know this is something you wanted but it's problem time to throw in the towel."  Which I did and sent both this unit and the bridge unit back to Amazon and have Overhead Garage Door coming today to install a new garage door opener which has the smart phone function built in.  I would also advise the company to make a unit which, both, makes your garage door "smart" and gives you the smart phone interface as well.

This device had just one job: open and close the garage door reliably. It doesn't do it that well. Here are some problems in the 11 months I've owned this thing. When you put all these together, it negates any convenience benefit you might have otherwise gained. To me this makes it not worth even the low price they sell this at. I'm pulling it out next weekend.1. Problem - Google Assistant integration is very unreliable. The biggest advantage for owning a device like this would be to tell your smart assistant to open or shut the door. Everything else, such as notifications or the Amazon Key integration is nice, but secondary. If it doesn't work with a smart assistant, you're not much better off than if you had just used your clicker. Here's what happens 9 times out of 10 I use MyQ with Google Assistant:

8/27/2020...  Week after posting this review (and on other sites) ... the app has started showing the time again.Still a flacky device.  Sometimes it will not close garage or you don't get notification the door is open but time stamp is back and I'm happy.  Changing 1 star to 3.

The install went well and insructions were clear. Connected to my older Liftmaster door (purple button).I was expecting that the local hub that connects to the local network/wifi would provide for basic web-based status and control or that there would be an API for the local hub.  Neither is the case.

The overall kit works as it says, opens and closes the door, but it has a very loud and incredibly annoying alarm that sounds when closing the door. 100% unnecessary and a deal breaker for me. I’ve owned it less than 5 hours and I will be returning it because of this alarm.

This thing is slow. I can not seem to get it to work with any home automation systems. alexa or google. very disappointed.I have to use the app on my phone, and I do not love that. The best I can do there is get google to access the app.

I bought this a little over a year ago. I was able to get it set up with a phone call to their tech support, including getting it connected to Apple HomeKit. Worked great, I could operate the door through the Home app, I could direct Siri to open and close the door, tell me if it was closed or open, etc. For some reason it stopped communicating with HomeKit after a little over a year. I called Chamberlain tech support looking for for help to figure out why it stopped working properly. They told me that they do not provide support getting it connected to HomeKit, that if their app was connecting, the HomeKit connection was an Apple problem, not theirs! After some trial and error I was able to get it figured out on my own. I bought this product BECAUSE it works with HomeKit so for them not to support that function, I find their support very lacking... so bottom line to me, this company does not stand behind their products and I will look for other options the next time. Would suggest, if you are reading this, you do the same!...

Be warned! This thing sounds an alarm loud enough to ensure that every living thing for a quarter-mile radius knows that the door is closing and to take cover!I'm fascinated by these products that seem to have been designed to make their users DESPISE them.

First, I have only 2 stars because it is not simply integrated with Google Home.  I want to ask google to open/close door and check if door is open.Other than that, install wasn’t bad but I’m a millennial.  It does work fine in the app, but that was only half the reason I bought.

Update. 9/24I removed one star, (probably should be two). Even though the garage door sensor is installed on the top door panel, if the garage door is partially raised and the sensor is at an angle, it will not indicate that the door is open. The door was open enough for an adult to crawl under it but still indicated it was closed. I was surprised and lucky that I checked it. The sensor unit should indicate an open door if it is not perpendicular to the floor. The attached photo shows the door open, but the app shows it closed.

Pros: It works from the Application on my phone, which is great: I just have to drive near my house, stop, loosen my seatbelt, get out my phone and open it, find the App and press it to open the door (all of which I can do in one step with my RF Garage door opener. Or I can install a Garaget, and ask Google/Alexa to open the door. IFFT? It works (with a fee) sometimesCons: All of the above except: A) Using the garage door opener, or B) Using Google/Alexa to open (or tell door status) with voice. Gave up on using the Chamberlain I had installed and added a Garaget for: 1) Ease of installation, 2) Voice control, and 3) Consistency consistent -- also no fees
2019/05/17 UpdateNo response at all from Chamberlain. Most annoying that they broke their own product via an app update.

I bought this explicitly for the purpose of using amazon key. It works mostly and was easy to install.However this doesn't always close. I've had a few issues where the amazon key delivery person gave me a call after a delivery and said that the garage wasn't able to close. So that's a security issue right there.

This product saved my marriage.  Anyone who lives with someone that leaves the garage open knows my pain. That little eye twitch when u find the garage was left open all night. Is my stuff stolen, was it really left open the whole night, did this really happen again?  All the same questions that race through your mind as u do the walk of shame to your garage in the morning. Yes, this product has changed my life. Easy to install less than 10mins. Shared the app with family, even set an alert to everyones phone when the garage is open longer than 15 mins.  Yes, it even alerts my apple watch. And with a touch of an app i can close the door.Those moments when your rushing to get everyone packed out the door and get a few blocks away and have to turn around to check the garage door. This doesn’t happen anymore!!!!  It has saves aggravation and time.  Why in the world are you still reading this.  Buy this already.  Paid full price but its a great life altering product that you should own.

Set up was easy. I have an iPhone and noted the insert in the Instructions. Basically, you don’t need the paper instructions. I have a LiftMaster opener and all I did was download the app “MyQ LiftMaster”, Open the app, and follow the instructions. Here at the easy to follow steps-1. Make sure you have WiFi

This product appears to do what it says it should. Easy install, and you can use the MyQ app to open and close your garage door remotely. However, it does not work with Alexa. I didn't read far enough into the comments to see this before I purchased. What I read was that it works with Amazon Key so that Amazon can deliver purchases inside your garage for safety. I made the assumption that this implied connecting to Alexa would be a given. Silly me. In the end, no big deal. It's just another app I keep in a folder with home automation stuff in case I ever need to open the garage door remotely. Just can't do it with my voice. That being said, I have no other issues with the product so far.

The big BUT is because the product line is hugely confusing on which one you need for what doors.  It took a tier III person to get these to work for me. and she was awesome as most Tier III people are.  The Tier I customer support was awful, rude and plain wrong.  Bottom line, depending on age of your openers,  I have 2 and one much older, you  need the right device to make them work. The online descriptions make no sense. Gerry rigging one to work both is not advised and more expensive.  You just buy two of the right product.  Also, the location of these devices in garage is very very very sensitive. You have to have them in the perfect spot to work.  But now working and functioning great. Great product with poor execution.  They can fix these things.  Hire someone from Kansas to write product descriptions and install.

Works good, but caused some major interferrance with my traditional opener remotes. This was very frustrating and annoying for my wife and I, as post install it wouldn't open with the old remotes unless you pulled right up against the garage door with the car. It always worked from a good 50+ feet away from the door previous to the install. I could get this distance again by simply unplugging the MyQ unit. I tried various trouble shooting including shielding the device with mylar, and moving the door sensor piece. In the end I found that the interference was coming from the AC power plug to this unit and I needed to move the entire receiver to another location in the garage. This eliminated the interferrance while maintaining a functioning MyQ unit. I am happy now, but the installation guide really should mention this possibility. Hopefully someone having the same issue finds this review helpful.

First off it was a bit of a pain to set up. I wanted to make sure it worked prior to screwing it to the ceiling. I hooked it to the garage, and it initially opened and closed the door fine, but then went into monitor only mode. I finally taped it to the ceiling about where it was going to be installed and it started working.After it appeared to be working I screwed in the permanent mounting bracket. Later that day it started reporting that the garage door was open when it was really closed.  Then if I hit the button in the app to shut the garage door, it would actually open it. Then if I hit it again it would end up in an error state, and I would say that I have to manually open/close the door to get it to work again.

The claims in the description are a lie. When integrating the myQ hub with Google assistant you can only close the door or ask if it is opened. The setup process to even get that far was a nightmare. Then, rather than simply say "Hey Google, close the garage door" you have to instead say "hey Google, ask myQ to close the garage door"I could get by if that was the only issue but this hub will not communicate with any devices that are connected to the same wi-fi network as the hub itself. I don't know about you, but I only have one wi-fi network at home so that means in order to even log in to the app on my phone I have to turn off wi-fi, then open/close my door, then turn wi-fi back on. Not exactly the SMARThome functionality I was going for. I'm going to give it a couple of weeks to see if Chamberlain will respond to any of the issues but if not, this is getting shipped back.

I purchased the hub and it came with a sensor. Extremely easy to install and NO subscription required.  I don’t understand how anyone could have a difficult time installing this. It literally took 5 minutes and that includes hanging the hub on the wall. The install uses a wizard driven set up on the app that walks you step-by-step.As of my set up in December 2019, it Works with Alexa! You must download BOTH the MyQ AND SimpleCommands apps and skills. The hub and sensor require no subscription for full functionality with these skills.

This is driven by a phone app that is of terrible design.  Everything was fine until I got to the sync with garage door opener (GDO)..suddenly I get a call and i'm juggling the phone.  Well it saved the status of the wizard as complete even though it was never registered with the GDO.  So it litterly requires deleting not just the "device" aka the garage door opener...it requires going back thru and SYNCING with the remote sensor AGAIN, and then I had to reset to factor defaults the damn Hub device that syncs to the Garage  even though the underlying app is Chamberlain...and my GDO is chamberlain...and listed in the instructions with matching purple button..they cant freaking talk to each other.  I"m going to give it one more try tomorrow...then this is going in the trash where it belongs..and I'll find a company with a REAL product.

Use Case: Kept forgetting to either close the garage door or having memory of whether I actually closed it or not. After several trips and time wasted going back to check whether it was closed or not, I decided to look for a smart garage door assistant. A deal came up and I took the chance.Pros:

It's easy to install and gives alerts to the main user when the door is opened or closed.Update: I bought a second unit since my garage has 2 doors. Actually I need only 1 hub and 2 sensors but when I am writing this review then the sensor is costlier than hub & sensor package. So I bought this package and using the sensor with old hub.

I bought this to be able to know if my garage was open or closed when I'm not at home. I get paranoid that I left it open sometimes, I don't know why. This gives me peace of mind and so much more. I'm able to open it through the app every time without any issues. I can let people park their car in my garage, which I do often since I live downtown, and they can come back later and pick it up without me having to be there. I have only used the Amazon Key option once, but it was very convenient as well. They notify you they are there to drop off a package, you authorize them to open the garage, they place your package in the garage and take a picture, then they close the garage with the app, and take a picture of the closed garage. You can also check it on the MyQ app. I have tried it a few times with Alexa, but haven't had much success, it's easier just to use the app.

This was the easiest wi-fi garage door controller I have ever installed. Plug it in, connect it to your wifi, mount the door sensor, and then it learns how to send a signal to open/close the door. There were no wires to connect it to the door opener, it does it all via wireless.My only gripes are it can't be directly controlled via Siri or Alexa (looks like you need a "hub"), the beeper volume is way too loud (I put a piece of tape over the speaker to lower the volume), and unlike my previous Genie wifi opener, the MyQ app cannot be programmed to close if the door has been left open for a duration of time (like an hour). You can schedule it to close every day at 10pm for example, and it can be set to warn you if it's been left open, but the auto-close is a feature that should be added to the app. Genie can do it, so the MyQ should have it as well.

Before the product arrived, I have downloaded the manual and "played" with it imaginably.  But when it arrived, I had a hard time to install it.  I had to reset and re-install about five times in three hours.  Still didn’t work.  MyQ support didn’t help much, either.  Drove me crazy.  It turned out, my Android Samsung Note 8 has some problems with it.  So I turned off my Note 8 and restart it.  God had mercy, it ran smoothly without a problem.  I was able to install it within 5 minutes.Important note:  1/ When you run into problems, make sure to reset your phone first. 2/ The Wi-Fi hub doesn’t have to be on the ceiling, it could be anywhere in the garage.  I put mine on a shelf.

Not sure what all the crazy disputes are for.  I bought this for the purpose of keeping me aware of when the garage door is left open and being able to close it remotely.  It works with the MyQ app perfectly for this.Install was simple...I do have a 2.4ghz and 5 ghz network running at my house so I was a little concerned about getting things to work but it kicked right in on the first try.

I know it doesn't integrate with Alexa (unless you're willing to build your own openHAB device on Raspberry Pi to bypass Chamberlain's lock down). But it also didn't advertise itself as having Alexa compatibility, so I suppose can't ding it for not living up to our expectations. Or maybe I can considering that it used to exist and Chamberlain intentionally blocked it for the simple reason that they (erroneously) thought that feature wasn't making them money. Chamberlain obviously is in desperate need of a change in leadership.As for being a way to open and close your garage door from your phone and also receive alerts if you accidentally left the door open, it works great. Of course if they allowed integrations with other apps, such as IFTTT, you could use geolocation to trigger the door to close automatically when you leave your neighborhood. But I degress...

The installation was easy, and went with no problems.  It took about 30 minutes from start to finish.  It works reliably, and the door opens and closes every time I use the app.  I also set up two alerts:- When the door is open longer than 5 minutes.
Let's be clear- when an automatic wi-fi garage door opener says it works with Google Assistant, that has some implied ideas:A) it's free (it's not)

Not really going to write a long review here, but I can tell you that it was beyond simple to set up. I assumed I would need to run some wiring and connect some sensors, etc. With this product, all the communication is done wirelessly. The trickiest part was finding a good spot to plug the hub in for electricity. I already have a Ring stick-up camera using a plug and my garage door motor using a plug, so I bought a simple outlet splitter to plug this hub into. Once you pair the door sensor and the hub together, you sync the hub and your garage door motor through its programmable button feature and bam! the door is connected. App is simple and straight forward. I find the product to work really well.One thing I will mention: after getting this product I figured out that it was time to move on from my obvious and easy to guess WiFi password as this IoT device now could allow access into my home. As a result, two days after I initially installed it, I tried to change the WiFi password on the device. It was way more challenging than it should have been and ultimately culminated in me performing a factory reset on the hub and re-installing from scratch.

I don’t usually have time to review stuff, but I am making time for this purchase.  I had this item in and out of my cart for 6 months and couldn’t decide if it was what I was looking for.  Some reviews were technical and I didn’t understand if it was what I needed so for the less techy people let me put it in terms that I was looking for when I was studying this product.  It’s great, we have a busy family, 4 kids plus 2 have significant others so 8 of us using the garage door.  Each person can have the app with the log in information and use it as needed.  There is no limit to how many people you give your log in information to.  Those with the log in information can see when the garage is opened or closed from wherever you are.  This also gives you the flexibility to open it for a friend and allow them to get in from where you are and you can close it again when your friend leaves.  There are 3 guest invites that you can give, let’s say a boyfriend, and then you can kick that guest off when you decide he’s not the one.  The guest log in can’t see as much as those with actual log in information.  I have no electrical experience and I installed this myself, it was not hard to install and works great for my family.  It’s not a camera, you can’t see the garage door or inside, it simply operates the garage door from wherever you are.  For my family it was the same cost as buying everyone an opener and we have a lot more flexibility.  I get notifications when it’s opened or closed wherever I am.  I can tell someone has arrived home or left.  I can tell when it’s left open at night when I’m working and close it.  I can reach over to my nightstand at 11pm and see if it’s closed when I second guess myself without getting out of my warm bed.  The app is great for us and our needs.  We love it!!

I got one of these for my garage, and the install is ridiculously easy.  It does everything pretty much automatically!  The instructions have you download their app, then the app walks you through.  It's literally finds the device, connects it, and you simply stick the sensor on your garage door and voila, works.  This took me about 5 - 10 minutes to install and it works beautifully.  The app is well done and really, not a single complaint from me.  You can set alerts, you can open your garage, whatever.  Well done, simple.  What more do you want?Just please, ignore the negative reviews.  Maybe the upgraded or updated or whatever, but seriously, this is a 5 minute install.  Just download the app, press the button on the device, it finds the device and that's about the end of it.

I thought someone should mention, that if you get stuck at the "Connecting to device..." screen on your phone in the app when trying to install this, try choosing the "I have a Purple Button" option.I have a button that is actually either Red or Orange, and I tried both of those options over and over and it never connected.  Then I saw a post on the MyQ forums that mentioned trying the Purple Button option instead, and it worked right away.

I had seen other reviews and videos on line that said this was a finicky product to set up, but I thought it was super simple. Followed the steps on the app once applying power to the unit, and everything set up automatically and quickly on the first attempt.Very happy with this product and the ability to monitor and open / close garage door as needed.  Also the app is very good, you can set alerts to let you know it's open, for how long, in between time periods, etc.

So I had been wanting this item for a while. Then, when I saw it discounted for prime day, I snatched it up right away. Turns out I was awaiting for nothing. I really wanted to connect it to Siri on my phone, but NOPE. If I want to connect it to Siri, that requires A WHOLE SEPARATE PART on top of the one I already bought. I have a google home too so I tried booking it up to that. Nope. I have tried so many times and I still cannot get it to connect to my google home system. They use this weird way to connect it and, surprise, it doesn’t work. If you have an Alexa, maybe it works for you, but don’t count on it connecting to anything else’s. If you use the app, it goes though the login process EVERY time you open it. And if I try to close it, it takes forever. It takes so long I get tired of waiting, find my actual clicker and just close it that way before it even starts to close it when I’m home.

I got this as a Black Friday deal. It was almost half off but knowing what I now know I would have gladly paid full price for it!  This thing is great. We got it because my teenage son leaves the house after us and he would sometimes forget to close the garage before he left. Easy to install the unit and pair with your garage door.  I would say start to finish installation took less than 15 mins. FYI...only works with 2.4ghz WiFi though. The app is simple to use and easy to set up alerts and notifications. You can open and close your garage door remotely, check the history of when the door has opened or closed and check the current status. Used this for 5-6 months and have no issues losing connection or any malfunctions with the unit. Absolutely recommend this product!

I rarely write a review unless a product or service is either a real stinker or a real Godsend. This Chamberlain is the latter. I have a vacation home and wanted to be able to open remotely and to give (and manage) family members access / the ability to open with iPhone versus handing out clickers. Installation took less than 10 minutes. Much easier than anticipated. App walks thru and manages each step including pairing and testing etc. No need to hard wire into garage unit. Totally wireless other than power to a standard power outlet. I have a double deep garage and that posed no issues. It operates just like my other home that came with new garage opener that had this chamberlain functionality already built in. That home proved bullet proof each time I used it. Very happy with ease of installation, user interface of app and the actual functionality and simplicity of operation. Just ordered two more for other garage doors.

I installed this by myself. The toughest part was that the ceiling in my garage is stucco so I was struggling to drill into that surface. I adapted that by zip tying to the PVC pipe that runs some electrical across the ceiling. I’ve had it installed almost a month and I am loving this product. I was one of those that would a accidentally leave my garage door open in a rush to get out the door. So the ability to make custom alerts and close and open the door from my classroom at work is a lifesaver and huge piece of mind. Also the price is surprising- very affordable for the ease. The app was super clear during the install. I had schedule my garage door installer to put it in for me but I canceled him after seeing how easy it was to do myself. I want one of these for my refrigerator and freezer doors so someone please make that!! This product is highly recommended.

It does the basic function of using your remote from anywhere to open or close your garage.  I took off a star because the directions were OK but could have been clearer.  I accidentally deleted all my remotes during the install process by simply holding down the learn button a hair too long because I didn't see a connection with the MyQ, but next time around it was OK and reprogramming my remotes wasn't the end of the world and a good reminder of how to do it.  I got it on Black Friday for $20 on sale so couldn't pass it up after a friend told me about his.  Not sure I will use the Amazon key function, too many security questions there. but I do have it set up to tell me if I my door is open for longer than 15 minutes and if I leave and get worried I didn't shut it I can always look and see and it worked out well.

I bought the MyQ garage door opener from the Amazon Warehouse at a very affordable price. I wasn't sure if the item was going to be compatible because I had an older Chaimberlain drive system nor did I do any research prior to my purchase; it turns out that this remote opener IS compatible with MANY drive systems as long at your drive system has opticle eyes. (MyQ states that most systems after 1993 have opticle eyes built in as a safety feature. There is a compatibility tool on the MyQ web page if you are unsure). I had no issues with set up and it was super easy although you must have a 2.5ghz wifi signal to do so. I chose not to mount the main device on the ceiling as instructed and only set it on a shelf for now and it still works; it should still work as long as the distance from the controller is within 3-5 feet of the drive motor and plugged into an outlet.

Turning smart devices on/off from a mobile device is a great convenience. Adding to that convenience is the ability to open/close a compatible garage door remotely takes it to the next level. Not sure if you have closed the door once you drive off? Check the app, and remotely close it. A friend wants to drop off an item but you're not home? Open the door remotely. A very handy feature to say the least. Although it is able to integrate with Google Home or Alexa, a subscription fee is required (I think first year is free but is subject to change). I actually have no plans to integrate with Home or Alexa but still think this is a great step toward a smarter home. Installation is super easy and quick -- you'll need a ladder and drill some holes (there is workaround to the latter but do it at your own risk).

The installation process was painful and took nearly an hour.  The major problem was the installation wizard asked for the color of the "learn" button on my opener, which was orange.  After selecting "orange", the wizard would grind for a while and then fail.  Once it failed, I had to rescan the QR code and start all over again.  Tried it three more times before calling tech support.  Turned out, even though my button was orange, "green" was the right answer.  Once I chose green, MyQ setup in minutes.Aside from the installation frustration, the MyQ has been working flawlessly.  I've been able to operate the door and check its status from everywhere we've traveled.  I've since added a second sensor so both doors operate and we've setup, what I think is the best feature, a scheduled closing.  If we leave either or both doors open, at 9:00 PM, they automatically close.

The device works fine, easy to setup, but has 3 really irritating "features"1. It doesn't work with Google Assistant. That is, it "says" it does, but they haven't actually done an integration. What they've done is host a crappy service that you have to subscribe to then attach to your Google Assistant account. It's lame

Installed to use with a Chamberlain model C205 opener.  This is in a townhouse, so there is a lot of radio interference from the neighbors, etc.  My Wi-Fi router is in the front of the property, about 100 feet away from the myQ hub.  The only problem I had linking it to Wi-Fi was RF noise coming from four 4' long LED strips hanging right in front of the hub between the hub and the router.  I turned the lights off and it connected fine.  I was going to disperse the LEDs in the garage anyway.If you have a Chamberlain opener, you don't need the garage door sensor, just the hub.  The hub will use the opener's already installed open/close sensor.  This little tid-bit only shows up in the troubleshooting instructions I read through because of the LED interference issue I had.

Easily installed along with programming and integration to my Liftmaster garage door opener! Looked up Youtube videos prior to receiving product and it was a better and faster process for me following installation and programming through the MyQ app! Can be used with Amazon Key if user is comfortable with Amazon having legal “quick” access to open your garage door just for deliveries of course, but having a camera that can record videos and images when motion is detected would be best!  I have seen some negative reviews though about the system spazzing at times opening the garage door with an unknown status on the App. Overall, highly recommended and will update if anything goes wrong with its intended use and operations.

Nothing complicated here...just wanted a way to remotely open the garage door.  Bought one of the "Used - Very Good" condition units (heavily discounted!) that turned out to be brand new inside the box.  Great deal for me!  Install was flawless.  Just followed the instructions in the app and my Chamberlain opener was paired and working in under 15 minutes total.All in all, it's been a great experience.  I have not tried Alexa integration yet (no real need), but may try it out later.

I have been looking at the MyQ for quite some time and the price has steadily been dropping. Finally decided to purchase it when it was available on the Treasure Truck. I'm a little bummed I waited so long. I watched a few videos prior to the install and was a little apprehensive about putting it up. Finally I opened the app and it actually walks you right through the install and people took some unnecessary steps in the YouTube videos.I have a Chamberlain garage door opener but it is close to 25 years old as this point. My garage is a 2.5 car detached garage that is quite a bit from the house. I don't get wifi on my phone and my new laptop can barely connect so I was a little concerned but thought if it doesn't work, I'll just install a wifi extender. I have yet to have any issues though and it has worked flawlessly. I have now successfully opened and closed my garage for a friend from 50 miles away.

Update: Chamberlain Helpdesk did send me the sensor again and it works flawlessly. My wifi router and the sensor is almost 30-35 feet and few walls between, but get good reception. Hence I bough another set for my other door now.old review.

I bought this product because we occasionally left our garage door open all night and didn't want this to happen again.  It doesn't!  I setup a monitor to close the garage every night at 9:00 PM.  If it's open it closes it and sends me a notification.  If it's already closed, nothing happens.  You can also check the log to see when it was closed (or opened) to see how long since the even occurred.  I had setup an alert to let me know when it was opened but I'm not sure it's needed at this point.I followed the instructions and setup the unit in less than 30 minutes.  It was very easy and I didn't have any issues.  You can see in the pictures, I have the sensor mounted to the top panel of the garage door.  The other unit is mounted on the ceiling near the garage door opener.  During my setup, my wireless router is just on the other side of the wall from the garage so I think this help during the installation.

OK, Chamberlain customer service contacted me after seeing my review. The conclusion was that I was shipped the wrong version of the product and/or in the wrong box. Either way, they shipped me an add-on hub that works with Apple HomeKit - so now everything works as I thought it should. So kudos to customer service. The “fix” was to add the additional hub to allow connection with HomeKit and the existing garage door opener unit. That combo shows up as an Apple HomeKit device and integrates with your iPhone/iPad/iMac. All good. All works.I still don’t understand why an additional hub device is needed as the garage opener unit could be made HomeKit compatible as it independently connects to the WiFi network. Upon further reflection, I think that if you have a recently made Chamberlain/LiftMaster garage door unit you will only need the hub unit.

I bought this for two reasons:  1) to be able to control the garage door with my phone, and  2) to use the feature that Amazon has for leaving my deliveries in my garage.  First, this unit paired easily with my 6 year old Craftsman garage door opener.  Installation and setup was easy and uneventful.  I am now able to open and close my garage door with my phone and I can also check to see if my garage door is open or closed.  Works very well.  One slight disappointment, although not the fault of this device is that Amazon does not offer the service of leaving deliveries in my garage in my area.  I assumed that Amazon would have this service everywhere where they make the deliveries themselves, but unfortunately, after I set it up and downloaded the Amazon "Key" app, I was informed that the service was not available in my area.  So you may want to verify if you have this service or not if you are getting for that reason.

Impossible to connect. I major trouble connecting to my first router. Now I have a stronger router and it won't connect at all, not even to the MyQ let alone from the MyQ to the router. It goes into an endless loop saying it's connected to the hub the says it's lost the connection and reconnects over and over and over and over and over. Opening and closing the app doesn't fix the looping issue but restarting phone does. That gets me back to square one but eventually ends up in the same loop.It also has a weak WiFi connection even though other devices in the same area, including my phone show 4 bars.
Pros:+ Simple to install. Was able to get up and running quickly

I wish I would have purchase this a long time ago.  I can’t tell you how many times I have pulled out of the driveway, driven down the road and asked myself if I closed the garage door.  I was even late for an appointment once, hurried out  and got to the appointment without remembering if the door was left open , or not.  I had to call my neighbor and ask him to check.Now, I get alerts sent to my phone and email that tell me when the door was opened, or closed.  If I find that I left it open, I can remotely close it.  Most people don’t panic about leaving the door open.  Hopefully you won’t learn the hard way like I did.  If not, you will once you are violated and something of value gets stolen.

First of all, let me introduce myself. I'm possibly the only male in America that struggles with basic household chores. Want that picture hung straight? Let me take 42 minutes and still have it at a 32 degree angle.Based on some of the reviews for this garage door opener, I was as nervous as a stripper at confession about installing this on my own. When I opened the package and saw the basic instruction booklet with instructions to simply  download the app, my heart sank.

If you plan to use Google Assistant or Alexa, don't bother. After asking for it to open the garage door, all it does is report the status of the door. I already know it's closed, that's why I said open. The one time it worked, it told me the door was closed, then opened the door about 5 inches and stopped, leaving it partially open while still saying it was closed. I bought 2 hubs on black Friday (luckily), because after an hour of trying to pair the hub to my opener, I finally resorted to opening the other one and it worked fine. But I factory reset the first hub and followed every step perfectly, and all it did was tell me it was trying to pair for 15 minutes straight and never worked. So in short, I spent hours installing it, just to tear it all down in 10 seconds when it intermittently opened my door partially without telling me. I'm returning them and I'll never but this brand again. I'm so upset I wasted my night dinking around with this junk for it not to work with Google like advertised.

Although it  is easy to install, and seems to work as advertised, integration with Google Assistant is not direct.  Google Assistant calls the MyQ app, and then you have to talk to the MyQ app.  So, if you want to review the status of your home quickly (say that you're away on vacation), you have to check different apps, and it's a multistep process.Also, the connection to Google Assistant is a "premium service," and while it's free now, there's no guarantee that it will continue to be subscription free.  Also, before you can use your MyQ app with Google Assistant, you have go to the MyQ website and subscribe.

The product itself is good but the Alexa integration is false. Installation was a breeze. Setting up the app was very convenient.It works reliably. I can invite friends when visiting and cancel when they leave for it to work from their phone. No more lending out my garage door openers to relatives visiting!

I like this. It works.  I will say also that their help line phone support is great.  They recently upgraded the app and it has some VERY non-intuitive features.  On the installation, make sure you consider the height of your vehicles so that the three way triangle between garage door opener (in ceiling) to your base unit, to the little thing you stick on the garage door itself.  That three way triangle has to have clear line of sight at all times, and AFTER door is opened (which blocked my first plan) and for would sometimes not close.  So I had to remove base unit from ceiling and put in wall, where it could see over car but not so high that is was blocked from seeing the little thing you stick on door (when garage door is open).  Was tricky.  After that, I had no more problems, except the new features they just put into app.  So, now for that, when in myQ app there is dumb icon in right upper corner of app that makes no intuitive sense.  Make sure to press it enough (works like three way toggle switch) to get the big view of your garage door icon in center of app.  If you have the other views, you will press button to open and close door, and it will put words like "closing" on the screen etc and look like you pressed a button, but it. WILL NOT WORK.  You must have it on a certain view to actually work.  Very dumb.  I called and reported the user interface problems to them.  So, had I just known all of the above, I could have avoided these issues.  I really like this product now and would but it again.  I'm thinking of getting a second one for my mom's garage door so I can make sure she is safe with the door closed.  I also love that you can set up scheduled closings if the door.  I have about four each evening and a couple in morning.  After people are supposed to be fine to work, school, then four more starting about 8 pm in evening, then every two hours till after midnight.  This way, in case someone leaves the door open, it will close.  It keeps record and can also notify you when these triggers happen.

I bought this because it has a phone app, IFTTT integration and supposedly works with Amazon Key to allow Amazon to deliver packages inside your garage.Amazon Key literally misrepresented itself to me when I typed in my Zip code. They said they offered it in my area. Only after buying this did they disclose that garage service isn’t available to my area.

I got this primarily because we have on a few occasions inadvertently left our garage door open overnight. I had tried another smart-device solution that would warn me when this happened, but it didn't work well enough due to its distance from the associated hub, and because mounting contacts for a garage-door sensor is tricky.This unit does exactly what I needed. I can use my smartphone to check whether the door is closed (and to open or close the door). I have it set up to alert me on my phone when the door opens or closes, which gives me added peace of mind. The door sensor mounts to the top panel of the garage door with double-faced tape or screws (I used the latter).

I hate leaving negative reviews but my experience with this product was bad. I set it up (which is pretty simple, so that’s a plus). Worked great the first night and the morning after! It worked for my wife as well. We used our app to control the door several times that morning, each time flawlessly.When I returned home in the afternoon, the app would not open the garage door. Not only that, but our usual garage door openers wouldn’t work! It was as if the hub was not synced and all the sudden, neither were the openers we’ve used for years.

After much research, I found MyQ Garage is one of the most affordable smart garage-door openers, and also one of the easiest to install.  Installation took me about half hour,  then it was a easy link to set up the account and  link to the phone,  and wireless network. It was also great that I could install it on family member phone but could the limit was 2 more.I'm updating my review, after using the unit for few months, the app on phone is crashing majority of times and I have to link the unit again to the app.

Works great!  I normally don't read the instructions before installing but this time I did.  It didn't really spell it out, but it works like the opener in your car - so the base unit hooks up to your wifi and then it has a built in remote control like the one you already have.Because of this it works with almost any garage door opener that isn't over 30 years old.  It has not had one error in over a couple weeks.

We had occasionally left our garage door open overnight recently because (usually I) forgot I had gone out that way when I came back into the house through another door. I was looking for a device like my father used to have, some sort of open/closed sensor with a wire that you bring into the house. If it's red, the door's open. Easy, right? Except the ones I found cost over $25, so when this went on sale for just a bit more than that, I ordered. The primary use is for it to nudge me when the door is open after 9:00pm. I also have it set to tell me if it stays open more than two hours. These both work flawlessly. I like the added functionality of also being able to open the door with my phone when I'm in the yard, making my old keypad unnecessary.I know it insists you have to mount it on the ceiling, but for my garage that would have meant extension cords for the power and the tall ladder to hang it, so I tried it on the call near where the sensor is when it opens and it has operated perfectly. The sensor is very close to the mounted unit when the door is open, which seems to be all that is needed.

Set up the system and it worked for a few weeks/ months.  At times the app is slow to kick in.  And I’ve had to reset the whole system to factory and go through the setup process twice.  So it can be a real pain in the butt when you need it to open or close.  There has been a few times, I’ve hit it in my subdivision:  4 blocks away, and it’s opened.  Other times, I hit it open, and the app says open and I come to a door closed.  If you also hit the app open a few times, the door sensor tends to malfunction, and it says that I have to manually open it.  Kinda defeats the purpose of having it.  So when it works,  no complaints.  When it doesn’t, it’s a time when that feature is really counted on and it doesn’t work.  Good luck with yours...

First, the evening I tried to install and configure the myQ, NONE of it worked. And of course I was working on it after their business hours so I was just plain confused and little upset over spending what I did, only to have none of it working. That was the first night. Second, morning of the 2nd day, I tried to perform the exact same things I had done the night before, and Behold, EVERYTHING worked. Received the second door sensor this morning, and had it running within 30 minutes of going out to the mailbox to get it. So now, in less than a week, I have 2 remotely controllable door openers. Had I known that the second door sensor was required, I would have had it all done the second day I was working on it's configuration. So, if you have multiple doors, my only tip would be to get the number of extra sensors for your myQ. I only have 2 doors and the myQ comes with 1 door sensor, so I only needed one more. Am very happy with this purchase.

Lots of stuff out there to jury rig a remote garage door opener including lasers to check if the door is open. This is a lot simpler probably because it is made by a company that makes garage door openers. You simple plug it in, tape a sensor that comes with it to the garage door and then program you garage door opener to treat it as an added remote. Then, using you wifi the garage door can be checked or controlled anywhere in the world.

May 2020 Update: still like this product very much, continues to work well. I am now waiting for it to go sale so can add to our rental house. No issues at all in the six months of use , and we have had major power outages so the electronics are well made.Saw this product on sale ($20) and jumped on it as I have been wanting something that would tell me when or if my garage door is open (particularly when in my bed upstairs). The device is extremely easy to install and setup, best of it works great.  I have used the MyQ to close/open my garage when we have left the house for walks (not having my keys). MyQ provides basic data such as when door opened or closed as well as how long in each sequence. I really like this product and can recommend it.

I purchase this knowing how many times we would get down the road and wonder if the garage door was closed, turn around only to find it closed, we now just open our phone app to see the MyQ showing door closed for a certain amount of time, it sure is a piece of mind, I also experimented with opening the garage door when I was about a mile away and again. it showed the door open. It was a breeze to install on a Genie garage door opener, I just took my laptop out in the garage and followed the instructions on it, and I didn't even have to do that as they were right on the phone after installing the app. Now the MyQ is fairly close to a range extender and I haven't had any issues with the WiFi connection but I could see how this would be an issue if your WiFi is a distance from the garage.

The product is very good. It is easy to set up and works quite well with the MyQ app. There is some conflicting information from MyQ regarding connecting this device to your WiFi. Some literature outlines a Bluetooth connection to share WiFi information, while others outline connecting to the MyQ device first, then having the device link to the WiFi. In any event, I was able to connect the second time I tried. The directions for installation could have been clearer, but with some trial and error, I got it going.I take away 2 stars because MyQ will easily link with my Wink Hub, but will not link with my Alexa voice control. While some posters have claimed that there is a safety and security issue associated with closing a garage door, I am sceptical because I have ADT and my front door lock on Alexa and have countermeasures built in.

Came home from a 12 day trip and panicked. Garage door facing the street was wide open. Was someone in the house?! Had we been robbed or vandalized?! How long had it been open?!A check of the app showed it had been for an hour. No alert notification. No idea why. So thankful that was only known timeframe it was open.
