Woke up this morning and door was open again. No alert notification again. Pulling it out for the trash. Warranty has passed. The Numerical average customer reviewd is decent, but you can also find many instances of this happening with no help from customer service.

The installation was super easy. Just plug the main unit to power and follow the instructions on the app. The reason for the four stars is that I've only had for about 5 days and already two separate times I've pressed the close button int he app and the door has not closed. The app says closing but it never closes. Luckily I've been watching the door so I can see it's not closed and I'll close the app and retry and worked without issue. But imagine if your away from ur house and trying to close it or one of the kids forgets when they leave for school. Ur thinking the door is closed but it's open all day. But has only happened twice so far just an FYI for those buying this device. Oh and I couldn't hook it up to my Google home either, which doesn tmattet o me but to others it may.

FYI, right out of the box, worked like a champ with the liftmaster.  I did look for compatibility, and the Genie 2028 did show as compatible.  Apparently, with Genie, this means that you can monitor the position of the door, but despite multiple efforts with both Chamberlain and Genie support people, I could not get it to pair to motor to control open or closing of door itself.Chamberlain says contact Genie.  Genie says "It's not our product; we offer ZERO support" (said with an attitude, BTW).  So very frustrating when no one wants to help, always pointing the finger.  Chamberlain people were most helpful via support, but still could not get it to work.  ANYONE out there who did get it to work  with a Genie 2028 I would love to know how.

Make sure to download the app first.  The app is also a guide for the hardware install and Wi-Fi connection  with easy to follow the step by step instructions and videos.My big gripe... when using the app to close the garage door there is an led flashing light to warn anyone that may be under the door that it is about to close.  There is also an loud, annoying high pitched beeping to also warn that the door is about to close.  The flashing light and beeping last for several seconds to the point where you begin to wonder if the door is ever going to actually start closing.

Connects easily, integreates with Alexa seamlessly.I cannot tell you how many times I have left for work and had to turn the car  around to see if I remembered to close the garage door. It seems like a simple task, and 99% of the time I have closed it. Cameras didnt do the trick ,because if you do happen to leave it open, you still have to turn around . Not with this product, you can easily see on the app that your garage is open or closed, (and for how long). Even better , the app texts you almost immediately if the garage is opend or closed.

I had another remote garage opener which died after a year with a known failure issue.  It was great while it lasted.  I’ve been looking for a replacement and saw this one which was  fraction of the price.  I read many negative reviews as well but mostly about subscription pricing.  While I was hoping it would be integrated into Smart Things it wasn’t a deal breaker.  I chose this unit because it supported my Chamberlain LiftMaster garage motor and it was so easy to set up. I followed the instructions and within minutes it was connected and installed.  It was much easier to install and setup over my previous unit.  I hope this lasts for a long time. So far I love it.

Product works as advertised with a Sears Craftsman garage door opener.  The app is reliable and easy to use.The installation instructions are detailed but there are a few minor glitches in the instructions.  There's also a video that shows how to mount the hub, although the written instructions are quite clear in that area.

Bought this item yesterday had it delivered last night and tried to set it up. I was in the same room and within 10 feet from my wireless router set up failed 3 times before finally linking up to the network. It comes with garage door tilt sensor that is supposed to let you know if the door is up or down and so far it has yet to update the the door has been opened and closed 5 times but the app is showing door has been closed for 14 hours. The instructions are horrible finding an actual "instruction manual" is painful.So far today I spent 45 minutes going back and forth thru the automated customer service menu's ended up having to disconnect due to being stuck in what seemed like an infinite loop of crap. I called back and was on hold trying to talk to someone at Chamberlain for 5 more minutes till i was given the opportunity to have my call returned it has been 45 minutes and still waiting.

You can check to see if the door is opened or closed, and open or close the door, via smartphone on the MyQ app.  It doesn't really connect to Google Home, but you can link to Google Assistant.  I couldn't find a way to link it to Alexa. When linked to Google assistant, it doesn't have the full functionality of the app.  As in, you can't open the door. You have to go back to your myQ app for that. On the plus side, you can schedule it to close the door at multiple times, in order to get around housemates who constantly leave the door open. I think I would have been happy with the product if the limitations in linking with home assistants were clear, for example, it it said doesn't work with Google, instead or works with Google, but then I would not have bought it.  Knowing what I know now, I would have shopped for something with better integration with home assistants. As far as installation goes, I had to uninstall and reinstall the app.  It would have been easier if this was something noted in troubleshooting, but I had to call technical support to find out. It seems like it is a few years behind.
Got this so that I could make sure that my garage was shut overnight when I go to sleep before my wife, instead of having to get out of bed to check.Pros:

I love the concept of this and so far it has worked with a few hiccups.  First:  while I couldn't find documentation, apparently there is a limit to the number of devices that can control my craftsman unit.  I believe it is four.  As I was going through the setup which is very easy in my opinion, I couldn't get my motor unit to connect to the MyQ.  I found how to reset the motor unit and was able to make it connect.  later in the day I got a close error which is supposed to be from something obstructing while closing.  That didn't happen so not sure why I got the error.  I could not get it to reset so I called technical support.  They ended up doing a factory reset and got it to work.  The next day I started adding my other remotes back and for some reason the MyQ lost connection to the motor unit.  I tried several resets per the app instructions and couldn't get it to work so again called tech support and they quickly helped me get connected again.  Getting other family members connected was very easy.  My issue now is that I have a wireless keypad that I cannot get to connect to the motor unit.  I have tried multiple times and ways to reset and it will not connect.  I do have at least one other remote connected so I don't think it is at the limit.  Overall I think this will be a good product and I hope they continue to fix some of the glitches.

This product is very good considering the intended function of the device. The installation and app setup was very easy. The Alexa integration and overall smart home assistant functionality could be better. The alarming when the garage door is closing is annoying and unnecessary, in my opinion. I could definitely do without that ongoing beeping since my garage, like most garages, has a safety sensor built in. These two areas are the way that they are in the name of safety, as I understand it. These two areas are a small issue that I mostly overlook due to the root function of the device being so good. I would definitely recommend it.

I just finished installing the My Q wifi garage door opener on the Liftmaster openers (2) at my house.  From start to finish it took less than an hour and everything went extremely well.  Once I downloaded the My Q app, it took me very thoroughly through the installation and connection process.  It took two attempts to connect the hub to my network but the app told me exactly what to do and the second attempt worked perfectly.Both doors are now connected and functioning just as I had hoped.  In addition to the convenience of controlling the doors with my iPhone, I love being able to set push notification alerts when either door opens, when it closes and even if either remains open for a predetermined period of time.

Overall it works well and I would probably purchase it again. I've run into a few times where the App won't connect to the door. Since that is the main reason for the App, it's a big problem for me. Occasionally I've run into a problem where the door is closed, but the sensor doesn't recognize that and sends me a false alert that the door is open when it's not open. I installed this myself and feel that I have followed the instructions correctly. Customer service has been helpful in resolving the issues when they happen, but the sometimes still occur. After all this, I second guess whether the door is open or closed and will probably by a security camera so I can verify remotely.

If I can get this working, I'll amend my review but, so far, it has just been a hassle. I didn't have any issues with the initial setup process, but I can't get it to work consistently--I would say that it works 25% of the time, if that. Most of the time I get a message that the garage door is not responding (after about 60 seconds) when trying to open or close the garage door via the MyQ app. I know the hub has a good wi-fi connection--the light is always solid green and I can consistently ping the IP address of the hub from my iPhone which is connected to the same wi-fi network. I am testing from my home--that is my primary use case as the main reason I bought this was so that I wouldn't have to carry the garage door remote with me when riding the motorcycle and could just open the garage via the MyQ app on my phone when returning home. I've emailed their support twice via their web-based form. They say they'll respond in one business day, but it has been way longer than that and I have yet to get a response to either of my emails. I finally called support today and, after a long wait (close to 30 minutes I would say), I finally got a support person on the line. I asked if the flashing light was anything other than a visual warning that the garage door would be closing soon because the instructions said the flashing light must be visible from the garage door opening. This person confirmed that it is just a visible warning. I mentioned that I had read that moving the hub further from the garage door opener than the 4-6 feet stated in the setup instructions might be necessary in some cases due to interference and asked if I should try that. This person said that is the first thing he would try so I moved the hub from the garage ceiling near the opener to an outside wall. It still has a good wi-fi connection, but the door still won't open or close with any level of consistency. I don't know what the deal is. I may try to call their support one more time (seems like that's the only option since my experience is that they don't reply to emails) but, if they don't have any suggestions that seem likely to solve the problems I am having, I will probably just return it. I don't think it is a compatibility issue with my door--it is reportedly compatible and I wouldn't think it would work at all if not. In any case, I like the concept of the product but, at least for me, it has worked very poorly so far--it's not something I could rely on—and their support is inadequate in terms of accessibility. As someone else indicated, it seems their user forum is closed.

I added this to my 15 year old garage door opener.  It works great, one minor flaw. Occasionally the app freezes, and I have to completely stop the app from running, and restart it.  However, it really is a minor flaw, and I do enjoy being able to both control the door from my ohone, but to also see the status of the door.Setup was easy using the app.

Personally I thought the step by step install instructions via the app was straightforward.  It was a 5 minute set up for me.  It took longer to mount the hub onto the ceiling of my garage (which I later discovered wasn't absolutely necessary).  I love the functionality and ease of use of being able to see my garage door notifications, and being able to control the garage from my phone.  I've noticed that only occasionally, the app will take a little while to load.  Also, i've noticed that a few times when i've tried to use the app as it's switching from my wifi to my cell signal, it will log out and prompt me to log back in.  This has been a rare occurrence and not enough for me to not like the app.  I'm happy overall and would definitely recommend adding it to your non-wifi garage door opener.

Love this product and would recommend it. If you are purchasing it with the thought of using it as part of a smart home don't. The things it does with smarthings and IFTTT are super simple. Asking it to check door status and close the door are about the only things that are unique to the device. IT WILL NOT OPEN THE DOOR for security protocols. Now install is super simple. I had one operation problem with it not working correctly and as techie I failed trouble shooting 101. Rebooted and all is great. The best part of it is no more remotes and auto close at X time and the app itself.  I have 5 cars to me this is the best part of the product. One last thing you won't  find a workable hack to open the door without app.

Originally paired with an ancient Genie using the MyQ app - worked perfectly.  The Genie died, so bought the Chamberlain B970 and again it paired easily once again with the MyQ app. This is all done on an Android Samsung 8. Then came the agonizing pairing to Alexa.  I scoured numerous web sites and 3/4 of a day of experimentation before I was finally able to get it working.  The key was to install "SimpleCommands", set up 2 triggers for the Hub (one to Open and one to Close) as "Routines", then get the Alexa app to discover the SimpleCommands Devices (Scenes) which then you have to say; "Alexa, Start <routine name>".  Once this is done, I can control the door with the Chamberlain opener with MyQ app, control the Chamberlain Hub with the MyQ app, and control the SimpleCommands (Hub) with the Alexa app (for Amazon Garage Deliveries).The kicker ....  after everything was working, I talked with an Amazon delivery guy and asked him about the Garage Delivery... and his reply (and I quote):  " Yeah, I've seen the Garage Delivery advertised on TV, but we don't know how to do it".  Gotta love.  And sorry for anyone that has iOS, I cannot help with that, but I think it's fairly close to what I just said.  There are TONS of people posting about pairing the Hub with Alexa, so just search the web.  Good Luck!!!

The product works great and as intended. It advertises Alexa integration but is not available in the amazon skills. This product is great if you want to make your garage door smart. This allows you to remotely open and close your garage door. It also is able to notify you if you forget to close the door. You can set up schedules where it will close the same time each day. It also allows you to use amazon's in-garage delivery service. Although it is possible to get in-garage delivery, it does take longer for the package to get to you.

On several occasions, I came home and found the garage door open.  Either I didn't close it or it didn't close correctly when I left.  So I needed a way to be notified if the door ever were open.  I tried another product that wouldn't sync with the opener, because at the time this make and model was twice the price, but returned it.  Then this product was discounted to the same price as the non working version, so I got it and it installed like a charm.  I can set alerts on my phone when it opens or has been open for an extended period.  I set email for the major activity like open and close, but added the text message when open for over 15 min or over 30 minutes.  And I can close the door should it be open.  Sure saves the stuff stored in the garage from interested eyes.  Not sure I will use with Amazon deliveries yet, which I could.  I would have to pair it with a camera if I would do that.  Some Amazon drivers don't appear trustworthy.

I installed this on one door of my two car garage. Installation was relatively straightforward except that the instructions for installing with my Genie garage door opener were not clear. I called Chamberlain customer support and they were able to look up the correct instructions for my specific Genie model. Installation took roughly half an hour, but without that snafu it would’ve been only 15 minutes. As long as you follow the same steps you use to program a new remote for your garage door, set up should go smoothly. Also be aware that once you download the myQ app and begin the installation process, you get more details as to what specific models of your particular garage door opener brand will work with it. You should check online with Chamberlain prior to purchase would be my advice to save yourself some anxious moments scrolling through the precise list in the app during installation. I have not had a chance to try Alexa integration just yet but so far all other features have worked well and Chamberlain customer support was excellent.

I re-purchased the Myq smart garage door opener (chamberlain) after the 1st one died after 2 years.  Warranty is 1 year. Yay (sarcastic). I like the fact that you can control the garage door with this and see if it is open or closed. Plus get alerts of when the garage opens or closes. Be aware the alerts (text alerts) may be delayed. Which defeats the purpose of knowing if your garage is being broken into. Plus, 35% of the time the app won't close the garage doors. I wish they still had the older detectors that you placed on the garage doors that also had the base/s that detect the garage door status. In this case, the old school detectors are better.

When I bought this I thought it would be more useful.  I have a garage located 3 miles from my house.  More than once I had to drive back to check if I closed the door.  This sounded like the perfect solution.  The reality is since installing it over a month ago I have never used it. I had already trained myself to sit in the driveway and wait until door completely closed before leaving.I do have a couple of hints.  Although my WiFi router supports a 2.4 network,  mine was set up as 5GHz.  MyQ only works on 2.4.  I had to set up a second network. Took me a bit of time to figure out that part of the install problem.

I bought two of these during the prime sale for $30 each since I have two doors and each order comes with one door sensor and hub. One door sensor is $30 on its own so now I have a spare hub.I read most of the reviews before ordering and being a techy, I was certain to get it working. One reviewer commented how he "chuckled" that it took some users a few hours. But let me explain to you why it can take a few hours. First, the Hub is very picky. You need to have a 2.4ghz network which is fine. My router is pretty powerful and has beam forming to help with signal strength. The hub for the first door took its sweet time (about 30 minutes) to configure. The second door took several hours. There is something about Hub not being able to connect after you push the learn button on your motor. Once I had that configured, the second door for the first day would open and close by itself like it was possessed. It stopped opening and closing by itself and is very convenient to open and close my garage door remotely from the app. Three stars for the easy but painful setup process. I have not tried the google home command yet but really dont have a need for it.
PRO-Very easy to install hardware

So it looks like a fairly well built unit for the price.  I did get it to work, but not without headaches.  The biggest problem I had was with their cloud account.  Before using the myQ garage door opener you have to download their app and create an account with myQ.I was not able to create an account within the app.  I kept getting and error "Unable to contact server, try later".
Love Love Love It! Set up is easy and works great. Great peace of mind.****UPDATE****

this thing is such a pain just to get it connected. it is all over the place and i would consider myself very good with computers and networking, im figuring it out but why? this REALLY doesnt need to be this difficult!

Works well for my needs. I got this mostly for the notifications because I like to know when people are coming and going and also to get rid of the "did I leave the garage open!?" paranoia. It also has a notification you can set up to tell you if it has been left open for X amount of time which comes in handy. Nice not having to lend out keys or trying to hide one as well. It took 4-5 tries/resets to get it to link up and of course my garage was 1000 degrees. So it was a little frustrating, but not too bad. My 1994 Lift-Master opener was right on the cusp of being too old, but it works. Definitely a good, inexpensive upgrade for the peace of mind until I upgrade the opener. I did not integrate with my Alexa as it does not seem necessary for what I use it for. If you found this review helpful, please let me know by marking it. Feel free to ask questions.

I got this so that I could remotely close my garage door if need be.  Peace of mind.  I do have a camera in my garage but before this device, I had no way to close it if I left it open.  Now I do.  That is all I really wanted this device for.  Would have liked if it had Alexa integration but that is certainly not a deal killer.  The setup was very simple and easy.  Just follow the steps in order.  The instructions do tell you that pairing the hub to the garage door lift could take several tries but my 10 year old Genie and the hub paired the first time.  I picked this up while Amazon had a great deal on it.  Worth every penny and then some to know that I can close my garage door from anywhere.  It does take 30 seconds or so to engage once you tell the door to open/close.  One reviewer said to assign a static IP which I may doUpdate:  This does integrate with Alexa via a third party app called SimpleCommands.  After I setup the app and added the skill for Alexa, I can now use the Alexa app to open and close my garage door.  No fees, no subscriptions.

As the title of my review would appear to indicate, this device provides tremendous value for those of us with traditional non-"smart" garage door openers (most people). The installation was extremely simple and I was surprised how good the wifi connectivity was. My router is quite far from my garage and so far I have no had any issue using the open/close functionality. The application is "dumb", which is actually a good thing. Remember, this is only a garage door opener, people! The app is basically a blank screen with a circular button to open and close your door. That's it. Reliability is critical and so far the door responds within 1-2 seconds of me pressing the button in the app, which is again impressive given the likely latency.I would recommend this as a low cost upgrade for most people.

After much trial and error, I finally figured out how to get rid of the default beeping when your garage door closes! First off want to say this device works as expected, easy to install (with the app on your phone), easy to pair each transmitter to the base for multiple garage doors! Quick install, not much to it. I don’t know why people all complain about the connection. Works great, integrates with amazon and their delivery, and easy to open and close from my phone wherever I’m at.Now, how to get rid of the beeping when the garage door closes. So you’ll need to open up the hub box and locate the sound device, which is the only piece of plastic with a hole in it. What I did was take needle nose pliers and from the inside of the hole to the out, bend the hole open wide. I took a small screw driver and scratched and poked the inside copper of the sound device (I’m no electrician so I’m using Laymans terms). The scratching seemed to do the trick, but what I also did was stuff the device with duct tape (figured rubber would be safe) and then put more tape on top and covered the hole and the sound holes of the main device. The scratching of the copper seemed to do the trick cuz I don’t hear the slightest faint of noise. The stuffing is probably over kill, but I attached photos so you can see clearly what I did. The blinking light still works (which I still don’t mind as being the only warning it offers). Put it back together and boom, works perfect and won’t wake my kids up if I use the app while they’re napping! Hope you enjoy!

I am an IT guy but I must confess — for years I’ve thought I needed to replace my garage door opener in order to gain “smart” control. This product not only works with my existing opener, it works REALLY WELL. The ability to operate the door from quite literally anywhere provides some powerful benefits. For example, if a customers need to drop off a computer for service and I’m not home, I no longer have to tell them to leave it on the front porch — they can call or message me and, within seconds, I can open the garage door and close it when they leave.Installation is very easy. It took about 15 minutes to get everything functional, then another 15 minutes to make everything “pretty.”

So far this is a great product. The setup is fairly rough which is why I’m giving it a 4 star. I’m a software programmer and it feels like maybe the setup is a bit buggy. Essentially WiFi and Bluetooth really need to be solid during setup. If not you basically have to figure out how to reset everything to factory default, then move to a different location to see if you get better signals. I finally got it after three resets. Now the second device for my second garage door went in perfectly. Maybe I had practice. Once these were in and no longer required Bluetooth which is just needed during setup they have been smooth as butter. That’s why they get the 4 stars., my point is, if you fail at setup, move it around and try again. If you can get through it, these are amazing.

Mostly worthless as an opener or closer of garage. When activated thru the myQ app, Randomly decides to either open the door or will close the door but cannot do both in succession. Any thoughts of using for the Amazon key application is a recipe for disaster. Not hard to setup although instructions for pairing the sensor to the hub are not really clear, just stumbled into getting synced. Supposedly it paired with my genie door opener and raised the garage door. Even closed it once thru the app before function ceased. Re-paired with genie but no different on function. If you just want to know if your door is open or closed may be worth the cost but not as a smartphone app to open and close

I own two great Chamberlain LiftMaster products. A $3000 automatic gate and a $400 garage opener. Both are awesome. However, when it comes to building software solutions, Chamberlain is terrible at it! I bought this Hub first, after spending 2 hours trying to make it work and troubleshooting with a very condescending young tech support rep. (I own a Silicon Valley tech company, I am tech savvy) I decided to just buy a new Garage Opener all-together that came with their wifi capability built-in. Then I bought the $100 Bridge in order to enable my brand new wifi enabled garage opener to integrate with Apple Homekit but it did not allow me to install. Their software had server time-outs on the app etc.  After 60 minutes, this time I knew enough to make the right decision, not waste more time and return it. All of their boxes (hubs/bridges/gateways) are poorly made toys, i rather not be able to use Siri to open my garage door than having to call their support line again to speak to a teenager without proper training in customer support. They must outsource their software to subpar developer shops.

MyQ hub garage door opener. Well it took about an hour to get myq to pair with our Craftsman . Secondly  it will only work on the initial phone that set up myq, it will not work on my phone, if I try to open or close garage or says error 000. So this is a horrible pain in the ass system to get going. So much so that it will be sent back immediately and I'll look for the next best thing.  Update days later.. still won't connect to my phone. Frustrating

I have spent several hours over several calls on the phone with Chamberlain, trying to troubleshoot two separate devices, and they can't get the hub to pair with my Genie Stealth 7055 garage door opener.Chamberlain's website says the hub will work with Genie. The Amazon page says it will work. Their app says it will work. All of the representatives say it will work.

This was an absolute game changer!!  It is probably my favorite purchase of last year!  My son seems to forget to let me know when he gets home from school.  I also had some late nights at work when I would come home at 8:30 and the garage door was still open. I would also get a text from the neighbors some nights at 10 pm letting me know that my garage door was still open if we forgot to close it.  It was sooo frustrating!  I bought this and it has made my life so much easier!  It was so easy to install.  Basically you hook it to your Wi-fi and stick the other sensor to the garage door.  It instructs you to mount the other part to the ceiling but it is not necessary.  When you close it from the app it flashes a bright strobe and beeps very loudly.  It is not a sensor of any kind, just a warning and only if closed from the app.  I have it sitting on the shelf in my garage and it works just fine.  I get a notification on my phone every time the door opens and closes and I can open and close it remotely from anywhere via the app.  I bought 3 as Christmas presents.  No more turning around to check and see if you closed the garage door.

Be advised: trying to find printed installation instructions will take more time than just downloading the app and following the instructions contained therein, so don't waste your time. The actual installation took about 10 minutes, because I'm a scofflaw who did not mount the internet hub to the ceiling as required by the instructions (the Wifi in my detached garage is weak, so I chose to keep it as close to the hub as possible). Not mounting the hub will not affect the performance of the device.Once installed, the MyQ works exactly as you'd expect it to, telling you at a glance if the door is open or closed and for how long, alerting you if the door is opened without the app (you will get an alert when using your existing remotes), and allows you to operate the door from anywhere. I have not used any of the other features yet.

This works great with two different garage opener brands that I have. Once installed, it has worked amazingly. The only trouble I had is during set up. It wouldn't register the QR code on either one that I got. I followed the steps and couldn't get it to go through. I contacted Customer Service and they were AMAZING! The woman I spoke with was friendly, detailed and explained every step with me. She didn't just help with the first one and leave me to it, she took the time to go through both setups with me to make sure they were working and in order. Rare to have people take this much time to ensure that you are satisfied with their product.

I selected the Chamberlain MyQ product based on reviews and specifications. My exterior garage door opener keypad decided to give up on me and the replacement keypad was the same price as this product. What a pleasant surprise. The product arrived promptly and after unpacking the box I followed the enclosed instruction booklet. Now I am a bit of a techno-geek, so nothing was foreign or new to me. I spent less than 10 minutes for the entire install and test. The instructions were real easy to follow and paired to the door sensor, my network and my mobile phone in under a minute.  The only area I see for improvement (I have an android phone, my wife (of course) has an i-Phone, so the "add a user" required her to re-install and pair the gateway all over again. The system works flawlessly from a local logon to my wireless network and also via the mobile phone network literally world wide (as long as you have a data connection). My existing interior door opener button and door opener remotes operate as normal. I have used the product for two weeks and used it multiple times a day. Great product. I strongly recommend this product for ease of install, value for money and no monthly fees :-)

This hub and the apps for my iPhone and my wife’s Android phone solved our problems with Chamberlain garage door remote controls. I could never figure out why the range for our remotes and the keypad got worse over time. I tried fiddling with the antenna, changing batteries, even changed the location of WiFi router thinking it might be interfering with the signal. Began to suspect the controller board was failing. Replacement for the board would be about $70. That was the same cost as the smart hub. Why not give it a try? Install was straightforward and worked right away. I would have given 5 stars but for a little quirk in my app. If the door stays open for a long time I sometimes get an error message that the door position sensor is not linked. This error clears easily (just close the door using hard-wired control) but you have to clear it before the app can operate the door.

This product would be a great idea if it worked.  I have networking experience.  I usually have no problems with network wireless devices.  Hub is only 10 feet away from my router. Signal super strong.  Sometimes li loses my left door.  Sometimes it loses my right door.  I have to go through the setup process time and time again. Will work great for a day or two.  Several times I have been unable to log into Chamberlains website to run the app. Very frustrating.  No tech support whatsoever.

I wanted this just in case our garage door opener in the car did not work ... batteries or someone pressing and holding the wrong buttons too long. This was easy to set up, the instructions were very clear, without having to be too handy or techy. No problems at all! Very happy with this device.Found out that every time I set this up it would bump out 1 of my cars from working with Homeline. I reached out to customer support and never got a response. I downgraded my rating from 5 to 2 star b/c of that (generously). I went with MEROSS instead b/c its hard wired to trigger the actual garage door open/close button and is not set up as another transmitter to the garage door. My problem maybe b/c of my genie garage door so I can't say for sure, but its annoying to reprogram the car and find that bumps the MyQ or vice-versa!

I do not use alexa at all, I value my privacy to an extent. It was very easy to setup and install, the only concern I have is I tried opening the door from my phone one day while at work because my son forgot his key and it did not work. I can open it up from a street over without problem and not sure how that makes sense, but maybe I just need to test it again and see if I can open or close it from anywhere on my phone with data connection.

Ignore the bad reviews. In fact, consult Fakespot regarding the many fraudulent bad reviews. This product does what it says and does exactly what I purchased it for. No more no less. I got it on sale for $40 - an absolute steal. The components are smaller than I thought they would be. (A good thing). The installation was quick and easy. (I have a Linear brand chain drive opener)Simply put, I absolutely love this product. The Android app is simple and seamless making installation dummy proof. Again, these other reviews are bizarre to me (maybe they are old or in reference to another product). It didn't really matter where I mounted the hub. As long as it picks up your wifi signal and is within Bluetooth distance to the module on the garage door. If you want to monitor the position of your garage door at all times and be able to open and close it remotely this is by far the best product in this price range.

This product is fine for the basic convenience of allowing your phone to act as your garage door opener.However, it is not a “smart” device for anyone who is accustomed to Alexa. It will not pair with Alexa. If you want to use IFTTT, you need a subscription. In other words, it is just one more “smart” device that will clutter your app with yet another app because they will not allow you to centralize all your devices to your Alexa app.

Set up and installation were both easy.  The set up video is the most well done, clearest presentations that I have ever seen for a product.  I took some liberty with placing the door sensor as my door has foam insulation.  Instead of the door corner, I placed the sensor on a vertical rail about 3 feet in from the door edge.I was most worried about the device not working due to the very low router wifi signa in my garagel.  Using an app, my signal dropped to below 50 mbs in the garage.  In spite of this, the product works well although it would save a bit of worry if the manufacturer was able to state the minimum mbs required by the hub.

Updated review - March 2, 2020After 7 months of using this device, I am ready to replace it.  Initially, I was happy with the product but since then, I have had problems every couple of months.  After 3 months of operation, my MYQ-G0301 started to go offline. I had to re-do the setup a couple of times because the unit would refuse to reconnect to the wifi router.  I contacted support and they asked me to replace the battery in my sensor, even though the battery was not low.  I replaced the battery but continued to have the same issue.  Then the support person said my firmware was old and should be updated, even though the unit was supposed to update the firmware automatically.  After forcing a manual firmware update, the unit seemed to work better for a few weeks.

Easily my worst purchase of 2017.First, setup straight up didn't work.  After 55 minutes on the phone with tech support, they suggested maybe I need a new battery in the (brand new) door sensor, and left it at that.  Still not working.

This is a great accessory that brings my 20 year old garage door opener into the 20th century.  It was very easy to install on my 1999 era LiftMaster garage door opener and works very well.  We frequently have family, neighbors and contractors that need access to our garage and now I have an easy way to give them access while I am not  at home.  I used to try to do the same with my external keypad, but I would inevitably make a mistake programming the time or the code and have to spend 15 minutes on the phone only to find out the garage door wouldn’t open.  Now I can control it from my phone and I can also control when the door closes too.  Great product and a very good value.  Would definitely recommend.

I installed one sensor on each garage door, as I did not want to use my in-vehicle garage door feature, zince I park in the driveway.  Now I just use my iPhone.I would give it 5 stars but it's a tad buggy.  I set up a Siri shortcut so I can use voice commands.  The shortcut works great to open the door, but about 25% of the time, when I tell Siri to close the garage, it says it cannot connect to the MyQ.  So I usually go straight to the app and it works 99% of the time.  Occasionally, I have to wait a bit for the garage to respond.

Most of these types of automation devices don't work with secure coded garage door openers, however this one does. I had a whole issue with one from another manufacturer claiming it worked with my door, and it didn't, after spending alot of time installing, troubleshooting, and searching forums to only find it wasn't actually supported I was hesitant to do it again. This one went in quick, you add it as an additional garage remote, attach it to your WiFi network (yes WiFi Only) and it works like a charm. You can see the status of the door, and control it through the app. You can also configure alerts (push, or email) for the door, and it has integrations in app for things like nest cams etc.

I followed the installation instructions on the video. I did have some trouble with my Wi-Fi extender. Once that was resolved I plugged the unit in an followed the prompts. Prior to the physical installation, the video just has you plug the unit into any outlet and finish the process. At this pint the unit worked. Then the mounting process began. The video show the mount on the ceiling and WRAPPING excess power cord around the mounting base (remember this step).  So the unit is mounted, paired and do not work. I attempted numerous FAQ fixes over the course of hours. Finally, I got thru to a customer service rep. After numerous attempts to fix the issue “we” moved the unit back to the original outlet. Eureka! It worked. I followed the video installation of placement 4 feet from the opener unit. The service rep stated no. 6-8 feet. So, after the THIRD mounting the unit is functional.

Install was painless a fairly easy.  Function of this unit is crap!  Doesn't work with Google Home AT ALL--This is a bog deal!  Furthermore, they charge for the google assistant integration (SHAME), although they are offering 1 year free right now.Google Assistant integration is complete crap!  When you say, tell MYQ to open the garage door, it says "which one".  I ONLY HAVE ONE...then you tell it which one, it tells you it closed....I just asked it to open it and it is telling me its closed!!!  NO SH**

Followed the instructions displayed on my Apple iPhone 8 to the letter.  When you get to the part about pushing the learn button on the Craftsman Opener (made in 2001 with a red/orange button - which is allegedly compatible) the whole process pukes.  Tried Chatting . . . no one answers.  Tried calling . . . . was on hold for several minutes.  Now after trying a few more times from the start, the instructions (if that's what they are) indicate I have too many garage doors on one hub and I'll need to purchase additional hubs!!! But I only have one door!!!??? Written out instructions on paper would go a long way to resolving this for me.  And instructions that actually follow the process and work.  What a piece of crap they have here.  About ready to ship back to Amazon.  Will try contacting the company again tomorrow.  Did I mention this is a piece of crap!!! DO NOT BUY THIS!!!

I should have done my research, but with all of the Smart Home stuff in the title and description, I had assumed it worked with Alexa, but it does not. Even the Rate Features of this review asks how its Alexa Integration works... If the item ONLY works with the very slow app of your own, its only partially smart. This needs to be added into the Alexa Skills area so it can work with Alexa. Thats WHY I bought this. So I am pretty ticked off it doesnt work.To make matters worse, I did some research after the fact, and it turns out the ONLY reason it doesnt work with Alexa, is because the greedy MyQ company wouldnt profit from it... They are fools, and this product is NOT what I wanted.

I purchased 2 of these kits.  Installed on 2 different overhead doors.  I have Chamberlain door operators.  This product takes a little time/effort to install/setup but once completed it works very well.  You can always check status of doors (open or closed) but it also tells you how long they’ve been open or closed. You can set text/email alerts for when doors are opened or closed and repeat alert if desired.  Connection to WiFi and pairing needs were all painless - only took a few seconds.  This is a good product.ONE BIG DEFICIENCY.  THERE IS NO SETTING WHERE YOU CAN SET AN AUDIBLE ALARM FOR CELL PHONE.

This was a christmas present for myself as I wanted to expand my smart home features to the garage. Unlike others who have reviewed this product, I had zero problems with the installation. It took about 45 minutes start to finish, most of that spent mounting the hub in an appropriate spot. My installation was for two doors. It was impossible to mount the hub on the ceiling within the recommended 4-6' from each opener as there was no ceiling outlet at that point (and the cord on the wall transformer was too short), so I mounted it on the wall, where I could get an equal distance of about 7' to each opener. My Genie openers paired up exactly as they were supposed to and the app worked great to open/close and provide notifications about door events. I've also had one Amazon Key delivery successfully done. My only complaint: there is no official integration with Alexa. I would really like to see that feature. I've only had the setup working for two weeks, so I'm going to be watching for some of the signs / symptoms reported by others, but as I said, so far, so good!

I feel bad for everyone that has had trouble with this device. I'm always hesitant to buy anything from Amazon that doesn't almost have 5 stars, but I REALLY wanted Amazon key access. I don't know if I just got lucky all around this time, but setup was quick and simple. I have had zero interference issues (I've read reviews about 2.4ghz and Bluetooth being a problem). Also think it's worth mentioning I bought mine used in like new condition. It came with all the mounting equipment I needed and looked like it was never opened. I did have to do a factory reset to link it to my garage door opener, which took all of like 10 seconds to do. I have yet to receive a package using Amazon key. It'll be here in a few days. ☺️Edit - update 08/23/20

When my 10-year-old garage door opener remote finally died on me, I thought that I was going to have to go through all kinds of hoops to try to find a replacement. This solution worked great to not only replace my dead remote control, but it allowed me to wirelessly control the door with my phone, which I have been wanting to do for a while now.  I was really surprised by how quickly this was able to be installed. It only took a few minutes for me to get everything set up and create my account.  Within about five minutes everything was set up and working just as advertised. The only confusion to this system that I saw is that when you share your account access with a friend or family member, it is not readily apparent within their app. The other person must install the app and create a profile for themselves.  You use your app to send your friend or family member an invitation, that they must accept.  This invite goes into a separate tab on their app that has your devices listed.  They must select the tab for your devices in order to use your opener.  Nothing a few minutes of head scratching wouldn’t reveal to you..  Anyhow- it was well worth the price and allowed me to replace my broken remote for only about $7 more than I planned to spend for it, alone.

I had some minor difficulties installing and it turns out it was too close.  Once I called customer service and moved it further away from the opener, it was fine.That said, the integration with google assistant is horrid.  You have to ask google to connect to myq and then you’re stuck talking to a dumb myq assistant instead of google.  I have 2 doors installed and there appears to be no way to ask for the status of both doors at once or do anything with both doors at once.  For single operations you need to specify the door name exactly and say exact commands.  The assistant is quite dumb and it’s very frustrating.  There is also no way to integrate these doors into other smart home features because of this extra hop.  They desperately need to focus on UX and just integrate directly with the google assistant instead of trying to create their own.

If your looking to just control your garage from anywhere then this works. I purchased because it was supposedly compatible with Google Assistant, which it's sort of is. Very disappointed that you cannot add it to the Google home, but was willing to give it a try since it's supported Google Assistant. The issue is the MyQ integration into Google Assistant is spotty at best. I can ask Google to close the garage with no problem, however when I ask Google to open the garage or placing a routine to open the garage such as I'm home it only ever tells me the status of the garage. The command words to open garage do not seem to work.

My note to Manufacturers: The App won’t open.  When I’m connected to Wi-Fi or whether I walk out with full bars I can’t open it.  I’ve tried more than 20 apps and all websites and my phone and internet are working... just not the MyQ app?  I bought a range extender because neither my garage door opener, nor the home bridge is working.  The home bridge was working when I went to bed, then when I woke up both sensors were missing from my HomeKit and the MyQ app. When I tried to connect them this morning, the garage door sensors wouldn’t talk to my garage app.  When I came back in the afternoon, I had the same issue.  I bought a Wi-Fi extender it works for my phone, but now the MyQ app won’t open on the previous network, the extender, nor my cell service (as we n the MyQ app wouldnt even open).  Now as I write you from my website and everything else works, the app won’t open.  I’ve deleted and downloaded the app to the same result.  What is going on?

Within an hour of install, I've boxed up and I'm returning this piece of garbage.  Loud, incessant BEEPING before, during, and long after the door is closed.I spoke with customer support, who verified this cannot be disabled as it is a "safety feature."  How the #&*$ is this a safety feature?!  I press the $*#*ing button to close the garage.  I know damn well it's closing!  There are also FLASHING LIGHTS - AND - LAZER BEAMS preventing the door from closing on me.  The only way I'd recommend this product is if you really want to get a rise out of your neighbors by scaring them awake first thing in the morning and/or late at night.

Had this running successfully for a month now.  One night a week back our door opened twice, did get a email that the device "closed" our garage door twice.  I have a rule to close the door at a certain time in the night.  So- what must have happened the device incorrectly thought the door was open when in fact it was closed.  The battery in the door sensor was replace about a week prior to this happening.  I sent two different messages to the manufacturer the next morning but still no response.My main point  in the 1 star, for something as serious as this "opening a garage in the middle of the night  I'd expect some form or a communication to happen.  I set this up to CLOSE the door if it were left open by the kiddos - this backfired.

I haven't seen any tutorial or steps to get this MyQ opener to work with Alexa or Google home. Hopefully this will help you out. This tutorial will let you to Open/Close the garage with voice command like this:"Hey Google, Open/Close the garage"Cool

I spent a lot of time researching and I knew after reading the reviews I finally bought this.It took me less than 30 minutes to install and I now know I never have to wonder if I closed the garage door. I have left it open several times having my neighbors calling me. Now that I have My Q, there are no more wonders with the well designed app.

I searched for garage HomeKit and this shows up and say in the title works with HomeKit. This is not true. This requires an additional purchase of a home bridge to work with HomeKit. Should have read the reviews better. The MyQ app works fine but I can't use SIRI or voice control and don't get notifications on the operation of my garage door. DON'T PUT WORKS WITH HOMEKIT IN THE PRODUCT TITLE WHEN IT DOES NOT.

The main problem I had was the set up of the MyQ Smart Hub. Apparently when I tried to set it up to connect to the MyQ Server, their server was down and I wasted an hour trying to figure out to get it to connect. I changed settings on my wifi network as recommended, etc. Finally, I just left it for the next day, and it connected (solid green light) right away. Then, after that, I had to connect to the garage door opener itself. I had a little trouble with it because the instructions said to press your opener's learn button until the led light goes on. It didn't say, the led light on the opener (which wasn't an LED anyway) so I assumed the LED light on the hub. It never came on and as a result ended up erasing all my remote door openers from the garage door opener memory. When I pressed the learn button until the light on my opener came on, no problem. Instructions should be much clearer and there should be a way to confirm that the MyQ server is working or not.

I love the features of this system, but am frustrated with constant problems. I purchased 3, putting them in my garage, my parent’s, and my brother’s. Setup was simple and they seemed to work great. Within a few days, my parents got a new WiFi router and I couldn’t get the opener to connect following the system reset instructions. I called the support line and was given unpublished instructions and got it reconnected. Within 2 weeks, I began getting door sensor error messages one each, causing the system to become non-operational. I received new sensors, but upon installing one, the system became completely non-operational, so I haven’t messed with the other yet.  MyQ support diagnosed the hub defective and is shipping me a new one, but it is taking 2wk for delivery and hasn’t arrived yet. The system has been non-operational 25 days and counting in 2mo of ownership.

Just installed and setup the MyQ Hub, and it ended up being relatively painless.  It took me less than 20 min or so to get it setup and working, and I'm happy with it's performance so far.  I haven't actually mounted it so far; my garage door opener unit is mounted about 1 1/2 feet from my garage ceiling, so I was able to just rest the hub on top of it for now - I want to run it for a week or so to make sure there are no issues, then I'll actually mount the hub then.  But pretty happy with it.I got it because my 9 year old sometimes forgets to close the garage door when coming in for the evening after putting her bike or scooter in the garage, so being able to schedule the door to close at a set time every evening gives me some peace of mind.

Installation was simple, as was pairing the garage hub with both the sensor and the garage door opener.Surprisingly, though, this unit does not integrate directly with Amazon Alexa devices, but connects only through IFTTT, even though it is recommended for Amazon Garage Delivery.

So I had a Nexxgarage that I bought last year but it kept having all kinds of issues but I stuck with it and just dealt with the issues (keep losing wifi connectivity, telling me the garage is open when it is actually closed, etc, etc..) After 1 year the Nexxgarage just stopped connecting to my wifi so I decided to give MyQ a try. My first try installing it via the app, the app kept hanging, then when the app was working I couldn't get MyQ to pair with my garage door opener. I tried again the next day and this time it paired! After everything was working I haven't had any issues so far. I am very happy with MyQ and I wish I bought this before rather than the Nexxgarage. I am very happy and hopefully this MyQ will keep working great for a long time!

The myq is real simple to install.  I did it in an old genie intellicode 1, like a 2000 model (maybe older).  I couldn't figure out why it wasn't connecting and called customer service and found out it needed to stay on wifi ovenight for a firmware update.  OK no big deal.  Next day it conceded to the opener 1st time no problems.  Great!  The phone app works great.  Tells me when the garage is open/closed and sends me a notification.  I can close it from the app too.Alexa: This is the tricky part.  You cannot directly connect it to Alexa.  What you can do is download the IFTTT app and connect the myq through that app.  Then you create a "trigger" in IFTTT.  Then you link the IFTTT app with Alexa.  It's all funky which is why I gave that a 3 star. Once you program it correctly you say, "Alexa trigger close garage." It works.

I want to preface that I didn't see that there was a charge to use it with Google home.Setup was as simple as can be. I used the app and it was efficient. The trouble came when I tried to use Google home. I found out I have to pay, even for IFTTT which is terrible. However I took their one day trial it's offering me to integrate it with Google home.

This thing is basically the same thing as your wireless key fob remote if it had power and you could use it with your WiFi to remotely close and open your garage door. Lack of Alexa and Google Assistant integration in this day and age is silly. The fact they want you to pay for the Google assistant integration is just stupid.. I have 10 dollar devices that offer that for free. All and all.. it's a great device if you don't mind having to pull you phone out to use it.Pros

Super easy to install but it just doesn’t work.  Install and setup was super easy.  It worked fine once and then just stopped working.  It would not close the garage door.  Only solution from help section was that sensors must show and interference so door wouldn’t close for safety reason.  That is total BS because door would close fine from wall mounted switch, clicker and car.  I took a gamble but should have listened to other reviews.  Also it makes a horible loud beeping noise when closing.  This is totally unnecessary.  I have no idea why the designers think it was necessary to add that feature.

The installation went smoothly for both of my garage door openers-one hub and two door sensors. But for some reason there was some type of cross talk between them because when I tried to remotely open and close door A, it would actually open and close door B.  I called Chamberlain and we spent an hour and a half trying to figure out why.  The agent needed to ask a higher level expert for advise because this one stumped the agent (who was determined to solve whatever was causing this-thus staying with me the whole time).  It turned out to solve the problem I had to reset both door openers to unlink their “learning,” then whenever I tried to “learn” one door I had to physically unplug the other door opener, and vise versa.  This worked, and the associate stayed with me on the phone step by step until I had the phone app working and the home links in each car working without any crosstalk.The free app is all I need.  It sends me a alert after the door remains open for a custom set amount of time (I use 10 minutes), and I have it set to check if any door is open at 6pm, 9 pm and midnight, and if open to automatically close.  This way I know neither door will ever stay open all night no matter what time anyone get home and forgets to manually close the door.

I'll start with the good..Installation was very easy and the instructions provided were very clear with video and text of step-by-step directions. All the materials for the installation were clearly marked and the fact they thought about how to eliminate cord slack in the mount was a pleasant surprise.

This device is very easy to install and setup via internet, now I can control the main access to the house, because sometimes you're not very sure if you closed or not the door.I my case I have a different setup for the door opener (I have 2 gates, they open form their side) I have an extra steps to make the sensor detect the correct position open (horizontal position for the sensor) and close (vertical position) but its working pretty good!

While our house has about every home automation item available this was not necessarily bought for that reason. We only had two door openers from when we bought the house but have three vehicles. Generally my wife kept her remote control in her purse but this caused the button to be hit and the door be left open or inadvertently opened.Insert the MyQ smart garage door opener. Install took roughly 15 minutes and set up using the app was seamless.  Apart from being able to control the door through the app if set up you can get notifications if the door is left open for a certain amount of time. This allowed us to be alert if the door was left open before heading to bed. It’s also come in handy when letting friends and family into the house. So far it’s work flawlessly.

Unfortunately this product didn't work for me. It says it's compatible with most garage door openers. It even says it's compatible with Wayne Dalton Classic Drive. Unfortunately if you dig deeper, it's only compatible with a specific frequency model of Classic Drive. Unfortunately I have the 303Mhz version which is not compatible.That being said, the rest of the setup was straight forward and easy. The app stepped you right through the process and had both video and written instructions right in the app to guide you through the process. It quickly found my network and connected. It wasn't until the remote programming portion of the process that I discovered it won't connect to my remote.

So the prior owners of my house have a Chamberlain opener for the double garage, and even had the ethernet bridge for that opener.  But my single garage opener is clearly original to the house from the mid-90s and is a Liftmaster.  Every once in a while the single grage doesn't close when I drive away, and I wanted a way to make the old opener compatible with the Chamberlain app.  This device will do that.Installation itself isn't bad.  You stick the sensor on the inside of the top panel of the garage door and pair it with the app.  The hub/controller is easy to plug in, but getting it to pair to my Liftmaster garage door opener was nearly impossible.  I cleared all prior codes to my opener (which disconnected all of my remotes/cars).  Somehow it got connected, but it was a hassle of me standing on the ladder for about an hour.  I can probably blame the extreme age of the opener.

It is fairly easy to setup and install.Waste of money....opener continually indicates closing on app when door is opening...also annoying beeping everytime it operates (I understand safety measures, but my regular garage door opener does not beep at all, it makes enough noise to make anyone close aware...and isn't that why there is a safety to auto open when it comes in contact with something...), without the ability to turn off beeping, pay to add to Google home, come on.... The Total disappointment, because I did not get around to installing until after I missed my return window. Will try a garage wifi adapter, seems to be simpler. I have a Craftsman/Chamberlain garage door opener, how come they did not make a simple wifi adapter. The system does seem a little overkill for what it does. Waste of my time to install.

Read a variety of reviews discussing how tough it was to install ... not at all ... follow the instructions and take your time and it goes smoothly. Few recommendations when installing:1- Have an extension cord ready when syncing the remote to the garage door ... the closer the better

I received and easily installed this item on an older Liftmaster garage door opener. Kudos to Chamberlain for making it so easy. Unfortunately, this product doesn't work with Amazon Echo. After contacting their support site via chat, I discovered this are no plans to do so in the future. I was surprised to hear it, but back in the box and off to Amazon Returns for this item.If you're not interested in Amazon Echo, this might be a good choice for you. As I said, it's easy to set up, has wide compatibility with existing garage door openers, and has a relatively good iOS app. If, on the other hand, you want to take advantage of your Echo device, then this isn't the device for you.

I never did install this sensor but I do have the main HUB and a sensor on my main garage door. I bought this because it was on sale before I was convinced that this MyQ product is a piece of junk.This is by far the worst wifi product I have ever dealt with and I have dealt with many. It works about 20% of the time, which defeats the whole purpose. I have four kids and many of their friends going in and out of my house so I want something that will tell me when the door is open and will let me open and close from my phone regardless of what state I am in. This is NOT the product for such a simple request.

Now that it is working, I am very happy with the Chamberlain MYQ "smart garage" unit. I installed it exactly as directed, but it kept giving me "sensor errors" and "opening errors," and I kept having to reset the unit. I had one more idea before reaching out to Customer Support--move the main unit. I had a hunch that locating it within a foot of a screw-in LED lightbulb on my garage ceiling might be interfering with it in some way, even though it got plenty of Wi-Fi signal and the green light glowed steadily. I moved the control unit about TWO feet away from the LED bulb, and all has been well, since. SO, friends, don't mount the control unit too close to an LED bulb, as I guess their built-in transformers must throw more RF than I would have thought. The Chamberlain, my garage opener (also a Chamberlain) and my iPhone now live happily ever after...

My wife doesn’t want to let Amazon delivery guys in our garage, so I paid full price for this. It worked well with my 20+ year old Craftsman garage door opener. The app itself isn’t great and is bloated with ads for other services it kinda works with. Surprisingly, since this is meant to work with Amazon delivery guys, one of those services is not Alexa. For a while, I thought I could operate it with my Apple Watch.  Unfortunately, the Watch app is so buggy it only works 10% of the time. 90% of the time, I get a spinning wheel on my watch and need to pull out my phone to use it. Fortunately, there’s a free Amazon Skill called Simple Command that will get it to work as a routine and you can customize a Alexa voice routine so “Alexa, open garage” and “Alexa, close garage” are all you have to say. It takes probably 15 minutes of reading to set it up with your voice on Alexa. Installation instructions of the hardware itself were very straightforward and easy to follow. Since my Tesla doesn’t come with Home Link, I’m using Alexa as my opener. With my phone on the charging pad, I say “Hey Siri, launch Alexa” then “Alexa, open garage”. Takes about 6 seconds. Not as easy as a button but it works for me!

First I'll say that I don't use Alexa but I'm sure it works great with it.  It was easy to install and set up.  I did have to add a receptacle because the existing duplex was being used by the garage door motor and the ac adapter for the door sensors but once I did that it was as easy as following directions.  It works great for In garage deliveries.  I paired both my phone and my girlfriend's phone to it so we both know when the door is open or closed and can control the door remotely.  Once I add a camera then it will really be perfect.  Oh ya I read a review before I bought it about lights interfering with it, but my garage is pretty d*** bright, and I have no problems.

Google and IFTTT have discontinued integration with Chamberlain, so the description provided is completely false. The Hub disconnected from both the internet and the garage door opener spontaneously after two months (no power failures or other Internet issues). It is difficult to re-pair, not worth my time since it was terrible to begin with. I'm currently looking for a new opener remote.  I advise you to not buy this.

So, I was told by all my neighbors that this was a must have item. I was very skeptical because my garage was already a smart garage, but my main interest was to utilize the Amazon Key feature. So far, I have not been able to purchase anything that utilized the Key feature, but I am completely ready. The install of the device was easy, but I did have to call customer service (now that was a different experience and not a happy one) to help me get it synced to my garage door opener. Once they told me what I was "doing wrong", I was able to get the garage to connect. Now I'm just waiting for my 1st Amazon Key order so that I can justify the cost of ownership. I did however get it during Black Friday! So it was like $20 bucks and that was great! I definitely recommend this device if you want to make your garage smart and utilize the Amazon Key feature.

I was a bit skeptical about this product. It was a breeze to pair with my garage door opener. Just make sure to follow the directions.The myQ app was easy to use. I just don't like the fact that it limits the amount of individuals who can use the app. Since, I have a big family only a 3 can use the app. I like that the app sends alerts when the garage door is opened and closed. However, it doesn't send any alerts to secondary users.

This is handy for me because my garage door seems to have a mind of its own and may open right back up again. You can verify on the app in what position your door is. I was extremely disappointed that this does not work with Alexa. Google Assistant is one system that operates the system. But in order to do that you have to buy a premium service subscription. I was able to locate a free coupon code online. And even then I have to say "Ok Google. Talk to MyQ" then you have to listen to a list of prompts on what to say every time and is really time consuming. And after you listen to all of that you can choose to find out if your door open or close it. Other than that its just yet another smart home app on my phone.

This device pairs seamlessly with the door sensor.  It is a breeze to get it on wifi.  It tells you if your door is open or closed.  Unfortunately, it does not pair with the door itself.  The result is that this device does not perform its most basic function:  remote control of your garage door.  With my AccessMaster garage door opener, I've paired new remotes and cloned them to cars.  It's really not hard to do.  Sadly, the Chamberlain MyQ is not up to the task of pairing with the Chamberlain AccessMaster garage door opener.  I am returning the one I bought.  I do not recommend wasting your money on this.  Wait, save, get a garage door opener with wifi capabilities built in.  It'll save you a lot of frustration.

tl;dr: best feature is being able to have other people use it on their devices and check the status of the garage door, which a lot of other devices will do and not charge you a subscription fee to be able to tell your phone assistant to do the same things you do in the app. The best I can do is review it and hopefully detour someone who didn't put a lot of research into it from getting something that isn't right for them.***EDIT: subscription is only $1 a month or $10 a year, which I find acceptable even though I would rather it be free. I can still not login to the website to purchase this service.***

I am still trying to get it to re-pair and work again after the app decided it didn't know my system anymore, for no reason. The wifi hadn't gone down, the power had never gone out. There's no reason it should be this hard to get an opener to work. The app is garbage. Even in trying to reset my password, it doesn't want to work. I reset the password once twenty minutes ago, but then for some reason, while I was waiting for the opener thingy to pair with my phone, it decided to time itself out and stop the app. So I had to sign in again, but apparently the password I'd gotten from them didn't last even twenty minutes. Then, when I tried to resend a new password, it says there was 'an error connecting to the server".... um, WHY? I'm ready to throw something. This is very poor engineering. Don't waste your money.
Pros-Super easy setup

Installation was fairly straightforward, though the promised easy instructions were not included in the box. Instead, a quick start guide with tiny writing was included, and it got you only as far as "download the app", which gets you to the rest. However, when pairing the unit with my Linear garage door, I think I accidentally uninstalled my other 3 door remotes! This was awkward when the garage door was closed and I was inside the garage! Fortunately the app worked to reopen the door, and after a little Googling I found a video on how to program Linear garage door remotes - super easy. Moral of the story - make sure you test your old remotes after you install this to make sure you don't have to re-program them.

The title says it all. The product was very easy to install and pair with my garage door opener: within a few minutes I was able to open and close the garage and check its status through the app. Once.Since then it has managed to open the garage door two more times. I have tried it at least 20 times. The Wi-Fi reception in my house is perfect, as I have multiple repeaters, the hub is always powered and it sits two feet away from the garage opener. I can see the status of all my cameras in the house and I can open and close my smart lock, but the garage opener just refuses to work.

Neat design, syncs almost instantly but the app severely lacks full integration. The door sensor doesn’t seem to give feed back consistently. You will often have to go check to see if the door closed/opened because the app will time out and creates an error. Ultimately concerning but definitely lacks the push to fully get the job done. Lastly, they sell a camera unit that is severely overpriced.AVOID It, I purchase a separate cam for 1/5 of the price which works perfectly.

Wasn’t sure what to expect but this device works perfectly, is easy to install and gives me great peace of mind to know what’s going on with my garage doors (I actually bought two of these).The installation literally took me less than 10 minutes and didn’t not require anything difficult.

I have a 2017 Genie garage door opener and integration and install was seamless. I had the hub and sensor out of the box, connected and installed in about 10 minutes. Super easy. The app gives step-by-step instructions and provides easy to follow video guides. After install is complete the app is pretty basic but has all the functions I need. I set up alerts for door opening at night and scheduled tasks to close the door if left open. Everything was fully and easily customizable.Pros:

I am very glad I have acquired this remote garage door control. I had to do it much sooner, to avoid multiple cases when I left a house for the  weekend with garage door wide open.I was little concerned about the installation, but to my surprise it turned to be the easiest and smoothest smart device installation so far, just next to the smart light bulb. The step-by-step instructions in the app are very clear, right to the point, all tools are listed concisely, pairing with door opener motor was a breeze.

Very easy to install in just minutes without messing with your wiring. Download the app and instruction videos are provided. So far works very well. The set up was basically a push of the button and you sync it to the device. Loud alarm warns you when the garage is closing. I set a schedule so that my garage door auto closes at a certain time. Also provides an extra security to look up on the app to ensure the garage door is closed. App is easy to use so that you can also control your garage door access remotely. I do hope they offer an update on the system where it automatically closes after a certain time when I drive away like my August front door lock.

This is by far the worst wifi product I have ever dealt with and I have dealt with many. It works about 20% of the time, which defeats the whole purpose. I have four kids and many of their friends going in and out of my house so I want something that will tell me when the door is open and will let me open and close from my phone regardless of what state I am in. This is NOT the product for such a simple request.I have contacted Chamberlain many times and they cannot help.  I have tried many different things including AT&T Internet, with the AT&T router by itself and with Google Mesh. I have also tried it with Xfinity xFi and the WiFi router by itself and with Google Mesh and the Xfinity Mesh Pods. Based on my experience and knowledge, those are all three very common options for a person to have wifi in their homes. Nothing allows this MyQ piece of junk to work consistently. I have had this for many months now and the reliability is getting worse. Just today, I received a notice from the app that my garage door was open. I was 25 miles away, one of my kids was over 800 miles away, one was in high school, the other was over 60 miles away, and the fourth kid was working over 30 miles away. In addition, no one was at my house since the previous day around 7:30; we all stayed the night somewhere else. I watched the Arlo videos and no one came into my house all day today yet my garage door opened at 12:09 PM. I then checked the History on the MyQ app and the garage door also opened at 10:15 AM and closed at 10:18 AM. All of this when no one was near my house.

I bought this because I have a habit of leaving the garage door open, which isn't a good thing in my odd neighborhood.  I like the fact that it sends a reminder to may phone when I forget to close the door.  Installation on my single-door garage was easy and took about 20 minutes--it works well with my Liftmaster opener.  I simply followed the directions on the smartphone app.  I've had it installed for a few weeks with no problems.  It does flash and beep rather loudly before it closes, but only when I use the app.  I have installed both the MyQ and Amazon Key apps.  I haven't yet used the Amazon Key delivery, but plan to try it soon.  Both apps appear to function well and simply.  Very much worth the low price I paid on Amazon Prime Day.

A challenge to install, you MUST have good wifi where the main unit is.  Operates fine.  I've used it to open up the door for someone when I was away.There are a LOT of false alarms from the web app.  I've set down, got an alarm, got up and see that the door is indeed NOT open as it claims,  Then I get an alarm that is closed.  Either a brief drop in wifi or some lag in the web app.  Many updates later the Android app is better, now only a few times a month rather than multiple times a week.

The thing about reviews, they aren't always accurate. Other reviewers and question answerers state that this device supports both Apple HomeKit and Amazon's Alexa-that's not true. The only way to get that functionality is to purchase another one of Chamberlain's products, a bridge. It also happens to be almost double the cost of this item.Installation wasn't easy either. Physically there's nothing to it, but software wise it took a few tries. Their outdated support and app make it difficult to get the connection and help you need. It took several tries to get my Genie and MyQ to talk. Eventually, it worked, even though the app said the connection wasn't made, it did.
