Update:  as I was setting it up my neighbor must have opened their garage door, so their remote worked on my garage door too. I still did not get notifications that it was opened (which I would have preferred).  Still uninstalled and returned because I didn’t get the notifications I wanted.Do not buy.  Would open garage door by itself. I had notifications set up for open/close but that never worked. I would receive a notification from amazon key that my door closed, I had no idea it was opened before that.  I could then see in the history that it was opened for an hour. Opened by itself and closed by itself.

This is probably the biggest disappointment of a purchase I have ever had on Amazon.  If I do get it to work it is only after I have to reboot my entire phone and try 3 times.  It was a pain to set up as well, took 3 days of fighting with it to get it to work, and I work with computers for a living. I eventually had to delete all remotes already connected and then add them all back in to get it to add.  Not to mention you have to PAY to get it to work with a smart device when nothing else in my home has you pay for this service. SAVE YOUR MONEY AND GET SOMETHING ELSE

Initial issue with registering the product because the field for email addresses did not allow enough characters for my email address (23 characters is not unusual) so I had to call the help line. So glad I did!  The person who assisted me recognized the issue with their system, and not only got me registered but stayed with me on the phone and walked me through the entire installation. Several times I thanked him and offered to let him go but he insisted on being of assistance.  Entire process including climbing up/down the ladder and mounting the unit on the celing took about 20 minutes and everything works great!

I'm glad I only spent $30 on this as opening and closing the garage door only works when I'm at home, so I just use this for checking that the garage door is closed.  Trying to open or close it when I'm away doesn't work.  When closing the garage door, the device makes a loud obnoxious beeping noise for about a minute as a warning for people in the garage or close by.  It's easy to install, you just have to patient when pairing the hub with the sensor--took me about 4 times.  Out of all of the smart home products I own, this is certainly the most mediocre, which is unfortunate given that this device is considered one of the best smart garage door openers.  As for integrating with the Echo or Google Home, currently, Chamberland is offering integration for free; I'm not sure how long that will last.

The system works well once installed. The initial setup is tricky. Follow the directions and have patience. The device needs a strong wifi signal and make sure you know what garage door opener you have first. I suggest taking a picture of the opener model and the wire connectors. That makes it easier to identify during the install process. Have a ladder handy and a helper nearby. Once it is fully installed it works great. Open and close remotely close in and remotely. Summary. Tricky install but pretty clear instructions, be patient, be safe on the ladder and the device actually works great.

Overall very happy with this device. I was able to get it installed and working within 15 minutes.In use, the system does exactly what I wanted it to do - I can check my phone to see if the door is open/closed, and can hit a button to close the door. I was able to easily setup a push alert so that if the door is left open for more than 10 minutes after a certain time at night, I will get alerted. No more getting up in the morning to find the door was left open all night!

The install and initial setup was extremely simple. The MyQ devices paired and synced with my Galaxy S10 Plus and my home's wifi immediately without issues. The MyQ hardware and app have worked flawlessly for a month now. A major letdown though is what a joke it is in working with Google assistant. You can't set it up as a device on Google Home, so basically you have to ask Google, to ask MyQ, to perform tasks. Thus far this has only worked about 10% of the time for me. Typically I'll ask Google,"Hey Google, ask MyQ to open Garage Door One". Google then responds with, "Getting MyQ". Then MyQ responds, "Garage Door One is closed", and that's were the conversation ends. Well I freakin' knew the door was closed that's why I asked for it to be opened!!! At that point I just open the MyQ app and tap the Garage Door one button and the door opens. Just don't understand how Chamberlain could do such a horrible job in how this device works (or doesn't work) with Google!
Quick delivery: We purchased this last night and it arrived by 6am.Set up: easy and simple. Once you download the myQ app, it prompts each step for installation.

Watched this units price go from $49 to $29 to $19 back to $29 on Black Friday and back to $19 on cyber Monday. I bought back on first $19 cycle. Easy to set up (leads you through on your phone).  I didn’t have my opener on pairing Mode first time through but worked well when I removed My user error. I like the fact that the ceiling unit beeps and flashes before it closes the door remotely from the phone in case kids are nearby.No more “did we close the garage door? Moments!
First one I purchased was defective. Took about an hour on the phone with tech to diagnose problem.We agreed that I'd send my unit back and would receive a refund AND a new unit for my trouble.

First, pls know that there is no monthly fee with this product as I use it.  That is...I don’t integrate it with Alexa or any other such service.  I simply downloaded the MyQ software app as suggested by the vendor on my iPhone and use this app to open and close my 2-car sectional garage door.  The app also keeps a history of activity.  That is...you can tell when the garage door has been opened and closed on different dates.  This is very cool.  I can also operate the door from my Apple Watch.If you have a strong WIFI signal in your garage, then this product works seamlessly.
My Q was simple to install, set up, and operate.Quite possibly once of the easiest tech set ups ever.

The product was super easy to install initially and worked great for both of my doors for about two weeks. At that point one of the door sensors stopped communicating with the hub in about a week later the other center stopped working with the hub.The product was super easy to install initially and worked great for both of my doors for about two weeks. At that point one of the door sensors stopped communicating with the hub in about a week later the other sensor stopped working with the hub.

I loved this concept and was excited to receive the MyQ. Setup video was very well done and easy to follow. The first 2 days this opener worked flawlessly. I have excellent wifi signal and no other issues. Now all of a sudden the MyQ commands to close the garage door do not work. Worse yet, it locks you out of further attempts after you try to close it twice. This is exactly the type of thing I was trying to avoid when I purchased it, as now its too unreliable for me to use as a safety backup to ensure the door is closed.  I have a relatively new Liftmaster elite garage door opener so there should be no compatibility issues. I will keep troubleshooting and try to figure out why it no longer works.

This does not work at all with intellicode one devices. I managed to get it to pair after 8 unsuccessful tries, I was able to get it to pair, but I was not able to get it to work with my garage door regardless of distance from the receiver after it was paired.It seems clear that the garage door opener transmitter was either defective or of very poor quality, either way I will not be spending any more of my time or money on this brand.

I had difficulty getting this to work, after spending considerable amount of time on the phone with Chamberlain customer service and still unable to get it to work, the customer service agent asked if I had LED lights in the garage which I do, after turning off the LED spotlights it worked fine, that should be mentioned in the instructions, after being installed one week I had a low battery warning and when I opened it the battery was leaking,  when I called Chamberlain customer service they told me batteries are provided as a convenience and are not guaranteed or warranted, if batteries are provided they should be good quality batteries and if they are leaking 1 week after receiving they should stand behind them, horrible customer service from Chamberlain

Don’t worry about that garage door being left open.  This lets you know via the app and notifications or emails if garage door has been opened or closed - and ability to open or close it via smart phone application even while away from home.It was an easy install & set up for this senior citizen.  Probably 1/2 hour which included digging the ladder out of the corner of the garage so I could reach the ceiling electric outlet.  Only issue I encountered - set up will ask for the color of the LEARN button on the garage door opener - my button is definitely Orange or maybe faded Red - but setup wouldn’t complete until I tried Purple and then it worked.  So if at first you don’t succeed - try another button color would be my suggestion.

I didn’t care for the sticker only mounting option for the sensor. If you have insulated garage panels it doesn’t stick so I had to move it to a place other than recommended to the far right metal frame of the door after it fell of twice. Also, it took several long tries and repeat msgs of “sorry your garage motor doesn’t seem to support...” before it finally paired and started working w my Genie garage opener.After about a week, it completely lost the device connection when I needed it most to let in my Aunt while I was out of town. Attempt to restore have been futile. I don’t recommend this device. I have another home with a Garadget remote opener that hasn’t given me any of these problems and works reliably.

I put too much trust in this thing and didn't take my garage remote with me on my motorcycle trip.  When I got back from my trip, I was greeted with the device "offline" message indicating that it could not connect to the internet as if the internet was down at my house.  Well that's just not the case as i confirmed I could connect just fine on my phone through our WiFi.  I eventually got inside my house, reset the hub and it connected.  "We were back in business", it had to be a fluke; I thought to myself.  Nope, this pile of dookie would continue to fall off the face of Earth on a daily basis to this day.  I've followed solutions to this problem, I even put a range extender in my garage to ensure I have a strong connection, nothing is addressing the issue  I will likely return this Cleveland steamer shortly as it's pretty worthless. I don't recommend it.

Best $30 I spent recently. This is a must have at this price. Install took maybe 10 minutes. Simple plug in power, press a couple buttons, let in do its thing, mount it and your ready to roll. Having the peace of mind of knowing if and when your garage door is open or closed is worth it’s price alone. Being able to control it anywhere anytime is a bonus. Timing from notifications and function between app and garage is almost instant. Not a big enough lag to complaint about. This is a must buy.
Bad for so many reasons:First off when you try to operate you’re Garage door through the app there’s a 10 second delay into it carries out any command.

This worked ok at first then it just stopped sensing whether the door sensor was vertical or horizontal. Replacing the battery didn't work and it would beep every time the sync button was pushed so it was a bad sensor. The app still opened and closed the door and I had a camera so it wasn't that bad until that app decided it knew better than me and refused to send a signal again. This left my garage door open for about 2 hours before I could drive home to close it.The issue is trying to contact the company was impossible so this was basically a waste of money for about 2 months of use.

I had a hub with a single sensor (i.e. a single door) and it worked great. Added a 2nd sensor - installation was smooth but then reliability went down. If you open the two doors at the same time, the device many times doesn't catch that at all and will just tell you the doors are still closed. It also sometimes just misses a door opened or closed. I called the helpdesk and they made me reset the entire system - hub and 2 sensors - which seems like it worked for a short time but now it's back to being unreliable. The good side of this is that I can still open and close both door remotely so that's one feature that works, but I can't trust the alerts anymore.

Be aware of limitations of this product when using Amazon Key. I purchased the Hub to take advantage of the KEY access for Amazon deliveries. Worked great. However, to have a KEY account, you have to be the primary user of the MyQ Hub. My spouse would also like to use Key but can't as we is not the primary account holder for the MyQ Hub, and she can NOT be given any kind of primary access, just guest access. So I thought I would install a second Hub and make her he primary user on it and thus be able to have KEY deliveries when she ordered item on her Amazon account. Unfortunately, there are issues with the second hub recognizing when the door is closed and Contacting the vendor reveals you can not have two hubs connected to the same opener. So if you want two different amazon account to be able to have KEY access, it can not be done using the MyQ Hub. You have been warned. :)

It's inexpensive, so there's that. Setup was kind of painful. Not very responsive when controlling through the app. Sometimes it doesn't respond. Worst part is there are no integrations with Alexa. I can be in my living room and turn off all of my lights,  lock my doors, and even have Alexa hum me to sleep, but I can't have her check if my garage door is shut. This means I have to go check which pretty much renders all if the other automation moot.From what I can tell, Chamberlain laughingly thinks they are able to monetize their API to be used outside of their application.  This will never work...sorry old school garage door  commodity company, but we are busy paying for subscriptions to everything else from Netflix, to Hulu, to Disney+, to Wink, ad nauseum!

I originally had an average WiFi signal at my house. I had no issues with signal inside, but it didn't go far outside. So when I installed this into my detached garage, it hit or missed on if the WiFi signal was strong enough to communicate with it. I've since upgraded my router and I have a constant connection to the device and I love it.I have remotes for my door opener so that wasn't really the selling point here, even though you can open and close it with your phone....the selling point to me is that when you rush out of your house for work in the am and can't remember if you closed the garage, this guy does the trick. It tells you if it's opened or closed and how long it's been that way and keeps a log.

I had high hopes for the myQ, and I initially had no trouble installing the product and getting it to work.  But, not long after installing it the sensor disconnected from the base.  I was able to quickly reset everything and get it working.  However, it will not stay connected.  Every few days it disconnects on its own.  It's very frustrating to need to open the garage remotely and the myQ doesn't work.  Also, resetting the myQ is a time consuming process.  Once or twice is ok, but when you have to do it continuously it becomes annoying real fast.  Save yourself the aggravation and just buy a replacement garage door opener that supports HomeKit.

Bought two of these for my Father-In-Law for his birthday and he loved them!  He has two LiftMaster openers.  Set up for these was awesome 20 minutes tops.  Get to know your “learn” button, will need it.  Chamberlain does a great job explaining on app.  Recommend watching YouTube videos and then going thru app makes install a snap.  I’d also recommend getting two hubs for two doors versus extra sensor.  Price isn’t too much more and easier to install.Now the bad news....Genie is supposed to be compatible.  After hours trying to make it work at our home, called Amazon support who connected me with Chamberlain support.  Rep was great, but never got it working after an hour.  Love the app and product based on my Father-In-Law units, but not my Genie.  Too bad, but time to get Genie  Alladin Hub.

It does as advertised. Our house is from the early 90s and our garage door opener remotes and keypad worked intermittently. I would frequently have to reset. So this has eliminated that. One issue the limit on the number of users. There are 4 of us in the family so in order to give our neighbor access, we had to remove one of us.Also, I highly recommend using a stronger tape than what comes with it. I ended up using Gorilla Glue. The remote attaches to the inside of your garage door and mine fell off almost immediately. Once I added the glue, it's been perfect.

After 14 yrs my garage door opener broke the sprocket drive and I had to replace it with an equivalent unit, much to my chagrin I discovered the existing (add on unit) Bluetooth unit was not compatible with this unit so I invested in the “required” MyQ unit. I downloaded the app and installed the MyQ and it worked for about 2 weeks then I had to reprogram everything again. (BTW the watch app only works about 20% of the time). It worked intermittently for another 3 weeks then gave me error codes and wanted me to reprogram again. I replaced the battery in the door sensor just  on GP’s, reprogramed and it is working again...so far about 2 hrs.To anyone using this app and/or system leave the hub somewhere you can get to it without a ladder because it makes it easier to re-program every 2 to 3 weeks.

If you're looking at this review, you probably want to control your garage door with your Smart Home system of choice. This is not the product you're looking for.1: Connections to smart home systems (Alexa, Google Home, IFTTT, etc) require a subscription for EACH SERVICE. They're currently listed as "free for a limited time" but do not specify what that time is or how much it will cost once the free period expires.

The install is straight forward if you follow the instructions. I am pretty good at putting things together but didn't want to create a situation that might be insurmountable so I read the instructions and watched the video twice each, still was up and running in less than an hour. Things should be done in the sequence outlined.  The sensor that goes on the door should be in place before you start anything. Plug in the unit that communicates with the motor and allow it to boot up prior to putting it in it's final location.The instructions are thorough and will do you good when sequenced as outlined.

1.) This does not work with Alexa - You are given the opinion that it does, this is not the case2.) You can connect it to IFTTT, however there is not action that you can take - It will not let you connect to Alexa or Google assistance to open and close the door

I've had this unit for almost a year and when it works it's fine, but on many occasions it doesn't work.  I have connected it to the garage opener on several occasions and it keeps loosing the connection.  When it is connected it works fine, but it it's not...it's worthless.  Now I can't even get it to connect at all.When connected I can use it from anywhere and it tells me if the door is open, or closed, and how long, but it keeps disconnecting.  It takes about 15 minutes to reconnect.  Why does it disconnects so often?  It's now out of warranty and doesn't do anything.  I CANNOT recommend this unit.  It has potential, but there are too many bugs.

I have been wanting to purchase a smart garage door device for a while but nothing decent a while. I was hoping nest would put something out but they haven’t as of yet. This device is worth the purchase for sure and easy to setup even if you don’t have experience with IoT devices. I would recommend this to anyway just make sure your actual garage door opener has a learn/sync button or it will not work but most should have that.

I purchased this item plus an extra sensor or a second garage door.  The actual installation of the hub and first door sensor was pretty painless.  After the setup, everything seemed to work as expected then DISASTER STRUCK!  I opened and closed the door a couple of times to make sure the first door was working before proceeding to the second garage door.  On my third attempt to open the garage door, I heard a loud pop and noticed smoke coming from the motor.  I immediately unplugged the unit and removed the back cover.  Something that looks like a large capacitor literally exploded inside the garage door motor housing.  My Genie Garage door opener worked perfectly.  I installed the MyQ Smart Garage Door Opener Chamberlain MYQ-G0301 and now I have to buy an entire new garage door opener.  As expected, customer support was a joke.  The guy I spoke with basically had no clue and suggested I  call Genie.

Easy installation, it connected to my WiFi with ease, even though it's a good 40 yards away from my router.  The phone app. is excellent, it allows you to open and close your garage door.  The reason I purchased it was for the convenience of using Amazon Key.  The driver can open the garage and place my packages inside, away from porch pirates. (Amazon was also promoting it with a $10 credit after your 1st Key delivery and $19.99 on Ciber Monday)  The app notifies you when the door is opened or closed.  A camera can be installed to have a visual of the delivery.  The phone app. is also a good back-up if have a rental car and or you don't have a remote to open or close the garage door. I think it works with Alexa  I will try it out shortly.  Just follow the instructions (online video on your phone)  step by step and you will be set up in no time.

My wife accidentally left the garage door open for 8 hours when she went to work, so I knew I had to get a smart garage door opener. I love that it the MyQ sends out warnings when you garage door is opened for too long and you are able to open and close your garage door remotely. I do dislike that the MyQ hub beeps and has flashing lights when you use the app to close the garage door. It’s annoying if you are at home and hear it, but I understand that its to prevent the garage door from closing on a person. However, most garage door comes with a laser sensor to prevent this exact event. Another thing that bugged me is that you have to pay a subscription fee if you wanted added functionality like connecting to IFTTT. Luckily I was able to get a year for free when Chamberlain did a promo.Pros: Easy installation and intuitive app

I am so happy to ditch those old, hardly functional garage remotes for a product that works seamlessly through my phone. No more dying batteries, no more having to reconnect the remotes. Just install and download the app! So simple and so convenient I can’t believe I didn’t know this existed sooner! Especially when you have family/friends visiting and they need access through the garage, no more deciding who will be home first so someone can open the door for the other because you only have 2 remotes. Everyone can have access by simply downloading the app and signing them into your system while they are visiting. Also the added bonus of having amazon deliveries put in your garage rather than leaving them on the porch is such a nice feature. I never want to go back!!!

I think it really sucks that it requires an additional hub to integrate with Alexa. And that hub cost five times what this product does. It’s lousy if not criminal of them to advertise Alexa integration when it’s not included with the current product. Also really hate the annoying loud sound it makes when preparing to close. Scares the stuffing out of my dog. Should be an option to turn that off. I consider this product a major fail by a well established company.On the plus side the install was easy but make sure you check the length of the cord since they tell you to put it as far from the plug as the cord is long. An extra half inch and you’ll have to remount it.

This product has the potential to be great. It will work just fine for anybody who has a newer garage door opener. And, yes, I realize that is stated clearly in the specs and description. I was hopeful...  They missed a great opportunity to make their product truly universally applicable!! A simple set of contacts on the outside of the device would have made it so that anybody could connect it to nearly any garage door opener that has a wired push button. This is lacking on the MyQ, so for me, the opening/closing function simply does not work at all, unless I completely change out/upgrade my opener. I can use MyQ for monitoring the state of the door. That's it. An unfortunate design flaw and missed opportunity!

First off, I highly suggest prior to purchasing this, that you check that your garage door opener is compatible. Just call chamberlin and tell them the make and model of your garage door opener and they will tell you if its compatible. I see alot of negative reviews, but my experience has been great with it. Super easy installation. Literally once you download the app and follow the directions to sign up. There is a step by step instructional video of a real person installing the kit. It took me less than 5 minutes to install it. My only dislike is the beeping noise it makes when the garage door is closing. I wish I could lower the volume of the sound but I understand that's just a warning noise. Other than that, no complaints and well worth the money.

I have recently started to make my home "smart". I own a newer Chamberlain garage door opener so I thought this would be the perfect pair. When the myq actually works, it works as pretty well. But this isn't always the case. It loses connection to the wifi occasionally. I have many other smart devices near, and further than the myq that never lose connection. Even smart bulbs outside of the same garage that this is installed. The real problem is the delay in notifications. Sometimes it is up to 30 minutes before the garage door closed notification comes in. Confirmed on multiple phones, Android and iOS. Other than this issue, everything else works as intended.

I've bought the meross Smart Wi-Fi Garage Door Opener before and install was a pain as you need to hook up 3 sets of wires, one goes to the garage door switch, one runs all the way to the garage magnetic sensor, and then the power supply.  For the Chamberlain you only need to hook it up to a power source, and it can be anywhere in the ceiling.  Heck you can just mount it anywhere in the garage and it would work.Without the app the product itself is pretty useless.  I'm glad to find that the current version is stable and has great reviews at the IOS app store.  The most important aspect for me is the scheduler and reminder functions and both works great.

Picked this up thinking that it had to be hard wired in to the opener to function but was pleasantly surprised to see upon delivery that it functions just like standard push button that you'd have in your car. Mounting the device is super simple (just two screws) and pairing with Wi-Fi and the garage door opener took less than 5 minutes. It works flawlessly although I wish that I could set it to only alert me to a door change between certain hours. I don't care if it opens at 5pm when someone comes home, but I would like to know why it opens at 1pm when nobody is home.Also I was unable to get it working with Alexa via ITTT. Apparently you have to pay for it, which I will not do. The Apple Watch app is easy enough to use.

The instructions are simple, and they’d probably be sufficient in lab conditions where there is no outside interference. But I had to call in, and we were able to isolate the problem to the placement of the hub itself. I had installed it on the ceiling per the instructions, after connecting it to WiFi, the door sensors, and the openers themselves. All was well until I mounted the hub on the ceiling. Now I have it sitting on a shelf, and there have been no issues since then. Maybe the metal tracks and supports of the door were getting in the way of the signal. Whatever. Glad to have it for when I get 5 miles down the road and start to question wether or not I remembered to close the door.

We had an entire garage door set by myQ. We moved and truly missed it but didn’t want to buy the entire motor. I stumbled upon this and had to try it. Super super easy to set up, fool proof. From using this app for years at my other home, it has been a life saver to have a garage control on my phone. The alerts are priceless if you have people who constantly forget to close your garage door (teenagers). I know exactly when my door was opened and closed. It is the best. I literally closed my garage door when I was out of the country and was alerted that it had been opened too long (the alert time I set for 1 hour). Buy this. You will not be disappointed. Especially at this price!

This was fairly easy to install. It has worked well so far, but it has been installed less than a week so I feel it’s premature to comment further than that. What I will say is that although the instructions walk you through set up very well, if you aren’t aware you need to install the app to receive those instructions that isn’t helpful. I think that no instructions contained in the box should be clearly stated since not everyone wants to use their phone for this (my husband’s car has the remote in the visor, so he will not install the app).

I'm sure if you can get this device to connect it is great! However, the hub would never connect to my garage door motor. I tried several troubleshooting steps online and then called Chamberlain for support. The tech was nice, but did not resolve the issue. After an hour of going through steps on the phone, I told him I needed to go. He said he would email me further steps. I did appreciate that! He did email me one further step, which also did not work. So, I email back letting them know I needed further assistance.  They closed my ticket saying it was resolved. I have since sent two more emails allowing the chance to correct the issue and given them 2 surveys because they keep emailing asking how they did. No one has followed up. So, I'm sending it back.

The Good ... I use MyQ with a 10 year old Sears Craftsman 1/2 hp belt drive overhead garage door opener. I followed the MyQ supplied printed and online YouTube installation videos.  Total install took 20 - 30 min (mostly reading and watching videos). I had a good /strong WiFi signal. I downloaded the MyQ app to my iPhone, setup and tested the system, then sent an invitation to my wife, installed the app on her iPhone, completed her app’s setup and voila, we are both able to use our iPhones to open/close the overhead door or verify “from outside the country” that our garage door is closed.The Bad ... Although I use Google Home speakers in every room of my home, I will not add the MyQ device because of their user fees.

The installation was a bit of a challenge to start with.  The directions that came with the opener were not clear.I went on YOU TUBE for better instructions.  After it was installed, the opener would loose the connection many times

I needed a way to open and close my garage from my motorcycle without carrying a remote control.  The system installs easily and pairs to my old Liftmaster door opener.  It appears to the garage door opener as just another remote control and you set it up that way.There is a phone app which works great.  I can open and close my garage door from anywhere as well as check it's status.  It has even notified me when it thinks the garage door has been kept open for a long length of time.

I debated on how high to rate this opener. It is inexpensive and it does work well. The simple setup walks you through the steps with almost insulting instructional videos. You can't place the hub within 4 feet of anything metal, so all the fluorescent light fixtures on my garage ceiling caused me to spend some time finding a good place for the hub where the door would both open and close remotely.Several of the reviews I read said it is Apple Homekit compatible. It is not, unless you buy a special bridge in addition to this kit. I wasted a lot of time trying to get it into Homekit. My complaint with support is that a KB search on the myQ website did say it was compatible with Homekit. I figured out the search results weren't limited to my purchased product.

Product is super easy to install and connect to home WiFi network. Bonus: You don’t need to get on a ladder to install the hub on the ceiling, close to the garage door opener, drill holes in the ceiling, etc. Instead, you can install the hub on the closest side wall (it works perfectly for our setup) using 3M two-sided tape.Gripes about lack of HomeKit integration are valid, but the product description is quite clear about this incompatibility. Interesting thing is that the myQ app “reverse integrates” with HomeKit, i.e. it can connect to any HomeKit hubs on my WiFi Network and introspect rooms and associated light switches, bulbs, etc. Maybe a forthcoming app update will allow end to end HomeKit integration. One can hope🤞

I wanted a new hub for control of my garage doors. My old home automation system went out of business. The hub would allow me to not have to completely replace my garage doors and have smart home integration and Amazon Key abilities. The first time around I had no luck, was actually ready to send it back. Support saw my tweets and reached out to me. Fortunately this morning I tried again and things worked as plan.As others have mentioned I think the radio system is quite weak and the app warns you that you need a good signal for the hub and that is quite true. I put an extender in the garage to boost wifi and it made a big difference in the install as well as the responsiveness. Yes, it stinks to pay a fee for remote capabilities, but $10/yr really isn't that much for what you get.

The app forces you to provide personal information that is not needed for a garage door opener!  Also, there is a very loud annoying safety chirping that goes on and on (~30 seconds before, during, and after) when closing the garage.  My garage already has all the safety features incorporated but I guess Chamberlain thinks they can force me to provide personal information and tell me how to run my house.  No way to turn either of these off.  Add in the annual charge to use IFTTT, a free service, and I am completely turned-off by this product!

When I first installed this hub it occasionally went offline and had to be reconfigured.  Eventually It managed to become stable (either from updates or my moving the wifi router closer)  The  main issue is this doesn't integrate with anything.  If you just want to open and close with the MYq app it's fine, but it will not work with Alexa and I've been using it with Home Assistant and the manufacturer provides no support and frequently breaks the integration.I purchased this because I figured it was the "official" way to connect my garage door opener to my smart home.  I figured that justified the cost.  But it simply doesn't work and the manufacturer doesn't care.

Everything I expected at a reasonable price. I've been looking at this product for probably 5 years or so, but the price for most of that time was over $100.Fast forward to Black Friday 2019, and I got it for less than $30. It was MOSTLY easy to install, works great and I highly recommend it.

After an initial install hiccup where I could not get the hub to pair with my garage door, this has been one of the best purchases yet, $25 on Prime Day.I love the fact that I can open my garage from anywhere where my phone has signal.  I also setup an alert to let me know when the door closes as sometimes people forget to close it so if I do not get an alert by a certain time, I can close it manually.

MyQ works great once it's setup properly. Pairing to the door sensor was ok but you have to press and hold.Pairing the MyQ to my lifetmaster Pro was a pain. Call to Help desk wasn't productive. Note: Have move MyQ 6' away from the garage door opener + NO LED lightbulb fitted on the garage door opener. My still didn't work out and I left it there for a while. Came back resetup the system again and it works.  I did not fit MyQ on the ceiling and it doesn't have to. I just left in near the wall socket and fitted the LED light bulb back and they work flawlessly. I have no intent to integrate with IFTTT or any of the voice assistance. So can't comment on that part. Overall for my use case the standard setup is good enough and affordable.

I have looked at this item before and didn't buy because of the subscription fee that Chamberlain was asking for.  Amazon had the device again at a nice price and apparently the fees were eliminated for basic operation so I took the plunge.  Installation was quite easy following the app instructions and a youtube video for backup.  I was concerned that perhaps my wifi would not reach the garage and although the signal isn't super strong, it was good enough for the device to work.  My only minor disappointment is the time it takes for the device to push the notification to my phone that the door has opened.  It can take longer than I like to get the notification but it will come eventually and it's not a deal breaker.  So far, I would recommend the product.  I will update my review should that change.

I'm a "newer" Smart Home consumer and just got my first Alexa Echo a few months ago.  Since then I've added Harmony Hub, Smart Things, and Simple Commands to control things like my dual zone stereo, TV, Blink Cameras, and now garage door.Installation is really straight forward.  It took me about 20 minutes in all.  Just follow the step by step instructions.  Once you get it installed do a search for how to set myq up with Alexa.  While not super intuitive, you can tell Alexa to open or close your garage.

After reading all the reviews I decided to try for myself and also install one in my neighbors garage and they work flawless, My 73 year old neighbor installed and programmed it by following the simple directions. Always works on with his or his wife's phones, all the talk about distance and frequency means nothing to the average person, you don't need controls in your cars or remembering to bring  one with you when you go out with someone else. No more standing in the rain or bad weather putting your code in a keypad. My experience has been great the the opener add on, but unlike some of the others reviewers I have not tried it from the moon

Bought this for my garage as I have people who forget to close the garage...including me. I can just look at my phone for piece of mind.  Install was a breeze....decent wireless coverage in your garage is the key.I have it set up for various times of the day to look for a closed garage....it will shut it if its open at that particular time. It has more capabilities that I have yet to use.

This is a great product, but it requires some patience to set it all up. The app tries to make it easy, but I had to start over a few times. I was able to get the hub onto my wifi, then link it to the sensor, but the show-stopper was that it just wouldn't sync up with the garage door opener itself. As a test I set up a remote in my car, and it went smoothly. I came to the realization that it's a problem with the MyQ App on my phone - it didn't seem to make the hub send the signals out once I'd pressed the learn button on the opener.The solution was simple - using a laptop I logged into the MyQ website, created an account, and manually added the Hub to my account (there's a serial number on the install guide). Once I did that, I was able to tell the hub to sync up with the garage door opener from the website, instead of with the app, and it worked on the first try! You'd think the app and the website would tell the hub the same thing, but apparently not. Hopefully this saves someone else some time.

it works but you'll either need to do some finagling or purchase additional components if you want to use your voice to control your garage door via siri.  it frequently tells me the garage door is open yet my security system says it's closed.  every time it says it's open, i go down to the garage to see it's closed.  nice to be able to open the garage door from my apple watch though after coming back from walking the dog.

I bought this because 1. my garage door opener likes to open, but not close the door and 2. we always forget if we closed the garage or not. Out of the box setup was easy, took 5 mins or so after watching a YouTube video. I was able to add my wife as a guest on the app, so she has access to it. It has options to send you alerts if it’s open/closed for a select period of time, schedule it to open/close at a certain time, and shows you when it was last opened/closed. My favorite thing is being able to open and close it from anywhere! When closing it using the app, it’ll beep, like an alarm, letting you know it is closing. I thought that was a nice safety feature.

A very easy to install out of the box item. I currently have a Chamberlain garage door which allowed me to add this extra “remote” without fail.My Luma WiFi mesh system gives me a solid WiFi connection in the garage so setting this and my Amazon cloud cam was a breeze.

I installed the myq garage door open/close app today. The software is absolutely horrible. When i press the button to open the garage door it opens but the app says its closed. Later the app says "Open" which closes the garage door. Did Chamberlain do no testing on this app. Why would they sell a product with such HORRIBLE software. The whole purpose of this app is to let us know if we forgot to close the garage door or to be able to open it remotely. Now I have to install a camera in my garage to double check that the app is not lying to me. I am so disappointed and expect better from Chamberlain. Until the software is fixed, I would NOT recommend this product.

So far so good.  Not using Alexa or Google Assistant to control this.  The app on the phone works just fine.  Set up was easy.  Pull up the app, create/sign in to the account and follow the instructions.  I have a Liftmaster garage door opener, and it had no issues pairing.  The one thing I do want to try in the future is the Amazon Key function for deliveries.  Like having peace of mind knowing my garage door is closed. There have been many times I've left in the morning and didn't have time to turn back to see if I had closed it.  Also have left it open a few nights.  Set up alerts and a schedule for day/night closing.  Can't beat this for $30.

It is important to follow the instructions in their precise order.  That will elminate most headaches with a complicated installation process.  The area we stumbled is on how to put the existing garage door opener into "learn mode".  I needed to page down on the instructions on the phone to see more details related to my particular model.  You could stand there staring at the blinking light for a long time and not realize it was not working.  I think that there is upside to the usability in this area.  My suggestions to customers is to make sure that you find exactly the instructions for your opener and make sure you understand precisely what learn mode is.  One suggestion I would have for Chamberlain would be to have some audio beeps to provide feedback on the process while in learn mode.  You are standing near the device and it could flash or beep to let you know that it is making progress or stuck.  It's not that hard if you follow the instructions and don't get stuck at learn mode.  /Todd

After 2 years of having this product, it's not something I'm super impressed with. Every time I open the watch app, it takes FOREVER to load the door status if it does at all. Sometimes it just says it can't authenticate in which case you have to look at a secondary way to operate the garage door, making the point of the remote garage opener moot.  The time lag between clicking on the app and the hub getting the message to close the garage door is pretty significant. Hopefully, there's a new version of this that's more reliable. But my advice right now would be to keep looking!

I had no issues what so ever installing this MyQ Smart Garage Door Opener.  Wifi has not been an issue and we are into our first week of use without any issues.  Our old Garage keypad stopped working before we installed this.  We are loving being able to go for a walk without having to carry an old opener.  The convenience of opening the door from our phone is amazing and we love that when we leave and question if we closed the garage we can simply check our phones to confirm that the door is closed!  Thank you for making this great product at such a reasonable price.

Works as described. The setup was pretty straight forward without complications - if you are using an iPhone/iPad, follow the additional setup instructions included in the package for iOS users. I added a second sensor and now I can monitor my garages. The Chamberlain iOS app works great and once properly setup, you can view the status of the garage door, open and close the door from your phone/tablet and also get alert notifications when an event occurs, all without a subscription fee.Highly recommended if you are in need of a device like this.

I recently purchased this during Amazon Prime Day(s). Setting up the device was going well until it came to pair my garage door opener / lift.I followed every troubleshooting guide and YouTube video. I reread the user manual. I even did a hard restart on the device.

It was a little difficult to install and were pretty technological savvy. We wanted to be sure we kept the safety function on the garage door for kids, animals, objects etc when closing the door. It does NOT integrate with Alexa. They should get on that which is the reason for the missing star. Bought this on a treasure truck and kind of assumed being pushed by amazon it would integrate.Other than that this is amazing! We use it often to open or close the garage. We have alerts set up to show when we’ve left the door open. And it works with the Apple Watch as well so if your hands are full or your phone isn’t handy you can still access the app. It also has a ten second alarm/beep that goes off to let you know the door will be closing soon which is a nice safety feature.

I have a Genie Excelerator opener that supports 7 remotes.  When I set the MyQ up, it was device 7 and had communication issues at first.  It's more a problem with the opener than it is with the MyQ so I decided to clear all remotes, add/learn the MyQ first, then cars, and wall remote.  I eliminated one hand remote to remain at 6 configured devices.  Since then, the MyQ has worked perfectly.  I only mention for those who might have the same opener.  The app is simple to install and partially guides you through the MyQ configuration.  The instructions are clear for installing the hub and the door sensor.  I especially like the alerts that can be set up to send an app notification if the door is opened overnight.  So far, so good.

It was on sales at a very good price (under $20). So I figured, why not.The installation is very simple.  Programming the hub for my opener is not as simple. I have a Genie opener and the instruction provided was not very clear. Still, it took me under 45 minutes to set everything up.  The unit worked for a couple of weeks. Then it would open but not close, cannot detect if the door is open or close. When I contacted support, I was given incorrect instruction (sensor needs to be lined up with the hub - it does not). I replaced the battery on the sensor, no help.  I contacted Amazon for a replacement and received it in 2 day (kudo to Amazon).

I'm not sure why, and neither is tech support at Chamberlain or my ISP, but it just won't connect. I did everything I was told and more; read through the top review post on amazon which walks you through the steps nicely (though a dedicated IP address takes some learning), got on with tech support again, had 3 devices and all the gear within 2 feet of one-another and nothing. I contacted my internet provider, and they said everything is fine on their end. Back with tech support - some are more knowledgeable than others. It seems that if they get stuck they just hang up on you. That makes the whole experience even more frustrating. I returned it and will try a similar product from China instead. Too bad.

it works with its App it will close the door for you if you leave it open other then that...  I wanted one thing to be able to ask Alexa if the door is open and if it was have her close it.  As far as I can tell it might be able to set it to close the door through a work around for Alexa that is not useful at all.  Thousands of devices have Alexa skills not this one.  if all you want is to be able to open close the door with the app and have it auto close the door at a time of day and maybe use the Amazon KEY program to allow Amazon to open the door and deliver packages then it will be fine if you want Alexa integration forget it.

I like the concept of this product.  However, app installation and setup was difficult - my family has both iPhone and android devices, and I consider myself tech savvy.  The app installation was extremely easy.  However, the setup sequence in the app was intuitive, but did not work.  I had to attempt several times on my primary device to connect the base station to the wifi.  I got frustrated and plugged in into a different outlet (away from the router), and the setup was suddenly complete.  Connection of the door sensor was difficult as well.  It took about 10 attempts to get the sensor to install.The real difficulty came with replacement of the home router about a week later.  WE upgraded our cable which required router replacement.  Getting the MyQ to reconnect to the new router was impossible.  It took almost 3 hours to do so, requiring me to completely delete the application from our devices, reset the MyQ hub on numerous occasions, and then had extreme difficulty hooking to the door sensor.  I got it hooked up to one sensor, then could not connect it to the 2nd.

I bought two of these, one for each garage door.BEWARE though: You may opt to have it automatically close (like at a certain time) or want to close it remotely and it will work far less than 50% of the time. For those using it for deliveries, it may open for the delivery person and then not close, leaving you fully vulnerable.

Update:  After a couple of weeks, bumped 4 starts to 5.  It's worked just the way it's supposed to, every time. They recently added a guest account feature, so you can give others the ability to open and close the door without access to scheduling or other features, great for the kids phone.----------

It was easy to install and worked perfectly for 2 days.  Then it started to glitch and continues to glitch.  The system gets confused and thinks the door is up when it's actually down.  From that point forward it does the opposite of what you want.  You can reset the system and it will work for a day then it get's confused again.  Everything seems to work except knowing the door position.  But this is a critical flaw.  I called tech support and did everything they suggested, nothing worked.  In my opinion the issue is in the technology in the door up/down sensor, everything else seems to be working fine with this product.  As is the product is useless to me.

It's almost Christmas, so I gave it three stars; any other time of the year it would have only squeaked out two.Installation did not go smoothly. I had to get tech support on the line and they remoted in to find some issue. (I should mention here that tech support was really good). Granted, I have a 15 year old Craftsman opener but it still was not easy and I had to reprogram all my other remotes once this one started working.

This use to integrate fully with systems like Wink etc, but now they are wanting companies to pay them to integrate with their openers, so they have been dropped by some major companies.I would steer clear, as now I have 2 worthless hockey pucks, when I just bought them in the past year. When I asked for a refund, because the reason I purchased them was because they supported my home network and now they don't, they said it was past 30 days and I have no recourse, but to use their broken and clunky app, that doesn't even do the one thing it was made for.

I have one of these that works pretty well.  That said...this one was bought as a gift, and it doesn’t work with their garage door opener, even though it’s a Chamberlin.Support was worthless. Lots of suggestions for things I’ve tried, and of course lots of blame on the opener itself (which they made BTW).

BEWARE IF YOU HAVE A GENIE OPENER!I checked that my garage door opener was compatible before purchasing but still cannot get this to work with my Genie model 7055. I spent 3 hours on the phone with Chamberlain support trying everything they could think of. Near the end of the call, after being “escalated” twice and getting absolutely nowhere, they told me they were going to send me a replacement. Which they then changed and said they were not going to send a replacement because they weren’t sure why it wouldn’t connect. “But it’s been escalated again so don’t worry” is what I was told 4 days ago and still no movement on my case with Chamberlain support. I was also offered the condolences of “well you can at least use it in “monitor mode” for now. Which is pointless because the whole point was to make use of the Amazon Key, and smartphone control features . I will be returning this and buying the twice as expensive genie Aladdin.

Given my paranoia as soon as I drive away from my house that I left the garage door opened, MyQ does cure this part of my mental issue (I never left it opened, but what if...).  The push notification of opening and closing comes to my phone immediately.  I was afraid of the setup, but it was not a problem at all. The app walks you through it well.I like the notifications about opening and closing, even if I am on a different continent. I added a simple camera to be able to open the garage door for delivery and watch the delivery guy walk in and walk out. Convenient.

I couldn't believe it. Just download the MyQ app, connect the hub to your wi-fi network, to your phone app and the little square thing that sticks (double sided tape) on your garage door. Get a ladder and press the learn button on the garage door opener. Voila! Done. Really, that's exactly how long it takes to set it up.I set up an alert to tell me when my garage door was open for more that 30 minutes. I got the alert and closed it. It doesn't take action on its own.

I purchased this because sometimes my garage won't open due to interference.  This makes a great backup if your garage remote is flaky.  Also, it's easy to install an app on your kid's phone to allow them to get in the house.The biggest downside IMHO is that you need a good wifi signal in garage.  During installation, I found that the wifi signal reported by my phone was much higher than the myq device received.  My android phone would show 3 bars, but the chamberlain setup app only showed one bar for wifi.  The setup app gave me a warning that I needed a stronger signal.  I ended up installing an old router in the garage which worked very well.

I had some issues installing it, and still have one issue.  I have 2 MyQ hubs, one in a detached garage and one in an attached garage.  When I close the detached garage door, the attached garage door also closes if it is open.  But that is OK, I keep the detached garage door closed.  Otherwise they work as advertised.  Follow the setup instructions step by step and don't gel over any of it.  if you have a problem, you have to reset the device and start over.  Also, if you have 2 hubs in separate garages, disconnect the one you are not programming so you don't have them get mixed up.
Do not buy this product, it is unfinished and unusable.It took me 1 hour to pair with 15 year old craftsman, even with any my car it takes a few seconds to pair.

This product is working quite fantastic, and it controls two garage doors independently and the interface is super easy to use and navigate.  I do love it  and I love the peace of mind I get from it  I did not rate the Alexa integration as I don’t want that integration.  I would give this product five stars but I bought it and it would not install properly so i called tech-support who left me waiting eight more days for a replacement unit....no troubleshooting.  The second unit did the exact same bad install and finally I got somebody on the phone that showed me a shortcut for install that is not documented  nor was it anywhere on the Internet or on their own support page, which really pissed me off.  I hate having my time wasted.  But otherwise it is truly great.

I moved into a home with an older Chamberlain garage door opener this year.  I had to find a remote to control it, and that was fine, but when I moved my mom into the room off the garage, I found myself having to carry my remote in and out of the house all of the time.  I needed another remote.  When I found this one that I could control from my phone, it was a welcome find!  I always carry my phone with me.I followed the accompanying installation directions and was amazed how simple the installation was.  As a 66 year old woman, I did not want complicated!  I was fortunate that the outlet to plug it in was already right where I needed it on my ceiling near the garage door opener.  Drilling holes to install the device on the ceiling went as planned.  The only question I had in the placement on the garage door was if it had to be placed on the first full panel or on the partial panel above it.  I put it on the first full one, though I don't think it would actually matter.

The install was pretty painful. They don't verify that the door sensor is working during setup, so in my case the app failed (because the sensor wasn't working) and then told me that my garage door opener is not compatible (it is). There was no option to start over or try again without deleting the device and adding it again. Eventually I got it working though.My bigger complaint is that every time you use this thing, it emits an ear piercing, painfully loud siren and flashing a super bright light and delays operating the door for several seconds. This unbearable alarm then continues throughout the entire operation of the door and then continues for 10-15 seconds after. In my small, single car garage it's literally painful to the ears and blinding, and apparently there is no option to turn it off. I'm torn between returning the device and trying to crack it open and physically disable the obnoxious alarm.

I returned just after installation.  I put the app on my phone and used it, then it stopped working.  But the major thing was that when you close the door, it has a VERY LOUD beeping noise.  I understand that it is a security feather but you can't turn it down or off.  I wanted to use this for my roommates to get in and out of the garage.  My daughter's bedroom is directly above the garage.  That beeping would wake her up if she were sleeping when it was used.  No other reviews say anything about this but that was my only reason for the return.

After reviewing the other reviews regarding smart integration, i was sceptical about buying this. On the orime day $22 i couldnt resist. heres the deal ... This product works wonderfully with their own myq app. You can use their app to open and close the door anytime for FREE.  You also get alerts when the door opens or closes and you can see the status. Integration with google will cost money, but that is absolutely unnecessary to do if you simply use your own app. Seriously, your not going to use your google hub to open the door when youre a block away; youll use the myq app. Prior reviews fail to speak to the myq app which equates to an embarrassing review.  Another reviewer is right if you know what you are doing you can bypass the subscription.  Hope this helps.

Product description says its compatible with any garage door opener that uses safety beam. But what they don't mention is that on some older door openers, even ones with safety beams, the compatibility is limited to app only showing if door is open or closed. There is no ability to control the door at all via app.App will show if door is currently open, or closed, and for how long. It'll let you see a history log of recent open and close events, and when they occurred. That's it.
Overall, I am very pleased with this project. The installation instructions were clear and simple to follow. Some notes on the installation:Required Tools:
This is the singular worsts purchase I have made on Amazon.I will be following this review up with the Chamberlain bridge that is also required to connect to Home Kit.

As I understand it, this product does not work with Alexa. I debated back and forth about getting a garage door opener that works with Alexa. But, I have young kids who are very good at asking Alexa for things ;) So, I didn’t want them to open the garage door on their own. It does beep and flash lights when activated. I do not believe this can be turned off without voiding warranty. At first I did not like that feature, but it is there because of safety. The times that you would use this would be when you are not at home. The flashing lights and beeps alert others that the door is opening or closing so they do not get hurt. I have a Genie SilentMax and device connected just fine with it. I can open and close door with my phone. I think it works with most openers that have the floor level safety sensors.  Install was very easy after watching the official video. Instructions weren’t as clear as to where to put the devices. Video helped solve that! Best feature for last, I love knowing if my garage door is open on closed! One last thing to worry about! ;)

No Alexa integration. IFTTT costs $1 per month. My smart bulbs, smart light switches, smart thermostats, and smart locks all work with Alexa and do not charge a subscription. It is crazy that Chamberlain thinks they need to charge a subscription to monitor/control the garage door from Google or IFTTT. I can now ask, "Alexa, is the front door locked?" and she will reply. I thought I would be able to ask Alexa, "Is the garage door closed?" after installing this controller. I can only monitor/control the garage door from the myQ app on my phone unless I pay for a subscription and even then...not with Alexa. Chamberlain, fix this!!!
Install was easy.App is easy to use

I bought the device on Jan 2019 and the installation failed several times. Only now in June 2019 (after the new app), I was able to install it. In addition, adding users is another struggle, actually, it is a major problem with this device. We are a family of six and after wasting hours trying to install the device and add users, I was only able to add 3 users by email invitation, plus, there is no option to extend the invitation to more than three days, at least I could not find a way to do it and I am not new to this  kind of work.

Received the product 5 days ago.  I downloaded the MyQ app to my iPhone, set up an account, and followed the step-by-step instructions in the app.  I have two garage doors, so I needed the hub, which comes with a door sensor, plus a second door sensor.  I bought two hubs, since the hub was cheaper than the sensor alone on Prime Day.  So I have an extra hub.The instructions were straightforward and well-designed.  I made sure I was patient while the hub paired with my wi-fi router and each sensor paired with the hub.  I liked the way the instructions asked if you wanted to pair a second door sensor after the first was paired.  Once everything was paired, I installed the hub with the included bracket on the garage ceiling.

Great instructions and easy to follow for a non tech person. Easy to control from your smart phone. Alerts and schedule setting good but could have been better if it had the ability to schedule door to open. Alexa integration non existent. Works with Amazon Key for deliveries but haven’t had anything delivered since installing. Overall very happy and Prime Day price made it an easy purchaseAfter subscribing and linking a couple other apps to the MyQ app I am even more impressed. Now when I leave my house usually just a mile out of my neighborhood I have it set so that it checks to see if the Garage door is closed. If it is open then it closes it and sends me a message that my door is now closed. Very cool

I can't tell you how many times I have climbed into bed and then thought "Is the garage door shut?" I used to have to get up, walk downstairs, check the garage and then head back to bed....but no more!!! Now I just look at the MyQ app on my smart phone and voila. Not only do I see if it is open or closed, I also know how long it has been that way! You can also set the app up to send you a notification when the door moves [open or close]. Beyond the product, the directions for setting it all up were easy to understand and follow. I had no problems with any phase of the installation and it is working exactly as stated for me.

Welp, if you want all your stuff stolen out of your garage....buy this.  Look at the "history" picture i uploaded....on the review.  My garage opened automatically without prompt twice today (day one after install) while i was not home.  It immediately closed at 2pm but was open for ten minutes at 645pm.Bottom line, i dont trust it.  Tried calling customer service but they had me on hold for 30 minutes and still no response.

First, make sure you have a compatible Garage Door Opener, and if you do, then this is a great product, especially if you get Amazon deliveries as this works with Amazon Key for deliveries directly into your Garage for many items so you know they’ll be made securely (not all items qualify as Key Deliveries, and many require you specify Key Delivery, so I wanted to make this clear).Even without Key Delivery functionality, I find this useful in that this gives you the ability to open/close your garage remotely, as well as receive notifications when the Garage Door opens/closes, or stays open for extended periods. This is inexpensive, and easy to install even if you aren’t technically inclined.

Chamberlain is one of those companies which would benefit from losing its footing for a while. Their product is ok but software and integration are annoyingly complicated or non-existent. iOS App is slow, buggy and fails to authenticate over cellular connection often. It poorly integrates with Alexa, there doesn't appear to be a direct-control API for Amazon to use, it has to open the MyQ app to open the door. What?!!!! App often loses the connection with the opening door and reports a failure while the door opened just fine. Apple Watch App is more offline than online with the iPhone App. The whole experience is clunky, slow, ill-programmed and SLOW. Had I known what I know now, I would NOT have bought it!

Every night before going to bed, my wife would walk into the garage for a few seconds, then come out, so I finally asked her why.  She said she was checking to see if the garage door was closed.  We had forgotten to shut the garage door, once, and a neighbor called to remind us.  So when my son in law showed me his MyQ, I ordered one the same day!  It was easy to install and is very easy to use.  Now every night before going to bed my wife checks her phone!  I like it so much, I recommended it to my neighbor who at least once a month calls and asks if her garage door is open.  If you have ever been asked if your garage door is open, you need this!

Overall, I like the product.  But I had some difficulty getting this working.  I followed all the instructions and things went well up until the end of the process.  Then the unit started getting confused about whether the door was open or closed.  Eventually, the unit lost it connection with the garage door opener, and could not get connected.  I did several factory resets and went through this multiple times.Finally, I called Chamberlain technical support.  They walked me through the same process and then mentioned in the discussion that there can be interference with LED light bulbs. BINGO!  I swapped the bulbs in my garage to regular incandescent bulbs, and everything has worked flawlessly since.

As we all know, what we experience when setting up a new Smart Home device. We often expeience frustration,  hours of research and rebooting, calling tech support and general frustration.I am SO excited to report setting up the MyQ Garage Door Opener was the easiest installation I've completed in a very long time. When considering the fact it's for opening a garage door locally and remotely, I am very impressed.

Shipping was really fast.you can actually set it up in your living room and then stick it to the garage with the hub still in the living room.  My house is 2000 sq ft and a 2 car garage.  Works great, easy to use.

I purchased this MYQ product in August 2018, and have had significant issues with it since.  I tried using the support technicians, and they were very responsive, and helped resolve the problem.  But the problem of the APP not working continues to this day.  It installed easily, and it does work if I use the web site to open/close the door.  But the APP has serious flaws and will not work.  The tech had to install firmware to the hub (something only he can do), and then basically re-install the unit (re-connect to WIFI, link to garage door opener, etc.).  I've given up and will purchase the MEROSS unit that uses different technology (direct wire connection).

This does exactly what it says it will with one possible exception.  The delay in the notification to my phone is several minutes.  Even if I am in the house.  That delay is likely due to my wifi and network rather than the product.  I just wish it was faster.  I had a little trouble getting it on my wifi and had to try a couple of times but finally got it.  It gave me some low signal strength warnings while I was trying to connect but it's not like I could move anything closer together.  So, I just kept trying and eventually got it.

I HATE this thing with a fiery passion.  Constantly losing connectivity, unpairing itself, not allowing the garage door to open, etc. It always works for a few days then stops and make me get a ladder to re-pair it and I’m sick of it.  This is the worst product to buy if you want to open your garage door.  But if you’re looking to waste your life on a piece of garbage by constantly climbing ladders and re pairing then this device is definitely for you!

programmed and installed according to instruction in manual and on app.  wifi set up.i screwed the hub to the ceiling, per instructions next to the opener and right over where the door sensor is when the door is open.

I was loving the product. Not the most advanced but perfect for my needs.  Great integration with Google Home.  Then one day it stopped talking to my WIFI.  That led to a cumbersome journey with Chamberlain.  The warranty replacement process is extremely difficult and cumbersome.  I am not sure if it was designed this way on purpose.  I called and started with an issue on June 4th.  It is now June 29th and it is not resolved.If I had known your company was this difficult, I would not have purchased a Chamberlain MyQ.  Do to my experience I am going to be looking for any other provider for my garage and lift needs in the future.

The product came in time and delivered at the instructions I added,  very satisfied with the delivery.  I always wanted an wifi/data enabled garage opening and closing.  I couldn't pass up the price so I bought this one.I gave the product 4 stars due to connection install hardships.  It took me an hour at least to complete the install.  I suggest setting up the whole thing in the garage. I had to do numerous reset of the hub in order to connect it to the wifi,  and it also took numerous try to connect the hub into my garage rolling code.

Such a great little device that ensures your garage is closed and safe.  Set alerts to let you know when it is opened or if it is being opened when you are not at home.  For such a low price it is great to have that comfort.  I wished I had gotten this sooner as we frequently go into the house without closing the garage and then it is open for hours.  I have a home garage gym and audio equipment for my patio I want to keep safe and locked up so this was a no brainer to get.I would recommend this to anyone who owns a home.  We have ours tied into our home security system for seamless operation and notifications.

This product is extremely easy to install. The app guides you and makes it pretty dummy proof. From the time it was delivered on my front porch it took maybe 45 minutes at most to have it up and running. My only complaint is the Google assistant integration. Instead of being able to just tell Google to open/close the garage or ask if it's open or closed, you have to tell Google to talk to myQ, then myQ's annoying prompt speaks to you and you have to go through that and it asks which garage you want to know the status of even if you only have it on one garage. Overall it's a great product, but if you want a product that is easy to use with Google assistant then look elsewhere.

I have the app configured to alert me when my garage door is open for too long. Since I have been known to forget to close my garage door, this is a nice feature.When testing the functionality, it works pretty consistently. But twice I got an alert that my door was open, and after using the app to close the door, it was still open when I checked it.

For the price, this is the best smart home device I own. Installation was super easy, wireless setup was in less than few seconds. My garage door opener is a 1999 Liftmaster, connecting the opener took four attempts which was noted in the installation guide.  It works like a charm, no problem whatsoever.  I was looking into buying this device for a while but some negative reviews discouraged me from buying until the recent price drop which made this so inexpensive that it was no brainer to buy and try.  I understand some negative reviewers have problem setting up the device.  There are so many small variables here, like wifi strength, door opener brand and model, interferences with other devices, placement of the opener and the device, and some other variables that could create problem for some users.  But unless you don't try it yourself you can't find out if this is the right device for your setup or not.  Also the installation guide is one of the best installation guides I've ever seen.  It's built in to the application and comes with videos and links to questions and troubleshootings.

Not worth it, can not be controlled directly by alexa or Google assistant (I have and use both) it requires using third party apps to play intermediate between the MyQ and Alexa or google , even with that it worked for two days and then stopped, not working, what is the point if you are outside your garage and can't rely on it to open, if I have to grab my phone and open the MyQ app what is the point??!! I might as well keepy remote in the car, I have to dig up good old Garage remote again, what a waste of my time and money

I love smart home products and have tons of them. I do not like or trust this product, however. It took like 20 minutes to install so it wasn't bad. But that isn't my problem with this. I don't trust this. Once I shut my garage with my remote, sometimes this hub tries to open the garage again. I have had it up for a week and it has already done so several times.  I know I shut my garage door (and confirmed it) the hub had opened it again. Luckily, I woke up out of a sleep to go check the garage door to see that it was open again at 12:30 PM! I also get notifications that it opens up at 3am when my husband is asleep in bed next to me.  I don't trust this thing at all.

I was looking for smart garage since I bought my house in 2017. My garage opener is Linear. I was looking at that brand for a long long time. it was selling for 80 dollars and it never go on sale.  After I saw this smart controller on sale also compatible with Linear I bought it. setuo was easy.  my understanding is this unit is an additional remote to pair with the opener,  in the mean time it talks to home wife to sent and receive signals. just love it

It stopped working after two days and support didn’t not respond to my emails. The garage door sends notification if it is opened, but it doesn’t close the garage door if it is left open (that’s the main reason I bought the garage opener. )One of the biggest problems of these system is that they connect to a server and when that server is down your system doesn’t not function as it is supposed to.

I looked at a lot of different mobile app based garage door openers.  Most had to be wired to your garage door opener, this one does not.  This uses the learn function on your opener just like your remote does.  It was a very quick setup and it works well.  I set it up for two garage doors with no problems (I did have to buy a separate monitor for the second garage door).

Easy install. Connecting HUB to WiFi easy. Pairing HUB to garage door motor was easy. A minor issue with color coding on Chamberlain learn button. Mine appeared brown but it was actually purple. Once I got got passed that, the app, HUB and sensor worked flawlessly. If power supply to HUB is interrupted, unit will need to be paired again with garage door motor but only takes about a minute or less.Just installed this weekend. Can’t speak about longevity but, pretty basic set up with no moving parts. Should last for quite some time. Only the sensor on the garage door requires batteries but app should alert if battery needs replacing.

I bought this in hours that it would have some integration with other services - yeah, not without their expensive Hub. The only things you can really do with this is open and close the garage door from the app, schedule it to open or close the door, and.... that’s it. Want it to open as you approach? Nope. Want to do things with IFTTT or any other service? Think again. But you can get Amazon Key deliveries with it. So I guess that’s something.This device is very much hobbled by the manufacturer so you have to purchase their hub. I wouldn’t recommend this to anyone looking for a truly “smart” garage door opener.

This thing does what it says it will do.  If you follow the directions exactly, and have decent wifi coverage in your garage it will work the first time.  If you don't follow the directions, it might not work for you, at least the first time.  Like a replacement clicker, this device has to "learn" the code to open and close the opener.  It took me two tries to for this device to "learn" my garage door opener.Never use an LED bulb in or around a garage door opener.
