It will put out a hash of interference which will make the radio receiver on the garage door opener very in-sensitive to your garage door clicker as well as this device.

It's convenient that any family member can open or close door without clicker. Installation fine with ladder and drill but wood was so firm I couldn't mount control unit flush.  App sometimes says door is closed when it's open and vice versa.  When I tried setting timer to make sure door is closed at 9pm, it opened door then closed it!  I don't use that feature now.  Alexa controls are awkward, and I don't think I can use Alexa to open AND close door, but that might be a good restriction for safety reasons, as is the beeps added.  I guess the hardware is fine but app and cloud service need refinement.  Good value for price paid.

Many attempts to pair the Hub with my opener failed. A call to tech support revealed two very important details that the documentation doesn't mention:-- If the red learning button doesn't work, try selecting green in the MyQ iPhone app. This worked almost immediately for me.

It works, sort of...  Setup was easy but after just a week or so I got a message about low battery in the box attached to the garage door. I was surprised that battery life was so short. I have replaced battery - for now it is good.The messages on my phone are hit and miss. Most times it sends a message, sometimes not. The other day I was going to work. As soon as I opened the door I got the notification. I got out, closed the door but I was not notified by it. Only after returning hope, upon opening the door, two notifications came: one about closed doors from 8 hours before and a new about opened doors.

I had recently bought a Chamberlain garage door opener to replace a failing unit on the 2nd stall. the MyQ settings for that were great. I wanted to have the same ability to check open/close of the door and to close remotely if I forgot to close the door when leaving. This hub did the trick for my 1st stall garage door.  Installation took about 30 minutes in all to do. pairing  to a Wayne Dalton Pro Drive garage door was straight forward and worked the 1st time. The door sensor is battery operated so will be interesting to see how long it lasts. I did not set it up for Alexa and do not plan to use that functionality of the unitl

The device was easy to set up but the operation has been very erratic and spotty with my Craftsman opener even though it is made by Chamberlain.  The only way I could get it to operate more than once in a row was to hang the hub next to the opener.  It still seems to be spotty in detecting when the door is open or closed and about half the time, I end up having to use the wall mounted button to operate the opener.  I would not buy another one.

This is the first "smart" home device that I own, and I have to say how pleased I am with the purchase!  I was always asking my wife "did I close the garage door?" after driving a mile or two away from the house.  Now I can just check the app to be sure it's down.Installation was easy after installing the app on my iPhone.  The instructions and video are straightforward.  The app connected to the MyQ device without any problems.  I have a Liftmaster door opener with a purple programming button that is about 10 years old, and it paired to the MyQ right away.

I have two genie garage door openers, one about 15 years old and the other about 1 year old. This worked fine with both. I ended up purchasing two complete units but that was just to get the second sensor. The entire unit was less expensive (on sale) than buying the extra sensor. I am using one hub and the two sensors to control both my garage doors. I have the hub mounted on the ceiling in between both of the garage door openers. The installation could not have been easier and the MyQ app works both of the doors perfectly and displays correct door status (open or closed) quickly and accurately. I could not be happier and highly recommend.

I can get the sensor to the hub and wifi sending me an email, BUT I couldn't get the hub to pair with my opener, which is a (manufactured in 2010) Liftmaster Model 3280-267M with the purple learn button.11/4/2019 update: turns out that my LED bulbs created a force field during the programming so you have to remove it during the programming of the hub to the motor.  Then for day to day operations afterward, use only LED bulbs from Philips, Eco Smart, 3m, Sylvania, FEIT, Cree.  I didn't see this in their FAQ or troubleshooting page.

I absolutely love this! As cheap as it was I cannot believe I didn’t get it sooner! I love having the peace of mind to easily look on my phone and make sure it was shut, or to open it using my phone. You can set up alerts so anytime it opens you can see it. It also tells you how long it has been opened or closed! A friend stopped by unexpectedly to drop something off, I was able to open it on my phone and the open my August locks with my phone and let them in my house. The only downside is every now and then it does take a minute or two to do the action on my phone, but I also live out in the country and my signal isn’t always strong.

I was setting up my account and was promoted to turn on location service on my phone. And the set up cannot be completed without location service. Why is location service essential in the set up process? And I started to realize, installing something like this is equivalent to inviting unknown danger to your house and families. Think about it, the device is connected to your garage door and the internet as well as where exactly you live. It's providing unlimited copies of your home key to people who are up to no good. Don't buy this type of product. Stay safe!

Pro: Complete package, easy to install, good instructions, works wi-fi with Liftmaster opener.I installed this unit with the understanding that it was compatible with Alexa as I queried Amazon for Alexa-compatible garage door openers. This was the first item displayed and it appeared to be a worthwhile unit as the manufacturer is Chamberlain; a Garage door opener manufacturer.  Once I realized that it was NOT compatible with Alexa, I returned it to Amazon and ordered the Nexx NGX-200. Now I wait another week to get that unit.

Recently either due to forgetfulness or possibly due to some mechanical issue with my garage door, I've come home several times after being away and found the door was open. I found the Chamberlain Group MYQ device and felt it would be part of a solution for me. If I left my home with the garage door open, I would receive an email and/or text message telling me the door was left open. But what if I don't or am unable to check my emails/texts? Turns out this device is both Alexa and ITTT (If This Then That) compatible. What that means is, using the app ITTT, I can set the device to close the door automatically when I have traveled about 3 minutes away from my home. How cool is that? Made this device such a great purchase for $40.

My boyfriend has a habit of leaving the garage door open so I got this for him.  He has the master account (app).  I am a designated user so I can open close the door from my phone as well. You can set timers so that it notifies you if the garage door has been open for a certain amount of time (you can chose that time.... winter we chose an hour.  Summer we usually let it stay open a little longer).Only downfall is that it only sends a notification to the person who has the master account and not all users.

This product is utter trash. Not to mention horrible connecting while infant of your garage. You're standing there infant of the garage waiting for it to connect......connect.... than they make you pay for the monthly service to use it with Alexa and routines and IFFT. Which when used didn't even work with the recipes and routines. how can company as bug as chamberlin be allowed to get away with total utter BS product. They need to be sued for crap.  I purchased tailwind no subscription, to use Alexa, no waiting to connect. If you buy this junk and you think this is good you're living in 1998.

Love the product for the price.  Sends me a notification of my garage door has been open for over 2 hours and allows me to close the door wherever I am.My issue with the product was getting it setup.  My garage doors openers are both under 5 years old and manufactured by Chamberlain so setup should have been a breeze or so I thought.  For whatever reason the hub would just not sync with my garage door openers.  So off I went to tech support who after an hour of trying many different things we were able to get the openers to sync by adding them as lights rather than garage door openers.

I love the fact that I have a backup "remote" for my garage now.  It's also nice to make the sensor automated such that it auto-closes the door after 9pm (kids like to leave the garage open all night!).Huge downside:

For the price, this was a really good purchase. It took maybe 15 minutes to install. It connected to my LiftMaster garage door easily, connected to my wifi and phone app easily, and was a piece of cake to install the door sensor and the hub. My wifi signal in my garage isn't great, so I thought I may be adding a wifi extender, but turns out that I didn't need to. It goes up or down when I tell it to, and that's all I needed since I had lost the only remote that I had for the garage door. And this costs about the same as a replacement remote, so it was a win-win for me. Alexa integration would have been nice, but still worth the price.

It is pretty straightforward to install although you would want to play a bit with the distance on how far it is to the garage door opener. I have inconsistent operation when I put it at the recommended distance and had to put it closer but that might due to the LED bulbs I used in the garage. They emit EMF. I got it at Black Friday deal, so just $20 for me. Definitely worth the money. Now I can be sure everytime I drive off garage, it is closed. If not, I can just use my app to do it. Google Assistant integration works fine but pretty useless to me since it can only close and not open which I believe is a security concern.

Overall, I would say it is a great addition to my house.  My daughter has no garage door opener and I do not like the 'button' in your car that can open your garage.  A simple window break and they are in your house.  Well not with MyQ.  The installation was a little difficult and would suggest putting the devices together while doing the initial setup.  Now I can open my garage door, check how long it was open, etc.  A new addition or update to the software would be to open it only a certain distance like half or quarter! (hint hint).  I purchased a Blink camera as well and with MyQ....it is TOTALLY AWESOME NOW!  All house keys have been take back from ALL the family!!

I have without a doubt a faulty door sensor that came with the hub.  I have had to call 3 times and I have been too patient.  Right now, the agent doesn't find it wrong to inconvenience me asking me to move my cars out of the garage and get a ladder just to give them the model number of the opener?!?!  THE PROBLEM IS NOT THE OPENER, it's the door sensor.  Why is it so difficult to acknowledge that???  I have not had peace of mind with this product, it keeps giving me false open door alerts.  Give it time to mature  before buying into it.  Feels half-baked

It took me some time to figure out how to get the base to talk to the sensor as well as getting it to learn my garage door opener. To make is easier for others, keep the host unit close to the sensor when configuring it. Also keep the sensor at least 24 inches from the garage door openers antenna. This way it picks up the signal much faster. Once you have it setup, you can remove the garage door key fobs from your car to ensure no one breaks in and opens your garage door (easy access for crooks). What I love the most is that I set it up to work with Alexa and voice control from my car opens the door before I get to the drive way. This is a must have for those folks setting up a smart home.

Absolute junk. Did not work out of the box. Attempted to chat with their 'stellar' customer support - they didn't even speak English well enough to understand what was wrong with my device. Then the entire support chat was dropped due to an awful connection on their end. The replies from the agent were several minutes in between and I just sat there waiting.The app never knew if the door was open or closed, and it would frequently beep loudly as it closed the garage door.

What a wast of time and money. I guess I received defective produce cause it didn’t work for me. I got it connected to my WiFi and liked up to my account but couldn’t get it working with my garage opener (lift master with purple programming button). I gave it a try several time but it wouldn’t compleat syncing. I decided to stop for the day with intention of going back at it later but then the crazy stuff started happening. As I try closing the door normally the door stopes 3/4 of the way and opens back up. Then 2 seconds later it tries to close it self and mid way stopes and go up again. I had to disconnect the devices power for it to stop. After something like that how do you ever trust it even if I got it to program correctly.

Sensor would not recognize door open or closed. Contacted tech support to get a replacement. They said it was probably because I had put LED bulbs in the opener. I said sure that's it. Well guess what that was it. I read up on why and there was a logical reason for it. I put in regular bulbs and door sensor senses open and closeg now. Then I was worried about the shop lights I put in to light up the garage, write up aid the more LEDs in line the less interference. Sure enough I turned on all 6 shop lights and sensor still works fine. Now I am happy. Sorry I doubted their tech support.

When I read reviews, which I always do when purchasing technology items, I obviously want to the the reviews heavily weighted with 4 and 5 stars.  Then I specifically go the 4 star reviews, because I don't want to hear about how perfect a product is...I'm already sold on it's benefits.  What I want to learn and read about is the pitfalls, issues and challenges, but I don't want to hear from a 1 or 2 star reviewer.  I want to hear from someone that has had success and likes the product, but has some small issue or problem.Whenever I deal with IP based products, I have to realize that every person's internet infrastructure, internet provider, wifi signaling, etc. will be wildly different.  When I hear and see some people have ZERO connectivity problems, and others have all kinds of connectivity problems...I usually discount that, because for the most part, my home network is secured, it's not overloaded, and my living environment is covered completely by the wifi signaling.  I use Ubiquity at home, and it kicks ass.

In our home, we have no desire to include Alexa, Siri, Google connections. But this device works wonderfully right from our smart phone. It is reasonably low-price, very simple to install and will keep us from having to be at our house to operate the garage door!  It has happened a couple of times that we were distracted and failed to confirm that the garage door was actually closed, which meant we had to go home to see to it. No longer a problem!  Also allows for the code to be shared as desired and eliminates the need for a separate garage door opener to be carried.  I love it!

Dislike #1: No HomeKit integration. You want this to work with Siri or Alexa? Buy another expensive part.Dislike #2: Charging for IFTTT integration. Everybody else (EVERYBODY else) does this for free.

Fairly easy to install, though the directions could use some work. Case in point, Step 2 Install the Door Sensor. There is a tip to test the door sensor. Well if this is your initial install, the tip will not work as you have not even plugged in the hub yet, which is Step 3.Also, the directions that come with the device, are a bit different than the ones located on the MyQ App.

5 stars for the very reasonable price and dead-simple install.  We have a pretty old Genie but it paired up fine first time.  Wifi signal is not very strong in the detached garage but so far I've seen no sign of it getting dropped.  The app is very simple and so far has worked fine to alert when the door is opened or closed, plus we've made a couple 'notifications' to remind if it's still open after 1 and 2 hours and those have consistently worked as well.  It's also  convenient to be able to manually open/close with the app.

Really easy to install, the myQ app couldn't have made it any easier. I didn't have to drill any holes; I used the existing hanger for my garage door motor to mount, luckily I had the correct screws and bolts laying around (had previously got them from home depot).THE BEEPING!! Every time you close the door it makes a very annoying beeping sound that can not be deactivated (as far as I know). So I opened the unit (2 tiny screws), pulled on the speaker, and cut 1 of the 2 wires (see pics). It was so easy to do i still give the opener 5 stars.

I've had the product Installed for around 3 to 4 months. I'm pretty tech savy so it was easy to get it running.  Just think... if your garage opener battery dies,  like mine did last week, this saved the day until I got a replacement. I originally purchased the home gift for my husband but I think I like it more! Had my first  Amazon delivery in the garage, such a bonus! No worries about package pirates especially during the Holidays.  One side note, I did have to replace the batter in the sensor pretty quickly but that was super easy and those replacement batteries are cheap.

Concept was simple. Installation was bumpy.  But is working good now.  Here are some tips.  Don't pull the battery tab out until it says so in the app.  Did it when I mounted on door and caused issue.  Had to pull battery out, reseat and start again.  Also, mount the server as close to the sensors as possible.  If you have 2 sensors mount equidistant between them.  I installed like the manual said "within 4 feet of the opener" but my furthest garage door sensor didn't work properly.  Reinstalled the server very close to both sensors and it has worked perfectly since.  Not sure why they tell you to mount close to opener since I think the sensors work via bluetooth.

The solution to accidentally leaving your garage door open. I installed on a single door garage with an existing Liftmaster opener. My wifi signal is strong in the garage so install was very quick and easy it almost seemed too easy to be correct. My struggle came with pairing with the iphone app. I called their customer service and was pleasantly surprised how knowledgeable and helpful they are. They had me up and running in 5 minutes. ( I called them on a Saturday). This is a must have if you have ever left your house and worried that you might have left your door up. Also useful for opening the door remotely to allow others access to make a  delivery while you are not home.

I was able to set up the MyQ device in less than an hour. Most of the time took mounting the hub and ensuring it could see the sensor.  I quickly was able to set up guests (my grown children that don't have remotes for our garage door) so they can access the door when necessary. Of course, when you have children that are comedians, they immediately want to play tricks and open the door when they are on vacation!  Having the alerts in place ensured I knew their game!  I also quickly set up a schedule so that the door will automatically shut at a certain time because sometimes people just forget to close the door! My next step will be setting up access for Amazon deliveries to ensure the security of my purchases!This is a great product so far and is a welcome addition to the other solutions I have in configured to have a 'smart' home.

Simple to install, setup and use!!Hardest part about the entire process is getting on the ladder to place hub on the ceiling. Directions are short albeit well written, easy to follow. Took less than 15 minutes total to install and verify operation. One of the better benefits is being able to send temporary access to ‘guests’ who may use this to open the garage without having to share any passwords with ‘guests’ and then can remove ‘guests’ access at will as soon as the in-laws leave : )  highly recommend,

It's an extremely finicky thing to set up as other reviewers have indicated. I wanted this because I am always worried I left the garage door open, and my mother in law who watches my kids at my house often leaves it open absent mindedly. I also keep my very expensive bikes in my garage, and I don’t want to be up for grabs. I had to do some trial and error to get it to work. For one, I recommend a WiFi extender if you have a detached garage as I have. Upon originally programming it seemed buggy. It deprogrammed all my other openers which I was able to reprogram without any issue. After the initial set up, the device failed to work. The device would simply not respond to open and close commands on my phone, even though it had the ability to know whether the door was open or closed. I knew it wasn't the WiFi because I was able to stream music and browse the web in my garage with no issues. I was ready to rebox the item and return it, but I wanted to give it one more try. Upon web searching some issues I found a page on Chamberlain's website that said your garage door motor CAN interfere with the hub if it's positioned too close to the motor. I previously had the hub on the inner side of the motor in the garage (further from the door). I then repositioned it to be on the other side of the motor (see the picture for reference, e.g. the correct positioning of the hub). I then wiped the hub's memory and reprogrammed it from the beginning. Other users indicated a second programming attempt solved their problems. For me, moving it further from the motor, specifically to the spot between the door and the motor, AND reprogramming seemed to do the trick for me. It has lost a connection once, but so far it's working fine.ONE WEEK UPDATE

Had this installed for just over a month and so far in that time I have had it lose connection 3 times, signal in my garage is full bars on my phone, but for some reason this loses connection. This alone wouldn't be a big deal EXCEPT for some reason when I open the app after this happens, it acts like I don't have any devices on the account, and makes me re-do the entire setup, re-sync the sensor, reconnect it to the app, HUGE pain in the butt, I have gone back to just using the remote on the door. Dunno what the issue is, the device or the app, but its a pain. Thankfully I only paid $20 for it on some Christmas flash sale so I don't feel like I lost out too bad, but still it is RIDICULOUS that the app doesn't remember the device when it loses connection. *Edit and update* got so bad I had to call their support, the guy was crazy helpful and walked me through the issue, very good on the company that makes this, I will update again in a month if I have no other issues*FINAL UPDATE! It has been working really well ever since I called their support line, if you have an issue, just call the help line, don't try and fix it yourself, the app for some reason wasn't going to a step I needed to do, and the tech directed me to the issue and helped me correct it, and now it works perfectly.

Took forever to link with a Genie Powerlift 900; not exactly an exotic brand opener.  Don't know how I can get the door sensor much closer to the main unit, but they lose communication like the blind man and his deaf son.  I bought a TP Link wireless cloner and plugged it into the nearest outlet in the garage for the sole purpose of providing a strong wireless connection less than 15 feet away, yet I still can't just open/close the door from the app reliably.And I've had to go through the whole process of linking the door sensor to the main unit, and reconnect it to my wireless 3 times in the month I've had it.

Lost my garage door opener and before buy a new one tried to find something wifi connectable that allows me open/close the garage door from my phone. Ordered this one because already bought some openers from Chamberlain and had a good (quality) experience. Setup took about 20 to 25 minutes and is very easy. Works perfectly with my Genie opener and my phones. The only cons I have it could work with Apple Home Kit. A plus feature is the door status (if the door is open or closed). For folks who never remember if closed the door after leaving (like my wife), you can check the door status just checking the app. Got this unit for $50, a limited time deal, fair price. The regular price of $80 is too expensive. Hope it last long.

Product that I received clearly had been used and previously installed.  I first noticed the plastic strip to activate the battery was lose in the box.  Then I noticed THERE WAS NO BATTERY.  The Velcro installation strips had been glued to the back, and the mating pair of Velcro was missing (clearly had been installed on someone's garage door).  The unit was completely unusable.  And, yes, it is supposed to come with a battery.  I returned it immediately and will not do business with this supplier again.  I have a MyQ on one garage door already and it works great.  I had ordered this unit to add the other garage door.  Now, I will just buy a new hub and sensor at Lowes.  It is only $10 more than through Amazon, and I'll keep the second hub as a backup.

No monthly fees, easy installation, working flawlessly so far.  No Alexa skill but can integrate using IFTT (I will wait for the Alexa Skill).  Follow the instructions.  Any new Access Point or router with WiFi worth its salt will allow you to create a separate 2.4GHz network, which I did.  As such, I have not experienced the problems some have had trying to use dual-band deployments for the same SSID.  I created a "Garage" network with 1Mbps bandwidth limit and all is well.  My garage is flush with high-output LEDs and the opener the unit is adjacently mounted also has two LED bulbs.  The report about LEDs affecting the unit have not held true for me.  Time will tell the tale, but so far I'm pleased.

Works fine, I had trouble installing from my Android phone app and had to switch to my wife's iPhone to complete installation. It only integrates with Google Assistant and not Google Home, which is a problem. There is no Alexa integration at all, which is a letdown. It would be nice to have an alarm sound followed by a voice alert either on the phone or preferably on Alexa /Google Home. If someone opens my garage in the middle of the night I am highly unlikely to notice a small pop up in app message or an email, it would be much better if it triggers an alarm with a voice alert/sound.
Hello readers,There was a sale on this device so I decided to purchase it since it works with my Wink Hub. I read that it does not integrate with Alexa because of security reasons.

Doesn't do a very good job at it's one fucntion: telling me whether the garage is opened or closed. It constantly losses sync. It's apparently not an active sensor. It doesn't actually send a signal every so often to poll the door position. It just sends one onnooen and close. I'm assuming it also doesn't monitor for a verification response. Because of this, the signal sometimes gets lost and the hub will read the wrong position. Pushing the sync button resends the position signal and corrects this. If you want something that works all the time, don't buy this thing. If it's not used that much, consider it because it's cheap.
This device has turned out to be way more handy than I thought.The "did I close the garage door?" after driving away from your home is a thing of the past.

My garage door opener is a GeniePro with two fluorescent lights and the garage has 5 LED shop lights hanging from the ceiling. The all process was a little touchy and ornery when trying to establish Bluetooth/ RF can be a little aggravating when first setting it up but all is well by just starting over. So, hardware install is very easy but establishing all the required communication can take time. Do it do what it says.. Yep. Wow what a great conveniece that you can verify if the garage door is open or closed which is one less stress point in my life.It is still disturbing that it doesn't interface with Alexa, come on guys you need to be more customer conscious and give us back the skill.

Installation was straightforward and it does everything it said it would do.  I can see when my garage is open and for how long and I can open/close it from wherever I am.Words of warning:  I installed this in the middle of the afternoon and after a day or so I started getting random phantom openings.  It freaked us out when our garage opened at 10PM for no reason.  After the third time, I just unplugged it and was ready to go through the hassle of returning it.

The set up was not to bad, but did take a while to pair with my garage door opener.  I did get them working.  But this device was listed as being compatible with Alexa, which it is not.  Seems like a huge over sight when developing a smart home device.  I should have done more research, but once it was installed I was not taking it down.  The integration with Google home is kinda clunky.  You have to first request to talk with myq then you can get it to work.  And if you have two garage doors it can struggle understanding.  If it was compatible with Alexa I would buy again and recommend.

I love this product (after I got it installed). I’ve used it a couple of times to check my garage door status and close the door if I left it open. The app on my iPhone is beautiful and easy to use. My only problem was with the install. The quick start guide is worthless. Might as well toss it as soon as you open the box. As a former technical writer, I would be embarrassed if I wrote the install procedure for this product. YouTube videos helped me and when I got done, I thought it seemed so obvious. Why didn’t they write the install that way. Terrific product but don’t rely on the documentation supplied with it. Go online.

My husband installed this in a matter of minutes.  We both had a problem remembering to close the garage door, or we would go somewhere and not be able to remember if we closed or not, so we decided to invest in this handy device!  It's nice not to have to replace the entire garage door opener.  It has an app that is easy to use and we can log on and check the "status" of our door (open or close) and you can set alerts, for example, we have our set to alert us every time the door opens or closes and when it stays open for more than 6 hours. It has been a life saver!

I love the installation videos. They are super easy to follow and very helpful. We got everything up and running through the MyQ app and IFTTT app, which easily integrated with Alexa. Make sure you follow the video instructions relating to the placement of the WiFi hub to the T because that can significantly impact its functionality.You won't be able to tell Alexa to open your garage (due to security reasons), but everything else works flawlessly! Also if you didn't already know this, when using the app to open/close the garage, you need to DOUBLE tap the circle to open or close the garage door.

Okay so I was a little nervous to install it just because of some mixed reviews! But I gave it a try during a class break! I downloaded the app first! Made an account and followed the instructions from the app!!!! I plugged in the main unit! Made sure there was enough WiFi connection( again all of this are instructions from the app!) follow app instructions it took about 15 mins or less to set up! Now this device works! I needed it after husband kept leaving garage door open at night! I can schedule it to open or close at a certain time! And it notifies me when it has been closed or open! You do have to change settings to get notifications but I love this! Will update in a few months!!!

I was so happy to get this in just one day with Amazon Prime. And then I was super bummed to see that it was "used" not "new" as advertised. It was very obvious that the package had been opened, the screws had drywall on them still, and the back of the velcro tape wasn't sticky anymore, as it had been stuck to a door previously. Maybe this is why I had to reset the hub to factory settings before I could program it. Very deceptive to send me a used model, when you advertised "new." I would have returned it, but was going out of town soon and wanted it in place before I left.Because I have a Marantec garage door opener, and not one of the more compatible brands,  I can only monitor my garage door---I can't open or close it remotely. This is still helpful for peace of mind. So far it works as advertised. HOWEVER, it took me forever to get the hub/WiFi/MyQ app all straightened out. I watched several videos about installation and how to connect the hub to WiFi, read all the directions several times, and STILL it was super glitchy. Nothing like the straightforward videos I watched on YouTube. I had to turn off and restart my router to get it all to work. And I had to go through the setup procedure twice for it to work.

At this point I'm going to have to rip this thing out. The sensor is just too unreliable in it's connection with the Hub. They should have used a more reliable communication than Bluetooth or made the connection more robust.The sensor picking up the correct state is about a 50/50 chance each time I open the garage. I've tried replacing batteries, moving the sensor and hub positioning around and nothing seems to improve that accuracy. Seems like this is a common problem. It's just too unreliable to be used practically - I can't have a garage door open that gets stuck because it can't figure out what state it is in.

One of the worst things I have ever purchased from amazon. Bought it and hooked it all up. It may work once a week. My router is within 5 feet of the device. Everything is connected properly. I either get door sensor malfunction, or it says it has tried to many times and I have to manually do it. Most of the time though it just says opening or closing but the door doesn’t  do anything. Biggest waste of money. They also don’t tell you that it does not integrate with any smart devices unless you pay a monthly fee. Abosulutely ridiculous. If it wasn’t so much work to disconnect and pack up I would definitely send back. Horrible product and am so disappointed.

Once configured this works well with Home Kit/Siri.  I literally open and close my garage door every day only with Siri.  I have a bad habit of leaving the garage door open in the evening.  So I set a scheduled time for the door to close at 9PM if I forget.  My wife really likes this feature.  Setting all this up the first time was a little ugly.  I had to reset everything and start over twice.  The instructions that come with the devices is not great in my opinion.

I have had this product for about 8 months now and am less than impressed. The product works great if you just want to see if you left the garage door open or not, but if you use it to actually open the door then good luck. The problem it seems to have the most trouble with is when you are coming into range of your homes wi-fi and switching over from LTE. 90% of the time the app just hangs there and does nothing. To get around this I have to disconnect from wi-fi to avoid this. Another problem is that I constantly lose connection between my wi-fi or my smart hub that attaches to the garage. When I troubleshot this problem my garage door always gets removed from my app and I have to go through the whole process of reconnecting.The hardware is great, but the software is awful. Maybe wait for Nest or Ring to come out with something because the software engineers at Chamberlain just don't have the skills yet for smart home automation.

Bought this and a Ring Cam so I could finally stop driving all over town to different Amazon Lockers to pick up my orders since front door delivery is not an option in my neighborhood (packages are sometimes stolen), I thought delivery right into my garage would be amazing.  And it WAS… the first week.  Two deliveries on two different days were delivered right into my garage with no issues whatsoever.  It was amazing to come home from work and find my packages safe and sound in the garage.  But starting the second week, deliveries were just left at my front door despite all the messages I got from Amazon saying deliveries would be placed in my garage.  This is a total missed opportunity for Amazon.  People like me who work long hours would order more from Amazon if only the drivers would actually follow through and deliver inside the garage.  Instead, they just leave packages at the front door and drive off. The packages are not safe sitting out where anyone can walk up and take them.  It happened to me many times before.  And my chats with Amazon customer service were the worst.  Most of the time, Amazon put the blame on me, saying my garage door wouldn’t open (there’s no problem with my garage door) or the drivers didn’t know the code to open my gate (there’s no code, no gate) or they couldn’t find the garage (my house is very small.  My garage on the other hand is big and hard to miss.  Plus, I took a picture of the garage and posted it in the Key App, and left instructions to not leave any packages at my front door and to go the few extra feet to the garage and put the packages inside only) and they said I wasn’t selecting the in-garage delivery when I order stuff (tell that to the Key app that tells me I’ve got deliveries coming to my garage on the day of the scheduled delivery.  It even gives me blow by blow details of my delivery even telling me a time the delivery will be placed in the garage.  Why would it do that if I had not selected in-garage delivery?) I think the answer is the Amazon drivers are just lazy.  And no one is enforcing the in-garage delivery.  I have Ring cameras around my house and could see the drivers just pulling up, putting the packages on my front doorstep, taking a picture and leaving.  No attempt to go to the garage, no pulling out a device to open the garage door, nothing.  Just lazy.  And one driver put on the tracking that she handed the item to me at my garage door!  I was at work, so I would like to know how she handed it to me. I have her on camera leaving the package at my doorstep and getting back in her truck and leaving.  she never went to the garage or even acted like she was looking for it.  And during my chats with Amazon after they told me it was my fault and I argued my side, they just assured me it would not happen again. And then the very next delivery is left at my doorstep, again!!!Out of 8 deliveries I placed for in-garage delivery, only 3 were delivered into the garage.  The rest were just left at the front door despite me calling and complaining and leaving instructions in the app.  This could be a great service if ALL deliveries were delivered into the garage as promised.  I would buy so much more from Amazon if I knew the deliveries were safe in the garage.  So now, I am back to buying most stuff at Best Buy or having Amazon deliver to a locker clear across town.

I had such high hopes for this device. Let me start out by saying, I work in a technical field, have my whole home automated so I am not new to these types of devices.Installation went smoothly and initial testing worked as designed. Immediately I began having connectivity issues. This is baffling to me since I my internet router is just on the other side of the wall not even 20 feet away. Signal analysis shows it to be very good. I even went so far as putting another wireless access point in the garage which didn’t help.

I continue to have unreliable permanence from the MyQ device.  It always opens the garage door but will not always close the garage door.  I have done everything customer support suggested in including:1. Placement within 4-6 feet of opener

It works, it's easy to install and the app is easy to use.  If you purchase an additional sensor, it can control a second garage door.However it's integration with Google Home requires a $10/year subscription for very limited functionality.

Wow can I say they made the install on this product so easy and user friendly. It walks you step by step and the best part is how simple they have made this technology. Great product with super easy install. Keep in mind you should download the app first to do the install efficiently.Also I used the Honey app to track pricing, as I bought this at half the price when they had a sale. Making the deal/product even more lucrative.

I bought this because it was cheap and we needed a way to let guests in and out of our garage.  We ended up returning it because we were so disappointed.  I am quite technically competent (software engineer in tech industry), so usually I am able to figure out how to get things to work well enough, but in this case the short falls were just too much to justify putting up with.1. Software Fails: We expected to be able to schedule when our guests could access our house, but the software is completely unable to coordinate this.  The guest functionality requires you to grant 24/7 access, and requires that your guest download and use their confusing app.  This is so disappointing.  It should have been easy to coordinate this through sharing of links, which should be able to be scheduled and revoked at any time without any third party app.  Really really disappointing software.

Ordered it on a Sunday morning and got it by that afternoon with Amazon Prime. Took me about 30 minutes to install. I read the directions entirely and then I got started. I found a good spot to mount both pieces and did that first. From there, I just followed the directions and it was working within minutes. Works great with the app on an iPhone X. Now I can monitor my garage door at all times with my phone, open and close it, make a schedule for it to be closed, set notifications, and have a detailed log of the garage door activity. Well worth the $80.

I had been considering getting one of these since I left the garage open by mistake several months ago, I keep lots of personal and work related expensive tools and equipment in my garage. My work vehicle is always backed into the driveway facing away from the door so I don’t always notice if it is closed or open and it’s easy for me to forget to verify it’s closed before leaving. It was fairly easy to install and set up. Just last week I went to get a car wash and run some local errands and while I was waiting at the car wash I thought, “did I close the garage door?” I quickly opened the app on my phone and saw it was currently open and was open for the past 20 minutes. I closed it with the app and got verification it was closed.I’m very happy with mine!

One of the most important parts of this device to me is the accurate logging of when the garage door is opened and closed. We can open and close with the MyQ app and sometimes it's logged and sometimes it's not.  My garage allows entry to the house and I would never consider amazon Key knowing that this thing will fail to log events. Furthermore, my son raised the door to put something in there then closed it using the app. It worked but his app says the door is open. It's not. My app says the door hasn't been open for 3 days. Wifi range in the garage is excellent. Hub is 30' from the router.

I have a two garage door openers one with the built in MYQ. Really nice for wife to check if it is closed on her phone before she goes to bed. The other door is a bit older before this technology came along. My son started driving recently we let him use the older door for his car.  Needless to say he forgets to close it from time to time. Now she can check if it is opened or closed just like the other one no difference. I work odd hours I get alerts at work when door opens or closes if it doesn’t close I will text him to close it, or I can close it from work. Super easy to install. Was going to replace with a whole new opener like other one until I found out about the product. Money saved. Directions very easy to follow.

Well I moved and my MyQ enabled garage door stayed. I kept the wireless connector but when moving into my new house, it wasn’t compatible.I bought this hoping it would enable me again to control it from an app. Kept getting stuck and wouldn’t connect. I just about returned it when I called their support.

Doesn't open the door reliably.  Seems to have a mind of it's own on whether it wants to open or not.  I have been locked out of my house due it not opening.  App displays it as "opening" but nothing happens.  I have never had an issue with it closing on command.  Which is really frustrating.I have read but can't confirm that subscription is needed to link to Google Home or IFTT.  Had I have known this before I bought it I wouldn't have even purchased.  Looks like there is a trial available but I didn't even try it since the door won't open reliably.  Another deterrent using the trial subscription was the setup process.  I started through the setup and it wanted me to install Google Assistant.  I am using a Pixel with Google Home already installed why do I need another Google app?  Every other smart home device can be easily linked through the Google Home app.

I had to return my first unit because it didnt want to work but the replacement is working great! I bought this because I always second guess myself when I leave the house whether or not I closed the garage door. This has made me turn around and go all the way back home just to see of the garage door was closed. Not anymore! Open the app and it will let you know if the door is open or closed. You can also open. It anywhere you have service or wifi. Great device and super easy to install. I love it! If you are on the fence... definitely give this a try. You wont regret it!

I did end up purchasing this product from another vendor. The product works excellently and integrates easily with my other door opener which has the Craftsman HomeLink. I can now control and receive updates on both my garage and workshop doors on the Chamberlain MyQ app. This allowed me to completely uninstall the Craftsman app. The MyQ-G0301 installed easily on my Genie opener in my shop. It only took about half an hour  total and I opted to drill and screw the sensor to the door instead of using the tape tabs. Having both the MyQ and Homelink internet adapters allows for more options should I decide to expand the home automation devices in the future.

I loved the user experience of this product. We had somebody stealing things from our garage when tenants or ourselves accidentally leave the garage door open. It is a great product. My only problem, and It’s a big one is that this product lasted for about 5-6 months before I had to change the battery in mid October. By the middle of November the battery was dead again... I found out from the company that the product drains battery when in the cold... but October to November is only a month... and we have only used the tool maybe 5 times. There should be clear information that this product’s battery needs to be changed very often in cold climates.

Size: I was hesitant to buy it because I did not want 2 more pieces of hardware in my garage ( I am a bit of a minimalist)... And most importantly I did not want to install a hardware on my actual garage door.. But I have to say the 2 pieces are smaller than they look in the pictures and If you install it in one of the top corners, you wont even notice it.Installation:  instructions were straight forward. I was able to complete the installation in 30 min. I was a bit concern because I read another review that complained about instructions.. but for me was very clear.

The description of this device does not inform you of a lot. It fails to tell you how/what the app is/not capable of doing. You can open and close the garage door. You can set it to open at particular times. But, you cannot close the door automatically or with some automation. The device works. But the app is lack luster and not able to do what (is no longer available) the MyQ wall button could do  - and that is automatically close your door at the defined time. As a result of this sorely lacking feature, I went with another product. I still have this one connected as a backup, but it isn't my "go to" for my garage door.

After less than a year using the device, now it is completely useless since it is unable to operate the garage door  even when standing in front of it in my driveway. The application doesn't even notify or show whether the door  is open or closed. All seems to coincide with updating the app on my phone by mid February. Tech support was blaming my phone, but it communicates perfectly well with all my wireless devices. For now, the android application has rendered the device to nothing else but a gadget drawing electricity. I'll update this review if the app is corrected.

This device does what I need it to do. Installation was a breeze (except that I couldn't reach my garage ceiling to install the hub so I just sat it in the bracket with the door opener). Works perfectly with IFTTT, which was what I wanted it for. Now I have peace of mind when I leave home and can check that we put the door down. I know when my family members come and go, and most of all when I'm in bed on the 3rd floor and remember that the door is up, I can ask Alexa or Google home to put the door down for me. At the low price this item sold for (prime days), it was worth the money the first day we used it. Every day since has been a bonus...and Amazon Key is icing on the cake!

This product description is deceptive as they make it seem you can connect multiple users and doors. That isn't true at all. I have tried to connect multiple doors and failed. There is no way to allow multiple user accounts to track, who left the door open and send them a notice to go back and close the door. Product BITES!!!

5 stars for Amazon who was great with one day delivery. 1 star for installation because it sucks that they don't tell you that you can't set it up with an Android device. I cussed and swore at it for two hours trying to set it up. I finally went to YouTube and watched someone's video that advised to set it up with an ipad. I tried the ipad and had it setup in 10 minutes. WHY DO THEY KEEP THAT A SECRET ? I guess they like to frustrate and piss off new customers. Now that it's setup it works with my Android phone. You just can't set it up with an Android device. If you don't have an Apple device to set it up don't buy this product.

We ordered this as it was on sale, with everything being smart these days, and with the right price, this was a no-brainer. Installation only took minutes and it has paid off quickly. We set it up in such a way, we would get alerts when the door would open/close, which was pretty annoying in the beginning, like... "duh... we know it's open/closed, we're right here", the one time my wife wondered, odd, we didn't get a closed alert and we logged in and what did you know, we forgot to close the garage. With the power of the internet....and.... Close.... :) .... completely worthy investment.We are still contemplating to take advantage of the integration with Amazon delivery.

I was excited for this item when it arrived. It was easy to install and seemed to work well out of the box. However, it began to fail when attempting to open and close the door with the app. I restarted the device and even uninstalled and reinstalled the app, per online advice, and while that worked for a single attempt, it failed to continue working. Also, while the safety beeping before closing might be helpful to avoid liability if someone is injured, it’s quite annoying for every day use.I’m a HomeKit fan and wanted to add my garage to the fold, but will need to wait for another product to make that happen.

When the price was $30, figured why not. I was pleasantly surprised. First it comes with everything you need. Syncing to my garage door opener ( mine is a Linear brand) couldn't have been easier. The app is easy to use. I linked mine to my wink hub so I can control through one app and that was easy as well.Doesn't impact any of your other controllers. It will send an alert whenever the door is opened. If you close your door via the app, be prepared for about 10 seconds of a warning beep before the door actually closes.

I was needing an additional garage opener and a came across this item while searching. For $20 I figured why not give it a try. It took my husband 10 minutes tops to install it, my only complaint is it was a little hard to sync it with the app. This took about 45 minutes of trying and finally we were able to get it to connect and operate it with our phones. We haven’t had no problems yet, but we haven’t had it very long to speak on the longevity of it. My husband was able to open it from his moms house who lives about a mile away. So far no problems have occurred, and it beat having to buy another garage opener. I ended up buying an additional for my in-laws.
I installed mine about a week ago and I love it!Pros:

We have loved using MyQ as a means to control our garage door.  We have had one installed for nearly a year and each update on the app has been better than the last.  Traveling frequently and leaving keys out hidden in the yard were just not cutting it for us.  This allows us to be sure the door is open for family, friends, and our children when we need it to be.  It also helps me to remember whether or not I remembered to close the garage door.  Peace of mind is well worth it.  Choosing this as a tech gift for family members has been easy because they are sure to love it.  I would like to see more Alexa capabilities in the future but for now I love this product.

Even with a wifi extender, wifi strength in my garage is poor.  I tried mounting Hub in several locations and almost gave up due to "offline" error messages.  Finally, I moved the Hub inside the house to a location with "3 bar" wifi and still close to garage door (but NO DIRECT LINE OF SIGHT to the sensors). - Works great now!  iOS app works fine and running two sensors off one Hub.  The Hub is close to the sensors - but the signal still has to travel through walls/house doors.  Your installation may vary -  I have a Lifemaster.

Have had the unit for about 5 months now. I mainly purchased it to be able to verify that my garage door was closed. I've tried to use it more lately to remotely open and close the door. It was able to do this the first month I had the unit but lately it doesn't work at all. The app can recognize if the door is closed or open but it will not open or close the door.  I've waited on it for as long as 5 minutes for the unit to open or close the door and at that point, what good is it? I'm either parked outside the garage door or standing next to the manual button. So, this is junk as far as I'm concerned. I would spend your $50 elsewhere and on something that easily integrates with Alexa without charging a fee.

I just installed the unit. Took about 15 minutes. Seems to work fine so far. I would say this though; Have your smart phone with you at all times during installation. Thee are NO printed instructions with this product. Literally the documentation that DOES come with the unit says "Download the app".So, after downloading the app, It takes you through step by step instruction. In fact, theres a nice youtube video. The only hiccup I had, had more to do with my garage door opener. The "Learn" button on my unit looks Red, but is in fact Purple. The subtle color shift in a darkened garage caused me to have to repeat the "learning" step.  Otherwise, things went without a hitch.

Purchased this to be able to add the ability to open and close my garage door via my iPhone App.  It works great.  I am able to open and close the garage door from my phone and Apple Watch.  Unfortunately, on top of buying their hardware, they force users to pay a subscription if they want to be able to open their garage door directly through Alexa or Google voice command.  Their app doesn’t allow to close the garage door after a set amount of time which is very unfortunate.  That functionality that is available on their newer doors would be a great addition!

Love the product if you follow the videos, not the written instructions. I had an issue linking it up when I mounted the hub by the opener first.  Do not do that. Mount your garage door sensor on the side of the garage closest to the wifi router. The plug in your hub within a few feet of the sensor. After it's all linked up then unplug and move the hub to the location you want to put it in.Recieved my first amazin delivery using amazon key because of this. They were able to open my garage, drop my package, and shut the door and keep my package safe. Great product at a great price.

First of all, there is no direct Alexa integration. So you should have a Google Home assistant ready.  And even then... you can only close the garage door through a series of “hey google, let me talk to myQ”. “Close garage door” (then it asks: “what’s the name of the garage door?”) “Garage Door”...  then it closes...  at that point...  a garage key fob is faster...Second of all...  the only reason this hub made sense was because of Amazon Key and whatnot.  Which appeared to be some partnership to make the premium membership free. Which it is. For a “limited time”.  And when that time expires, it’s $10/year or $1.00/month.

I was gladly surprised that this worked with my older garage door mechanism. Set up was well detailed.  Glad that it gives me a status on my garage door.  I have it tied to both Alexa and Google.  Frankly, Google is easier to use.  The reason is that Google can be set up with a simple command, "Close the garage door."  Alexa, after being set up, requires a command that includes the word "trigger."  "Alexa, trigger close the garage door."  Don't forget that word "trigger" or it's not going to work.  I also haven't found a way to get either Alexa or Google to "open" the garage door - only close it.  Either I'm missing something or maybe it's a security issue.  I wish I could do both.

It's ok, and the remote opening/closing comes in handy.  Often times, though, it shows the door status as the opposite of what it actually is... It's not very consistent and, yes, I checked the orientation of the door sensor.  Luckily, I have a camera I can check to see where the door is, because I don't really trust the MyQ...Also, I had to replace the door sensor battery immediately upon installation, because it was too week to complete the 6 beep test (read the instructions).

Integration with Google assistant does not allow opening of the garage.  It will let you close it, or check on status - but not open.  Same for scheduling from within the app - you can only set a schedule to close it - which is just about useless.  Overall, I consider it an almost complete waste of money.To be fair, the installation was a breeze, it paired with my 1994 model Liftmaster on the first try. The few things it allows you to do it does reliably.

Not sure WHY I had to reset occasionally, but sometimes I get a message on the app stating it is no longer paired to the unit.  Resetting is simple, but it entails getting a ladder and being in the garage with my phone to do so.  This means I would lose the ability to monitor/control the garage doors if I were away from the property, which was a big factor in purchasing.  The other factor was the CLOSE ON SCHEDULE option offered by the app.  My husband forgets to close the door at night, and I am able to set both doors to close at 10 PM if they are not already closed.  Awesome.  This feature did require the purchase of an additional module ($40).

Got mine in and found the installation a breeze right up to the last step of mating it to the opener motor.  It just wouldn’t do it!  Checked the instructions, tried over and over and it just wouldn’t mate up.  Since the garage was really hot I decided to heck with it and stopped trying.Next day I started early morning before the heat set in, tried the linking to the opener motor and it worked just as it was supposed to!  Darned if I know why and since in the end it works as advertised, I’m not sure I care.
In this situation it is nor probably, it is definitely a junk.I did not do some research before baying this stuff, counting on Amazon rating and it was a huge mistake.

Quick and easy to pair with wifi and phones. Simple to hang. Worked on the first try.  Hung it on a wall instead of the ceiling close to the opener motor.  Phone app is basic and simple to use.  UPDATE:  The unit has been in service about 6 months.  It does a great job opening and closing the door from my phone, which is why I bought it.  Notifications are another matter.  I have had notification delays of up to 30 min.  That would be critical if/when the door opening is unexpected or accidental.  As a work around I installed an alarm on the door between the garage and the house.
While I was able to install and connect it to my Garage door opener without any major issues, it really went downhill from there.Here is a short list of issues with the system:

The installation was easy. My garage opener is Chamberlain that I purchased in 2010. So there's no brainer there.But this remote garage opener works intermittently. It seems that if it is not used frequently (which happens a lot, since there are other remotes available for my garage door), then it can't perform the remote well. It also seems that it has more problem with closing the garage door vs opening it, which is weird (I presume closing it should have less problem, since there's no need to authenticate the message).

Finally installed it last week and it works perfectly. Took me about 30 min to put it together. Very easy to install. I love it and now the notifications helps me a lot if/when in forget to close the garage door. We don’t have amazon garage or in-house delivery available yet in our area but hopefully soon.Having a remote keypad to open/close migh seem like a redundant effort but I think it has more uses than the keypad. You don’t have to give out your garage keypad code to anyone anymore. The notifications definitely help out with securing your property

This took several hours to install. Then our garage door started opening on its own, around 6 at night and 6 in the morning. It would say it was open on the app, but when you got home it was not. Our garage door opener is a Chamberlin, the same as this brand. I emailed customer service and it took them two days to tell me they needed my garage door opener model before they were able to help. This is cheap for a reason.

It is rare that I review a product, but this one is worth a review because it has such potential that its failure to reach it is notable.I installed a Chamberlain myQ garage door integration system in my garage about a month ago. I have two tracked garage doors and I found the overall installation process to be simple. It suggests that you mount the base unit, though I have opted not to mount mine (and to the extent that I was able to get the app to work, it worked fine unmounted).

I was looking for garage remote control system that I can close and open anywhere, and this is the perfect product. I can open it at work or anywhere if I need to, and I have Arlo camera in the garage, so could check whether it's really working. IT WORKS!!!!!  One thing was original garage remote doesn't work after I paired this with my phone app but my husband car remote system is still working. Mine was actual remote control, and my husband is using car remote system. I don't know why it's not working with original remote control. I love it's scheduling function as well, since my kids sometimes open the garage and forget to close it, but now no worries.

Works great with my Chamberlain garage door.  Runs from the cloud with your 2.4 Ghz wifi. The iPhone and Android downloadable app provides any functionality that I want. Open, close, schedule, and and it keeps log entries of past operations. Don't expect it to run it wit Zigbee or Z-Wave. For a buck a month, you can pair it up with Alexa using IFTT, but I did not do that and very happy with it straight out of the box. I can open and close the door and get notifications locally and while out and about. A great starter for people who want to know if they like home automation. For 48 bucks, what do you want. Highly recommend.  - jwrit Boulder Co

I thought with the way the description was written that it was Alexa ready. It is not. I do like the device in that it was fairly easy to install and the remote app on the phone is fair. However, I don't think it really wouldn't take much for programmers to add this device onto the Alexa platform. Then I could use my auto Alexa to open my garage. I also did not like how loud the warning sound is when closing the door. It is a bit excessive. I have it in an enclosed tub and I can still hear it way too loud. I am hoping that they can add this to the Alexa platform. I would definitely change my rating to a five star then.

Great idea but the reality is very poorly executed. I have been locked out of my home multiple times while the app fails to load or the Internet connection seems unstable. To use this product you must first launch the app on your phone and hope it loads correctly login and wait for it to recognize your password wait for the Internet connection to be transmitted back-and-forth wait for the opener to connect to the Internet and receive the signal and many times something in that situation fails to work properly and you can spend 5 to 10 minutes waiting to get into your home sometimes unsuccessfully

This is a functional device with crippled software application.  They advertise Google and IFTTT compatibility (*super fine print) with a Subscription fee, didn't see that before I bought it.  Who does that in today's economy?  Fine, I will pay you the $1/month or $10/ year to get integration with my Google Home..... but wait, Google Assistant, not Home.  What is the difference you ask?  Instead of saying  the intuitive "Hey Google, close the Garage Door" I have to use the the less intuitive service "Hey Google ask MyQ to close the Garage Door" not that big of a deal.  BUT WAIT!  It can't open or close the garage door..... by design?????  It can tell me if the door is open (like my eyeballs) but it can't open or close the door via Google Home.  I can open the App and press the button in the App, but honestly, unless I am in bed, isn't it easier to just hit the button on the wall at that point? Then why two stars and not one?  Using the App, I can set a the door to close on a schedule.

I had high hopes for this product - it has generally good reviews and I’ve had strong experiences with other Chamberlain products. After a very frustrating setup process (involving difficulties with getting connected to WiFi and reaching the limit of # of connected remotes for my garage door opener) it mostly works, but it isn’t 100% reliable, occasionally disconnecting from our WiFi network (despite me verifying a strong signal in the garage). I’m not comfortable counting on it for Amazon Key delivery.Additionally, app control through Google Home does NOT work as conveniently as other smart products. You can’t just say, “Hey Google, open the garage door” - you have to follow a specific syntax to talk to the MyQ service through Google. Plus, you CANNOT open your garage door via Google Home. You can only close it or ask for the status. Why???

This product is not ready for prime time.  Google all the issues people have with this.  I ran into something many people posted, where it gets an error talking to the device.  They tried to be too fancy, determining if the garage door is up or down and not doing it right.  It thinks it’s down when it’s up.  Then you can’t reset it remotely.  I bought this thinking Amazon garage deliveries would be useful but I have no confidence in this thing working right.  I had to tell the Amazon delivery person on the last order how to close the garage with the button on the wall instead of this device.  I do not recommend.

The app and install went smooth.  The only reason for 3 stars is their Learn color coding for my Liftmaster door was not correct and linking two doors was not easy.  The learn button is orange and it would not link to the hub.  After trying it 10 times I started hitting the other color options on the app and sure enough purple linked the first time.  Other than that the app and door notifications have been great.  I also linked two doors to one hub.  I had to watch a YouTube because it wasn’t intuitive enough for me to figure it out.It also does not work with Alexa.  Not a show stopper but would be nice.

2 door garage.  Installation on the first door took many tries, but every controller has that problem with that door.  Wound up holding the button too long and cleared all remotes.  Opener light blinked, but didn’t link many times. Finally everything clicked and it worked. Second door worked first try.Seems reliable now.  Biggest problem is the only Amazon Echo function available is the package delivery option.  Unable to even ask the open / closed state of the door.  Several 3 d party apps supposed to work, but the components didn’t exist at the advertised sites.

Works great for my Genie Garage door. Way to install. The instructions are not very clear wrt every Garage opener model. Got to figure out for your specific type; i was about to return it when I accidentally found how to get it working.Pros: works great once you figure out

Just bought and installed the MyQ device (11/2019). I had some initial difficulty getting it to pair with my older Liftmaster opener but reset everything and it now seems to work perfectly. Installed a second sensor on my smaller door.I'm fortunate to live in a neighborhood where my kind neighbors have let me know when my door is open and they've even closed it for us in the past when we weren't home. But the MyQ device and app certainly add a level of security knowing I can check and close the door from anywhere. I've also scheduled it to go down in the evening in case I end up going to bed without checking it.

This product was a absolute headache the second I got it. Took a few hours to get set up because it wasn't pairing with my Craftsman garage door opener. Once I finally got it to work it only managed to work for 2 days until the app decided to delete the hub. Trying to go back through the steps to relearn the hub it would open the garage door and close it 2 times and still manage to somehow say it failed to pair. I then decided to do their support chat where whomever I was talking to started out professional. He then asked me for my password to try to add the hub manually from his end, I obviously declined to give him my password because that is terrible practice. Before I was able to to send him anything back after declining to give him my password he took it upon himself to abruptly end the chat. After this little exchange I decided to return the product and give this review. stay way from this. There are probably better options for a little bit more money

I bought this because I had been looking into a way to allow access into my garage remotely since My wife and I don’t always carry our keys with us. This offered an affordable solution that worked with current garage door. The setup was pretty understandable in the instructions but it took a few times to get it to sync properly. The phone app works every time but I try to use it frequently with my Apple Watch and it only works about 50% of the time getting stuck loading causing me to wait about 2-3 minutes before the app finally times out. Overall I like it though and it does what it is intended to do well.

I viewed the how to install video on the company website, followed instructions in the app and had it installed in about 10 minutes. Basically, this is a remote control operated via the internet. It does not interfere with the HomeLink in my car. Most of the time I’ll use my car HomeLink. This device is for the “did I forget to close the garage door” moment. The app will tell me and I can close it from my phone. Nice! Unfortunately, it does not integrate with Alexa. BTW I also have a Wyze camera in the garage ($26) so I can see the garage door from the app on my phone. Great little cam that records anyone entering the garage.
Pros: Straightforward installation.Works with Linear opener.

Warning: If you have two garage doors, you DO NOT have to install two hubs. You still have to order two hubs so you can get the second door sensor that tells whether your door is open or closed, but you won't actually be installing the second hub part as one will control both doors. The app will actually walk you through the correct steps for one door, and then ask you if you have a second door as well. I got confused and closed the app because I thought it was screwing up by having me install both doors to one hub. Luckily the app was robust enough to allow me to fix my panicked screw-up.

I don't know why I didn't buy this earlier.  I have a remote keypad for 1 garage and was going to buy another for my other garage then realized this was cheaper and a no brainer. I only have 1 original remote for each garage and was always looking for one. Very easy to install. Download the app first and follow the easy directions and videos. I think it took me 15 minutes. Now, no remotes needed, just a tap of the button on the app. You can open and close the door wherever you are and set up alerts if door is opened or closed even if someone is not using the app. I know it has alexa control and can give permission for prime delivery but I have not used those features yet.

I bought this from Amazon. It was easy to install, etc, as mentioned in the headline. I was receiving notifications whenever the door was operated. However, I could not get it to sync to my phone so I could operate the door remotely. I called customer service, spoke to a friendly and knowledgeable person. She asked for the hub's serial number and the model number of my Genie opener and determined the hub was not compatible. She shipped a new one ASAP at N/C. I hooked it up and it now works perfectly.I highly recommend the product!

Installation was easy if you follow the prompts in the app. Using with a linear garage door opener. I’ve not experienced any issues like others saying the door was open when it was closed or saying closed when it’s open. I’ve had to reset the sensor several times because it’s throwing a sensor error in the app. Just simply press the reset button and it comes right back online. I love that my entire family has a garage door opener on their phone now, you can add up to 5 family members in the app. I purchased during Prime Day for $29.99 and it’s been worth it. I wouldn’t recommend for full price of $49.99. Buy it on sale and it will make a great addition for your household.

This was VERY easy to install.  I looked at different options but didn't like the description of the install methods of the others.  This one provided much easier install.  This product has a subscription in order to fully integrate with certain smart home devices.  I did find that if I said "hey google" on my smartphone and told it to open the garage and my phone opened the MyQ app.  This was without any premium charge.  HOWEVER I have not tested the option with my Google home speakers or displays.  I believe this is where the premium charge would be required.I bought this on Prime day for $29.99, a total STEAL in my opinion.

Overall the product is working as advertised. I'd give it 5 stars, however it took over two hours to get it working and Chamberlain support was no help. The issue was the Hub and the Sensor would not pair. They kept trying to troubleshoot pairing between the hub and garage door opener. Google search revealed an article that directed me to reset/clear channels 1 and 2 the power cycle the hub. After that I was able to use the app to pair the Hub/Sensor. Everything else went smoothly.It would also be nice if we had the option to either turn off the alarm or set the interval as to how long it sounds when the door is closed remotely via the app.

Awesome product, works exactly as described.  My one gripe is that the wifi instructions aren't very clear and took me a while to figure out.  Despite that, I gave the product 5 stars because once setup it works extremely well.  I have been using mine for a couple of months now and it has worked perfectly.  I love being able to check on my phone whether I remembered to close the garage door, and to shut it if I forgot!

I had some trouble at first getting it to work, but they did an update and it linked up to my opener easily after that.  I have noticed that the history seems to be about when the app was used to open and close the door rather than when the door itself was actually opened.  If you have 2 Garage Doors, buy the extra sensor so you can use it to open either door.  You can name the doors anyway you want so it is easy to know which one you open.  I like the guest function if someone else needs in. There is a visual and audible alert that sounds for quite awhile before the door starts to close, and then you have to allow time for it to actually close and for the communications to update over the internet. Be sure to allow plenty of time for the door to open or close

Bought this on sale.  Setup was extremely easy.  Others note some difficulty and I'm guessing they struggle with tech.  You can skip reading the paper instructions and just open the app.  It will guide you step by step.The reason for 3 stars:. No Android widget.  The app takes a few seconds to get you to the open and close screen.  They charge for integration.

First, I have three garage doors.  Maybe it was poor research on my part, or bad documentation on the vendors part;  This product only supports 2 sensors.  If you want a third sensor, you need another hub.Second, the sensors kept getting an "unknown" error, and then disconnecting from the hub.  It would require me to repair the devices.  I have had to do that about 3 times within the first month.  When you're using this as part of your security, reliability is essential and this product isn't reliable.

The concept is good, but the software has some quirks. It’s happened twice that the sensor had an error and the entire system wiped itself. So when I checked my phone, there were no garage doors installed anymore and I had to reset up everything. Also, there is a flashing alarm and beeeping noise that goes off before the garage closes. Cool safety feature, but it’s very annoying especially because it beeps for almost a minute even after the garage door is fully closed. It’s loud and there’s no way to decrease the time. Not sure why it doesn’t stop once it’s closed. The software in general is okay. Would be nice to have a quick shortcut or easier way to open  and close the garage door instead of having to sign into the app each time.

I left home and came back to my garage being left open one time and I decided to get a Wifi device for my garage so I know if it is left open and can close it remotely.
