This was on sale for $20 during Black Friday and it was a no brainer to buy.Super easy to install. Plug in the hub, sync it through the smartphone app and connect to your wifi network. Install the sensor on the garage door as instructed and pair it to the opener. Very simple to install, even easier to use the app. Now I get notifications when the door is opened and closed, provides great peace of mind.

I am med-high tech savvy. MyQ worked fine with ATT UVERSE router, once I replaced with a new Orbi Mesh, it cannot connect to the wifi. I tried all the magic tricks in the internet (disable 5.0ghz, moved close to router etc'), nothing.I have over 10 other wifi devices in my home, IOT plugs, speakers, water irrigation.. all works. this MyQ after 2 weeks still not. Support doesn't do much than repeat what I already did. Sorry, but if your product can't make a connection work, you should not be making this product. RELIABILITY AND EASE OF USE... I wish can I return and get a more expensive working device.

Good step-by-step instruction and made it work in about an hour.  It gave us the peace of mind that my wife will not need to ask me to drive back to check if our garage door is closed:-)A couple of notes for future users:

I wanted to control my garage door remotely.  This was easy to install much like you would adding another garage door remote.  You use your garage opener's learn button to scan for the MyQ opener.  Once it's added, you can see the current status of your door if it's open or closed.  It opens pretty fast, but closing takes a long time because it requires it to flash some lights and beep a bunch or time to warn that the door is about to close.  There's a service fee to add google home / alexa capability, but if you have a Smartthings hub, you can add that and do it for free.  Doesn't cost you anything if you just want to control the door using their app.

I like the smart garage door opener. It gives us peave of mind when we have left the house that our garage door is closed.  There is a delay when getting the alert on my smart phone of the garage opening and closing.  Amazon attempted to make a delivery while I was out of town and there was an issue with the smart system making the garage door go down. The delivery person would not go into the garage and hit the manual button to reset the smart system or respond to be via security camera. It timed out due to multiple attempts by the delivery person. It was very frustrating and I have decided to not use it for Amazon deliveries if I'm out of town.

This works great with the app on both the iPhone and Apple Watch for opening and closing the door once it is installed. I’m pretty tech savvy and I had a hard time getting it to connect to an existing lift master garage door opener. To install and connect you use the app and it guides you through. However my jack bolt style garage door opener was not in the list of openers to connect to so the my Q device wouldn’t connect. After an hour of trial and error I finally got the right combination and it has worked flawlessly since. App was worthless to solve the problem as were online instructions.

I have been in the Garage door Business for 30+ years. The idea behind this is great. Sadly this does not always work and that was a big issue with my wife. Sometimes it will only open the door 2' and stop. The door works perfectly when I remove the unit so I know it is not the door. Or the opener. I believe Chamberlain and Liftmaster have the best openers but their support for this has been worthless. On hold for over 30 min to get we do not know or the door is not working properly is just not acceptable. Buy at your own risk!

Obviously the ability to check your garage door from anywhere a cell or wifi signal is available is the #1 advantage of this device. My only frustration came during installation, having an older Craftsman door opener with a model number unknown to the Chamberlain web site. So discovering the correct coding for the device to work with my opener was tedious. Beyond that, the device works very well and I'm happy to have purchased it.

1st off, I'm not handy. Right off, I did not have a wall mount control as was pictured in the manual, but pretty close. I found one online to see how it was paired. OK! Got that done. When I tried to key the router password for the myq, my keyboard blocked  the box. I couldn't see what I was typing. A little frustrating. So it took a couple o' tries. But I got it! Ok, my fault, I know. Then I only saw part of the installation video. It just stopped. Luckily, the manual is EZ to follow. So I got 'er done. And my wife and I LOVE it. Can't tell yas how  many  times we were going somewhere and had to turn around and make sure the door was down.

I was skeptical when reading some of the negative reviews whether or not to order this product, but I figured with the Chamberlain name, I ordered it. I had this installed and running in less than 20 minutes, it was simple and the set up guide in the phone application was more than helpful. I had the hub connected and the door sensor paired in no time. The hub paired to my Craftsman opener the 1st time. I LOVE that I can see the status of my door, and the fact that I can set up a daily schedule to close the door at 8:30pm. The notifications are handy as is the history of openings and closings. I am really happy I bought this product, 10 stars from me.

The device is quite small, the main hub is not much larger than a hockey puck maybe 4"x4" and the door sensor is maybe 2x2. The door sensor sticks to the door with Velcro, the hub to the wall or ceiling with two screws through a mount plate. Took about 10 minutes to install following the on screen steps from the app. Proceeded to install the app on the kids' phones, and all work just fine. You link the hub to the door opener by pushing the link button on the opener, and mount it. It acts like any remote, except it's connected to your WiFi and the internet, and then to your phone via the app.

Wonderful product, was ordered, shipped and received promptly.  Installed hardware, and two remotes to two garage doors in less than one hour, including time to hunt down ladder and tools.  Installation instructions contained on app were clearly written, easy to understand and follow.  Only drawback in my case is the fact I ordered these so that I could receive my packages from Amazon with their Key App.  Unfortunate to find out it is currently unavailable in my area.  Also have not been able to integrate into Google Home Hub, but works fine independently with App.  No regrets though, it is a good app to inform if garage doors are operated.

thought was pricey when bought but well worth the money; mainly wanted for ensuring garage doors were closed after a forgetful opening of the door and needed for the second door.  the app tells me the status and I have no problems with the use of app; compatible with IFTTT and WINK with other services.  allows me peace of mind and the ability to open for early family arrivals as well as package deliveries.  works with hub as described in website description.

This is the dumbest smart home product I’ve ever had.  I had to reset this thing at least once a day for the first 3 days I had it setup.  I’m guessing if the Wi-Fi goes out you have to reset it and if the power goes out you have to reset it.  Every time he reset it you have to reset the entire thing.  The set up process is defective and doesn’t work well with iPhones.  When it does work I do like it  and I’m not ready to quit on it yet.

It was a very easy setup for the hub and even easier for the app for our phones.  Only issue is with Alexa to open and close the garage door.  You have to install IFTTT and connect to Alexa.  However, you can only close the garage door, not open with Alexa (something about not allowed because of safety issues).  We no longer have to worry about leaving our garage door open plus when we travel, we are notified when someone access the garage door.  Very cheap way to be able to monitor, open and close your garage door from anywhere in the world.  BTW, there is NO subscription fees for now for using IFTTT or Google Assistance (changed June 26, 2019).

Installation process is “ok” but been on with tech support 3x already.  Device gets “glitch” - a word the techs use.  Tech support generally is a re-installation.  Link with Amazon Key was easy - but when delivery team can’t get Q Hub to close the garage door - less than effective.  Generally seems like there is interference from either opener or LED lights that is corrupting functionality.My understanding from tech support is the that Q Hub will no longer connect to Alexa.  So no asking Alexa to open/close garage door (or ask her if it’s open).

I have had nothing but inconsistent performance since installing a week ago. Door sensors don't stay paired, and the app periodically doesn't show the correct state of the door, or gives no indication at all if the door opens or closes. I have no confidence that this product is accurately telling me if the door is open or closed, or that 8 have the ability to close it, or know that it's closed if I am away from home. Often it operates properly, but invariably in the morning one of the sensors will not be paired and I have to start the process over. If it happens to lose hub connection when I'm out of town, I would have no way of re-pairing the sensor. I can't believe the product can be this bad. Troubleshooting steps on the website so far hasn't been helpful and the phone support, though good, has only been able to help re-pairing the sensor, but can't solve the subsequent loss of connection that periodically occurs. I'm happy to edit this review when and if I get this resolved, but at this point would definitely not recommend it.
Was a pain to install. Had to retry it multiple times to get it working.The remote opening/closing is unreliable.

Do not rely on this as an alternative entry tool. Constantly and usually at the worst time possible goes completely unresponsive when trying to open the door. Went on a walk and used the app to close the door (no issues here) so I wouldn't have to hassle with locking doors. I realized I had forgotten my keys inside but didn't worry about it since myQ seemed to be a suitable alternative. On my return however I spent over an hour stuck outside my residence with no way back in to the point I had to seek assistance from a friend. Other times I used it as a way for relatives to come by without needing a key where they met a similar fate to mine.In the end, 2 stars for the few times the app would work but only when the regular remote was in grasp. Horribly unreliable.

The install was really annoying. I had to restart the multiple times on my phone. And every time you restart you have to flash the device. I couldn't get it to pair to my garage door opener at all. Literally tried for hours. Looking around yieled that you could pair it outside the app via button combos. We did that and during the pairing phase in the app it opened and closed the garage but the displayed a failed to pair dialogue. Very frustrating. Finally got it to work after several restarts. For some reason it unpaired all my garage remotes. The ceiling mount is hard to drill and unessecary. The device is light, you can mount via command strips.

I have a 2001 model opener not specifically mentioned in their support statement.  I half expected that this product wouldn’t support my opener, but for the price, took a chance.  It paired very easily by locating the learning button on your motor.  Mine only had one button, so the choice was easy.  The only part that took any time was picking the mounting location and drilling the holes.It does beep continuously to warn you when it is about to open and close and during the process.  It is pretty loud and continues to been even after it is fully open/closed, maybe 15 seconds after.  Not a big deal.  Just slightly annoying.

I like it.  It's simple.  It was very easy to install and setup.  The MyQ app appears to do the basics you'd want it to: you can open/close the door remotely and you can create a schedule that will tell the door to close at a certain time if it is not yet closed.  However, there is no Alexa integration.  This is surprising since it allows AmazonKey integration.  You cannot, therefore, include it as part of an Alexa Routine.  For some, this might be a bummer -- especially if you like all of your devices under one roof.  However, this will likely not be an extremely sad thing for most.

No matter how close you work away from home, this is the best thing. I've been anywhere from 20 minutes to over 1 hour & 1/2 away and can open my garage door when I receive packages, or just check that I did close it in a rush to leave.  Installation is relatively easy did have to call support for assistance in getting linked in but they were great & professional & had me solved in a matter of minutes.  Seriously people end the question did I close the garage door, and worrying about when packages are delivered if someone is going to steel.  Best thing ever.  It does work with Amazon Key, however Key was not available in my area

I don't write reviews often but felt one was warranted for this product. Setup was inconsistent and flaky. I ended up going through the setup process four times before one of two doors was connected. I moved to the second door and got the error message that I had too many doors installed on this hub. I looked on Chamberlain's site and saw other having this issue. I tried several steps others had mentioned, factory resetting the hub, uninstalling the app from my phone, uninstalling the door sensors from the app, etc and nothing worked. Someone on Chamberlain's site indicated that the techs even had them unscrew their light bulbs from the opener (I hope they were making this up but somehow feel they weren't). After going through another factor reset, I finally ended up changing the name of the hub on my app and both sensors were picked up. As I went to program the second door, the hub synced to the door just fine, but then both doors were controlled at the same time. I then followed more instructions online, resetting the rolling code, re-pairing all of my openers, factory resetting the hub again, re-pairing all of the doors, and still the hub controlled both doors simultaneously and not independently. I have two seven year old Chamberlain garage door openers with multiple handheld Chamberlain garage door remotes, a Chamberlain keypad for exterior use, and two car home hubs all paired with the garage doors and operating each independently. You would think this Chamberlain product would pair to their  openers without  issues but I’m not finding that is the case.

I have a garage door motor which is not wi-fi compatible. This is a perfect, affordable solution. I use it all of the time. If you follow the directions, it works exactly as designed. I love getting notifications when my garage door is opened or closed. At anytime, using my phone, I can see my garage door status, how long it's been opened or closed.. from anywhere I have internet connection. Being able to use Amazon Key has been a game changer for me as well. I'm immediately notified when a delivery person opens my garage door and no more worries about packages sitting on my porch!For the price, this is an excellent product!!
Easy to install.Basic function device...

Has been working perfectly for months, I like the fast response even when using mobile app.  Open and close alerts are instantaneous too. And I like the scheduled closed at night for safety and it tells you the current status of the door being close or open.  But integration with Google Home requires another subscription (Google Assistance?) which i think was free but changed to subscription,  so I don't think it's a necessary feature I need so skipped that.  The rest of features works fine for me.

I initially bought this to allow for amazon in-garage deliveries. It seems to work for that, but only works about maybe a third of the time when I try to use the IPhone app. The app almost always errors out when trying to open the door.I also use it with my apple watch 4 and it has the same results. I am surprised when it does work!

It took 15’ to install, very simple. And it’s been working as expected for a week now (I did some different test scenarios initially as well). A minor complaint is that it enables you to set an alarm if the garage door remains open for, say, 15’ during night time, and this would send you a notification but would not let you set an action to close the garage door. You can only schedule to close at specific time but not upon a triggered alarm. So instead, I have to schedule a door closing every 30’ during night time (10+ schedules). I hope they’ll update the software to enable this feature in the near future (it’s connected to wifi so that’s possible, isn’t it?)

After being interested in an alternative way to open my garage door, I learned about this Smart Hub system.  When it went on sale, I was ready to buy.  Although uncertain how complex the installation and/or setup might be, I am very pleased to relate to you that it was as simple as following step by step directions and completed in about a half-hour.  Much of that time was dragging out a tall enough ladder.  An available YouTube video makes it even easier as you follow along.  I have yet to explore all my options such as Alexa integration and an extra module for a second door, but I am very happy with this for now.

This is the easiest thing I’ve installed in my house. I just got the Amazon key hooked up and im getting packages delivered in my Garage. Literally anyone can do it. Instructions are super easy and ig has no problems syncing. I drilled it up right above my garage door opener and it doesn’t fail. It does have a little lag in the app when opening and closing the door but it doesn’t bother me enough to not buy another one of these. I’m sure a developer is working on an update for this somewhere with the next update.

I like this device. It was straightforward to install and to operate. Their youtube and app instructions are easy to follow. I had to call their helpline because I was having an issue syncronizing the hub with my garage door opener, but the problem was that I was unable to recognize the right color on the synchronization button. The person from the helpdesk was really nice and quickly help me to correct my own problem. I don't  know what people are expecting to do with this device but for me checking remotely if the garage door was open or close and being able to open or close remotely and it has been doing a great job for me.

Selecting 1 star to get frustrated buyers to find a solution.  But also because they should have been more clear on instructions and not cost me hours of my life trying to pair.After hours of trying to figure out how to pair to Liftmaster 8500 (and possibly any Liftmaster after 2004), I finally figured it out.  Surprised there wasn’t anything to be found online.  When pairing you select your garage door manufacturer as Security+ 2.0 (not Liftmaster).  Security 2.0+ is really the sub-name and model of later Liftmasters, despite not being written anywhere on the device itself.  You also select the Yellow button.  If you have a wall switch with the MyQ image, instead of pushing the learn button on the garage door opener itself, you double tap the learn button on the switch.

This is a great little device, and for $20 or $30, impossible to beat.  It's easy to install and quickly programs itself to open and close the garage door.  You can program it through the app to make sure your doors are closed at night, for example, which provides peace of mind when you go to bed. The only knock on the product is that to get it to work with Siri, you need an expensive bridge device.  Highly recommended.

I ordered the hub and one additional door sensor (the hub came with one sensor) so that I could operate two doors at my house.  The setup was easy; connecting the hub first to my WiFi, then to the sensors, and finally to the garage door opener.  I added the app to my wife's smartphone and now both of us use this as our primary opener for either door.  All of this took under 30 minutes.  I currently have the app set to notify me whenever the door opens or closes, which may eventually become too much, but for now, I like knowing that it is working.This has been the solution we were looking for, and the price was by far better than any other options we considered.

Our garage is on the back of our house. I wanted a way to monitor, open and close my garage door at anytime from anywhere. The MyQ was affordable and pretty easy to install. I could setup alerts to notify me when my garage door opens or closes and if it’s been left open for a set amount of time.But, that’s where the good ends. Using my iPhone or Apple Watch to open my garage is only successful about 30-40% of the time. It just spins and/or tells me my hub is not responding. Once it’s open it works to close it. But what good is that once I’m inside?  My hope was to utilize this to gain access to my garage without my remote should I come from the back of the house. But it’s so unreliable that I’m afraid to even use it because I’ll get left out in the cold.

Once properly installed and configured it works well, but be prepared for a rocky road ride before that.I have an "Overhead Door" opener from sometime between 1996-2016, which should be compatible. However the documented configuration process does not accurately describe the required steps for pairing with this type of opener. Luckily I had previous experience with HomeLink controllers in my cars, so I kind of guessed what might be the correct process. It involves using the original clicker and turning off the "code dodger" mode for the learn process.

This was probably the easiest product to install ever. Great software assist and I had no problems setting up and using with my iPhone 11p. Used my phone to make sure I had sufficient  WiFi signal at mounting location. Got it for my Amazon deliveries and emergencies so its serving its purpose. As other review said, it would be nice to have additional background information on how it works. Also I mistakenly hit the LOCK button on my wall mount garage door opener(didn’t know it had a Lock function) and spent a half hour troubleshooting before I saw my error:)

Installation was easy but there seems to be some issues with the sensor or the myQ app. I paired it with the app and set it up to send an alert if the door remains open for 30 minutes. I consistently get false alerts, i.e. app says the door is open when it is actually closed. Not good since I could inadvertently leave the door open all day thinking that I’m closing it!! I ended up moving one of my Arlo cameras to the garage so I could verify whether the door is really open. Now I mostly ignore the app alerts and sometimes use my camera to verify that the door is closed.Quite disappointed with the device due to this issue since the main reason I bought it was to ensure I knew the door status remotely.

I had a terrible time trying to get this to work before I decided it wasn't reliable enough to keep. I moved the hub and sensor around in many different places, but it would connect sometimes, mostly not, then open, but wouldn't shut, then make me reconnect. It was really frustrating.I called customer service for help, but the girl on the phone sounded way more annoyed than I was - I guess from dealing with problems like this all day. She kept blaming different stuff like a weak WiFi signal (which it wasn't) and then telling me I had to move the sensor a little more to the right or I had to get the hub 2 feet closer to the opener. Ridiculous stuff that I still tried but could never get it to work like it should.

I went to the website, and there it claims that product works with Overhead Door openers manufactures after 1996. It was not until I went through the whole installation process that the app told me it needed to be openers using a specific technology. Lo and behold, my opener did not use such technology, and I got a message that I could use the product to ensure my garage door was open. What a joke. Wasted almost one hour of my day because of their lazy website that didn't include all information necessary.

I bought this hub for my existing Chamberlain garage door opener. Installation and setup was easy, there were videos to show you how to install each step. The app works well independently. I gave it 5 stars so far because I haven’t had any issues with functionality at all. I even after added it to my homebridge to allow it to work via HomeKit, and it works extremely well. Having notifications for when the garage opens or closes which is great for people with young kids that like to press buttons.

Install went off without a hitch. Make sure to follow the instructions to the letter. Watch the video on youtube. The link provided in the info takes you to an advert page. Seems like the link has been hijacked.Just go to the Chamberlain site and look for the link to the MyQ Setup.. Also, install the app on the phone. It has links to install instructions with helpful videos. YOu can connect the hub to your network be for mounting.

I already have OverHead Door OHD anywhere internet controller but purchased this to use Amazon "KEY" delivery.  It works seamlessly with my OHD controller.  OHD actually uses contacts to open/close the garage door.  Chamberlain MyQ uses RF like the car opener or pocket opener.  It alarms and flashes a light before moving up or down.  I do get notification on my phone when it is used.  I have had 3 deliveries made using MyQ.  I put a mat on the garage floor for the packages and I found them everywhere but on the mat.  I made a sign "Please place packages here" and taped it to the mat.  The latest delivery did place it on the mat.

This thing is garbage, very bad WiFi range had to buy an extender just to use. Never worked correctly, and the safety beep it uses when operating is deafening even after trying to cover the speaker. It would only open my door but would never close and because it wouldn't close it beeps it's ear breaking beeps until it eventually times out which is like a min of pure hell. I'm not kidding I would literally unplug it just to make it stop. Do not waste your money. I returned this and bought the Nexx nxg-200  which exceeded my expectations and has the WiFi range to work without my extender that now apparently I wasted money on because of this piece of garbage.  If you do want to try this thank God Amazon does have a great return policy.
I liked the no nonsense, straight forward instructions on the MYQ thru my Smartphone.The only problems I had with installation were:

This was the peace of mind I needed! Did I close the garage door? Lemme whip out my phone and check! Hardest part of installation was figuring out which method of pairing my garage motor to the sensor unit I needed to use. In the end I just tried them all until it worked. The one that did the trick was Liftmaster with the yellow button even though mine has a red button. Either way, now that it’s working it’s been bulletproof! Well worth the money and time spent on install

As a techy guy I didn’t sync it up with Alexa or Google assistant just for security reasons. You really don’t need to order Alexa to close your garage door. The installation is pretty simple. You only need a drill, a screwdriver, and a ladder. The sync process with your garage door could be tricky, do not press the purple button before the app tells you to or you will need to repeat the process a few times. Other than that works perfect and it will give a piece of mind to know your door is closed when you are not home.

This performs as expected. Set-up initially did not go as easy as expected. Company was in process of pushing out an update and were having problems. As such at the time I installed it required a call to their tech support to complete install as they had to work around issue. I have had this installed for several months now. Works very well. I have this installed on both of my garage doors. Definitely makes closing door easier and you can definitely teelif you left the door open. Also great for allowing the plumber or electrician in while you are somewhere else.

The only plus is that this is easy to install. I’d read a lot of good reviews but I’m disappointed in the opener. The app takes forever to load and I have to log in each time to close the garage door. Then it doesn’t update properly and says that the garage door is open when it’s really closed. Also I can no longer use the remotes that came with my garage door which is part of the reason I got this in the first place as I wanted to give my remote to my babysitter and then still be able to close the door with my phone. Overall  I wouldn’t buy this again.

My wife and I have separate Amazon accounts but only one garage.  We bought this so we could both use it to have packages delivered to our garage when we are out of town.  The garage door control works perfectly, but not so much when you try to link it to your Amazon Key account.  What Amazon fails to warn you about is a restriction they have in the Key app that only one amazon account can be linked to the garage door control.  That means that only one of us can use the garage delivery feature when ordering from amazon.  The fix is simple, just allow accounts that are linked through household sharing to both use the Amazon Key app for package deliveries.  Hopefully they will make this change in the app.  Otherwise, just be aware that you will have to purchase and install one of these devices for every  amazon account you want to use it with.

For starters, this is super easy to install and works perfectly!! The only issue I have is that there is no way to connect it to Alexa as of yet. If this changes in the future, then I will update this review. I purchased this to allow Amazon to deliver to my garage, but Amazon logistics won't follow any of my delivery instructions, so I hope everyone else has better luck!!

I’ve actually had this product almost a month and I was about to send it back but I called their 800 number and the lady was wonderful She was on the phone with me for over an hour and made sure that it was up and running I actually love this product don’t need a house key anymore each of my children have downloaded it to their phone so that they can get in and out of the house but I’m actually loving this product it tells me when it’s open how long it’s been open how long it’s been closed so I’m definitely glad I picked up this deal awesome product

This thing is just not too reliable. It will work fine for a couple weeks or months and then it will stop registering when it's open and closed. Went out on bought new batteries for the sensor and everything, but no luck. Talked to support and reset everything. Worked for a few weeks and stopped working again. What I usually do now is just hit the button on the sensor and that like re-syncs it and it will start working....but just for a few weeks.It's pretty annoying. I suggest to spend a little more and get one you can trust.

I paid 30 bucks for this and all I wanted was something I could open and close my garage remotely with.  The best part about this is Amazon can deliver inside of your garage where your stuff is safe from thieves.  Alexa integration sucks and IFTTT intigration is ok if you like to leave locations on all the time on your phone.  I wish you could remotely open it when you got close to home but I can see why that would be a security risk.  30 bucks, worth it, any more I dont think so.  at least the subscriptions are free right now but I dont know for how long

This worked to replace my Craftsman Model 139.3043 with Assurelink (Yellow Learn Button).  5 months ago the App quit working for the Wifi system I bought in 2010 and it was driving me crazy not being able control garage remotely and check status. The install took less than 30 minutes most of it was deciding where to place the new controller and drilling. We had no issues...the Mobile App was clear and easy to follow. I wish I would have bought it 5 months ago!

The myQ Garage Door Opener is a great investment! I only wish I'd have known about this before Christmas! My packages are now delivered into my garage and I don't have to worry about "Porch Pirates". The delivery driver gets a "single-use" code to access my garage, they drop the package, take a picture of the delivery, and I get notified on my phone. Bounus - I get a notification on my phone as soon as my garage door is opened and closed.Aside from that I also can use my phone to open/close my garage door from anywhere. I can let my mom, a friend or whoever I choose inside my house remotely.

I really like this product. I was worried at first but it does exactly what I want it to do. I needed another remote for a different car, and this cost less than a standard remote (especially on sale!) and extends functions to warn me that the door is open, and can be opened wherever I have connectivity with my devices, not just when I’m sitting in the driveway. Once I opened the door for my wife who went out for a walk, and the battery had died in the normal keypad, and I was in a different state! Needing to have my phone available when I want the door open or closed is a tiny inconvenience in the car sometimes, but it’s not so bad once you learn to have your phone where it’s accessible. Installation was easy and so far it works flawlessly.I wish Alexa connectivity was easier; I think it will work, eventually, but I can’t get it to work yet. They (MyQ and Alexa) seem to communicate with each other, but I can’t get the Alexa to open or close the door- maybe I’ll get it figured out, but that wasn’t the top of my “must do” list.

My old craftsman garage door opener that came with the house died so I bought the Chamberlain with MyQ. What a smart move. Matches the track and bolt configuration of the old Craftsman I replaced so super easy to install. Same as the app. Fantastic. Then I bought the hub for the other side and it worked like a charm and again, super easy to install. They truly make it idiot proof, especially when using the YouTube video for easy installation. On a scale of 1 to 10? A 12! I will never ever again have to leave the house, drive 2 miles down the road and wonder if I left the garage door open, just look at the app. Good job guys and gals who created the system!!

Honestly had a bit of trouble getting this set up. It turned out, however, (after doing multiple Google searches. resetting the main unit, and uninstalling and reinstalling the door sensor), that the app (Chamberlain myQ) needed to be updated. Since this was done the unit has performed flawlessly, even through power failures. I'd like a few more options in the software, but the device does what it claims to do and I would recommend it to anyone looking to monitor and control their door remotely (works with WiFI, per the description, so can be used virtually anywhere in the world).

The product works well, that isn't my issue. What IS my issue is Chamberlain has chosen not to play nice and charge you if you want to integrate with your home automation controller. I have so many gadgets, I don't want to have to use a separate app for each of them. Unless you are willing to pay a monthly fee, your only option is to use their app. Want to say "Google - open my garage door" on the way home? $$$ Very disappointing. I should have opted for a zwave device instead, but will probably keep it since I already installed it.

Love this thing, as I now don't have to come back home to be sure that I closed the garage door (a frequent occurrence as I drive down the street :-)  Only negative is that I did not find it easy to install.  The included instructions didn't work for me.  But, calling the Chamberlain help line worked great.  They were very helpful in walking me through the install and staying on the line until is was done.  The biggest thing I learned is that the unit doesn't have to be mounted on the ceiling, but anywhere in the garage where you have power and a line of sight for yourself and the garage door opener.  (Unfortunealty, found this out after I changed to a 2 plug ceiling receptacle to power this unit and the opener.)

I got this one as I needed extra remote and turned out for about the same money I could get more than just a remote but ability to monitor and control my door from anywhere I go.Negatives, if installed too close to the opener motor, it may get confused and drop the connection. After weeks experiencing issues when I first installed it, I finally called support and they explained to position it further. So instead of the ceiling next to the opener, I attached it to side wall and since then for more than a year I have no issues. It reconnects nicely if internet was lost and overall I am very happy with this product and many handy features it offers in the mobile app.

I bought this in my quest to fully automate the house. I want to create routines for lights, door locks, thermostat and everything else through the use of the Alexa app. This garage door opener will not work with anything but the MyQapp. The MyQ app is slow to open and doesn't always work. We had to replace the garage door remotes in our vehicle due to constantly having to send a kid around back to let us in with the spare key. Find another remote garage door opener.

I love the idea of this Wifi Garage Door opener, but it just isn't reliable.  I get a "sensor error" once a week.  This is frustrating because I can't tell if the door is open or shut.  Also, while it appears to be tracking when my garage door is opened, it is only 50/50 about when door is closed.  For example, if I close the garage door with my car when I leave for work, it won't register as being closed on the app.  Hopefully a software update will fix the problem.

This thing is not very smart at all. The only schedule you can set is for closing. And 9 out of 10 times, it will reopen within a minute of closing. It's a pain to use with google home. You actually have to tell google to talk to myQ. Then a dumb voice comes on and says the same thing every time - like you don't know what you want to say so it has to remind you. This is the absolute worst "intelligent" home device I own. Furthermore, it is rare that anything I buy from Amazon is myQ deliverable. Only once have I been able to use use it and the driver did deliver into my garage, but of course, the door reopened within a minute of closing. Dumb item. I researched garage openers for days, and this was supposed to be the best. Argh. Glad I paid sale price, but still, I wish I would have never bought it.

I am using this with Amazon key , in NYC, Amazon did 4 flawless deliveries in my garage, I added a Blink camera outside, way less money than the Amazon camera. Although Blink is an Amazon company... Without a subscription required.Only complaint I have too many apps to get this to work.

I don't need Alexa integration, but only a way to monitor the garage door status/notifications. The installation went smoothly, and it opens/closes the door from my phone as expect. There are, however, a few minor issues:* It beeps like crazy before closing the garage door from the smart app. It might be legal requirement, but it's definitely super annoying;

I did extensive research before purchasing this product.  It was in fact recommended by a repairman working on my garage door instead of something they sold and installed.  The listing in Amazon said it was comparable with Alexa, for a $1/month charge.  The other reviews I read  on Amazon mentioned the fee and their displeasure with the companies “greed” but the Alexa compatablity was key for me so I made my purchase.  Installation was pretty easy and went off without a hitch.  The problem started when I tried to pair the hub with Alexa and could not.  After consulting Dr. Google I found out through the MyQ community chat that Chamberlain had removed the “skill” from Alexa.  I contacted Amazon help and found out that was true which made me very unhappy, especially since the listing on Amazon still said it was Alexa compatable.  Kudos to Amazon customer service for eventually making me a satisfied customer but the misleading information in the listing is the sole reason for my low rating, I would have given it a one star rating except the ease of installation and the products function gets is an extra star.

The hardware is easy to install, first programming on the Wi-Fi is easy, if you happen to change the router from another company in the future, you may have to call MyQ to have them assist you into reprogramming it but they were very helpful and professional.It is very customizable with the setting alerts for time the door was left open, the obvious plus to this device is still alerts you and you can control from wherever you are to close the door, to open it as well. I got an email today from them alerting me that my battery level was getting low and to change the batteries. It’s been about eight months. So far very satisfied.

I was surprised on how quick and easy set-up was. Technology is not always my friend. It alarms to let you know it's closing, which threw me off a bit because I thought I'd done something wrong. I feel it's a safe feature if you have children or pets. Super nice to have the access right there on my phone. I was 2 streets over from my house and it opened, no problem! It's only been installed for a few days so we'll see how things go, but for now it's 5 stars!

Was a bit of a pain to setup and still does not work 100 percent with both of my Craftsman openers.  Right now it's free to integrate with Google, but I can't see any benefit to paying for it either since google cannot directly communicate with the device.  You must ask google to ask myq to close door.  Keep in mind the doors cannot be opened thru voice.  I had some issues early on as their servers went down after primeday.

This myQ was easy to install and works great with the app. Unfortunately their is no siri feature built in but that's no big deal. Also there is a very annoying safety feature sound when closing door and there is no option to bypass it in the settings. To eliminate that all together just remove the 2 screws on back of unit and counter sink one of the screws in the speaker hole slowly. The speaker will pop off and then cut the wire and problem solved. Overall it is a quick responsive unit.

Loving this so far. Only bought this due to a great Prime Day deal.Very easy install with step-by-step instructions via the MyQ app. Was even able to link to my Nest easily. Just wondering now how MyQ will go forward with Works With Nest (WWN) since Nest is migrating to Works With Google Assistant (WWGA). Any updates on that end?

The only good thing I can say is it was easy to install. I followed the instructions and videos, which were excellent. However the product does not work. Distance from the garage ceiling hub to my wifi router is 9-10 ft.  Setup worked easily but ever since then it was down hill. I cannot get it to work from my phone consistently. The whole purpose of having this was to be able to control the door when away and somewhere needs to access the house. I bought 2 of these thinking it would be a great product for my daughter too. Obviously I will not be installing that system for her. Concept is great, performance makes it useless.

I have old Maratech non compatible garage moto, but bought a Linear MDR/U DNR00100 1-Channel Plug-in Receiver and a wire Electrical Wire 22 AWG 22 Gauge Silicone Wire Hook Up wire Cable 20 Feet [10 ft Black And 10 ft Red] - Soft and Flexible 60 Strands 0.08mm of Tinned copper wire High Temperature Resistant (22AWG) , connected the Linear MDR to the pins 3 and 4 on the garage opener motor, use the app to add the MDR/U  and Buyaaaaaa!

I have a 13 year old Chamberlain. Specs says it’s compatible. I was looking forward to updating opener without buying a whole new one. Couldn’t get it to work. I called customer service to make sure I wasn’t doing something wrong, but they couldn’t help. I even got a replacement and that didn’t work either. My whole house is smart with switches, doorbells, thermostat, locks, and alarm system... no problems getting any of those systems working and online.Seems like it would be a nice system... oh well. I would not recommend.

When I first got this opener, I was excited. Too many time have I left my neighborhood and could not remember if I closed the garage door or not. In come this product. Setup was relatively painless. Internet connection in the garage can be spotty, but once I installed a mess router system I had no issues.The sensor that tells whether the garage door is open or close is great. It has a simple job and it does it with no problem.

This is very easy to install on the door and ceiling, and I've had no issues with LED lights in the area like some reviews stated.I have noticed a delay sometimes in the unit realizing that the door has closed, and if you try to open it before it has recognized it's closed, it won't open.  This isn't usually an issue unless you forget something right when it closes then have to wait for it to catch up.

Easy set up (video on the app walks you through step by step). Did have an issue come up because iOS data was interrupting the WiFi signal but after reaching out to their customer support to realize that was the issue and turning data off on my phone during set up it connected with no problem. Great way to allow access to family and friends who may be house sitting or checking on a pet while you’re away. Ability to grant guest access or you can just have them send you a quick text when they are at your house and you can grant them access from the app. MyQ has an Apple Watch app as well which works extremely well! For a similar price to a keyless entry door opener this option feels like a more secure option!

So far so good.  Set up was straight forward but the Sync with the garage door itself took a while. I am not sure if the directions were just not specific enough or my configuration was off.  But after I moved the hub closer (right next to) the garage door opener and tried a few more times it finally worked.  No issues since.  Would like integration with Alexa and an alarm or alert if my door was open for too long to at a certain time but can make it work.  Just scheduled it to close every night at 12am in case I (or kids) left if open.  With the phone app I don’t need to buy more of the long lost controllers for the cars we have that do not have openers built it!  That is handy!

I've bought two of these now - one for an uncle and one for my gf. Both times, the install was very easy to do. I learned of these after I had upgraded my whole motor with the Chamberlain MyQ system, and was glad I did since apparently a lot of people have a hard time remembering whether or not they've closed their garage door. The only thing that I can't seem to figure out on this particular model is how to have the door automatically shut if it's been open for two long. Sadly, I think that may only be available on newer models

Super easy to install, works exactly as advertised. Software setup was very simple using the app, hardware install was a snap.Not super crazy about the loud beeping when closing the door via the app, but I get that it’s a safety issue so I can live with it.

This was definitely an EASY install, literally took a couple of minutes for everything! The only issue that confuses me, is that you lose the garage sensor (the one that stops the garage from crashing down on a person or object).  I'm not so sure that this is safe around children or pets - - that frequent the garage.  At the moment, we still use it - - but we may need to find a better solution or opt to actually purchase a smart garage.Also, we haven't hooked up the Alexa functionality because we don't own any Alexa enabled security cameras - - and Amazon Key isn't available in Hawaii :(

Is not compatible with Alexa.  Why they put it in the search when I specifically asked for an "Alexa enabled thermostat" I cant yell you but it kind of pissed me off.  That being said, I only have one garage door, I can still use my phone to work it and I'm moving to a house with three garage doors so it will do for now.  It was easy to set up.  App is a bit limited but works fine.Just hate that it's not Alexa enabled.  When I move, I will not be getting rid of all my Alexa equipment around the house so I will not be using Chamberlain garage door openers.  Tio bad.  Good unit otherwise.

Installation was really quick and easy. I have two garage door openers, so I wanted to get a second sensor. I found it was a lot cheaper to buy a second hub (which includes a sensor) from an Amazon Warehouse deal, than it would have been to buy the sensor by itself. Now I have some spare parts in case I ever need them.Anytime I'm away from home and want to verify that I remembered to close the garage door, I can do that now. I can also use the garage door to let friends and family into my house when I'm gone.

It was difficult to install with inadequate instructions. There wasn’t clear instructions on how to pair my opener with this hub. Works fine after installing. Does loud, unnecessary prolonged beeping while closing which initially made me think something in g was wrong. The garage open alerts work and are nice.EDIT: It recently detected garage door was open while it in fact was closed. Had to fiddle around a bunch including killing the app and opening and closing the door a bunch of times for it to be correct again.

Multiple reviews documented the problem with this product, though some were also positive.  I assumed that most people were not technically savvy and that explained the poor reviews.  However, after owning this product for about a month I can report that the hub is unable to detect the door sensor on a regular basis (eg, almost daily).  I have followed the setup instructions religiously, tested the sensor battery, repaired the hub and sensor.  It doesn't seem to matter what troubleshooting technique I attempt, the hub cannot detect if the door is closed when we are away, thus rendering this product useless.  Moreover, if you try to close the door remotely when the sensor is undetected, you can only do so twice without encountering an error and having to reset the entire system in the app.  The only fix seems to be to press the sensor test button, then, and only then, the hub will detect the door sensor.  Of course, one has to be home to press the sensor test button.A product whose core value is to give homeowners piece of mind when away, in fact raises more questions.  "Is my door closed or open?"  There seems to be no way to know with this device.  Save your money.  If you want remote access and detection, spend the extra money and replace your  garage door opener with a wi-fi capable opener. This solution is simply a waste of time and money.

Let me start by saying I’ve been a software engineer for 17 years, both embedded software and .NET development. This was a pain in the ass to setup. First, it wouldn’t sync to my garage door motor as I tried several times, following the directions to the T. I gave up and initiated a return. Two days later as I went to take it down, I gave it one more try and got it finally connected and the door did it’s initial open. Then the next hurdle, getting the ap to actually open and close was another challenge. After several attempts and resets on the device and phone I got it working. I wouldn’t recommend this to anyone. You would be be better off making your own with a simple  particle photon

The headline...it works.  It does exactly what it is supposed to.  It monitors, opens and closes the garage door.  There is no surprises.  However, you may have some difficultly with the programming.  I had to go through the process several times.  Any delay in the steps will make you start all over.  That is really the biggest issue I had and why I gave it four instead of five stars.  The app requires you to start over from the beginning every time instead of picking up at the last successful step.  But once you get the setup complete, the system works just fine.  I was once 300 miles away when I got a call from a neighbor that my garage was open.  If I had this in place then, I could have easily closed it right from there.

I'm only give the MyQ 4 stars because I just feel like I haven't had it long enough to give it 5 Stars. The MyQ was very easy to install. I read the directions prior to installing anything and I also watch the video on how to install the MyQ. Though the instructions for MyQ said my system is compatible with the MyQ I had some concerns because my garage system is a Lift Master and the MyQ is made by Chamberlain, the two work as said by the instructions. I have had some test runs, may be 3 or 4, with the MyQ but that is about it as far as using it. I purchase the MyQ for those days when I think I forgot or I know I forgot to shut the garage door. Though I gave it only 4 Stars I do recommend the system if you don't already have one.

Had this for several months.  Took over an hour to finally connect.  After that the connection to open/close the door was very intermittent.  Directions seem easy however the system struggles to connect to the WiFi and I constantly receive an error messages to start over, reset the device.  I have the serial number memorized as I have went through the reset process 1/2 dozen times.  Will call support for more help.  Do not recommend if your WiFi is in the basement.

First, I want to say that this is one of the best smart control system for garage. I tried 2 other systems before but it wasn't as good. The app was also well developed. Thank you putting your time in making it looks great and easy to use. I also like how the app gave you a step-by-step guide for the installation. This help make the installation easier. I finished the installation within 20 to 30 minutes.I had this smart control system for about a month without any problems. Happy shopper.

Great product for $39.  I waited for this item to drop from $100, to $80, occasionally on Black Friday at $60 but when it finally came down to $39 I pulled the trigger.  Great product. The only recommendation and caution is when the app says to push the smart/learn  button on the opener, and wait for yellow light, they are talking about on the yellow light on the opener itself NOT the yellow light on the MyQ WiFi hub.  This could have been clearer and would have saved me from wiping out all my other programmed remotes. But once I figured that out, everything went well. I did have  to reprogram all my remotes but that is not hard if you know how.

The sensors gave false reports of door open 60-80% of the time so were worse than no sensors.  I tried four times to contact support via their website and the app, but never got a response.  I got very nice help from their chat person and learned that the problem was that LED bulbs interfere.  I have had one false alarm in the four days since replacing the LED bulb in the garage door opener.  Hopefully this actually fixed it...The company does not acknowledge nor respond to repeated emails even after five data (and counting)

Could not have worked worse if it were designed that way. Refused to connect to my internet despite a strong signal. I set it up to search, waited 2 hours, then just decided to go to bed. Woke up in the morning and the thing still had the same message on it ("Attempting to connect to network, this may take a minute"). My poor phone had to spend the night in the garage, alone and cold, for the first time in its life. Just so this sorry excuse could play with my emotions and my time.After 12 hours of unsuccess, I get a message to my phone that there *might* be a problem, and I should consider a hard reset of the device. This process apparently requires the precision and attention of a bomb squad technician. Once that was completed, the poor thing blinked, chirped, than told me to call customer support because something was "definitely wrong". The last thing I want to do is spend time on some phone call with a poor guy whose sole job is to talk all the poor suckers who buy this product.

This was a wonderful purchase.  I love the integration with the Amazon Key app to see every instance my garage door is opened or closed.  It gives me great peace of mind to know that my loved ones made it home safely.Furthermore, the mornings where I leave for work in a hurry, I no longer have to worry about whether or not I remembered to put the garage door down.  No more circling around the neighborhood to check.  With the MyQ app, it's as easy as opening the app to view my garage door status.

The system is very easy to install the hardware, but syncing it to the app was a nightmare.  I have a Chanberlain Liftmaster so I tried to sync under those two names and Craftsman.  The app would open and close the door with all three names, but then would give me an error it could not sync.  This didn't make sense as it obviously found it and worked.  After about an hour it finally synced.  Not before I had to reset it and remove all devices previously synced, reset the MyQ box and the app.  Wasted over 30 minutes to set it up. Their tech support is only available during business hours.  Once it finally synced it worked great.  Glad I can get alerts, open and close the door from my phone and add guests.

The garage opener is easy to install and its configurations. I installed in less than 10 minutes and it works perfectly. I love it because I can open or close my garage door anywhere. If my dad or family go to my home, I can open it without providing them a key or the sensor to open my garage. Also, the garage opener alert with a lot of BIIP when you are closing the door to avoid accidents. I am very happy for the moment with the item and I recommend it if you want to create an automatize house and have control with your garage door (also, provide a notification if another person open or close the garage).

Beware of Phantom Operations!!! I installed the MyQ hub two months ago and it worked perfectly...until it didn’t. Two weeks ago, it started randomly opening on its own. I called customer service and they assured me it was not a defective MyQ because they do not show any signal from the device at the time of the openings, so it must be a neighbor who somehow synced with my garage door... weird. I’ve lived in this house 5 years and have never had this happen. So I bought their excuse and said sure, let’s fix it. They walked me through a hard reset of my garage door opener that wiped its memory. I reinstalled MyQ, which was super difficult compared to the first time, and thought it was fixed...for a day. Guess what, phantom operations are back. This is so scary and not worth the risk.

I’ve been thinking of buying one of these for a while. We went out to dinner & shopping last week and we came home several hours later only to find our garage door wide open! That’s when the decision was made to stop thinking about it and buy it! I ordered this through amazon and as expected, it arrived promptly. I had a few problems setting it up so I contacted Chamberlain Support for help! Couldn’t be happier with my experience! I spoke with a gentleman named “Andre” who made the rest of the installation a piece of cake! The most surprising thing? He spoke perfect English which is the language that I’ve preferred for the last 65 years ! If you’re thinking about getting one, just buy it! You’ll be glad you did!

Installation went ok. I followed instructions to a tee. The grand finale was when it opened and closed the door. Since then it has accurately reported door opening and closings, but seldom works to open or close the door remotely. I have re-paired the opener but still hardly ever works. My car remotes, wall push button, and keypad all still work fine. The myQ hub just won't stay paired to the Craftsman opener.UPDATE: Chamberlin support contacted me and sent me a new hub. I've installed it and so far it's working, both for monitoring door position and for remotely operating door opener. I'll update again if that changes.

I'm pretty good at staying chill, but the garage door is that thing in the morning that can sometimes make me double back because, "Did I leave the garage door open?" is in the back of my mind. My daughter is the same way, and now neither of us ever have to worry about that again! Lots of good videos on how to install, and easy to set up. If you set up the wifi, then unplug the unit, it still remembers it all. That was my only concern when I installed it (actually unplugged it twice and it was still good). Great product - and only $30!!!

One of our cars sits in the driveway. Due to car thefts in our area we were wary of leaving a garage door opener in the car. We ordered and installed this product without frustration! The app makes it easy to open and close.We were away from home for the day and our dog got out of the yard. Our neighbor called to let us know he was safe. I opened the garage door through the app so she could put him in the house. When she was done we used the app to close the door! We were an hour from home and it worked!

I installed this about two weeks ago. Was a bit hesitant about purchasing after seeing all the negative reviews. I followed the instructions and videos in the app. The units paired up and connected to my WiFi network right away. I was concerned about interference from florescent and LED lights since I have both, but it hasn't been an issue. The app opens and closes the door almost instantly and I get all the alerts I have set. The one thing I am unable to do from the app is lock and unlock the door. At night I push the "Lock" button on the Liftmaster controller to lock out the remote clickers and the HomeLInk remotes so if someone gets into my car they can't open the garage door. This also locks out the MyQ. I would like to see the MyQ hub work like a Keypad remote and operate the door whether or not it is locked. Or have an option to lock and unlock the controller from the app. I will check with support and see if that is possible.

Web says it's compatible with all Genie models after 1993 or something, not really!  If yours is made after 2016 it's not comparable either.  I have a Genie 3024...doesn't work!  Wasted hours trying all their tips on their site.  When I search your site for a specific model you should bring up the correct info. Was on hold for 45 mins one day, gave up...was on hold for over 20 mins today and finally got through.  Then I find this out...aggravating to say the least.

Guys this is a great product, it took me few minutes to setup the  hub with the home network. I had issues paring the hub with the garage opener. I called the customer service and the person was experienced and used his knowledge  to help me with getting the system paired.Key - if you have an LED lights it may interfere with the frequency and may have issues.

After reading some of the (very lengthy) reviews that went into great detail about their horrible install experience, I was a little on the fence about ordering this. However, my experience could not have been better. The app does everything for you. EVERYTHING. This install is quick, fool proof and easy to follow. My only knock on this product is it’s lack of Alexa integration. But the MyQ app is great, so I don’t mind having to use it. I would recommend this to anyone regardless of how tech savvy they are.

Have had this installed for about 2 months now. Connected with no problems. iPhone app is easy to use and I have it set so it logs me in automatically.  Only issue I’ve had is trying to control the door when I’m in the zone where house WiFi is diminished and cell hasn’t quite picked up. I like the flashing light and beeper because I don’t have to wait on the door to move nor be watching it to know it is about to open/close. Was able to use this rather than purchasing a single door controller which costs more and didn’t give me the ability to get remote notifications or see the status of the door.

Very easy to install and get working - the instructional videos and click-through instructions on the app make it nearly impossible to get it wrong.The door opens nearly instantly - a little delay in closing. The MyQ unit flashes a few times and starts beeping a few seconds before the motor starts closing the door. The beeping will quickly drive you insane as it starts when you hit ‘close’ on the app and continues to beep the entire time the door is moving and for some seconds after the door is closed.

I used the MyQ garage door opener to enable my house to become smarter and I wanted to be able to control the opening and closing of my garage from anywhere, because I have family members that often times forget to close the garage because they were in a rush.  The system works great, however, I loose my signal to the hub sometimes. It has nothing to do with MyQ.  The problem I have is because of my outdated cheap modem/router from Time Warner and my aging Samsung phone loaded with apps. I resolved it a little by placing extenders in the garage. The only other issue I had was difficulty getting it to interface with Alexa and I m still working that issue. Its reported that I need to purchase additional hardware and interfaces to get it communicating. As you can see in the posted video it working great... I was not very detailed but shared enough to let you know that the system is worth the price.  Lastly I advised to keep the garage remotes which is also compatible with the system because if your phone is in any way like mine loosing charge quickly...…..you may get locked out...lol

I was so excited to get this. I even did my homework and checked if my Gene garage door opener was compatible and it was on their list. When I received it, I read the instructions and follow it. I installed it and was following the instructions on the app. When I tried to input the hub serial number, an error messages kept coming out. I tried everything even calling Amazon help but they couldn't figure it out. So I'm returning it. So disappointed!

I like this product, I really do, it just feels like you are an early adapter. For the right price, when it goes on sale, it's a good product. However, it does not integrate well and I had to set mine up twice to get it to work. Once it was all setup it generally works well, but once in awhile I will be told the door is open when it is in fact closed. It was worth the price and I would not want to live without it; however, if I had to do it again I would consider spending more on another product.

Set up is very user friendly, I did not have any issues with the connection to my network. The problem I stumbled upon was setting my Alexa devices to connect with the MyQ opener. I had to connect with an app called Simple Commands. It definitely works with Alexa but will need some extra steps by using simple commands app. Another issue I have had happened to me is the MyQ app will sometimes not connect with the MyQ opener not too sure why, so I have to close the MyQ app on my iPhone and reopen for it to connect. I’ve experienced that a couple of times. Overall I’m very happy with the product. I love the warnings if you leave the garage opened. Would definitely recommend!

Product does work with google, but you can’t open the garage door with google.  Saying “Ok google, close my garage door” doesn’t work simply.  You must say “ok google, talk to MyQ”, the MyQ opens and it explains with a voice prompt what it can do, such as “is my door open?, or close my door”.  Then, you can say,  “close my door” and it will (usually).  After that you must go back in, same routine and ask if it’s closed, no push confirmation.  The most frustrating thing is that it can’t open your door using voice prompts, but it does give you a “I’m sorry Dave, I’m afraid I can’t do that” response.  This means you must launch the MyQ app on your phone, go into my devices, wait for them to populate, then press the icon to open the door desired.  That would be that bad.... but the effing app logs out within 10 minutes of last use.  So, every time, you need to log in, which takes at least 30-40 seconds of spinning cursor, then, finding devices, the opening.  Support sucks, I see at least 4 comments posted on chat/forum re: lack of persistent login issue, and they all have gone unacknowledged, unanswered for months.  Even trying to register on support page navigates to blank page (although I’m on tablet, and pc ymmv).

I began install and everything went smooth till trying to pair to the garage motor.  Tried and tried, wouldn't pair.  Called chamberlain support, who were absolutely wonderful, and we ended up pairing it by doing the pairing for a remote light instead of garage door opener.  Once that was done, the system works phenomenally. Lets me know if the garage opens and will hopefully be more useful when amazon key comes to my area.

I wanted something I could tell my voice assistant to open/close the garage door with, whether it be Google or Alexa. Guess what? It worked for about a week, and then all of the sudden it was a "concern" and they yanked the feature. Now it literally just acts as a way to pull up yet another stupid app, that requires yet another stupid account (because we live in a world where you can't... ya know, "sign in with" something like a Google account?) to see if it's open or close. Bonus: the app allows you to use your glorified fondleslab as a $1,000+ garage door clicker. Save your money.

I was a little daunted by some of the reviews from professionals who had trouble installing and controlling this device, so I set aside some hours - being a single mom whose profession is in finance, not construction or garage doors. It took about :15 and :10 of that was because my genie garage door needed a little extra prompting (I don’t take no for an answer, lol) to sync. No more turning around after leaving the house to make sure my door is down and no more giving out my code if someone needs to access the house, and I get alerts when my door opened telling me my kids got home late. Love love love.

I purchased an used(open box) unit from amazon warehouse for 1/2 price. It was practically a new unit. Installation was easy. It works very well. It's a nice addition for an old openers.Pros) No monthly fee if used with the basic app provided by Chamberlain.

I would say it works and I used the in-garage delivery a few times already.The install process is not very smooth. The main problem is that I didn't realize I had to put the sensor on the door. I thought I could put it anywhere. Call the support and finally figured it out.

I set this up in about 10 minutes. The app does all of the linking and pairing with the garage door opener, so no fumbling with codes and button mashing.The app also provides step by step simple instructions on getting your hardware setup and mounted properly.

This was a very easy product to setup and use.  It provides an excellent safety net for monitoring and controlling our garage door.  I was so impressed, I purchased a unit for my daughter and their family for Christmas.  Installation was easy.  They called me to see if they could integrate another door sensor on the same base station.  After a little research, I said it would be easy.  They ordered another sensor and integrated it into their configuration.  Piece of cake.  She texted me this morning and said it was one of the best gifts she got for Christmas.

I read Steve's review (https://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-reviews/RGO7EDQMIMEPK/ref=cm_cr_arp_d_rvw_ttl?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B075H7Z5L8) and found it more useful than the Chamberlain instructions!  Thanks, Steve.  The physical installation was easy; getting everything communicating and working together was not.  I love this low-cost alternative to make my 2 old but functional garage door openers sort of smart.  But I wish the issues that Steve addressed would be cleaned up by Chamberlain.  The other problem I had was following the instructions.  The minimal instructions in the package were less than adequate.  They expect the app to guide you through the only difficult part: getting everything communicating.  I followed the app instructions carefully until I got to the point I needed to register the hub.  But the app said that the device could not be found, and offered no help on what to do next.  After several minutes of frustration, i closed the app and restarted it.  That time I got what appeared to be an entirely different sequence of clear instructions that worked...sort of.  i got the 2 doors working and then my first door quit responding.  All I could see was the circle rotating on the app around the "1" door.  Since I was out of time, I manually closed the door and the app.  A couple of days ater, I tried again thinking I would need to repair the sensor but, no, everything was working together.  What was the problem and how it repaired itself are both unknown.  This is a great device with lots of potential but Chamberlain needs to cleanup the bugas and provide better instructions.

Very easy to install. I installed it on two garage doors that have Chamberlain openers though it looks like it works with most models sold after 1993 that have the safety stop sensors  by the bottom of the garage door. They work independently, you only need one hub and two door sensors if you have two doors. Sometimes we would forget to shut the doors and now I can easily check from anywhere on my phone to see if they are shut and if not close them. You can also have it send you an alert based on your time preferences if the door is open for too long etc. it’s also capable on being linked to amazon for deliveries, so they can leave packages in the garage, though I have not used this feature.

Works great! Reason why I gave 4 stars is because sometimes (very rarely) it sends false notifications that garage opened and closed.And installation is very simple.  It could have been explained in the quick start guide.  Thru videos from several websites, I came to know that keeping the hub next to the garage opener is the ideal place and that’s when this works better.  But, I think that’s not mentioned clearly in the set up guide.

I followed all of the instructions to try to get it set up but it has never worked. I tried to call the support but there was a long hold and I hung up and gave up. I did just receive a notification that the battery is low and I need to replace it. I have never used it and have only had it for a few months, so be prepared to replace batteries a lot from the sounds of it.

Downside, don't know if it's a fluke or in the programming but I recently experienced a power failure, when the power returned the myQ did not reconnect to my WiFi network like all my other devices, I had to go out to my garage and go through the entire setup process again in order to reconnect to my WiFi, could be a bad thing if the power goes out when I'm away from home. I will update my review if anything changes the next time I experience a power outage.

Incredibly irritated as this product cane up when I searched “Alexa enabled device”, but after getting it I come to find that it does not integrate with Alexa.  I am somewhat to blame as I should have done my homework, a quick google search reveled thay it doesn’t work with Alexa anymore.  After taking the time to install it I’m just going to use it from the app until I can find someone who is using something that works with Alexa and I can physically go see it in action and that person recommends. Very frustrating. I hope the other items which claim to be “Alexa enabled” actually are.

The MYQ Smart Hub I purchased (Model G0301-E, manufactured 4/19) said it would work with all Genie openers built from 1996 to present.  My Genie H6000/07/M would not pair after numerous attempts.  Unplugged all LED lights in the garage, rebooted the hub numerous times, even called Chamberlain support for help.  They had me do all of the steps I had already done but it still would not pair.My Genie was manufactured in 2007 and uses intelligent code remotes, so according to the MYQ Smart Hub, this should have worked.  Not sure if I have a defective unit or what, but am sending it back for a refund.

Very easy to install and get up and running.  The directions say to mount it on the ceiling next to the garage opener but I have it just sitting on my workbench for now.  The app works very quickly and pretty much immediately tells you when the door is open or closed.  The only thing I wish it had was native Homekit integration without having to spend 3.5 times as much money for the bridge.  I was able to get it working with Homekit by using a Raspberry Pi and Hoobs for a fraction of the price but still, most people won't want to do that.

Well maybe I didn't do it, rather my son forgot to do it while we were in Europe traveling - yes he forgot to shut our garage door.  No worries thanks to this little baby.  You can program it to shut your garage door for you at certain times of the night like 9 PM/ 10 PM, etc.  So if you happen to forget to close the garage door, this baby will do that for you and send you and email letting you know that the rule you setup triggered.Setup was fairly easy.  It is all video based and the only issue is it is hard to go back and review an item. Overall no real issues for me.

Love This. I always would worry that I forgot to shut the garage door.. now I look at my phone and it tells me if it is opened or closed. I also had a rough time with my remote that came with my garage door opener.. sometimes it worked and sometimes it didn’t. Now, I just click a button on my phone and it works every time!!  I bought this for my husband for Christmas.. he loves it.. but I think that I love it more! I even bought another one for a gift!! This is going to be my go to house warming gift from now on!

I was a little concerned it would be hard to install. I'm a single, working mom of three and the garage gets left open all too often. So I took a chance, grabbed my drill and went to work. It wasn't bad at all!! It was fairly easy. The garage door opener and myQ initially wouldn't connect, but the next day, everything worked, and I've been using it for 2 weeks now. I LOVE IT!! It works perfectly, I know who's getting home and leaving the door open. I can close it easily, without hassle. It's such a lifesaver. Wish u would have bought it years ago. Great product!

So, the reason I purchased the MyQ was because my teenage son accidentally left our garage door open while we were away on vacation and I had no way of closing it remotely.  I wasn't home when my son left the house with his other teenage cousins.  His mom, sister & I left had already left a day earlier.  Anyway, I will only say that teenagers have a "very short memory span" (Lol), how he left the garage door open is something I'm still trying to understand to this day!Lucky for us, I had a Nest video security camera already in the garage, so I received alerts and saw via their app that the garage door was open, so I had to drive 2 hours back home to close it - let's just say I wasn't to happy!
