Easy to install and setup.  Worked well for a~ two months.  But like many others report, stops working, becomes stupid, gives false reports that the door is up when it's really down. The individual device disappears from the app and you have to go through the install process again. My experience is that it is not that reliable, read other reviews.Recently the app became stupid and could not detect "MyQ". Reset MyQ, went through the install/setup again but could not get it to connect to the "Liftmaster" opener. Just wait a few months and give another review of your "MyQ"

Well at least it worked for a week or so.  I had difficulty getting it to install properly, but after several attempts it finally worked.  I went away and it worked fine for awhile, wanted to make sure no one forgot to shut the garage door as has happened every so often.  All of a sudden, the app went POOF and it was no longer linked to the opener.  There's no way to fix it without my actually being there and reinstalling from scratch so that's that for that.  It should be called  MyQ Not so Smart garage door opener.

My garage door occasionally fails to close, and we had no way to monitor it.  This product allows us to monitor the status of the door and open/close it remotely if needed.Installation is straight forward.  It only has two mounting screws to install.  Mine at first would not operate my Genie garage door.  The help line suggested I move it 6 feet from my opener, I only had it about 3 feet away, and to remove and LED bulbs in the garage.  I had several.  I then reprogrammed it and it works perfectly.

I purchased the MyQ Smart Garage Door hub to interface with an existing Chamberlain garage door opener in my home.  Some of the Amazon reviews were very negative and I wasn't sure this was a good idea.  I found the installation to be uncomplicated but a little time consuming.  It went in and got activated without a hitch.  I was careful to follow the directions provided, which were pretty clear and nicely illustrated.  I made sure I had good WiFi strength in the garage, installed the pieces in the order given, and did not plug in or activate items until the directions said so.  I have had this running for a week and it has been very reliable.  The iPhone app works fine and is easy to understand.  I should have bought this sooner!  Very happy.

Don't listen to all the other complaints unless you have bad wifi or some other issue.  This app and product rocks, I didn't even install it in the correct locations on my garage door but product still works perfectly.  I'm running it on my 5ghz wifi though which is maybe why other people have issues.  All I know is the alerts work within 5-10 seconds of door moving, the app controls the door with no problem and I'm so glad I didn't pay attention to all the negative reviews.  Love having this product!

My family of 3 only has 2 garage openers, my father is too stubborn to get another one. So I suggested getting this, installed it myself, very easy, only took 2 zipties and 15 minutes. I ziptied the module on top of our garage opener, drilling and screwing was too much trouble, but its had no issues for 2 months now. It's basically free too because once you have Amazon deliver something inside your garage you get that $30 discount. WORTH

06/03/2019The app shows "Close error" and I can not control from the Myq app about one week after the set up. I followed the instruction in the support section but it did not work. So I have been making a lot of call to them but they just let me wait for long and I never successfully talk with them so far.  I do not know how to resolve this problem.

Had the product for several months, woke up one morning to alerts that my garage was opened and then closed on its own. After reviewing the history of the Chamberlain app, the garage phantom opened and closed 4 times over night. So I looked in prior days and it has been doing it for almost a month without alerts being sent that I had set up. I researched the issue on forums and it is apparently a problem that has no solution. Today the MyQ Smart Garage Door Opener will be visiting the local landfill. The last thing I need is the door to open at the right time some jerk decides to walk-in and start taking my stuff.

We like this door opener a lot. Have not used the Alexa or Amazon features, but as a door opener its been working great for about a year. I had no problems installing it. The software works well with our phones and it's great to be able to open and close the door from anywhere. The only shortcoming is that of course it won't work if your wifi is down. Overall it's still awesome. Walking around your yard and need to put something away, just pull out your phone and open the garage. I like it.

I was disappointed with this purchase. Somehow I must have lost my place going back and forth between posts and reviews. When I order it I expected the Hub and Motion Sensor.  I just received an add-on sensor. I had been researching this for a month and product was pushed by Amazon to my account.  Advertising was misleading. The picture/advert displays a complete package (Hub/Sensor) however, they are sold separately and the advert does not indicate this. on the page.  Adverts should indicate "...Sold Separately"

I've had the MyQ for awhile now and used it with my old Genie Screwdrive until the Genie broke.  I replaced it with a new Genie 7750 BECAUSE THEIR WEBSITE SAYS COMPATIBLE GENIE from 1996 to Current.  I am here to tell you it is not.  I tried for a couple of hours to program it following their detailed "Genie" directions which involved the use of the remote control and it simply does not work.  Then, I search under questions and "Chamberlain Support" says it doesn't work with Genie models after 2016, but their own website says 1996-Current.  Thanks Chamberlain.

I have a chamberlain garage door opener, so I thought this would work well. Unfortunately, it is the most disappointing purchase I think I have ever made. I have two garage doors, so I ordered an extra sensor. The set up was easy enough and it seems to work well for me but when my roommate tries to close a door using the app, it closes one and then opens the other door and if he then tries to close the newly opened door (which should not have opened on its own) it gives an error so that he cannot close the door remotely. I haven't used it much beyond testing but i have not yet encountered issues from my app. Unfortunately, now I do not trust it not to do the same to me and leave our door open. If you have more than one sensor or more than one person that you want to have access, this is not a good option. Other things to note, aside from it randomly opening/closing doors, if you give access to anyone else know that they have minimal access. They can open/close the door (or both depending on whatever the app decides to do) but they cannot receive notifications if a door is left open or create alarms to notify them if it is left open. It is very clearly designed for only a single person to use and is poorly adapted for multiple users.

I purchased this because I was tired of wondering if I remembered to close the garage after I left my house. This took a few minutes to install and setup. Works great and would recommend. Notifications work great as well. I am supposed to be able to link it to Google home but I have not been able to get this linked. If I am ever able to get it linked, this will be the perfect garage door opener. If not, still very pleased, especially for the price.

Works Great!  Use the SimpleCommands app to create awesome Alexa routines. Please note, for some reason it takes the Alexa app 24 hours to sync with SimpleCommands to create scenes, which you can then add to routines. So you can now say "Alexa, Good Night" and add a scene where it'll close the garage door as well as anything else you have added to that routine.Also, MyQ was VERY EASY to install. I didn't mount the receiver to my garage ceiling, I simply zip tied it to the beams that hold the garage door opener. Works flawless!

This thing is inexpensive.  I expected it to be way less awesome based on the price.  Considering what it cost, I'm very happy with it.  The app experience is "fine," but not as well developed as other smart home products.  But considering the frequency with which I forget to close my garage door, this is super handy.  I have an alert set to remind me when the door has been open for 5 minutes (in addition to alerting on every open).  Would strongly recommend.

I have an Android device and the app will not allow me to login. You put the username & password and click Login and it just sits and sits. I did an online chat and then later was called by Chamberlain tech support who told me that there is a known issue in the app that causes this problem on certain phones. They are working to release an update to the app for this but in the meantime said I could connect and control my device thru the mychamberlain.com website on my phone's browser. I will be returning this and repurchasing only when there is an update.

Super easy setup, the app is a breeze, I have one in two different homes and it works amazing. Very responsive as long as you have good internet and wifi signal in your garage. The mounting is very easy, once its setup you never have to do anything again outside of log in and out. I get push notifications so I always know if the door is opening or closing, I can let family and friends into the garage. Its great for dog walkers so you dont have to give anyone a key. I would buy it again, like I said I have two of these in different locations. Zero issues with multiple IP's / location with one login.

Very easy to install. Set up was a breeze and there were no problems. We did take advantage of the “free for a limited time“ integration with IFTTT. However, the functionality we had hoped for when purchasing this product is not available. In fact, integration with IFTTT Doesn’t give you any options. The app keeps reporting “No Options Found.”  This is apparently quite a problem judging from Internet message boards. But we have been unable to find a solution and have not received any word back from the MyQ folks.

I bought this hub after looking at making my apartment garage "smart". All of the competitors seem to be at least twice the price and this seemed like a good deal especially since IFTTT and Google Assistant integrations were free "for a limited time" (whatever that means). Well... I should have done my research because there is no way to open a garage via Alexa, google voice, IFTTT, or any integration. You have to use the app which is a bit more cumbersome thann just saying "Alexa open garage". However, the good news is you can close the door with your voice. This would be a 5 star review if they could enable the open action from smart assistants by voice.
1. Monthly fee to use with IFTTT, others free. You can only close funtion, not open.2. Buy this with hope that can use with google home and IFTTT but not working because of the fee and limitation
Love being able to know if I closed the garage door, instead of turning around to check. 😆Wish it had an auto close time.  Not just a schedule.

It doesnt see that my door is closed so it opens my door at the scheduled "close" command.EVERY MONTH, i have to reset this POS of a device.  Its 2020, we are nearly ready to send people to Mars and the idiots at Chamberlain cant figure out to tell the hub if the door is closed or not

I got this setup and I'm a Systems Engineer but not without a bit of pain.  The Wifi adapter on this device is terrible.  I had to move the unit all the way to the end of my garage to get a decent enough signal.  I had it in the middle of the garage and it kept loosing signal.  My garage isn't that far from my home and my camera in the garage works perfectly from the middle leaving me to believe the antenna in the adapter lacks performance.  I was going to install one on my nieces garage but it's much further than mine so I'm going to look for another option.

The app CONSTANTLY confuses up & down and if it thinks the door is down & you hit the button and the door closes, the app panics and throws an error you can ONLY clear by manually operating the door locally (if that actually fixes it). If you are away from the house, well your garage is WIDE OPEN to the street because the app disables operation until you reset the error. I have a camera because I bought the stupid thing for Amazon Key (which turns out is not in my area so a complete waste for WHY I bought it in the first place) With the camera I can CLEARLY see the door is open and there's nothing I can do about it because the app locks you out. I'mI bought this because of Amazon Key but

Let me first say that this is a great system, especially for the price that it has been selling for lately ($30). Before you buy it, you will want to make sure that your garage door is compatible.  It's very likely that it is, but if not, it might still be useful to you as a monitor (that is, telling you whether the garage door is up or down, but not letting you do anything about it remotely).  Also make sure that you have a decent wifi signal in your garage.  If you have two garage door bays in the same garage you might want to buy two of these.  Not because you're going to install two hubs, but because each of these packs comes with one hub and one door sensor, and while each hub can control two doors, the extra door sensors are generally $31-32 each, so you can get what amounts to a spare hub for less than the cost of an extra door sensor (and yes, they are fully compatible).Now, the main issue is that the system comes with a "safety feature" of the most obnoxious alarm beeping if you open/close the garage remotely.  If you have dogs (or frankly, if you have ears), this alarm is intolerable.  It also flashes its bright light, which is probably sufficient for most people.  If, like me, you wanted to turn off the alarm feature, you may only do so in a permanent (presumably, warranty-voiding) manner.  You will want to take a phillips head screw-driver and remove the two back screws and then you'll see a small black round case with a hole in the center.  It's got the diameter of about a nickel and maybe 1/2" tall.  I'll let you watch some youtube videos, but the premise is to remove it and cut the interior disc wires with some small scissors or a pliers.  Don't bother with the glue method and if your plan is to disable it in such a way as to one day make it useful again, using the method that involves a small screw that you almost certainly won't have, I recommend following the setup instructions and listening to the beeping and then tell me that you'll ever want to hear that noise again.

Short review - but full details.  Works EXACTLY as it should but the Google Assistant, the main reason I purchased it will require some additional work.1. Google Assistant cannot OPEN the garage door - due to security concerns either Google or Chamberlain has prevented the voice assistant from "OPENING" the door itself.

Easy install. Easy programming I don't bother with sync. All I di is control my doors from my phone and check whether open or close.  I have 2 doors and have not been able to coordinate the independent opening of the doors.tried everything. Be aware that it's difficult with 2 doors if not impossible.

The product is poorly designed, tested and supported by Charmberlain. Why would a company continously sell a product, obviously, does not work and/or cause financial damage to customers. Let me say, for get company, a group of people decided to sell this cr@p, and its is fulfilled to order. Question what if this product closes on someone.

It took me a while to get it connected to my garage door opener.  Not sure if I didn't understand the process or whether it just takes longer than I anticipated for the unit to connect.  But once I got it connected it works well.  I got it because I have a motorcycle and the garage door opener for the bike was expensive (its a Harley Davidson so of course it was stupid expensive just to add a garage door opener).  Any way, this works well.  Just a touch on my phone app and the door is closed!  The app also monitors how long the door has been open/closed.  Definitely recommend for an inexpensive way to open/close/monitor your garage door.

I'm an engineer and 25 year communications systems designer and integrator and I have to say this My Q is an incredibly irritating system to try and get working properly. It's basically worthless for my application.Right out of the box the hub wouldn't pair to the door sensor. After searching online for troubleshooting information, the hub had to be reset to factory defaults. Then it would pair. But I've never been able to get it to pair to my Genie Intellicode opener that it claims is on the compatibility list. Additional instructions say you "may" have to push the learning button on the opener twice and you "may" have to push the transmitter button during pairing to get it to work. Very vague.

I originally purchased a hub with sensor and a second sensor. Set up on first garage seemed to work, but, became inconsistent. Sometimes I get "push notifications" and sometimes not. Sometimes it shows that door as being open when it is not. On the second door could not get that operating at all. Changed out the sensor with no success. At least one support tech told me line of sight was important, another said it was not as important. I even upgraded my router to one that is many times more powerful than the original, no luck.I was very disappointed.

thought was pricey when bought but well worth the money; mainly wanted for ensuring garage doors were closed after a forgetful opening of the door.  has flashing light that warns opening and closing since not always in immediate area when door open/closes.  the app tells me the status and I have no problems with the use of app; compatible with IFTTT and WINK with other adjustments.  allows me peace of mind and the ability to open for early family arrivals as well as package deliveries.  works with Alexa with subscription, which didn't subscribe and have no problems with it's function.

Much easier to install than I anticipated.  Have two door garage so had to buy another door sensor, didn’t know that at first.  But pleasantly surprised that it worked on the iPhone.  The remotes on our sun visors and the Homelink openers on our Subaru’s weren’t affected and still worked independently.  Now, we can go to bed and feel secure and not wake up next morning only to be surprised we left the garage doors open all night

Easy to install and works great. There are tutorials on YouTube that describe the installation process and it took me 15 mins to get it setup and ready. Don’t know what people were doing for 11 hours on other reviews. The only thing to chekc is if you garage door opener is compatible. The concept is quite simple, the device is essentially a remote control that can be access through an application on your phone. The app has some nice features to customize alerts based on time of day or time the door remains open. I did not do anything special with wifi, I have one router for the entire home and the range is sufficient for for device.

Not sure where to start. This product has a very simple job, open/close the garage and give you notifications if either event happens.Install was relatively easy. Somehow a standard remote can work from anywhere within 25 ft, but this unit has only worked with 5 ft of the right side of the opener on the ceiling.

It's a similar setup to anything else added to control a garage door opener.  The hub learns the garage code the same way an external keypad or additional remote would work.  Only difference is that now this is a wifi-connected device that can be controlled by an app, to be able to trigger that same code from across the house or from the other side of the country.  The setup procedure is like many of the other IOT devices, where it provides its own wifi network, you connect your phone/app to it, then from that app, it is used to identify/connect to your actual wifi network.  Once you understand that workflow/process, it's pretty simple.  App is simple and effective, and I like the options for the alerts to be app-based, email-based, or both.Still waiting on a second sensor for our other door, out of stock at Amazon so getting it shipped directly from Chamberlain.

Installed on my 7 y/o LiftMaster and the process was simple. The install instructions are on the app and they make it really simple to get it up and running. Once working (took no more than an hour), the app makes it very easy to open and close the door, and you can have the app notify you when the door opens/closes. I like this most for the app notifications so I know when people are coming and going from my house. Good stuff!

We love our MyQ! It works well with both IOS and Android and was easy to install. I love being able to open/close the garage door with my cell phone or smartwatch and the convenience of checking if the door is open or closed anytime, anywhere. We travel a lot, so to have the piece of mind of making sure the garage door is secure is so worth it! I would highly recommend this purchase, the convenience and peace of mind you get is so worth it!

I bought this opener since i connects to existing garage door opener and works from my phone. I am handicapped and in a wheel chair and my ramp is in my garage. I use this to open the garage from in the house or out in the driveway as the button to open in the house is too high and the opener in the car uses batteries that die quickly. Now I use my phone which is always charged and is always on my side. Does not matter what car I am in or where I am in the house or driveway.Installed the device but could not get it to connect to my opener. Used the call me button from Amazons website and the connected me with manufacturer within minutes. Cleared the app per instructions from the tech Barb and was able to set it up on the first go. Issue was in app on my phone not the device
What I have1. Garage with two garage doors
Really great functionality, to check door status, & open/close from anywhere.Two minor annoyances:

DO NOT BUY EVER AND I MEAN EVER. IT DOESN'T WORK AT ALL.I can't believe your selling products that don't work. Every bit of your product doesn't work and you lie about what it does. It does nothing. I paid for a paper weight that plugs in. Talk about false advertising and stealing from your customers. Oh and to Amazon for saying this thing works for deliveries, when it doesn't work at all. So I hope your happy that your lying to your customers as well Amazon. I will be asking for a return and I'm seriously contemplating ending amazon prime. WAY TO GO! WAY TO GO!

I opened the box, installed the app and followed very easy instructions.  Took about 30 minutes to set up and configure.  Make sure you have good internet access in your garage and you will not have any problems.  As for Alexa integration it does not seem to be supported,  tried several recommenced apps but was never discoverable in the  Alexa app.  Did some investigating and found Chamberlain does not support voice control via Alexa directly,  possibly do to security concerns.  Overall its an excellent product.

I am tech savy so it was very easy for me to connect to my wifi and install. Even if you are not tech savy by the slightest, forget the instructions from the box, just download the app from the app store and there are step by step instructions with pictures in it. Just remember, your router needs to be able to support 2.4ghz wifi bandwidth. If yours doesn't connect, make sure it is enabled. Almost all routers will have 2.4, while newer ones will provide support for BOTH 5ghz and 2.4ghz. If you have one of the newer routers, you MUST connect your phone/tablet/computer to the 2.4ghz wifi signal THEN set the garage door up from there.

Wow.  This product was so simple to install and set up - took me less than 10 mins start to finish.  Hardest part was getting my ladder off the wall to mount the unit on the ceiling.  Works great!  Gives me peace of mind when I am out of the house or on travel.  I also like that I can set notifications for various things: door open after a certain hour; notification that is being opened, etc - my kids often forget to close the garage when they come in at night and the app will let me know - or, when out of town I can be notified if someone opens the garage.  Also as a side benefit, due to recent break-ins of cars in my area, I had stopped keeping my standard garage door opener in a vehicle that I keep outside - now when I use that car, I can use the app to close and open the garage door safely.  Bonus!  Love it.

Easy install with well done, simple video tutorials.  90% of the reason I asked for this for Christmas was to simply determine if my garage door was open or closed - I don't know how many times I've been 1/2 way to work and wondered "did I shut the garage door?".  Now I don't have to turn around.  A secondary benefit to me is to be able to remotely open and close the door, but not sure how much I would use that given the really annoying beeping upon remote closing (remote opening doesn't have the beeping).  The integration with Google Assistant is a bit clunky, one has to ask "Hey Google, ask MyQ if the garage door is closed" then a different MyQ voice comes on and answers the question (sometimes). Not seamless but easy to get used to and not the primary reason I bought this.  And at least at the time of this writing integration is free (although it does say for a limited time, whatever that means) despite some recent reviews.

Once installed & connected to wifi, it works as advertised.  Two things made my experience a nightmare however.  First, you must turn off your smartphone's mobile data or you will NEVER be able to complete the wifi setup!  Thankfully, I was able to talk to a real customer service tech who was able to figure this out.  The second thing is, you must choose your garage door motor from a list of manufacturers, but the list NEVER loads (using the app).  Again, customer service to the rescue...you can complete the installation by going to mychamberlain.com.  However, this site apparently will soon be abandoned.  Overall, a good product, and in retrospect I would have saved a lot of time IF I had gotten Chamberlain customer service techs involved sooner (again, those two individuals saved the day!).

I almost did not buy this product because I read the reviews about the subscription fee for Google Assistant integration.But the service seems to be free for now and with the money I saved buying it from the treasure truck I figure it will cover some of the service fees.

I purchased the hub + one additional sensor. I downloaded the app and used the app for setup / installation instructions. Two things I did differently: 1)  I mounted the hub on the wall opposite my doors rather than the ceiling - it did not effect performance. 2) I opened the hub and took a tiny screw and screwed it into the speaker (there's a tiny hole on top of it) - this "disabled" the annoying beeps that emit every time you close the door. I did not damage the hub or the circuit board, just the speaker.From start to finish I think I may have spent 15 minutes if not less setting up & installing. It's a breeze!

Product is very easy to install and integrate into your "smart" ecosystem. It paired with our Google home very easily and worked almost everytime for me each morning. I was upset I couldn't use voice to ever open it when I got home, only when I left in the morning. The deal breaker was it never worked for my wife, and it was pretty finicky most of the time with voice or in the app.I still think this has some improvements that are needed before I would use it again.... Returning it for now

Tried it out by driving to the nearest store after leaving the door open, and my wife at home to watch for prowling eyes. App came up quick on my smart phone and just pushed the button. The door closed. I then opened it again. Closed it again. Works perfect.Even comes in handy when I'm working around the yard or outside the house. If I forget to open the garage door, I just pull out my phone and press the open button. Easy as can be.

This garage door hub is great! It was a little difficult At first. I followed the instructions on the video and on the paper that came with it. I paired it with my door opener motor and the test worked fine, but after it was all mounted and I thought I was finished, it wouldn’t work- it was no longer paired. I went through the steps a couple more times and it worked fine again. I t has worked great ever since then. The WiFi signal isn’t super strong in the garage, so that could have been the issue. I am really enjoying the ability to open the garage door from inside the house and remote start my car on these chilly mornings!

This doesn’t work with Alexa?! Are you kidding me?! My FISH FEEDER works with Alexa!This is just beyond stupid that Chamberlain CHOOSES to make their product compatible with Alexa. ESPECIALLY when Amazon is heavily promoting this garage door opener to work with their Amazon Key service.

Based on reviews, I bought this product. Upon arrival and inspection, I found that the bracket and hardware was missing, and that the hub and sensor had already been activated. The sensor battery protection tab was removed and the battery was low as soon as I turned it on. I'm giving 2 stars due to terrible QC, but have since ordered a new system thanks to Amazon's amazing return/replace policy. As soon as I receive the new unit, I will revise my review. Chamberlain, this shouldn't happen. Not sure where it slipped but I'll give it another try.

I was hesitant to buy this because we rent and the garage opener was installed in 1999. The garage door remotes were so old that 1 of them didn't work which caused me and my husband to share the other remote - SO FRUSTRATING!! I was afraid it wouldn't be compatible (even though the website says compatible with products dated from 1993). I took a chance - purchased it on Wednesday, got it Thursday and it took roughly 10 minutes to install. Instructions were VERY EASY to follow!! I love that the app came with a short video. The device works perfect and now I can get rid of those old remotes and not worry about sharing the last remaining "working" remote!! I'm able to "invite" 3 additional people to access the garage on their phone (with app download) which works PERFECT for my MIL to enter our home through the garage when she visits. The beeping is a "tad-bit" loud BUT I view it as  a "notification" that the garage door is in use. All in all, great buy, easy to use, glad I decided to purchase!!

The app is great for guiding you. I would recommend watching the video and then before doing anything follow the app instructions. I put the sensor in the mide.of the top panel. Watched video and thst seemed fine. Then read the instructions by going next and saw I needed to put it left or right not center. So I removed it and placed it right. But before you choose a side look up overhead and see which side works best by the opener.Bottom line is I will be ordering another one for my other garage. It was so easy to do and for me, no issues.

I really wanted a smart garage door opener but didn't want to fork over $300+ when my opener works fine. That's where this product comes in. Super easy to install (I did have to move my router a tad closer to the window to reach way out to my garage for the hub). Once I got it setup I activated IFTTT and Google home. Now I can tell google to open/close my door or to check the status of it. I also created an IFTTT to close the door automatically after I leave home. I love the fact I can order additional sensors for $39 to add my other garage doors to this hub.

This the second unit I bought.  It does everything the listing says. My wife got me one last year for Christmas and it has worked flawlessly.  I have a second garage and wanted to purchase another Door Sensor so I could control both garages, however a second sensor would cost me another $59 which is what she paid last year.  Amazon had the unit for $19.99 on sale for Black Friday.  I would gladly pay twenty bucks for a second sensor, so that's what I did and now I have a "backup" hub if mine ever goes bad.

When I first bought this I was having issues with it staying discoverable.  It would work for about 24 hours then it would indicate no devices found.  Went through this a few times and gave up on it.  Then I found another review from some one having similar issues that had been resolved.I then went through the set-up routine again. I then logged onto my router and reserved the address the opener was using.

Note for installation: don’t view the videos as they do not comport with the step-by-step instructions. For example, in the video it appears you can install the sensor almost anywhere on the sectional door whereas the step-by-step specifies exactly the two places they are to go. Also, it is suggested to place the hub from “4 to 6 feet away” from the opener; don’t go more than four feet as the power cord only has about 4.5 feet of length. Bottom line, go slowly. In net, though, great product and works flawlessly.

This device works splendidly with my Wayne Dalton ProDrive garage door opener.  I bought a used one, and it lacked a bit in the documentation department, which was to be expected.  Normally, I can figure out most things, but I went ahead and performed the reset on the hub device (the thing with the light, which talks to your phone and wifi) and then I was able to update it, and get it all talking.  Then, I began the task of trying to pair it with the garage door--and I didn't attach it to the garage ceiling first because, well, what if I needed to hit reset, power it off, etc.  Also, I did not know that I needed the door sensor to be attached to the garage door before this pairing would successfully complete, I figured I would do that afterwards, when I was all done and then hanging everything up permanently.  You CANNOT complete the garage door opener pairing procedure without the door sensor installed on the garage door!!!  Once I figured that out, it was smooth sailing and the device works beautifully!I also installed a camera (Blink XT) in the garage facing outwards so that I can watch the garage door and verify that it does as the app says, and it hasn't failed a bit.  Also, the device has been quite resilient to power outages for over an hour--I would reset the breaker and it would eventually come back online without further intervention.

There are four people in my house and the garage door was inevitably left open at times. I would come home and the door would be open with no one home or it would be open all night. Now I have it set to notify me if it is open longer than 10 minutes. We've had a few burglaries in the neighborhood over the past year, especially when car doors get left unlocked or garage doors get left open. That isn't a problem for me any longer. The MyQ works great. No false notifications.

I bought this mainly to get the notifications about the door opening and closing...not the "key by amazon" function.  I was quite pleased with how easy it was to set up.  Simply install the app and follow the instructions (with videos).  The only reason I gave 4 stars for installation (instead of 5) is because you have to get up on a ladder and attach this to the ceiling of your garage.  (Although, I found it was working OK when it was at chest level on the wall, but since instructions wanted it on the ceiling, I did it.)

The installation of this went easily with the only real problem being a VPN app on my Android phone.  Once I disabled it and rebooted the phone, everything went smoothly.  I really like the fact I didn't have to hook into wires or point a laser at a mirror on the garage door.  The physical installation was very easy.I like the myQ app.  I like being able to see the status of my door from anywhere and if it is up, put it down.  I expecially like the schedule - I created a daily "close the door" event for bedtime and thus peace of mind.

Whatever you do, don’t buy this. I’m a really tech savvy guy connection should have been a breeze. I’ve been at this for over an hour. Now I’ve been on hold with tech support for over 30mins and still haven’t talked to anyone. The first time through, all the steps went smooth leading up to connecting to my opener. It wouldn’t connect (this list of openers it will and will not work with is really vague). So I followed the instructions for a factory reset. DONT DO THAT!!! Now nothing works. I can’t even get step one to sync.

This was my second one. I originally bought the one that has the adapter for the opener on a treasure truck before the craziness of Covid. This one I got for the other garage door. I was skeptical because I didn't think it would work since the other door has a different motor but it was just as easy to install as the other and works perfectly. We all have those days where we can't remember if we closed our garage door. This has been so awesome to have.

I got this as part of the Amazon Key bundle along with the Amazon Cloud Cam. It was easy to install when following the step by step via the MyQ app. Also, worth noting, I did not have to install it on the ceiling next to the garage door motor. Instead I decided to bolt it onto the wall closest to my Wifi router that I have in my garage because I wanted to ensure a good internet connection and easy access when I need to troubleshoot. Works well and opens/closes just fine. I didnt like that I can only close and not open the garage door with Alexa via IFTTT app. So, I opted not subscribe to the feature.

Added this sensor to my existing MyQ hub.  Installation and setup was very simple.  No issues whatsoever in pairing this to the hub and the hub to my NetGear Orbi router.  As others have mentioned, I wish I could turn off the beeping sound the hub emits was the door is opening/closing, but I'm sure this is a safety feature that they do not want you to override.

I have a Linear garage door opener. Considered upgrading to a full Wi-Fi opener, but glad I didn’t. Saved a lot of money by getting this. The install took less than five minutes. The app is beautiful, with facial recognition built-in so that you can get into the app securely and quickly. I love that my Amazon packages can now be delivered in my garage. I also love that I can open my garage when I’m not at home when I have people who need to stop by and grab some thing. Also that it automatically closes at night – can’t tell you how many times our kids left that door open all night long. No longer! I highly recommend this product to anybody in the market.

This thing is a complete mess. Instructions incomplete, help desk support horrible (They just read you the instructions) Very unreliable. I even installed a camera in the garage to make sure the door was actually closed. Finally I had enough and replaced it with the iSmartGate here on Amazon and my problems went away. I spent a couple of weekends trying to work with this thing, complete waste of time

This garage door tracker system is VERY useful.  Once you figure out how to set it up, it works like a charm.  Besides being able to open/close using your phone, it tracks how long the door is open (or closed) and can be programmed to send you notices if it meets a threshold that you set.The only potential issue-the battery that powers the door panels may run out and will not emit the signal to open (or close) leaving you stuck outside.  However, the instructions do tell you to check it every once in a while. Also, I wish that the instructions sharing access to family members are a little more clear since it is confusing,

My home security system has a sensor on door but never works right.  It says it’s open when not all the time.  Bought this so I would have peace of mind so I could know if I remembered to close.  I can just pop open the app and check. I also set a schedule so that if ever open after a certain time at night, it will automatically close even when home (like when I am in bed and would wonder if the garage was closed).  Had it for about a month now and love it.  It was very easy to install.  Should not be a problem as long as you have the proper Wi-Fi signal in garage.

Installed the MyQ Smart Door Opener on one of my Overhead garage door opener.  When trying to pair the MyQ with my garage door opener, it open and closes my door multiple times but then says its is unable to connect...  Tried to pair with the garage opener several times but same results.  It opens and closes it when you do the setup, but then tells you it failed.  So I am stuck with non-functioning system,  will see if support is any help, but I doubt it.Update: After dealing with there support I still can't get the opener to work correctly.  I can get it to pair with my opener and work one time, then it quits working and I have to go back thru setup again.  Completely worthless.

I live in a 1930s stucco home (basically a faraday box) so I was worried about getting a good wifi signal in my detached garage, but I have not had an issues with it.  It was easy to install and does exactly what I need it to do - tell me if my little pea brain forgot to close the garage door.  The only feature that I wish that it had would be to let me know if the garage door is left open more than a certain amount of time.

Picked up this as it was a suggestion from my brother in law.  Having two garage doors, I needed an additional sensor, but because the hub/sensor kit was on sale, it was actually cheaper to buy two of those instead of a stand-a-lone sensor :)  So, now I have an spare hub, power adapter and mounting hardware.  Anyway, I think it took me all of thirty or forty five minutes to install the whole thing.  Instructions are via the APP, which is nice because it even provides little video clips along the way to help guide you.  Nice touch!  Works great and so far very  with our purchase.  Of course, have not figured out the Alexa/Dot process yet.

My wife and i have a habit of leaving the garage door open when we leave so i was on the hunt for something i could use to operate the garage door away from home.  This was the first product i found that seemed to have what i needed and wanted to i tried it out, actually purchased used like new from amazon.  Product arrived with a bit of damage on the box which was expected.  Installed and set up the unit which took about 20 minutes total and this, so far, has solved my problems.  Now i have it set on a schedule and i worry about the garage door being left open less often!

This solved our garage door situation!  Our key pads were not working at all, and my husband who is not the handiest person around was able to order this and install very easily!  First we bought one unit, and then after it was so easy and worked so well, we bought the adapter for our other garage door.  I highly recommend this product for ease of install, and how easily it works on everyone's smart phone!  Everyone in my house has the app so it is like each of us has our own garage door opener!  So glad we go this!

I absolutely love this device, when it works.  I bought this December 15th and was having trouble mid January.  I followed the trouble shooting section of the directions and found that the sensor was defective.  I call February 5th to resolve the issue only to find that I was 5 days outside the return through amazon.  Amazon tries to connect me to chamberlain but they won’t honor the warranty because it was bought through amazon!  Be warned that amazon can open your garage door to put your packages in your garage.  However amazon and chamberlain will not warranty this product more than 30 days.  Total bull

When we recently lost our garage clicker, I decided I had enough.  FYI, we live in an apartment and have an individual garage at street level, which means that we can't access the garage any other way than opening the garage door from the street. It's annoying because you have to take the clicker in and out of the car... And then you lose it...  This thing took me about 10 minutes to instal.  Super easy to follow instructions on the app.  Works great and I like the added security feature that make the device beep and flash for a few seconds before the door closes.

Great product!!  Took 30 mins to install and that’s including signing up on the app.  The instructions the app took you through were very simple and clear to follow.  Simple!  Product works great and I love that I can now see the status of my garage whether it’s open or closed through the app.  There’s been times I left the house and didn’t remember.  Additionally I installed it on my kids phones and just made it simple for all.  I highly recommend this product.

I have bought this item with the bridge twice and none of them were working and the description is not correct. I have used it with chamberlain garage door opener and it lost the Wifi even though there was bridge and finally after a couple of months it failed to work and I had to remove the item and get another type. The app was not Freindly user and not sync with the unit or lost the connection and door stayed unopened, this was a waste of money and not recommended at all.

This was easy to setup and works well on my garage. I wish there was Alexa voice integration, but that might be a feature they add later on. Haven't tried to setup with IFTTT yet. I do enjoy the alerts if the garage is left open and the schedule to automatically close it at certain times. My only real gripe is the alarm that goes off whenever you close the garage through the app - i would like an option to completely disable this. It beeps for 5 seconds before even initiating the command to close the garage, keeps beeping while closing, and beeps for 5 more seconds after it closed (this is annoying)

I was under the impression this could do more then what I expected. It does not get added to Google Home. You can ask Google assistant to close the garage door or check if the door is closed. It will not open the door for you.  The app is nice and has some good features but does not beat the good old fashioned remote. Remote takes a press of the button to open.  To use the app I would have to take out my phone, unlock it, open the app, and then press the button to open the garage door. A little time consuming for something so simple.

Now that it is working I am happy. However, as others have stated in reviews the trouble to setup was very annoying.  Make sure you spend time learning about your home network and integrating it with the product. Cudos to Chamberlain they responded quickly to my connectivity issue quickly and their email had several suggestions to correct connection issue none of them worked and my ISP was useless! You definitely need a computer tech over the phone to help setup or strong networking background.

I have a good 2.4GHz WiFi signal in my garage, and the installation process was nearly effortless. Works like a champ.One silly bit of behavior from the iOS app: it apparently doesn’t understand that time is a continuous cycle of hours -  so setting an Alert when garage door is opened from 11pm-6am fails because the end time of the alert must be later than the start time. Fixed by setting an alert from 11p-11:59p, then one from 12a-6a, but it’s silly to have to work around that and shows a sloppy approach to the design and testing. Thus, I deducted one star.

I paired this with a chamberlain garage door after i got frustrated with my kids leaving the garage door open. This works with amazon lock and amazon deliveries now come inside the garage. Take time to install after watching the video from chamberlain. The phone app is very easy to use. Now you can be relieved if you are on the road and dont know if you left the garage door open. Amazon deliveries are safely delivered in your garage(with amazon lock). Get a $30 credit from amazon towards the price of this opener.

I got this as a backup remote, as sometimes when I walk, my outside keypad has trouble opening the door, and I wanted remote access to the door for helping family or others I don't want to set a code for.I was a fairly easy DIY install. I don't know why the included instructions don't give ALL the steps! They get you to the app and then the app guides you through the hardware install. But it wasn't that difficult and my garage is on the other side of the wall where the Wi-Fi router is. (This is important as you do need a strong signal.) The LOUD BEEPING can be annoying but is a SAFETY FEATURE! Since you can open, or more importantly, CLOSE the door from anywhere someone could be in the wrong place. The sound doesn't last that long and certainly isn't a reason to return this device!

I bought this as an alternative to getting off my motorcycle and manually inputting the code every time I ride it. Unfortunately, every time you open the app it forces you to input your FULL password! It allows for Face ID but that defeats the purpose of the product (making it easier to open my garage) if I have to take off my helmet the second I pull in my driveway. To my knowledge there isn’t an option to set up a 4 digit pin or anything like that either.. So for now it’s, pull in the driveway, put in full password, open garage door; or pull in driveway, remove helmet, Face ID, open garage door; or just get off the bike and manually input the code to open it as I did before. From what I understand I can buy the Apple “Home Bridge Kit” which will allow me to bypass the app altogether and set up geofencing so that my garage door just opens when I get within a preset distance from my house. At this time it looks like that’s my next step because this product alone didn’t solve anything for me really.. Other than being able to squash that sinking feeling of dread I get when I can’t remember if I closed the garage when I left my house. If you want it for that reason, it’s great. If you want it for making your life easier save yourself the headache and buy the “Home bridge kit” at the same time so you can have all the great features that come with home kit.

I was pleasantly surprised to find out this will integrate with not only Amazon Prime Garage Delivery, but with my Tend Secure security cameras.  As other reviewers have noted, you must follow the rules for the install:  two bars or more of wifi and proper placement distances for both pieces of equipment.  After some failed mansplaining I talked my guy into calling their customer service where they determined the hub was too close to the garage door engine.  When they say four feet, three feet away does not work! Trust me!

1st, I gave it 4 stars overall because it’s functionality is great. I didn’t give it more because I couldn’t find the installation instructions to review before I opened the box thinking there might be something in them that might keep me from doing the installation.Also, as I followed the installation video sometimes I’d pause it while I performed the step. Sometimes that caused the video to timeout making me find it in the app and starting them over again.

You can have Amazon Deliver packages by opening your Garage. So they should have all the  information they need to create a MyQ Skill for Alexa in partnership with Chamberlain Group. Having to rig something with another Skill/App just doesn't seem right to us Alexa Users. I was going to use garage delivery until I found no skill for Alexa. I did see that MyQ works with Google Assistant. Amazon take note!Added Note now even newer cars have Alexa access.  Chamberlain Group myQ take note our Automobiles use Alexa!

With 5 vehicles and 3 drivers, there never seems to be enough garage door openers to go around.  So this was an easy solution to spending a ton of cash on more clickers than we really needed, just to put one in/on each vehicle (3 cars, 2 motorcycles).  It was very easy to install, and works as advertised.  Without the loud, obnoxious beeping and lights flashing whenever you close the door with the app, it would be a 5-star rating.  I also value my family's safety, and having the app on a phone that only we have access to is safer in my opinion than a clicker.  Think about it:  If you have a clicker or use HomeLink as an accessory on your vehicle and your car were to get stolen, now the thief has not only your car, but your address (from your registration) and a way to access your home through the garage.  Ideally only you and those you trust most can access your cell phone, so your garage door is no longer a portal to all your belongings.

I love the simplicity of this MyQ Garage Door Opener.  The installation was very easy, the only trouble I had was getting my phone to recognize it.  I must say I had a Galaxy S6 Edge and the last time the software was updated was in 2017.  So that could have been the problem.  Once my phone recognized the app and the WiFi connected it’s been working like a well paid butler!  I highly recommend this.  I did not set up the Amazon Delivery app though.  I live in a newly built guarded community so I do not need that app.

I purchased the MyQ Smart Garage Door Opener for my two door garage. I purchased the MyQ hub for the second door. The installation was quick and set up was very easy for both. I am still getting used to the devices and haven't delved into the options available nor have I tried to integrate them into Alexa since I am still piecing together the IOT Smart Home devices I have purchased. So far this is a work in progress, but I am pleased with the performance of the MyQ Smart Garage Door Opener.

The opener is easy to set up, and works reliably enough, but the dealbreaker for me is- in a product advertising its Amazon Key capability- that it has zero integration with Alexa, and that's by design as the manufacturer intentionally removed the skill for integrating with it. This is just unacceptable for something pushed as part of an integrated smart home setup. Don't even know why Amazon lets them make it a part of things like Key when clearly they are going to do zero work to integrate it with the Amazon ecosystem.

I really really wish I could give this 5 stars. It was super easy to set up. Had it up and running in 10 mins. Super easy to use and the app was well put together. They even out in safety stickers so people know it's an auto door that can be remotely controlled. But the one, only and huge downfall is there is no, and I repeat no integration with alexa. Idk what is up but there is no skill. I would have never ordered it if I would have known this...

This product works very well and for the money is a real comfort. Our Door Openers are 2005 model Liftmaster base grade openers and they are working as advertised. We do a great deal of ordering from Amazon and we can include our 'code' on orders and the delivery driver can put packages right inside our garage when we are not there.  The instructions do caution that it may take several attempts to link the system to your network, this was true. We had to go through the 'linking' sequence (which is not difficult) several times before it finally was fully functional.

I like the way this product works, ONCE it's physically installed and, linked to our wireless network.  HOWEVER,I found it very frustrating try to follow provided instructions for linking to our home wireless network. Four times, I followed the directions which were enclosed for iphones, and, it didn't work. I was ready to return it. Then, on 12/15/17, we changed Internet/TV providers and, the installing technician noticed the box on my kitchen counter and commented a previous customer had this product and really liked it. I told him I hadn't been successful in linking the hub to our wireless network. Since he was installing a new network, and, while he waiting for some data to download, he said he would try to help. He spent over half an hour working on it.  He finally advised the instructions were incorrect and, he used instructions for Android phones instead. In order to complete the installation, it was necessary to push the Learn button on the garage door opener, and, he was able to set up the system so it operates correctly.  He said the process was extremely challenging and, he's a person with a technical background and training!  Colleen in Olathe, Ks

I bought this system with additional door sensor to control my two garage doors with my nest secure system hoping it would integrate into my home security system since it advertises that it "works with nest" the truth is in the myq app you can set home or away settings in your nest system but you can't access the control of the garage doors with nest and it won't trigger your alarm if someone opens a garage door when your nest secure alarm is armed, best you can do is get a notification to your phone that the garage door has been opened if your nest is set to away. so when I'm home at night if someone were to show up and manage to open my garage door it won't notify me. This product does seem to work good so far I just wish the product had been more clear when advertising that it works with nest but I never found any details claiming it wouldn't integrate into my next app. Hopefully nest will release something like this that works in their ecosystem soon.

As I understand it, the Q doesn’t work with the echo (or any voice  command devices) unless you pay a yearly fee to Q. With that being said my Q and  genie garage door opener work flawlessly together . I can check on my door from anywhere through my Iphone and control my door from anywhere with my IPhone. It is added  security but even if you are logged onto your phone the app requires you to log on to it a second time to be able to open and close the garage door.. Not my favorite part, as most of the time I’m driving when I need the door to open or close. I gave it 4 stars out of 5, because of the second log in and not being  Integratable with Amazon Alexa

Very easy to install, however it changed my garage door opening code so it took me a while to figure out how to match my car garage door opener with the newly coded garage door opener.  Booma it works well, the cell phone chicka pop feature is why I purchased it and it was very Sarver intuitive and easy to install.  I recommend Steelers it highly because of the features compare to cost

Overall the device does what I want it to do, it informs me when the door opens or closes , I should note the device responds to an open or close command from the app within seconds.  I would have given 5 stars but for two reasons, 1) documentation is limited, however more detailed information can be found online ie) to reset the device hold the gear labelled button until blue led flashes 2) when first configuring the device i mistakenly entered the wrong password for my home network, as a result the myq hub got into an unknown state, it took several resets of the hub and resetting the app on my iPhone to get it to a state i could start the setup process from the beginning again.

I purchased this device so I would not have to purchase several individual garage door openers.  With three cars and only one car with a built in garage door button, anyone who drove the other two cars had to open the garage with the external key pad.  The original remotes stopped working reliably, even with fresh batteries.Pairing the device to WiFi was not hard, nor pairing it with the door sensor.  Where the challenge occurred was connecting it to the opener.  It wasn't until I saw a YouTube video where the person said to push the learn button once and don't touch it after the blinking learn light goes out, that I had no issues.  I did that and the system learned the opener on the first try.

my luck it didnt start glitching out till just after the return policy time!  so i keep getting the same issue.  twice now i ahve closed the door and it has given me a alert saying its still open.  i have turned around and driven back home only to find out it closed.  On top of thatSometimes i like to open my garage door 1/2 way up if i am working in the garage and i want fresh to let sawdust out or if its raining hard etc.  When i do this it can understand the cycle.  Once i close the door i keep getting the error saying its open.

We had purchased new garage door openers several years ago, but did not get the WiFI option. Later, we found ourselves asking if we had closed the garage door and having to go back home to check. We purchased this unit so we could check and operate the garage door by phone. Installation was easy and setup was done using the MyQ application. We had none of the issues that others have experienced.Delivery was excellent and packaged well. Unit works as advertised.

I bought this to use with a Genie brand garage door opener and it works well. Installation took about 20 minutes but everything went as expected.Make sure you read the other reviews about potential "gotchas" and print out the instructions from the Chamberlain website before trying to install it. The printed instructions that come with the physical unit are incomplete. Make sure your Wifi network is on 2.4GHz Wifi as the unit isn't compatible with 5GHz (Disable the 5Gz network if you need to.)

Following the instructions (always key) I was able to easily install the MyQ app on my iPhone and connect to my Chamberlain 2007 Liftmaster opener. The model name is required and was not present but an internet search of the model number located by the learn button provided that piece of information.I did receive some erroneous error messages when pairing the door sensor with the main unit only to find they had paired successfully. That was a bit strange

I've had this product for just over a year for two garage doors.  One of them works well, the other is very inconsistent.  I will tell the garage door to open/close and it only works about half the time.I originally was skeptical about buying the product because I wanted a garage door that worked with alexa or with wink that I could then use alexa to control.  I read the reviews, and I knew it didn't work with alexa, but I also read the questions and saw that Chamberlain had been replying to questions (since 2017) promising that support for more 3rd party integrations was coming.  In 2018 they went on to say that they realize their customers want alexa integration and that they are working on it.  Here we are in 2019 and they still don't have alexa integration.  They still charge $10 to integrate with IFTTT.  I have no confidence that they're ever integrate with alexa.  It's not that hard to build an alexa skill at this point.  I wish I had bought a different product.

Although my new truck has the integrated garage door opener, I tried several times unsuccessfully to connect it to my garage door opener.  I had lost the original garage door remote years ago, but it was never an issue until I sold my Sequoia.  Now with my new 4 Runner not being able to connect I constantly have to get out to open and close my garage door....that is until last month when I bought this wifi enabled garage door opener.  It literally took less than 5 minutes to install and now I can open and close my garage door from anywhere through my phone.  I've even closed the door from 3 hours away when I realized I left my door open after leaving super early for a lacrosse tournament.  I checked my app, it said it's been open for 3 hours and 1w minutes, I tapped on the app and within seconds my home was secure.  Highly recommend this product to anyone who lost their opener or sometimes wonders if they left their door open.

Poor support, user forum shut down, contradictory Quick start guide-manual-app directions, restricted hub to opener RF range window.  MyQ Smart hub failed to pair with my 2009 Chamberlain opener.  Stuck with "Monitor Door Only"Chamberlain support on MyQ Smart hub did not cover this opener pairing topic.  Web support email request to Chamberlain ignored for 1 week so far.  No Saturday evening PDT or Sunday voice or chat support for DIYers

The installation was easier than I thought, and the hub itself functions much better than I expected. It took me about 30 minutes from start to finish. After installing it works flawlessly for me and are miles better than my outdoor entry keypad. Though I wish the app had a functionality to auto-close the door if it is left open for more than 30 minutes. The flashing light and beeping upon remote door close is annoying and cannot be disabled, but I suppose it's a good security feature to have in place.

I bought this device primarily so I could have in-garage delivery of my packages.  It worked perfectly!  The device is very easy to set up.  I placed it on top of the cabinet instead of mounting it on the ceiling because I don't have an outlet in the ceiling.  It's about 12 feet from the garage opener and still works great.The fact that I can remotely verify the garage door is closed, as well as open or close the garage door using the app is wonderful.  Great purchase at a great price.

I had been considering a smart garage door control for a while.  When this particular model showed up in the Amazon Warehouse, I peaked at the reviews and decided to give it a try.  I can't imagine a more simple, yet intuitive solution.  I unboxed it, plugged it in and downloaded the app (required for setup) to my phone.  I was able to open/close my garage door in less than 10 minutes.  It took another 10 to mount the hub.  Though it has only been a week, I'm very pleased with this product.  I have not (don't plan to) integrate with Alexa.  However, I may search IFTTT for integrations with other devices in my home (lighting, camera, etc).  I would certainly recommend this product to friends, family and other Amazon shoppers!

Awesome product.  Had car get broken into several times.  Of course theives stole remote and got into garage.  This solves my security issue as car(s) no longer have remote in car.  Have app on my phone that alerts me when door open or closed.  I am able to open door from outside house no extra keypad.  It took only a few minutes to install and setup.  Highly recommend to increase security at house.

I didn't see it anywhere other than the box (after it arrived, and not very prominent), not on this page or in the instructions, but iOS 10 or higher is required.  Shame. Lazy.Instructions for Android forget to mention pairing with your home's wireless network, oddly the iOS instructions do and that step can be done on a pre-iOS 10 device.  Lazy.

If you’re trying to change the Wi-Fi network on your Chamberlain hub, you press and hold the settings button to get a blinking blue light on the hub. If you press and release the button normally/quickly you will get a flashing blue light as described, but you won’t be able to change the Wi-Fi. You really do have to press and HOLD UNTIL the blue light blinks. Also this door opener has a super annoying warning beep/alarm that goes off when you use it. This is required by law for 5 seconds, but this alarm goes on much longer (20 seconds or more).

Hi.I was initially very impressed with the way things worked. It was reasonably easy to install and put it. Worked fine for a month. Then suddenly the app did not have any information on my device and I had to basically redo the whole setup process!!

Work as advertised, installation instruction can be better but using common sense it can be install without any instructions.  I have 2 of them in 2 different houses both works fine.  Notification in your phone if you turn it on is really fast.  When closing the door there is annoying beep, according to them it is for security should have ON/OFF button or option but not. With my iPhone 7 I use finger print readers when I open the app it works nicely, using it for couple of months so far no issues

After about 2 months of use with the MyQ-G030 Garage Door Opener for my Chamberlain overhead door I am very pleased.  Installation was a breeze and I found the included instructions to be spot-on.  I only use the MyQ system with my android smart phone application and have not found it necessary to incorporate either an Alexa or Google voice control system.  This keeps it simple and dependable without paying any monthly or annual fee(s) to Chamberlain. Highly recommended especially if you exclusively use a smartphone application for usage.

I love my MyQ garage opener! I have been able to allow people into my home without being there and without having to give a code to the front door! Also I have a screen door that I often lock so there's no access to my front door to access the code! In these instances I can open my garage door remotely if someone needs entry into my home! For example, my son when he leaves his keys in his room and no one is home when he returns from school!

This product is good in that it can remotely open and close your garage door with your phone. BUT be warned that it DOES NOT link to your google home. It does link to your google assist but you have to tell google assist to talk to myQ before any commands work. This the worst interface ever. Very disappointing that it can't just be directly linked like every other smart product. Hopefully they change that or update it soon. Till then I would save my money and get something else.

I purchased this unit to add smart features to my existing Genie garage door opener.  It performs that function quite well.  The big drawback is there is only one way to control without paying an extra fee and that is through the MyQ app.  The unit also doesn't integrate with Alexa at all (although it is compatible with Amazon Key).  None of this is a deal breaker as it performs its core function well and was easy to install and setup.  For the price I paid on Prime Day, I am quite pleased with the unit.  Just be aware of the shortcomings.

The product would not work without setting up an account. When you set up the account it requires that you validate your email. When you click to validate the email you get a page with this, "We're sorry but there was a problem with the page you were trying to access. We took note of the error and hope to address the issue soon."Could not get past that.

I was alerted about this item from an Amazon Truck deal. After purchasing I read several reviews about this product but felt unsure of the person who I bought the garage door opener for would like it. They did like the gift but the new garage door that they currently have already has a similar device installed already since it's a newer model door. I gave three stars for this product in hopes that my review would be deemed neutral. The return was easy although I had to contact Amazon about my refund.

I purchased two MyQ Hubs and two additional sensors for my parents 4 garage doors.  I'm very surprised at how easy this was to setup once I got the first garage door opener to pair w/ the hub. I set a schedule for them to close @ 6pm every day so my elderly parents wouldn't have to go outside @ night to close them. It works perfectly. You can even set an email notification when they close. Very pleased with this purchase. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone.

Been using this product for years. When this went on sale, I bought a couple as Christmas gifts. Gave one to a fiend of mine last Christmas and he was very thankful for it. He and his family have been using it since. We both love the convenience of having the ability to check your garage door status. Now there’s no need for me to come back home whether I have doubt if I’ve closed the garage door or not. So many countless times I had to turn around and see whether I closed the garage door or not. I recommend for people to have this device.

Wow!!  How can people complain about this product.  I was t sure if I should get it after reading a few reviews but I really needed it.  If you can’t follow a simple tutorial, you shouldn’t be buying this product or Just let your teenager install it for you, it’s that simple. It took me maybe 10-15 minutes. Easy easy set up and no problems.  Just make sure you have WiFi signal that reaches the garage.

The physical installation is simple and I had no issues with the initial application install or wifi setup. What did turn into a problem was the Chamberlain MyQ would not connect with my Chamberlain Garage Opener. No errors, no diagnostics, no way to troubleshoot, and on a Sunday afternoon, no tech support. I left it overnight and, prior to calling tech support, started from the top. The app was smart enough to identify I had already done the wifi, and when it came time to pair, it worked first time.But - it won't directly integrate with Google home. The integration with Google Assistant is like invoking an Alexa skill and is very limited. It's best just to stay inside the native app on the phone. If I can turn off/down/shorten the "closing beeper" I can't find it. If I can rename the "Garage Door Opener" to "Garage Door" to shorten the command, I can't find it. Trying to find useful support articles on the website is difficult. While Google returns related items, when you arrive at myQ Support, you never get the "discussion", just the general help. Be aware that a "subscription" is required to integrate with Google, etc., though at present the fee is waived.

I bought this on Amazon Prime Day.  We have been converting our home to be a smart home and this was one area that needed attention.  It was easy to install and works as it should.  I did have to use IFTTT to integrate with Alexa.  If there was a Alexa skill, I could not find it. I think the company needs to address this.  Because closing the garage door is something I don't give direct attention,  I occasionally find myself on my way to the gym and can't remember if I closed the garage door. In the past , I would turn around and go back home to check.  Now I can just pull up the app on my phone and assure myself that I did indeed close the door!

This product is great. I really didn't purchase it to replace the remotes or the button on the wall in the garage. It's more of a piece of mind that I know the garage is shut as I occasionally will forget to close it when I leave. If I want to let a visiting family member in the house that doesn't already have a key, I can easily do it as I haven't got around to purchasing a smart door lock yet. I user it with my Google Hub, so it does integrate with Google. I do recommend the product.

This is a great feature and addition to any garage door. This hub allows you to control your garage door opener from anywhere on planet earth. Crazy right?The other crazy thing is it just randomly opens the door whenever it feels like getting fresh air. Not cool. Especially if your garage is full of awesome stuff that randoms can just walk in and grab.

I bought the MyQ hub to use with my 3yr old Liftmaster garage opener. Installation went well. No problems. Instructions were pretty clear and the install videos in app helped as well. Very smooth install and the MyQ app worked great for opening closing via phone, and notifications when it opens or closes. Also I like the scheduler (although I haven't tested that part yet).Several complaints though. One the closing siren is a bit loud. I know it is a safety thing, but honestly my garage door isn't exactly quiet. The door alone is probably noisy enough to warn people.

If you have teenagers, or others, who leave the house and forget to close the garage door this is the solution for you.  I searched other comparable products and chose this one.  The most effort to installing this product is mounting the hub to your garage ceiling.  The install instructions are clear and easy to follow.  If you follow the included instructions the integration and setup are super easy.  I love the "open door" alerts on my phone and set mine for 10 minutes.  I also scheduled it to automatically close at two times of night for when my daughters come home late and forget to close the garage door.

Apple Watch app is useless without the expensive addon (3x this), there is no Alexa integration, and IFTTT will require subscription fees. So all in all, kind of a big bait and switch, unless maybe you are  a google automation user. Ended up getting Siri Shortcuts to work with another switch that ALSO wanted an IFTTT subscription.Really strange that they offer Amazon Key integration and no Alexa. WTF is all I can say.

At a little under 4 months, this product began sending false alerts stating the garage door was left open when it was in fact, closed. Following all of the FAQ's, I checked the door sensors which work fine, and deleted then re-installed the app as well as installed a new battery in the door sensor. None of this took care of the issue which has continued for several weeks. I contacted the seller through the support link on Amazon weeks ago with no response.  Since the unit continues to send out false alerts, it cannot be trusted with the security of my home.  Another unit purchased as a gift has been flawless, as was this one for several month before the issues started. I cannot recommend this to anyone based on the lack of response to support requests by the company, as there is no option for exchanging the unit when they don't reply to requests for service.

Tgis was a very cost effective way to integrate an older garage door opener into a smart home environment. Follow the instructions and the garate door status monitor will work instantaneously. It was more work to get the  smart phone app to operate the opener. The support page on Chambo's website had enough help for me to complete the pairing. My learn button apparently was purple at some point, but looks brownish red-orange now. The site mentioned that faded purple may appear brown. That was all the guidance needed.

I installed this in minutes without any help!  I love being able to know my kid really did close the garage and that I can let my animal caretakers in should their garage fobs fail when I’m out of town (would’ve saved a broken window had I gotten this sooner). The only feature I dislike is the long/loud beeping that happens before and during close if. However, it’s a necessary safety feature if you’re closing it remotely should someone be in the way since you can’t see them.

The problems started with installation.  I have over 20 WIFI connected items in my house and never an issue with installation.  But the installation and setup required a call to the Support desk.  I got a very helpful rep and we got it working.  Then it was hit or miss if the device worked.  I called Support and followed all the suggestions.  At one point they told me to replace the battery in the door sensor even though it was a brand new device.  They blamed Amazon for repackaging old devices.  Spent another $5 for a new battery but no improvement.  I have three hours into the MyQ.  I’m done...returning it.

Just bought a house that has a Chamberlain door and I was disappointed to learn it did not have wifi capability. Then I discovered this product and purchased it. Took me maybe 10 mins tops to install and program it and it is truly fantastic. I have already let several workmen into my house, and I know when my daughter gets home and leaves. I love this and I love how easy it is to install and use.
