installed okay, but afterwards other remote control transmitters would not work. I had to set them up again. But then I  found that they could not all work "together". that is, only 4 remotes could be set up with my particular garage door opener. the myq was the 5th, so one of the others has to be discarded for myq to work.additionally, the wifi connection is weak, won't stay connected, although other wifi devices in the garage work okay.

There has been a few times when I would leave for work and have this guilty conscience on my mind that I had left the garage door open. I would turn around already miles away just to find that I had closed the garage door and I would end up cutting it close being late for work. This is a very easy installation and setup. And now i no longer need to turn around to see if I had closed the garage, all I have to do is open my app, and check. If it is open, I am able to close it from my app. All I need now is to buy the HomeKit hub so I can control it with Siri and the home app.

This is one of those truly great smart home products that sneaks up on you with how cool it is. What starts as a relatively simple way to open and close your garage door from anywhere with your phone turns into a long list of ways to use it and make life easier! In the short time I've had the MyQ Smart Garage Hub, I've already...- Pulled out the driveway on my way to work and forgotten to close my garage so I used MyQ to close it

As a IT professional, this took me almost an hour to setup while watching multiple videos.  I have a Genie 2028 which it said it was compatible online but saw reviews that it wasn't.  I was finally able to get it to work to only find out that it doesn't integrate with Google Home as it states on the website and you have to use IFTT and Google Assistant to get it to work.  You can also only close the garage or have the light turn on/off.  Totally useless without complete Google Home integration and the ability to actually open the garage.  I am returning this to get a device that hopefully will give me complete control over opening and closing the garage door.

When it's working its great, but I can't count on it working. It often has the wrong door status. Get alert that door is open, so I remotely "close" it only to have a neighbor tell me my door is now open.  Batteries in sensors only last a few months and when they start to go is when I notice its not accurate.  Trying to repair with multiple doors inevitable requires me to clear and reprogram all the remotes on one door in order to not have it sent open/close commands to both doors together instead of independently

Based on some of the reviews, I was a bit hesitant about installing this. But the only hiccup I experienced was caused by my existing garage door motorized unit. It is an older model in a home I just bought. I called the Help line and they talked me through the adaptations to make. This works great.Another advantage of this unit. Recently we had relatives coming to our house and we were not there to open the door for them (having been delayed elsewhere.) We used this unit to open the garage door for them so they could go into the house and wait for us.

Great product. Works well. Glad iI bought this. Only complaint is that if it loses power, due to an outage or whatever reason. It doesn’t reconnect to wifi automatically once it has power again. Which means I have to grab a ladder and go i to my garage and press the button on side of the hub and use the app the reconnect it to my wifi network. Wish it would do this automatically. So if you’re away from home and lose power through out the day at your home. You won’t be able to open or close garage door using the app until you can reconnect wifi at the hun.

When it works, it is good, when it doesn't, not so good. Installed according to directions, worked, didn't work, worked, didn't work. Talked to CS, then Tech support. Decided sensor was bad and sent me a new one. Worked, didn't work, worked, didn't work. Tech support again and they had me move sensor, worked, didn't, worked, didn't. Called again and wanted me to move plug in remote, completely different location than the direction require. This all happened over a couple months and every call I would spend another hour re-programming their unit, our hand held remotes, garage key pad and both cars, just to find out a couple days later, their unit would not work. Done, waste of a lot of time, money, great concept, it just does not work on a consistent basis so we removed it and went back to the old fashioned way, remotes, keypad or car remote.
Pros:-It works, and does what it claims.

I like the concept of this and I got it on a deal of the day. It's a great concept and works great with my smartphone. However, to add more functionality through IFTTT and other integrations, you have to pay a subscription which is completely  silly. IFTTT is FREE and I have many other applets with it. So, Chamberlain is trying to extract money on something that most other services use for free. Very silly. I'll just keep using my phone app only. I also really want Amazon to hurry up and get Amazon Key in my area so I can use it for deliveries.

I installed this in my garage with a 1975 Craftsman garage door opener (green setup button) and this is superb. So many times I have to turn back home to check or close the garage door. I installed a small cam inside the garage so I could see if the doors were open or closed. But even if one was left open I still had to turn around and go home to close it. Now with this device I can close it from anywhere with the MyQ app.  I am so pleased I am beside myself. Just loving this device and hoping it stands up in time.

Easy to install, works well, no issues to report.  I read a number of reviews that stated it was difficult to connect to your home network.  This is totally not the case. Read the directions. If you have an IOS device there is an insert with instructions that are different than other devices. It is very easy to setup. We have a finished garage with a beam running the length of the garage. I had to install the hub in the ceiling which blocks the wifi hub from the piece that attaches to the garage door. The system still connects with no issue.  Worth every penny. I did purchase the extended warranty. Hopefully this unit will stand the test of time.

Excellent step-by-step instructions. Easy installation. Outstanding value. Works fantastic. Essential that you have good Wi-Fi Internet connections exactly where you install the hub. Note hub location between garage door openers and location of sensors on doors. This is exactly per instructions. Result? No problems and great functionality.

Let me start of by saying this  installation is not so simple, look at YouTube video on how to install and use some  of your know how if you think that you can not do that from the get go better to leave it to someone else and save yourself a lot of headaches maybe a friend or a good neighbor. If you are a DIY kind of person then you should be able to do it with no trouble.I have had fun with this project and am thankful that we can purchase these kind of devices to make our lives much easier.

the directions are absolutely awful! This deserves 5 stars, it's so wonderful, but the directions are SOOO bad that I was told after setup, that it was only good for monitoring my garage door(Genie). But instead of preparing to send it back, I chose not to believe it and explored the possibility of what they might have meant by hitting the "Transmit Button." WHAT transmit button!?!? Where? On what device?!?!? There's going to be a lot of unnecessary returns on this because of the inadequate setup instructions.

Very simple to install with easy to follow directions. Probably took me 10min. My main advice would be: do mount the hub to the ceiling like they show in the directions.  I did this at first and figured it would be best since its out of the way. This hindered the hub and sensor from communicating properly.  The door would go up but rarely come down. I moved it to the front wall of my garage facing the garage door, since then I've had zero issues.

Love this thing. I can now tell when my kids leave for school and when they come home. I can see if they forgot to close the door also.The instructions weren’t too bad. There is one spot where they say to test the unit and if the receiver doesn’t respond the battery is dead. The place they put this instruction led me to believe that I needed to do the test as part of the setup process. So it fails and off to target I go to get this odd shape battery. Come home and it’s the same result. Fails the test.

I read the review on this and was a little apprehensive after seeing a couple that said it was hard to set up.  I decided to take a chance anyway since it was a prime day deal at 29.99.  It can quickly and I opened it up and downloaded the app and created a user account.  Later that night, about 9:30, I decided to give it a look.  I installed the unit next to the door opener and plugged it in.  pulled up the app and walked through the instructions to set it all up.  I then programmed it to my door opener and gave it a test and it worked like a champ.  I was back in th house by 10:15.  Easy Peasy.  I decided NOT to set it to Alexa however since, ANYONE can tell Alexa to open the garage door.  I suppose I could give it a funky name no one would know though so I might change my mind later.

Great addition to a smart house. Have always been concerned about if the garage was closed and this product gives me that reassurance plus more. Did really think I would use the WiFi open/close feature much but with the Apple Watch app I find I use it all the time and my exterior keypad is no longer used. Great product and easy to install. Only frustrating part was pairing with my current unit as the colors of the buttons have faded over time which you use to identify the unit type. But after a few tries it worked. Love it!

DOES NOT WORK WITH ALEXA OR GOOGLE without subscription. MyQ marketing is very misleading about it's "integration". I also had trouble with the setup of my garage door. I was trying to pair it and the app said it wasn't paired, but it was actively opening/closing my garage door. Also, the sensor requires a battery with is very annoying to think that I'd have to replace it. The sensor also uses adhesive strip to mount on the garage door... Terrible way to mount something. Those strips won't last a year in Texas.

Relatively easy to install, but may be challenge for some.  The door opening process is kind of slow and the closing process is really Loud (it engages a safety alarm function every time) and it's slow.  Having it on the network did save me once after I locked myself out - if you have the app installed, you can open the door with your phone.  I haven't had to use it for guests or anything else - but I can see this would be useful as you can email a link to others if needed.

This product work as intended.I don't have any SMART HOME HUB all i wanted was peace of mind in case i left the door open which has happened a few times to me in the past making me waste time and truing around.

Bought this on sale on Prime Day for $29.99. It was a great deal and so far I have been very happy with it. Installation was very easy. The only complaint I have is that the myQ app installation process quits after a short while and you have to start the process all over. It does not remember what step you were on. Other than that, it was very simple and it functions very well. I use the app on my Apple Watch to control it. It responds fast and is extremely convent. I also set up SIRI Shortcuts so I can just ask SIRI to open, close, or what the status of my garage door is. I have not used this with Alexa yet. This was a great buy.

I installed this MyQ Smart Garage Door opener a week ago. So far it works as advertised. I can open and close the door from anywhere, I can check my phone to confirm if the door is up or down so no more stressing out on whether I should turn around and check or not lol. The push alerts work very well and show up almost instantaneously. I disabled the email alerts because they take a while to show up and make you think that there was another garage door event. When closing the door through the app, here is a delay and it makes a super loud beeping noise which is kind of annoying but I can deal with it because I will only use it to close remotely anyway.

I bought 2 of theses for my 2-door garage.  The installation went smoothly.  Instructions were easy to follow.  I tried to find some caveats for this product, but the only thing I found is the delay between when the garage door opens or closes and when I get a notification on my phone.  I noticed that when a garage door opens, I get notification within about 10 seconds.  When it closes, the notification comes in between 20-25 seconds.  Other than that, product is great!

I was a little skeptical after reading some of the reviews, but I really needed something for our second home so that I can open and close the garage remotely when our trash pick up service comes to collect our garbage from inside the garage. The set up was very easy; I just installed the app and followed the instructions. It took me about 30 minutes to set up by myself. The only issue: the anchors for the screws that are supposed to attach the unit to the wall via a bracket were pretty cheap and didn't hold up. They collapsed when I tried to insert them into the hole I drilled in the drywall. Luckily, the unit it is supposed to hold is very light, so the screws themselves were strong enough to hold the bracket that houses the unit. After installation, everything worked as expected. My old garage opener still works with this installed, and now I can control the garage door with my phone, and I can tell the status of the door at any time. I installed it last week and so far it hasn't failed while I have been here. I will have to test it when I'm back at my other residence 6 hours away.

Took about 1 hour to finally pair with my Genie ProMax. I don't know what the problem was but that was a long time to stand on a ladder.  I have paired both my new cars to the door opener so I know it wasn't a problem with the opener. Unfortunately, this does not work with Smartthings or I'd put these on my other garage doors.

Does not integrate with google home. They want a subscription. Even then, it does not work natively with google home, it runs through an app.And don’t get me started on the beeping. It sounds like a damn smoke detector going off every time you open or close the door through the app. It doesn’t even stop when the garage door stops, it just keeps going. Also, you can’t disable it. Wtf were they thinking.

This one never worked for me. The app did not find it at first. In the second leg after trying from an older phone, the remote sensor wouldn't connect.Realized that a friend of mine also bought it but has been having trouble on its reliability of use. I saw him to into his garage and manually close when his MGo app couldn't close the app.

Flawless amazon deliveries. No complaints. Very courteous service by delivery drivers , I have a Wyze cam installed to look over the deliveries , they are very careful about the placement of the packages very careful about closing the garage door I am very impressed Good Job delivery drivers Thank you so much. The device works flawlessly I also like that the device will sound an alarm warning that the garage door is getting ready to close an important safety feature being that I have a child at home. Thank you

Bought this MyQ Hub so I could remotely check to make sure my garage door was closed (my kids are hit/miss on closing it when they leave).  Also, being able to open it from wherever I am in case I need to let someone in, like a neighbor to let the dogs out, is a big plus.  Plus it works like just another garage door opener remote that is always in my pocket.  The app works great, easy download and configuration, no bugs or crashes, and there are numerous security features for when a username and password is required that can be toggled on and off depending on your needs.  Installation was relatively easy and works fine with my Genie garage door opener.  The part where you link the hub to your home wifi isn't foolproof, but I figured it out without having to call tech support (hint: when I connected my cell phone to the MyQ hub so I could configure it with my home wifi I had to click on the configure router link in the app rather than going to the web link in the instructions).  Very happy with it to the point I'm getting one for my parents for Christmas.

I spent about 4 hours installing. I installed the MyQ hub and sensors on two garage doors. This part of installation was very simple. However, had difficulty in getting garage doors to open and close from MyQ phone app. Eventually, had to call service support. The service rep was great, however, it took several hours to resolve. The fix was SIMPLE. Double tap on the garage door icon in the MyQ app. Apparently, since I installed two sensors (one on each door) a single tap only confused the MyQ app, and it appeared to try and open/close the doors, but nothing happened. Again, the fix was simple. just double tap the garage door icon in the MyQ app (installed on an android device).I would have rated this product a 5 star. However, I spent many hours in an attempt to get my garage doors to open and close from the MyQ app. Other than that, great product! Service was also great!

I have never been so frustrated with a product. I have two Chamberlain/Liftmaster garage door openers. I bought two sensors to go with the hub in order to control both doors. I have spent over 2.5 hours on the phone with their customer support, have been sent a replacement door sensor and still cannot get this product to function properly. The problems are inconsistent: sometimes it won't display the proper position of the door, sometimes it won't sync to the garage opener, it will never allow both sensors to be installed and working. Most of my home is "smart" and I work on computers so this isn't a case of "operator error."  This product simply does not work as advertised and I am just cutting my losses and putting it in the trash can after wasting hours trying to get it to work correctly.

We moved into a house that had a newer  Chamberlain garage door opener. Unfortunately there wasn't any remotes left for it. I tried buying replacement ones from the vendor, they didn't work. I bought this on Prime Day. It was very easy to install. Worked seamlessly with my phone. Alexa integration was very easy too.  Door opener works great and I no longer have to worry about 'porch pirates" taking my Amazon packages! I even get a message on my phone every time it opens or closes I am very happy with the My Q.

Not a difficult installation but you might need to repeat a few parts of the setup multiple times before it takes. I also had to reprogram the Homelink in one of my cars after this was paired to my garage door opener. I have no idea if this was a glitch with the MyQ or the opener but it's something to look out for.Once it's installed it works great. It's not quite the perfect and complete integration as I've got with the Chamberlain garage door opener that has MyQ built in but the differences are really minor and nothing worth passing this up for.

We apparently have a lot of RFI around our garage. We could hardly get our old automatic garage opener to work unless you got out of your vehicle and stood next to the garage in a certain spot and clicked the button. Now we can open the door from anywhere. Installation was very easy. The instruction were simple and well written. I worried about our WiFi reaching the garage, and did have to move our router to the middle of the house instead of the front. But once I did we had no issues and my husband loves just using his phone to open the garage.

"SMART COLLABORATIONS Linking your myQ account to Google Assistant and IFTTT is free for a limited time. No credit card required"This made me think it would work just like everything else I've linked to my Google Home. The process was horrible. It wasn't spelled out properly. I've linked many brands of things to my Google stuff before and I've never had as difficult a time. In the end I've learned you can't just say "OK Google, Open the garage door". You have to say "Ok Google, talk to MyQ." Then it connects to MyQ and another voice asks you if you want to know if your garage door is closed or if you want to close a door. It doesn't have an option to open the door. It's clunky and it's much easier/quicker to open the app and press the button to open. I was hoping for hands free operation.

When this HUB works its fantastic, easy to use and set-up.  The problem is the sensor loses pairing or errors and has to be re-sync'd, for me this has been consistently every 5-6weeks.  The last time I had to completely uninstall app/info and re-install as it would just no longer read my opener.  When it errors and the app remote doesn't work it at least shows the current status of the door so I can see if its open or shut away from home, but there has been no consistency in function.  I did leave it on since it's been purchased and can no longer be returned, but ended up getting a stand alone remote and use HUB only for "monitoring." unfortunately would not recommend

The gateway doesn’t tell you that you can buy a second sensor until you are going through the setup process. I bought this and returned a second gateway I bought. This worked fine and programmed faster than the first sensor. Apparently the gateway needs to be at a special spot or garage doors won’t open. Had to move the gateway around twice for it to open garage doors. But now they work fine.

The myQ garage door unit is easy to set up and install. So far, it works as advertised. It's a convenience. But the price for a second (add-on) door sensor (basically a tilt switch with a radio link to the hub) is 73% of the cost of the entire system (hub plus 1 door sensor).  When I installed the unit, the Chanberlain subscription cost to permit myQ to work with Google Assistant was zero for the first year of use with no comment on whether that's a 1-year come-on or a no-cost, long-term deal. Remains to be seen, I suppose.

What a POS! No, not a point of sale... I just drove 40 miles bc this thing would NOT close my door. Apparently there were too many failed attempts. I never had that issue with my NexxGarage. It’s a good thing I have cameras to check in my house and good neighbors. Anyway, I just got home and ripped this thing out and plugged my NexxGarage back in. It’s going back!!!!!!

I can totally understand the frustration on the amazon reviews. I tried to pair using the android app. Three times unsuccessfully and i have a chamberlain opener with a yellow learning button. Should be a no brainer right? I installed the hub on the first attempt then it wouldnt pair after that and or pair then instantly lose  the pairing. On the final attempt I bailed from the app on the "Paired" screen and now it works. When I followed the instructions to the final screen it would unpair for whatever reason.

It took quite a while to get it to link up. I had to do 5 factory resets. Once I got it to link up it works great. I really wish it could connect to Alexa. Apparently it might have in the past but the skill on the Alexa App says it no longer available. Big disappointment since most of my house is connected to Alexa. I also have a Samsung Smartthings hub. would be great if it could connect to that but it doesn't.
The MyQ is Garage Door Closed Peace of Mind.I no longer wonder or guess, "did I close the garage door?"

Being fairly handy, this was a breeze. Took 20 min max. Installed on a fairly new Genie opener, and not one hiccup. As long as your model is on their list of approved, no idea how people have trouble with this. Even someone who isnt tech savvy should be able to pull this off. Instructions couldn't be easier or clearer with the provided videos. WIFI connection is crucial, so if your signal is weak, consider a range extender. App is flawless so far, and for the price, this is great! I dont use Alexa or need other integrations. Sure, it might be nice, but by no means a deal breaker for me. I already have cams and an alarm i love, so having a little additional control over my opener, and simply knowing if the door is closed at night was all i really needed. I thought for sure I was going to need a new opener to get this type of tech on my opener, nope, just $25 and about 20 min of my time. Pleased!

I have a Chamberlain opener so this was a perfect add-on.  It works off the learn button so it has no wires to attach to the Opener motor housing.  I replaced an IRIS garage door opener that worked off of z-wave and was always disconnecting and took 30 - 45 minutes each time to try and reconnect it.  I was looking to get away from z-wave and find a wifi opener/monitor that worked and had good reviews.  This was perfect.  We'll see if it stays connected or drops connection periodically like my IRIS.  I'm hoping the wifi connection will be more stable as I have had much fewer problems with wifi devices such as my phone, printers, etc.

If you have a Genie after 2016....don’t buy.  It will not connect.  Tried multiple times.  Tech support was nice enough to make me aware on a help page:We appreciate all the time you put into trying to get Genie's opener's to work with myQ.Unfortunately, because Genie has changed their openers (2016-present) they are no longer compatible with myQ garage/myQ Smart Garage Hub. If the serial number on your opener starts with 16, 17, or 18 it is too recent of a model number. We are aware that there are customers who are trying to connect newer openers with our myQ devices and we are always looking for ways to improve our products.

I bought this to monitor our garage doors..  it looses connectivity to the wifi every other day..  we even bought the google wifi to make our range bigger - still looses connection...  very frustrating..  i also thought it would connect to my alarm (comcast cable/security) - i can see the openers but i can't open and close the doors though my security app, i have to use the "myQ" app..  kinda annoying to have to use 2 apps when i get home.

This smart garage door opener was very easy for us to install and pair up with the sensor. It is so convenient to be able to open the garage door with our phones. It is helpful to be able to let people in if needed. It has saved me multiple times already with the customizable alert that the door is open - and super awesome to be able to shut it without being there if we're already on our way out! My only complaint is that at times the app crashes - usually if I've already had it open and tried to open it again. Usually, closing the app and reopening fixes it. If not, the app usually needs an update.

Received my product quickly from Amazon and I installed it the same day. Installation was very easy. The hardest part was getting my Genie to learn a new device but even that worked on my second try. I feel this is under priced for what you get which is a good thing if you're in the market for it. I can now tell if my garage door is opened or closed and for how long it has been in that position from anywhere. I can also control it remotely. I don't use Alexa so I couldn't rate that. I use my phone for controlling it.

Nothing like starting a vacation or getting on the train to work and wondering if you closed the garage.  Now you can check on your app for peace of mind.  More importantly, I can schedule my garage door to close every evening in case forget to close it when I take out the trash or put away a yard tool.  Or open the garage door with my phone to get a tool when working around the house without having to go inside back inside and push the button.  Really quick setup.  Only downside is that there's no Alexa integration, other than subscription IFTTT functionality.

works ok, was easy to install and set up.  I was surprised by the loud beeping noise when using the app to close the garage.  I can hear it all over the neighborhood, sounds like a smoke alarm going off.  I understand its purpose, but it is waaaaay tooo loud and piercing.  also no way in the software to lower volume or disable the beep, so I took it apart and put a screw in the speaker and tightened it till the noise is much lower.  this worked.  Also I set up the Amazon key app, and it works fine for me, but the Amazon delivery person cannot open the door like they are supposed to.  I contacted Amazon support, and they said I need a range extender.  Not the case as the door works fine for me from two houses away!  I hate it when amazon support thinks it is some other reason that their "perfect product" does not work.

I followed the instructions and it only took a short time to install. Once I had it hooked up and paired up it worked perfectly. I think the hardest thing about the whole install was getting the plastic off of the peel and stick pads for the door sensor. My remote in my truck gave out and this was almost less expensive than buying a new remote and does so much more.

Bought this so I could get rid of the opener in my car. Didnt likenthe idea of someone being able to walk right in if I left my car unlocked on accident. After going through installation and set up, which was very easy, I started testing it out. The first time I tried to open it, it took about 20 seconds to even start moving. Then I tried to close it. It beeped like crazy, a safety feature, for about 40 seconds then it finally closed. That beeping is terribly annoying and cant be disabled. I tried to open it again but the app said it was still closing and eventually I just closed the app. Then i opened it again and clicked the open button. It waited about 10 seconds then started to move. Then I tried to close again and it beeped like crazy again, timed out 3 times, and then wouldnt respond anymore until I operated the door manually. In short, this thing barely works and is super slow to respond when it does. I'm gonna give it a few days before I make my final decision but I'm probably going to return this.

As the headline says, this was very easy to install.  Maybe took me 15 mins tops.  The only issue I have is that in the write up on the page it says works with Google Assistant and it does however it does not read in the Google Home app where every other product I have is connected too.  That would have been nice but other wise you cant beat this product.  Highly recommend to avoid having to buy a replacement remote or buy an outdoor keypad for your door.

This over all installed/connected smoothly. Easily integrates with Xfinity home system and read correctly. I only wish that the app would update correctly. I had used it a few times to close the door and it never updated to closed. I also have the amazon cloud cam in there so I can view it if it states that it is open; but every time it says that it is open it is actually closed.  Wish the status of the door also synced with Xfinity home.

I installed this in July 2018, so I've been living with it for over a year.  Installation wasn't difficult - I put the base unit within a good wifi signal (used a phone app to measure), and it's only about 6 - 8 feet from the two sensors.  I have two thoughts about this product.First, every time I open the app to open my garage door from the house before I walk out to the garage, the app goes through a log-on cycle.  I've saved my password, so it happens on its own, but it takes a good 5 seconds to connect (I assume to Chamberlain's servers).  Sometimes it fails to connect, so instead of being able to just open the app and open my door, I have to wait 5 - 15 seconds for the thing to log on before I can hit the button.  This seems TOTALLY unnecessary.  It's my phone - just leave me logged in.

I'm a home automation gadget freak. I have installed many different brands and types of devices, and this one was one of the smoothest and easiest -- I wish they were all this good.  I'm two weeks in, and everything works great.  The iPhone app doesn't have a lot of frills, but it covers the basics and works extremely well.  A good point of comparison is the Ring video doorbell app, which is way too complicated and confusing.  Keep it simple, make sure it works, and Chamberlain did that.

I leave early in the morning several times a week to head to the airport. I can’t count the number of times I pulled away wondering if I closed my garage door. This device has help me sleep comfortably knowing that I have closed my door or I could if need be have I forgotten.I’ll also add that my sensor that originally came with the device wasn’t operating very well. The customer service I received was excellent and they shipped me a new sensor that arrive within a couple of days. Since then I’ve had absolutely no issues. Love this device

I really like the alerts on my phone when it opens and closes. We were having random issues with the garage door opening while we were gone and this provides a sense of security. Have been able to open and close the door remotely. Amazon delivers packages into the garage, which is much more secure than leaving them at the door. I get alerts on the phone when the Amazon delivery van is en route. Was Very easy to setup and install.

took a few attempts to connect to my wifi not sure why. also first installed it to far from my garage door opener 10-12 ft worked once then stopped. reread instructions and they instructed to install 4-6 feet from garage door opener. moved it closer and everything is good. does beep and flash before closing, beep is annoying seems to go on for ever. beeps for probably 10 seconds before door shuts, while it is shutting and after it shuts. but is a safety feature so i get it.

My main concern was how easy to install - I am not a very handy person. After watching an instructional video (which was very good), I decided to buy it. It was easy to install, and if I can do it within 30 mins, everyone can. App is nice although a bit limited (I guess this is a free version limitation) although good enough for me.  It's a very good product for a very good price.

Had a hiccup during installation in which it would not connect. Did a hard reset and after that setup was a breeze. The app is built extremely well and whoever designed the flow of the setup instructions should be promoted as it was super user friendly and easy to use. Only thing I dislike is there is no Alexa integration. I get that you don’t want to have the ability for someone to say “Alexa open the garage” but I see no harm in being able to close it....

Overall this product works like it should. Some say setup was easy and others disagree. They make the setup process fairly easy and even someone who is not the tech type at all can figure it out. The only issue I had during setup was that the hub would not connect to my WiFi. I got on chamberlains website and was able to reach someone from customer support fairly fast. They cleared up the issue and I was able to connect to WiFi within a minute or two. After all is setup, they provide you with everything you need to mount this item. I’ve been using it for about a  month now and it’s been pretty good. There was one time that it lagged for a short time when I told it to close the garage but I haven’t had the issue since. I would recommend this product.

The was very easy install and set-up.  Be aware that it has a very loud buzzer that sounds for a few seconds before the door is lowered and while the door is being lowered.  Really loud and annoying. (Hint - carefully insert a small screw through the speaker membrane and it will not make noise.)This product does NOT support Alexa out of the box, but a quick search for "Simple Commands" will show how to use additional software to allow this device to work with Alexa.

Love this product, super easy to install & use. Loving it, as no more to worry about wondering garage door is closed or not when i am away. Another feature i like about it, setting up alert, if the door is open for long.I am not integrating with Alex or singing with Amazon shipping option. I am not comfortable to have someone else operate  to open the door while I am away.  But someone interested it may be a good option.

Love this.  Great for letting people in the house when you are away.  Great for making sure garage door is never accidentally left open.  I work in my basement and between the Ring Doorbell and this, I can deal with almost anything without leaving my office.  Makes me way more efficient.  Highly recommend.Gave low marks for Alexa integration, only because it does not have that.

I set this up for both garage doors in about 20 minutes and it has worked flawlessly since then.  I am able to check the status of each door and open/close them from miles away....how cool is that?  The notification works well; however, I have not figured out if I can get an audible alarm or if the only audible notification is the instant message "ding" on my iPhone.  I would like it to be a distinct sound with some volume as I do not use/look at my phone when I am driving.

It works quite well, but the MyQ app is very glitchy and slow to respond. Often if you close the garage through the app, and the garage laser sensor detects something below the garage, it takes forever for the app to know that the garage didn’t actually close. During this time, you have no control over the garage door from the app. So, does the product work? Yes. Could it be vastly improved? Definitely yes.

This product does not fully integrate with Google at this time.  Google will say that for security reasons it cannot open the door, but it does allow you to close the door.  To be clear, open/close both work within the dedicated app, but that is seriously a pain.  I purchased this because it was compatible with Google.  This is only partially true and is misleading.The beeping on close is also pretty annoying.

What is nice is that there is minimal wiring. All you need is in the box from Amazon. The issue was that my setup which runs off the app on your phone would not connect to wifi; so, customer support was enlisted to run through some alternate methods to connect to wifi and also a second call to connect wirelessly to my Gini (overhead door) opener. Once that was done programming the door to close a few times at night  was simple. The software has a nice GUI.

Do you own the first version of this product and are pissed and going insane from false open close alarms all the time? I was and buying this new version was very hard to do bc I expected another pile of crap! For my own sanity I had to try the new one bc once you have the convenience of this device you can’t go without it. So I’m an expert with the setup process already, if you’re new it may be hard but just read carefully and it will work although for WiFi it must be close enough to the router to keep a constant connection, once it loses WiFi it has issues reconnecting on its own. This new version works perfectly and I have had zero problems as with the first version thank God!  Finally!

This is a great set up with a wireless door sensor that monitor whether the garage door is open or close. the hub act as a wireless transmitter connected to the web and is able to control 2 door with an additional door sensor. it’s painless to install and you can install the hub anywhere in the garage where this is an outlet. you don’t have to mount the hub in the ceiling. I’ve installed mine for a month already now it’s saying the battery need replace on the sensor. I will put new battery and see how long that last. 3 star for the weak battery.

I was excited to install the MyQ smart garage door opener only to find out that after I installed it correctly, I can no longer use any of my car remotes or the wall mounted kypad to open and close my garage door. This isn't mention anywhere in the (minimal) documentation that comes with the product, and searching for a solution online is equally frustrating. When you Google "Installed MyQ and now car remotes won't work," you can see several sites with text from other people expressing the same problem, but when you click the links, it takes you to Chamberlain's main support page without any of the information you can see in the Google preview. Incredibly frustrating and feels like a total waste of ~$40.

Very disappointed.  The door down function triggers an alarm that sounds like a smoke detector and is just as loud, and continues well after the door is completely down.  I understand the need for safety but isn’t that what the electric eyes are for?

Chamberlain need to seriously improve its app and user support before I can recommend this product.I upgraded to this MyQ setup specifically so that the garage door sensor could let me know with confidence that the door was indeed closed.

I had some issues but once I did the google, I found the error in my ways.  The wall mounted remote is the key to programming.  Once I did this, everything has been awesome.  I have a heated garage with many things I do not want anyone else to have.  This allows me to make sure it is closed when I am not home.  I also have set up a schedule to make sure I close it at night.  Great great product.  I think my initial setup was more on the Liftmaster side.  Great value when you compare prices.

WORKS with older lift master 635LM - found this info on another review and sharing here, because it saved my butt (not in manual or anywhere else I could find online): select Lift Master in the app, then: “I used the 490 MHz (for orange learn button) 635LM unit.”However, doesn’t work with Apple home kit without spending another $100- seems absurd when this unit is already on WiFi and accessible through its own app.  Shame.

I bought this because I was having issues with my garage door opener remote not working. It's super simple to setup, the app literally gives you step by step instructions with short videos on what to do and how to do it. About a 15 min install from start to finish. The app is about as simple as it gets, it tells whether your garage is open or closed and how long it's been open or closed. The only annoying thing is the beeping noise it makes when opening and closing the garage door, not a deal breaker.

When you need it, service is unavailable. Although I have fiber internet and really good WiFi coverage, all the iOT devices are work properly, this one, opens your garage when you don't want it, - be aware if you're not home, that the garage door might be opened when you get back... and when you need it, it doesn't work! The worst part is that the garage door opens unexpectedly and several times we found the door opened in the morning or during the day. Wish that we can give 0 stars review...

Decent opener, works well from the app. It is annoying that you have to jump through hoops to get it to work with other home automation systems. Initially had some problems with the sensor giving occasional false readings or being unable to communicate door position to the app, but moving the hub closer to my router seems to have resolved that problem.  If it integrated better I would give it another star,but it's a solid, easy to install, low cost product.

This product is exactly what I have been looking for for a while.  Install and setup was super easy.  My only slight complaint is that while they say it works with Siri, you have to buy a separate hub to make it work with Apple Home Kit.  Additionally, the Alexa/Siri part will only close the door, due to security reasons, so I decided it wasn't work the extra $50 just to be able to tell Siri to close the door.  Adding family members as a little convoluted, but other than that, this product works awesome.  The one thing I am trying to figure out is how to set it so that if the door is open for more than xx minutes between 12AM and 6AM to close it.  Looking at IFTTT to do this because I don't see a way to do this within the app.

I purchased a refurb unit, was a little disappointed that they didn't remove stuck on adhesive from the last user.  No big deal...  Installed the unit per directions but hosed up the linking to the garage opener.  I was looking at the wrong light when pushing the programming light on the garage door opener.  I erased all mu codes... ugh... went back reviewed instructions again and got a better ladder so I could see the lights... after that everything worked as advertised.  It gives you piece of mind that I can see what position my door is in and if necessary close it.  It has been working flawlessly for the last few weeks.  I would recommend it if you garage door opener is compatible.

This was much easier to install than expected.  It needs strong internet, so I put a wifi extender in the garage.  Basically you just plug in the unit, connect to internet, pair sensor, then pair with the opener the same as you'd pair a new remote.  Our opener is a 20 year old Genie and it worked fine.  Install the bracket on the wall, hang the unit, and you're done!  Very easy step-by-step instructions on the phone app.

I installed this today on my Liftmaster 8355 door opener. Other than taking longer than it should have (due to my mistake in pressing and HOLDing the Learn button during setup), it was easy.It was only $30 so heck... you can't go too wrong. Now, I'm going to see if I can just add a 2nd door sensor to be able to control the 2nd door. If not, I'll go ahead and spend another $30.

I recall not getting earlier because of "payed monthly subscription" needed.  NOT THE CASE.  And I'm really happy with the unit and works really well for me. I also purchased a second module for my second door; they both work and the wife is happy.

I just installed the MyQ door opener with no issue.  Works great!  Now, I'm trying to enable the Key app and I'm following the steps (just click, click, click) and log in to myliftmaster.com account.  Nothing happens!  I repeated about 10 times.  Doesn't do anything.  Hey Amazon, if you are reading this please let me know what to do.  Thanks.

The unit was not easy to link to my garage opener but after 20 mins it did. It works for most of the time but it send false alerts to my phone very often.  I have it set to 5 min and it sends me wrong alerts almost every day. I had to turn around so many times to come back and check the garage door. The app shows wrong status of the door.I have not had a chance to troubleshoot / reset the unit yet but I would expect the product not to malfunction like this. Imagine you get a false alert when you are away for a important appointment !! If it malfunctions then how would you trust the status even after you reset !

The reason I bought this was because we were often unsure if we closed the garage door or not. It only takes a quick peek to know for sure now.It took me 30 minutes to install; a quick check for internet signal strength, and couple screws in the garage ceiling. It was pretty easy. You just follow the step by step instructions from your phone after downloading the app - you are simply walked through the setup.  It can do a lot more than what I need (and didn't bother to configure) because these "extra smarts" appeared confusing. Otherwise, I'd have given it 5 stars.

Will not connect to to WiFi, if it does connect it will not hold connection and operate the garage door, check compatibility with my opener and it is compatible and still will not work. Troubleshooting is zero help have gone through it 8 times now and still no connection. I’ve moved it to different areas in the garage, checked network strength, reset it countless times. Flat out dose not work

I have wanted this for some time. I have fully automated home with cameras everywhere... so I could always check if my garage door was left open (drop camera in the garage), but couldn't do anything about it without driving home. It never fails to get that feeling of, "did I close the garage..." when I was a few miles down the road (almost always was closed; it was just that the routine become forgetful.....then you wonder....). No more! Excellent price, SUPER easy installation.

I initially had problems with the Bluetooth connection dropping, but after relocating the transmitter to the same side of the garage as the Hub it’s been 100% spot on.If I had mounted the Hub in the center of the ceiling, instead of on the one side, the Bluetooth connection may have worked fine.

I thought I need a WiFi extended to install this. (Since my phone gets really limited signal at my garage. ) But actually I don’t . It has better antennae than your phone. (Mine is iPhone XS Max ) so I think if you got signal in your garage on your phone but no network or very slow. It still could work for you. It support garage delivery.Amazon provide 10 dollars gift card for the first time using garage delivery. It cheap and nice and nice! Highly recommended!

Bought this in case we forget to close the garage door and be able to close it remotely. First unit was defective and would not connect to my internet network. Called amazon and was sent a replacement unit. Installed everything exactly as the app suggested and everything connected fine.I am able to see if my garage is open or closed but the unit will not signal the door to close or open at all. The light on the hub flashed and we hear a peep for the worning that the door will close and then nothing happens. After few trials the app will give me an error message. I installed a camera on the garage to tell me of the door is open it closed. So this device is useless since so far it is only good for monitoring and sometimes It is lot even accurate. Waste of money.

I just took delivery of this item and installed in right away. Installation was very simple and took less than 30 minutes (including pairing with both garage door opener and door sensor, and physical installation). There was no installation physical instruction manual in the box, but the iPhone app had complete instructions from pairing to the physical installation (it even had a video on the app). Once paired with the sensor and garage door opener (I have a Chamberlain garage door opener), the hub worked flawless.Some reviews complain about the warning noise that the hub makes when closing the garage door, but I don't feel that is really an issue. It will make the warning noise only when you are using the hub to close the garage door. If you are using your remote or wall switch, the hub will not be making the warning noise. I will be using the hub mostly for security and notification purposes, and will be using my wall switch to close the garage door.

I installed this a few days ago. Not a single issue, complaint or confusion. Easy to setup, great Android app, schedule  times and know if the door is open or closed. So easy a caveman could do it.Did anyone complaining "Verify" their unit would work with this model first or just playing the victim card?

I wanted it for verification of if the door is open or closed. I wanted Google Assistant integration.Google Assistant integration requires an account with an admitted low fee, but still a monthly payment. I figured out that with enabling the MyQ notification, I would have what I basically wanted. No Google integration, but OK. This should be made clear BEFORE purchase.

Works as described. Very simple to install and if you subscribe to the Wink service through the Wink hub it then you can integrate with Alexa using wink. I terminated my Wink and switched to SmartThings. SmartThings does not support MqQ so it no longer integrates with Alexa. Unfortunate, so I can only use the MyQ phone app.The package includes one sensor however if you have an additional garage door you can buy an additional sensor and have the hub control that as well which is pretty cool.

The hub was very easy to set up and program. We purchased this when our outside keypad failed and our dog walker was locked out. Luckily we weren't far from home, but it could have been a disaster for us. So we purchased this as a backup, and I love the peace of mind it gives us. I can see the status of the door (sometimes I'd drive away and after a few miles think, "did I close that door!?". Now I can be sure, and if I've forgotten, I can close it from wherever I am! And I know if for some reason the keypad fails again, the dog walker can call or text me and I can open it for her. This has been a great purchase so far!

Really good inexpensive solution to garage door automation. I wanted to install a 2GiG solution but was not compatible with my operator. This solution was super easy to install and it works. I’m a bit disappointed there’s not an Alexa skill available but I do love the fact that we can check if we left doors open or not remotely. BTW - some reviewers mention MyQ charging a monthly subscription fee for this device and I did not find this to be the case.

Randomly won't work.  Have to toggle my WiFi.  I put a dedicated WiFi extender in the garage for this device.  When I leave home I often have to turn off WiFi on my phone to get it to work.  That seemed to do the trick for several months but recently after some updates the app on my phone doesn't work consistently.  Power cycled the controller and that seemed to help but that's impractical when you want to rely on it.

I now have peace of mind that I closed my garage door.  I backed down my street EVERY morning to recheck closure because I couldn't remember if I shut the door.  My neighbors probably think I have major OCD.  Love the convenience.  Just remember to get cord out of chain's way when you program.  I wasn't watching and when I initiated the program the door activated a caught the dangling powe cord and ripped the brand new cord in half.  Called the company immediately and they shipped me a new cord for free.  It was a total error on my part but I did it right the second time and it works like a dream.

Fine so far. Haven't experienced connectivity issues others mentioned. Connected to my router, the garage door transmitter and my garage door opener just fine. App is OK. And none of that matters if it doesn't work with Alexa.It's cool to check to make sure I closed the door when I get to work and can't remember if I did or not. Other than that, it's a pretty useless product. Certainly not smart. Would not buy again.

It actually works occasionally. I programmed a garage door close for 9:30 PM everyday as I have forgotten to manually close it. Tonight again I got a message to check the door. I closed it earlier but I found that it had opened the door. This has happened several times before. The sensor on the garage door will loses sync with the control module. I press the reset button and the control module beeps as it should but that is only good for a day or two.

What a great concept but does it always work? no! We locked ourselves out of home twice already, we moved the sensor and had better luck but now the battery on it has to be replaced every month. The battery is about $6 and that is monthly so if you want to invest that monthly for something that some times works well that’s up to you. Do I feel confident I only need my phone to come into my phone, nope! No it’s too late to return and I’m crap out of luck.
I love this Smart Garage opener!It was super easy to install.  Did it in maybe 30 minutes, if that.

The MyQ smart garage is easy to install. The smart phone app is even easier. Just make sure your wifi extends to your garage prior to purchase. I am very happy with the product. I have been using it for about a week now. I have not hooked it up to Alexa due to not seeing the point of asking her to ask MYQ to check the garage doors instead of just looking at the app on my phone.

I was very happy with MyQ until yesterday and today. I heard the beep warning me the door was going to open, it did. For absolutely no reason. There was no one else around and I didn't do it so, I chalked it up as a one time deal. Today, out of the blue it did it again. The only time it beeps is when Amazon opens it for a delivery. I will have to disconnect it. It's been 5 months since I got it. Will update if I figure it out.

Installation does require you to get on a ladder and its necessary for your garage door opener to be connected to a duplex power outlet.  One outlet that is being used by your garage door opener and one for this unit's hub.  The iPhone app works well.  You may be surprised when testing the 'Close' feature during install.  The hub flashes and beeps for several second before starting the closing of the door.  This is a safety feature since you normally will not be near the door, but others might be.

Was able to install easy enough as we already had the system set up on one garage door. Get notifications when the garage doors open or closed however when we try to open or close using the app it fails to work. Thinking it was the garage doors itself, I tried this one on our other door that we had the MyQ setup on for months and it still didn’t work. Oh well, I’m at least able to get notification if we mistakenly leave the door open.

It took me less than 10 minutes to have everything running perfectly, very easy to install. So far works perfectly, the downside is that it requires a subscription fee of $1.00 dollar a month to integrate it with a third party like Google Home, Google Assistant or IFTTT. That is really bad since I don't want to go through another application to run this. I could integrate to IFTTT and the to my Alexa device, or my Google Assistant. I'm seriously thinking in returning it.

I had big dreams of pulling up to my garage door and having it open for me automatically, of asking Google to "open the garage door", or having Google open it and close it as part of my programmed routines. Almost none of that works the way you think though.First you have to route everything through Chamberlain's own servers which barely integrate with any other services. Then, when you finally do it turns out that opening the garage door is only available through their app. That's right, you cannot automate opening the garage door in any way, you can only close it when integrating through a third party.

I haven't integrated with Alexa yet but installation was easy and works 99% of the time. There are a few instances where the sensors wern't right and seems like the garage is open when it's not. It then acts weird and needs operation using some other means ( like the garage-remote which I then need to remember where it was the last time I had to use it). Overall works great for the intended use.

I don’t understand all the posts about installation problems. From the time I open the box, it literally took me 15 minutes to get the product installed. If I had one complaint it is that the written paper instructions are a little out of sync with the MyQ app instructions. How it works in a long-term is yet to be determined, but so far this was a piece a cake.

First, this item requires a reset (of its internet connectivity) much more than other smart devices. (I have about a 1/2 dozen others.) Unfortunately, the reset button is to the side of the device, rather than facing down. This makes it very difficult to do the reset, and requires a ladder each time I must do the reset--about once a week.  BTW, I have a dedicated Wifi extender in my garage, which easily and consistently connects to other devices--so my internet is NOT the issue.

If you've ever been a few blocks from home and wonder if you closed your garage door, or can't easily see if your door is open or not in the evening, the MyQ is for you. We will also use it to give our extended family access.  My first unit kept puking, even though Chamberlain chat chap was very knowledgeable and helpful.  Tried changing the battery, but to no avail.  Second chatter sent me a new unit with next day delivery which I reinstalled in ten minutes.  The system now works as advertised. (Have not tried to integrate with Alexa.)

It's quite convenient and consoling knowing that you can open your garage door from anywhere if needed. We love using this.Keep in mind that your remote will no longer work, as long as this is hooked up. We've had the wifi go down and was forced to come back inside to close the door and use the front door. But it's all good. We also have a digital lock on the front door which allows us to get in remotely as well. So it works out for us, whichever way.

Ok after I got this set up it works perfectly.  I installed this on a lift master chamberlain professional series. The trick that worked for me was during the set up process instead of clicking on the brand I clicked on other and just kept following he directions until it worked. Be patient with this and you will be rewarded I assure you. It’s nice knowing I can close my garage door from pretty much anywhere now.

Quick easy installation, about half an hour. However, there's a very annoying loud beeping sound associated with the device that sounds when the door is closing when using the wifi/internet to close the door. No noise when using car garage door opener or buttons mounted in the garage. And you can't disable the noise. Had I known how annoying that beeping noise is, I never would have purchased and installed it. Look at youtube videos and you'll see what I mean.

[update] Worked well for few months then disconnected. I couldn't get it to reconnect despite several attempts. I finally connected it to my hotspot on my phone. Strangely, after I did that, I was able to switch back to the original router. There is some sort of bug so that it can't reconnect to the original router unless you clear the wifi settings by connecting it to another router/hotspot.---

I was keeping my opener in the glove box of my Chieftain, but as many know, the latch on that is pretty flimsy so I hated opening and closing often. I keep my iPhone mounted for Waze and Apple Maps, so looked for something that I could put on my phone. Ended up getting a MyQ Garage Door opener. Works using wifi so I can open garage door from anywhere.. Simply open when I get to my street and it works like a champ. Ran somewhere around $41 (much better than the $154 for the Polaris opener!)...

I bought this looking for a simple solution for remotely opening my garage door. It was not entirely clear from the information provided by the manufacturer that this would wor with my overhead door opener but I finally found that it would indeed work with my opener. After doing the install by the instructions and pairing the sending unit twice, it still would not work.  It does work as a monitor so that I can tell if the garage was left open but this is not the functionality that was promised.  All in all, I am a bit disappointed in the unit and would not recommend this to anyone.

The installation on this product was simple, even for a 65 year old female. My concern, and therefore reason for this product was the fact that I tend to absentmindedly leave my home and then question whether I in fact closed the garage door. Generally I have, but I waste valuable time reversing direction to verify that fact. This product solves that problem. I will eventually utilize notifications, but at the moment I’m happy to see the fact that my door is in fact closed via the app.

The Hub works. Sometimes. I get lots of close errors and I have to reset manually constantly. I even had an Amazon Key delivery where Amazon called me and told me they could not close my door. I had to leave what I was doing and come reset the door manually.I contacted them and they sent me a control panel called 888LM, which I later found does not work with my garage opener.

Does it work?  Quite well actually.  Even integrated with ‘Alexa key’ so Amazon can open my garage door to securely deliver packages.  But no Alexa integration?  Shame on me for not reading closer.  This does NOT integrate with Alexa, just the myQ app which is helpful but not what I thought I was buying.  VERY misleading!!! A google search proves this is a wanted feature.  Get a clue as to what people want Chamberlin and you’ll have a winning product.

This was a breeze to install. Worked perfectly the first time and has been smooth operation since. The loud beep that sounds for 10 seconds when closing the garage remotely is extremely annoying, but I understand that it is for safety reasons and can not be turned off. Being able to open my garage remotely for friends/family to access my house when needed and being able to receive alerts when the garage does open/close is fantastic. No more worrying if the garage was left open, if it way I can now close it from anywhere.

Installation was flawless and took 15 minutes. This garage door remote control permits me to view door's status and close or open it from my phone. Alerts can also be set for when others open or close the door. This item was purchased to replace a failed gifted installation of others. That product had a work around to make it work but was involved and would require further expenditure. Completely satisfied with my purchase.

This unit is not dependable. It works maybe 7 out of 9 times. And, yes, it has been set up exactly as the instructions/video demonstrates. I was 30 miles into a 78 mile trip after leaving my second home before I realized that I left the garage door open. No worries, I have the Chamberlain garage door control! I pulled over and touched the “ close” button. Round and round went the icon. Finally, it stops and wants me to “visually confirm the position of the door. WTF. This is precisely the situation that I bought this for.

Works great!  Bought one that had been returned with "cosmetic" damage; had no instructions and still easy to install.  However, unit was evidently missing the piece that the hub attaches to for proper mounting.  If I could get or had one of those, rating would certainly be five star!  Also, I only hooked up one of the garage doors and I am not sure how to check whether the other garage door opener will work with the unit.  Any answers to this question would be helpful.

Read the other comments.  This has not worked well for me.  The state is hardly ever correct, meaning you don’t know if it’s open or closed.  That makes automation impossible.  I’ve tried to automate closing the garage door at night if it’s open.  The other night it opened it instead, right in schedule at 10:30.  If I had been sleep, it would have been open all night.  Very dissatisfied with the performance.

I installed the MyQ app and installed the unit to be used with a Sears Craftsman garage door opener.  The hardest part was screwing the two screws into the ceiling! Follow the directions and you won’t have a problem. I did not use the IFTTT option. We can use the app to open & close the door and tell if the door is open or closed. It’s nice to be coming home in an Uber and open the garage door from our phone before we get out of the car. Especially if it’s raining! Love the product and highly recommend it!

I got this around $35. It is a no-brainer for the peace of mind you get with the app. IFTTT integration is free for a while, so it works out even better.I actually did not install the hub by the controller. I just plugged it in next to an outlet and it is just chilling there. Works well. No issues.

Very easy to install. I think they have some work to do with improving the digital offering of this, such as allowing the machine’s lights to turn on and off within the app and maybe even alexa and having an alexa skill to close the door. Understandably you wouldn’t want a voice skill for opening the door. Super easy to install. I wouldn’t recommend paying more than thirty though. Love that you can have friends and family invited to have access.

Followed the instructions, but sensor did not connect to garage door operator.  Went through the reset procedure and everything worked fine the second time.  I would like to see some more automation capabilities in the App.  For example,  If it is after 7PM and before 8AM, close the door if it has been open for more than 1 hour.I would also have wanted the replacement battery to be a more common size such as CR2320.  The warranty could be better as well.

Props for super easy installation; dummy proof and has a video guide via the app. Even for a guy with crippling RA I managed to get it installed in under 20 minutes The problems? On a given work day between my wife and I leaving the garage door will open and close a minimum of 8 times in total and the device only recognizes 7. Not an isolated incident, 5 straight days. A huge issue since the entire sole intended purpose of the device is to to catch this 100% of the time. For a couple with anxiety and OCD issues having the app tell us our garage door has been open for 7 hours was a nightmare.  Also, bought this to pair up with Alexa; it is not compatible. No skill to learn and isn't recognized as a device to add.

Set up seemed straight forward but was not. Took my multiple tried to get my garage door opener to pair with the device. Mine has an orange learn button but I ended up cycling through all the color options until purple finally worked. Once set up the app functions well. The major disappointment came when I paid $10 for Google home integration and all it does is close the door and tell me whether it is open or close. YOU CAN NOT OPEN THE DOOR WITH ANY 3RD PARTY APPS. This should be explained by Chamberlain in the description. It is pretty deceptive in my opinion. The main reason for my purchase was to open and close hands free using Google assistant so in that respect it is a total fail. Chamberlain, if you read this, please remedy this issue as it is a major misstep.

It took me maybe 5 minutes to get this up and running. iPhone app works great. How many times have I gone down the block turned around and come back to make sure I remembered to shut the door - who knows. But worry no more. This device is well worth the $ in peace of mind, and it works perfectly for me. The warning signal before when using the app to close the door is cool.Note: I have a 7 year old Lift-master that is MyQ labeled.

Installation took me about 30 minutes and that was with me taking my time.  It connected with no problems on a 15+ year old Genie garage door opener.  The app works fine on my iPhone, but can take it would be nice if it had positive feedback that an action occurred.  It can take some time to update the status of the door.  Could be a factor of my location and phone signal strength around the time I'm normally opening the door.  In any case, I highly recommend this unit for updating an older garage door opener to the 21st century.

I held off on this purchase after seeing some say it did't work well or didn't pair well.  I have no complaints. I followed the instructions closely and watched some Youtube videos to fill in the gaps and it is working great. Love having the ability to see if the door is open or closed and to be able to open / close it from anywhere.  Glad I pulled the trigger and bought this.
Installation instruction is simple and easy to install.Mine is Genie Pro - 1024, it worked with that.

I was concerned at first because I read all the reviews that say this is impossible to install and doesn't work. If you are thinking the same thing, buy it. This was the easiest thing I have ever installed. Step 1 says to download the app. That was the last time I referred to the instructions. The app takes you through step by step and includes videos. This tool me maybe 15 minutes to install and works like a charm. No more circling back around the block for me to make sure I closed the door.

It works with my Genie door opener.  It sort of integrates with the Amazon Key app, but it only gives status.  It sends you to the myQ app to open and close doors.  It’s very helpful, as I have no way to visually check this door, other than walking outside to view it directly.  Now I can check it, open or close it from my living room.  I can open it remotely if my son in law needs to borrow something or drop it off in the garage.  The ability to get status alarms, or even assure that the door is closed in the evening helps.  The quick start instructions dump you to the setup routine in the phone app, before you really understand how the installation works.  I used the online Chamberlin installation video to get familiar with what the steps were and what I needed before I went out to the garage.

Used this for two weeks and everything was fine, it was working perfectly.. today I received an alert that the garage was open but didn't received the alert that it closed soon enough... Went and check the garage.... It was closed...... It has a sensor that physical senses ( by gravity) that the door is closed, so it's not a software issue... Wonder why they are selling these for cheap....

Super easy to install. It took no time at all to install it and has worked great from everywhere. The app is super easy to use and the fact that it integrates with the Key app and lets Amazon deliver packages into my garage where they’re safer than the front porch makes this all the better. By the way, you can also add a camera to the setup to watch who is opening and closing the garage door via a camera that works with the Key app or the MyQ app. Definitely worth the money!

Works great once you get it setup/programmed. Install is easy for the hardware. It took me numerous tries to get it to kinda work with my Genie opener (book says it will work) so I switched it to my other door with a Sears opener and it works great. Love it telling me how long it’s been open or closed. Also handy to remotely close if you drive off and forget to close it.

Ok so the setup is a little involved, but if people would just stop being so impatient and read the instructions, they would get this set up just fine. All the instructions are step-by-step in the app that you register your device on, just READ THEM, people. Once it is set up properly, it works like a charm. You can get on your app when away from your home and see that the door is closed.

I was worried about connecting it to Work so that I could control it from their app. But I never got round to connecting it, because the MyQ never worked.After connecting the hub to my home network and testing the door sensor, I tried to pair my Precision PDS 4700e garage door opener to the hub. In about 10 attempts, the MyQ android app said I was successful once, and even then the door would not open or close.

I got this as a Lightning deal in December. Installation was really easy, and it went in without a hitch. I would like to have it linked to Amazon’s Key app, but apparently, it isn’t available in my area. Hopefully, it will be available soon. It would be nice to have my packages delivered right into my garage. I like the fact that I get an alert anytime the door is opened. This was a nice inexpensive way to move more towards having a smart house.

Comes with no installation instructions; those are all available online after you sign up for their cloud account.  But how does somebody know they even really want to install this until they've reviewed how it gets hooked up?  App is free, but useless until you sign up for their cloud account.  WHAT IF I DON'T WANT STRANGERS HAVING ACCESS TO MY LOCAL WIFI???  Who with half a clue about security would put something like this on their network?  I would only install something this if I set up a separate wifi network just for these kinds of cloud devices.  What a pain.  The old way was better - such devices contained their own http servers and smtp clients, they sent you emails, and for greater control you could optionally forward ports to them in your firewall.  NO CLOUD REQUIRED.  Not sure what I'll do with this cloudsourced thing.  I guess I'll throw it in the trash.

It functions as promised, big hurray. However it is only for one Amazon user, no family accounts, and I could do without probably mandatory delays with beeps and lights before the garage door closes.At a bare minimum there should be a way to mute and or reduce it from the app.

Great way to get phone control of your garage door, I just wish that it would connect to the google home assistant or Alexa easier. It’s advertised as such but I couldn't get it to work with either. The amazon key works somehow though, surprise. Installation is super easy, just make sure you have strong wifi signal and pre-download the app.The app to control the door itself is a bit slow (30-45sec) to sync to load but works well once loaded.

If you are looking for a remote garage door opener, it will do exactly what you expect. Easy to install and the price is right. When you close the door however, the hub emits a loud repetitive beep that continues even after the door is closed. A little obnoxious. I understand it is for safety purposes, but we already have laser sensors that will stop the door from crushing someone, so would be nice to have an option to turn the alert off. Would have been nice to have AppleHomeKit integration built in; instead you have to buy an additional peripheral to enable this feature. Seems there is no excuse to not have this included in base product. All in all it’s cheap enough to still make it worth buying.

Great product!  Works perfectly!  Easy to install!  Instructions say mount Wi-Fi / Strobe unit on the ceiling 4-5’ from opener but I mounted mine 9.5’ away on the back wall so I didn’t have to climb a ladder to reach our ceiling, which is 16 feet up.  The unit worked perfectly despite mounting it farther away.

Confused how this solution gets 4 stars from more than 12k reviews.  The system works as advertised with the boundarys stated in the set up.  The MyQ app allows remote opening and closing although the audible alarm when the door closes is a bit annoying. Only having the ability to add 3 guests makes it difficult for the family unless everyone uses the same account.The device does not really work with google assistant and cannot be added to google home at all.  When you finally get MyQ linked to google assistant after you "purchase" the free subscription.  you can only close and get the status of the door.  The door cannot be opened with google assistant.  If Chamberlain ever start charging to link with google again I'm out.
It is an excellent product. The instructions are clear enough and the setup was easy.It does what I need it to do: open my garage from a remote location.

This installed without any difficulty and works really well. It paired with my WiFi and garage door opener on the first tries. You have to go online to get full instructions but it is a simple process and the videos are helpful.Initially, it worked well. Then after a couple of months it would randomly report the door as open when it was closed. The problem went away after an update. I added a second detector for my other garage door and they have both been working great for several months.

This was a good purchase, although the remote control function is not 100% reliable. The alert when the door is open and the status of the door seems spot on.  I tied to integrate with Alexa but it didn't work very easily. I might try again but it wasn't simple and I wasn't to concerned about that. I really like the technology of it and the only thing that I wish was better is that the door would always go up or down from the app. It does work about 85% of the time...
