When it arrived, I initially thought I had to connect it to an existing remote. Thank goodness no. All that's needed is an existing wifi system and a garage opener already installed.The system took 15 minutes to install and worked as advertises, right from my cell phone. No need to worry about connecting my cars to garage door openers or buying a new garage door opener.

It is very easy to install. I really like the ability to control the garage door with my cell phone. It makes my evening walk to the park much easier.I do have a major complaint and are considering returning the product. The door sensor only sense correctly about 80% of the time!  One of the reasons of getting this hub is to ensure we close the garage door securely.  I was able to set an alarm to notify me if the door stays open after a certain amount of time.  Well, we got these alerts so many times they are being ignored.  I have send email to tech support but received no response back yet.  Anybody has similar experiences?

The instructions and setup were very simple to install the MyQ.  This is a great addition to any smart home setup.  There is an integration for SmartThings and the setup was easy to follow to setup the device in the SmartThings manager.  If using smarthings, I would recommend to add an additional zwave sensor to the door to allow for SmartThings to see if the door is open or closed.

What a complete piece of junk and waste of time. Was on the phone for over an hour with technical support. This thing would not connect to my Wi-Fi. Even after I made sure it was on the correct bandwidth, it still wouldn't connect. Then while I was on the phone with technical support, my login for the app wouldn't work. Even after resetting the password it still said wrong credentials. Yet I could log into their website with the same credentials just fine. Absolute garbage. Waste of my Saturday morning!

I watched a quick video for a few tips beforehand. It only took me 5-10 minutes to actually mount the hub to the ceiling and Velcro the door sensor to the door with the provided VelcroAfter the physical installation was done, just downloaded the app and followed the prompts and it was all set up and ready to go on the first try.

I have two car garage and mostly instead of closing the one , kids will open the other without looking at the door as a result we will have both garage door open. Many times we left the both door open throughout the day or night. This product has solved that problem by alerting me on my smart phone.It works as mentioned and the app is also easy to use. Setup instructions were missing in the box however it was easy to find the video on YouTube.

I like the idea of having an app rather than a physical device to open my garage so I thought i would try this out. In the past month, I've been locked out of my house twice because the app didn't load. It also is supposed to keep you signed in but it doesn't always so in order to get back in you have to log in again. I also had a power outage and it took over an hour before it came back online so I could open my door.

This was installed in under 30 minutes. It was easy to do by myself and easy to connect to my iPhone. I use to worry about whether I closed my garage door, especially in the morning when things get so hectic trying to get everyone out the door, but now I can just check my phone to make sure everything is closed. It especially came in handy when I was in a rental car and did not have my garage door opener, but I was still able to park in the garage like I normally would. The only drawback is no connection to Google Assistant, but I guess it is compatible with Alexa (which we do not use). Will be purchasing a second unit for the other garage door!

If you have a two-door garage, you need to add only this door sensor to the second door to control it automatically (if the first door already has a Chamberlain MyQ hub). Each door needs its own sensor, and both sensors can share one hub. The sensors are wireless, and very easy to install and operate. Great product, great product support, highly recommended.

Bought mainly as an "in case of emergency"/"did I really close the door" piece of equipment in the never-ending quest to smart-out the house.  Set up was a little finnicky with our Genie opener... getting the MyQ to send the right code took numerous repeated attempts until it finally took.  There is a bit of a delay when opening and closing through the phone - even more of a delay through the watch - but this is/was the simplest way to convert our door to a smart opener.Happy with the purchase but the difficulty with the set up is worth the loss of a star.

I love being able to close and open my garage door remotely. We left on a trip recently and I could not recall if my garage door had been closed so I was very happy to have this app to check on it rather than having to drive back to the house (or send a relative over to do it). I found in this heat wave we have that when both of our cars come in at the end of the day, the garage can get up over 110 degrees and it's cooling down outside so I leave the garage door open for 30 minutes and then close it with the app.  I also use it if I need to let someone into the house remotely - I can just open the door when they arrive and call me.

I got this so that I could make sure the garage was not left open during those times when you just can't remember if you closed it when leaving the house or not. The only reason for the missing fifth star is the voice assistant control is not available without additional cost. It'd be great if I could be driving home and just ask Google to open the door for me, but sadly I either need to be in range with the opener's supplied remote or pickup my phone, open the app, and press the button on the screen.

Bought this to protect my garage from the street and from our forgetful minds when we leave the house. It notifies us when the garage is left open more than 15 minutes and I am able to close it, even when out of the country.One annoying thing is when you shut it remotely all hell break loose and the neighbors have to hear a SUPER LONG beeping sound that lasts forever. Even after it's closed? Strange. But it's a safety feature, I get it. When there's not eyeballs on the door it's a necessity.

I was upset about the lack of free Alexa integration at first, and had tried another product that was horrible. Opted to give the MyQ a try and was shocked at how dead simple the install was. Had it paired in 5 minutes and had it fully installed within 15. Honestly I don’t even think I want my garage door accessible by Alexa now that I’ve used it for a while. I love how easy it is to open/close the door with my Apple Watch.

It works well enough once you get it paired and on your wifi. The app works, but it can be slow. It would benefit from some kind of widget.Unfortunately, they also charge a subscription fee to use your voice assistant. This feels like a money grab. I would have bought something else had I known.

Setup was a bit difficult for me--it did not work through the app as expected (otherwise would have given it 5 stars). I needed to search on the internet how to link the hub to my router using WPS. Once the hub linked to my router, I was then able to set up via the app. Other than this annoyance, the product works great. The app is otherwise well designed.***Update Dec 17, 2017***

I thought this was very easy to install and get operational, I had no issues during the process.  I wanted it to determine the status of my garage are any time, or place.  When I leave in the morning for work, I sometimes notice I left the door open overnight and this app will allow me to check that the door is closed during the evening, without having to physically look at it.  I also setup an alert for being open for more than 30 minutes after 10:00 pm.  I'll enable the Amazon delivery option and plan to give access to my kids, but they have other options to use to enter my house.  I'd like to have packages delivered indoors during cold, snowy, or wet days.  I read the critical review about want "Chamberlain doesn’t tell you (and should!)" and I agree with about 10% of that.  Most of that was typical to anything WIFI and somewhat overexaggerated.  2.4 GHz is an unlicensed frequency and does compete with other devices using it, but there are channels that separate the spectrum into individual zones, so many different devices can share the same space for Bluetooth and WIFI.  This is a pretty minimal cost now ($30) and I'm thinking I'll get a second one for other garage door too.

The only thing it has going for it is the customer service. The device is rubbish. I tried to install it using the directions. After an hour I decided to call customer service because it wouldn't connect to my wifi. The customer service rep was awesome and got everything working. I tried 30 minutes later and it refused to close I spent another 30 minutes on it and kept getting an error code. At that point, the device  was crap in my eyes and I sent it back.

This does not "technically" work with Alexa, but there are a few workarounds that are pretty easy to set up. Very easy to install..the only maintenance is changing the battery which is simple. I really like being able to give others access. There is a very loud alarm for 30 seconds before it will close, it cannot be disabled in the settings. I dont mind it but I'm sure some will. It has made my life easier and I would buy it again.

I would have given this product five stars because it was so easy to setup and the app integrates with Amazon Key, but there is no Alexa skill which totally doesn’t make sense. It’s still been great to open my garage door remotely, get status updates when the door is open, and get in home packages. I just can’t get over the fact I can’t say “Alexa, open my garage”.

I have two Liftmaster 8500 garage door openers that were installed in 2016. I purchased the hub and an extra sensor. I wasted hours trying to get the hub to pair with my wall units. I gave up and called Liftmaster/Chamberlain customer service. I  learned that I didn't need the sensors at all. The nice woman who helped me walked me through the process adding the two garage door openers using my laptop. Now everything works perfectly. I wish that Chamberlain had included these simple instructions in the manual that comes with the hub. The hub gets Five stars. The lack of comprehensive instructions gets 2 stars.
Purchased based on a recommendation from our overhead door repair tech.Monitored pricing on Amazon and bought on the price drop.

I got this product for my mom, so she wouldn't have to worry about packages being stolen from her front door, and no longer worry about if the garage door is open. The product works exactly as stated, I love it, she loves it, the catch is... Amazon key isn't ready in every area yet. I love the product and it was super easy to install, took less then 20 minutes taking my time and even eating while doing so. But check to make sure Amazon key is available in your area first!!

Amazon sells this product for their in-garage delivery service (which is  unfortunately not available to me). One would think it would work with Amazon's home control system. IT DOESN'T WORK WITH ALEXA!!After the easy installation I found out that it wiped out our remotes and exterior keypad. This isn't a product- it's a punishment.  don't make the mistake I made. There's a reason Amazon is restricting reviews of this product.

Like that I can use this product from my cell phone and see when the door was last closed or opened, also open or close it myself from anywhere.Don't really like that I need to mount the unit, either on the wall or on the ceiling. But it is not going to magically mount itself so I guess I will do it. Right now it is setting on a bench in the garage. Works fine, but going to be in the way until I do something with it.

The product function is great, and the app is intuitive. The finish of the hub or the sensor is a little on the cheap side, but perhaps it does not matter as the product stays in the garage. Installation is a breeze. However, pairing can be frustrating, and this is the only reason I thought the product does not deserve five stars. I started my setup late night, paired the sensor with the hub and picked things up the next day. While the app reasonably picked up where I had left off I kept running into an error in the subsequent steps. The app seemed to go in a loop asking me to pair the hub to the garage door; the garage would open and close, but the system would produce an error. I changed so many things including erasing all remotes from the garage door opener. I reset the hub, and I even installed and started using the old Chamberlin app. Nothing worked, until I decided to also delete the sensor pairing from the hub. Once this was done, in the old app I managed to pair the hub with the garage door. The settings between the two apps were based on my account and everything worked. I deleted the old app, and now everything works nominally - happy with the product. I hope that MyQ developers do something about this finicky pairing process.
Received my order on time and as promised.I installed myself (75 year old retiree😊).

What a relief to know the garage door is SHUT!  My husband has left it open by accident 6 times now...driving me crazy as we've got too tools, camping gear, etc on there.  So nice to be able not only to check it from my phone, but to be able to close it when I'm not even home.  Only concern is I'm worried the little sensor that goes on the garage door will stay on there.  I'm in South Carolina and our temps are already in the high 90's.  Hope it doesn't melt that little sucker right off our garage door....

Overall, the device was easy to install and get working with my garage and my WiFi network. However, they require a premium subscription if you want to use it with IFTTT, Google Home, Alexa, etc. Seriously? It's definitely not worth $10/month. That's the about the price of Amazon Prime where you get Amazon Video, basic Amazon music, better shipping, etc. However, this device thinks integrating with other services is worth that. Move on to something else.

This product works as described. Easy/simple install that took less than 15 minutes total. Easy integration with App.No major issues, other than if by chance you have door sensors that will not allow the door to close if something is blocking it, once that trips, you have to manually close the door via the physical button and reset the unit, then reset your phone app for all to resync. I did not look for a fix to avoid the rebooting of everything, but once I did it, everything came right back up.

Had to go thru 4-5 attempts during the set up.....watched videos before hand...followed the steps religiously, and still gave me a hard time to connect......took me about 1 hour to finally get it to connect....BUT once I got it going, it works great....I can check the status of my garage door from anywhere, and I can close and open it from anywhere...LOVE IT

Went through the install process, and the app will not let me through with Server Error 000.And any reps from Chamberlain who feel like replying with some bs canned response, save your time and don’t bother unless you plan on heavily compensating me for the time lost with your piece of trash device.

The My Q hub was easy to install, no wires to run.  It works as advertised,  Only problem I had was I had to re-program my Liftmaster opener in my truck, was no big deal.  I wished it could be used with Alexa and Apple Home.I like the notifications and being able to set a schedule.  I also like the warning light and audible alarm when closing the door with the app.

Let me start by saying the product works great. The one thing I would warn buyers about is that when setting up there is an option to scan the serial number on the back of the hub (the bigger piece) or enter it manually. I tried probably ten times of going through the process fully from start to finish to get my hub to link to my receiver. The last time I went through the motions before I sent it back was enter the number in manually. Before you knew it in no time everything linked fine and was working great. For some reason it seems when scanning it it wasn’t filling connecting somehow. I also had issue with it connecting to my WiFi which posed an issue but everything worked fine once I entered the number manually. Maybe coincidence, maybe not. Also, as a side note the unit will beep and flash the light when choosing to close the garage door from the app. I have researched and there is no way to disable this as they say it is a safety feature mandated to stay on. Other than that it is great!

This was a little finicky to setup, but it got the job done in the end for my 2 year old MyQ Liftmaster.  Worked great for a few months, then it suddenly stopped working.  I contacted support, and they said verbatim "Yeah, it worked for your MyQ Liftmaster previously as a sort-of hack.  We updated it though, so now you need to buy a home bridge."  Seriously?  That's the same price as the original device purchased.  Feels like a manufacturer bait-and-switch scam.  Too bad I'm a couple of months outside of the refund window for this product.

I've red some review that it is so hard to install (professionals took 12 hours to install 2, etc) and people are having problems with connecting it to wifi...Well, I installed the app, followed all instructions and less than 30 minutes later, everything was up and running - the hub to open and close the garage door and then sensor to tell me if the door is open or closed. So far, everything is working great, the whole family has the app now and any one of us can open/close the door via the cell phone.

The only reason I'm reviewing is to help others. I searched high and low (aka google'd the crap out of it) to figure out if this would work with my Overhead Odyssey 1000 (Model 7030) opener. There were a couple of reviews that said it wouldnt work and one said it would. MyQ web sites / compatibility checker would say YES on one page and no on another. The answer is YES it DOES work. Not just monitoring mode but, it will open the door. YOU do need your transmitter remote to program it. Most importantly follow these steps and repeat them several times (took like 20-30 mins to get the right combo to make this work). Step 1, tap the black program button 1 time (blue like flashes), then quickly again (purple light flashes, your in program model). Step 2, click and hold door open button on your transmitter for like 2 seconds (DONT KEEP holding it, doesnt work). This should now help MyQ program the door. I will open and close the door fairly quickly, then will open (2nd open fairly quickly), and the last close wont happen for like 1 or 2 mins so be patient. Now your good. As for the product, it works well, I would like the ability for it to self close after x period of time based on a rule. It will warn you but, doesnt close it automatically.

So easy to install!  No wires.  Connects to your garage door opener wirelessly like any other universal remote.  Nice, easy to use app that lets you know if door is up or down and lets you open and close door remotely.  Installed mine in 10 minutes.  Instructions say to mount hub on garage ceiling but I mounted mine on the wall because it was easier.  Works great.  I don’t know why anyone would buy a device that requires hard wiring.  IPhone useres - follow the separate network instructions for iPhones you will find in the box.  This will save you time.

It really does let you add your garage door to your home automation.  Slightly more complicated than things like light switches since you need to use simple commands and set up a routine in Alexa but not difficult.  The warning light and alarm when closing the door are, personally, annoying but you can't slight them for safety.  Some electrical tape easily blocks out the blinding light.  Other wise it's great to be able to say a command and have the garage door open.

After spending 3 hours trying to program this opener I can say it is useless. The product communicates with my opener, evident by the light patterns on the devices but fails to open the door. I have verified that my exact opener is compatible but it refuses to work. I am very adept at these kind of installs and would not recommend this product. I would instead opt for a wifi portal that hard wires to the opener, much more reliable and efficient. This is a poorly executed product with little though for the user.

FALSE ADVERTISING!!! THIS DOES NOT WORK WITH ALEXA OR GOOGLE. YOU MUST PAY A MONTHLY FEE FOR IT TO WORK WITH GOOGLE AND ALEXA HAS NO SKILL FOR IT NONE ZIP ZERO... NO WORKY.  You can make it work with a third party app that a user created but it unofficial. Shame on you Amazon for letting this advertise like this.

I was not aware of this nor did I think of this when I purchased this device.  Today i received a call from my son who just luckily was home.  My home lost Internet connectivity due to a power outage at my ISP.  When that connectivity was restored, my MYQ door opener picked up the signal but being it had lost connectivity the garage door just kept opening and closing when connectivity was restore.  IF my son had not been home all afternoon my house could have been open for anyone to enter.  Please be aware of this issue, the support person I spoke to acknowledged  this will happen when network connectivity is lost.  Very unhappy with this finding.

It says it works for most of the latest garage door but seems like it's not compatible for my garage door.Problem is not with the compatibility, the actual issue is after trying for 30 minutes it pairs with my garage door successfully, but it never worked. Whenever I press the open button the app says opening for 1 minute, 2 minute, etc but it never opens my garage door and same for closing.

The price is right, but it doesn’t work on all the openers it says it works with. Had to chose the Chamberlin config for a Genie. Even after it successfully opened and closed the door, it said it didn’t connect and we could only use the sensor to tell us if the door was opened or closed. Wonderful!! Now I get to sit all day knowing a door is open and I cannot do anything about it.  Spend the money and get a better one.

We made the decision to purchase this as we wanted the ability to open our garage door using a phone app so when riding our motorcycle it would be possible to open/close the door without carrying an opener.  The opener couldn't be easier to install, took less than 10 minutes.  Works as advertised, easily open/close the garage door with the app and you can easily see when the door is open or closed.  Also provides notifications when there is movement of the door.  Ready to try Amazon Key but want a camera in the garage just to be safe and a ring camera looks easy enough to pair for added peace of mind.My one disappointment is I have yet to figure how to easily pair with Alexa.  We are an Alexa house, not Google, and while I think its possible there are conflicting reports online and requires more research than I'm willing to commit right now.
The ad made it seem like it would work as a garage door opener for my Guardian door opener, but once installed it said it could monitor only.

I bought this extra door sensor because I have two garage doors.  The Hub I bought only came with one door sensor.  The MyQ app allows me to open or close my garage doors from my phone, or check the status of the doors when I am away.  No more "did I close the garage door?" after leaving the house.  I can check my phone immediately and check the status.  You can also let someone in your garage by using the app and then closing when they leave.

This thing doesn't work for me most of the time. Closing especially. My device is only 25 feet from my router. It is super cool when it does work but when I get home with a car full of kids and groceries and wanna open my garage from my phone I find it is yoo frustrating to try and use this thing and it doesn't work. It is spot on eith notifications of activity. I wouldn't suggest this to any family or friends

My garage door was installed some 15 years ago so I installed this door opener kit for the advantage of having control over the garage gate when i'm away from home.  It works really great and so far I'm extremely pleased.  My only hurdle during initial setup was to get the hub connected to my wi-fi as the included instructions are not very clear.  That said, I found thorough instructions without much difficulty on the chamberlain website.  Two nice features are that (i) i can check the garage door status from any location and (iI) the audible alert the hub emits  just before and during door closure.
I tried a few smart garage door opener options, and they don't stand up to this one. The criteria I had for the device I was looking for was:- Needed to work with my garage door (of course)

It was super easy to setup and install.  But it stopped working after 2 days.  Went offline, and I couldn’t get it to come back.  I finally made it through to support (couldn’t contact them from app, had to go through computer to find a number to call), tried to reset everything over the phone, like I had already done by myself, and they are going to ship out a new power cord for the unit.Support seems good so far, and I’ll update this review if the power cord does the trick.

I bought this because I kept forgetting my bike outside of the garage and it finally got stolen (a conventional garage door opener was too bulky and inconvenient to carry, so I would go inside to open it up). Now I can ride up and open the garage door with an app. Setting it up was super easy--I didn't have any issues with range from the router or interference from other devices. Very happy--I wish I had done it before my last bike got stolen.

The Chamberlain smart garage door opener provides peace of mind when after you leave the house you question whether or not you shut the garage door. It provides the status of the door, plus a history of when the door was opened and shut. Further, you can program it to shut the door at a scheduled time should you forget and leave it open. I found the installation to be relatively easy, but I am an experienced DYI guy.

I got the item with deep discount from Amazon as open box item. I always want a garage remote embedded with smartphone and this product serves the purpose very well. Few years back it requires to spend $100+with professional installation now down to almost 1/3 of the price plus simple 15 mins DIY thanks to this product. One star off due to missing original cohesive when coming in but quickly solved by putting velco tape. Very happy with this product overall

The unit was very easy to install and worked perfectly without any issues.My only issue is that despite advertising on their website that they support Apple HomeKit, the software only allows you to view (not control, just view) the other devices in your HomeKit from the myQ app. It’s very confusing to understand who needs this feature.

Does not work very well. The door sensor keeps getting out of sync and you can't operate the door from the app when it gets out of sync. Support from the manufacturer is virtually non existent. Apparently you can't connect it to google assistant and you can only connect it to one service for free, then they want to start charging you a subscription fee for a service they are not providing to begin with. Seems like a scam.

At this point, all the thing can do is tell me when the garage door opens.  It’s supposed to work with my opener (Genie Pro Stealth), but it doesn’t.  It is really unreliable at capturing garage door closures (missed roughly half of them).  I’m beginning to understand why it was on sale.

Very easy to install. Worked on my Chamberlain garage door seamlessly. It functions as any other wireless remote control. I was told by a garage door installer that I had to buy a new garage door opener in order to achieve control of the door from my phone, but that was not true. This allows me to determine the position of my door, i.e. whether it is up or down, and to open and close the door from anywhere my cell phone has access. One caution: allow the door to open or close. Do not issue close/open commands in close succession.

Overall I love this and was easy to install and had easy to follow instructions with minimal installation.  However, there is lengthy delay in technology from iPhone to garage hub to open/close...Very simplistic design and easy to use / teach...

We had the Aladdin Connect system for a couple of years and HAAAAAAAAATED it. On Black Frost the myQ was on sale and I was able to save even more by buying an open box item. We are so happy with this product. First off, the app allows Touch ID or Face ID for login (Aladdin doesn’t). Second the door opens very quickly, much quicker than Aladdin. Third, the app is superior in almost every way. I TSS such a better experience. We are very happy!

Installation was very easy with my garage door, and the app connects reliably, and I am overall very pleased with how it works. However, when it comes to closing the door, it beeps and flashes a bright light for about 5 seconds before it triggers the door. I understand this is for safety, but I was expecting to not have that delay. My garage door already has safety features built in and I feel that having the warning is unnecessary.

I was adding a second door to the app, Setup was a pain. There a list of things that just weren't working out.  What did work was removing the app off all the devices and installing it on only one device. From there the setup was easy. I then reinstalled the app back on the other devices.I found out that Mounting the hardware close to the opener motor gave errors, it wouldn't connect or see the sensor mounted in the door. I ended up moving the Hub closer to the garage door and all those issues went away. Now it works flawlessly.

I’m a girl and a nearly 70 year old one at that...... who has more electronic WiFi gadgets connected to my router than the law allows.I had zero problems connecting this product! It works fine for me! I’m glad I didn’t read any reviews before purchasing it or I probably would not have bought it!  However, I am obviously more cell phone obsessed than others and would not dream of connecting My Q to my Alexa! The only thing that does concern me is whether the tape on the back of the garage door sensor will continue to adhere to it during the more humid months. Otherwise, I’ll deal with it if and when I need to. I’m lovin’ My Q!

I purchased this remote to work with an 8 year old Liftmaster opener (also made by Chamberlain). The instructions were clear, installation took less than an hour, and both the link to the opener and to the remote MyQ app were easy to connect. I wanted to control access to my vacation home by service persons and this is doing the job well after a month of use.

This was an easy install for me.  Hug is approximately 30’ from my WiFi hub with two walls in between.  I was concerned after reading some reviews but it sync’d easily with my network and was working perfectly in just a few minutes.  I use this on my short term rental to give me confidence my property is properly locked up after tenants vacate my property.  Really gives me peace of mind since I just look at my phone app to validate the status of my garage door.  Love this!
Pros-Install is easy.

Seems to work as advertised. But the configuration is really a nightmare. I'm a tech guy, I can handle myself around these gizmos, this one took me a lot to figure it out how to configure it. If you have a product like this you need to have a well documented process or a simple enough app to handle the configuration.The box comes with two pamphlets, one looks like a book, another like a loose sheet. The loose sheet is key to configure it. That's a really bad design. These guys need a better design department and a less technical team to go over the design of their apps.

I tried to set up Google integration and after setting up the account, found that myQ no longer supports the feature even though they still show it on their website and allow your to subscribe.  Without Smart Home compatibility the product is very limited in having to be controlled from only the app.  I cannot recommend the product until they re-add the smart home features (and not charge for them).Look into a Google/Alexa WiFi Smart Garage Door Controller instead to have a device they can actually perform basic functions (and costs a little less than this myQ).

This device works fine UNTIL you try to use your existing remotes - then the nightmares begin. Installing the MyQ and the app was relatively simple, but then the remotes in my cars didn't work, nor did the existing wireless keypad. One of my cars has a handheld remote and I was able to get that to work relatively easily. My Audi uses HomeLink and it took over 45 minutes on the phone with tech support before that worked. The wireless keypad never worked, in spite of calls to tech support. Their final suggestion was to remove ALL existing programing and start over. Given the extreme difficulty with programing my HomeLink remote, that was unacceptable. So now I have a functioning MyQ and a useless wireless keypad.

For my Liftmaster garage door opener the instructions in the app are incorrect. This required a call to their support which thankfully was painless. The "learn" LED light is yellow on my garage opener, however on the app yellow doesn't work. The tech support call eventually had my use the purple light after asking the color of the plastic on the antenna. As Liftmaster and Chamberlain are the same company it seems odd that they would make this mistake. Thereafter the opener works as intended. Another curious fact is they partner with Amazon for in house delivery yet don't offer support for Alexa.

Work great! Setup is easy. Instructions don't tell you how to set it up. Once you download the app, it explains how to set it up. It has written instructions and videos. You can setup security. Options do include opening and closing of the door, along with email and or push alerts. You can also set security for opening the account settings in the app. Might want to consider the MyQ door open (wall mount), which includes accessing the hub.

I bought this because it said that it works with most openers built after 1993. Well, my house was built in 1997, so I thought I would be set. Unfortunately, that was not the case. After wasting an hour going up and down a ladder, having to continuously hit the code button on the motor, I was told by the app that the version of my motor had to be made 1997 or later.WHAT THE HELL!

Any issues I had were "operator error", my errors when connecting to my WiFi. Actually I was pressing the wrong Color Learn button on my Garage door opener. I have a problem with some colors. Once I pressed the correct color Learn button it was easy-peasy from there.  I was never sure if I closed the garage door at night, or even if it was open or closed. Now, as long as I'm within my WiFi range I know if the Garage door is open or closed..  also, it shows you the last "status" , Closed or Open...  so if you drive away and not sure if you closed the garage door, all you have to do is check the App and see what the last Status was ...  giving you piece of mind..  so I think it's cooler than sliced bread !!  only thing I didn't like is how loud the Alarm is. When the door closes it Blares out a loud Alarm and flashing light warning that the door is about to close..  but I wrapped a piece of carpet around the speaker to muffle it a tad..  I would have given it 5 stars but since It's only been up for a few days I will wait and see if it's still working a year from now..?

The opener works well and after a few months using it, it has operated correctly.However I purchased it to use with Amazon Key (in-garage delivery), and I'm finding that most of what I buy from Amazon is not available to be delivered using the service.  Expensive items end up on my porch while $10 stationery is securely delivered to my garage.

I have to say I love this thing. Worry about whether or not you shut the garage door is a thing of the past. However I had a bitch of a time getting it to work with my Craftsman opener. I had to call customer service and it took a while to get it to work but it's definitely worth it. Use it multiple times a day.  Works as a remote or alert if someone opens the door. In certain areas Amazon can even use it to put your deliveries in the garage. (Can't wait for that in my city)

This product is very easy to install and program. There are YouTube videos that help a lot so make sure you watch those as the written instructions are lacking quite a bite. I rated it with 5 stars because it was very easy for me to install and program.This product is very handy should you need to open your door for a repairman or relative that needs access to your garage. They call ou on your phone and if you feel it's necessary you can open a door and close it when they call you. Also if someone opens a door you get notification of that as well.

I wanted to like this product. It’s something I didn’t need but really wanted. I have pretty good Wi-Fi coverage surrounding my house and stay above 50% on WiFi across the street from my attached garage. While setting up, it was a coin flip of being told the signal is low. After not connecting to the WiFi network for an hour, I brought the hub into the house to no avail and finally into the same room as my router. After a few hours of attempting, I’ve given up. I’d like to believe I have a defective product.

Have owned this product for 2 weeks now and am loving it. No more wondering if I forgot to close my garage door on my way out in the morning. Very convenient for me to open my garage remotely for family dropping items when I am away, and I no longer have to give them outside opener codes.Installation was a breeze and took less than 15minutes.  The video provided by the app made everything so simple. Well done!

Best $30 I have spent in a long while.  Took 20-30 minutes to install. The time was mostly hauling the ladder around and screwing the bracket on the high ceiling. If I had to do it again, I could probably do it in 10 minutes.It works beautifully.  I can easily see whether the door is open or closed. I can also check the history of when it was opened whether I use the normal clicker or not.  PERFECT.

Sooo awesome. This was very easy to install. I started my journey when I was looking for a new garage door remote and this was on sale for practically the same price as new remotes; the best part, my phone becomes my remote. I was able to share the access without sharing my password to 3 family members. It was so easy.I bought this to go with my Chamberlain Whisperdrive opener. It was not specifically listed however it was made in 2009. We were still good. The button to connect was more of a grey and not purple but it still connected without issue. I am very pleased with it.

Now that it’s installed it does everything that I wanted. Let’s me know when the door is opened and I can check to see if the door is closed. The only issue I had was I couldn’t get it setup. I called their support line and the agent was great. Very patient and knowledgeable. He would definitely get 5 stars.

This is an excellent way to upgrade an existing garage door opener to the new technology which comes with the current state-of-the-art products.Now I can receive a notification on my phone and via email if my garage has been opened or closed, and can also check the status (ie is it open and for how long?)

I'm not sure why anyone would give this product a bad review. It took about 10 minutes to install and it work immediately the first time. I no longer worry about "did I remember to close the garage door." I just check the app on my android phone and it tells me if the door is open or closed and for how long. If I left it open I merely close it using the app. The only minor problem I had was synching it with my home security system. Once I took the time to ACTUALLY read the instructions everything synched beautifully.

How many times have you gotten half way to work and wonder if you've shut the garage door?  I don't know about you, but I do all the time.  I always seem to get distracted getting out the door - kids, garbage, lunches, etc.  Well, this little device just solved that issue.  DH said it was easy to install and the app is on both our phones.  We didn't integrate it with Alexa because we have Google.  Not sure if it's compatible with that device.  100% recommend.

This little device has closed my garage automatically on multiple occasions and likely prevented theft. It is pretty easy to install as long as the garage has a good WiFi connection. The app allows you to set automatic timers or warnings and it is easy to open or close the door remotely.I really like being able to give people temporary access through the app and will use it for Amazon deliveries as soon as I get a camera in the garage.
Two things, 1. The actual product is great 2. False advertisement regarding it working with Alexa.1. The system was extremely easy to setup. Clear instructions and setup to WiFi was simple and fast.

Easiest install ever. All products should be this good. Used 3M Command strip to avoid drilling any holes. Followed the easy instructions and it works like a dream. Cannot beat the price too. App works perfectly and I can set a 'close' time to ensure my door is never left open. You can even receive notifications if the door is opened from the conventional switch. If the door moves, you will know about it. Everybody needs one of these.

At the time I purchased this I was not into Alexa and would have rated it a 5/5. However I now use Alexa in my house and was a little disappoointed that it did not have any Alexa integration. I have mostly gotten over it by now because who needs to ask Alexa to close the garage door when the app does it quick and easily as well. Still running great, though I find the batteries run out quickly for the key pad.
Easy to use and install. It’s just a remote connected to WiFi. Not anymore dangerous/hack able than a keypad.Addition...

I love mine.  Works great with my older genie garage door opener.  I found it super easy to set up and connect.  The only 2 things very minor is 1) doesn't warn you but you will have to reprogram you remotes and key pad.  That was easy though.  And 2) It's a different ap so my home automation is split between this and my alexa and my samsung smart hub devices.  You get the notifications on your phone anyway so probably doesn't really matter that I have so many devices to get my home automated.  The price was great!  I made my genie garage door opener a smart garage super cheap compared to buying and installing a state of the art one!
I can now use my phone to check my garage door status and open and close it from anywhere.I can’t count the times I wasn't sure if I left the garage door open SOLVED with this device.

This product is a great concept, however, our WiFi is less than 20’ away and the device kept losing connection. I tried several different WiFi routers I have and everyone did the same thing with this device. I even did the system check and it said i had a strong connection when it was originally connected. I would love to see better technology come out for this product. All in all it felt cheap and you had to go through the entire setup each time to reconnect to WiFi. It should just have a place on the app to select your WiFi and reconnect without having to get the device back off the ceiling each time.

Install was easier than expected and haven't had any issues opening or closing the garage doors.  I don't prefer the beeping when I close the garage door from the app, but usually I am not in the garage when I close it on the app, anyway.  Was able to place two sensors on one unit, and one sensor on the other (three doors total) and they all are on one very simple format page on the app.  Very happy with purchase.

The system is great when it works, but if my WIFI as much as flickers, the system disconnects, and does not re-connect. I had to re-set it with phone once. Help desk said, "Get an extender, and put it in your house." The unit is six feet (through one wall) from my WIFI, don't know why an extender will help. My computer and phone have interaction with my WIFI at 20 feet outside the far corner of the grarage (as well as all over the house through multiple walls). The unit is way under-built ... a piece of junk. {when it works, it is good, but I am away, and when I return home, my app says "off-line." Good think I kept one of the remotes]

I was a little afraid of the setup process because of some of the reviews I had read. I have to say that setup was a breeze and I love the unit! I would highly recommend it if you are looking for a smart garage door solution. I also love being able to check and make sure that my garage door is closed.

Simple operation BUT chamberlain requires a paid service to link to Google and IFTT which is deplorable. Also has zero geofencing capability. Basically use your phone as a remote BUT no widget capabilities. I downloaded Wink so I could use widgets. Too many work arounds for the cost. Not worth it to make it truly integrated into a smart home as I wanted to do.

Set up and programming was a bit tricky for me but mobile app got me in contact with support quickly. With in 15mins. I was up and running. I also got a second door sensor a week later and now have both of my garage doors set up. The mobile app is easy to work with and is free to use. The only dissapointing issue is that should you wish your google home or Alexa to purchase a subscription. I understand that having the use of the mobile  app  for free is very genorus compared to other competors, so thank you Chamberlin. However, as far as needing to pay for a subscription so i could have  my google home open my garage door doesn't appear to be the best use of my limited income.

We love ours - it's helped so much with those "whoops, did I close the door" times and the occasional person stopping by to pick something up, we can open up and close without granting them access to our home while we aren't there.We've now purchased and installed these for our parents and it's great that you can have multiple users on an account therefore allowing us to access their homes with our app as well. Good buy!

Installing this was a breeze and I  was hoping I would be able to rely on it to close and open the garage door without having to carry a fob around. It does give me alerts when the door is left open for a certain duration. But if you wanted to buy something to close/open your product through  an app from your phone, then this product is not what you are looking for. At random times, it would just beep and pretend it is about to close the garage Door, and it doesn't. We are done with it now, and I  will soon take it out. I wish it worked!

The system works as advertised.  I am using the MYQ to operate and monitor two garage doors with Genie Screw Drive operators.  The whole installation could have been completed in about 1 1/2 hours but one of the receiver boards on the Genie Operators had failed in a mode which let existing transmitter operate the door but would not allow programming of new transmitters.The MYQ has only fully been installed for about 3 days and so far everything is working as advertised.

Garage stopped functioning properly ever since I installed this MyQ opener on my garage door. I am not sure whether the issue is with the sensors or something else that causes the garage door to stop as if something is blocking the door, it beeps and retracts back to the original position. I have to hold the garage door opener for the door to close whenever I face the issue. Not recommended, defeats the purpose of installing when it is not reliable.

I'm a careful person til one day i forgot to close my garage door. Luckily my Arlo in my garage detected motion which alerted me that i forgotten to close the garage door.No more of that problem from now on as i've successfully installed and linked this MyQ Smart Garage Hub. I can easily open or close my garage door remotely from my cellphone.

Purchased for my kids who do not have remote to the garage door in their car.  Took less than 10 mins to install, works like a charm.  Get notice to my phone every time the garage door opens or closes.  No longer have to work about "porch pirates", can give Amazon a virtual key to open garage to place package inside.  Great product, reasonable price, and just works as described.

Initial the system installation went fairly easy although it did not have an option for the type of security we use so we chose each option until it linked. However after we reset the home network because of an outside issue I can no longer get the system to link with the home network. Factory troubleshooting has not helped and I will try relocating the hub to see if it’s being interfered with but if that doesn’t work I will return it. Great idea but they need to update their software to stay current.

It was not Clear I only needed One Hub - Anyway - the install went pretty good, the only hard part is installing the hub and making sure your wifi will reach out into your garage.  I had purchased Myq a while ago and tested my Wifi in the garage - NO GO - I then purchase a new ERRO mesh system and it did the trick. Instalation was pretty simple (except you ahve to look at YouTube to see how to install correctly - there are really no instruction with the product.
First, very happy with the product, but the product research and install took some time.Reviewer 'steve' provides valuable info.

I'm super satisfied with the hub. I had some concerns when reading some reviews, but this solution seemed simpler than others out there, so I gave it a try - couldn't be happier.Important things to know:

Great product. The only issue that I have with this garage door opener is with the app. So I went to the app to share the garage door opener and the camera, In the share part of the settings you are only allowed to share the garage door not the camera.  I think this is something that Chamberlain needs to correct. My wife should have the option of seeing the camera without being logged into my account!!

Works great.  I wanted something that would allow me to see if my garage door was open or closed if i wasnt home.  We have a habit of leaving door open over night.  Now at 8pm, it checks door and if open, it closes door.  I dont need it to talk to Alexia or some other internet know it all.  It does what it says it will do.  Its $80.  And does it well.

After 2 hours of attempting to install this unit to sync to my Liftmaster opener (only 5 years old), I finally gave up and tried to chat with tech the manufacturer tech support. They never could understand the problem and they disconnected the chat conversation. Called their tech support - waited in the que for 30 minutes - explained the situation as I have strong wifi signal and clear line of site to the opener. Still won't work - after a long conversation they said that they were going to transfer me to a "tier 2" technical rep and I told them that I was unwilling to wait another 30-45 minutes on hold. The customer service rep didn't seem to care that I was frustrated - I gave up and returned it to Amazon for a full refund. Bad product - bad service.

In my previous house I had a garage door that had myQ built in, after having that, when I moved to my new home I knew I had to have it again. This product makes it possible without having to install a whole new garage door opener. It was very easy to install. It allows you to program alerts, like when the door opens, etc. and if you can’t remember if you closed the garage door you can just check the app. One of the coolest features is being able to open the garage door from the app, from anywhere! You’re out of town and you need to let someone in your house but they don’t have a key, no problem. Highly recommend.

I purchased this product with the intent to compliment my existing classic remotes. I anticipated it being an easy install. However, I took a journey through several calls to customer service and techs. I consider myself a techie, but the install was complex and a waste of time.I spent a lot of time on the phone with their IT trying to figure it out. They attempted to update the firmware to no avail. After several tries the IT person said they would mail another one to me.

I love this product! It’s a great addition to our very old garage door opener, and a great addition to our smart home. Before, we had trouble using the keypad to open our garage because the buttons would stick. Now, in one click, we can use our phone to open our garage in a matter of seconds! You can secure it using Face ID or Touch ID, so if someone gets access to your phone, they can’t get access to your garage. It’s also incredibly easy to install and to pair with the garage door. I highly recommend this!

Great product setup was easy and once the app is installed is very easy to set up. I will suggest that if you are using it on a garage door that is facing the sun most of the day you don't want to use the supplied 3M strips as the door will get really hot and the sensor will fall off. What I suggest is that you use zip ties to hold it in place. And with that being done like that it's easy to get off in case you have to replace the garage door or you have to relocate to a new house and you can take that device with you. Great product works well with Google just do not like that you have to pay for the integration. But hey it works like a champ. You can open and close your door from anywhere. And if you pair it with a video doorbell you can sign up for the Amazon prime keychain, that will open your garage door start recording with the video doorbell when you have packages delivered via Amazon.

This does not work consistently and it gives way too many false alarms and data.  I set up an alert to notify me if the garage door remain open for more than 5 min.  Unfortunately, I have received numerous false alerts and it has cause serious problems.  On at least 3 occasions, when no one was home and the garage door was closed, I received the alert that the door was open.  Then the APP also showed the door to be open.  On those 3 occasions I then used the APP to close the door remotely but in reality, I was actually opening the door.  It was only thanks to a friendly neighbor that called to tell me that my garage door was open that I realized that the APP and the alert did not work and gave false data.  I have since disconnected the unit and determined that I had wasted my money.

I decided to purchase the MyQ beacuse I find myself turning around and driving back to the house about once a quarter since I could not recall with 100% certainty if I closed the garage. I wanted to be able to check it from my phone for piece of mind, and then have the ability to close it remotely, should I need to.This product checks all of those boxes. The actual physical installation was simple. We have 16' ceilings in the garage, so I was a bit worried if the distance between the box and the part you attach to the garage door was too far apart. No problems thus far.

So you consider purchasing this, but then you read the reviews from "experts" who install this stuff "for a living."  And they say, "don't buy this."  Well, consider the fact that the "experts" usually are of the opinion that they do not need hand holding nor do they need to follow directions.  I have learned, in watching "experts" that they commonly ignore written directions and just dive in.  My experience with things that use Wifi and Bluetooth is that you follow the steps exactly as they are listed, and when you do, usually the thing just works -- correctly, the first time.  Which was my experience.  Took me all of 20 minutes to unbox, watch a video, follow the in app guide and have it installed.  Works as advertised.

We are very happy with the MyQ Smart Garage Door Opener.  It is worth the price alone just to be able to check the garage door status remotely to make sure it is shut. Love the history showing the opening and closing record as well. Would have given it five stars, but it does occasionally fail to open when triggered. It took a little work to sync it with our garage door opener, but not too excessive.

I installed it quickly and was impressed that it was really easy to install. I understand the need that it has an alarm to let you know that the door is going to shut or open but I don’t have children or any reason to have an alarm on it and there’s no way to shut it off.  At least it’s not too loud although it is definitely noticeable, I was worried I would hear it in the house and my garage door gets opened at all hours so I was a little worried but that part isn’t too bad. There is definitely a few seconds of lag time because it wants to  have the audible alarm give you some notice before it opens her shuts.But overall, I would definitely recommend this as it makes it so much easier to open the garage door as my keypad and remotes are often finicky and I have had no problem whatsoever with the app functioning correctly.  I wish I had hooked it up sooner .

I had the original Chamberlain Smart Hub MYQ and it was starting to disconnect randomly for hours at a time. I had to get a door sensor for my garage door to reliable know when it was opening and closing. My Wifi signal was quite strong (~60db) so I wasn’t sure if it was perhaps an issue on MYQ’s end.Flash forward a few months, I splurged on the brand new model and it has worked perfectly since day 1, no issues what soever. On the one hand, this is the functionality I expected with the original, but on the other hand, I’m happy the new model greatly improved in connectively and reliability.

Wow. Installation was easy. None of the problems I read in some reviews. Downloaded the App and followed the step by step process. Adding the second door unit also simple.  Very satisfied. I set up rules to notify me if door is open greater than 10 minutes and i like the automatic open notifications.Only question is how long does the sensor battery life last.

This has made my life so much easier! We use it when we go out riding, we use it if we have people coming to do work on the house and we're not home to let them in, the dog sitter, etc. It's great. The video installation guide was awesome I loved it! I wish everything came with a video installation guide like that. It really was super easy to do. setting it up on the phone was no problem either and you can share it to multiple phones for use so my husband has it on his phone as well.

What better than being able to control and keep an eye on your garage from a distance.In the age of remote garage door openers, it's nice to know if someone got a hold of your code (easy to do) and is entering your garage. Especially if your garage is the entry into your home. I have a 2 car garage and bought 2 sensors. Easy to install.  Only think I've noticed is both doors will not receive a signal if you use the app and hit open/close too close in time. Give it a few seconde between sending the signal and you're good to go. The doors open and close every time. No problems!

This first shipment yielded an easy install but the sensor that attaches to top panel of garage door that relays whether the door is open or closed would not function correctly even through it went thru setup without any issues.  Case number was assigned by Chamberlain Tech Support. I am ordering another as i believe this was just just a fluke.

I'm writing this 3 years since owning. First, have to say I have 2 Genie doors. The documentation states genies are difficult. I agree. Works. Doesn't work. Works. Doesn't work. Back and forth for 3 years. Door sensors always say low battery. Even after several replacements. I cannot recommend this system. I went with the wyze smart switches and integrated my own relays to go with my cameras. All systems in one app.

We were fed up with all of our garage door remotes, clickers and outside push buttons. Time to go with the time and new technology. Unit was easy to install and easy to connect to the internet via my smartphone. Now I can do everything I need to do with the garage door without worrying about batteries, distance to the door or location of the remote. Love it.
Note that I got this for my second garage door.  Works as expected.Ensure that the hub is located at a distance where this can be paired.

I like having control of my garage door from anywhere and getting notifications when the door opens and closes. I get my prime packages delivered in the garage now using amazon key. I read some not so good reviews on the installation process and was a little weary about buying this just for that reason but I can honestly say that after watching a YouTube video and following the step by step instructions and a little common sense (my wife helped me) we were able to have it up and running in just minutes. We love this garage door opener. I would recommend this for anyone wanting control of their garage door from their smart phone and to anyone who likes getting notifications when the door has opened and closed.

I lost a few days on my install.  Everything is tied to downloading the app.  There are no instructions or anything.  The problem is, there were multiple apps alled 'MyQ'.  I picked the wrong one.  That was my fault, not their fault.  BUT... I must not be the first dummy to do that.  So, maybe they could put a little QR code on the box to assure one scans the right thing.  Ok, off to install.

I've had a couple of times when it gave me some difficulty logging back in to the app, but mostly, it just works, stays logged in, and works well.I got it just in time; my wife lost her garage door opener remote, but now she can use her phone.

A few years ago I installed a Garagio system to my existing not-smart Genie garage door opener.  The Garagio system pretty much provides the same smartphone functions but was way more complicated to install and involved wiring and such.  A couple years went by and I could not get it to work again after changing networks.  When I read the install instructions for the Chamberlain I literally thought it could not be this easy and thought I must have bought the wrong product.  Nope, I bought the right thing and it was a complete breeze to install.  If you have the technical ability to install a light bulb then you can do this.

I like the fact that I can check anywhere and anytime to see if the door is open/closed. This gives me some piece of mind as I have left the house before and then wondered if I shut the garage door from the car when leaving. Some things you sort of do automatically but then later begin to wonder if you did indeed do it. Install was quite easy but getting the unit to talk to my garage door opener was frustrating when following the guide. Finally the next day I tried it again a few times and low and behold it worked to my amazement. My only dislike now is the annoying beeping sound it makes when closing and still continues to make for about 10 seconds after the door has been fully closed. Think I'll open it up and try putting some tape over the beeper opening to lower the volume. I still want to hear the beep as a test for the door mounted part of the system to insure that it's battery is good and is communicating OK.

It's cool that this allows you to control most garage door openers via the MyQapp,but I bought it because it advertised Google home integration and control, yet it requires a subscription to do so AND it does not open or close via Google home. After a long run around of filling useless guides from MyQ that are completely inaccuate, I got Google assistant on my phone to tell me if the door is open or closed, but only if I say a very specific command like "Hey Google, ask MyQ if the garage door is open" then I have to wait for it to connect and then the weird MyQ voice says yes or no. Very terrible integration with Google assistant, no integration with Google home, and false advertising. Will be returning immediately.

I got this kit with Amazon Prime day, so it only cost a third of the regular price. I downloaded the app to my Android first, the followed the instructions and I got it working within 15 min. I no longer have to run downstairs to check whether the garage door was left open or not. It helped me not to lock myself out of the condo without my car keys, unless I also forgot the cell phone... I love it and plan to get another one as a birthday gift or Xmas gift...

This is the second MyQ sensor I've purchased.  I'm using it on my single garage door and links up to my first MyQ sensor on my double garage door.  It works like a charm and installation was a breeze.  Only criticism I have is the sensor alerts for open/close on the MyQ app seem to have a random delay built in.  Some times when I open the garage door I'll get an instant alert on the app that it has opened and other times it can take up to an hour.  To me it's not a big deal and I didn't think it changes the functionality of the devices capabilities in my case.  The MyQ system has always opened and closed the garage doors within seconds and without fail.  For the price ($20 black Friday deal) I highly recommend this system.

Keeps getting disconnected...and to reconnect....u need to move the car out of the garage, get a ladder and reprogram with the garage door opener...What a pain each time it happens....I would not blame the WIFI for it. When I reprogram, it connects again without having to move it closer to the router or anything like that...

This thing was easy to set up. All I’m doing is using it for an Internet connected door opener. I don’t have it integrated with a smart home or anything else. You should check for a good Wi-Fi signal in your garage before considering do use of this. I can operate my garage door from my smart phone. I can tell when it was opened, when it was closed, and what its current position is.

This hub was very, very easy to install. Watched a couple of You Tube videos then unpacked it, followed the simple directions and KA-POW it was working!Stress relief with an app! If I forget to put my door down when I leave I can put it down easily with my phone. Boy is that nice! Very good value here. My neighbor will be at 'loose ends' as he can call me anymore and rub it in that I left my garage door up!

It works. My biggest complaint is that they have it locked down so you can't actually do anything useful with it unless you pay their monthly fee. It's a ridiculous to make people who are buying a smart device then have to pay monthly to use the smart device. This will be returned and I'll purchase a different brand from a different company that will do more and integrate with Alexa directly without a fee. The device also takes and extremely long time to open and close the door.

I installed one for my daughter and liked the concept so I ordered one for myself. It worked at my daughters house until Amazon had a delivery. After opening the door the Amazon driver couldn’t shut the door. The driver did the right thing and waited until someone was able to close the door. On the one I installed 40% of the time after I leave and close the door I get an alert saying it’s open. Support had me remove the app and install again. Still didn’t work so I’m returning it. For $25 it wasn’t worth the effort.

It comes with an adapter for various type of garage door and installation. My garage door is just a typical roll up so didn't need to use the adapter to install it. It paired with the garage door hub easily and functions as expected. My recommendation, read the instructions and make sure to follow them exactly. These units don't react well to people who try to install something and then refer to the manual when stuck!

I purchased this item during the latest Amazon Prime Days. I made sure my current garage door opener had the latest features to add this first. Install was fast and easy with both an online video and step by step instructions via Chamberlain's website. It took me about 15 minutes to get everything done and now I am able to remotely open and close my garage to let friends and family have access when I am away or when I forget my opener. Great product-highly recommend.

Very simple instructions and not difficult to install. The problem comes with syncing to your WiFi then your garage door opener. I have a Chamberlin garage door, should be easy.... nope. After climbing the ladder 20 times to hit test button only to get a can’t connect I gave up. Chamberlin does have tech support but it wasn’t easy to just get to a person. I like the idea of the device and you may have better luck.

The reason for the three on the installs I have a Chamberlain Access Master garage door opener.  In the instructions it does not tell you to not as in delete the sensor on the door because you do not need it if you have a recent Access Master garage door opener.  I have no clue why there is no instructions telling you to delete.  After 30 minutes on the phone and deleting the sensor off the app and starting over it works fine with a double tap on the icon to open and it double tap to close.  It worked at the beginning with the sensor so I don't know where it went wrong maybe an update or something.  Now with the deleted door sensor I only have the Wi-Fi hub and the garage door opener I hope this helps everybody else.  obviously the 3 stars is for the instructions not saying to not use the sensor with my particular garage door opener.  Could easily put an app instruction in or post something on the website and the frequently asked questions.  I mean how hard would it be to take one sentence and put it in???

After reading the reviews I was a bit doubtful of this but decided the price was low enough to take a chance.  The install was super easy just by following the directions on the app.  I have LED lights and cameras in my garage and everything works well with no interference.  Just follow the directions and have decent WIFI coverage and you will be fine.  The Amazon Key app works great with this and if they continue to develop and support this it could be even more useful.

The initial setup was easy and straight forward! The unit worked like a charm for about two weeks, then out of nowhere it failed to open or close the garage door. All attempts to reset and reprogram/pair the unit with my garage door opener has failed. Totally frustrated with trying to get this unit to work per the design! The “Only” thing this brick is currently good for is showing me that the garage door is in the open or closed position.  Would I purchase it again? NO!

Works like a charm. Hardest part of the install was the physical install on the garage roof. The app took couple of tries to connect to wifi  and also sync with door piece . learning garage code was easy. I was not expecting the time it takes start closing the garage but I can understand why it needs the flashing light and beeping.First year of linking to home assistants is free but would have loved to see expected fees going forward in the product description. if first year was not free I would have called bait and switch

bought 2 of these in nov of 2019 already received low battery warning on one of them batteries are easy to find for them 2450 flat batteries light in middle don't work on either of them but not worried about the light the openers have lights on them but on the good side it is nice to be able to see if you left the door open or open the door for a delivery or a guest to come in. didn't even know that they had batteries in them since they are plugged into an outlet.

What I liked best about MyQ is that it was super affordable and very easy to install. What I find I needed to learn is that it does not operate immediately. What I mean is the device has a built in flashing light and beeper. These go off for about 15 seconds before it closes the door. Also, it can take awhile (think 10 minutes or more) for the app to determine if the door is actually closed or open. I learned that it doesn't matter - the app has a single button to click, and it then opens a closed door or closes an open door. It can be controlled by more than one phone. Last, it does not talk to Alexa.
It took me more time to setup my ladder than to install this.Steps required:

I bought this so that my legacy garage door opener could be part of my home automation system. It was supposed to work with Smartthings. But the controls are not all there. Also, if you use with Amazon Key, about 90% of deliveries cannot use, since they are contract drivers, not Amazon employees. Useless for package theft prevention.Not too hard to set up and configure. Better than nothing. Less expensive than a new garage door opener.

This thing SOMETIMES works, sometimes will open the garage door and when leaving, and trying to close it, an ERROR message comes up and you are left with your garage door open, or having to turn around to physically close it. Basically the opposite of what you need the garage opener to do. Also, the fact that it makes a ridiculous fire alarm sound when closing the garage door, maybe to let the neighbors and potential burglars know that you are now leaving your home.

From your phone/app, you can (1) tell if the garage door is open or closed, (2) open the garage door, & (3) close the garage door.  Programming or paring it to the garage door opener was straight forward (thank god).  It also is Amazon Key compatible (Amazon delivery people can open your garage door) so you can select deliver by Amazon Key and the items will be left inside your garage.

So far I like everything about this product except it is not easy to integrate with Alexa.  It was easy to set up, took maybe 30min. Linked up with my network with no issues and worked flawlessly with my opener.  the app is simple and I can open/close and check status from anywhere.  Even the first week my wife left the garage open, my neighbor notified me and I closed it immediately.  Now I have the app notify me if it's been open for more than a certain period of time.

So far the hub has worked well for me. All I wanted was to be able to open and close our garage door using our phones and this product does that very well. It was easy to install once I figured it out. In fact the poor installation instructions are my only complaint thus far. The quick start instructions are worthless. I had to go to the web site to get the proper directions. Even the online instructions need improvement. All said, I would buy this product again.

Great concept, bad product. It wasn't hard to setup initially, but it did not work after the fact. It would not sens that the door was open or closed and would go into error state after only operating the door a sing time. Trying to troubleshoot was pointless and extremely frustrating. I gave up after completely re configuring 3 times and getting the same result. The app was clunky and did not work with my Nest products as advertised. Zero stars.

It works great! Application that comes with this product loaded on your phone gives you a very simple to follow directions to install an integrate your garage door opener. Less than 20 minutes I was able to open and shut my garage from my wife or my smartphone. I can open and shut the garage door from anywhere it's quicker than I thought it would be. Again I love it highly recommended I'm going to get a sensor for my second garage door so I can control both of them with this hub awesome product

This was a really simple installation. took me about 20 minutes +/-.  It paired perfectly to my Overhead Door Garage door.  Set up of the hub was super simple. I linked it to my Google account and it works from the assistant which is great. It does not work with the Google Home which is a bummer, but overall it was a great purchase and I am very satisfied!

Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. Twice now Amazon delivery has had to leave door open in middle of day cause they couldn't get it closed after 'key' delivery to garage.  Directions suck. No idea about light in center - has large LEDs in center and they are for??? Cause they don't come on like I would have thought, when door is operating.In the end I'm looking for something else that works better than 1/3 of time and integrates with the opener (this uses a radio transmitter to transmit signals to garage door, thought it was wired to opener).

So far the product is working great and is easy to install. My only complaint is that the unit requires mounting on the ceiling and if your modem ever loses power, in order to reconnect to WiFi you have to press a button on the unit-it doesn’t auto reconnect on its own. Would be less of a big deal if it wasn’t on my ceiling, but it is. Also frustrating as every other product own that uses WiFi can reconnect on its own. But this one, the one on my ceiling requires my help.

Works perfectly. I had a previous MyQ built-in opener in my old home. I recently moved to a house with older units. This was a super easy retrofit and works just like the embedded unit. I have a 3-car garage with 3 separate doors. I do wish the hub would work with three units, but even with 1 or 2, it works flawlessly. Very easy to setup.My previous unit was LiftMaster brand, I was able to use my same credentials despite the different app.

One of the easiest installs I have done in a while. The app literally walks you through the entire setup with videos and diagrams. I have to hand it to their teams. It doesn't work natively with SmartThings, however, there there is a SmartThings community smartapp that will allow you to control the door. You will, however, need to purchase a third party tilt sensor, as you cannot use the one that comes with the device to tell you if it's open or not. I was able to get this completely installed and running with SmartThings in under an hour. I do wish that the audible warning that the door was closing was configurable, it's really loud and and you can't turn it down at all.

Works great and was bought at a low price during the holidays. Works flawlessly and install time was less than 30 minutes for this and an extra door sensor. The system has a loud beep when the door is closing which is nice to  stay alerted the door is closing but can be very annoying. I would recommend this product to anyone looking to turn their garage doors into smart home items.

The range on this is abysmal and the recommended setup doesn’t make sense in the context of a modern home. For example, they want the base unit an unreasonably and impossibly close distance from the door sensor. Second, the integration with google home is horrible. It’s a garage door opener, it’s something I want integrated but chamberlain is trying to monetize the service and limits integration.

This is a great product that I added to my 13 y/o Chamberlain Whisper Drive Plus.  With this update I can make it another decade before I have to purchase another opener!
