Arrived on time quickly, a ton of support for this product can be found, but really is not needed.  It took my son and I about 10 minutes to set it up and that includes installing the app!

Very easy install and works great so far.  The app is pretty easy to use and all 3 family members are able to use it.  We only have 1 door hooked up at this time.  I do wish I could change the settings on the alarm for when the door is coming down.  When you push to close, it starts beeping for about 7 seconds before door closes and lasts for 30 seconds total.  Other than that, good product.

After reading some of the reviews, I did hesitate to make this purchase, but I didn't want to come home to an open garage door anymore. I did a couple things as mentioned in the reviews; I stayed away from any LED shop lights, and did read through the directions (I'm a guy... we don't always do that). As it turns out, it went just as simple as some of the other reviews mentioned. It was up and running in less than 30 minutes. My Apple Watch let's me know when the door opens, and when it closes. And I can check the status on my iPhone (I wish I could do that with Siri, but I have to purchase a Apple Homekit to make that happen. I don't need that feature that bad; I just open the app on the phone to see that the door status is open or closed). So far... I would purchase this again.

This is strictly a review of the installation. I was at first dismayed at the lack of printed physical installation instructions but after installing the iPhone app and creating an account I realized the app itself will guide you through the step by step of adding the MyQ.I was adding this to an Overhead door opener that was installed in 2006 and was compatable. My Wi-Fi signal strength in the garage was spotty but ended up being adequate. My hub is mounted at eye level on the garage wall 10 ft. from the opener and easily connected during the Wi-Fi pairing phase. I currently have two remotes and a wireless keypad paired to the opener and was able to add the MyQ with no trouble (I mention this because your opener may have a limit as to the number of devices that can be paired) The door sensor attachment and pairing went just as the step by step indicated with no hitches. I installed an additional app on another iPhone in the household and logged it in as me. The app functioned as expected so it wasn't necessary to Invite the additional person as a guest user. Since the MyQ has only been installed a couple of hours, exhaustive testing hasn't been done but so far it appears to be a good investment

This is an awesome product.  I have a garage door by Overhead Door and the MyQ device works great with it.  Fairly easy to install but you will most likely need to climb a ladder in order to mount and configure the device to work with your garage door opener.  Works OK with Google Assistant.  It was a little tricky getting it set up and still having issues getting it to OPEN via Google Assistant.  Most of the time I just use the MyQ app with no issues at all.

This system is very glitchy and does not sync well with the app. The door open/closed status, on the app, is often incorrect - defeating the purpose of the system. Multiple re-attempts to close a door showing open will result in an error and instruction to close locally. I am disappointed in the robustness of this system, especially since it is intended to provide peace of mind and security while away from home.

Bought one of these a couple of weeks ago.  It should be compatible with my Chamberlain Garage door opener.  No matter what I tried I could not get the hub to pair with my opener.  Got on the phone with Chamberlain support and, after over an hour on the phone with them, they said that the hub was bad and sent me a replacement.  Got the replacement today and I have the same problem.  No matter what I do it will not pair with my opener.  I’ll just return everything to Amazon as this product is clearly full of problems.
Got this after we left the garage door open for a whole night. Luckily nothing happened.I use it with a wink hub  so I created a notification to be sent if the door stays open for 15 minutes.

This is NOT Apple HomeKit or Alexa compatible.  I purchased it thinking that it would compatible with one of them.  Other than that, this works just fine.  I have a bad habit of not closing my garage for the day.  Now I can just open the app to see if it’s open or not.  I can also program it to close at certain times of the day - like after my kids leave for school and at the end of the day when they are done playing outside.  Also, is like a third opener if I am a passenger in someone else’s car since my garage is the main entrance point.

The MyQ opener not only provides a new confidence in knowing if my garage door has been opened, or that it simply didn't close properly, but also a restored confidence from a stellar Customer Support team. I had to call their tech support team because the hub would not link properly to my garage door opener during the installtion process (which by the way was very simple except for this.) Opener hub and free app both work great and I can open or close the door from any where. I also removed my remote openers from my vehicles in the case my car was broken into. You can also email a temporary or permanent access link to service people or friends. Super happy with the product and I would recommend.

This is a nice way to get your garge door to becomes "smart".  However, the google intergration is quite bad to say the least.  You need to purchase a subscription to allow google assistant integration which is crazy.  The google home integration is not seamless either.  With that said, it was extremely easy to install.  the guide was amazing.  Too less than 15 mins to get everything done.  Overall I recommend it.

I have a brand new home with a new garage door opener. We have the Overhead Door Legacy 850. The device will not pair. After 10 attempts, I’m done trying. The opener is on the list of compatible openers.

I had two nice MyQ battery backup door openers at my old home and loved the app and the ability to know what was the status of doors at anytime.  So, I bought this unit thinking it would do everything the built in system did - I was wrong.  It only does rudimentary functions and the app seems stripped down without all the reporting options.  Yea, it saved me money by bolting it on to the older Chamberlain opener but really is not as good as the fully integrated system.

I bought one that was $85; a different brand! It was supposed to be easy setup! 2 DAYS LATER!!! I returned it & watched YouTube reviews. Okay! Bought it do to the easy setup & price. Let me start off by telling you, I set this up & installed in about 10 minutes! I run Google Home & it does work on it with Google Assistant. I totally recommend buying!

I searched on line first for the entire process in a video so I had a picture of the install from end to end. I was working in about 10 degrees F so you used a heat gun to warm the place where I mounted the sensor on the door. My garage is detached and about 50 feet from my house where I have my Google Mesh network. My garage door opener is a fairly recent LiftMaster. I had installed a Chamberlain door opener with WIFI on my other door on the same garage so I had the app already installed on my iPhone.The install took about 1/2 hour. Other than my fingers freezing I didn't encounter any issues and I'm happy with the results. I haven't taken advantage of the Alexa integration or Amazon deliveries. I don't believe in pulling out my phone while driving so I use the previous remote(s) for opening doors when I arrive home.

Hands down the worst purchase I have made for my home.I have owne the myq garage door opener for 2 weeks, i checked multiple sites to verify the compatability of my garage door. Installation was super easy but then, my garage door starts randomly opening at all times of the day. 12:30pm, I'm at work getting notifications my garage door is open exposing my home and in the middle of the night, potentially putting my family at risk.

It mostly works as advertised. I can control opening and closing the garage door from my phone. The problem is it will not reliably tell you if you left the door open or not. I’m constantly getting notifications that I left it open after leaving the house. Kind of defeats the main purpose of this thing for me. Support said reinstall app and swap in new door sensor batteries but that didn’t change anything.

I am extremely disappointed with this product's lack of Google integration. Research this if you are considering purchasing this and using it with Google Home. This product does not integrate with Google Home. It "works with Google Assistant." By this, they mean that Google Assistant can open the app for you on your phone.You are unable to see your garage door status or control your garage door through the Google Home app or Google Home/Nest devices. This makes the product extremely inconvenient to use, and I will be returning it and searching for an alternative that I can actually add to Google Home.

I love this product! It works great as advertised once you follow the installation directions strictly. Most importantly, you need to check first with any mobile device for signal strength of your WiFi from your garage and once the signal is strong enough, you can go ahead and follow the simple instructions for the installation. It took few minutes to install and it works flawlessly. I have opened and close my garage remotely without any problems. It works alright with Amazon’s key app but  I’m yet to hook it up with Alexa. I believe it will work okay as well. Buy with confidence and follow the instructions accordingly and you won’t have any problems whatsoever.

My wife and I have a bad habit of leaving our garage door open.  We also wanted a way to open the garage door when we didn't have access to the standard remote.  Since we seem to always have our cell phones with us, this sounded like the perfect solution.  It is!  The instructions can be a bit vague, and their videos could be complete.  Rather than providing those, they rely on the app to walk you through things.  That ended up being sufficient.  Fortunately, I am a technical person.The remote control through the app is great!  Being able to configure alerts based on time of day and mode is great as well.  The very best thing is that this works perfectly with our existing door opener, which is about 12 years old.
Works as advertised for my 2 Chamberlain and Liftmaster GDO’s.The first door installation took a few cycles of hitting the normal GDO button on the wall before it worked using the App consistently.

I bought this product for peace of mind to know that my garage door has remained closed.  So many false alarms telling me my door is open and then not letting me close it remotely, because as it turns out it was never open.  Just got another false alert and had to climb a ladder to unplug the unit to reboot it as this can't be done from the app.  I'm about ready to throw it in the trash.  Shame on Chamberlain for this product.

Installation was a piece of cake and it works well.  the only complaint I have is that you have to have an internet connection for it to work.  It often needs to sign in to the app when I open it.  If my internet connection or the app server is running slow, it can take forever to open my garage door.  This inconvenience stands out to me because the last wifi opener I had (app no longer on app store), only needed a wifi connection and was always signed in.  I understand the internet connectivity is required to see the status of your door when you're away from home, it just gets a little tedious waiting for the app to sign in.

Some of Amazon’s deliveries are available with the Key Garage Delivery App but some are not. Nice, secure feature when available. Has to be an Amazon delivery and not UPS. Sometimes you have to opt for an extra day if you want in garage delivery. Had an intermittent problem with it only opening garage sometimes. Reprogrammed My Q with Genie garage door receiver. Now working consistently again.  Hope it lasts.

I like the fact that I can check to see if my garage door is closed when I'm away and I love the fact that I set it up to alert me every time it opens or closes (good for checking on when my son gets home from school).  I like the Amazon Key integration however I've had a couple of deliveries that didn't work, so not sure what that issue was.  I can see the Amazon driver on my camera trying to open the door.

I bought before I moved 3 miles away and found out that Amazon Key services not available in my new location yet which was the primary reason I bought this.  This is my fault, but I was also hoping that the smart door opener would work with Alexa devices but was not able to find with device search and couldn't find an Alexa Skill related to this device.  Set up straight forward but took several attempts and repeated attempts and more attempts until it finally connected.  It took a couple hours total time for installation due to repeated attempts.  It could have installed in less than 30 minutes with a faster connection to garage door opener.  Not sure why it took so long since this is the same brand as my garage door opener.  Overall it works well, but not for the purposes that I intended.  For the $20 I paid, I will keep it on my door in the hopes that Alexa and Amazon Key services will expand.

This product has exceeded my expectations. Of course when I buy something, I always wonder if it will work the way I expect it too. This did. Installation was a breeze. The app literally takes you step by step and even uses videos in some parts. This item took me less than 15 min to install from start to finish. The remote open/close from the app has worked great. Anywhere I get phone signal, I can open and shut the door. One of my favorite features is the alerts. I set it up to get an alert every time my door is opened or closed. I also love that I can go the app to check if the door is open or closed and for how long. This was a great security and convenience add for my home.

Set up was terrible until I read the tips below from Eric E. Peterson on January 20, 2019:"After hours of trying to figure out how to pair to Liftmaster 8500 (and possibly any Liftmaster after 2004), I finally figured it out. Surprised there wasn’t anything to be found online. When pairing you select your garage door manufacturer as Security+ 2.0 (not Liftmaster). Security 2.0+ is really the sub-name and model of later Liftmasters, despite not being written anywhere on the device itself. You also select the Yellow button. If you have a wall switch with the MyQ image, instead of pushing the learn button on the garage door opener itself, you double tap the learn button on the switch. This should allow you to pair."

Just installed it, so far it works exactly as advertised. I don't have Google Home or anything similar so I can't comment on that, I just wanted the ability to monitor/control from my phone and it seems to do that. I thought the setup was fairly easy, all done on my phone (though I did end up creating a second unit when I unintentionally hit the "back" button). Anyway, so far so good, I'll update later if that changes.I have an Android phone, so can't comment on iPhone setup.

Was cautious at first, but after installation - was very pleased how easy it was to use.  Having it synced with my phone made it a pleasure not having to ask someone to open the garage door.  Didn’t want to spend more money to fix the garage door clicker that kept failing.  myQ Smart Garage...cost less than having garage repair service come to charge me double, only to have it stop working 2 months later.

I never could get the unit to work properly.  I suspect the door sensor was not working. When the hub was working, it could not detect that the door was open or closed.  Finally, the hub would not connect to the garage door opener at all. I tried to contact support but could not.  I finally found a way (with great difficulty) to send an email, but never got any response.  I sent it back.  I really wish this had worked; it would have been very useful.

I feel like such an idiot. Whatever chamberlain says about HomeKit compatibility I was an idiot and thought they meant if I had a myQ garage door this hub would be _sufficient_.No, no. I’m addition to a “hub,” I need a “bridge.” I am going to avoid looking, but I assume and hope that there are myriad useful devices that connect to the bridge besides hubs. But the hub is necessary but not sufficient.

This works exactly as described. My only issue is that, if I want to use the MyQ app for anything, including opening/closing the door, the app asks for my login ID/password. That's annoying. But, it works well otherwise! UPDATE: I've replaced the battery in the door sensor once since purchase. Now, less than a month from replacing it with a lithium battery, I'm getting a notification that the battery is low again. It has gotten cold, but, for a device that only operates a couple of times a day, this is ridiculous. I expect that the battery should last for 3-6 months, not a month or less!

Using it for about 5 months. Very happy with the product. There is slight lag between the action and receiving the notification on my cell, but not a major deal.Was extremely easy to install. I did not install the hub on the ceiling, rather have it on the side wall close to the power outlet and it is working fine. Loved the convenience of being able to open and check the garage door remotely as well as checking its status. Very convenient. Has been working flawlessly so far. Will definitely recommend.

I would not recommend this product as it poses several security issues.  First the installation process is far from easy.  Pairing the sensor to the hub and configuring the internet connect was smooth.  It’s pairing the device hub to your garage door opener motor.  Took several attempts, then would not work properly.  Then at 1am in the morning it would open automatically.  Researching this was determined to be a glitched and I was instructed to reprogram it.  Then twice in the day I got the alert it opened automatically, so I looked at my outside camera to determine if someone was trying to gain access with the pad, nothing but I noticed my neighbor coming home and the second time was my other neighbor opening his garage door.  The engineering of these devices needs looking at so I am returning it and going another direct.

It may work for other people but it didn't work for me. It would work 2 or 3 times and then just stop working. They recommended moving the hub to different parts of the ceiling. After drilling 8 holes in my ceiling I got the same results each time. Now I have sheet rock repair work and painting to do in the garage thanks to this defective product.

The product overall works great. However, I bought the item from a seller as a used item. The description said it was mint condition but the device had clearly been used or installed. Description was inaccurate but the device seems to work just fine. Pairing took a little longer and more attempts than other smart devices but it wasn’t bad. Highly recommend this device to make sure your garage door is always closed.

I found the installation of this very simple and the app provided easy step by step instructions. Works great and easy to open and close from the app. One little point to note. It does make a considerable amount of noise and flashes a light when you close it remotely. This is obviously a safety feature to warn anyone nearby that it is closing so they won't be hit by the door. But just know it is doing this, not too loud inside the house, but it is quite loud in the garage if you were doing this late at night or early in the morning for example.

Disappointed for the lack of support. My garage door is on a brand new construction home . Overhead door legacy 850. Chamberlain site says it is supported. I was able to get it setup to monitor the door (tell me open / closed) but not to control the door through the app. I spent 2 hours in a hot Texas garage working on this. Called support and after another 40 minutes on the phone, the lady said my garage door must not be compatible. Even though it says on their site it is.Won't bother returning because at least it tells me if the garage is open or closed. But I'm not convinced my door is not compatible, just sucks there isn't someone there who can help me.

Returned: Didn't work for me. Even though the OVERHEAD Door I have was built in 2012, it will only work to monitor. Won't link or pair up to actually give me access to close or open my garage. I don't need monitoring. I have my security camera for that. I can look on my camera to see if my garage is open or close. All I needed was for this thing to close remotely or open. It failed to do that. So RETURNED

I wanted to ensure that the kids didn't leave the garage door open over night, so I was looking for a product that I could set up a routine to shut the door at 9:00 PM every night. I tried another product, and it couldn't tell when the door was open or closed. This unit does exactly what I needed, and it also provides notifications when the door opens and closes, so I have a way to tell when the family is coming and going. Great product!

It worked great and we loved it, for two weeks. Then the sensor fell off the garage door and laid in a puddle all day until I got home. The cover had popped off and I wondered what a little green circuit board with a coin type battery was doing on my garage floor. The battery was weak so I replaced it. Tried to reset it and start over with the setup but I can't get it to work. The instructions do say to clean off the surface of the garage door, which I did, but apparently not good enough. They have you attach it with double sided tape.

So far everything is working well. I was disappointed to find out that the app provided by Chamberlain doesn’t include iOS shortcut support. Instead you have to purchase another piece of hardware to be able to do things like control this device with Siri voice commands, or automate lights turning on/off with the door opening/closing.I’m already invested in this device so I’m just going to order their bridge. If I had done more research before I bought this I probably would have bought something else though.

In my experience, this is one of the worst "tech" products that I have used. People says hardware companies do NOT know how to build software. This product is a perfect example of this.1. The product keeps loosing the settings and asks you to sync every 2 to 3 days....

I was so pleased to find this product on Black Friday deals at a good price (19 something) . Just what I needed to let in service people when I am not at home to open the door. My first order got lost but Amazon replaced it. What I liked was that very easy to install (I am not particularly handy). Installation was easy through the stepwise explanation using the app.Remote functionality is good though there is a 5 second lag (not a dealbreaker).

It’s easy to install and works well with the app. Only downside is you cannot use Alexa directly, not supported at the time of this review. You can connect to IFTTT to close the garage but not to open.It never lets a third party software to open the garage as far as I know. However, it’s a great value to make a 20 year old garage opener smart.

I have a mid 2000 yr. model Craftsman garage door opener and didn't have any issues with connecting and putting the MyQ to work. Simply follow the instructions in the MyQ Quikstart pamphlet and in the MyQ app after you download and create an account. There's no mention of any fees. Now I don't have to worry about leaving my garage door opener in the car. Thanks Chamberlin for making an affordable and very good product.

Took more than a little effort and time to get it sync with my genius garage opener. Then after a few days it kinda lost the programming and had to reprogram it but now it works well last 2 months. Also the google assistant function never worked for me. Besides that, for the 25$ I got it when it was on sale it's worth aplenty to give me peace of mind I didn't forget to close my garage door.

So I’m not sure if I got a newer model with a different setup process, but I have seen a bunch of people complain how hard this was to configure... that was not my expectation at all. Opened the box FOLLOWED INSTRUCTIONS, and it works just fine. I will say I did the entire setup before installing it, maybe people installed it first and that is why they were upset? Anyways, seems to be working as described.

Have been using this item for a couple of weeks now and I love it! I can open or close the garage door from anywhere and can see the status of the door to make sure someone didn't forget to close it. So far the only issue I've had has been on my end if I try to open the door right as my phone tries to switch over to my WiFi. I set it up to send me alerts anytime the door is opened or closed and it works great. Occasionally I do notice a couple minutes of lag between when the app says it happened and when I get the push notifications but overall I love it! It was super easy to install

Installed on both of my garage doors.  Installation was very easy. The location parameters for the install were logical and not a problem at all.  The instructions are cleat that you need a good WiFi signal in the garage.  Signal in my garage was strong.  I would suggest for folks that have a weak signal and want to use the MyQ, a WiFi repeater would be a good investment.  The quick install guide was adequate but the videos were very clear and helpful.  It took me about 30 minutes to install both units.  They have worked flawlessly.  Alerts programmed so I don’t leave the doors open at night.  I have not integrated with HomeKit yet, but plan to at some point.

Purchased this for my Chamberlain garage door opener.  My opener was manufactured back in 2012 but this works well with this particular opener.  The installation was simple.  Mount your sensor on the upper part of the garage door (inside) then mount your Hub on the ceiling (~4 - ~5) feet from your opener.  Pair the hub to your opener and it works like a charm.  I can now check to see if I left the door open from my phone.  Also, open/close the door from anywhere.  Great purchase.

It correctly senses door open 100% of the time. It senses door closed unreliably so using the device to alert you that the door was left open has enough false alarms that it trains you to ignore it.  I wanted to like this product and I spent multiple hours debugging with their online chat and phone support. They sent a new sensor but still about 10% of the time it doesn’t sense that the door closed.

I am one who will leave the house and then ask myself, “did I close the garage?”. There have been occasions when I’ve driven back to check. Now I don’t have to. I can look on the app on my phone and it will tell me if was closed and how many minutes it has been closed. It also alerts me when garage is opened/closed. For example, when my family gets home, they go through garage. I get alert on my phone that thedoor has been open/closed. We lost a garage remote and my husband bought this as a replacement. He just uses his phone to open/close it now. There is sometimes a few seconds delay when hitting the “close/open” button on app and door actually doing it—however that’s to be expected with WiFi.

No more looping around the block wondering if you closed the garage door! Open the app and close the garage door in seconds, it's that easy. You can even open the garage door for friends or family from the beach while on vacation. The install only took 30 minutes and the instructions are detailed and easy to follow. You can even pull a history log and see every open and close with a timestamp for long periods of time.Easy decision, you will not regret it.

The App and the hardware work great, the integration with Google Home is lacking, and while they have made it connected, its a bit forced and does not always work smoothly. First, you have to link your MyQ account and Google, which right now they do not charge for that connection. I guess they did in the pst. Then you have to remember exact wording to get things to happen or check the status via Google. Overall the product does not cost a lot and works great with teh app. Just wish teh Google home automation was cleaner.

I gave this a three-star rating for one reason alone: I was not able successfully to set it up. The reason was very simple, as this device requires a reasonably strong WiFi signal IN THE GARAGE, and I don't have that. I live in an apartment, and my garage is far enough away that the signal from my router is very weak--not strong enough for this device to connect. This was not clear to me when I ordered this device. I guess I just didn't read the product specs carefully enough.

Now that we have installed this device the remote keyad and wired door controller work. We have gone from being able to openand close the garage door with the vehicle remotes to having 4 mobile and 2 stationary ways of operating it. Yes we are planning to add light and thermostat control as well a a camera or two. It was easy to install and came with unexpected benefits.

Just bought this and struggled with the pairing so I eventually called customer support.  First, I was told that the hub should NOT be very close to the actually opener.  I moved it further away and still had issues so next was to remove the LED light bulb.  Still no go but when he heard that it was an opener from 2006, even though the Learn button was green I actually had to select purple and it worked.  He had me mount the hub across the garage and have no problem with the connection.  It does send off this piercing sound when activated which is pretty annoying.  I'd like to shut that off!!  So overall, it seems to do the job.  The primary purpose is so my handicapped son can open the garage without his aids knowing the code.  I added the app to his iPod and it works fine.

The unit seems to work well so far and if it continues this way I will be happy! Mounting of the unit is pretty straight forward but getting it all to work is another thing. If you are not tech-savvy I would suggest professional installation even the instructions say"be patient this may take several attempts" but once working it does work well. The placement of both units is very important.

Does what it says in that it opens and closes the door and provides feedback about whether the door is open or closed. I thought from the description that it gave an indication of how far open the door is, but really it doesn't matter and it only says when it was last opened or closed last. Seems quite simple, but does the job. Have not tried to integrate with alexa as I am not comfortable with that level of internet activity for a security device.

This is an easy product. It has its own app that lets you see the status of your garage door and how long it’s been that way and you can easily open or close it from the app on your phone. This does not have any integration natively with Alexa though so don’t expect any voice commands or hearing Alexa telling you the garage is open or what not. Other than that, I got it on sale and it controls my garage and I can see the status anytime I want.

I buy my fair share of cheap imported electronics on Amazon and many miss the mark.  This thing was crazy cheap (Xmas sale) so I was half expecting to find that it either it did not work or the installation was too complicated.  To my pleasant surprise,  it worked right away and the installation was simple!  I am loving this - I get a beep and notification each time I leave the house so no more second guessing if I closed the garage door.

My husband installed this by himself in about 15 minutes after watching the video. We love this so much we tell everyone about smart openers! My brother and father-in-law bought themselves one already which makes it really handy for all of us to help watch houses etc. The app is easy to use and the ability to set a program to always shut the garage at 10pm in case we forget to close it adds extra peace of mind.

Once these are setup they disable your remote, Genie garage door opener. Any attempt to fix the issue by reconnecting genie remote, out well disabled MyQ from working. Throwing theses things away.Also, theyThis do not take commands from Google assistant to open or close  garage doors.

So far so good. Had to consult the manual for garage door pairing but ultimately worked relatively quickly. I typically research more but didn't realize that at some point Chamberlain was charging a subscription fee to use with Google Home (what???!!!). I don't think they should act like they are doing a favor to provide it free to use my Google Home to operate the door. Also, I can't open the door. Weird. If they say it's for safety, you let me decide that with the option at least. Otherwise I give 4 stars because it's nice to not forget to close the door like I did the prior night to installing and it's cheaper than I thought to add this function to my home than I thought it would be.

Got this on Treasure Truck for an amazing price below what is listed here. Installation was a breeze and took 10-15 min. The app will walk you though the installation process. The MyQ app works great to open and close the garage. The only con is when closing using the app, the SmartHub with beep and flash it’s light as a warning to others.Other than that great product and highly recommend

Item works as it should Found to be easy to set up and install. (Wireless signal in garage is only about two bars) Make sure you make sure that your door opener works with this unit. If you go to the manufacturer web site they list by Model number each unit this will work with.  So, I you buy and it not combatable it’s on you. The only thing I found is that my standard garage door openers stopped working after. It’s been too hot to mess with, I think if I re-sync them to the opener they will work but can’t say for sure.  I do like being able to tell if I forgot to close the door from anywhere.
Installation was a breeze (5, maybe 7 minutes total - more of which was spent downloading the app).Verify that you have a compatible garage door opener - can't stress this enough.

Easy to install, more complex to write routine with another program to have it work with alexa though. That seemed uncalled for - you would think that an alexa skill for this model would be available. One is listed, but only showed nex when chosen.Add alexa skill for this so customers can use it straight away instead of getting yet another program and learn how to write routines for it.

Installation is fairly simple and an easy DIY. The problem is that the description speaks to integration with Google Assistant and the product line (MyQ) touts HomeKit integration.Google is canceling their Nest integration product

Got this on Amazon Prime Day for a great price.  Easy to set up and so far works as described and as expected.  Gives you peace of mind when away from home and wondering if you remembered to shut the door.  I was worried about some comments that the door will open by itself sometimes so I set up one of my cameras to watch it in case it happens.  So far, so good.  Has not randomly opened and all is well.  Highly recommend if your like me and sometimes wonder if you remembered to shut the door when leaving in a hurry.

The problem was the setup.  It took a while to get this working right, plus I was a little disappointed that the door sensor's included battery was dead and I had to replace it.Now that it working, I like it.  I get alerts if I forget to close the garage door, I can open and close.  Now Amazon can have deliveries left in your garage with a MyQ garage door.

Very easy to install and app works great BUT NO Alexa integration and it has a built in alarm when you use the app to close the door that is louder than any smoke detector you’ve ever heard and way way way too long. I put some duct tape over the speaker holes on the control unit and it’s still loud enough to raise the dead. Luckily it only goes off when you are closing the door from the app.

Opened no problem. Error continuously when closing. Can’t reach Amazon. Spent hours on line and then with a delightful and knowledgeable young tech at Chamberlain  MyQ and we realized instructions are not correct when working with a garage door that has a metal brace for stability and rigidity at top of panel which holds sensor. Overall a wonderful journey but end result is a failed product for my application. Appreciate all your efforts. Blessings in Jesus Name. Love you all!

I would give ZERO star for Alexa integration. THERE IS NO OFFICIAL ALEXA SKILL FOR MyQ. Not able to discover MyQ in Alexa app. The product description claims it works with Amazon Key, made me think it is compatible with Alexa App. Amazon Key allows random delivery guy to open your garage door for delivery but does not give you voice control to open/close your own garage door. If you want a smart home garage door opener that integrates with Alexa, try other products.Installation was easy, though had to climb ladder to mount hub to the ceiling. MyQ app guided through installation. Connected to Google WiFi without any issue. Able to open/close garage door, get door status in both MyQ and Amazon Key app

Very easy to install, works great, but caution, it is limited to two doors.  Note that you will need 2 units for 3 doors which is a shame as I can't imagine the unit would cost much more for 3 doors.  On the other hand, if you like the safety feature of the light blinking before the door goes down, then ideally having one unit per door would be the best from a safety perspective in a public area, but in a home, I sure wish it would support 3 doors.

I'm all about IoT, but this device just doesn't work that great. in the last 2 months that I've had it, I've had to rejoin the device 2 times to the phone app. The app is able to open the garage door, but it can't close it. Amazon Key, however, seems to work fine. It can both open and close with no issues (so far).My garage door open is LiftMaster 8355-267 (8355) Premium Series (without built-in wifi)

It works great and Amazon Key with the MyQ has been great, especially given the reports of stolen packages in our neighborhood. Installation was a bit glitchy, some because of me and some because of the product. First you actually need to give it some distance from your garage opener in order for it to work. Too close and the signal won't register. Second, it synced incorrectly to the device on the door that detects the garage door being open or closed. So, undoing and redoing that was a pain that required resetting the system. Nonetheless, once we got through that everything has been great. Amazon has access to my garage and leaves the packages conveniently out of the way of the cars (that's more Amazon being Amazon than the opener but the integration is nice).

After successfully installing a MyQ hub to use for one door...I found out that I could buy a 2nd door senaor and use my existing hub to control my 2nd door.The MyQ app works well and it's great to know when doors have been opened or closed. And if needed, I can open my doors with my phone from anywhere.

Use the installation tips from Steve in the list of reviews.  With his guidance,  it took 20 minutes to install.  Works great.  I like the flashing light to warn of a remote closure.  No interference with the LED lights I have on the ceiling.  I will not have to reverse course to check that I remembered to close the door.  Great peace of mind.  Plus, since you are informed if it opens, it may alert you to a break-in.  Thieves like to kick down the front door, pull their van/truck into your garage and close the door.  I recommend this device.

Would not pair with the opener. Called support and they said it was my led ceiling lights causing interference and it will never work. Lights were off, so I don't understand that. Whatever. So I returned it. If it pairs with yours, great! Give it 5 stars. But my bad rating will keep the score honest by including the ones that won't pair.

Works very well. My only dislike is sometimes the notifications that the door has opened are delayed by several minutes.  90% of the time it tells you within the first thirty seconds to a minute of the door opening.I did have a problem of the MyQ malfunctioning but the company was very responsive and helped me troubleshoot and fix it right away.  Now it is working great.

Who hasn't ever had the feeling that you forgot to close the garage door? With this, that anxiety is completely addressed plus you can set up alerts to let you know if it opens/closes while you're away and even open it remotely if someone needs to get in and they don't have a key. It was incredibly easy to install, pair, and start using with my Liftmaster opener.  Easy to recommend and is one of those things that is almost instantly useful.

Got this to connect my MyQ garage door hub to Apple’s HomeKit. The installation was quick and easy, though I did have to look up how to connect the two hubs together as the instructions in the box didn’t match the app. It turned out to be easy and straightforward though and it has worked great.
I want to write this white the rage is fresh. These Chamberlain products are HOT TRASH.1. Why do I need another hub just to connect to Apple Homekit? Package your technology. I'll pay for it.

Pros:  Very easy to follow installation instructions.Cons:  Routinely does not close the door.  It signals audibly and visually as the directions indicate but the door does not go down.  Checked and confirmed my opener is compatible and checked for obstructions.  I also checked and WiFi signal is very strong, even reset to default settings and reinstalled but no improvement. For my use being able to close the door if left open accidentally is the most important feature so I’m disappointed and considering returning it for a refund.

I bought this to know if my garage door is open or closed both at home and when I was away and to be able to close and open it remotely. It does that as advertised. The installation was so simple. Follow the app prompts to hook up to your wifi.  Mounting it was simple one device attached with velcro glue to top panel of door the other with screws on the  ceiling next to door opener, but I opted to mount it on the side wall near an easy to get to outlet. It works like a charm.You have to understand that if you want to hook up to alexa or other electronic home devices you may encounter some issues. the more devices you have the more interference may occur.  For my purposes this is a great unit.

I have an old Genie garage door opener and the keypad stopped working I sometime need to have my contractor or neighbor have access and never knew how till I heard about this. MyQ. I wasn’t even sure it was compatible but decided to give it a try. I just finished installing it myself and I must say that I am nit known to be a great handyman. It worked perfectly! I have full co girl of my garage via my iPhone. Perfect for all these crazy aloccassions when you need control over it when you are away from home. Love it!!!

The product works great. Follow the instructions manual for placement location of the two units. Pictures will show good areas where to install them. During installation, the app was having issues connecting the hub to my wifi, but after a couple of times it guided me to calling customer services. I got a rep on phone within a couple of minutes and she was very nice and knowledgeable. We were able to set it up in a few minutes. It's been working great ever since the first install. Overall great product, functionality and ecosystem.

First I do not know if it will work with Alexa but  I not not need to use Alexa on my door when I am home.Setup is super easy. Load the app and run it. The app runs you through step by step. It shows you what you need to do each step. You can control the door with the app. I will also how you if it is open or closed. You can set up notifications if you door has been opened or closed. Will worth the money.

I usually forgot to close my garage door after I pulled out my car from the garage. Now, I get notifications when the garage is open, and I can close it in my phone app. I got a used one for 11 bucks, and it’s awesome. Having a little bit trouble when pairing with my home WiFi because it was paired with the previous owner’s WiFi, but it works good after I reset it. Easy installation by the app.

Horrible customer service. According to compatibility tool my Craftsman with a yellow learn button is compatible.  After installation it would not pair. I called customer support and they acknowledged that it doesn't work with my model. If you know it doesn't work update your website. The suggested fix was to buy a new opener, that would work with the hub. If I was going to buy a new opener I would not buy one with WiFi and not a Chamberlain.

Overall, it's great. I never have to worry if I left the door open. The downside is it's integration with Google Assistant since you have to say "hey Google, ask myQ if my garage door is open" which is not a common command to everyone.  The best feature is the alert feature to notify you if the door is left open.Overall, id recommend it since it's easy to install, cheap, and does its job

We have two garages.  Although it was specifically advertised to work with both garage openers, it doesn't.  The remote garage, the one I specifically bought it for, is not compatible with the product.  It only works with older garage door openers.  Mine was only 10 years old so too new for this product.I then installed it on the 25 year old garage door opener.  This hooked up relatively easily and works fine.  However, they have a very, very loud warning buzz to alert you, your entire household, and your neighbors that you are using the product.  This is so annoying we will not use the product.  Our neighbors thanked us.

I have "SEAR" garage door opener build in the year 2000 but according the information from "Chamberlain" this shouldwork starting from year 1978 NO!!!!!  it does not work ( CHAMBERLAIN need to update inf. OR reprogram MYQ-GO301)

I bought this hoping it would be an easy install and setup. Immediately it became a problem. When I went to sign up for a MyQ account (Step 1!) it said I already had an account using my email address. I've never used this product or this company's services so I don't know how I already had an account setup. Now suddenly I have security concerns when I bought this hoping to better secure my garage (ironic, yes). I tried to reset the password. Didn't work. Called customer support. They finally got the account set up. No explanation why my email already had an account. Not even a concern to them. Ridiculous. Went to install. Failed at first step after power up when it tried to find my network. Tried to start the process over. Wouldn't let me. Failed. I'm done. I can't return the product now because I'm outside my return window (I had to wait for it to warm up to work in my garage). Big thumbs down on this thing.

I gave 5 stars for "easy to install" only because they've made such a great how-to video.  It is a bit of a challenge to get set up, but with a little patience and the video, it can be done right the first time.  Besides, when I upgraded my home wifi, teaching this device to use the new wifi was tremendously easier than my IP cameras!  The thing I love most, that I wasn't even expecting, is the push notifications that alert me when the garage door has been opened.  Great piece of mind, especially when your garage door is your forward defense line!  Don't buy the other ones that don't come with a door position sensor to save a few bucks - you'll be sorry.  Not a single complaint!

I really enjoy this product. This is the second one that I have. First one was purchased used because at the time, the price was way too high! I was able to buy this a bit after Black Friday for as low as $20! That is honestly the lowest price that I have seen yet. Easy to install and I purchased this second one for my future house since my current home only has one garage and the MyQ hub is already set up.

I'm a retired IT person and found the setup very easy. I have 2 different garage door openers, Craftsman and Genie. Now I can open. Monitor or close either one. I have a DVR with one camera mounted inside so I can verify the status.  I have added the Key App, to allow Amazon to deliver a package inside and close the door. A UPS (Brown truck) said they can also be set up for inside deliveries. I was disappointed that support to be used by the Alexa integration was removed. I hope this returns in the future.

I bought this for safety because my family loves to leave the garage door open all the time and this gives me the peace of mind of knowing when and how long the garage door has been open.  The setup was so easy.  Followed the instructions and there were no hiccups at all.  Simply connected to my home network, stuck the sensor to the garage, put the bracket up on the ceiling of my garage and slide it right in.  No problems.  Works every time.

Works when it wants to, clearly has some firmware issues to iron through. Connectivity is hard, i've bought 2 units and reset both for a clean installation like 13 times. MyQ still doesn't know when it's open, even if you do it right after a 'susuccessful setup. I literally designed a system more robust than this in college, i'm thoroughly disappointed this is a product on the market.

I thought it didn’t work but mounting instructions are terrible. Both infrared sensors on door and hub must see one another when the door is up. Literally they are close and opposite the other. Now it’s working 100% of the time given strong WiFi signal.Need to buy myQ Homebridge to add Apple HomeKit capability and geofencing.

Installed the product on 2 garage doors. very excited about it. Installed fine on genie garage doors. worked for a couple of times. Then app shows sensor errors, incorrect door status (shows me door open for 4 hours, when i can see the door shut). one door went into monitor only mode. I have tried resetting it, but the product will open and close the door during this setup, take a long time and keep door in monitor mode only. pretty useless product

It works as advertised. But two issues I want to report.1. Wifi signal strength - even though the my garage has great wifi signal the myQ base shows the signal to be really week. Seems the wifi receiver in the base is of low quality.

Product is smaller than I thought it would be, which is fine. Installation of the actual hardware was very easy. It took some time to get the unit to connect, but finally did and worked flawlessly. Tried using the chat feature while trying to get the unit to connect, they are useless. Best thing to do is try figuring it out on your own. I was able to do that without their help fortunately

This was easy to install and easy to link with my home WiFi. All you do is download the Chamberlain app and the Amazon Key app (don’t need the Amazon app if not setting up garage delivery) and link your Amazon account with the MyQ app and you’re done. No my packages from Amazon can be delivered inside my garage and the door closed to keep them safe from “Porch Pirates”  Go for it if you want to protect your Amazon deliveries and know the status of your garage door from anywhere.

I spent way too much time trying to get this to connect to my new Genie garage door opener only to eventually find out that it won't work with Genie openers made after 2016, contrary to their marketing materials. It will give you open/close status since that's just a manual sensor, but it won't actually open/close the door. Boo.

Advertisements and specs said it was compatible with a lift master garage door opener. Not the case.... After trying to pair it was my opener, tech support stayed that it wasn't compatible with the commercial model. My car universal remote can pair with it.  What's their problem? I'm going to return it.

Getting it to sync was a nightmare. I had several instances where it said that it was successful and didn't work. After resetting it and trying again dozens of times I got it to work. I'm not sure how though because it didn't say it was successful or anything.The app isn't the greatest. You can only have two guests at a time with access. I had to give people my login to get around that limit.

I bought on the premise that it's Alexa-compatible.  It is NOT.  It is compatible with the Amazon Key skill.  But, you cannot say, "Alexa, open the garage door" and have it open the garage door.  VERY DISAPPOINTING.Now, the good points are that it's very easy to install and gives you a door status on the app.  Hopefully, some clever person out there will develop a hack to make it Alexa-compatible.

Simple and easy to use.  Integrates with door opener using RF, so no need for wires!  Did take a call to their Tech Support as instructions were incomplete and when adding to my existing account on iPhone, it was missing the step of connecting to device over WiFi for setup.  Given the simple step, I don’t understand why their app based setup misses this.  BUT, they were easy to call and terrific in quickly getting me through the additional step.  And the unit works great!

Works as it should. It paired with my door opener on the second attempt. I noticed that you cannot open both doors simultaneously, you have to wait until the first is completely opened before you open the second. But that was only on a test run but not a big deal. Very pleased overall. 😊

This was easy to install, the directions were clear, and my opener paired to it immediately. The app is easy to use and to setup an account. I'm very happy with the functionality and the app. Luckily my WiFi is strong enough in my detached garage. I was disappointed that it didn't work with Alexa, but I found an unofficial skill for Alexa that works. Also, the company wants to charge a subscription fee to use with IFTTT which is ridiculous in this era of technology. I would have given it 5 stars if not for the subscription issue.

I am one of those person driving down the street and say, "Did I close my garage door?"  Well, this solved the problem. My goal is just that and this gadget does the job.  I didn't want to connect this to Alexa, etc. so there's no additional subscription fees.  I have tried and returned a different brand prior to purchasing this cool gadget.  It took me 20 minutes to do the installation.  Again, no wires except the one you have to plug into the outlet.  Works like a charm.  I highly recommend this product.

I purchased MyQ Smart Garage Door Opener early this year. Due to the busy work schedule, I installed it about two months ago. Following the instructions, the hardware installation was easy; however, the instructions to run the app was not clear on the instruction sheets (after the account set up) comparing with what was showing on the app. Fortunately, I did some Google searches and got the app working. My wife and I love the push notifications to our cell phones when our garage opens and closes. However, there have been a about three times when the garage door opened, then closed. We received 3 notifications each time: (1) Garage opened; (2) Garage closed; (3) Garage opened after the garage door was close! The first time, I already left my home and my wife called me and asked me if the garage door was opened. I had to turn around and drove back home to make sure the garage door was closed (and it was closed!). The last time it happened was this morning! Luckily, I checked the push notification. Sure, there was a message the garage door was opened, but it was actually closed (in front of me!). So, I opened and closed the garage door again. I received only one notification that the garage door was closed, no notification when it was opened the second time!This issue could be from the garage door coming down a little hard; therefore, the sensor installed on the door could sense the door bounced, so it might trigger the garage door opened message, but in reality it's still closed! But this is my assumption! Hopefully, there will be some fixes in the future. May be I should install a camera in my garage in the future to make sure the garage door was closed! I gave 4 stars because of the push notifications, if there was no error push notification, I would give it 5 stars.

I already had the My Q for my main garage door and added this extra sensor for the second garage door in our home. The app walks you through the setup, and honestly its extremely easy. It automatically connects to the hub and then all you have to do is hit the learn button on you Garage door motor and voila it connects...Easy as that.

What is not shared is that 1 hub can control multiple doors.  I bought two hubs, one for each door, based on this lack of clarity in the product description.  This worked out OK since I was able to use the sensor from the second hub.  I then gave the  unused hub to a friend and he bought the needed sensor (same price) so it was a wash.Good experience overall.  Basic operations and alerts which is all that is needed.  The main driver to install was the vulnerability of HomeLink buttons in cars which remain active on older models.

This was purchased because my kids keep leaving the garage open at night.  The installation was very easy. The main unit mounts to the ceiling with a couple screws and plugs into the existing garage opener ceiling outlet.  The door sensir attaches with 2 screws or sticky tabs.  All hardware is provided.  The android app is intuitive and easy to use and the alerts are fully customizable.  We get text messaged whenever door is left open longer than 1 hour or if it opens at all from 10pm to 6am. Love it!!

Installing this was a smooth process. The instructions were clear and straightforward, and I was able to get things mounted and set up to be able to control my garage door opener with my app, and then integrate it with Alexa as well. This product can help make a garage just a little bit smarter, and give you the peace of mind to be able to monitor what are the doors open or closed even remotely.

My favorite feature of this was how ridiculously easy it was to install. The app guides you through a fool-proof installation process that is just so easy! I haven't been able to get Alexa to open/close it, and sadly it doesn't connect to SmartThings like I'd hoped. There is a short lag time on opening/closing it from the app, but only a few seconds more than you'd expect. Overall, very happy with it and a great product for the price!

We have older model Chamberlain Garage Door Openers, and sometimes we get busy bringing in groceries or supplies and forget to close the Garage Doors, OOPS! This just happened which is why I purchased the MYQ Hub + an extra door sensor since we have (2) garage doors. Install was a breeze. I was nervous I would mess it up however, with the easy to follow instructions after downloading the Free App there was no reason to worry. It walks you through all the steps. Easy Breezy. The only thing I had my husband do was mount the Hub Bracket to a ceiling joist. Everything else I was able to do myself which was great. I love being able to see via message on my phone that the garage doors are open or closed. Just make sure you have a WI-FI connection and you should be good to go.

I feel like the app reports that my MyQ is offline 70-80% of the time. I set up an access point in the garage to help its connectivity but have not seen an improvement. It occasionally lets me open the garage and then say it's offline before I can close it.I got the device to use with Amazon in-garage delivery. Once, the delivery person couldn't get the garage open and left the package at my front door. Worse was when they opened the garage, left the package inside, but couldn't get the garage closed and just left it open. It wasn't a big deal because I was home but could have been all sorts of trouble if I hadn't been.

I have been looking for garage door integration when Amazon offered this unit to use with their My Key feature.  It's awesome not having to worry about my packages being left on the step and stolen.  The ease of connecting this to my network was a breeze.  I still have not been able to connect to alexia and really dont want to use a skill where anyone can open the door with their voice.

very good product. it is as I have expected and product is as described. setting up with my existing genie garage door opener was not easy and I was getting an err that "unfortunately learning has completed unsuccessfully. try again or monitor door only?" but actually it was already set up well. The MyQ ppl should test this product with different garage door opener before putting into market.

I installed 2 of these devices, they are absolutely wonderful!! One is on a Chamberlain opener and the other is on a genie opener. Both installed the same way. I recommend using the phone app to install, much better instructions and step by step.The alexa option was a little disappointing.  You have to tell alexa to open the myq app and o have yet to be able to get her to do anything but that. Can't get her to open the door to save my life lol

It takes a few minutes to install it, but instructions are very clear. You simply register as a user, then follow the instructions on the phone. My programmed opener in my car continued to work as before. The hand held one in my other car did not. I suspect it needs a new battery.Using the app is excellent, and works from anywhere. I have a 13 yr old opener and it set up perfectly.

Wow, that was easy! I had just gotten home from work last night and amazon had dropped it off a few minutes earlier. I was so excited I didn’t even take my suit off. I got my latter and drill and had it up and running in 15 minutes. And I’m an executive who prides himself on not knowing how to fix a paper jam with the copier. I can’t trust my family to close the garage door (it’s my pet peeve) so I’ve been waiting for a simple solution to this persistent problem. Mission Accomplished!

It works with Google Assistant, great! But it doesn't work with Google Home. So if you want all your smart-tools in one Hub like google home. Get something else.Aside from that, it works as intended. You can check your phone app to see if its closed and use it as a remote to open/close it.

I'm very satisfied with this device. It solved our problem of continually forgetting to close the garage door at night. Thankfully we live in a good neighborhood. Very easy to install. Turns you phone into a remote. Closes door on a schedule. (Best part) Allows operating the door from anyplace. And it's priced right.

This unit was easy to install and fairly easy to get programmed. There was not a lot of work to it, just a little confusing at first because I tried to install without reading the directions closely. The unit pretty much matched up with everything on its own once I started following directions. It  connected with my Android phone, my wife's Apple phone and our tablets. It was easy to program and set alerts to notify us when the garage door opens and closes. We are very happy with this product and are enjoying the peace of mind knowing the status of our garage door no matter where we are.

Was cautious to buy this considering the bad reviews I saw.But it has been great this first 2 weeks! Quite easy to install (used command strips instead of screws because the hub is pretty light weight). Connected to my WiFi the very first time despite being 2 floors below. Didn’t require any special tools, not even a screw driver with command strips. The door sensor has its own Velcro strips. The step stool was helpful however. App was also simple and intuitive.

This hub works perfectly for my garage door. I have another house that has the Chamberlain garage door openers that are newer and have this technology built in. I liked the ability to access control of my garage doors instantly through my smartphone.. I purchased a second home and the garage door opener was older. I was able to connect this hub easily and now I can control both houses' garage doors. I would highly recommend this product.

So, I've been a big fan of this product quite some time now, but only recently decided to actually procure it. Installation was super easy, functionality was straightforward, and the app/user interface was very simple. So, after weeks of using the MyQ very sparingly, we found ourselves playing in the backyard with our kids. Our 5 year old went inside to get his T-Ball bat, and for some strange reason decided to lock the back door on his way outside. So there we were with no house key or any other way of gaining access to the house. It was then that I glanced at my Apple Watch (I left my iPhone in the house as well) and located the MyQ app. Thanks to MyQ, I was able to open the garage door, jump the backyard fence, and regain entry to our house. I don't do a lot of reviews, but when I thought about how bad this situation could have been without MyQ, I figured that the least I could do was submit a review on it.I highly recommend this product to anyone who leaves their keys and smartphones inside while playing in the backyard with their young children.

Setting up through the app was a hassle, I had to repeat the process 4x to finally get the hub to connect to my garage.It doesn’t always work. You cannot continuously open and close your garage. Sometimes I’m outside and I want to open my garage but the app says that my garage is already open.

I bought this over thanksgiving since I got it on a deal. It was quick and easy to install. Took me about 15 minutes to install the whole things. It works great. I am able to control my garage door with my phone now. You can also set up various alters on your phone and it will send you alerts if the garage is open. The only reason I am giving it a three start is because the app UI could be improved a little bit and it does not integrate well with google home. I would be giving it a five start if it could be controlled seamlessly with google home.

Installed with a Chamberlain belt garage door opener.  I followed the online videos for the installation.  Everything was exactly as described and installed in minutes.  I used it for our first Amazon Key delivery yesterday.  We were away and didn't want the package to sit outside for a night so we had it delivered to the garage.  The integration was great and saved me from having to ask a neighbor to grab the box from our side door.

Worked well with my original Chamberlain, but then its belt broke and a replacement belt was almost as much as a new Genie, so I went with a new Genie.  The My Q doesn't work with the new Genie at all.  Although it does still send me a message when the  door opens.  It was also a pain to program and I don't care for the mounting bracket.

I've had this product for ~2 months.  It took me an hour and half to sync it with my garage opener.  Just when I was about to give up, it worked.  During that process, I read the instruction manual from cover to cover trying to debug the problem.  I have to say, the word "UNIVERSAL" in the product description is misleading.  One page 1 of the user manual it gives you a link to the garage opener compatibility list.  So it does not work with ANY garage opener.  This is the main reason for my 3-star rating.That said, it works as advertised after the painful installation.  So I decided to keep it.

Easy to install. Not easy to keep “online”. Continually goes “offline” despite several calls to my internet provider and to MyQ (Chamberlain) company. Both were basically helpless. Also, no refund of replacement of item from Chamberlain unless purchased directly from them. Not a user-friendly device. Poor customer service with Chamberlain. However, this review does not reflect my experience with Amazon. The device is now believed to be defective and Chamberlain was subpar with their troubleshooting and customer service.

I have two garage openers, one LiftMaster and one Chamberlain B500.  They both work nicely with the MyQ hub.  Installation/setup was pretty easy and quick.  I didn't even need a separate door sensor for my B500.  Mobile app is also great with notification.  Alert texting is almost instantly as garage door is opening or closing.  You can also schedule to open/close at anytime.  Me like!

Relatively easy to install and get working with the myQ app.  However, I bought this for IFTTT and/or custom smarthome integration.  Due to "security and safety reasons", I'm not allowed to use this to open my door.  But I can close my door with it.  Yep.  All the functionality is there, but simply not allowed.I pointed out that they would readily allow/enable a random person from Amazon (UPS, etc.) to open my door but not me.  The online chat agent wasn't allowed to acknowledge this flaw in reasoning.

Surprised to find that garage door opener in my new house was compatible with this technology.  I have left the door open in the past and was interested in remote status and control. Very easy to set up.  In 5 minutes, it was up and running.  I have a schedule to automatically close every night as a safeguard.  I like the notifications whenever the door opens or closes too.  I am considering Amazon key for deliveries now.

We first purchased this device when I was pregnant and constantly had pregnancy brain and couldn’t remember if I closed the garage door. At first I thought it was a bit excessive but now I can’t live without it! Such great peace of mind knowing that my garage door is closed especially on busy mornings when I’m rushing out the door. The added bonus is that you can open and close from the app anywhere! Great device!!

I bought this product to help overcome interference problems we have at night from outdoor light outside of our garage that uses LED bulbs. I have to say that I'm thoroughly confused about all the other reviews that claim this product is hard to setup up as I had this up and running in probably less than 15 mins (and that includes mounting the receiver to my garage ceiling as well). Prior to using this product, at night, we would often have to get out of the car and manually enter in our garage code on the keypad to get it to go up being that our garage door opener transmitters were blocked by the LED lights outside of our house. Being that we live in Pittsburgh, PA where it is almost always raining and/or in the Winter months it's snowing, sleeting, etc... it's utterly WONDERFUL to be able to use this product from our iPhones where we no longer have to get out of our cars. This is especially helpful now that we have a baby as well. Overall, this is a great product that works as it says it does and was the solution to a problem that I've been struggling to find for about 4 years now. My next step would have been to either change the garage door opener itself to a WiFi unit, or the outdoor lighting which would have been a considerably higher expense than this product.The only extremely small feedback that I might pass back to Chamberlain is some way of being able to disable the alerting beeps when closing the door as a 1-time thing. Meaning, I get why it flashes its lights and beeps loudly, which is to alert anyone who might be under the closing garage door to get out of the way if you're not within line of sight when you use the app to close the door. However, if you're actually in the garage itself, and want to use the app to close the door, (and perhaps you have a sleeping baby you want to sneak into the house), disabling the loud beeping would be clutch.

So far it has been a great addition.  The only problem I had was pairing the hub with my Liftmaster garage opener.  After trying it several times, I decided to erase all of the codes on the opener and then it paired within seconds.  Overall works great.  I park my vehicle in the driveway and I didn't want someone to be able to steal the remote out of my truck and have access to my house.  I also like the feature of being able to schedule the door to close at a certain time every night just in case someone left it open.

I bought from this seller cuz its offered lower price than a new unit from Amazon. It arrived with a tampered door sensor; it never worked.I decided to pay postage and return the defective unit to the Seller; as of today, the refund is still outstanding. I will not recommend this seller cuz he/she should have inspect the unit before shipping to customer.

I set this up with an iPhone and a Linear opener and it literally took less than 20 minutes to get it to work. This was a painless process and the app led me right through the installation. Works like a champ - very happy!The only downside is once I got it working, the car remotes and the built in remote in my Ram stopped working. I just re-paired the remotes and everything was back to normal.

Set up couldn't have been much easier.  I set up three additional (max) users to have access to the device.  App via your phone shows if door is open, closed and how long it's been in its current state (open 10 minutes, closed 5 hours, etc).  Fancier stuff out there but this one fits the bill for me and was inexpensive.

This is super easy to install and use.  The only problem is the beeping when you close the garage door with the app.  It is extremely loud and goes on for way too long.  The first night I found a Youtube video and saw how to take the speaker out so it doesn't make noise.  The beeping is a safety feature, but I don't know any garage door that is so quite that I need  a warning it is closing.  It is so loud I was worried about the neighbors across the street having a problem with the sound. But with the speaker removed, this is a great garage opener I definitely recommend.

I have been using this product for a week now. Installation was relatively quick and easy after watching a fellow user explain the process. Took me about 30 minutes total to connect everything and have it installed. Since I got this product for $30, I think it was well worth the price. Just the other day my wife had forgotten to close the garage on the way to work and I was able to use the app which notified me that the garage was open, and close it while I was away from home. Keep in mind when using this that there is a loud beeping noise with a flashing light when activated, which is a safety feature to alert if anyone is nearby. Overall, I have had no issues thus far and I would recommend this to anyone looking to be able to have remote access to their garage!

I bought the system a few months ago. But as soon as I installed the app for my wife as well the system didn’t function properly!  The app doesn’t close the door and indicates the sensor should be realigned? After trying to resent the sensor according to instruction, the app work but again next day I have the same problem! In short useless system!

Wow super easy to install and works likes a champ. The app is great too. I have one garage door with WiFi installed and then added the hub to the other garage door and both work the same with the same app. Took me about 15 minutes to install. Followed the instructions in the app to a T. The price is right too.

Easy to install and calms the wife when she freaks about whether the garage is shut or not. The notifications from the app are nice. Now my wife gets an alert on her phone the second I get home for work so she can assign me a task immediately. So that’s great.

This is the best little application to ensure our garage door is closed without the hassle of going and looking!  It has given me a break from listening to my wife worry and ask if the garage door is closed.  It was pretty easy to install.  Took about a half hour.  We have it set up to email or text us if the door stays open for more than a certain amount of time. With the application we can close the door remotely too!  So worth the time and would definitely recommend this to others.

While I had initial issues with this product, it ultimately ended up not being the part's fault. My garage door opener's logic board was slowly dying, and this caused the part to act like it would not pair with my opener. Combined with MyQ app updates on my phone this a useable and reliable product, and the addition of the Amazon key and guest passes have been nice.
GOOD:- Very easy to configure and install
Documentation is minimal.The App does not have a widget, so you'll have to open it every time.

The device was very easy to install.  I installed the primary unit and two garage door units in about 20 minutes.  The unfortunate thing that I realized is that I cannot control the opening of a door without going directly to the MyQ app.  Meaning if I want to have the door open when I get close to the house or open the door through another app, this is inherently not allowed.  I can close the door through other apps (i.e. IFTTT) but not open.  I am sure the legal team at Chamberlain is very concerned about this risk however there should be ways around this if this is what the end user wants.  Also, I have signed up for Amazon Key but cannot seem to figure out how to get the drivers to start using this.  Any tips would help.

Easy to install (really well done on the set up instruction in the app), but the product does not work reliably. WiFi is perfect but will just not close one in four times rendering this a useless piece of junk. No way will I use with Amazon key as no way to be certain it will close. Recommend look elsewhere for remote control. Shame as hell of a deal....I guess I now know why.

Whose wife forgets to close the door??? ok if its not your wife then do you forget to close the door?? haha This MYq Smart Garage door opener is the best ! I highly recommend. Easy to install/hook up. You can see door open/close history. You are able to open/close the door remotely. There are a lot of awesome features in this. I highly recommend!!!

What an amazing product. My wife and I were never sure if we had closed the garage door at night. Getting up half asleep to go check was getting annoying.This product feels kind of cheap but works perfectly. It was pretty easy to install and I hope it lasts!

Was able to install in less then 10 minutes, there is some drilling required. Tools you will need: Drill with drill bit, hammer, screwdriver, rubbing alcohol and a towel. Would also recommend syncing with your garage door opener before you mount. Have been using it for a few months now and love it. No more turning around to make sure the garage door was shut. Simply pull out my phone and check the status of the door, if it was left open then it can be closed from anywhere with the app. Extremely helpful for the forgetful and worrying types!
I installed this on an older 1990’s Craftsman garage door opener with a green learn button.  It works like a champ.  Easy to setup and work with phone app.

Very easy.  Plug-2 screws-and mount the sensor it's easy.  Works great and the guest feature is awesome.  Won't use it for Amazon drop off unless it becomes an issue.
