BUT REALLY AMAZON CAN'T FOLLOW MY INSTRUCTIONS SO THIS IS GOING BACK. LET SOMEONE HAVE ACCESS TO YOUR HOUSE THAT DOESN'T FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS. WALK IN DRIVER HAS HIS FEET UP WATCHING TV AND DINNER COOKING KINDA DEAL.

I read some bad reviews of this device before I bought it.  I don't know what device they were installing but installing this puppy was easy as pie.  I was taking my time and I still had it installed in 30 minutes. Added the app to my wife's phone too. This is a great device. You can't go wrong buying this device. Just follow the instructions in the MyQ app and you will be smiling in minutes.

The headline says it all. I read lots of reviews of this and competing products. Decided on this one to use with my 14 year old Craftsman opener. Installation was easy, literally took minutes. Have had it installed for a week now, only problem so far was an alert that the door had remained open (it wasn't). Other reviewers reported this happening to them, so I added a baby monitor camera, for confirmation of the actual state of the door. Do yourself a favor and do this as well if you buy one of these!

This was a pain to get working. Once I finally did, it was great... for a while. It kept dropping my network.  After having to do the full set up over again- about 10 times (~6 mos) I couldn't recover it.  Amazon key delivery was nice, but really only half my purchases were eligible anyway.  Don't bother with this thing.

Very happy with the product itself, and its integration my Amazon Key, though I did not try the garage delivery yet.Installation was easy.  Being able to monitor the garage status from the myQ app or the Key app is a big plus.

Easy to install, works great.I wanted to have Google Home make sure the garage was closed when we went to bed, but it doesn't integrate very well with Google. IFTTT works great though. I linked IFTTT with Google Home and with MyQ and then created a Google Assistant applet that then sends the close command to MyQ.  Using IFTT as your middleware has worked well for me so far. Great deal at $35.

Very easy to install.  App is easy to use to set up alerts and functions like closing the door automatically at 10pm in case I left it open.I did have 1 glitch in the 6 months I have been using it.  I got an alert shortly after I left home on a trip that the door was left open for 20 minutes (which is an alert I created).  I asked a neighbor to close it for me because the app was saying it couldn't.  Neighbor said the door was closed.  Other than that one time it's worked flawlessly.

Just be aware that if you buy this you can not open the door with Google Assitant whether or not you pay the monthly $1 fee for Google Assistant Integration. It does not work with Homekit/Siri unless you buy the additional $100 HomeBridge and although there is an Apple Watch app for MyQ, it doesn't work unless you have your phone unlocked. So much for letting myself back into the house with my apple watch after my runs.No Siri Support / Cant open door with Google Assistant, Doesn't work on Apple Watch unless phone unlocked.
This has a subscription you have to pay for their service. I did read the reviews and therefore returned the device.

The device was very easy to set up, and the instructions were very clear. It connected to my Internet without issue.However the lack of connectivity to Alexa, and the fact that you have to pay for a subscription to IFTTT is very annoying, as that was the main reason for installing the device. Based on that I don’t recommend this product.

Purchased this during prime days, just installed. So pleased, works with my Genie opener when I could not get the fob or my car buttons to program.  Install was fast and easy, just follow the app instructions... took longer to get the ladder setup. Now I just use my phone to turn off alarm and open garage door.  Note:  I did make sure my garage door opener was compatible.

It works really well.  You can install the app on multiple phones so they can all control the garage door.Physical installation of the unit is a breeze. The problem for me was getting the unit to communicate with my garage door opener. I had to chat a couple times with their Help desk.  They were helpful.  Instructions could be clearer than what is provided with the product.

It was super easy to install. We tried to hire a professional to install it but they cancelled on us so I did it myself. I am definitely not handy and was able to do it easily!  I like the fact that we can open and close the door remotely. Now if we are out of town and need someone to check on the house we don’t have to worry about giving them the garage door opener or a key we can let them in from our phones!

My kids were always opening the garage and leaving it open.  I would come home from a hot date with my wife and would be aggravated that my kids had left the garage wide open. No more concern with the MYQ.  I am notified when opened, closed, and can remotes open or close if I want.  I’ve also given access to amazon Key to allow some Prime deliveries to be placed in my garage.  Life is serene!

We love this product.  For forgetful people like us, this is a life saver.  We always get down the street and ask each other if we closed the garage door.  We check the app to see what the status of the door is.  Right after we installed it,  we forgot to close our garage door.  Just hit close on the app and all was taken care of.  This is a great product for anyone.

It wasn't the easiest to setup (I had to reset the devices a couple of times), but once set up, it works well. Since I travel, I basically wanted to ensure that my garage was closed; and I wanted to be able to open it remotely, if I needed someone to check on things for me. I have not integrated the Amazon Key option that allows a delivery person to store packages inside the garage, but I like the option of that feature.

The door sensor only lights and does not beep.  I followed the instructions and changed the CR2450 battery three times and still it only lights and not beeps.  I'm not sure if this is normal, but the unit also has a rattling sound when you shake it.  Lastly, when I opened the box, the first thing I saw was a piece of hair.  Not exactly thrilled about that.

Wow no more key pads needed just your phone 📲 we always had our key pads running out of battery or our garage control gets un programmed. This was a perfect solution as a back up if you’re car getsun-programmed you just hit the app and boom you can open from anywhere in the world 🌎 this is the latest and greatest for me and my family! Thank you Amazon 👍🏼💪🏼

Product works and was relatively easy to set up.  I even found their customer support to be helpful.  My issue is with Liftmaster requiring a subscription fee to link the MyQ hub to Google Assistant or IFTTT.  Why should I pay them $1 per month for each link to a smart device?  This is a rip-off because it doesn’t cost them anything for me to link devices within my home.  And yet they somehow think I should pay these subscription fees.  No thanks and buyers be advised if you want to also link devices,  you should be aware of this hidden fee system which Liftmaster tried to trap you into paying.  Shame on you Liftmaster

This product is pretty neat. I like being able to remotely control my garage from my phone. My biggest and really only complaint is the integration with Alexa. It has no integration. It would be nice to be able to open or close my garage with Alexa. Especially when Echo auto comes out, it would be nice to say “Alexa, I’m home” and my garage opens, lights turn on, AC turns down and my tv turns on. If Chamberlain would make this integration a reality it would make this a near perfect device. Hence the reason for the rating. Also if you have a Genie Powerlift model it’s a little complicated to get it set up. I had to contact Chamberlain support to get my device set up. 5 stars for their support. They were very helpful and walked me through step by step.

I am quite forgetful. I forgot to close my garage door a few times. There’re multiple times I had to go back home to check the garage door after I left my house. Now not only I can tell if my garage door is closed or not, I can also open or close the door on my phone. Last week I was talking to my neighbor and she saw me close my garage door on my phone, she’s so surprised and wants one. I wish I had bought it earlier. Money well spent!

I read some of the bad reviews on this and I don't understand. I am by no means a professional installer but it took a total of forty five minutes to get both of my doors working. I have had it in for three weeks and have had no ”Phantom” openings or closings. It works every time from anywhere. I love it!!! I would recommend this to anyone.

I reside outside of Kansas City, MO. This product service is not in my area. But, five miles, Near  a major airport, that area is in the select area. A few miles makes a difference. Why wasn't there a verification (zip code) , that a zip code could be available for my area. If there had been, I would not have wasted my money  and time with this product.

There is a lot to like about the MyQ system from a feature and price perspective.  Unfortunately there is no "cloudless" option so If your Internet access is disrupted for any reason, storm, a construction company accidentally cuts the fiber in your area, unreliable ISP, etc; your MyQ system will not work.  This could be easily remedied by allowing the smartphone app to open & close the door when both the phone and hub are communicating via the homeowner's WiFi.  Could easily rate the product five stars if it also had a cloudless mode but as a complete cloud-dependent product it ranks a two star.

Very easy set up. Very useful. My own recommendation would be mounted the hub before you connect it to the app/wifi.Only gripe is the lack of FREE Google assistant connection. Subscription service to open my garage door? Imagine being nickel and dimed by be every smart device company. 10/month to ifttt, 5 to Philips. 20 to Wemo, and etc!! Come on. Plus it doesn't have Alexa support and Chamberlain refuses to add it. This company is out to make a killing and piss off ppl in the process. If the device wasn't easy to setup is return it for one that doesn't charge for smart feature connection

Returning product due to defective design (perhaps defective app design).  Opened door (open door registered).  Closed door (have video showing successful).  No confirmation on close, received warning not closed.  Pressed closed button, error on closing (because it opened).  Already gone from home with door open, app refuses (as does chamberlain support) to allow any method to remotely retry garage door close.  UNACCEPTABLE.  Returning as product does not do the basic function it is required to do... open/close my garage door remotely.  1* rating is more than it deserves.

After I forgot to close the garage door one night I decided to get this. Works well, easy to install, app notification is accurate. Although no Alexa or Ring integration is a shame. Google Home integration doesn't work, said no subscription, although it's free of subscription now. The app is flexible enough for scheduling though.

While this works for "Amazon Key" it doesn't work with Alexa. You cannot tell Alexa to open or close your garage door.  There simply isn't a MyQ app for Alexa.The device reports door open when the door is actually closed. I reached out to support about this, did everything they instructed me to do (to include change the battery in a brand new device) and there hasn't been any changes to this behavior.  When using the MyQ app to close the door, the door closes but the app reports a timeout then a close error and reports the door open.  There seems to be major issues between the hub and door sensors.  All in all, this was a total waste of my money! (Buyer Beware!)

you first want to check to see if your current garage opener has this built in.  Most new openers include this feature.  This product is easy to install and works great for opening the garage door for family members or for your children.  The best feature is you can have the device to check several times per day.  If it is open it will automatically secure the door.
first one  i got had issue but great customer service  sent me a good one . it was easy to setup.few enhancements they should look in to ..

The model I purchased last fall 2019, a MyQ D3F stopped working on the 8/14. Spent hours resetting it and my garage door opener.  The model I have purchased from Amazon did not come with a door sensor at the time of sell.This piece of crap app will not discover or pair the D3F, the product is not listed in the device on the app either.  Almost as if Chamberlin and MQ want me to buy the newest product.  One comment - HECK NO!!!! Fix your app, fix your product list!

I absolutely love this set-up and it works amazing!! Recently the battery that is in the module that attaches to the door died. I assumed it was a simple swap, I was wrong! I am not sure why the designers used a special battery (it is a watch battery style but bigger). That was a horrible idea so now you must buy a special battery and not use something common such as a AAA or AA. Just a heads up!

I was a bit skeptical after seeing the reviews, but Im sure those people with bad reviews must have bad wifi service.  They are extremely easy to install and setup.  I have two garage doors, so I bought this and an additional door monitor, and everything was installed and software setup within 20-30 min.  I will also say that I have a 15-20 year old Genie garage door openers and it works great on them.  Highly recommended!  I even bought and installed a setup for my in-laws.

this doesn't really work with nest.  You cannot add the device to your nest app.  You can only add nest to your MyQ smart app.  but the MyQ Smart app doesn't support other things that might be hooked up to your nest.if your intent was to use this with the MyQ app, then its probably 4 stars.  That app isn't perfect but its opens and closes my garage door.

I did not have to find another "original" controller for my older model. Then the ability to open or close the door from any location is a plus, if someone comes over to drop off something....Oh - I forgot if I close the garage door and have left the house...no problem just look at my cell phone. Just for fun, they have a separate part on your internet account (FREE) which you can open, close and see past history when the garage door has been opened and closed. Did I say it was VERY simple to set up and install - YES.

Poorly designed.  Doorsenaor won't work 10-12 feet away.  WiFi is poor... It says wifi is weak, despite a hotspot being in the garage.  It was trying to pair to the opener, opeing and closing the door in the process, but they says it can't pair; probably due to the door sensor.  Very poor rf design/performance.  Returned.

Installation was quick and easy, thanks to the videos embedded in the app.  The only thing I would change is to add self-drilling screws for the sensor.  Also, it would be nice to have instructions for smaller garages.  In my case, I had to install the sensor at the very top of my garage door.  Lastly, I noticed that programming the MyQ hub removed the setting on the garage door button in my car.

When it works, it fine. I have already had to replace the sensor that goes on the door because it quit talking to the receiver. It worked again for a month, and now it isn't talking to the receiver again. Most of the time it just tells me the door is open. I've moved the receiver, put a new battery in the transmitter, but it still doesn't register. I've also done the test procedure multiple times, and it works again for a bit the stops talking.

I purchased this product when there was a great sale. I thought why not give it a try if it doesn't work I won't be out that much money. It's a little tricky to install and the provided directions are a little hard to follow. But after installation I'm very pleased with the operation. I haven't used it with Alexa because it's not a free service. I just use the app on my phone and it works great.

It was a 15 minute install as advertised. It works out of the box with my lift master 3240. I didn’t even bother mounting it to my roof I just left it on top of my garage door opener.  I had to redo the pairing with the main unit to my garage door opener since I was impatient. It sucks I can’t pair it to my amazon key app since the delivery service is not available in my area. I would like to have it there since I got my ring and Schlage door opener on it . Other than that nothing to complain about, let’s see how it goes as I use it

This thing should be taken off the market! Unless, you don't mind your garage door mysteriously opening and remaining open without your knowledge or consent. I have owned this garage door opener for nearly two years now and I have had nothing but issues with it. This item is truly a waste of money. Buyer Beware!

Don't make the mistake of thinking this will work with Google Home. It only works with Google Assistant at this time. This means Google can't process the commands. Instead, you have to ask to talk to MyQ and wait before you can issue a command. I also hesitate to say that you issue" commands." The only input myQ understands is yes or no. It simply asks, "do you want to close the door?" And closing the door is the extent of its ability... It can't even open it.As laughably bad as the integration is, they also expect you to pay for it. They are having a promotion currently, so the first year is free for now. However, begining next year it will cost several dollars a month to keep the integration. Can you think of any other automation tools charging monthly subscriptions for integration? I can't.

This was very easy to set up, just follow the directions in the App. It takes you through it step by step.  the biggest complaint I saw was not being able to hook up to wifi.  If that's the case, buy a wifi extender and will solve your problems.  My garage door opener is over 10 years old and hooked up like a champ.  If your is compatible, very good buy.  Also, less expensive that buying it at Lowes.

Easy to install.  However, the app is clear and straight forward, the enclosed book is weak.  Just download the app, you'll need it anyway, and follow the instructions.  I have a tall garage.  Ceiling is about 14.  Motor is at 9'.  I was concerned that the 5 foot limit would cause a problem with the operation.  But, no problems.
So before I ordered the product I read lots of reviews and watched a video on how to install.To be honest the video of the woman installing it is what sold me. The reviews were mixed but
The one thing I hate about this unit is ever time the power goes off you have to go through the entire set up process again!! Get a ladder, reset the hub, connect to WiFi. DUMB!

I can't tell Alexa to close the garage or tell me the status of the garage. I can't understand this as dozen of similar devices can easily integrate with Alexa.  I understand that opening garage should not be enabled by closing and alerting you through Alexa show be available.  Funny that key allow Amazon key for Amazon to open your garage but not allow Amazon Alexa to close it.

Unable to control garage door from the google assistant directly. It will ONLY allow you to close the door, first you tell the google assistant to start myQ assistant and then pass the voice command “close the garage door “ to myQ assistant. It required paid subscription to integrate myQ with google assistant . Once integrated with google assistant, you cannot ask google assistant to close the garage door. You will have to ask the google assistant to initiate myQ assistant and give voice command  to Close the garage to myQ assistant. You can ONLY close the garage door via google assistant —>myQ assistant then passing voice command to myQ assistant. It is inconvenient, basically useless without direct integration with google assistant.

I purchased this product mostly because it was on sale and was therefore relatively inexpensive. Plus, I have a Chamberlain garage door system, so I figured it would work well with it. It was easy to configure, mount and pair with my wifi. I set it up using an Android phone. Since I set it up, it's worked perfectly. A great device if you are looking for the convenience of remotely opening/closing your garage.

This product did what I wanted it to do.  It was very easy to install-- I was done in 15 minutes and it allows me to open my garage door with my phone.  Now when I go bike riding, I can close the garage door when I ride away and open it when I am down the street.  I think there are some limitations/costs with smart home integration but I'm OK with that.  MyQ does what I need and the Prime Day pricing was good.

While I was going through the setup of this product, I ran into issues connecting to the garage's motor.  I called support and someone took their sweet time to walk me through the troubleshooting steps to resolve the issue.  I love the fact that I can open my garage remotely from anywhere in the world. Also, I get alerts when it opens and closes.

Never worry again about forgetting to close your garage door. The app works really well. You can remotely allow guests to enter. The only reason I docked it 1 star was because it makes an annoying beeping noise as it closes the door. I don't want to wake up the entire neighbor when I have to leave early or come home late. I wish there was a way to turn it off.

I had been looking at this product for some time and when Amazon had it on sale I bought 2.  I was nervous about the installation after reading some of the reviews but it installed without a hitch.  Since I have 2 doors I used the sensor from the second kit to  sync to the hub.  Two doors will work with one hub.  The only issue is it doesn't have an Alexa skill.  That is surprising to me.  As of now I highly recommend.

The MyQ hub, made by Chamberlain, is not compatible with the Craftsman garage motor model 200.57933. It says in the product description that it is compatible and I even tried to look online to see if it wasn't compatible. This is because I had earlier bought a Chamberlain universal remote for the garage motor and found out after hours trying to figure it out and then finding it on some website that this Craftsman model is not compatible. Surprising since Chamberlain owns Craftsman.After at least 5 online chats and telephone conversations, tech support finally tells me that this particular model was made after Chamberlain sold Craftsman so this model is not compatible with any Chamberlain products such as the universal remote and MyQ.

This thing is so awesome.  My wife said I'm going to break it because i keep opening and closing the garage with the MyQ app and the Xfinity Home app.  It linked right up to xfinity home with no issues at all.  Very simple to install.  I can't count how many times i have left my garage open and had to go out in the middle of the night to close it.  Now I just have to check my phone.  Thanks Chamberlain and Amazon Prime Day!!!!

Fairly easy to install, and integrated easily with my 20 year old Chamberlain garage door opener.  Would suggest a few improvements though, including improvements to the app (does not appear to allow one to stay logged in for long periods of time, making notifications in the app limited in value), the unit appears to have a light built-in, a feature I liked, but what looks like a light does not appear to be one, some other enhancements would be nice.

It's kinda neat. But it's a product thats only 1/4 of the way done. The installation was pretty easy and the app works fine. But the smarts is where it loses it. First you have to pay to use ifttt or Google assistant. And on ifttt you can only close the door, not open it. What's the point? Same for Google Assistant. There is no way to open the door!

Mislead about Alexa integration. No Alexa skill available. From what I’ve read post-purchase Chamberlain discourages the integration due to security issues. They also took their own app out of the Alexa skills. Also some features will work with google home but not Alexa. Bought on prime day and severely disappointed. I should have done more research.

Installs easy, I opted not to connect to Alexa for security reasons (Alexa can easily be summoned from an open window.). MyQ app works great and sends an alert to my phone every time door is opened or closed. Remote closing works after a delay where the device beeps and flashes a strobe to warn anyone inside that door is closing. It’s simple, and it works.

The device works perfectly and it’s hard to believe how inexpensive it was. This property is an AirBnB and I can add my guests as users and they use their phone to get in the garage. I don’t worry about losing remotes. After they leave, I remove them. I can also see if the door is open and if it is for more than 30-40 minutes I call them. Multiple times they said they forgot it open. Good value. Well worth it.

I made this purchase for the sole purpose of using Key by Amazon's In-Garage delivery, since the porch pirates here in Miami are prevalent. The basic remotely operated opening/closing/status of the garage door works fine, however since the MyQ app does not allow for more than one account to be associated with the hub, and the Amazon account will only recognize the account assigned to the hub, the In-Garage delivery option is limited to the ONE account associated with the MyQ garage hub. My wife and I obviously have different Amazon accounts, so that means only one of us has the In-Garage option when ordering Amazon products. Did not know this when I made the purchase, and it's kind of a deal-breaker issue  :(

I installed this in about an hour, as I couldn't tell what color my learn button was on my garage door opener ( Yes it makes a difference) , One quick chat to customer service and I was good to go as the looked up my model number and told me what color to pick .  I am going to buy the add on device so it can be Alexa enabled because it is better than ITTT. But overall a good system. Just be aware that it takes a bit of time ( 3-5 sec) to activate it from your phone remotely as it not instant like a clicker in your hand, but overall I like it.

Really nice opener. Shame or garage door opener is too old. Set up was easy until it got to the part where we couldn't get it to work with our older opener. Wish I'd have seen in the description that it wouldn't work, had to send back. But I really think it is a nice opener even though we couldn't use it. Would purchase if we update our Garage door.
Bam, straight-up workedOut of the box to working in 10 minutes. Simple install and “programming” to my old Sears G-Door opener. Would buy this everytime before buying about remote opener.

I just wanted to be able to operate our garage door with my phone, so I didn't have to carry my car remote when I went for a bike ride.  Also to know when when my Wife got home.  It will serve a a "hidden key", instead of putting one under the flower pot.  I was not looking for any additional capabilities.

Following the directions this was an easy set up and it works without any issues at this point.  I have had it about a week and I absolutely love it.  I didnt have to buy any extra gadgets just downloaded the app and off I went.  I would highly recommend this.  As a side note it also works with Amazon Key which makes it super nice.  Now I dont have to worry as much about my packages ending up in the wrong hands.

I'm one of those people that gets 500 miles away from home and starts to wonder, did I shut the garage door? Now I can check from anywhere and close or open it if necessary. It also has cool features that allow you to set it to close at night if I'm home and forget. Can't use the "key in garage delivery" option as it is not yet available in my area, but still well worth the money.

Installed in a couple of hours, most of that time was setting up accounts and linking.  Very easy to install hardware, double sided tape for door sensor and two screws for the hub.  Used a 110v three way power cord tap from garage door opener for hub power, you need to mount the hub on the ceiling by the opener motor.  Used MyQ garage skill to link to Alexa and it all works great.

I installed mine less than a month ago. So far so good.  I like the notifications that it sends to my phone every time the garage door opens or closes.  My only concern is the device notified me that the battery is low and needs to be changed. I bought another battery so will see if the one that came with it was bad. I sure hope I don't have to change the battery every month..

I purchased two of these units for my home, and was pleasantly surprised how easy they were to install.  Saying these are "plug-and-play" is an understatement.  It took me less than 15 minutes to install each one, and most of that time was spent mounting the control unit on the ceiling of my garage.  I followed the instructions on the app, and the units worked  as advertised.  I would recommend these to anyone.

I love this thing.  We no longer have to worry about whether my garage door is open or not, and the install couldn't be easier.  The only request is that it work with Alexa, but it doesn't yet.  However, there are work arounds with different apps.  I didn't need it to be remote; so I have not tried the workarounds yet.  I liked it so much, I bought one for each door.

This works perfect so far!  So easy to install and configure!  Took me less than 30 minutes and I am definitely not considered a "handy" woman with a drill and ladder.  I have not tested the app outside of home, but I was able to open/close door from app and configure schedules and alerts, with no problems.  Exactly what I wanted, not concerned with Alexa integration, as this is perfect for me.
What’s not to like?  Amazon Key integration made this all worth it!  No more package bandits or porch pirates!  Took less than 5 minutes to setup and the app walked you through it all

Easy to set up and use right away! The first week of having this device, my neighbor called me at work to tell me my garage door was left open. I was able to quickly check my app and sure enough it read ‘open’ so I was able to quickly close it from my phone at work. Also our son has a habit of leaving the garage door open at night, I was able to set a time to have the garage door close every night at a certain time. We love this garage door opener! You will not be disappointed!

This was extremely easy to install, the app gives you step by step, with video, instruction. I also downloaded the myKey app from Amazon, so we can take advantage of the garage delivery from Amazon. We haven't used that yet, if there is a problem I will update this review. But I do like that I get notified on my phone by the myKey app when my garage is opened. So far so good!

The hardware works great. I could live without the aggressive beeping when you close it via the app but I'm sure it's a regulatory safety issue. It was easy to install and I can control both my garage doors in a three car garage. I can control this with my Apple Watch which is nice if I don't have my phone. My biggest issue is the software. It needs to be quicker. Every time I open the app on my phone it seems to go through the login process and then needs to check the status of the doors. It should be as quick as using the garage remotes in my car.

During the installation the hub would not connect with the garage door (Craftman). Their support told me the hub must be between 5 and 8 feet and it was 19 feet. Note that it does detect the door sensor that is 29 feet away. I was trying to install it on the garage wall opposite the door because I have a plug there. I think there is a design flaw that it can't detect the garage door unit that is 19 feet away.

My wife and I would occasionally forget to close the garage overnight - and heard through a friend that there were wifi-enabled products that could help ensure that this wasn't an issue.  Fast forward to this purchase, and within ~30 minutes (it would have been 15 if I had someone around to pass me tools while I was on the ladder), everything was up and running perfectly.Note that, as we have two garage doors, we ended up purchasing an additional door opener.  That took ~3 minutes to install.

After having this for a couple of months, we were sitting in the living room watching TV when the garage opened. After confirming we had no deliveries arriving, it freaked us out. Our apps on our phones didn't notify us the garage had opened either, also extremely concerning. I grabbed a baseball bat and headed down. The motion sensor light was not on so no one had entered the garage. What if we were not home? Immediately unplugged the device. This is not ready for primetime.Update: There is a setting to close your garage at 8p every night if you had left it open. The device didn't register a closing on the day in question and triggered the door, which was closed at the time. So that setting is now disabled. I added one star, but this still should not have happened.

We love this!  It monitors your garage door and the app. tells you if it is closed, and it also tells you if it has been left open after a certain amount of time.  I don’t know how many times I headed to work and couldn’t remember if I shut my garage door or not, so I had to go back only to find I did have it closed!  Now I just look at the app. on my phone!

If you are looking for an easy install, easy to configure smart garage then this is it. Took me 10 minutes to physically install it and 10 minutes to configure it. Works like a charm with reliable notifications and alerts! I added one for the second garage and that too was configured in 5 minutes.All you have to so is to make sure that it is compatible.

I wanted to buy a garage door opener that came with an app, but I didn’t need a new garage opener.  I found a video on YouTube with the top 10 gadgets and this hub was on there.  What did I have to lose, this hub was about 80% cheaper than a new garage door opener.  The installation took about 5 minutes.  Now I have a garage door opener that I can control with my phone.

so the biggest downside to this product is trying to get through pages and pages of terms and conditions associated with the software.  otherwise, the app and hardware work very well.  I don't use it often, we got it because we sometimes forget to drop the garage door, and have to call the neighbors to check on it for us.  no more!  Used the youtube video to help with installation, went very quickly.

Hours of frustration trying to install. Can you believe it - it changes my WiFi password on my phone when pairing with the unit!!! Spent 3 hours trying to get assistance from Chamberlain, but was left hanging on listening to music. Lousy system plus no support equals frustration

The app and the installation went very easily and works perfectly. It is NOT Alexa friendly and I never did get it to work. My garage is detached however I was still able to pickup the wifi signal. The phone app will send notifications when the garage is open and that is exactly what I wanted.

Does a great job letting me know if the garage door was left open through notifications from the app. Allows me to close the garage directly from my phone even though I have a different opener. I can also know history like when it was last opened and how long it's been closed for. Works great!

Have 3 garage door openerss, 2 craftmans and a Genie... it installed fine with the Craftsman, but could not with the Genie... no matter how many times and variations I tried.  Also, the CR2450 battery drains quickly.. after only about a dozen cycles of the door.  Contrast this to my wireless Door opener.. haven't changed the batter since it was installed.. back in 2004....

My wife is always nervous about the car remotes being left in the car, especially if they are getting serviced or left outside. She is not a fan of programming the remote into the car's 3 home link device. So this is the answer. I first had a chamberlain garage door opener so I was all set getting the myQ. It was to my surprise that I was able to continue to use it when we moved and now have a Linear garage door opener. myQ is compatible with a lot of brands, research to make sure yours will work but it does not need to be a Chamberlain garage.

Great remote for your garage door opener with easy to follow instructions.  Worked perfectly the first time, and the hub can be placed anywhere in the garage, not just on the ceiling.  The app was easy to install, or set up, and worked easily as well.  I now control my garage door with my phone.  I highly recommend this remote opener if it is compatible with your door opener itself.

I’ve been a happy user of two Chamberlain garage door controllers with native support for the myQ iPhone app and I bought this Smart Garage Hub to add another door controller (a LiftMaster) that didn’t have native support.The myQ app on my iPhone was missing the + icon that I needed to use, so I called support and she told me to go to my iPhone Settings under Display & Brightness and uncheck “Bold Text”.  The iPhone restarted and the missing icons appeared.  The installation went smoothly after that and all is working as expected.

I have been looking to purchase this for a while, but could not pass up the $20 BF promo. The installation was super easy. The install instructions and videos that were presented in the Android app were clear. I also paired up a myQ camera (from Tend) so now I can control my garage door and look at video, all within the myQ app. Highly recommended, especially at this price point.

This is awesome. My wife always forgets if she closed the garage and now there is no guessing just open the app and see. If you forget no driving back home to close it, just do it remotely. I also love that you can set schedules and have it open or close at certain times. We have it auto close at night incase someone forgets to close it. Easy to use and operate. Good price to.

SIMPLY HORRIBLE!! Spent a good part of my night trying to pair it up with my Chamberlain Garage door opener. I assumed that since it's the same brand, that it would work. WRONG !!!Multiple tries, trying to pair up. No success.

WiFi hub was easy to install and associated application works well. Allows me to open and close my two garage doors (needed to also buy a second sensor for second door) remotely and set up notifications if door was inadvertently left open, especially overnight.  Deducted one star because my other (non-myQ) remote controls now seem to be a bit less reliable than they used to be.  Speculating there might be some signal interference since I mounted the hub within a foot of the actual garage door opener — I going to try moving the hub further from the opener.

This is an awesome device. Very convenience and functional, easy to install with simple app to control, and can control remotely. Works very well. There is a delay when closing the garage door from the app but that is a safety feature as an alarm sounds to warn others that the door is about to close. Can configure device to send notification of when door is open or close. There is also a history log showing all the times the garage door is open/close.

Mine is guardian garage opener, it doesn’t work with it, i don’t understand when there are 100’s of garage openers in the market it only works with 5-6 openers then what’s the use of this product. Why so much advertising when it cannot connects to at least 50% of openers in the market. Useless for me and it’s going back.

I picked up this controller at a time when both of the remotes for my liftmaster were having problems. I looked for a solution  to help instead of buying new remotes. MyQ was the answer. Install takes a bit of technical knowledge but the available install vids did help a lot. Over I like this product and it allows for "guest" controls for family when they come for a visit.

Had this unit installed for 3 days.  The unit reported the status of the garage door incorrectly on two occasions.  Had to use the keypad to open/close the garage door on multiple occasions.Can only have one user for the opener.  You can login on multiple devices, but only one device was receiving the notifications of opening/closing the door.

Now we have full control over our garage door.  Had a family member want to drop some things off at the house while we were out of town.  They called and let them know to call us when they were in the driveway.  We opened the garage, items were placed in side and we closed it.  We have not tried the Amazon Key Delivery yet however that will be next.  Installation took me 15-20 mins and was a snap to set up.

It is a good concept and it is easy to install, BUT. The device does not store WiFi connection information when powered off or gets confused every time I momentarily lose power in my house, which happens every other month. The only way to recover is to reset WiFi setting on the MyQ hub. Resetting WiFi requires to press and hold the Settings button on the hub, BUT. The hub is supposed to be mounted on the CEILING and getting to it requires a ladder!! Bottom line, it is useless half of the time because I don't have time in the morning to move the car out, grab the ladder and climb up to reset it...

This thing is a piece of junk. I have followed to the T of the Quick Start Guide only to get a message “No device found.” Followed their website video (a totally different setup) again no device found. If you watch the video, the lady is showing in a fast pace way as if the user has installed it dozens of times. I’m going to return it to Amazon tomorrow.

I had a hard time installing this because it wouldn’t connect to my garage door opener even though it’s same brand. Finally connected but it takes longer time to open and close using app. somehow, my key pad ended up disconnecting after this installation too. It’s currently working fine other than these issues. Oh and I hate the beeping sound. Wish I can turn it off.

Has a VERY loud alarm and bright light when closing the door with the app.  When questioned, Chamberlain Support replied "unfortunately this feature cannot be turned off. This is a safety feature to notify anyone around the garage that it is closing. Sorry for any inconveniences".  I intend to use it ONLY for opening the door, my dogs cannot stand the incessant beeping when closing.

I was able to install the unit and have it connected to my wi-fi system and working the garage door within 10 minutes. It works beautifully and without a hitch. My only problem or slight concern is that I cannot get it to work with Amazon's Alexa (Echo) system. I read that there is a required fee or subscription for that service but I cannot find out where or how to pay the fee or purchase a subscription.

I already had an opener that came with MyQ, so this made it easy to add functionality for the second door.A minor negative -- there's no option from Chamberlain to use existing MyQ hubs - this connects separately to your network.

I am giving this product a three because it was easy to install and works well with a phone.  The reason it is not higher is it does NOT work with Alexa.  You can have Amazon open your garage door with it and leave packages, but you can’t tell your Alexa device to open and close the garage door.  How does that make sense?!

If you have a relatively new opener, you might not need the door sensor.  Very useful for Amazon Key to deliver packages inside our garage.  It sends a notification to our phone if we leave a door open, and we set a timer to automatically close any open doors at 10 pm.  No more leaving the door open all night.  It was a bargain at $30, then we saw it as low as $18 on Black Friday.
Overall I'm happy with this smart garage door opener because it does what it says it does. The downsides in my opinion are:1) Too much delay when using the close command from the app.

Well, so much for the "smart home" part. This thing is actually quite the annoyance. It routinely loses connection and sends me alerts telling me the garage is open. Then is tries to close the garage when it is already closed. Guess what happens? It OPENS it! Now I have my garage wide open all day or night. Not worth the hassle of trying to repair the devices. Just use the remotes your garage door comes with.

Got through Treasure Truck.  Easy to install (<30 minutes) and MyQ app works well.  Can open/shut through app with ease.  App tells me if door is open/closed, the length of time open/closed and history.  Only con is the warning beeping when the door is about to close, but there are hacks to silence the speaker.  Good price and no subscription fees!!

They recommend that you install this device on your ceiling, and plug it in to the same outlet that your garage door opener is plugged into. When you press the button to close the door, the device beeps and flashes a bright light as a warning that the door is about to close. Then there is a small sensor that you install on the garage door so it knows when the door is open or closed. I found it very user-friendly and the installation process and programming was easy.
I have been using the opener for a few months.  Couple of problems really bother me.1)  When I try to use the app to open or close the garage door, the app will be frozen.

This worked great with my liftmaster garage door motor, install took no more than 10 mins. People complain about subscription fees but it's only for linking it to Google home for $10 a year, not necessary.I like the feature to set an auto close garage door time at night if you forget.

Only buy if you have a new or newer than 1999 garage door opener.  I went to their website before purchasing, to see if my unit would be compatible.  They said it was.  Guess, what?  no such luck.Edit.  7/30/19. Update on this issue.  I finally was able connect after no les than 24 times.  But it finally worked.  It has to be easier than this.  Good luck all.

This did not install correctly. I received multiple error messages after installing it. O spent 45 minutes on the phone with tech support, only for them to recommend that I buy new batteries. I purchased two door sensors, so this meant that both batteries were dead on arrival.After spending another $15 to replace the batteries that came with the sensors, and another 30 minutes on the phone with tech support, we finally got it to work on both doors. The very next day, I got an error message showing that my garage was open while I was away. I tried to close the door remotely, and got another error message. I came home to an open garage door, even though I had closed it and watched it closed before I left. Now I can't log on to my account.

Great unit, easy to install and connect to network !! It works with my 15 year old Overhead Door Legacy unit. The app is awesome, has tons of features....alerts, schedules etc. Works with my Wink 2 hub. One thing, the sensor that mounts on the door, it appears the rough vibrations of the door can begin to dislodge the battery over time. Put a small piece of tape on the battery in the holder to keep it in place. Couldn't be happier !!!

I needed a simple way to see if our door was up or down and to close it if necessary. (as my kids didn't always close it) I have a Genie garage door opener and the MYQ was incredibly easy to install. The sensor velcros to the door and you plug in the WiFi hub in the garare. Simple install of a couple screws into the garage ceiling. The setup on my mobile phone was pretty easy, but read the directions in the app itself.The MYQ learned the Genie garage codes in a few minutes and it has worked perfectly since then. You can have the app notify you when the door goes up and/or down. You can check the app to see how long the door has been open or closed. You can also open or close the door remotely from the mobile app on your phone.

This works great.  I was tempted to get the older MyQ system last year and I'm glad I waited. This system is very simple to setup.  It took me less than 10 minutes from start to finish, and everything worked correctly the first time.  I haven't had any issues with it since either!  This is honestly the first "smart" product I might actually recommend to my parents because they can set it up themselves and it's dead simple to operate.It loses a star only because Google integration requires a yearly fee.

I bought this, because the kids were always leaving the garage door open, and since there weren't enough controllers to go around I thought I kill two birds with one stone.First, I get an alert when the door is, opened and it let's me know how long it's, been open.

Listen to the reviews!!!! Spent hours setting it wouldn't open or close the garage and all my othe sensors were possessed. The door kept opening and closed. Disconnected the thing and took another hour to get everything reprogrammed for my door to work like it did to begin with. WHAT A HORRIBLE PRODUCT!!! I wish it worked

Relatively easy set up.  Had some issues connecting it to my home wifi connection, but once set, easy as pie.  I often leave my house sometimes wondering whether I left the garage door open, so it’s nice to have the ability to check on the status or open it up for family before they arrive.  I have not used the Alexa functionality, so I can’t really speak to that.

We struggled with getting the device to work with our 2011 commercial opener but a call to the support number told us exactly what to do and it worked great!  So nice to be able to control our door from our phones.  Previously we had to get very close to the door for the remotes to work because of the steel siding and heavy insulation.  These work from anywhere.  Very convenient!

Im so glad i got this.  mainly for the peace of mind of being able to double check that my garage door is closed when i am not home.  plus it beats carrying a garage door opener around all the time even for short walks around the neighborhood or for when i'm outside working in the yard.  i always have my phone with me so it just became that much easier

About the only thing this does for me is let me know when the garage door has been open for over 10 minutes but otherwise, I don't use this as much as I would like.  It doesn't work with Siri or Alexa.  Using the app while driving is distracting.  They need to fix this issue...asap.  This proprietary nonsense doesn't help anybody.

I wasn't sure this would work with my older door opener but for the price I didn't mind trying. I didn't like that it didn't come with set up directions until I started to install it. Once you get the App going this is an absolute cake walk. I have 2 openers a newish MyQ door and an older overhead door (I think its a rebranded genie) The hardest part about the setup was getting the ladder out. It was all said and done with both doors operating perfectly in less than 20 minutes. I would advise screwing the sensor to the door instead of using the velcro tape but I live in a colder environment.

This is possibly the very best item guidance I have ever experienced. Simply sen the Q code and follow step by step, even a child could do it. I was so very impressed. I even linked it to my SmartThings Hub and this is controllable with all other home automation. Very nice work from Chamberlain. The person the created the step by step program deserves a bonus! I have seen very few that were so well done.

Follow the step by step directions and in telling you, this is a great product. It does exactly has it is suppose to do and is a great purchase. If you rush the installation and steps and deviate from what it specifically tells you to do at any point in time, you’ll have an issue. Had a neighbor who bought one and that’s why I was prepared to follow directly when I received mine. Very happy with it

Easy to install. Simple instructions after you download the app. I hate installing anything but this wasn’t too bad. Believe it or not, screwing the holder into the ceiling was by far the toughest part. Wife is very happy she can pull up the app and check the status. I like programming the app to close every night. Too many times we thought each other had closed the door. Never again.

The product is easy to install. Easy to pair up. But if you do not initially open the garage with the app, then it does not allow the garage door to shut With the app. This is a problem. If you are not aware who open your garage in your family and you notice it is open while you're at work and can't do anything about closing the door with your app.

I bought this because the wireless keypad mounted outside works slow and the code has to be entered multiple times on occasion. Now I have shared the MyQ Smart Garage Door Opener app with my kids so they can open the garage from there phone and not have to stand in the rain, heat or cold to enter my house through the garage. Works great we have had no troubles from installation of opener (I am 63 years old) to installation and logging in phone app. I also like knowing that I remembered to shut garage.

Beware trying to scam you, to integrate with Google or other automation solutions you have to subscribe to their premium service.  If you want to connect to Alexa, no skill, pay to connect to IFTTT then write your own interface.  Might as well done this with raspberry pi

Read the ad and  he led out on web site. Guaranteed to work with my opener. Wrong. During install instructions noted device would only detect if door was open or closed. Other features did not work. Checked back on web site and found a chart that clearly indicated the device would not fully work for me. Appreciate Amazons easy return process.

Works perfectly so far for monitoring my garage door status and also opening or closing it from my cell phone.  Installation is well explained, and there are also many YouTube videos to help with installation & set up. At initial set up, MyQ and the app worked just as described for "monitoring" my garage door, which (for me) was actually more important than opening and closing it from my mobile device. Although the app walks you through setting up your mobile device to open/close the garage, I had a difficult time pairing it with my opener even though my opener is a compatible Chamberlain opener? If you have are having the same problem, pay attention to the placement of your MyQ on the garage ceiling (IE: follow instructions). I moved the unit to the opposite side of the opener and it paired on the first try.

The directions for this product are on point and make installation easy.  I works perfectly, but of course, if wi-fi is down, so to is your GD opener app.  I have not had a problem and it's nice to know that Amazon can deliver right in the garage and re-secure when done.  LOVE IT, and could not live without it now.  If you are considering it, do it.

Works very well after its setup. Setup is a pain, at least from an Android phone. I followed the instructions to the letter, but I could not get the thing to connect to my Android phone for setup. Tech Support was able to get me going. Then, a month later, I wanted change the connection to a Wi-Fi extender, and the paintful setup process started all over again.

Installed this and it keeps saying sensor error, then you have to pair it again with the hub and garage door opener. Video instructions from Chanberlain said install it 4-6' from opener, one big problem, cord is only 5' i had to reinstall it because of their poor instructions. Thinking of sending this back if it doesn't start working without problems

Does not work consistently. Frequently crashes and reports status incorrectly. Once I left my house with just my phone with plan to get back in using my phone to open my garage, and it did not respond leaving me locked outside my house. I also had purchased this for Nest integration, however it only allows you to see your Nest products in the Chamberlain MyQ app, and is not visible through the Nest app. Also does not allow you to create multiple user accounts. I am returning this for something that works more consistently

Do yourself a favor if you use an iPhone and just leave the instructions in the box.  Download the app and follow the app.  I fought an error screen for over an hour when the system tried to go out and register the S/N and create your account.  I finally punted, went to the app store and downloaded the app.  Once I did that, I had 2 doors working in less than 15 minutes.  The original "pairing" for the sensors was a little finicky but that was the only hitch.

The APP never works with it. It can open the door, but can never shut it. Also to get it to connect during the set up took hours to finally get it to work to be able to open the door. It is extremely frustrating and quite a disappointment that it does not work correctly with the APP, since that was the only reason I bought. It doors out is is just an expensive half use (only opening) garage door opener.

this works just like you would expect.  you set up your own notifications and it alerts of you of whatever you want (i.e. open, closed, opened for a certain amount of time, etc. ) would recommend on a newer motor but for the price you could spend a little more and buy a motor with wifi that does this for you.  will probably be quieter than current motor also

Installation and setup for this device is a breeze. Surprisingly simple. And the app is very straightforward and easy to use. For the most part, it works how you'd expect it to.However, the myQ experience is advertised as having Google Assistant compatibility, but it is seriously lacking in this area. It only works with a phone, not with smart home devices like the Google Home or Google Home Mini; and even when it does work with the phone, saying "open the garage door" opens the myQ app where two more taps are then required to actually open the door, instead of actually opening the door. The same sort of thing is the case with closing the door.

We got this specifically to allow us to invite other users (like out petsitter) so that they can easily access our house and it works perfectly.It's very easy to install (took about 15 minutes) and worked great even with our 20 year old Craftsman garage door opener.  You just need to be a little handy (you basically need a drill, a ladder and a screwdrivers) and then be able to follow the instructions provided by the app.  The android app is pretty self explanatory and worked great the first time.

Had new garage doors installed, however, the openers are 20+ years old. Even with the age, the openers are made a bit better than new openers with integrated open/close sensors and controls. The MyQ allowed me to update our existing door operators and has worked very well since installed. No longer have to double check to make sure doors are closed when away from home or at night. Had no problems installing.

I got this because I came home to an open garage door that had been that way all day. I decided to end that so I saw this and thought it was a decent price. Install was so easy and surprised me I didn’t have to do any special wires. It’s a total plug and play item.  It’s already saved me stress I’d knowing if my garage is open and working with amazon for dropping packages in the garage is the best

What an upgrade for my garage door opener! This was an easy add on to our Liftmaster garage door opener and works easily from an app on our phones now. It’s great for those days you’re in a rush, make it down the road and then have that nagging feeling that you might not have remembered to shut the garage door- instead of turning back or calling a neighbor to check, you can easily check the app and close it from wherever you are. Easy to install! Works great! It was my favorite Christmas present this year!!

Purchased the device and installed for months.Installation was not straight forward but was not technical required either; just takes time to try select the correct garage opener.  Operation is also easy; only downside is the APP won't allow garage opener to stop while it's on the move, i.e. you have to wait till complete cycle (either opening the door or closing the door) before next action.

I purchased this product to replace the old 201 model that would not save the wifi information in the situation of a power outage.  The first smart hub I received worked great, but the door sensor would work sporadically.  (The troubleshooting guide recommended replacing batteries, which I did, and this did not solve the problem).  I decided to order a replacement unit, which was a smooth process.  I installed the new unit, and this time the smart hub would not learn my garage frequency and would not open/close.  I decided to use the first smart hub and the second door sensor together, and this did the trick.  Seems like some units are just lemons and you may need to keep ordering replacements until you get a working smart hub and door sensor.I've had this installed for two months and has worked flawlessly with one exception.  I initially installed the hub on the ceiling as recommended, and this would sometimes not open my Genie Intellicode garage opener.  I ended up putting it on a shelf in the back of the garage and it now works great.  In other words, don't rely on the instructions and just do trial and error until everything is working right.

This product worked for a year and then just quit. It will no longer pair with my garage door. It is difficult to install and requires multiple attempts just to get it to pair with your network. No warranty past one year so I am stuck with this junk. Bad product. Bad service. A loser any way you look at it.
Product is very problematic in that having it open and close a garage door from Alexa or any other similar system does not work.THIS PRODUCT DOES NOT SUPPORT OPENING FROM ALEXA.

The device works just fine but required a lengthy call to customer support to get it to sync with the garage door opener. We ended up taking steps that were far beyond what was covered in the app. I had one family member who bought one and had no problem getting it to set up right away. I had another who purchased one who also had to go  through customer service. Both those family members were IT professionals. BTW, I found the customer support rep extremely pleasant, patient and helpful. So, the product itself is great but be prepared to contact customer service to solicit their help in syncing your unit. The good thing is you hopefully only have to do that once.

I got this for my 2000 Genie and it worked perfectly, was easy to install using the video instructions...you don't even have to READ the manual!!!  I also hooked it to Amazon Prime KEY so that they can make deliveries via garage.  Wife isn't ready for that part tho.!Highly recommended...just needs a good WIFI signal in your garage.

Installed about a week ago.  The biggest issue is the basic function of this product is defective.  It randomly opened my garage door twice today!!  Setting off my security alarm and sending the cops to my home.  The myQ app itself has no history of the door opening or closing at all either after 9AM this morning, when the door opened and closed at least 3 times.  Complete fail.In addition, even if it did not have this major functional and safety defect - it has very poor smart home integration.  Does not integrate directly with Alexa.  Best you can do is link to IFTTT (free for now but usually they charge a subscription fee), and create a routine so you can use voice commands to open the door.  Cannot use Alexa to open the door (ironic when it opens randomly on its own!).

Very easy to install from my perspective. No issues connecting and programming 2 sensors for 2 doors. The app promoted me and it worked great to program the 2 sensors. So far it works great and I like the alerts. I also purchased this to have in garage delivery but my items still get put in front of my door so not sure what the point of signing up for that service is. False advertising? Delivery people don’t care?

my old house had a wifi enabled garage door opener and we honestly got spoiled.. not wanting to spend the money to replace the existing unit in my new home that works fine, I bought this.  I am not very technically adept, and i was able to install it in about an hour or less, and it works great.. definitely worth the money.

This company brags about their product being compatible with Google Home. But there’s a catch. In order to milk more money out of you, they have added a fee if you want that compatibility. I wish I would have known this before purchasing. This crap needs to stop and stop now!

Seamless easy install.  Download the App, follow the directions and you're ready to go.  Setting up a schedule to close the door at a specific time is great.  No more forgetting to close the door at night.  The App notifications on your phone is helpful too.  Don't let the comments about subscription or fees sway you.  It's not necessary at all to connect to Alexa.  Checking/closing/opening the door while we're away will be very useful.

Does not work with either of our garage door openers. Page says genie models after 1996, but they only work 1996-2016, newer models are not supported. Can be used to monitor the status but not control the door. If you are uncertain you should go to genie website to verify that it will work as expected.

Worked everything as promised in description, simple install. Havent faced the issue with erroneous status on app or unexpected opening or closing. Will update if i face in future. Garage closing through app triggers a really annoying sound though before the shutter drops. Other than that its great so far.

Install took all of 20 minutes - mostly time spent finding something high enough for me to reach my garage ceiling.  Only issue I had was that my opener had a purple BUTTON but said orange on the unit.  Had to try both in order to get it to work - but that's not the hub's fault.  I was able to share it out to my kiddos so they can bring their bikes in when coming home from school - which was the entire reason I got it.  I even get a notification to tell me when the door opens, so I know they're home.  For someone new to home automation, this worked great.

I found it fairly easy to install. Programming it was a breeze. Once set up has worked consistently. I did put it on Amazon for package delivery and that has worked well so far. I even had to open the garage for someone who brought something for me without warning. Was in the restaurant, opened the garage, they dropped it off and closed the garage, all without leaving my seat! Great stuff!

This is so convenient. I purchased this at a discount on Amazon when a bike was stolen due to a roommate leaving garage door open. I love that it gives alerts when the garage door is open or closed, and keeps a log. Great when you need to let a friend in that arrives when you're not home. They don't need a code (they just call or text and I open garage from my phone)

Do NOT buy this if you want to connect to Google Assistant or a Google Home. They charge $10/year for that functionality. On top of that, you can't even tell Google Assistant to open the garage door. Basically, the Assistant will only tell you if there door is closed and to close the door for you if it is open. Really limits it's usefulness. The other disappointing lack of feature is that you can't directly add it to your Google Home devices. You can only use it through Google Assistant.

If you always have to turn around because you do not remember if you have closed the garage door, this is the solution. I am really happy that I have purchased two of this. Now if I have my senior moment, I just open my app and I can operate the garage door from my phone. Very easy.Installation is fairly easy. It did take me some time to sync my garage door to the hub because I could not find the right model from the app. The rest process was very simple.

This door opener was so easy to install with the myQ app.  The problems comes in when you try to integrate it with alexa. You are required to pay a monthly or yearly subscription.  I got it for the Amazon garage delivery option and was so disappointed  with it not easily free integration with alexa.  I will keep it for the Amazon delivery but hopping chamberlain will come into the 21st century and allow alexa link at no charge.

When you have gotten fifteen or twenty miles down the road and you simply can't recall if you closed the garage door or not, this is what you need. You can also grant privileges to your neighbor should they have a reason to access the garage in your absence. It can handle a single garage door (as displayed) or, with a small add-on, two doors.

this garage opener was fairly quick & easy to install - the step by step instructions & available videos etc were helpful. It worked well after setting it up but the next day I was having a terrible time getting it to respond - especially trying to close the garage. I was ready to send it back thinking I didn’t want to deal with something unreliable but happened to read a review that suggested turning the unit around 180 degrees in the mount which I did and it’s worked perfectly since! I’ve been really happy with it and it’s made my life so much easier since my traditional garage remotes were having trouble shutting my garage unless in very close range. I also really appreciate the door sensor that tells you if it’s open or shut just for peace of mind.

Highly disappointed in this product. Installed it as directed by the videos in the app and more than half the time it tells me my garage door is open when it's not. Have had to reset it up already because it was dead in the water saying the garage was opening but it wasn't. They say you get what you pay for but $20 to open and close my garage 3 times... not worth it.

You do NOT need to subscribe to anything to use this device out of the box, unless you want to use Alexa. I don't (and never will) own an alexa, so this works just fine for me. I use my phone to control it and the ability to close the garage door if it is left open (at 10PM) and send me notifications is awesome. Great product!

I'm nowhere near handy, but the hub is indeed super easy to install. The video guide inside the app helps you step by step. I've been using it for a few weeks now and it's always been working in terms of triggering open/close on the phone. Sometimes it can be a little slow though, but still it's reliable. I haven't figured out a way to add an iOS shortcut though, so I'll just need to open the app every time. It probably works with Google assistant, and it has the integration in the app, but it doesn't work for me, and a Google search is telling me it's not possible to add it to Google home, so this is not that great. That being said, it's still worth the money.

The only reason I got this is is because it advertised it works with Alexa, it does not! On the plus side it’s amazon key app works great with in garage delivery. So convenient!! Especially now during the holidays and with porch pirates on the rise, it really gives peace of mind. My husband installed the my q about 5 months ago and we just got an email that it needs a new battery?! So battery life is very short on the component that sticks to the actual garage door, but I do use it every day. All in all useful but please amazon make it available to link to Alexa as you advertised!!!!

Absolutely a most valuable device for the garage. Saved so much hassle with family, friends, and construction worker access. Works like a charm. Was very easy to install.Only minor complaint is that the door part battery required replacement within a few months after installation. I am hoping it was because of a bad battery from the factory.

It took several tries to get this to sync to my remote. All day actually. But once we got it working I LOVE it. I can now tell when my kids leave the garage door open. I can see when they get home. I can also allow my ups driver to drop opp packages inside the garage door to protect my purchases without giving away my garage door code. VERY handy!

We purchased this products for the peace of mind of knowing that we didn’t leave the garage door open when we left home, or at night when we went to bed. In the 30 days since we’ve had it in operation, the garage door has opened at various times of the day, AND NOT AT BY OUR OWN INITIATIVE, ten times. THIS PRODUCT HAS IN FACT MADE OUR HOME AND GARAGE LESS SECURE.

Love the Chamberlin MyQ!!!  Setup was easy once I figured out my wifi password.  I actually remembered the password for forgot the sequence  of spaces and special characters!  Once I had that right, rest of the setup  was smooth.  Now all is dependent on house power, internet and phone connection.  Power situation will be under control once my new Briggs & Stratton is hooked up. Now I don't have to worry about leaving the house with the garage door wide open like I did for 4 whole days.  TG nothing was missing or messed up when I got back home!!!

Such a neat idea to make my existing garage door opener current and wireless enabled with the use of an app. Now my family and I can see the current status anytime we don’t remember if we closed garage door. Very easy setup. No issues whatsoever. My only wish is that I could have it Alexa enabled but I couldn’t see how to do that. Even so, love the app as it is.

I bought two of these. One for my house and one for my father's house. Mine worked pretty well for several months but there have been two instances where the device didn't detect that the door was closed until several hours later.I've installed a backup sensor to my hub and I'm only using the myq to open and close the door. I. E. I don't trust the myq to tell me if the door is open or not.

This product works as advertised. What really stands out though is the installation. The instructions are presented as a tutorial online. Whoever created this tutorial is a master perfectionist. I was super impressed. I'm sure this person never worked for Microsoft or Apple. NICE!

Not much use since it doesn’t use geofencing.  Can’t close garage door using IFTTT.  You can only open it.  Seems Chamberlain marketing folks don’t have a clue.  Best I can say is it’s easy to install as it requires no wiring, despite lack of advice on where to get the online procedures.  Sent a question to Chamberlain and two weeks later, no answer.

Amazon support was awesome, they contacted the support vendor and they said the cause of the random open & closing of the garage door was the garage door opener motor or mother board or both not myQ hub. I called my home warranty and the tech confirmed it. After they installed the new garage door opener everything worked grate! Note: you do need a router repeater for your WiFi myQ to work properly.

This, combined with the hub, has been one of the best home automation additions I've made yet.  Shut your door that you forgot to shut when you left for work.  Let a friend into your garage while you're away.  Get notified if the door is opened.  Also, integration with Amazon Key is a game changer.  Never worry about porch pirates again.

I found the device to be a breeze to install and operate.  I followed the directions step-by-step.  The unit paired immediately with the door sensor, and then connected to my Wi-Fi without an issue.  I have a standard Chamberlain Lift-Master garage door opener, and it worked the first time.Some of the reviewers have talked about false openings and such.  I haven't had any such issues.  The thing worked as advertised.  For $30 (Amazon special), it was hard to turn down.  They don't have Amazon delivery here, so I don't get a chance to do that.

hubby bought this months ago for us and it works amazing great! love that I don't have to worry if I shut the garage and trying to get ahold of neighbors or just worrying all day. My inlaws loved it when they visited so bought for them at christmas. Installed in couple minutes and we use all the time. Do not regret this purchase and I recommend to everyone I know!

1st one stopped working after 1 week.  Contacted Chamberlain and their support was sub-par.  My unit wouldn't connect to my wifi and I suspect the wifi module was bad.  They had me do a few tests, which I've already done and knew that they were just following the troubleshooting script.  I finally gave up and got a replacement from Amazon (thanks Amazon!).  The new one has been working for months without any issue.Would have given 5 starts if it wasn't for the bad unit (-1 star) and inept support (-1 start).

I found the MyQ easy to install. I have set it to notify me if my door is open for more than five minutes. Hi f it is it sends me a notification. Then I go to the app and check the door.  If no one is home I can close the door from my phone  and find out what’s going on. I also like that I can make sure the door is closed every night at 10 pm MyQ takes care of that in case someone left it open.

Performs as expected, promptly delivered, good price when on sale.The rating was reduced from 5 to 4 stars because the door motion detector battery needed to be replaced less than two weeks after being placed in service.

Have a Genie 3 garage door opener and it worked with it. Quick and easy install. Tried another brand before this and spent hours trying to make it work and install so I was very happy how quick and easy this one was. I also love the flashing light when it closes or opens via cell phone app. Great product, very happy. Liked it so much I even bought one for my mom's house as a gift and installed it there with no problems as well and she has a craftsman door opener and it paired and installed just as quick if not quicker.

Setup was very easy and proceeded as per instructions without any issues. As part of the setup, the unit opens/closes the garage door, so at some point, it is able to operate the door on its own. But that is the last time it works. I can not operate the door again via the app. Initially it worked, and as with other reviews, stops working. I have an older Genie Intellicode opener (mfg circa Y2000). Perhaps it’s not keeping up with the rotating codes of the intellicode opener?I’ve reset factory settings, tried different WiFi networks in my household (all showing full signal where the MyQ is installed), but every time, it stops working after a short period.

This device works great if all you want to do is open and close your garage door from an app.  But if, like me, you had dreams of telling your smart speaker (Google Home/Amazon Alexa) to "open my garage door" or "close my garage door", you will be disappointed.There is apparently no way at all to open your garage door with these devices.  MyQ says its a security issue so no unauthorized person can open your garage door.  Even if you want to use a voice command to close your garage door, you can't simply say "close the garage door"; you have to phrase it something like "Ask MyQ to close garage door" or "talk to MyQ".
I read some reviews where the garage door will just open randomly.The last thing I need is it open when I get home and its cleaned out.

Primary issue: Alexa integration.
