Had delivery instructions setup accurately, made sure what we ordered would be delivered inside garage & found packages all over the exterior of our home.after too many calls & a lot of time on my part, Amazon finally started to figure it out.Had product installed and that was a waste. I should have done it to save the money.

I bought the MyQ Smart Garage Door Hub for a couple of reasons.Reason #1. I got tired of wondering if I closed my garage door after driving away. Now I can tell through the app on my cell phone, and close it if I forgot.

I really like this product because I can check to see if I put the door down or not.  It's also handy if you need to let someone in when you aren't home.  It raises the door near instantly and is just as reliable as the remotes that come with the opener.  The app is super simple, so no complaints there.  This was a great deal at the low $20 price I paid.

I really wanted this to work but I could not make it happen. The hub would not connect tried about ten times, kept showing on the app as "lost connection" pretty much. Distance could not have been in an issue. I have Blink, Arlo, Smartthings, and Hue hubs, this one a no go. I read all kinds of strange troubleshooting like reboot my router and all this stuff...nah. Hope they iron out the issues.

I liked that it was a snap to hook up to my Wifi system and easy To setup an account after I downloaded their app. This opener is 15 years old but it’s just got a much needed upgrade!  Plus I got it cheaper from the Amazon warehouse so that was a nice bonus. It’s also easy to give permissions / send an email invite to family/friends/roommates so they can use it also.

Do not purchase this product. False advertisement to not tell your customers of the subscription fee. Lucky I did not open it and the package arrived today and It was sent back immediately. Not today Satan. Not today.

Works fine. Easy to install. The only issue is that it does not integrate with Amazon Alexa and Ring security.  It works great  and I get notifications from MyQ on my mobile.It's annoying that it does not integrate with Alexa.  HOWEVER, do not let that be a show stopper for using it.

My old push button wall mounted door opener was failing i  decided to go with this product! Very in expensive and seemed like a great way to go!  I highly recommend this product. I have a sears craftsman opener 2002 dated mfd.It pair very easily by the simple instructions and woks great... Very safe also!

Not as good as expected. I had trouble installing it but once installed it did work to open and close the door. However the notification leaves something to be desired as there needs to be a sound notification such asGarage door just opened. I did find that I can add sound though the phone notification but it doesn’t have the ability to say Garage Door Opened or Garage Door Closed.

It was a lot easier to install than I anticipated it would be. Was initially a little worried for the mixed reviews, but overall happy.Have had some issues with the installation to make it work on another phone due to some software limitations for some reason.

The Smart Hub is easy to install. But, I have IT experience so the install is not for the faint of heart.  Follow the instructions explicitly.  Also, I needed a wifi extender (Netgear) even though it was "45% signal strength" (Wifi Strength Meter by Mobilia Apps V2) to start and other wifi devices work in the garage.  With the extender, strength is 70-75%.

I like the easy install took me about 20 minutes. I like the real time viewing to check whether the door is up or down. I have to be pretty close to open or close the garage door using the spp on my phone. When I say close I mean within 50 feet. That’s the only issue I have a negative comment sbout.

I had great expectation for this device.  It is a link into my smart home setup.  First, I will rate the instructions a 1 star.  The instructions were greatly lacking but I was able to deal because of the other smart home devices setup in my home.  There are two apps that can be used with this device and both will work, again the instructions are not explicit to which app to use.  So far, the application does work as it should, for that reason a total of 3 stars is what I give for this device.  Had the instructions been more complete, I would have given a 4-5 start review.  I will update as more time passes.

The instructions were not very clear I did what it said but their tech support told me to do something different that still didn't work o wish I could refund it not a good product tech support not very patient with me

This unit works as advertised. I had a little bit of an issue getting it to pair but after that it has been solid. So nice when I come home from a motorcycle ride and just pull my phone out to get into the garage. Haven't used it away from home but I think it will work great. I have a YI camera inside my garage too, that way I can make sure it's closed when I'm away.
I havent installed yet, been teading reviews about installing & am surprised cause say follow guide exactly. Not sure what guide they got but this is what mine has

Device was easy and straightforward to install.  That is where my accolades end.  The MyQ application is the only way to control the device.  While it SAYS it integrates into the Googke Assistant app, you can only get a status update from the unit... no control.  And it does not bridge to Google Home at all.  I'm not sure how or if it integrates into any other system... but having 12 applications for my smart devices is NOT being smart.

Easy to install.  Remote open and closes fine.NO CARPLAY FUNCTIONALITY and NO HOMEKIT.  IFTTT will not open the garage door even with a premium subscription! And if you want HomeKit you must buy an additional home bridge.  On Amazon is $97.  This is a rip-off on a rip-off

This was an easy install after watching provided video link.  I had a compatible garage door opener,  so everything worked first time.  (Go to the website,  it will tell you if your brand and model is compatible) I really like that I can check to see if I remembered to close my garage door and the notifications when someone enters or exits the garage.

BE WARNED BEFORE BUYINGI bought this on the amazon advertisement that it will allow for secure package delivery and they were running a sale for the holidays. As someone who has suffered porch theft, I was sold. What I was not made aware of is that the Amazon Key service is not available universally everywhere. I did not find this out until I installed and paired the device with our garage opener then attempted to register with our amazon account and shipping location. Party foul Amazon. Now we own an expensive 3rd garage door remote. Definitely disappointed.
The app is very slow and keeps forgetting my password. If the internet connection is not perfect, it will go back to a login screen without the saved password. Too unreliable.
I purchased one of these to control two doors. Had to buy an extra sensor.Make sure you have wifi signal in your garage though. No WIFI, no work.

Very  straightforward set up through the app. Allows you to open & close from anywhere which is more convenient that the opener which only opens if your close to the front of the house. Convenient for accepting packages or letting someone into your home. Do not buy this expecting it to pair with Alexa.

The remote would raise the garage door, but would not lower the door. All TECH REFERENCES said it was due to a misaligned safety device mounted on the bottom of the door frame, but... I made sure the lasers were aligned and it still did not close the door, so... I went to Walmart, bought a new battery for MyQ door opener remote and now it works as advertised.

I bought two.  1 installed easily.  The second, connecting to the same router, same opener model, different garage (where my cell had a good signal) took a while.  I had to reset to factory defaults and try again 10-12 times before it finally worked.Once setup it's been great for the week it's been connected.

Good product that works well once you get it installed.  I ordered an extra sensor as I have 2 garage doors and the instructions were not clear in explaining how to set it up when the 2 garage doors have exact model of motors....3 hours later of talking with tech support and 2 different techs, we got it resolved.

Working just with the app this item is great.  Incredibly easy to install, the app works well.  Very handy.  Problem is that it requires a subscription to integrate in with smart home hubs such as Alexa.  I would have rather paid more for it upfront and get a fully functional unit vs getting drilled for a monthly cost even if it is low.

This is my second unit and sorry I bought it. These units work for awhile then when there is a blip in the wi-fi or a power loss you have to reprogram it. Get back on the ladder etc.. Not a good thing when you are away and need to close the door. Save your money I believe there are better products on the market.

Installation is simple. Hardest part is connecting the MyQ hub with garage system. TIP: place the MyQ hub as close to your garage opener when pairing. Length of time to pair is dependent on how new your garage system is. It took me a few tries(each try was at least 3 minutes). After it's connected, voila!  Easy least. Works great! I'm glad I purchased it.

Yikes.  One time out of ten the app reports that the garage door is open when it is actually closed -- enough to make you not trust anything and have to figure out how you can get home to see the actual state. One time the app even locked me out from use, but luckily I had access to the physical garage door opener.  Dear Chamberlain:  remove that feature!Tech support was great, but even after replacing parts I still had the same issue.  I wound up having to buy a web cam for the garage to actually see what the door is doing. I would love a refund but it is too much work taking everything down and sending back.  Two stars because the system physically opens and closes the door.
this was not very easy to setupit will not work with alexa even after it being out for years now

Easy install - downloaded the app on my iPhone and iPad before beginning and that made the process easier when it came to the install - no stopping the process to work on your communication devices.  Like being able to program my garage door to close itself and or make sure it is closed every evening at the same time and/or check it when I'm out in case I forgot when driving off.  Nice to be able to open the garage door from my phone and the same for closing it.  I know some people dont like the closing alarms but when you may be putting someone or thing in harms way of a closing door, it's best to be safe.

I have tried set this up.  I would get to where I need to check the door position sensor and there is no response.  Just in case I bout another battery for the sensor. It was frustrating so I set it aside and tried again.  This time I had to a factory reset.  After resetting tried use the app to set-up but could only get where it says serial number mismatch.  While in the application they asked for my email and password.  Requested password reset and continued in the application but still could not get past serial number mismatch.  Went online tried to login using the password sent and it said the password I had requested earlier was incorrect.  Tried several times from the website to get it again to reset the password but no reset came.  Tried to find a phone number for support there appears to be none.  I couldn't find even an email for support.  I will box it up, send it back and hope they will refund my money.

This was my 2nd unit in 24 hours as the first one which I ordered new turned out to be used.  Amazon quickly sent out a replacement unit which was new.  Very easy to set-up, but disappointed that MyQ can only be linked to one account, i.e. if you want to allow multiple users to have access to the garage door opener, then you have to share your personal userid and password.  This is bad from a security perspective!  Hence knocking off two stars.

I often panic driving away asking myself “did I close the garage door”? Not anymore with real time messages and status.  Also like the Key by Amazon feature, no more boxes vulnerable to porch pirates, it works very well! Added bonus I can open the door remotely if I need to even with my Apple Watch! Was super easy to install and pair with my craftsman garage door opener. Can’t go wrong for $35 when amazon gives you a $30 credit when using Key for the first time!

I bought this solely to enable my wife and I to use Amazon Key In-Garage Delivery.It half works.  One (and only one) Amazon account can be linked through the Key app to the MyQ account used for the registered "owner" of the device.  I've tried several workarounds, and none seem to work.

Easy to follow instructions for pairing with existing (compatible) garage door openers.  Followed the instructions and was able to pair it on the first and tested opening and closing it several times before mounting the hub without any issues.  Not using Alexa or IFTTT features - basic open and close features are good enough.As other reviews have noted, the safety features are a bit excessive.  The flashing light is not a problem but the ear piercing alarm is loud and continues to go off for longer than seems necessary.

Installation had some initial glitch but then went smoothly. We hooked two doors adding a second sensor. Useful and a must have for safety. Amazon Key is a useful feature too for in garage prime deliveries. Security cameras installed.

It works well for me. I have a detached garage and w/ my wifi extender, it picks up the signal w/o problem. I know sooner or later, it will lag and/or not give me an quick response (just as with my security system). It does let me know if the door starts to open after closing, or if someone else opens the door. For me, overall it serves my purposes.

It works with most models and works with models 1993 and up ....paired with the app i can now open my garage while im at work miles away or i can be overseas and open my garage door ,,,,,what a convenience.....easy to install and pair light to hang ....nothing to hate specially when buying cheap from warehouse deals

The system is easy to install and set up. Interface is simple and intuitive, and when working correctly is provides a satisfying experience. However, I can not recommend this based on the widely reported faulty door sensor and poor customer service.Soon after installation, I noticed the auto-close feature was improperly functioning. I have it set to close at 10pm in case I left it open. Apparently the sensor doesn't report if the door is already closed and attempts cycle it anyway, so the door opens. Then for some reason closes again. So now every night at 10pm I have a screeching alarm going off and cycling it open and closed.

What great service! I was having a difficult time with installation because my program button didn’t match the colors listed. I reached out to customer service on a Saturday and within minutes had an answer from Zoey, and it was the right one! It is so nice to get rapid customer service. The product works like a champ, is easy to install, and lives up to everything in the description.

I have Wayne Dalton Quantum 3213, and the description page clearly states, that this device is compatible with Wayne Dalton Quantums. What it fails to mention, it is only compatible with 372 MHz Quantums, such as Quantum 3214. But not with Quantum 3213, which is 303 MHz. Took me over an hour of research to finally find this information. Very disappointed as a result, and have to return it.

I like this product because it make my 15 year old garage opener new again! I am able to open the door from anywhere in the world. I have given access to my kids too. I strongly recommend this for the convince and value. I had a hick up trying to install but customer service stayed on the phone and helped me and answered every question. Thanks a million !!

I'm very disappointed with the connectivity issues I experienced with this device.  It refused to connect to my network and im contemplating returning the device or spending some time with tech support on the phone.  I'm pretty savvy with wifi tech so I was pretty surprised to find that I couldn't get the device to connect and function.

Very easy to install, with clear instructions provided in the MyQ app.My only real complaint is with the time before the door closes when using the phone app, due to a prolonged series of high-volume beeps that serve as a warning the door will be closing. I feel the same warning could be achieved with a lower volume, or shorter duration.

They update there terms and agreement haven’t be able to use My Q because the terms and agreements page won’t let me agree to the terms and has me locked out of the app! Tried calling to complain the number to call to complain is a number to a fire company!  Tried calling Chamberlain and kept getting hung on.  DONT BUY THIS! Will be sending it back for a refund used it only a few times before they updated there terms and made it so you can’t use it! Worst app ever made!

The installation of this product was relatively easy and straightforward.  However, the functionality of using the app on my iPhone was sporadic, at best.  As a result, I wound up returning the product.  I was really looking forward using it, mainly because of the fact that it allows for Amazon package deliveries directly into my garage.

I don't know about the rest of you but i'm sick of buying products that have "simple" installation instructions that "don't work" and spend hours trying to figure out why. This is one of those products. Three installation instructions on the box. The wireless will find the device but not connect. The router is 3 feet away. Tried to connect with support per the instructions in the setup software, got the old "Please wait, we will connect you with a live support person in a minute." Waited for over an hour, never got any response. This review space asked that I write a review and say what I was using the device for. I'ts a garage door opener, I'll let you figure out what I was using it for.

I've attempted 2 previous garage controllers and this one just works. The sensor knows the door position and the controller was super easy to setup and enable. Very pleased with the simplicity, but more so with the functionality that they have built in and that it just works.

The device stops working every other day, works barely 20% of the time and sometimes has a mind of its own. I have tried pairing the sensor and base several times, resetting the sensor but nothing works. We’ve had several occasions where it opened the garage door in the middle of the night. I regret buying this product and it has caused more issues than solving the problem it’s supposed to.

I bought this to open and close my garage door remotely. Having left the garage door open accidentally overnight and once in a while when leaving home. This is perfect for me. Installation was a breeze. I went step by step, had no problems, and the app was closing the door in less than 15 min from the time I started. I don't know what the other reviewers are talking about. The only thing I do not like is the alarm that sounds when you use the app to shut the door. It's obnoxious and I don't not see the point. They should have a disable/mute feature for that. Otherwise great product for the price!

Great product . Would be better if it worked with Alexa but I’m hearing that is going to happen soon.Also I live in New England , it’s been cold lately and seems the switch inside the door sensor freezes because for hours in the morning it says door open when it’s really closed . Then after the sun is on the garage a while it goes back to being closed again .

No more wondering if you closed the garage door!!  Easy to install and great app functionality.  I would highly recommend this device.  I love the "schedule" feature, you can program it to close automatically at a certain time so you don't accidently leave your garage open at night, I have mine set a 9pm and it works great.  There are several helpful YouTube videos that will make it even easier to install.

The install process was pretty straight forward and the instructional videos along with written instructions were simple to follow along for the install. This works great to have peace of mind that the garage is closed when I'm away from the house. I'm still working on the alerts and how to make them match what I am looking for to ensure i leave the house safe.

I was expecting this to take my weekend, but I was surprised how easy it was to install. I was done in 20 minutes. App works great and guides you step by step instructions with periodic videos to guide you through.I would highly recommend this product. Now I just need to figure out on how to add another opener for my second garage and will I need another hub or not?

Glad I got it! Worked excellent, didn’t even have to mount it up high for the first few weeks, just sat in a power strip on the table. All is good and had iWatch integration. Notifications are nice.It didn’t pair to the garage opener on first try but second try it did.

I love this thing.  Do you ever drive just out of sight of your garage door and think "I wonder if I shut the garage door?".  I do.  At the next stop I look at the app or I turn to my wife and ask her to check the app.  No turning around.  It's awesome.I can also open the door from my phone if I need to let someone in.  It's magic.

I love the end result. The problem was getting there.  The instructions could include more scenarios. It’s like these were written from their R&D facility without real life testing.  For me and probably only me, I finally, strangely found that turning the device 190 degrees towards the house, away from the garage door, towards my WiFi extender cleared all issues. I had to figure that out myself. I could not understand why the thing would connect and drop connection immediately.  Turning it kept connection.  It just needs to help customers out more. Be prepared for struggles. Maybe you’re lucky and WiFi connectivity is perfect with no issues. More power to you.  But this was my finding. But after those struggles, I do like the product.

The install was pretty straight forward.  Took about 20-30 minutes, and the app guided us through it no problem.  Have had it operational for about a week now and it has worked flawlessly.  Only exception is on one occasion when it reported a loss of internet connection.  The problem resolved itself and it came back online in a few minutes.  I'll watch out for that and update this review if it becomes an issue, but for now it has been great.

Had it installed in less than an hour.  Was driving to work this morning and wondered if i remembered to close my garage to the point I was considering driving home to check and risk being late to work.  But, then I remembered the My Q app and was able to confirm my door was closed.  I went to work and thanked my friend who recommended that I purchase the MyQ Smart Garage Door Opener.

Like that you can integrate older non WiFi Chamberlin/Liftmaster products. We just moved and wanted to upgrade our home to a Smart one.Don’t place too close to the actual garage door unit.  A couple of feet away works much better. Use a separate electrical Receptical  from the one used for the garage door opener.

Installation was easy, particularly with the in-app installation videos and graphic depctions. Sure wish Chamberlain would include Alexa integration, but the app makes monitoring the status of my garage door extremely easy and user-friendly.  My boys arrive home from school shortly before I arrive home, but I've programmed the Chamberlain app to let me know when they arrive home, and to be sure they close the door (I'm not paying to heat the whole neighborhood ya know!) behind them.  If they fail to do so, I'll close it up behind them in a snap. So simple.

Working as advertised ,I'm happy ,the App is good to,it tell me how long garage door stay open to close.(updated as of July/27/2019)HUM,after down load new app Chamberlain to my new phone  it's such. Now I'm away from home open garage door up, then try to closing the door, the app did not do it,few time attempted,the app say must be locally close to reset????NEW APP IS SUCK...don't use it.

I got this specifically for Amazon In Garage Deliveries. Verified that my address is eligible. I've ordered more than 20 items since install, and NOTHING IS ELEIGIBLE FOR AMAZON IN GARGA DELIVERY. So then what's the point? I've got a nice wifi garage door opener! 😂

Easy physical installation. Written instructions for integration into wireless network slightly confusing as to absolute sequence and expected results. Finally got over that hurdle.Had to call tech support for integration with my Chamberlain opener. Turned out they needed to push a s/w update to the MyQ device. After that it worked great.

This is an outstanding addition to my garage door opener.  I installed it an 30 minutes with no problems.  The app is simple and user friendly.  It's nice to be able to check the status, open and close my garage door anywhere there is internet (including 4G with my mobile company).  And you can set up notifications on your phone to warn you when the door is opened, closed or stopped.

This is by far the best WiFI Garage Door opener hands down.  It took me all of 15 minutes to install it and works flawlessly.  I have another off brand WiFi Garage Door opener that works similar, but it has a wired door sensor.  This door sensor on this one is wireless!  Do yourself a favor and get this before it goes back up to $50.

It worked with my overhead garage legacy 650. Had to program twice before the system connected to the garage door opener and instruction did indicate that. Really enjoy the convenience to open remotely.  Wished i had this when my brother locked himself out when i was at work. App and instructions were very useful.

Don't waste your time if you're wanting to make your garage smart. The Google and IFTTT integration is hot garbage. This device will allow Amazon to open and close your garage when you're not home, but you can't close your own garage for "security reasons". Bologna.You should find a device that just works. This is not that device.

I was skeptical about this opener as there are several reviews that say this product is difficult to manage, set up, opens randomly etc. This review is not to debunk those claims but say I have not experienced any of the aforementioned concerns. This product works very well. I have several people in my family that have access to and use the app to open/close my garage door. If you are concerned about this product go on YouTube and watch a few videos. These will help to avoid some potential set up pitfalls.

Cool idea but horrible waste of time and execution.Edit: Tried this again due to it being on sale and finally got it to work using an iPhone. App seems to work but the setup took over an hour and two different attempts to pair. The beeping it makes when closing is really obnoxious and long but I think that can be fixed with some modifications. So far, I'd give it 3/5 with some annoyances on the setup. Will update if anything changes.

The install was flawless.....  I have an older Craftsman Opener (late 90's) and it was easy to install and worked right away.  Ended up having to reprogram my car remote afterwards but that was no problem.  I love the alerts I get but you can turn that off if you don't want to get notices.  I am very happy with the MyQ Smart Garage Door Opener.

The product works as expected except for the really annoying beeping sound whenever you shut the door using the mobile app.  The sound is for safety purposes, similar to the sound of a truck backing up, but the sound is too loud and the duration is way too long - my neighbors down the block do not need to know that I'm shutting my garage door.

Update: If you live in area the allows Amazon Garage Delivery this is a must. I still stand by my comments below about the IFTTT integration but if you don't need any of that this is a solid way to add smarts to your garage door.The product works fine if you only want to use the MyQ App but If you want to automate opening the door you are out of luck. IFTTT integration is poor. Chamberlain removed half the functionality from the integration which makes the unit not worth hooking up. Also you have to pay a subscription fee to fully unlock the integration which doesn't add geofencing or the ability to open the door automatically.

To make your garage smart does not get any easier than this. I tried the Amazon Delivery in my garage and worked great. I added a old camera in the garage to make sure all was good and delivered properly and it was. I love this option. You could by a MYQ camera also to Intergrade with the opener if wanted.  great product for an older garage opener.

I have a compatible Craftsman garage door opener (with an orange button).  However, the myQ device is unable to pair with the opener despite following pairing instructions to the letter.  No matter how I many times I reoriented the device, it will not pair.  I sat the myQ hub at the top of the opener enclosure to check if it is just a distance issue, but the result was the same.  I gave it two stars because it recognizes the door if it is closed or open.  I want to return it but I no longer have the return button in my order page.  I bought this during the Amazon prime week but was only able to have time to set it up two months after.  So disappointed it will not work as advertised.

At least once a week I would turn around to make sure my garage is closed. I have gotten text from neighbors once I’m at work that my garage is open. Those fears are now squashed, one quick look at the app and my nerves are settled. No subscription needed the way I use it. I can open and close it from my phone or garage door opener. That’s all I need it for.

Liked the key from Amazon since always using but not offered in my area yet and can’t control with Alexa without a myQ bridge. It is still handy I guess to know when door is open or closed but would not have purchased not being able to use either of those if I would have known.

This was an easy install and works exactly how I'd hoped it would. I bought this for the convenience of opening the door from my phone so I don't have to leave an opener in my truck which is parked in the driveway.The only bad thing it's the subscription they want you to pay to pair it with anything other than their own app. I have no use for paying it with my Amazon Echo so not a huge deal but this may be for other users.

This was incredibly easy to set up and I can control my garage from outside the WiFi zone. Bought it because typical me - 10 minutes into my commute I always think “did I close the garage?” And I thought this would basically tell me the garage was closed but ALAS I can close my garage if it’s open.It says it needs good WiFi in the garage. It doesn’t. I get like super minimal WiFi and it works. It says you need to put the hub close to the garage door opener. You don’t. Mine is on the wall probably 15 ft away and it works fine. Also didn’t mount it to the wall yet because I don’t yet own a drill. So yeah. It’s great.

Pretty simple to install. Nice guided walkthrough. Absolutely atrocious smart home integration through Google Assistant. You have to ask Google assistant to "Talk to MyQ" instead of adding service through the Home accounts management page. Full linking of service (that doesn't even allow you to open your garage with your voice!) requires activation of a currently free premium subscription that's soon to be $10/yr. As of 11/04/19 the activation link for this subscription leads to a login page that errors out at a 500 internal server error page! Effectively broken right now. The only thing this item does correctly is open and close the garage door through the app. That's it. Even at the sale price I wholeheartedly do not recommend.

This was very easy to install and set up on our garage door opener.  It works great but we have had some odd issues like the app reporting the door is open or closed when it is not.  Usually opening or closing the door with the switch on the wall resolves it but it is still annoying.  Without that issue this would be 5 stars.

Like the ease of installation. Was easy to set up and has been working great!!! Went out of town and ups/fedex delivered some packages and called my neighbor to put them into the garage after I used my app to open and close the garage. He was amazed by the ease of how this product works.
I was looking forward to using this, but could not get it to work and had to return it because:1) the instruction manual was missing information about connecting the hub to wifi;

Chamberlin could be much more upfront about the capabilities with this device.  It does not function as a smart home appliance like a light or mini plug or something, it works through a google assistant service.  So in order to use the voice functions, you need to ask GA to talk to MyQ, and then myq can tell you if the doors are open or closed, and can also close the doors for you.  IT CANNOT OPEN THEM.  This appears to be a policy decision made by MyQ, for whatever reason, I dont know.  It will not appear in your Google Home list as a device. However, its not a HUGE deal, because you can remotely open the doors from the MyQ app.  Installation and syncing was as easy as any other smart device.

Easy to connect and install.  Simple app.  Works great.My only complaint is that I wish that the app alerted you if the garage door reversed when closing.  That way you can tell it to try again.  AT present, the app just tells you if it closed or open, and perhaps stopped, although that alert has yet to occur, even when the door reverses.

Was able to set it up in less than 15 minutes, clear instructions, easy install and robust equipment.NO need for electrical knowledge, even your grand ma can do it with help, just need to step on a ladder for the mounting part. Rest is easy . Opens fast as well unlike other brands which I have in another garage. Would be nice to have a cheaper cam work with this, need more options there.

I love this product. I can never remember if I shut the garage door when I leave for work so being able to check on my phone is very nice. We only have one garage opener so it’s nice to be able to just open via the app as well. The piece that mounts in the garage flashes and beeps when you close the door via the app which adds a delay to the closing. This is supposed to warm people to stay away from the door. I wish that portion could be an optional feature but aside from that this system is really great!

I wasn’t sure if I could install this, but it was pretty simple. The instructions were very easy to follow. I receive notifications when the garage is opened or closed and I could even setup custom notifications to remind me if the garage door is open for a certain amount of time, which proved very useful when I forgot to close. I was able to close it from my office. I checked off one more thing on my list of things to automate my home.

Installed without a hitch, but I strongly recommend reading instructions carefully. Our garage is detached and approximately 25 ft from front door. A recent update to the app eliminated an occasional failure to connect. Now connection occurs within 5-10 seconds and the garage door opens/closes every time.

We have 4 children and they are constantly coming and going in the house and the code on the garage doesnt always work. Well this solved the issue for us, now they can control the garage remotely and we dont have to worry about it not being closed if someone leaves it open. Best money we have ever spent to solve a huge issue

Quick and easy installation.  Easy to control with the iPhone app. My favorite part is the integration with Amazon's Key In-garage Delivery. which protects my packages from porch pirates. Upon my recommendation, my son installed MyQ in his garage and is very happy with it.

I use this with the HomeBridge to integrate with Apple Home and Siri. It works great, and just as it should. I'm sure there are cheaper options out there than this one, but this is very easy to setup and gives you notifications anywhere if the garage is open or closed. Also there is no charge monthly anymore (at this time), which sold me on this opener.

I received my remote garage door opener and  it took me 45 minutes to install. It works and we love it. I can close the door from anywhere as long as I am connected to internet. No more walking downstairs to make sure the door is closed. And I have an alarm for after 10:00 p. m. to notify me if the door opens. Everything works. We have a Liftmaster garage door opener👍

Worked good with craftsman garage door opener.  I have i  iPhone device and i initially struck i connecting with my home wifi.  It says "page cannot be found" (setup.myqdevice.com), i cleared my cache and after that everything works great.  It connects to garage opener wireless and to me its great.  I tried Z-wave device prior this, as it integrate well with smartthing, but it didnt quite work well to my expectations.  I really hope that Chamberlain will soon support smartthing which is very important for me.

the wifi hub is easy to install, just follow the step by step APP instruction. It works great, the best feature is you can see the garage door status from the APP, if you forget to close the door leaving home, you can close the door from the APP. Very useful.

A great product that does exactly what it says. The installation instructions (on the cell phone app) are extensive and well thought out. I had no problem installing it in less that 15 minutes. Yes, you do need to have decent WiFi 2.4 GHz (not 5 GHz) signal, so that should be the only concern. And that it works with your garage door.

This product has mixed reviews here but I haven't had any issues with mine. I have four 4' dual strip LED fixtures in my garage and two 4' dual bulb florescent fixtures in my garage. My hub works perfectly. I watched the install video before I got the unit and it took me about 20 minutes to install from opening the box to operational. I have the sensor mounted on the top far right panel on my door and the hub mounted on the ceiling about 1 foot behind and to the right of the opener.

Don't waste your money. Chamberlain charges a monthly fee of $1 to connect to Google or IFTTT. Cannot be connected to Amazon Alexa. I am surprised that Amazon even sales this.You can control from an app but requires $$$ to integrate into Google or other smart homes.

I was disappointed that I was sent a Used item when the description said it was "New." The velcro was already attached and the sticky sides were not very sticky because someone had already attempted to install it previously. The package of screws were open with traces of drywall on the threads and the anchors were gone, not even sent. The product itself seems to function as advertised, although the 30 seconds of loud and obnoxious beeping whenever you utilize the app to open and close the garage is quite annoying. I do like being able to monitor my garage from my phone anywhere I am.

Love this product, does everything it is supposed to do.  I have OCD about making sure my garage is closed, this product allows me to be notified immediately if it goes up and reassures me that it is closed.I had a bit of difficulty setting up the hub but i think it was more Iphone user error that a fault of the product.  Easy to install.

It does NOT integrate with Alexa, but it is still a great product. Have a LiftMaster garage door opener with a YELLOW learn button. The out of the box instructions didn't work, so I called prod support. I was on the phone for less than 5 mins before I spoke to a very knowledgeable and friendly agent that showed me a hack to get the garage door working.

I really like the product, super easy to install and the in-app video's are really good.  My only issue, and it's a bit of a nit, is the battery died a week after I installed it.  That seems really strange and is disappointing.  How long did that device sit on a shelf that the battery would die that quickly? Hmm

Have a smart craftsman garage door on one side and an older craftsman on the other.  Add this to the older one in about 10-15 minutes.  Now don't need the old falling apart clickers, as this allows control with my cell phone.  The new MyQ app is quicker then the craftsman app they just cancelled, as well.  Love this addition.

I had a little concern reading the reviews re: installation and remote function. This thing rocks! It resolved my dilemma of worrying about getting locked out. I carefully followed the good instructions and awaited the glitches which never arrived. Not one. Works perfectly.

This control unit works great. It does require WI-FI and I have had very few issues with it. Occasionally the app and the unit has disconnected from each other, requiring a reset after returning home.  Overall it’s a good performing controller and a good way to add control of your garage door when you don’t have a smart garage door opener.

It's always nice when a product does exactly what you need it for.  This was easy to install and allowed us to extend our smart home to the garage doors.  It's so nice to be able to check on my phone if the garage doors are closed, or get an alert if they've been up too long.  The instructions were simple to follow, worked exactly as they stated and has been very reliable for several months since I installed it.

Super easy setup. The instructions are thorough enough and if you do them step by step without getting ahead of yourself it’s foolproof. Ensure your opener is compatible before you buy! Only thing I don’t like: the hub beeps when you close from the app. It’s a safety feature to ensure someone near the garage is aware of the garage door a few seconds before closing but it’s loud and annoying. Safety first!

The installation and setup was quick and painless.  It took me about 30 minutes to do everything and that was with about 10 minutes trying to find the screw that I dropped. I was going to do a DIY setup but I couldn’t get it to work. I then found out that I would have to take my control panel off the wall and solder wires on to the board. That was about a month ago and I just wasn’t thrilled about the soldering. I was looking at YouTube and found a video of this unit being installed and decided to do this instead.

Install was easy however, about 50% of the time the sensor doesn’t update so the app will say the door is open when it’s closed. Once the error appears you can’t open or close the garage via the app again until you do so manually, so 50% of the time when I get home I need to get out of the car to go inside and open the garage so I can pull in. Also, HomeKit support requires an over priced bridge (which wouldn’t be as big a deal If the sensor worked consistently, but since it doesn’t I’m not willing to shell out. )

Easy to install and works great with my phone! Have no issue with the product! But I have an issue with the company for charging extra to use Alexa! So cheap and greedy of them! So disappointed when I realized that i wasn’t able to use it with Alexa! I wouldn’t have bought it if I knew it wasn’t going to work with Alexa!

Using it will Google Assistant and on MyQ app.  I like the scheduling of closing.  I disliked the beeping to close so I followed a user's advice and screwed in a screw to the speaker.  Ended up breaking the speaker enclosure(black round thing on the board) but the speaker stayed intact.  I now can just barely hear it and it is much better.

Install was a breeze and took me about 45 minutes. Make sure and follow the quick start guide and it's easy. Also make sure you have good WiFi where you mount the control module.  Works like a champ and I love being able to set my own schedules and notifications. Total piece of mind that my kids or elderly mom left the garage door open.

Install is pretty straight forward. Note that you don't really need to install the ceiling, you could put it really anywhere in the garage as long as it connects well to the wifi/internet.  If you download the Key by Amazon app and link accounts for Key in-garage delivery at no extra cost if you're a Prime member - then your packages aren't sitting out on your doorstep to get stolen.

Works as described! Bought for my husband who always worries if he has closed the garage door. Now, we don't have to turn around every time to double check -- just open the app and save time. Notifications are good too. Notifies me when my kids get home. Controlling from my phone also allows me to open from anywhere.Most convenient when my oldest locks herself out and I'm not home! Overall, great product -- MUCH more affordable than similar smart garage openers.

Bought it. Went to install it and wouldn't. Connect. The company that made it didn't put the serial number into it's system. Had to call for them to correct it. After that it hooked right up. Been using it for over a month. Love being able to check my app and see if the garage is open or closed

This door opener arrived on time and packed well for the shipping.  It was easy to install, a little bit tricky to program but I'm not as technologically proficient as I'd like to be so that being said, it must be easy to install if I can do it.  The connectivity can be a bit slow so you need to plan ahead when using it to minimize waiting for it to connect and then sending the open/close command to it.  All-in-all, it's a great option as a universal remote for the garage door.

It takes minutes to download an app. And quickly integrated to my Chamberlain Opener with a single touch of the pairing button, through the app on my phone.Literally completely set up and operational within 3 minutes. The only real installation required is to mount the receiver with two screws, near an outlet, near the opener.

Chamberlian trying switching to the recurrent payments business model and it is not clumsy anymore. They're bending existing customers by forcing all 3rd parties integrations to be purchased via subscription and undoing all existing. I would advise against any of their products this attitude should get them off the market ASAP.

The unit was a snap to install.  The most time consuming part was drilling two small pilot holes to mount the bracket that the hub attaches to.  The rest of it was very easy.  Took about 15 minutes to have it up and running.  It works fine.  I’ve been able to remotely open the garage door and now have Amazon Key running which will be great for receiving deliveries from Amazon when I’m not home.  Haven’t tried to do the Alexa integration yet.

Not sure that this review is relevant because I was not able to get it to work with my garage door opener (it's Wayne Dalton Quantum 3212 model). I didn't need just 'monitoring', so I opted to go with Meross, which works perfectly. I am also able to bypass third party subscription fee besides getting full functionality.

Received my MyQ one hour ago and it’s already completely installed. Be link the device before you begin your installation. I watched a few YouTube videos first and it made installation a snap! It was 15 minutes tops! I love the ease of operation of the application. Getting it connected to Alexa is the hard part!

So far this is a great product but it omits an ear piercing signal so load and sharp when the garage door opens and closes that I want to rip my ears off. Trust I will be looking for a way to disable the sound but officially there's no way to turn it off. If it had an off sound button I give it a five. Actually I hate to sound so much I'm giving this a two.

Unit worked great for a few days..... Now it's not functioning because of a "closing error" that doesn't exist.  It is indicating a bad sensor, but I assure you that is not the case.  Have also re-paired with no luck. Now it want's me do work it manually because of too many attempts, which is a crock, also. I like the concept, and I really want to solve the problem, but customer support is just a myth with these folks.  Guess I'll keep it a few days in case another buyer has solved the same problem.  After that is is bye bye to this piece of junk.

I gave it two stars because it does work and it’s easy to install, but opening our garage is sooooo slow.  It takes less time to unlock the front door, walk through the house and open it from the inside.  Doesn’t work with homekit without an $80 add-on.  No thanks.

I no longer need to wonder whether I left the garage door open.  If I did, I can take close it.  This has worked very reliably.  Installation was quick and easy.  It has also had the unexpected secondary benefit of being a sort of burglar alarm - Once the door opened when I did not expect anyone to be home.  I got an alert on my phone.  Turns out it was just my wife, but it's nice to know when the door is opened unexpectedly.

It works, is easy to setup and install. When you close the door via app it's a little annoying that it beeps for like 15 seconds before finally closing. Still shocked it doesn't have a feature allowing you to autoclose the garage if left open for X seconds/minutes. Seems like they could add that feature to the app pretty easily so I sure hope they do, then I'd give it 4-5 stars.

This product is incredible.  Who knew you could run your garage door from your cell phone and it send alerts when opened.  Love this thing.  I have an older Chamberlain garage door opener and it works great.  Would and will buy another when I install the other garage door opener.would recommend to anyone purchasing a door opener or a replacement door opener.

It works fine - but the instructions are a little tedious.  You need a decent WiFi signal - my router is in the room next to the garage and that is sufficient.  It provides great peace of mind when away from the house allowing me to verify the garage door is closed.  Once installed, it just works.

The biggest ripoff. They want to force you to pay monthly fee for Alexa and Google Home Voice control support. No way! Installation was kinda okay. Important! It was not the color of the button. It was the color of the antenna. App starting super slow. Pretty annoying if u just want to close quick. With Amazon Key App u cannot close your garage directly. Amazon Key openes MyQ App and like I said, super slow...

Super easy to install,  it took me less than 15 minutes including downloading the app and installing the parts. The app walked me through the pairing process and was included in the 15 minutes. I cant stress how easy the installation was. It works exactly as described.  I have mine set up to receive a push message everytime the garage door opens or closes. I also set it up to automatically close in the evening in case I forget to close it. I also like how the app opens right to the door status and opening or closing the door is only one click away. I don't have any complaints  and can't think of anything more I wish it did. No more wondering if I  left the garage door open.

Excellent addition to our garage operator. Installs in minutes even with an opener with “rolling codes “. Instructions are very well written. It is important to make sure you have a good strong WiFi signal in the garage. A nice safety feature is a bright strobe light that flashes for a few seconds before closing the door.

I was looking for a way to open and close my garage door with my phone. I park my car outside and don't want to keep a remote in the car.This was easy to install but the "Quick Start" instructions are a joke, giving no installation instructions at all. However, the app has very good step by step instructions that walk you through the whole process. I did need customer service help at one point and they were very helpful.

I bought this unit because of the reviews.  Don't waste your time and money and get something else.This is GARBAGE!!!  I will be standing right outside my garage door and I still can't open it.  The stupid app either gets stuck or something else is going on because it defeats the entire purpose of having this because I can't even open it right outside my garage.  Ridiculous!!!!

I was really looking forward to this smart upgrade.  When installed found out I can’t open and close door remotely.  It shows if the door is open or closed and the duration.  My garage door opener is 2 years old so puzzled why it doesn’t work??  Find this to be an expensive novelty with very little practical value.

I purchased the garage door opened and wifi expander for my garage, so that I can have peace of mind knowing that I closed the garage when I left or getting an alert when the garage door is opened or left opened.The setup and install of the expander was very easy and straight forward and so was the garage door opener.

This is just what I wanted. Easy install, connects to IFTTT easily, and notifies opened, closed, open for length of time, quickly. At this time IFTTT is free, so I’m not familiar with a fee as others have commented on. I followed the advice of others and established the WiFi connection before I installed it. It has a beeping sound when I close it by app or IFTTT, and no way to disable it, which is a drawback.

It’s super easy to add another sensor to your MyQ app. It takes like 3 min to setup. My only gripe is it’s a little pricey to add a sensor compared to the price of the main device ($36 for main device and sensor vs $27 for separate sensor only) but not a huge deal.

I tried the Menross opener and was disappointed with interference it caused. but the MyQ was easy to set up, no long wired and no interference with  my opener that came with my garage door opener or with the opener in my car rear view mirror. Seeing that it used to sell for $100 it's a real bargain at $25 or even better when it was $19.99

easy to install and program. I just DO NOT get it, why I need a separate devise to make it work with "home kit" ....? don't make sense to me but I should have done more research. I didn't know this kit DOES NOT come with bridge and will not work with "home kit" , however still can operate with the app. easy to install and app works as expected.

Such a great addition to the house that extended family have bought the same system for their house. Used to to let people in the garage for a pickup and monitor when the kids have opened or closed the door. Battery life in the sensor is OK, not great. The one that the system came with lasted about 4 months. We'll see how long the Energizer Lithium lasts.

I thought it was very easy to install. You don't need a subscription like some of the reviews I saw on here. I have Google Home and regular wifi at the house. It doesn't allow you to schedule to open the door due to security reasons. But, you can hit the button to open and close. I have it scheduled to close on it's own just incase I forget to close it when I leave in the morning. I am over a block away while driving home and I hit it to open. Always works, haven't had any complaints. I bought a  Google Wifi enhancer for the house, which works wonders. Not just for the garage but, for the whole house. It was just an added perk! I installed by myself and I am a small woman not too handy

Love this product!  Extremely easy to install with step by step video instructions.  I have a Lift Master garage door open and it works flawlessly. We had previously purchased a competing product which does not work well and was complicated, so this was a nice contrast.Looking forward to trying amazon's garage delivery!

MyQ Smart Garage Opener is great! I often leave our home and try to decide whether I close the garage or not. This saves the day each time! I am not used to all the other abilities with it, but I hope to learn more about it and use it to its fullest potential.On installation, my brother-in-law gave me the best tip ever. Allow time for you to set it up all in one session. Don’t start, go have dinner, and then try install.  It works just much easier with one segment of time. I had to move a couple of things in my garage to make it happen so all in all it took about an hour.

The installation is easy and using it is super convenient. I got it as a present for my dad who enjoys tech and a smart home.  It was easy for all of his kids to be able to get in and out of the house when we visit. Just do not use this as the only way to get in and out of somewhere. The app often crashes or just never loads making it hard to use for every day situations. The other small issue I have with it is that when you press it to open or close there is a lag and does not say if you are opening/closing the door. Often at night he checks to see if the door is left open and if it is he often hits the button but due to the lag and lack of being able to see the if it is responding he often hits the button several times making the door open/close several times. Overall the system it great but it is the app that needs work.

I find their subscription approach to be nothing more than a greedy approach to business. What further development could they develop that is worth fleecing their customers for?  Since they do not appear willing to reconsider their approach of subscription based access; it will cost them customers.

It is a good device.  Owner can know the real status of garage door and history open/close period.Actually It doesn’t need any tool to install.  It is OK to put the device on the top of garage controller.  Most new model garages do not need the door sensor.  So the prince could be lower if the sensor is not included in the package.  The manufacturer should give customers two options - with / without door sensor.

This is decently easy to install, and the app is extremely easy to use. I absolutely love being able to use my phone to open my garage door from wherever I am. If I am at work I can still let someone in the house through the garage with a click of a button. This is also great because you can invite anyone to have access to your garage for free and you don't have to give them a remote for their car - they just use an app on their phone.

Unit was easy to install and has been reliable in use.  NOTE: Using the mobile app to close the garage door -- Unit makes a loud beeping noise when the door is closing -- This is a Federal req't since person closing the door is not there.  Don't be surprised.  Closing the door using your remote or any other closer behaves nornal (no loud alert).  It's great to get alerts when the door is opened.

Only has open and close so any additional functions that my remote controlled such as lights on doesn’t work. Following the instructions didn’t work. No manual setup so where you can see what isn’t pairing correctly. There’s a point at which it asks what color your pair button is. Mine is red. It didn’t work so I tried the others and once I tried purple that worked.

this will not link up to WIFI, but I have added wifi extenders at a few dollars more for  little action. I continue to try to hook up but to no avail. I've gotton up to a point I have to do other things, so it sits.

Very easy to install, and works as described, but there is a bit of ambiguity at hand when it comes to some features. Customer service has been less than helpful, but we have eventually figured it all out and this product serves our needs.Had we realized it would loudly beep every time it was remotely opened or closed, we wouldn’t have purchased this product.

Nice unit. Pretty easy to set up. Looks like it's only a bit more complicated with iOS as opposed to Android, but no problem. I messed up briefly when moving the hub to a different spot on the ceiling.  I unintentionally pressed buttons when grasping it to remove it from the bracket, but a quick call to excellent tech support had me back in business in no time.  We love the convenience & reassurance this unit offers.

After one day use, the MyQ garage product works very well.  I bought it because we have an older car without the Homelink buttons and this allows us to have access to the garage door without having to have one of those clunky visor mounted remotes.  We installed it quickly with minimum problems after watching the YouTube video instructions.  I must say that the quick start guide supplied with the product was a little short of explanations, as noted by several reviewers, but the video made the install pretty intuitive.  We're twenty four hours into our use and everything is working fine.

Super upset that after the complete installation, downloading app, etc we got stuck in their instructions on integrating with Nest. Lo and behold there is a small note on a random website that says oh...wait no it doesn't work with Nest anymore. Bullsh&*!!! They should give me my money back.
Very frustrated.  There are problems with the MyQ Home skill.  It says that "the skill is not currently available"There's a bunch of complaints about this in the app reviews.

It took several attempts to pair The My Q Hub with our Genie opener. It’s an older model opener, so that is most likely the reason it was difficult to pair up. Your experience will likely be better if you have a newer opener. This hub makes my third car garage opener function just like my newer opener with My Q built in. I hope they make a My Q skill for Alexa someday.
Does NOT work with Alexa.  Going to return the 2 I bought.  After researching it used to work with Alexa but they removed it cause Chamberlain wanted to charge an annual fee for no reason.
I wanted an "anywhere on earth" opener that could close my door automatically at midnight if I forget to, without any hidden or recurring fees. This does exactly that.Fully programed in 15 minutes.

Product has good directions and is easy to install. Once installed download the app and connect your product to receive alerts. I receive the alerts on my cell phone in real time once the door is open or closed. Have also use the app to open and close the door on a few occasions and it works well. Great product at a great price.

I owned one of the wifi chamberlain garage before and has been working great except for from times to times that app doesnt respond and it kept asking you to close it manually when you miles away from the button, which is really anoying that your have to ask someone to close the garage. So far this opener has been working great no problem. I have it installed for months and it still up and working. Good investment
Will definitely transform silently operating door into a noisy one.Makes an annoying beeping sound when closing which Chamberlain calls a “feature”.

This product is a must for any home, works great from anywhere in the world, If you have Wi-Fi then you have access to  open and closed the garage door,  I have opened my door United Kingdom for my UPS guy, Its works very well confirming door Open and Closed and if you add a wireless camera in your garage your have total security for your parcels and packages ! , I don't know how I managed to do without it !!!!

From anywhere in the world, I can allow entry to anybody that needs to be in my garage without sacrificing the security of my house.  Before having this, I had to remote unlock the door, remotely deactivate the security system while some stranger was gallivanting through my house to open the garage door.  Now when the guy comes to cut my grass, I just open the garage remotely, and close it when he leaves.  Perfect.

Unfortunately, this unit gives me a notice that the garage door has been left open.  If I am not home, there is no way for me to check.  Fortunately, when this message comes up I have been home to check, and it was closed.  If no one would have been home, I would have had the system close my door.  However, this would have actually opened the door.  I spoke with the rep and he said it needed a new battery (only being 2 weeks old).  I should have returned it at that point. As now I am a week too late to return it.

I have a MyQ hub and sensor.  Initially the system worked as advertised, but after a few days of use, the device was no longer recognized from the app. I had to re-do the setup to get it working again.  The device would repeatedly work and then the programming would disappear requiring setup to get it working.  After some trouble shooting and replacement of the sensor battery, I determined that the sensor was dead, so I bought a replacement sensor.  Finally everything worked again..... and then it didn’t.  Same old issue.  I’m done with this frustrating, unreliable device and am researching to identify a higher quality option from another manufacturer.

I like it, transform my old garage opener to be the smart one. Had some trouble to install, I almost wanted to return it but I gave it another try. I pushed different colour learning button on the garage opener, the opener light turned on and the garage opened, I was so surprised. Try push a different button, it might work for you too. :)

I am really happy with my new garage door opener. I love how I am able to open/close my garage from anywhere and the price was great! It was also very easy and quick to install. I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a remote garage door opener.

It learns your garage door code which means outside of plugging it in its wireless. It also means this has wide compatibility beyond Chamberlain brand. I have a garage door model that wouldn't accept a different zwave garage door opener. This does the trick even though it's yet another smart home app on my phone.

Less than a month after delivery, the battery in the door sensor was dead. I'm hoping the battery lasts more than a month. Batteries are $4 each. Otherwise it was easy to install (I'm an electrician) and sync with my wifi. It gives an indication when the door opens and through the app you can check the door status (open or closed.)

Tried a different wired smart controller for our garage door, and ended up going a different direction with this product. What a smart move on my part. No wiring issues. Easy app integration. Great safety with the closing function light and sound. Haven't tried the Key with Amazon yet, but might try that later.

Bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband. We installed it and found it to be great! Installation is super easy and quick, just make sure to listen to the instructions. We had it installed in less than 10 minutes. Awesome phone and app integration for easy use. We love the notifications and that we can share with friends or someone if they were house sitting etc. Amazon Key is not available in our neighborhood yet, but when it is, this will prove to be an awesome item to have for them to use when delivering. The only annoying thing is the alarm that goes off when the garage door is going to close, but I understand why and it does not really bother me - it is only a couple of seconds long!

For a long time now I've been trying to come up with a safe and convenient way to handle deliveries.  Finally, Amazon came up with a way that really works for me.  Amazon can and does now leave deliveries inside my garage.  Great!!

I have a chamberlain liftmaster professional garage door opener and this "my q" could not sync to it. Tech support confirmed my garage door opener was compatible. I was able to sync the door sensor, but never the garage door opener.

I am not a handy.I had someone put this in and it really did work correctly so I called customer support and got it working perfectly.I love that when I am not home I can tell when my son leaves the house and that the door gets closed.We had a incident where my son left the door open all day.I personally have not had any problems  and I even got one for my sister and her business store.My son loves to open the door and close it from phone.

Very easy to install as well as getting it functioning. Not many products are compatible with other manufacturers but this one does work as described. Read the critical review and I had no problems with anything the reviewer described but have the same products and I did not replace anything. For what it is designed for and the cost I would highly recommend this product.

We love this so much we bought a second sensor for the other garage door.  My Wife and I are always on the run and always forget to make sure the garage door is down.  This gives us the reassurance that we have documented verification on our phones that the doors are open or closed.  We love it, I may get my parents one.  Love the fact that if we did forget to close the door we can remotely close it with our phones.

The instructions are so limited and the website is not much better.  If you have a chamberlain with orange learn button and it will not pair with the garage door opener, try using the purple icon in the app.  i could not get it to pair.  I found this suggestion on line and it worked for me.  I have not had the  unit very long so I cannot say if it works well.  time will tell.

Love this product!! We have only had it for a short time but it has come in very handy several times already. We drove up to pigeon forge and even though it is only a hour drive we decided to stay up there but since we where not planning on staying we didn’t leave a key out for the neighbor to let the dogs out but all I had to do we send her a link to have access for a predetermined amount of time and she could open and close garage door to let them out. We have had friends bring things over and we where not home but I could open and close the garage door for them to drop or pick stuff up. It’s crazy how many times it has come in handy. Not sure how we managed without it in the past.

This is a must have for your garage. I always forget if I closed the garage door, and now I can just open the app on my phone and check. You can also set alerts that will be sent to your phone if the garage door has been open for too long (you set the time limit). Some people talked about being charged a yearly fee -- but no fees associated. Easy to set up and connect to home wifi.

The MyQ worked well for my garage.  I have a Wayne Dalton opener that doesn't have a corded button or any way to hard wire a z-wave opener.  This was the only reasonable solution I could find.Setup was fairly easy.  The open/close functionality has been flawless so far, and notifications are nearly instant.  I have not tried IFTTT or any other integration with it yet, but will do so soon and update this review.

Product installed very easy. Seemed like it would be great because I’m always forgetting to close my garage door. I would continuously get an alert that my door was open so I would use my iPhone 11 to close it but got a error message stating that MyQ was off line. I would would contact my neighbor and was told that my door was closed. 30 minutes later it would repeat the whole process. Tech support wasn’t very helpful by telling me that it was a simple glitch. They said delete and reinstall the app. Absolutely made no difference.

I purchased this not knowing it would integrate with my alarm.com system! I was able to contact Frontpoint and get this system set up pretty easily and integrate it seamlessly into my system. I did have a small problem with the door not closing, but a 5 minute phone call to chamberlain fixed this!!

set up process was a joke.  If it doesn't connect to your wifi automatically then it doesn't make it clear that you have to manually connect to a website.  Then the sensor is to far away from the other sensor it doesn't work.  Even though it was not that far from it.  Too many issues i had get this set up.  Enough of a pain for me to give it only 2 stars.  So far no issues with it, but set up process was not good experience.

Despite my many desperate attempts to connect the MyQ Garage Door Opener the device refuses to cooperate. I've even reset my router to factory settings (which was a pain because I had to reconnect all my other devises to the WiFi network) and MyQ still will not connect. I've reached out to the Chamberlain support page and still have yet to get an answer. I don't easily give out 1 star reviews but this one was well earned.

My goal when replacing my awful Genie / Overhead opener was to get one that was quiet. The Chamberlain with belt drive did not disappoint! The motor and drive are all quiet. I also purchased the optional MyQ hub which I also love. This was an easy install with two people. I hope it lasts for many years, unlike what I had....

I have a craftsman garage door opener with built in WiFi.  A few months ago I got a new router and since then, unable to connect to my app.  After dealing with support I decided to buy this opener.  Installation was easy. Quick step by step instructions and not real issues setting up made it  worth the price.  The flexibility to transfer this device to other openers is a great feature.

Installed easily. Worked well initially. Not I have app crashes and door sensor problems. If the door sensor fails the app won't open the door. Carry a back up entry just in case or you could be screwed. You can't reset the system outside the garage, or house..

MyQ did not work with my system. I suggest adding a hardwire setup so it could easily be used with old garage doors openers that don't have a remote that works with MyQ. I even tried to purchase the Liftmaster 850LM for $45 to add the ability to have remotes control my garage door. The Liftmaster worked on the door however the MyQ would not pair with the Liftmaster. I returned the product.

Extremely easy to control and a great addition to smart and you're home. At first I wasn't sure what functionality or benefit it would provide. But it already came handy a few times when we needed to open the garage door for someone to pick up something and knowing when your loved ones come in and out of the home.
If you have trouble remembering to shut the garage door this is for you.Installation is simple and straightforward. It took me about 10-15 minutes once I set up my ladder.

The MyQ works great and we have been enjoying the Amazon Key delivery service.  My kids use the garage doors to enter the house after school so it's nice to get notifications they're home from the MyQ app.  I did have trouble getting the MyQ to connect to a new router, what I had to do was dedicate a network range extender to the 2.4Ghz range and connect the MyQ server to it.
Easy to install and for the price this works great when family needs tool in my garage. Not sure why they won’t buy there own but that’s here not there.It works great and can close right after.

I absolutely love this product ! Works just as advertised. It was a little trickier to configure. I ended up calling customer service to help, and they were wonderful. We even got disconnected, and they called me right back! The hardware was super simple to install, and it works like a champ. I let my teenager in the house all the time while at work because they never have their key

My wife and I have seen Wifi options on new garage door openers and never thought of doing this till we saw this product. It was easy to install and now we never worry about a door being left open since we will get a notice on our phones if one is. It is a great product!

Purchased this on a friends recommendation. Numerous times after leaving my house I questioned myself on whether I had closed the garage door an would turn back to check, only to find in most cases I had closed it. Now I can just look at my phone to check and with a click can close it.  I have checked it’s operation away from the house using my security cameras to make sure it works. Works as advertised would recommend this.

I was good with this for a few months and now it it is confused if the door is open or not, to a point to where it will try to close the door when it is already closed, and it actually opens it and then errors out saying it couldn’t close it and becomes unresponsive (and now my garage door is open!). Too big of a security concern.  Yes, tried resetting and new battery.

Complete garbage! Tried for hours to pair to the motor (Chamberlain Whisper drive 10/2014) with no success. Customer service was a joke... well jokes on you cause it's going back. I will never buy another Chamberlain/Liftmaster/Craftsman garage opener again.

This would have gotten 5 stars all around had I added this for the 2nd door at the same time as doing the first door. I had to remove all of them to install at the same time as a 2nd door option to get it to work only on one door. When I added it later, it would open the double door and the 2nd door at the same time.

The device worked well with my Samsung S6 but could never get it connected to my S9 for some reason. Only works with smartphone through the myQ app. This means no Amazon Alexa or Google Home support. I guess you can call it "smart" but nowadays most people want to use assistants, i.e., Amazon Alexa or Google Home. For example: a) "Alexa, open the garage door," or b) "Hey Google, close the garage door." You will NOT be able to do that with this MyQ Smart Hub. I waited too long to send mine back. Not really heavy enough to be a paperweight. :)

I was told by the Chamberlain technician that I could use this with my existing hub to control a second door which  was about 40 feet from the hub because the range was 350-400 feet.  As it turned out the range was only 35 feet so the ub=nit would not work.  I exchanged it for a hub/sensor package which was an additional $8.00 and returned this sensor.  I was shocked to see that they charge me over $7.00 return shipping.  I don't think this charge should apply because I was following the manufactures instructions and I did purchase an upgraded product.

Works with Amazon Key. Easy to install nd operate. Integrated with Google home. I like it as it helps me know if someone is in or out of the garage. Safety for all IOT devices is to setup guest network and put all IOT on that , not your primary wireless in your home router

We purchased this key because we have had problems with packages "disappearing".  It installed easily and linked to my Amazon account.  However, my husband, who, surprise surprise,  lives at the same address, cannot link his Amazon account to the same opener.  Also, Amazon states that you cannot link more than one key to the same address.  They suggested I order everything for him on my account....

Some said it was hard to set up, it’s not! Apparently some people try to make things a lot harder than they are. As long as you go by the instructions, it takes less than a half an hour. Work beautifully the first time. It has every day since. It’s a perfect set up, and you’ll never leave your garage door open again.It’s a steal too.

Item is not smart in any way. No Alexa or Siri integration, just a useless button in an app on your phone. The garage door opener clipped to my car sun visor is more convenient than that. Don’t waste your time if you are looking for a smart garage door opener because this isn’t it. Also has a sketchy required subscription. An all around bad product.

Spent about two hours with a very friendly and helpful Chamberlain customer support agent.  Working with my Samsung, it turns out that the device doesn't like Android.
