We then tried my laptop, and that didn't work either.  We switched over to my wife's iPhone and after five or six attempts, we got the hub to connect to the network.  The sensor paired after two tries.  But after that, nothing worked.  Couldn't complete the install.  Outside the return window since I bought it and didn't try to install it right away.  Stay away.

This thing works ok with the app but I can’t get it to work with Alexa.  I believe I would have been better using an aftermarket brand of app-based remote. Can’t get it Tom work with IFTTT either. AllMy other household automation works fine and integrates with Alexa and IFTTT as they should.

I have a gate, not a garage door so it works a little bit differently than the instructions show.  BUT, the people at the 800 number were more than helpful and walked me right through it and it was installed in minutes. Here it is  months later and it still working perfectly. If a workman is coming by I can let him in or if I don't want to bring my keys for a walk I don't have to. Love it!

Great product at a great price.  I bought it so I could have Amazon deliver my packages directly to my garage.  Unfortunately, that Amazon service hasn't reach our neck of the woods yet so that part is a bust.  However, it's a great tool for my children to use when they get home from school each day.  The installation took about 20 minutes, and the only reason it took that long was because I needed to call Chamberlain to help determine the button color of my current garage door (it's faded a bit over the years).  They answered the phone promptly and had my up and running in less than 5 minutes.

We researched to make sure that our garage door opener was compatible with this device, which it was, but it was very finicky for us and it would only a couple of times and then beep the test.  We are highly tech savvy people but just couldn’t figure it out.  So we ended up returning it.  I am sure it’s a great device and I don’t want this review to deter anyone.

This device installed easy enough but it's not reliable.  Serveral times in the week I've had it, it doesn't report actions of the garage door, or reports them an hour or two later.  I bought it so I could see if I remembered to shut the door after I drive off, but I can't trust it, so it's useless to me.

I had a problem with my network, so a few components had to be changed. I reconfigured the network setting, but could not get the MyQ hub to work again, and I tried everything with all the information I could find. Will not recommend this unit or ever install it again.  About $80 in the garbage. Don't waste your money on this junk, it has no durability.
Not the best if the product on the market.It does not work with Samsung Hub or Alexa.

I don’t have Alexa so I couldn’t review this area. However, I like the fact I can open and close the door with my IPhone. it works from far away.I was able to open my door from Virginia and I live in New York. If you’re like me, can’t remember if you shut your garage door, you can do it from your phone or Alexa

With three drivers (including one teen) rotating through using the detached and alley access garage, there were a lot of texts of “did I shut the garage?”  This was a cheap and easy to install piece of mind.  I set an alert for any time the door is open longer than 3 minutes, and I can now close it remotely.  Works great.  I took off one star because it won’t integrate with my SmartThings hub.

This My Q smart garage door opener was a great purchase. The price I paid was great and it was very easy to install. I have left my home in past and was not sure I had closed my garage door.  I had to return home or call neighbor. Now I can check phone and close with phone no matter where I am. Great product and I would defiantly recommend.

I have a Liftmaster with MyQ but no wi-fi. I installed the hub quite easily, connected to the door sensor for my main door. Then I decided to try with the second door and to my surprise, I could sync it with the hub without the sensor and it knows when the door is open or closed. I then reset the connection to the main door and re-did it, it synced well without the sensor. Now the hub doesn't go all crazy when I close the door, the motor will blink and beep (but more discretely).I removed nd put the sensor away so I don't have to worry about replacing the battery. I wish I didn't have to pay for it, since I wont use it.

This device works only with the following frequencies: 310, 315, 372.5, and 390 MHZ. So if you are residing outside the US, there is high chance your garage opener doesn’t operate on these frequencies.The compatible frequencies should be in the item description instead of just saying works with almost all major brands!

I ordered two of the products. One of the sensors works just great. The one issues 2nd synce took for attempts to install. After it was finally installed close the app out open it it went to monitor mode on it. That means it won't open your garage. So I reinstalled again and now I have Sensor error. All this has happened on one that sensors within 12 hours. I called company yesterday with tech support and they finally concluded that I have a bad sensor. Now I have to wait 5 to 7 business days to receive it. I will post an update how well the new sensor works.As for the one that does work, it opens and closes just fine.
I have mixed feelings about this little device.MyQ app shows the status properly however it doesn't always open or close it. The time goes on and nothing happens.

It was easy to install, set up with the app and operate. Now I receive alarms when door opens/closes and I don’t have to worry about carrying the individual remote while going out for a walk or with a loaner car.It also helped when my wife was stuck at the door without garage remote.

I bought this product hoping it would stop me from worrying about the detached garage door being left open. I’m very pleased with my purchase The Chamberlain myQ integrates with my Vivint security system providing me the comfort that my garage is secure I would recommend this product

This works well once I figured out some of its quirks.  For one - if it only opens your garage door but won't close it then you probably have the unit too close to your motor.  The proximity to the motor can make a difference.  Also, after programming your unit following the instructions you may find out that your existing garage door openers may need to be re-programmed.  Once I figured all of this out this unit works like a charm as does the app.

The instructions are all located in the downloaded app.  They are very clear and easy to follow.  I am able to complete the entire installation in less than 10 min.  I thought pairing the learning remote is difficult (like with my car's homelink) but this one is very easy.  It's been working well since then.  Now I can monitor the garage door status inside or outside of home, especially my garage door has the tendency to bounce open during the closing operation.

I am very happy with MyQ.  I am one of those people who drives away from home and wonders, "Did I close the garage door"?  Well with MyQ installed I no longer have that problem.  I always know when the door opens or closes because the app notifies me.  And the app allows me to open or close the garage door from anywhere.  The installation was very easy.  Just download the app onto your phone and it walks you thru the set up.  I like it so much I bought 3 more as gifts. I highly recommend this product for your garage.

If u simply need a way to control your garage door by phone, look no further.I’ve had a tendency of leaving the door up at night and the app allows you to set a schedule to close it at a specific time which solves my biggest issue.

I hang out at the bar a lot,  so when Amazon delivers a package i don't have to run home to put it away. Know i can jut just sit back and relax with my old retired friends. Update, garage door failed to close after driver delivered package one day, so he called me and luckily my wife was home and was able to shut it.

I've wanted to get this for a while.  I got it on Black Friday, and I'm sad that I waited so long.  I have a habit of leaving my garage door open overnight, now it automatically closes when I programmed it to.  It also alerts me every time it open.  I have been impressed with the lack of lag when using the app to open and close my garage door.  The only thing that makes me sad is that it was even cheaper on Cyber Monday :(But all and all, I am completely happy with this purchase!

This is pretty much perfect. I installed to my 0.5 HP Craftsman door opener circa 2014. Of course Craftsman openers are made by Chamberlain so the connection was easy. I've good WiFi in my garage so linking was easy. App could be a little more user-friendly but it's functional. Anyway, installed in 30 minutes total. Great control and great comfort knowing the status of my door and getting a text when it opens. Couldn't be much happier.

It was easy to install.  Our only hiccup was some step in the process erased the programming in our cars.  Fortunately my husband was able to restore quickly.  We have a homelink bridge, so maybe that created a bit of inconvenience.  The garage hub works like a charm now.  It is great to know the door is closed,  and be able to open it for guests and family.

The unit was very easy to install and worked as advertised. The only thing I don't like about the product is that it beeps when closing. I searched their website but couldn't find a way to turn off the beep. I'm sure it's a just a warning sound, but we live in a quiet community with attached homes and I don't want to disturb my neighbors.

This thing is a brilliant idea.  I have been laying in bed multiple time and my wife ask me if the garage door is closed?  I can't remember so I stumble downstairs and check.  This helps, but there are two issues.  The app does a great job of walking you through how to set it up.  The first issue is that MyQ took 8 tries to connect to my garage door.  Each try takes about 5 minutes.  It gets tiresome very quickly, especially when it is winter in Minnesota and you are sitting in your cold garage for 40 minutes.  The next issue to connect to your google home is $10 a year.  A pain but I found it worth it.  The issue is that it is not even fully compatible with Google home.  So they are one of the few if only companies charging money to work with Google home but to not even be fully compatible.  This is when it becomes a rip-off.Such a good idea, just too focused on $ and not on making it work right.

The product is easy to install with clear instructions. We only had one outlet in the garage so placement was challenging.  All said and done great device esp since kids come and go ... can come in through garage instead of the front entrance.

I had previously been using the MyQ app with my new Chamberlain garage door opener.  After I had changed my wi-fi modem/router, I was unable to access the wi-fi function for controlling the opener.  I ordered this unit, hoping it would be able to capture the wi-fi signal.  Installation was very easy with the online video, and I was quickly able to access the signal and enjoy all the benefits of the MyQ app.

Super easy to install and works with the app very well. I use Google home and I believe you have to pay a subscription to use it but either way I use the remote on phone to open and close. The sensor battery ram low two months into using it so you have to replace it. Other than that it works as promised.

I have one on both of my garage doors and bought one for a relative for his house.  I decided not to hang mine, I just have the base unit on a shelf, so it literally took me about 5-10 minutes to setup.  You have to download the app and it walks you through everything.  Love it!

It was very smooth to install 'MyQ' app and connect to the hub. Pairing tilt sensor works also fine. However, I tried 'multimultimultple' times but failed to pair with my old Liftmaster LM60K-CN which I got in 2005. Chamberlian US online services gave me an email address said it's their representative supports China, however never get a reply. Have to return this cool product, pity. Now I am working on DIY a smart solution with a relay to replace the open button. There is an Aqara product works with Homekit and Mijia directly.

I’m a 69 year old gramma and I just followed the instructions, watched a few videos on YouTube and I installed this device. Now when I’m away and my kids need to get in the garage they can call or text me and I can let them in! Easy peasy.
It does not synch with Google Home!It does not synch with Google Home!

Initially I was having issues with the controller getting confused as to whether the door was opened or closed. After moving the controller as far away from the garage door opener (and away from its LED light as well as closer to the wifi), it has been working great. The one thing that really SUCKS is that you can only associate one amazon account to the unit. So either you’re going to have to consolidate to just using one account or you’re SOL.

Paired once with the door opener, then spent the next hour telling me it was always open even when it was closed, then that I had an error... so please open manually.... after an hour trying to getting it to re-pair and it failing every time I'm sending it back.tech support works bankers hours, and since I'm actually working during those hours I won't be spending more time on this product.

I’m sure this works well with other openers. With my 1 year old Genie opener, we could only use this to monitor if the door was open or closed with the app. It was not compatible with my opener to open or close remotely via the app which is the reason I bought this. The description should be updated from it working with Genie openers after 1986 to not all features are compatible with Genie openers.

Was skeptical of how well this would work but installed in 10 minutes or less.  App was easy to set up and guided me through the process seamlessly.  This little device has been awesome and beat my expectations.  I have used it several times in the first two weeks and it is super handy.  Highly recommend this to update an old garage door opener to new connected home of today.

10 minutes out of box it was installed.  Worked for the first two openings/closings, then nothing but errors when trying to close.  To reset it, you have to use button at home to close it.  Kind of defeats the purpose when I bought this to close the door when I leave home and accidentally forget to close it.  I should have heeded the lower ratings this device had

The beeper that sounds at about 75dB when the door is closing IS SO ANNOYING AND WILL WAKE ME AND MY NEIGHBORS AND YOU CAN'T TURN IT OFF.  Chamberlain has lost their minds in excessively covering their you know whats for liability.  Will find a way to silence the beeper it or I will return it.

The installation was very easy and the app controlled the door remotely most of the time, although annoyingly needed manual overrides from time to time. Unfortunately, after updating my home WiFi router to a new Linksys and after may hours of working with Chamberlain and Linksys support, the WPA2 security settings were deemed incompatible. The MyQ was the only device out of 15 smart homes devices that had a problem with the new router. Only solution from Chamberlain was to turn off router’s WPA2 WiFi security, so not viable. MyQ smart hub... Not so smart!! I have to find a different product for my WiFi network.

Overall, it is a nice product....when it works.  I seem to have too many sensor issues, where i am required to raise or low the door to get it to sync again with the app.  Very annoying.  I don’t know if my sensor is bad, or if this is just how it is.  I am working on getting a new sensor.  The app is very nice.

I absolutely love this product. I was worried the setup would be confusing or time consuming but it was SO EASY. The setup instructions are done through the app and were so intuitive and easy to follow along. I've never had instructions be so clear as these ones. We also love the app because when we're traveling we can check in on our garage door and make sure it hasn't been opened. We can also add friends to it too so they're able to access our house if needed. Such a great product for such an incredible price!

Super easy to install. Videos included with the app are very helpful. The only reason I’m not giving 5 stars is the unit occasionally loses connectivity to my network even though my router is in the garage. This could be my network and not the device. A very cool solution and works from anywhere!
It took 15 minutes to set up with my Craftsman lift while following the instructions in the MyQ phone application.  It covers nearly all modern US garage door brands and works very well.

Had the whole thing mounted and running in less than 10 mins. Running off a Google Wifi system with zero issues. I do dislike the fact you need to pay for google assistant and can't open the door with voice commands. Other than that the system works great and the app works well. I would recommend to anyone who has a decent wifi signal to purchase this kit.

App doesnt work well and I've had to re-sync garage door to device 3 times in 3 weeks. It's useful when working but so far it's been a pain in the butt. I installed wifi extender to see it device needed better connection but still having problems. Also.. many times it tells me garage door is down but it's not.
Easy install.Only closes or opens the door part of the time. I have to wait a while before trying to open or close it in succession in order for it to work

I bought 2 as I have 2 garage doors. Turns out 1 hub unit supports 2 (or more?) door sensors so I have a spare hub if I ever need it. I use it in monitor only mode to alert my phone if I leave a door open for more than (user adjustable) 20 minutes. I also connected it via  ifttt.com to smart wifi light bulb in house to light while either door is open.Each sensor lost contact with hub ONCE in first week at different times. Pressed button on sensor to reestablish. No more problems after that.

Saw this deal on amazon. For me first thing is the easy to install part, since I am not very good when it comes to Handman work. Video showed only few steps. With the discounted price , it was a steal. I was little stuck in installation, since I did not followed the entire steps. The door remote HAS TO BE FIXED ON Garage DOOR, before you do the pairing. That was the part, I messed up. I thought, its just a matter of keeping in the range of Hib and it should work but NO, it's the movement of the remote on garage door which it looks for while pairing.But otherwise, it went thru pretty quick. Started using it and now I don't have to go back always rechecking, if the door is open or closed. The app is also very intuitive. I recommended to five of my friends who bought it the very next day.Great product !

If you’re like me, a little older and not so tech savvy, this is for you and the skilled. This is my first leap into automation of my home. I was pleasantly impressed by the simple instructions and installation. They recommend tools but I didn’t need any. I didn’t install the Hub I set it on top of my garage motor casing. I like products who follow the K.I.S.S method (Keep It Simple St**id)

I was hesitant to buy one of these, thinking that I would prefer a unit that's more integrated with the opener itself, but it was very quick to set up and I longer worry that I have left the garage door open after leaving the house.I haven't had any issues with it at all.  I have the unit installed right next to the garage door opener on the ceiling and use it with Google Wifi.

Have two doors so needed an extra door sensor.I was a little nervous that my 5 cars would make adding another remote problematic due to some limit, but my openers are both Liftmasters about 10 years old and It worked fine.

Purchased this product to improve security with my Amazon purchases.  I've had a couple in garage deliveries and everything seems to be working well.  It also works great for my morning walks around my community.  I don't have to bring keys anymore, just my phone.

I love the ability to control the door from my phone, but there desperately needs to be a way to adjust the alarms for door closing.  Living in a condo complex the alarm is too loud and too long to be neighbor friendly.

Fairly easy to set up, installing th app on your phone will guide you through it.. The WiFi is weak in the front corner of my garage, but when i discovered you can mount the hub anywhere in the garage, i put it in the back corner nearest my router and it connected quickly.  The alarm for the door closing is a bit annoying, but you WILL know it's about to close...

This is a great feature and tool for your garage.  Have you even left home and wondered if the garage door was still open?  Easy to check on your smart phone app and to add a second person to use the Garage hub.  It shows you if the door is open or closed and the history list shows when it was open or closed and for how long.  You can also have it send you emails if letting you know that the door is open.  It was very simple yo install and the app was essential in setting it up.  A good buy.
IT does not work with Alexa unless you purchase the hub so if you are looking for a product that does this is not the one for you...however- this product works really well. I

This will not close my garage door only opens it. I repaired it several times to the garage door opener with no luck. It will beep for about 30 seconds then eventually error out. I had to actually delete the device and repair it to get it out of the error state one time.

I have left my garage door opened and thank goodness my garage door will automatically close my door at my time set. You can set it to close any time you wish am elderly it will shut every day at 5 pm. Also let’s me know on my phone. Wonderful  peace of mind  wonderful  buy it you will love it Dorothy

This item works great on my garage door opener no problems at all and sure beats purchasing a new garage door opener just to have the app and ability to open and close it on the phone.It was very easy to install but beware when your setting up the unit and establishing the connection it will disable all your other remotes including, you’re in car programming so you will have to reset them all again.
It tool less than 10 minutes to install and setup. But, it doesn't work with Alexa.Works good with the MyQ Android app, very easy

integration with Alexa and Google Assistant is not intuitive.  Overall, love the product as it otherwise works as advertised and we can use Amazon in garage delivery now and I get alerted when the door opens and closes.

This is a snap to install. The hardest part was tracking down the unit’s power cord. Door actuation with the app is pretty good. My garage has good signal from the router, but the app will sometimes just hang. Considering the low price and ease of installation for this aftermarket feature, I am quite pleased with the product. My teenage son is not yet security minded, so would often leave the garage door open overnight. I was looking for the ability to monitor the garage door’s status and be able to close it, if left opened. This product satisfies my needs perfectly.

Great device that works. Not sure why some users have reported it not working, maybe it was not placed close enough or the garage door opener is too old. I have a chamberlain whisper drive from the early 90s and it works well.This is a big improvement from their previous internet gateway which had a known issues if you had an NVR. Took me about 15-20mins to setup and install.
Great product,  BUT...... please read through other reviews regarding troubleshooting.I could NOT GET THIS TO WORK. Once I took my LED garage bulb light out I tried to install again and voila!!

Summary: I am a Software Developer and generally very critical of UX design and usability issues. I didn't find any issues at all while setting up my Garage Hub. It's very intuitive and super easy to install and configure. Great job MyQ team.I highly recommend this product to anyone who is looking for Smart solution for Garage.

Its a great device that was easy to setup and use; we have even used it to its fullest-advantage when we were out of down and needed to let a neighbor inside. The only negative I can think of is how long it takes for the app to load - obviously its not a "quick-click" like a traditional garage door opener. Given that, using this as your primary opener might be a little cumbersome unless you open the app as you're pulling up to your house, before you enter the driveway, for example.

The box displays a woman receiving this precise alert: "Garage remained open at 08:15am." It's one of the reasons I bought the item—to be alerted if the garage door is open at certain times. Nonetheless, when setting up alerts, I only was given the option to be notified when the garage door is opened, closed or stopped. So, I chatted with support. I told him I wanted to be alerted, like the woman on the box, when the garage door is open, not openED. He said that feature is no longer available. So, if that is important to you, as it is to me, do NOT buy this product.

Purchased 2 of these for my 2 doors. Neither hub was able to connect. They are sitting within 10 feet of my router. The hub would say they were connected but the app would not. So it would just give me an error message. I tried to do a factory reset and both of them failed. Both arrived missing parts. Very disappointed.

Is easy to install and connect, but am having a lot trouble with the door sensor, I have to reconnect the sensor every day, does not seem to like the cold garage, i replace the battery because I tough it was low of charge, but is doing the same thing even with the new battery, I am very disappointed with the product
So far so good. My most ideal device would include two more things... maybe this has it and I don't know yet?1) Be able to set to always close in "X" minutes after last open.

This unit installed fine using a Motorola XT1254.  I needed to change the password on my wifi.  Turned out to be a big pain.  I couldn't get it to change the password or run setup using my new Samsung S10+.  Pulled the old XT1254 phone out of the drawer, and it re-setup the MyQ no problem.  They need to improve and test their software.

I bought this just for those times when you leave the house and you suddenly don't remember "did I or did I not close the garage door?" It works great for that. Just check the App and it tells you if your door is open or closed.I didn't like how long it takes to close your garage door using the App. It felt like 30 seconds of alarm chiming and light flashing (to warn people to get out of the way) before the door finally activated.

9/10 on this thing. It works great to control your garage door and monitor the status with alerts. It doesn't really integrate with Alexa in that you can control your door with it, but they do have Amazon Key if that's something you're interested in. Super easy to install and didn't take long hooking it up to my Craftsman 3/4 hp opener.

Install the iPhone app first. Then follow the instructions on the box. I got this on a deal for about $35. It's a great addition to the garage. I didn't mount it near the opener motor since we have a detached garage in the alley. And, I had to open the human door from the garage to let the wifi signal in during setup, but all in all, it took about 15 minutes of my day. Have your wifi password handy if it's a long one.

I have a Genie Chain drive 7035 model garage opener, installed about 4 months ago. So I purchased this MyQ wifi few days ago. I was not able to pair my garage opener to the MyQ hub. So I contacted technical support. And after 2 hours of back and forth and attempt after attempt, still couldn’t get it to work. Returning it right now. Waste of my 2 hours. Please do not buy if you have a Genie 7035 garage opener

This product is great. The MyQ app works well, also making it easy to setup. Had a bit of a problem syncing the hub to my second opener, but the phone support person walked me through getting it working. I’m using the app to check door status and close, if necessary. I’m not using voice control and don’t plan to b

Not sure why people are having trouble. It couldn't be simpler. Took me 15 mins and it's done. Tested it from across town. The only downside to the product, which is a necessary evil it seems, is the alarm that goes off when the door is closing. Haven't found a way to turn that off because its loud and annoying. Anyways, great product

We purchased this as an add on for our second garage door.  Installed very easily without any issues.  The cost is a bit high for the one sensor, almost as much as the entire system.  Unfortunately, there aren't any aftermarket options at this time, so if you have two garage doors that you want to set up, you'll need to factor the total cost with the high price of this second sensor.

This product works flawlessly. I needed something to open my garage from my motorcycle and this did the trick. I also really like the schedule and notification features. My kids would open the garage and forget to close it. The device and app help me keep up with my rear entry garage door. I highly recommend watching a video before installing because the instructions are seriously lacking. It took me about 20 minutes to install. I highly recommend this product.

The set up took me a while because they had to update the software on it before it would connect. The customer support was awesome.  Now that i have it all linked it’s great! The app is self-explanatory and easy to use.I would have given it five stars but like I said set up it’s kind of a pain. For the price I am super happy and I would buy it all over again!

Awesome product! I was so sick and tired of leaving the house only to turn around a mile down the road because I couldn’t remember if I closed the garage door or not!Install was easy even with the extra step needed for an IPhone user.

Very easy to install. It does require an app. My alexia was not able to locate device. Its very loud when in use as a safety.  The app is shareable. It saves time when I need to unload groceries into the garage freezer.Its great for my son who frequently loses amd forgets to take his house key.

I followed the steps to set up the MyQ Smart Garage Door Opener. It all seemed to go fine and as part of the set up it opened and closed my garage door.  After that however, the app was linked to my garage door opener but it was listed as "monitor" mode and there was no way to control the opener. Worse is the garage door opener no longer responded to any of the existing remotes so I could only open or close it manually, or with the wall mount control inside the garage. Beware! I'll be sending it back and trying to figure out how to reprogram my old remotes to work again.

The hardware and software work great for me. My only dislike is no Alexa or Google assistant integration. I would prefer the Google assistant integration over Alexa to be honest. Actually there is some form of Google assistant integration, but it just tells you the status of the garage door.  Come on really Chamberlain? It's 2020! Get with the times! I'm sure that it's nothing that can't be fixed with a software update. Sheesh!

This device is the dumbest smart device I've used yet. IFTTT doesn't work anymore (says the device is connected but wont let me select the when making a script). Google home does not show any MyQ device support anymore. The wifi connection sucks. Half the time it doesn't know if it is open or closed. Also the app feels like it was made in 1996, geocity website owners would be impressed, but I am not...

Update: Changed to Nexx garage door opener since it is compatible with Alexa without a fee.I have own this product for one year now.  Originally, I was hoping it would work with Alexa but a fee is required. I did not purchased the subscription. I wanted something to secure my garage door, especially at night. If it remained open, I was hoping it would close it automatically. When I  set up a schedule to keep the door closed it would automatically open the garage door, mostly at night. I turned off the schedule because it happened multiple times. It has turned out to be an expensive garage door opener using my cell phone.

Took a little while to install and program, but once I did, it works pretty well. I get an alert every time the garage door is open. The trick I learned for installing is that it must have a strong signal to your wifi router. I wasn't able to at first with 2 floors down but once I installed a wifi extender, it worked like a charm. So I recommend that you get a wifi extender and dedicate it for this garage door opener. Took like an hr to get it all set up and install, don't give up and return it. It works.

I have two of these and after about 6 months they both started randomly opening the garage door. After contacting customer service and going through their troubleshooting the guy says well you had to do something wrong it can’t be the device. I unplug the myQ and no problems. Plug it back in and fantom openings start happening again. Stay away.

After many (10+) attempts to get this to work properly i have given up. I have another brand on my other garage door and it always works for both opening and closing,but not this one. Only allows me to Open the door. Once the door is open the link seem to break very time.

So happy I finally bought this. After finding my garage open one night and knowing I closed this now I have the knowledge of when it’s closed or open and tines. I love this! Got it on prime day for a great price too.And I suck at installing stuff but I’ve had garage door openers harder to install then this.  So it’s truly a cakewalk!

Couple of times, we left the garage door open when we went out. So we got this. This is very easy to install and connect to the wifi. The instructions are very clear. Now we can see the status of the garage door and we can open or close the garage door from anywhere using the App.  The only drawback is, when we close or open the garage door from the app, it gives a warning sound and lights for few seconds and then it works. That's irritating. Otherwise this is very good and useful.

This takes you through installation step by step and it is WONDERFULLY "dumbed down." Soooooo easy. Works perfectly and I'll never need to turn around and check to see if my garage is open again. I have a Chamberlain MyQ enabled, fairly recent motor, but I had no idea that was a thing when I got it put in.

first day after setup i am already having errors. it says to manually control the door. after doing so it seems to be working. i wouldn't trust this for amazon key. i got it to be able to remotely close my garage door in case the kids / wife left it open. for this purpose it seems to work ok. will update after some time has pasted.

I was nervous about installation because things like this never seem to work, BUT I had this installed and working within 10 minutes. Directions from the app included video and were super easy! I have a genie door opener and of my remotes stopped working. This was basically the same price (prime day) as a replacement remote. Give it a try!

Surprisingly easy to install. Programming it to my garage doors was as simple as coding any new remote—press the button on my chamberlain garage door unit, myQ connected in seconds and it was done. I added a 2nd unit for my other door just as easy. Now Amazon can safely drop off packages but more importantly, I can keep my family safer my knowing access and usage of my garage.

My husband suggested we get this for our garage door which was compatible. It works very well. You need to download the app, which gives you alerts when the door is open or closed and also gives the time. You can also open/close the garage door using your phone. Overall pleased with the purchase.

This is working perfectly for me, and at this price point deserves 5 stars. Room for improvement: when I open the app on my iPhone, it immediately closes and I have to open it again. Also, the setup instructions could be clearer about how to get started, I had to do some lucky guessing to get through it.

The install couldn't have gone easier.  The instructions were very clear and I had it up and operational within minutes.  Fastening it to the ceiling was the most time consuming part, which isn't saying much.  It connected to the Bluetooth sensor and to my network very easily and quickly.  Chamberlin has the technology figured out.

Horrible!  Disappointed!! This product does not integrate with Alexa, And for a Google home you need to pay a service fee To enable the feature, and then only find out it does not close your garage door “ due to security reasons“. So other than the app being a glorified garage door opener, this product has no value.

I really like this except that it often says the garage door is open when it's not or closed when its open. I've tried to reset it but it keeps happening. It wasnt a big deal until it did this one night and my scheduled alert opened a closed garage at midnight and my garage was robbed. I know I should've deactivated the scheduled close when I noticed it acting up, but it never occurred to me. Bummed because I really wanted to love this.

Cool idea. But After installing. It only works when it wants to.  Most times I have to find another way. Because it won’t open or close the garage door. And when it does it take 3-4 minutes to get it to work. Definitely don’t depend on this to be your opener and access to you home

Ordered this one after reading many reviews for it and similar products for my mom. Chose this one for simplicity of installation. Garage sensor wireless. We are short women at barely 5 ft and my daughter and I were able to install in about 30 min. Luckily had 4bar Wi-Fi in garage. Garage ceiling plugs full, and we were actually able to simply place hub high on garage wall and have it work on the first try.  Adding this device allows my snowbird mother to open and close her garage door from 500 miles away.  It also was the solution to needing additional remotes for my teenage daughters when the 15 year old opener memory slots were full. Great solution for an older single garage door opener.

I have a 3 car garage with 3 doors. I purchased 2 additional door sensors, but this hub can have 2 sensors at the max. When trying to set up the 3rd sensor, I got an error saying either to buy another hub or to remove a door. Seriously!

Wow! Best thing for multiple family members or kids. No accidental remote button pushes and peace of mind knowing the garage is open or closed. Love the gueat feature also! No worries about vehicles remote getting broke into alowing entry all better now!

I got it because it was on sale and I don't have to be worried if I left my garage door opened or not. I have used it for delivery a few times and I like it. It doesn't glitch or have any issues connecting. I have not tried it with Alexa yet because I keep forgetting.

I just purchased this Smart Garage Door Opener, since I lost one of my openers and thought it would be easier by phone.  Not only was it simple to install, and works perfectly, I can still use my existing one garage door opener AND the remote one I have mounted on the outside of the garage.  This is an excellent product and I highly recommend!

I got this so I could use Alexa to open/close the garage, but it won't. In addition you have to go to IFTTT to "program" it to work. You can still use your phone as a garage door opener and for Amazon Key, but I was disappointed in it.

A bit expensive since the hub and one door sensor was only a few dollars more. But, it was worth it to be able to control both doors. Works well and was easy to install and connect.I think this is one of the coolest uses of a position sensor since cell phones started using it.

I had MyQ built into previous garage door and it worked beautifully. This this doesn’t work at all. It routinely said my door was open when it was closed, failed to receive signal, requires me to reset both garage doors to be able to connect this with a second door sensor for garage #2. The customer service guy on the phone was great but clearly this product is not ready for the market yet. It is a shame they would release a sub-par product.

The myQ has nice clear installation instructions with guided videos in the app.  It takes a bit longer to pull up the app and get the door opening or closing than a Bluetooth- based opener that I have been using, but the Amazon Key integration and the ability to send guests access invites is really handy.

This was very easy to set up. I had no issues with it at all. My intention was to just use the app to be able to check whether I left my door open and to auto shut the door at night because I forget to do that sometimes. I did not do any voice control stuff with mine. It works exactly as advertised and for my intended purpose it is perfect. I’ve had it about a month now and it has never dropped wifi connection.  Router is about 35ft away going through one wall with the electrical panel on that wall directly in line of sight between router and MyQ hub, but still no issues.

Installed fine and paid up with my opener. Worked one time and then it shows up in monitor only mode. Tried to pair it again, but kept failing. Deleted the hub from the so and started over with the same result. Returned.

I have access to several company cars. This is perfect when I don't have my original remote. I had an issue setting up the second door. what they don't tell you is unplug the first door opener when you program the second. After some frustration,  customer service walked me through setting up the 2nd hub. I highly recommend. If what I know now I knew then I would have had no issues what so ever.

Works as advertised and was easy to configure and install.  People whining about having to pay for connected services need to get over themselves, the functionality in the app does everything you really need for free.  Those complaining about the lights and alarm, would you rather run over your stupid 3 year old who is screwing around where he shouldn’t be anyways?Wonderful product that works right out of the box.

Installation was fast and I haven't had any issues with it's operation but there is room for improvement.The most glaring issue is the beeping. You can't turn it off via a setting. If you want to stop the beeping your would have to physically hack the device to remove the speaker. This is apparently a safety feature. But the device already requires you to have door sensors, so I don't know why this is necessary. It really limits this to emergency closing only. I wouldn't be able to use this after everyone in the house has gone to bed.

Installation was quite easy, but pairing with my existing system(different brand) was quite bumpy. I almost gave up, but after several attempts it connected "open" feature and after repeating all the steps it connected "close" feature - a little weird. But It has been working perfect since then (all I needed was just a close by schedule).

My Amazon one touch buy ordered this for me in my pocket, I wasn't to pleased to see a shipping notification for something I didn't want to buy... But so worth the accidental purchase. Such a simple product that puts your mind at ease every time you forget if you closed your garage or not. It does struggle with my 110 degree weather and bugs out every so often. But that's very minor. I'll probably just get the actual garage door opener later down the road where all the features are built in and that will fix the heat problem.

The best part about this device honestly is the awesome instructions that are built into the app. The only issue I had was with getting it connected WiFi even in a place where other devices connect easily. After some reconfiguring of my access points, everything is working well.I docked it one star for not having HomeKit support out of the box. I went the DIY route and am controlling it through HomeKit via HomeBridge.

I can’t say that I dislike the myQ smart garage door opener, I mean it was very easy to setup and very easy to use, I set it up on my phone first just like the video I watched, everything went smooth.It connected to my wifi right away and my door started to move. I stopped and then closed it all with my phone, I recommend this product.

This thing is garbage and so is the myq support. I have one that works and I tried to hook up my 3rd car garage and they blamed it on my mesh WiFi stating that it won’t work, once I told them it works on my main door the chat disconnected. Wasted 2 hours of my morning and did all the steps they said and got no where

This product would never connect to my wifi. I went through all of the setup and troubleshooting steps to no avail. (Wifi signal was strong in the app but it still wouldn't connect). Unfortunately I had this for a while before attempting to set it up, otherwise I would return it in a heartbeat. Don't waste your money on this one!

I bet you ever wondered if you shut the garage door when you got half way to work. Never wonder again with this easy to set up smart garage control. Easy instructions allow you to turn wonder into wonder no more. Loved this addition to my smart home and an absolute must have for any smart homeowner. Comes with bracket for ceiling installation. Well worth the money

I wanted another way to get into my garage, I didn’t add the option of having Amazon access my garage for deliveries because I’m home and that if added that option I would have to request Amazon not to use my garage every 24 hours. There is no permanent block for Amazon not to use my garage. Other that that it is a great unit.

This was an awesome addition to my home tech.  It was incredibly easy to install for two garage doors (on Chamberlain, one Craftsman).  Has worked without a flaw.  Have had no issues with my router (5GHz Netgear orbi) that some have reported.  Highly recommend!  Only thing that is odd is that a second sensor costs more than the hub and sensor together. (???)

I like this hub and the sensor. It is easy to install and to set up with the application on the phone. It have saved me a lot time and given me the peace of mind. Whenever I am not sure if the garage door is closed or not, I just simply open the app on the phone and see the state of the garage door right way. I can close or open the door remotely. Good stuff.

Very good garage opener using blue tooth, easy install and use of app on the Iphone. Should have got this opener long ago and get rid on the garage remotes on the sun visor. Works well with Alexa and on command opens and closes quickly.

The install was simple and quick. I opened the app and followed the instructions and in about 15 minutes had it up and operating. The setup was simple and the door has worked to perfection. I can highly recommend this item if you are looking for remote access to you garage door.The only down side is the loud beeping when closing the garage door. I understand the safety reason but my door has the safety sensor so that it won't close if the beam is broken so I don't see the need for the loud beeping. It would be nice to have the option to silence it or at least turn it down.

This is an amazing additional feature for our garage. It works perfectly. We wanted something to alert us to the garage door being open, without buying a surveillance system. This item works perfectly, and it happens to integrated into our alarm system. No longer do I have to ask my husband is the garage door open, is it closed, did you close it. We can close it and be alerted to its status clear across the world...it is a must have..

Loved the idea of this item. I bought it and it arrived quickly from Amazon. It connected to my home wi-fi and the device sync'd to the motor on my LiftMaster opener. It seemed to work, but then randomly disconnected from my consistent wi-fi signal. This renders it useless. So I am returning it.

Wouldn't connect to my door opener.  I emailed support and heard nothing (still haven't seen anything), finally called while they were open and they remotely connected to my opener.  Several times it has locked my boys out of the house because it lost connectivity.Product was returned

NO Alexa integration and subscription based IFTTT that only closes the door. Also, you can only add three additional users. I will be returning this for it’s inaccurate description.It’s too bad as this would have been a good product but, I think I will stick with the NEXX and all the features it has.

Works great on my Chamberlain Whisper Plus opener that is around 7 years old. Like other reviewers, found the instructions to be ok. I made a couple mis-steps early with programming but just kept at it and tried again. There is likely a Youtube video tutorial from someone that would be helpful. Once I made it to the MyQ setup wifi page on my droid device, things came together nicely. My second issue was that my opener had two buttons near the "learn" button area, and I pressed the wrong one a couple times first as I reached around blindly to press it (car was still in garage). Be patient and you can set up in 30 minutes or so, mounting included. I think the interface is good, but could be jazzed up visually some. It does what it needs to afterall. Expect that may get better through future updates. So far, very pleased with function and alerts sent to me letting me know when it opens and closes. Very cool add on.

I’m not very technologically savvy but this was very simple to install for me. We lost both remotes to the garage door so this is a great substitute AND we can take it when we move to the next place. I was also able to open the garage for access into my home once for my 7 year daughter when I was late getting home for her bus. Not the best solution but I was glad I had that option vs her being outside on the porch!

We bought this guy to automate the opening and closing of the garage door for my wife. Long story short, unless you pay for their subscription service, you cannot integrate with IFTT to automate the closing. Automate the opening? Absolutely not. Chamberlain has said no, because security. Wish I hadn’t ever bought it now. I guess I don’t return it because I hope they will release the “open” operation. I wouldn’t buy it again.

Installation was pretty simple and it worked on first try. After a couple of days it would only work half of the time. Not reliable. I tried everything. Changed its position, reconnected, restarted. It would work for a couple of days then back to the same problem. Not sure I got a lemon but I see several reviews reporting the same problem. I give up. Returning it.

Very easy to install. Took about 30 minutes. I bought this product so I would not have to wonder if I closed the garage door.  I get notifications on my phone every time the garage is open or closed. You can also make unique alerts for example - if the garage is open for a certain amount of time. You can remotely open/close your garage from the app. It does everything that is says it does. An added plus is it works with amazon key - amazon can now deliver my packages into my garage safe and sound. I do not  have to worry about them being left on my front porch.

We installed this according to the instructions received and set it up to work with our Alexa devices. It never worked; Alexa always thought the garage door was open. We finally got it to recognize that the door opens and closes, but for some reason, it had it reversed. It showed up as closed when the door was open and open when the door was closed.

This is a cost-effective and highly functional solution to manage your garage door remotely. I love that. However the setup process was full of errors (I had to take to online forums to figure out what to do. The workaround ended up being easy, but it didn't come from Chamberlain but rather other frustrated users like me. Chamberlain should address this.). Also the inability to have multiple user profiles is a big miss. You have to use the same login across multiple devices if you want multiple people to control the door. No way to see the history or get a notification based on who is opening or closing the door.

Cheap enough, fairly easy install, although the door sensors are kind of obtrusive. The beeping before closing is super obnoxious and unnecessary. I put tape over the speaker to mute it. That helps some. Lack of Alexa integration is why I’m giving it one star.

I waited until after the myQ arrived and was configured, to order this, so this came separately. If you buy the MyQ, note that it only comes with one door sensor. You will be needing more of them depending on how many doors you have. I have 2 garage doors, so I needed this for the second door. Now both doors are remotely controllable from my iPhone.

where was this invention when I forgot the garage clicker and got locked out!  I got this thing and installed it pretty quick, followed online instructions on chamberlain website and got it up and running in less than 5 minutes. i'm able to open and close the doors on demand from my android phone, and works everytime.

After 1 year of using it in my garage I can say this smart garage sensor is well worth the price for it. The product is very small and not bulky since I didn’t want to replace my whole entire garage hub for a smart garage unit. By installing this device I get a inexpensive smart garage . The only issue was if your new to this it can be a bit complicated for a beginner to install. So far it’s working great and my whole family loves it.

I ran into zero problems with install. I set it up on my existing garage WIFI extender. I stayed on that WFI Ext during setup on my iPhone. I now get notications on Alexa, iPhone and Apple Watch. Also, I scheduled it to close every night at 2200 hours. I'm happy that our garage-door has become part of our expanding Smart Home. I was not compensated to promote, nor am I a bot. I am just impressed and a fan. All at an incredibly low price.

The installation went smoothly. tested the product several times to ensure that it works. The next day, the garage opens on its own multiple times within several hours. my phone was not being used at all. When I tried to use it, it gave me an error. I factory reset the product and went through the installation one more time. It works fine again. On the next day, the garage door opens on its own again and because I wasn't home, it remained open for over four hours! I got infuriated and wrote to the company support twice and still have not heard back when it's been over a week. I've had enough; will not take any more risks.

I had no issues setting it up. I followed the instructions and it all worked perfectly. My one problem is you can not set a schedule to open the garage, only close it. It should my choice if I want to take the risk of the garage door automatically opening on a schedule I should have that option.

I had the system (2 doors) up and running in less than 20 minutes. Their app makes it very easy. The only reason I rated it 4 stars instead of 5 is that I would really appreciate a better indication in the app that the door is moving. As it is, you have to wait for a while to be sure the door responded. It would also be nice to bypass the sign-on screen on my secured iPhone. I have Face ID enabled on my iPhone XR, but I have to go through the Face ID process AGAIN to open the MyQ app.

Bought 3 weeks ago. It already reminded me to change the battery.  The battery came with the product.  Is it a battery problem or this product ate the battery so quickly? It is approaching the return window.  I am still struggling to decide whether to return or keep it. It took time to install them.

Took me 20 min to install, and it worked right away. The package had the hub and one door sensor. I have Chamberlin openers on all 3 garage doors, so I ordered extra door sensors for my other 2 doors. Each additional door sensor takes at least 2 minutes to add (in other words, no problem at all). I see other folks on here complaining about all that Chamberlin doesn't tell you. But from my experience, these worked exactly as advertised and do exactly what I need -- allow me to open/close doors remotely, and allow me to enable in-garage delivery from Amazon Prime.

Love that I can check the status of the door from anywhere.  Somewhat difficult to set up but if you follow the directions to the letter it works.  I kept getting error 101 which there is no code to explain.  I found that the battery on the door sensor was not making contact because the plastic strip that you are instructed to remove tore off and left the battery  not making contact .  One that was resolved the error code cleared.

I like the product and am glad that I bought it, That said: My first device arrive with problems. The tech spent the time trying to find out the problem but without any hesitation sent me a new one the next day. It worked perfectly. Now to the software. I am still a bit shaky about relying on it but I do not think that it is the fault of the device. I do not subscribe to data so when I am off site the software does not work. Not sure that it is a problem with the device or me.I would love to have a unique signal when to device is accesses. All in all, I need to play around and experiment more to be sure that I am not the problem.

Does NOT work with HomeKit despite being the first one that comes up on the search. And closing the garage door remotely triggers a very annoying loud beep for about 5 seconds and doesn’t stop until the door is closed all the way.

Wish I had done more research.  At the time of this writing, June 2020, this product does not support the command "open the garage door" in Google Assistant.  It is also misleading to say that this supports Google Home: It only integrates with Google Assistant which is not the same thing.  Home automation is confusing enough, they should be more clear.  On the plus side, installation and setup using the myQ app was very easy up to the point of integrating with Google Assistant, which took a little more effort.

After Reading several reviews I decided upon this particular model after the Amazon recommendations and I’m so glad I did it was easy to install simple steps to follow and works perfectly.  I will be buying at least one or two more !!

This was very easy to install and it only took me a few minutes.  There's no free plug near my opener, so I just put the hub on a shelf on the garage wall near a plug and it works fine from there.  The sensor just sticks onto the garage door, so that was very easy too.  Now when I leave the house and forget whether or not I closed the door, I can check and fix it without turning around and going back home - which I have done many times.  Getting old sucks.

The MyQ Smart Garage Door Opener was straight forward to install, set up and use from the MyQ app. I've had it fail to open my garage door on one occasion so I still have my garage door opener in my car. I was able to set it up to work with Amazon Key so deliveries can be made to my garage if I want but I have not been able to connect it to Alexa to allow voice or Alexa app control.

I didn’t know it intergrated with Alexia! This product was easy to install, honestly jst couldn’t tell what color my push button was on my chamberlain device! Help desk was very helpful without having to talk to someone over the phone, jst thru messaging!!
I've had this for half a year now and it's still going, no complaints from me.1. Install was easy. I did it in about 10 minutes.

After several months of use, I haven't had any issues with the reliability of the notifications or manual check of status. Install was easy and straightforward. Although I haven't had much need to remotely open and close the garage door, I did try it several times and had zero problems doing so. (I have a camera in the garage so I was able to visually verify it's functionality every time I needed to and it worked fine.)

I wish I could return this product, it is such a disappointment.  I daily get false "MyQ Alerts"  that tell me the garage door was left open but each time it is a false reading.  I purposely purchased this device in hopes of having confidence that the garage door was not let open.  I have purchased new batteries, relinked the device on the network  and repositioned the sensor on multiple locations on the garage door.  I had such confidence when I installed this product that I tossed the packaging. What a MISTAKE.

Price is cheap enough.  Does not exactly install like instructions.  Does not integrate with Alexa or any others... therefore, don't buy it folks.  Chamberlin should understand that their position is HARDWARE, and Google, Amazon, Apple's business is Software.  Yes, it does work, on their app, but if you are going to have one... shouldn't it be one that integrates with everything else?

Love the simplicity and functionality.  Have the app installed on both an iPhone and Android (Blackberry).  No problems installing the app and integrating the myQ devices to control two garage doors with a single gateway.However, I discovered a challenge and figured out the solution after consulting several home automation blogs.  If the myQ gateway is installed too close to a garage door opener, the opener interferes with the functionality of the gateway in sending alerts.  The door would close and it would take 30-45 minutes for an alert to be received.  When I repositioned the gateway so it is about 5-6 feet from the opener, alerts are sent immediately.

I love having remote access so much that when I moved I bought another one Of these. It does seem to have issues every so often with connection but I still give it 5 stars because of the price. Can’t beat that. We plan on buying another for our external garage doors.

We purchased this unit for two reasons,  1 to check the garage door to verify that it is open or closed. 2. To have Amazon deliver our packages security away from potential porch bandits.  I am very pleased to say that both reasons have exceeded our goals.  If you are looking for a delivery option that is safe, then this is what you should consider.  We have had over 6 Amazon deliveries made in our garage. With notifications sent directly to my phone when the door is opened and closed. Amazon also notifies me when the delivery is on it's way to the garage. Well worth the investment.  Simple installation and set up.

I LOVE THESE!!! They are so easy to install, I gave these to my 65 year old father who isn't the most tech savvy and he was able to install it by himself and get it running on his smartphone in under an hour! WE LOVE garage door openers!!

This product was quite easy to install. I saw some of the other reviews where they had a hard time pairing the garage door motor to MyQ smart door opener and thought the process would be more complex. I simply followed the instructions on the MyQ app and took me about 15 min to set everything up. Now I can open and close my garage remotely. I can also get notifications anytime the garage door is opened even when the app is not used.

Easy to use.  Just wish it integrated with Apply CarPlay.  Seems like it would be an awesome app to work with CarPlay.  Otherwise I have no complaints.  It’s easy to use and works great.  I love being able to check the status of my garage door at anytime. Very easy to install too.  Glad I made the upgrade.

Ready to install right out of the box. I will say however that there wifi signal used to make this device work is very weak. You'll need a booster in your garage if you intend to use this and not fuss over resetting it multiple times. It's a great tool as a backup if you get locked out and for kids, baby sitters and the like. The overall software for the app is a little archaic and requires patience.

There is an annual fee associated with this service that is not sufficiently highlighted by Chamberlain in it's advertising.  Integrating with Google Home was a bit of a pain as the instructions were not clear.  You also cannot open the garage via voice control, only closing is supported for "security reasons".  Controlling the door from the phone is easy enough.  The first year is free, but I am not convinced that it is worth the $10-$12 / year that Chamberlain seems to charge..  We'll see after that.

It is advertised as a device that will shut the door after a certain time, it does. I set it to close at10:00 nightly during the summer and 6:00 in winter. Also...install note: mounted mine under my Garage Door opener. It’s easier to get to if it gets out of synchronization.

Had to return this.  Couldn't get it to work.  Chamberlain support couldn't help get it right and they took too long to respond.  After 2 calls and an email I returned.  Have 2 identical door openers.  They are MFG date 2009 Chamberlain's and on the supported list.  Could sync up one.  Then would sync up the other.  Either the 1st would lose sync or both doors would operate with the 2nd door command.  Relocated MyQ 3x.  Numerous MyQ resets and clears.  Even cleared all remote pairings for both door motors as well.
Works well once you figure out the installation - called customer service and it was not helpful.Website send you back to instructions on package.

Easy to install with you tube videos or step by step screens.  Now I can be sure my garage door is closed.  No more nights left open.  Schedules and alerts are great.  Only drawback is the time to log into the app each time to use it.  I guess it's security.  Not as quick as a garage door opener.  Does work with watch though.

Sadly does not work with Alexa without an additional service. But work excellent with the MyQ app. Can control it from anywhere. And let’s you know when the door is left open and how long it has been open. The only draw back is that it only works with amazon key in select cities and areas for the time being. Hope they expand the coverage in the near future.

The MyQ garage door opener is a fantastic buy at the $50 sale price on Amazon.  The installation was extremely easy and straight forward.  I had it up and running in under an hour.  So far it has operated flawlessly and the notifications to your smart phone I have found useful.  You can set a schedule to close it at a certain time of day but you cannot set it to close automatically after so many minutes of being left open. That is one area I see that could be improved.  Overall though it is a good value with a lot of functionality.

Make sure you mount the control box more than 48” from your garage door opener. Too close and it’s very unreliable. Found this out the hard way and had to remount the control box. Other than that I love being able to open, close, and monitor status of my garage door with my phone

Simple to install and easy to operate. However, my biggest problem is that it sometimes does not respond to the app. I know it’s not a WiFi issue since I have a router sitting in a room right behind the garage. So I have reverted to also carrying a garage door opener. Till I can figure out why it sometimes does not respond, I can’t trust it to let me in consistently.

It’s not smart and It is not compatible with Alexa. They lie and say it is compatible with ifttt yet, it’s not. You can’t open or close you garage door using triggers in ifttt. Feeling kind of scammer. Even at 18 dollars they are charging for this it is the dumbest smart product I’ve ever owned.

Works very well.  I love being able to open the garage door using my phone.  I've been able to open it for my daughter when she forgets her keys.  A little tricky to get the wifi connection set-up, but nothing too technical.  I've had it working for about two months and only had two minor glitches.  Once it said the door was open when it had already closed.  I cycled the door up and down and it went back to working normally.  The other time it said the door had opened and closed in the history log, when it did not.

after i install it I realized that my 3rd garage opener so old that wouldn't work remotely with this device. It would be cool if they have hard wired connection outside this device so you can just connect to wires to the old openers as well

Would not stay connected to network and when it did it would show weak signal. Phone had full bars with same network. Moved wifi router 20ft away still had weak signal. Never did connect to Craftsman garage door opener. Not going to do this every time I have a network issue. Not going to waste half my life trying to make something work that doesn't do what someone says it does.

I’m not sure why so many people are having issues with getting their sensors to work but mine worked flawlessly every time. Installation was VERY easy and took no more than 10 minutes.App works great every time and never fails. I recommended this to everyone especially my sister who wants to cancel her Vivint subscription.

When it works it is really good, it sends an alert when there is activity on the door. And you can use the app to open and close the doors. However this device opens and closes my doors at random. So if you don’t care about your family’s safety this is the product for you.

After trying another brand nexxxgarage I bought the this one and returned the Nexx because it was Chinese bs, could never get It connected but then bought this and literally within 10 minutes using it. Worth every penny.

Does not work with Alexa?  How can this product work with Amazon Key, but not Alexa.  Overall this is easy to install and works well.  Especially the auto schedule feature.  If I forget to close my garage door at night it will send a notification and close it for me at my specified time.Unfortunately without Alexa integration I will be installing a different device and donating this one to St. Vincent.

My neighbor turned me on to this product and so far it saved me twice. It’s better then giving a key out and or lock boxes.  I can’t hang a picture straight so he installed it and I watched under 20 mins with no issues at all. I’m not sure all the screaming is about and giving one stars bc witnessed install myself ang he had no issues and it works.

The setup was a little more involved than I thought it would take, but overall very straightforward. Works like a champ, no issues at all. I was a bit worried because the garage is at the fringes of my wi-fi coverage but there have been zero problems with communications. I'm pretty pleased, especially at the price i paid.

I was looking for a solution when the security company said our garage door was TOO smart to configure with their software. As a previous owner of the Chamberlin doors I was familiar with the product and found this solution during Prime Day, so it was a bonus buy! Easy to setup and install, from the time I opened the box until I put the ladder away was a whopping 10 minutes. In addition, I can now received eligible deliveries through the Key app for Amazon and MyQ Smart Garage Door Opener. Highly recommend!
I originally bought this on the Apple HomeKit enabled page. Got it installed and found out you need to buy an additional bridge for it to work with HomeKit.

Purchased open box and had no issues. Ive had to reset a couple of times because the app was not detecting even tho I was able to see it on the network.  There was an app update a few weeks ago and it has been solid since.  Happy now since app update.  Also peace of mind knowing I closed the garage door...saving me gas since i dont have to go back and check.

This is an incredible concept. You can open your garage door from anywhere. The only issue I had was that no one tells you you have to tap the icon TWICE to open or close the garage door. If you press it once it will not work. That being said, the directions are terrific. You can follow a video that will take you through each step. They have great phone support if you need it.

I got this to use with my Chamberlain garage door opener about a year ago.  Pairing was successful the first, second, third, and fourth times.  You will have to pair it with your garage door opener again and again, every time the network goes down and sometimes for no reason at all.  You'd think that a device with such a simple task would be way more stable.  The app has beed updated at least three times and it's still a coin flip as to whether it will operate in the morning when I leave for work and another coin flip in the afternoon when I return.  IFTTT integration requires a paid subscription.  All in all they tricked me into spending $50 for a pain in the but.  Not worth it!

It works better than expected.  Love it make life so much easier now that we don't have to worry about a garage door opener.  Worked so well got one for a friend for his birthday.  He loves it and still has not stopped thanking me!  Most of the other brands don't work with Craftsman openers but this one does right out of the box, simple setup and installation.

I bought this knowing that per the MyQ website it would work with my Genie Max Pro opener.  I have it all connected to my Wi-Fi and talking to my app and sensor.  But it won’t connect to my opener at all.  I emailed their customer support and haven’t even gotten a confirmation email they received my question let alone an answer.  Few more days of silence and this thing is going back to Amazon!

This opener is amazing.  Extremely responsive.  From the time you click open or close in the app to the hub responding is just the blink of an eye.  Also, the hub has been very reliable so far.  The only issues I have with it are: mine hasn't actually worked at all with the wink hub.  It will link and will work for a day, but the shortcuts don't work after the first day.  This review would have been five stars if the shortcut would have worked at all.

I lost the remote to my garage a while back and also the replacement after that. Being able to use this device from my phone has been a lifesaver. I like that multiple users can access it as well and the notifications are very useful. It has only lost connection to the WiFi a couple of times and resetting the modem and router easily fixed the issue. I would definitely recommend this product!

It was a quick install thankfully.  For the hub I just use a double sided tape and mount it on top of the garage door machine (thereby skipping the drilling hassle).But I agree with done commenters that the alarm and flashing when closing the door is too much.  Let the app say “Door closing” in a sultry female voice  at least twice would be more than enough.

The communication between the hub, sensor, and app is awful.  The garages will be closed and the app will say they are open which is frightening if you arent at home and dont have a camera in your garage to verify.  Additionally, they may say they are closed when they are actually open which is a really awful false sense of security.  Occasionally the app will say the doors are closed or open correctly.  This means you can have no trust in the app which defeats the purpose of purchasing this product.  Additionally, the sensors like to "error" and then you lose control over the opening or closing feature which requires a physical hard reset.

This is a piece of garbage, it couldn’t even connected to the internet I tried 5 times even with someone from product support, it didn’t work. This product is bad, and it is advertised as universal compatible with any brand of garage opener, which is not true. Thanks the customer service representative was nice enough to refund my money.

Sometimes it works, sometimes it just says "Garage door opening" for over a minute (without the door moving) and then just times out.  What is the possible use of a garage door opener that works intermittently?  Does not seem ready for prime time.

It worked great until I cut the power for 10 minutes while I installed it in the ceiling. Now it has great WiFi reception, but won’t control the garage door. I’ve tried to reset the device and reconnect to my garage door opener following the instructions closely, but it never is able to reconnect to my Chamberlain garage door opener.
It was easy to install, configure and go live with.  Now if I ever leave the garage open it alerts me, and we can easily shut the garage.

I love the fact that this is set up so you can have multiple times a night where the door will automatically close if it is left open.  And the remote status / control is awesome - NO MORE do I have to drive back to my house and check to be sure I closed the garage door.  Love it.  I just bought another one for my lake house.

1) The device needs to be installed 4-6 feet from the garage opener, which might be challenging if there’s no power outlet 2) it says supports HomeKit but no where in the setup and there is no code or QR for HomeKit setup. Otherwise it does work using a dedicated IOS app. The unit flashed and beeps before closing so that’s nice touch.

I'm extremely happy with this purchase.  I sometimes wonder as I'm down the hill if I remembered to shut the garage door.  This makes it easy.  You just look at the app on your phone.After initial set up the app was malfunctioning on my phone.  I watched the video and a simple relocation of the hub away from the garage door opener unit solved the problem.

This was so simple to install. The MyQ app has amazing ratings on the App Store and is really intuitive and easy to use. I did have a tiny hiccup and had to call support during install - and was amazed at the quick phone answer and very knowledgeable tech I spoke with. Really a neat product!

I have the Smart Garage hub for my double garage door and I bought this for my single garage door. For some reason though, this sensor is synced to the double door so they open and close together....which is worthless to me. I have tried a sensor reset to no avail. I've emailed tech support twice and have not received any feedback.

I purchased this item to guard against accidentally leaving the garage door open. In order to achieve this result I had to schedule 48 door closure events (i.e. every hour on the half hour). A better user interface would permit the user to schedule an automatic door closure when the door has been open for a configurable period of time. For example, automatically close the door anytime it has been open for more than 30 minutes.
This is a wonderful convenience when it works. At least once per month we have to reset it as the sensor has an error.

Unfortunately I could not get it to work with the Genie garage door opener. The APP can just tell me if the door is open or closed but cannot open or close it. In the future I am sure it will work if I buy a Chamberlain garage door opener. But that will not be for many years. Too bad. I really was looking forward to it.

Look this up before you buy.  We saw our brand of garage door listed and thought we were good.  Had a friend recommend it.  After much frustration of not getting it to work, researched much deeper and found out it only works with certain models of our brand and it's very vague on which models.
