If you have a garage door opener it will work with, my friend said it's great.  Not so great otherwise.  Company was very quick at issuing a return.  Thank you for that.

This is beyond easy to install! I didn’t want to drill holes in my garage so I just used command strips instead and it worked out perfectly! It also has a set up to allow Amazon deliveries be left in my garage instead of the porch, which will work out perfect for the holiday season!

Amazingly easy to convert a non-MyQ garage opener without buying a new opener.It was very easy to install. Did not need electric knowledge other than finding a location to install. All things required were part of the package including double sided Velcro tape. Instructions were simple and easy to complete.

Don't waste you money or time. The Google and IFTTT "integration" doesn't open the garage door for you. The whole purpose I bought the thing was for the ability to open the door when on my motorcycle with Google Assistant. So now I'm hunting for a different solution.

I have the MyQ hub and sensor combo originally and love it. Have had that for over a year. I bought a second sensor for my other 2 car garage and this sensor is giving me grief. It’s more of a burden than convenience. Contacting manufacturer to see if they’ll replace or not.

I took a few tries to install but then worked perfectly. This was an add-on sensor for our existing myQ.  It works perfectly. We have alerts set so each time one of the garage doors open or close as we get a push notification to the phone.

This is a nice, simple device to monitor your garage door and open/close it from anywhere. You can customize alerts to be notified if the garage is left open at certain times during the day, and/or for more than a specified amount of time. It has come in very useful to make sure that kids close the garage door when they leave for school each morning. It was a bit tricky to get the wi-fi set up. The first time I tried to set it up, my wi-fi router couldn't find the device. The next day, I tried again and it connected with no problem. I haven't had any issues after the set up.

This product totally lived up to my expectations. It was very simple to install, with very comprehensive instructions. In total it took around ten minutes.  Seamless integration to our wifi.The app is effective although it requires touch access to open each time on my phone.

It is easy to install and I can use my phone to open the garage door. I have never try to see if it work with my Alexa or Google. But the reason I take one star off is the battery life. I have install it almost half a year and use it almost twice a day in a daily basis.  Now,It is requiring me to change the battery for the sensor. I am not sure if it is only happen to my device only. Other than that it is very convenient to have it installed especially I always forget if I close my garage doors or not.

I purchased this product to control all features of my garage via voice.  I was very disappointed to find out that the main thing I wanted to do with it,  open the garage door by voice is not a feature due to security reasons.  Everything else works fine,  but I do not like having to open my app and find the button to open my garage when I get home.I feel this is an easy fix with a pin code or password set in Google voice that would allow them to know it was me that used the voice command.

Even though Genie is listed as compatible, it would not link to my opener.  It offered a "monitor only" option that would tell me if my door was open or closed, but would not allow me to use any of the features that I bought it for.  I returned it

Was a bit apprehensive from other reviews but this was very easy to install and sync to the door opener. Connectivity and range is good, it’s probably 100 feet away from my router and has not lost connection. Can’t speak to the smart home integrations since I don’t do those, but the app is simple and straightforward and allows you to add family and guests.Great peace of mind!

Was given as a gift. Installation was quick and easy. MYQ-G0301 system works well. However, attempts to integrate with Amazon Alexa was time-consuming. Should be able to integrate with smart home devices easily. Happy with the workaround and performance of the garage door opener.

It was much simpler to install than we anticipated. We had to do a second order to get a second sensor for the second garage door because I did not listen to the home electronics guru. It is nice to have on my iPhone, no more trying to remember if I closed the garage door, and if I didn't, I can do it from the i-phone.

This worked for a few weeks, however it slowly stopped being accurate. It would say the garage was open so I would close it on the app and then go out and it would have opened it (and vice versa). I couldn’t trust that if it said it was open and to close it that it was actually open. We haven’t used it since because it was so unreliableWould NOT recommend.

The system is very nice when working, It stops responding at random times. I had to factory reset the device 3 times in less than a month so I will discontinue to use it today because the MyQ system is not reliable when I have a strong connection in my garage and I'm fed up with the "guessing game"

Great system.  I have a 20 year old LD050 Linear garage door opener.  The remote was shot and I didn’t want to buy another one.  Mostly because I hated carrying it on my walks.  I always have my phone so I thought this system would be nice.  The package arrived just before noon and I had the system installed and working before 1pm.  Download the app and follow the simple instructions.  This is going to be nice!

We travel and when a neighbor let us know our garage door was open and our son had to leave work to close it we realized this was a product we needed. It works great. The only 4 star is because uTuve rather than company helped us when we had an issue.

If you're anything like me and often forget to close the garage door before going to bed then you will love this product too.  So easy to install and connect to WiFi and smartphone... And so affordable!  Way worth the peace of mind you get when that message comes to you that your garage door is closing!

I bought another brand first. OHD anywhere or something. Install was a medium challenge. Never worked. Not compatible. Tried to check compatibility first but couldn’t and gave up.MyQ took a couple minutes learning the install and a couple minutes to install. Super easy. Worked the first time. I did use the install screws from the other unit for the hub base plate and mounted to garage door bracket. I hate drilling into sheet rock.

Really good / easy.  Tried an off-brand model before this, and it was not compatible (thankfully).  This model is super easy to install.  No wires required for main unit or door sensor.  App isn’t great, but it’s sufficient.

I needed something to let me know whether the garage door was open or closed when I drove away all the time. This was the ticket. Additionally it works perfect to open and close the garage with my phone regardless of how far away I am or my location. The app is easy to download and works perfectly. Highly recommended.
Pros:1. Not hard to set up
I would give it zero star if I could.This thing is great when it works, until it doesn't.

not the fault of the garage opener itself; my WiFi doesn't reach very down my yard to the garage. I love knowing if anyone opens my garage (even if they use the keypad). It can also make a great prank if your mother in law stops by your house and you are unaware!! installation worked even on our older door opener and we were happily surprised

We use this through the app on our phones. Can open the garage from anywhere! Have a kid locked out of the house no problem.  Want to go for a walk but not carry house keys..easy enough just use the app to open and close the garage.

I don't use Alexa.  Only purpose for me was to be able to tell if Garage was closed when I was away.  If I forgot.  If my wife forgot. If the cleaning lady got it closed.  If the cat blocked closing as I drove away.

I love this thing. It took me about 25 min to be up and running. Directions not great, but with a little know how, you'll be fine. Just be sure not to hold the 'learn' button too long, otherwise you will have to reprogram your remote, as it will 'forget' and start fresh only working for the app. Other than that,  this is kust what I was looking for.

This system works flawlessly and the app is also intuitive.  Love being able to see status of my garage door through my phone, set alerts for open/close and when the door has been open for longer than a specific period of time.  My only wish is that it had integration to Alexa or Apple HomeKit

What a P.O.S.!!!  From the moment the unit was powered on, it failed to perform correctly, according to the setup instructions in the app.  Resetting the unit also did not work.  Attempting to get support by tapping the Support icon, as instructed in the app, also did not work.  I’m done!

This was simple to install, and now I have control over my two garage doors.  I love that I can set it to automatically close at a certain time in the evening.  (In the past, I've accidentally left my garage door open overnight and things have gotten stolen.)  I also like setting the app to notify me when the garage doors are opened throughout the day.  I'm very happy with this product.

I used to have to take my  garage door opener remote from my car when I rode my bike. That worked until I lost the remote on one of my rides. Now I can close and open the door with the app on my phone which is much more convenient. I can also check to see that the door is closed whenever and where ever I am. The system was easy to install and to link to our garage door opener.

Very easy to install and intuitive setup. The reason I gave it less than five stars is features I had on other units like geofencing were priceless features for me, the fact that I didn’t need to tell the garage door to open when I come home was priceless. Living in a townhouse everyone passes through the garage.  If this isn’t important to you I would highly recommend this unit.

I usually struggle setting up wireless stuff and I expected to do the same with this considering my garage only has a two bar signal from my wifi because it is detached from the house but the hub picked up the signal quick and synced with the sensor on the first try as well.  It's a pretty cheap upgrade to my old garage door opener and works like it costs three times as much.

setup was a little tricky but we beat it into submission :-)!  Now i love it- i can control opening/closing from anywhere which is helpful because from my car door to the kitchen, i've forgotten all about the garage.  Then, after relaxing a bit and then i remember...  'did I close the garage door???', i can just look at my phone and voila!!!  especiall helpful in bad weather and if your garage is a bit away from your house.

I can remember way too many nights waking up in the dark and wondering if the garage door is down. Not anymore. My iPad or iPhone will let me know quickly - and allows me to shut the garage door if I had forgotten to earlier. It works every time. I'll soon try out some of the other features, but this alone was worth the cost and installation to me.

The whole purpose of the product is to be able to know if door is opened or closed. And to be able to open or close remotely if needed.Well it worked fine for a week then sent me alert saying door was open. Upon checking the door was Not open plus the alert kept me from operating remotely.

I love this. I am always worried that I forgot to close my garage door on my way too work, but with this device all I need to do is open the ap and check. If I for some reason did forget I just push the button from wherever I am and close it. Great value and worth it to keep my mind at ease.

I was worried that because my garage was a Liftmaster that I would have at least some friction when installing this. Pleasantly, that wasn't the case. Setup was very easy and the app works perfect. Didn't setup anything with Alexa or Google Assistant, but as a stand alone option on your smartphone it works great.

Our garage door opener is a Liftmaster with a MyQ marking on the side.  This remote was quick to install...the app and online YouTube video were helpful.  We have the app installed on two Android phones and we both get an alert when the door is opened.  If we need to open the door to let someone in, it is done with a click on the phone app.  Quite useful and at a great special price.

This thing works fantastically! I love being able to open my garage door with my phone. It was easy to install. It works with our wireless. The only thing is if the electricity goes out then we couldn’t get in the house through the garage. All in all I am more than pleased with this purchase.

Overall works really well.  I wish it had better integration with smartthings or google home (not just google assistant).Setup was pretty straightforward, except for when it locked up trying to join wifi.  Something got locked up when registering it to my account.  Had to wait a few days for it to allow me to properly join the wifi and register it again.  Other than that, super easy setup and install with my existing liftmaster garage door opener.

Works good, had a 1 year of api automation cloud hook for GH and IFTTT. Biggest issues was no mention of needing to log into the manufactures website to activate the 1 year. I’m hoping this will stay free after the promotion, only time will tell.As for the function everything works, easy to install, I had to press the program button a few times since the programming on the  garage door opener expires after 30 seconds. Once programmed it worked as advertised. I was worried about the heat affecting it since the garage is hot, but so far so good.

Easy enough to install, but it stopped working reliably after a few months. I had to move the sensor on the door to the center to get it closer to the base. It works solid now, but troubleshooting the issue was annoying.

The reason I bought this unit was because my wife drives off and leave the garage door open at times but now I know when she opens it I know when she closes it even I sometimes leave it open now if I drive off I can just hit the button and you tell me if my garage doors open or closed great unit thumbs up all five stars
If you need more than one garage door opener,  buy this instead! You can add up to three phones to open the garage... from anywhere!

It took 4-6 tries for the garage door opener to recognize the device, so keep hitting the reset button on your door opener until it kicks in. Other than that its a great device for the price $30, records when door has been opened and closed, allows you to close door if you are away from home.

Worked as needed - did have to plug it into another plug - I think it interfered with the reception - they do mention sometimes you have to put it further away - wire plenty of length - I mounted on garage wall near the top and plugged it in to a different outlet

It's utterly unacceptable that the long and loud "door closing" alarm on the the MyQ cannot be disabled.  Once I learned that it can't be disabled it was back in the box on it's way back to Amazon.  Sorry, but on top of the incessant beeping, every time I would use this I would have to deal with the wife complaining about how loud it is and the fact that my kids will think they are burning alive each time the garage door closes.  No thank you.

App says garage door is open.  Its actually closed! When you close the door it beeps and its loud and annoying. Tried to reach customer support. Good luck with that. Finally able to figure how to contact support,  but its been 4 days and no response.

The MyQ I received works just like it's supposed to.  If you download the MyQ app and set up an account, the app will walk you through a very simple pairing & installation.  It takes about 15 minutes.  I have a 16' door & a 9' door so I purchased a 2nd sensor and it also was very easy to add & pair.  You can open, close, & check the position of either door from anywhere that has cell service.

The garage door opener works great but it does not integrate with Alexa. I can open and close with my iPhone but I am used to asking Alexa to do things for me. I found out you can write a script on IFTTT AND DID THAT BUT I RATHER GO THROUGH ALEXA DIRECTLY.

I have a detached garage with a Chamberlain C205 opener. It is MyQ compatible. I bought this because there are times when I ask myself, "did I close the garage door?" The installation was very simple. You just follow what the app tells you to do. Since I have a detached garage, I needed to purchase a wifi extender for MyQ to work well. Now I can see when my garage is open and closed.

Amazing...that's it just amazing. I'm fairly good at electrical installs and computer repair. But was a little apprehensive when it came to this install. What a breeze. Only problem I had was on 1st linking the sensor. And door closed.  My wife's car's auto start activated. Not good to have a closed garage door with a running auto inside. I did call customer service and was assured that it couldn't happen with the frequency that MyQ used. But it did. The add on sensor for a Genie opener was a concern but worked flawlessly. But it also (on 1st opening after linking activated the auto start). Maybe has something to do with the Bluetooth linking 1st time.  Again, hasn't repeated and very happy with it and the app.

I have several of these on my garage doors. Any change in temperature will make them stop working. After a full restart to the system they will work for a day or so, then back to nothing. Waste of time and money.

The system works as advertised.  Simple to install using the app but don't follow the video as it is wrong, as it leaves out essential information.  My one major disappointment is that it is not compatible with Amazon Alexa.  I would love to have the voice control and the audio notification that is available with Alexa.

I thought this product is compatible with Genie garage door opener 2016 model serial no starting with 1636. I have spent so much time trying to configure this product. Attempted several times per day for 3 days. Finally called Chamberlain, they said - This product is not compatable with 2016 Genie. They should have advertised that before hand. I read comparability well before buying.

If I could rate it zero I would. Setup was insane. Spent 3/4 of a day trying to set it up. It worked for a few hours then went offlline, we called customer service next day. She was very helpful and tried to get it online. After about an hour it worked. Notifications weren't working properly on the app. We had to do it on our PC and they still didn't work all of the time. Sent it back the next day. Worse product ever. PS the instructions that come with it are a joke. I had to google info over the internet for help.

Setup the first time was easy enough, though the app seemed a little buggy.  After installation, the device would only update the position of the door sensor intermittently, though it would successfully operate the opener.  I decided to factory reset the device and run through the setup process again.  The second attempt at setup went smoothly connecting to my wireless network and to the door sensor, but it would never successfully pair with the opener again.  My opener is a fairly new chamberlain model and have had no issues pairing other remotes in the past.  This device is a waste of time and money, I'll be looking for another device to replace it.

In the era of package thiefs I feel this is a must have. I am afraid of unintended consequences of having my garage on IOT as well, but the devil that I know is forcing my hand. Not into being a victim for someone's drug habits or whatever.Install's a synch. Interface is simple.

Getting the latest  technology for remote control management of a garage door without without replacing the garage door motor drive-what's not  to like? The most difficult chore associated with installing the MyQ Garage Door Opener is making sure that the garage door opener is compatible with this product.  Enjoy!

First, let me start out that I would have given this a 5 star but because it is NOT Apple Homekit ready I docked it down. This had nothing to do with the vendor I bought it from. I am very tech-savvy so I was able to get it to work with Apple Homekit by using Homebridge. If you just google "install HomeBridge" you will find all you need if you are technical.The MyQ works flawlessly and I will never have a home without it. The app works great and you do get notifications as it is opening and closing. This is a no brainer at 20 bucks mark!!

I like this device. It upgraded my garage door so I can close it remotely when I forget as I'm leaving. The app is useful but very basic. It doesn't work with Alexa at this point. It doesn't even have Amazon as a company you can link your account to except; it does have Amazon Key. Only useful if it's available in your area.

I am totally pleased with this purchase.  It is a good value and gives me "peace of mind" in at least a couple repeat circumstances.  When I leave distracted and wonder a few blocks away, or further down the road, "did I close the garage door?"  I can quickly check and close the door.  I also receive notice if the garage door has been open for an extended amount of time (amount can be chosen).  More than once family members have forgotten to close the door when they come in the house.  Now I can close remotely, or follow up as I see fit.Additionally it was easy to install, and I am not a super experienced handy chick.

Once I got started total set up time was about 30 minutes.  Would have been less if I read directions first.  My garage door opener is a 2005 Genie.  Setup and activation was very quick and trouble free.  Able to monitor door position and open/close remotely.  Very satisfied.

Very easy to install and it was much quicker than I expected. The only complaint is the Alexa integration. It is possible but you have to download a third party app then add a routine in that app then add that apps skill in Alexa. It was somewhat confusing

The installation process is very simple, and it doesn't take long before I get it up and running.  So far, I have tested the schedule door close, and that works well.  It even alerted me when the door was not properly close after the command was sent to the garage door opener.  If you have a garage door, you need to get this thing.

The sensor keeps getting stuck saying the garage is open and when its closed it just losses track of the status of the door. The integration with Alexa is really bad (no actual alexa skill for it but have to go through third party), Finally the door sensor battery only lasts a few weeks. Very dissapointed!Some advise, if you are buying this dont pay more than ~$20 for it, the price keeps changing every time, saw it go from 49 to 20 in a span of 2 weeks or so!

Easy to install. Its pretty cool using your phone anywhere to open the garage. Also I have linked to amazon so when theres something I ordered expensive. I tell them to put it in the garage and they have access to open and close it. 👍

Works well, occasionally the sensor indicates indiactes the opposite. Shows door up when door down, so I used the app to put the door down and it went up. Hasn't happened in a while so the app updates must have resolved. Camera integration would resolve concerns about that. Great for getting Amazon Key deliveries.

I use this product for my home. Both my wife & I love it. I have it integrated into my Honeywell Security System TC 2.0 remote services platform. Best on line install guide I have used on any product. Even has Video clips with install instructions. Every friend or neighbor that has seen ours, wants one.

Have to pay a fee to integrate with IFTTT which sucks but i did get it for less than $30 on prime day so not terribly upset. Haven't had an issue yet and the schedule works good but the alerts are the best. I setup a custom alert to notify if door has been open longer than X amount of time. Makes it nice to be able to just remotely close it if needed.

I bought this because I have 2 garage doors. The first one works great. Trying to get the hub to recognize this 2nd door separately is IMPOSSIBLE. The best I have been able to do is set the app to open both doors at the same time. VERY DISAPPOINTED

It is very easy to install and functions just as described for me and my deliveries. It only takes a few minutes to install. I think the only con is the loud beeping but I'm sure it's just a safety feature. Either way it's great. I dont understand the negative. Some just can't be pleased.

Was very simple to install and connect. It’ll you can program it to shut at a certain time in case you forget to close it. Gives you piece of mind knowing your garage is closed just by looking at your phone when you are away from home. You can open and close the garage door from anywhere with your phone.

I have always worried about leaving the garage door open. And I usually have to drive back home to check, sometimes even from 2 miles away. For such a small amount of money, I am happy to have solved this problem. I thought about a camera, but it will only show me the door without solving the problem.It took me less than 30 minutes to install the system, including the app. I tested it from many miles away and it works perfect. Completely satisfied with this product. Highly recommend it.

Super easy step-by-step instructions. I have 2 different openers made by competitor company Genie. One has the old rolling code software. One has the new encrypted software. This Chamberlain system setup was quick and painless. So one Smart Hub controls and monitors two different openers perfectly. I highly recommend this product!

If you plan on integrating this with your Google Home Assistant and saying "Hey Google, Open (or close) my garage door".. NOT GONNA HAPPEN!The integration sucks and to top it off they charge you a subscription fee to link with Google.. My bet is Amazon wants the device for its Alexa eco system.. Either way, device works as advertised but sucks with Google Assistant integration which is basically a gateway from Google to the MyQ Voice Assistant which makes you repeat your command again (and sometimes again after that..)

My fiance always makes us turn around when she cant remember if the garage door is closed. I bought her this so that she can look at her phone and it will tell her if it is closed or not. If not, she can close it remotely from her phone. I have it linked to my phone so I can tell when she has made it in safely at night from work.

This thing is awesome it works great super easy to install you don’t have to use the mounting kit if you don’t want to you can use command picture frame sticky’s. I haven’t tried it with Alexa yet but works super great on my iPhone XR

When I purchased my home a few years ago I put a craftsman smart garage door openner on my home.  Craftsman stopped working so I purchased the myq attachment. It only took 30 minutes to install it and it works great. I'm very happy to have more control of my garage door.

Disregard the negative reviews! I have an Apple phone and from unboxing the unit to fully installed , it took me less than 20 minutes. It is working flawlessly and I have a total of 6 led bulbs in my garage and have no problems with interference. I also like the alarm that beeps when the door is coming down. Now I can have Amazon deliver my packages in my garage instead of sitting on the front porch!

I wanted something simple but efficient.  When we are away from the house and turn and ask each other 'did you close the garage door?' it is demoralizing.  Now we can just look and make sure without coming home to see.  The price was also a pleasant surprise.  Thank you.

This is supposed to work with HomeKit. It says it’s what makes my garage door opener work with HomeKit . Well they lied. You have to buy a separate adapter. Be careful if you’re buying this to connect to your Apple products.
Plan on an hour or more of trial and error to get it all working.  If you are running Google Home the integration will work, sort of, but not seamlessly.  Product will not display on Google Hub.

This is my second Hub for another home.  I purchased the two door package for this one.  Install took about 20 minutes total for both doors.  Works perfectly so far.  Have used it to let in post control guy while gone, again perfect.  I highly recommend this as a solid solution for access and peace of mind.

I used this Chamberlain garage door opener to remotely control the door when I’m on vacation, allowing my dog sitter easy access. I can also check to see if the door is open or not while I’m at work in case one of my kids leave it open. Set up of the product was very easy and it works as advertised. I would highly recommend it
BEWARE!  Chamberlain requires a paid subscription to use the Google, Alexa and IFTTT integration. I would have never purchased this if I had known.

This is an internet enabled device and wireless to your LiftMaster/Chamberlin opener.  MUCH MUCH easier to instal than thos needed by the "Genie" opener and ONLY a power connector needed.  From App download until the first test of the opener took me a whole 15 minutes, much of which was drilling the holes in the garage ceiling!

Works great but needs a garage left open alert.  You can set alerts to tell you if someone opens or closes the door but there is no apparent way to alert you if say the door is open between 9-10 PM.  It seems like a simple fix that I hope they add to the app. Set up and install was easy.

Great idea, too bad it's so unreliable. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. Strong WiFi signal but no response from unit. Sometimes it even flashes the light and beeps, as if it's going to work, but does nothing else. System doesn't notify you if the door is left open, as it says on the commercial. I would recommend that you not waste your money on this product.

Did work with my garage door opener. I looked for compatibility and Chamberlain listed Genie ReliG, but later was told my opener was a newer version and thus wouldn't work.Edit: Moved to a new house, but again had a Genie opener of a different model. And again, the general guidence is that this hub would work, so I bought it again. Upon setup, the hub just would not pair with the opener, no matter what method I did. So, I returned it, again.

It installed in 10 minutes and works great every time! Love not having to have a garage door opener in my car (so anyone can just break into my car and have access to my house). I also love that it tells you how long your garage door has been shut or opened.  Would recommend!

The complaints about the product are true, "it randomly opens and closes".  It was easy to install and all, but afterwards it randomly opened and closed.  We tried resetting, we tried investigating when it opened to figure out the issue; nothing ever came to light or resolved the issue.  Today I tore the thing down and will wait until a better product comes out.  Do not buy.

This controller works really well if your opener is compatible. It can be difficult to figure out, however. It took me about 4 hours of research to figure out that it won't work with mine.Having said that, I saved about $10 and bought a competitor that works better.

I was a little concerned about compatibility (I won’t post my manufacturer, but it was listed as maybe not supported on the Chamberlain site). However, it was easy to test and confirm that the MyQ device does work, and it works well. I love knowing that I can check whether or not I left the garage door open...and close it if necessary, using my smartphone, wherever I am. It’s very early (only installed a few days ago), but I’m very satisfied with this product.

I got the hub to pair with my first opener (Overhead Odyssey 1000) after many tries. With each try I moved the hub closer to the opener and they paired at about 3 feet away. My second opener is 20 feet from the first (a fairly standard 3-car garage with 1 double door and 1 single door). I had called Chamberlain's support number and John assured me that if the hub was inside the garage, it would work at 20 feet. I figured I would split the difference and place it between each opener at 10 feet to either one. Sadly this is too far. Neither would work at 10 feet so I sent the unit back and bought a Genie Aladdin Connect that hard-wires to either the openers or the wall buttons. Problem solved.

I got it as a gift and installed it quite easily, the hardest part was having to carry up my heavy ladder from the basement.  It really works well so I got the second transmitter for my other garage door.  I like that I can share control with family or friends.

I bundled it with my chamberlain which was installed prior to 2015, doesn’t have built in WiFi. It is a great extension letting you be able to control your garage door system from your mobile. However, it doesn’t support Alexa also the beeping time is way too long before closing the door. I feel the purpose is to alarm people to be away from door area when closing but this is definitely something needs improvement.

I almost returned the opener after I read posting about "hidden charges" I installed and works like a charm. What I like the most is the "closing programing" it eliminate the possibility of leave the garage open all day on when you forget after living for work

This was very easy to install and set up. We did it within 10 minutes and it works like a dream. I enjoyed being able to open the garage remotely when I was at work for a company to work on my garage door.

This doesn't work. Initially it says monitor only mode after a spending close to an hour with configuration. Later it was able to connect without the monitor only mode label, however it won't open/close my garage. Not worth the money at all.

I love this device because It links with "Amazon Key "so when I get a Amazon delivery the driver is able open and close my garbage door with his app and leave my packages safely inside my garbage without giving out a permanent passcode or access to inside my home

I added this to my Chamberlin garage door opener. The install was beyond easy. The app walks you through every step of the way and it just worked perfectly. I do wish you could  integrate it to apple home without having to buy an additional $60 worth of parts though.

I was super happy with the install process. Easy and quick with good video each important step of the way. Good job to the engineering and dashing teamHowever note that there is a “premium subscription” to use with google assistant. That is pretty stupid. Right now it is a limited time free. If they ever charge for it I will immediately bring this down to 1 Star cause that is a pretty customer hostile approach

Pretty easy to install.  Didn't have any trouble getting the sensor to pair with the hub, getting the hub to connect to my network, or for the hub to learn my garage door opener.  It would be nice if there was integration with Smartthings--but I knew it didn't when I bought it.  Software needs updating though because it didn't list my garage door opener as being compatible though the website did.

Easy to install and operate from your phone, anywhere your phone can access data. Description is very accurate and the app is simple to use, I bought the kit and wish it would of included names of manufacturer's that make compatible devices to use with the hub. Guess that's what Google is for, great product.

This is awesome. I love how easy it was to install. I don’t have to keep triple pressing my key pad to open my garage door. Since I bought this house the last home owner did not leave me any remotes. So I have been using the key pad. Not any more. Definitely recommend this to anyone.

You can open and close this all day long through the MyQ app, however, if you want to use "Ok, google Close Tell MyQ to close the Garage door" you'll get a message to pay a subscription to do that.The 30$ Amazon Credit is a hassle to get too.

I connected this to my chamberlain garage door opener. It was very easy to install: a couple short videos inside the app to guide me step-by-step. Simple mounting of the garage door remote unit with Velcro. Simple mounting of the main power unit near the garage door opener itself. The app is easy to operate… Very happy!

If you can get to this work - good for you.  The videos are straight forward except for one thing - the app does not look anything the one demonstrated in the video.  Not a big deal as the app is simple enough to figure out.  I had to follow the pair/reconnect the hub/sensor/garage opener (Liftmaster by Chamberlain)/wifi 3 separate times.  The system would work fine for 30 min - 1 hour, then no longer operate.  The fourth try, I just re-paring the hub and the garage opener - the system operated for 30 min and then stopped working.  Sending back for refund and will try a competitors product.

Great product but it is not compatible with Alexa.  Besides that I love it.  I can open/close my garage door from anywhere and if I forget to close it I get a reminder.  It the door is open too long or too late at night it closes it's self.  Just wish it was compatible with Alexa.
The worst instructions I've ever seen. They don't know the difference between Bluetooth and WiFi. As a senior software QA Engineer I'd fire whomever came up with their deplorable instructions.

I bought this for my new house where prior owners had not kept their garage opener manuals.  AND I read reviews mentioning Alexa integration.  So imagine my surprise when there was no Alexa bridge in my purchase.  Apparently Chamberlain pulled this feature.  There’s a workaround, but it’s tricky and unstable. It works, but not consistently.  Disappointed.

If you drive away from your home and can’t remember if you closed the garage door. This product is for you. I get notified when it opens or closes and a notice a few minutes later telling me it’s still opened or closed. You open or close remotely from the app. Easy setup
Pointless.  Don’t buy. It doesn’t integrate with Siri or Alexa.  You will have to open up an app every time you want to use it.  I struggle to find any benefit.

I have a Craftsman garage door opener, but for some reason I am having the hardest time pairing this with it. Which leads me to believe that my model opener is not compatible with this device. So the claim that it works with Craftsman openers made 2005 or newer is false. I will keep trying but I am not hopeful at this point.

Fairly straight forward install instructions, just remember there are three radio connections, the 318 Mhz remote, the bluetooth 2.4 Ghz and the WiFi 2.4 Ghz that the hub needs to make to the motor/receiver, door sensor and your WiFi router.  At first the alarm from the hub caused me to think the setup fail, since it only goes upon the closing command from the phone and not the open door command from the phone.  It is slower than the car and keypad remotes, but not significantly.

Easy to install, easy to setup, easy to use. Great for knowing when someone gets home or leaves the house when you set it to send you notifications.  We no longer need to leave a spare key for the housekeeper; she texts us when she shows up and we can open the garage for her from wherever we are. Then she just closes the garage on her way out. Great for piece of mind.

It’s not made clear this device *requires* a cloud based account with continuous internet access for basic functionality.The terms and conditions of use are to my mind onerous for such a device, and giving remote access to my house is unacceptable based on them

Easy to use app, simple interaction, and product which is of good quality. You can't go wrong with this. You have to install one piece with the garage to check open and close and one with the wall with power and wifi.

The product is great once you get it setup!  Easy to use and very useful. Missing from the directions is an explanation that when you first power up the unit you need to connect your phone to a WiFi ssid created by the unit to start the process. Read the other reviews for more info if you have trouble installing!

Even though my garage door opener was listed as compatible this just would not work. I can sync my opener with other 3rd party openers and my truck's home link system but after 3-4 days of trying and talking to support I gave up trying to get this to link. Returned.

Very easy installation. Doesn't work with Alexa.  Loses wireless signal frequently.  Won't reconnect for long periods of time due to server-end issues.  I have a Nest Cam and an Echo at the garage that never have connection issues. This thing does constantly.  And customer service is only available during work hours on weekdays. I would not buy this again.
Didn’t work on sommer and chamberlain garage doors. Low budget, no support impossible to write an email for help, very surprised it’s a major company selling at Amazon with no return email.

works great. mine is just a little shy from WiFi. so had to get a repeater so i can connect to the APP from the car outside of the garage. Would be nice if it could open and close away from home. other than that its great! emails me or text. that my garage is closed when i leave the house or people come over and open the garage. And gives you peace of mind trying to remember 60 miles away from the house if the garage was closed or not.

I followed the quick start guide in the box and the very informative on-screen directions in the app, and got this opener installed and working in about 30 minutes.  Definitely one of the better out-of-the-box experiences I've had in a while.  It also linked up with my Honeywell Total Connect app to allow for automation.  (It does not, however, show up as a Z-wave device on my Honeywell Lyric Panel.)While I can't take any stars off from it since it's an intentional safety feature, I can say that the siren this thing emits when activated is a bit annoying.  Fortunately, the case is easy to open, and the piezoelectric buzzer is very accessible and simple to remove.  (I de-soldered mine from the board, but you could also just rip it out.)

After install it seemed to only work intermittently. Using the app, sometimes the unit just wouldn't respond at all. In some instances when trying to close via the app, the unit would beep and flash as though it was about to close the door, but then wouldn't. It would just beep in perpetuity. A garage door opener that I can't count on to open or close my garage door isn't useful.

Family members keep leaving our doors open. I added this to be able to remotely monitor the position of the doors. It took a few tries to get each opener to sync (the directions indicated it might). After setup, I have not had to touch either opener. Works great with my Genie and Chamberlain. Strongly recommend this.

Installation was a breeze. Liked it so much that I purchased another sensor for the additional garage. Love all the features including ability to share a one-time or multiple-time code with friends and/or neighbors for us.You can rescind anytime you would like.

Took some work to make it work with Alexa but I managed to figure it out. My 2 year old locked my out of our house and now I have no worries about getting back in. As long as your cell has a decent connection, your garage opens effortlessly. Great product.

This thing is freaking cool!!! I love it! Our first time with a garage and we kept forgetting to close it when we left the house, so luckily this alerts you when the garage is left open for a certain amount of time and we can close and open it from anywhere through our phones!

So easy to install and works most of the time.  I only gave 4 stars because the app does have a delay and if you press "close" or "open" too quickly, it will freeze up and then you have to control the garage door by pushing the button.  Just need to be patient with the app.  Overall, it's very convenient and I like the feature of seeing the history of when the door was opened and close (good for monitoring elderly parents).UPDATE:  the device loses its connection frequently and has to paired to the base.  A real pain.

Pretty sweet little option for the garage door that didn’t come with reminder to shut your garage. Only thing I would like to see is maybe a timed option that after so many minutes it will shut automatically rather than a predetermined hour mark. Overall good product.

The very first thing in the product description should be in all caps: NOT COMPATIBLE WITH ALEXA. I assumed (my bad) that because it said it was Amazon SmartKey (or whatever it's called), that meant Alexa compatible too.  I saw that this was asked in the questions and the manufacturer said they were working on a third-party app that would work with Alexa.  That was in 2017!! Where's the app, guys??

I already own a Chamberlain garage door opener. This hub (and an Add-on sensor) allows me to control and monitor my existing Chamberlain garage door opener and my 2 older Genie garage door openers. It is nice to be able to check the status of all 3 doors with MyQ and share access with family members.

After install if the door closes but your app says it’s open don’t use the app make sure that you use your garage door opener because the garage door will open and stay open and you’ll get an air in the appThis also happened to me when a driver could not close the door so what I did was install a button to close the garage door close to the exit of the overhead so the driver can just push the button to close it hopefully the next firmware update will fix the strange issues happening
Awesome product. Purchased mainly because I found myself second guessing myself if I closed the garage door.Unfortunately, Alexa integrations is not yet available for my address.

As mentioned this device does what it's advertised to do.  I was really surprised at how easy the setup and installation was.  I often experience that these types of WiFi devices don't always setup as easy as they should and you have to fiddle with them to get them working correctly.  I had this installed in probably less than 20 minutes.

Setup for this product was very easy. We set it up over the weekend on our single-car garage door and didn't run into any issues. It took maybe 30-45 minutes to install. I have a problem where I get to work in the morning and wonder "did I shut the garage door?" even if I checked it 3 times before I left. No more worrying! More than anything, this gives me peace of mind. It's also great in case my husband and I ever forget our keys or garage door opener (which we share and sometimes forget to give to the other person when they need it). Problem solved. Sanity saved. Also a very reasonable price for a cool home gadget.

I purchased this to protect the expensive items we keep in our garage.  It allows us to open/close the garage from anywhere and receive notifications when it's opened/closed or left open. The app is easy to use.  The installation was mostly easy, except I did have to restart the app twice so it would load the next step.

I have a 1996 Craftsman opener.  Everything went fine on the install (I have excellent wifi coverage in the garage) but the key is to line up the sensor on the garage door with the base.  The instructions told me to put it to the side of the garage door but it should be lined straight up.  Once I did that it has worked perfectly.  With the garage door sensor, a $8 battery will have to be replaced about every 10 to 12 months.  If that battery dies, you will not be able to see if the garage door is open or closed.

Purchased this for my daughter’s garage due to the fact that I could not get the garadget I purchased to work. This, compared to the garadget is pure night and day.So sorry garadget, I was a supporter until now.

You have to have a "learn" button to connect this device. Other products allow you to connect to he wall unit thus eliminate the need to add a new remote using the "learn" button. Support does not help with resolving this issue with a compatibility device like other providers. I suggest you select another competitors product.

Installed in less than 5 minutes.  Very easy.  Make sure your home has a router close enough to connect to the garage.  The app can be set to alert you if the door is open, closed etc.  Follow the directions, and you will have no issue.  I installed the hub in the ceiling next to my door opener.

There are no wires to connect with this option.  It did work with my Liftmaster 1997 era garage door opener.  Had to navigate thru the app a couple of times to get it connected -- it wasn't totally clear.  After pairing with my garage door opener, I had to rotate base unit in its mount because the other direction would not open door at all.  Perhaps the antenna was on one side?  But it has worked well since installed and I have it configured to do a push notification on door close to my android phone; that has worked flawlessly since setup.

So easy to install both the hardware and the app on phones. Set it up for family members. Haven’t had a delivery with amazon yet (as I’m home now during the day) but eventually I will use this feature as well. Works well. Highly recommend.

Works excellent with my Two Genie garage door openers. The mobile app is 100% reliable with great notifications. Only wish it had an automatic connection with Google home. However, using the free IFTTT app, you can get it to work great with Google - no Alexa for me.

The jury is still out on this one. I'm controlling a Chamberlain opener. I have an Ech Dot nearby. Have not yet figured how to pair the devices. I can monitor open/close, but nothing else. This product needs to be perfected. My ADT system does much more, with better tech support.

Love it!  It was easy to install, and it's super easy to use. I like being able to set it to close after a certain time, should I forget.  Nice to be able to open the garage from anywhere for someone to place an item inside if I am not home also

Doesnt actually work with google home as advertised, although it would be extremely easy for their programmers to implement. Google home will only tell you if your garage door is open or closed, that's it. Wont let you open or close it by voice, which was the entire reason I got this thing in the first place. Otherwise, I would have just got a cheaper normal remote.

I purchase this add-on to control second garage door to be used in tandem with my main garage door WiFi controls from MyQ Smart Garage door.Installation was super easy, and integrates with my Google Home without a problem.

I’m a huge techie and have an automated home, so I was looking forward to having this. However the software was buggy and setup kept failing. The app would only allow me to monitor my door but kept telling me it was open when it was actually closed. Trying to re-pair the sensor kept failing, as did a factory reset of the hub. The app tries to connect you to product support but the wait and advice just made the experience more annoying. Returned for a refund.  Too many promises and it doesn’t deliver.Very disappointing.

This was very easy to install and has worked flawlessly. The app works well also, allowing me to remotely control my garage door from anywhere. I wish it worked with Alexa without the additional subscription. Not sure why MyQ wants to achieve by locking smart integrations. Opening it up would give it more goodwill and far less dissatisfied customers.

Ive only had it for a few days but i am becoming increasingly irritated with this product. The sensor has disconnected already several times. Once i had to add the hub to the app from the beginning and the other two times all i had to do was click on the sensor to reconnect to the hub. NONETHELESS IT HAS NOT WORKED THREE TIMES IN A THREE DAY PERIOD.

myQ set on both doors. Both openers are Liftmaster/ Chamberlin and were compatible. Need good wifi signal in garage and the myQ app on your smsrt phone. I have set it up such that if door is left open it will close at 10 PM. Plus you have control over wifi from anywhere

It is very easy to install with great, easy to follow instructions.  The app is easy to use and works great.  It doesn't work with Amazon Alexa.  Setup with Google Assistant was clunky and difficult to follow.  It doesn't seem to play well with other smart home hubs.

I thought I would have trouble installing this but it installed in a few minutes to my Gene opener. I love the fact I can look back and see when it was last closed or opened and it remind me when I leave it open. So happy with this purchase.

I was apprehensive about buying this after reading some of the reviews. I received the item at 8 PM from Amazon delivery open the box read the directions had it installed and working within 15 minutes! I’ve got fluorescent lights and LED lights right next to it and it works perfectly!

Our garage remotes broke and I needed to get a couple more...plus I have a house of 4 drivers. Voila. Go onto the app, click OPEN and it opens. No more need for a remote and I can check if its closed. I wish it would send a notification if the door is open too long, but still a great little device.

I purchased the first unit at my local big box store which included the hub to connect everything to my home network. Adding the extra hub is incredibly easy using the myQ app and the added peace of mind of knowing the garage doors are closed when you headed down the road is invaluable.

The Opener will not attach to my wireless network.  From some reason it does not like my settings which are not all that complicated, however they are complicated enough to make me feel somewhat safe.

A little worried at first on the installation but shouldn't have been. Install was easy with my iPhone and the Genie opener. Took about 30 minutes going slow. Linked to Alexa and now I can check to the status, open and close from inside the house with Alexa or open and close from away. Nice equipment.

I have a garage door thats from 1996 - Genie Intellicode ic250/a model.  I gave it a shot and this product modernized my ancient garage door.Instruction was bit off on the app.  You just have to push learn button on the Garage door control unit once for it to go into rapid blink mode.  Thats it leave it alone and let the unit do its magic to get it to work.

This thing was super easy to install and setup.  I know people reported problems but it seriously was a breeze for me - took me only about 30 mins to install and have up and running.  The integration with Key is awesome.  Integration with Alexa would give it 5 stars.

To star, this product is a PITA to setup. The setup process is buggy and I had to factory default the device numerous times and then do a hard button combination to fix the device to allow it to pair.  Initially I thought the server issues were a result of weaker WIFI connectivity, so I upgraded my house to an enterprise level mesh network with wired backhaul. I have great WIFI coverage inside and out now... Yet the MYQ hub still doesnt have great signal strength... Even just feet from an AP.  Customer service wasn't helpful and after hours of attempting to get it, I took to the chamberlain forum and found many people had to return their device for a new one and it worked. I kept searching and found the fix.I feel that someone with advanced electronics, networking and automation experience should not struggle with this device setup. The lack of Alexa support that is once had is disheartening. I think I may give this one to my parents and try the NEXX Garage door opener as in my struggles, I discovered that one has bettter support and integration options.

Works great for remotely opening the garage door or for checking to make sure the door is down after I've gone to bed. If you have an iPhone make sure to read the direction before installing the unit. Works perfectly but I could have saved a few minutes if I'd read the directions about using it with an iPhone.

It seems like it will work once I get it set up, but God has it been frustrating to try to get it working. I’ve gone through the set up multiple times, each time the opener is clearly connected to the garage door as it opens and closes it several times while syncing, and each time it fails to complete the setup and tells me to call customer service. I still haven’t found time to work in the set up during Chamberlin’s customer service hours. It’s very frustrating.

I had a new garage door installed in my detached garage and it came with myQ and I absolutely.  I started looking into retro fitting my existing garage door opener in my integral garage and I found this device.  It was easy to install and I totally love it.  I love the alerts that let me know when family members come/go as I know they're safe and at home!

We have an overhead door brand opener. Install was a snap. We go for a walk every morning and now no longer need to carry a door opener. I also sent quest connections to our out of town kids and they can now open our garage door when they visit via their phone. Much more flexibility when they come and go.

Would not pair with our garage door opener. I recommend making sure it will do so prior to purchasing. Our opener is not that old and didn’t think we would have any issues unfortunately it acts like it is trying to pair but never finishes.

Alexia integration is a big challenge!! Smart bridge app is supposed to be a good path, but  one cannot complete registration. Looking for other apps  that might accomplish the task. The unit operating independently works great and full control, overall installation easy .

If you are a techie person, you will love this device as much as I do. It was not difficult to install (IF you can read simple directions). I already have it working on my wife's phone and have given guest access to a neighbor who watches our house when we are gone. They are ordering one today!

I bought two for each garage. The first setup was for a Chamberlain Liftmaster it was a little problematic because the button did not correspond with the instructions. I discovered the correct button (Purple) instead of orange by trying every color option. Once, the correct color was selected, it worked flawlessly. The second unit was connected to a Genie effortlessly and works great.

very easy to install. Never wonder if you closed your garage door again, just look at your phone. A thousand miles away from home and expecting a big delivery, look at your phone, open the door, close it when it's delivered. Great unit and great app.

It was very easy to install and connect to the wifi. The app works well but it would be nice if it connected in Apple CarPlay and Android CarPlay so you didn't have to pick the phone up and go to the app and click the button, you could just do it from the car screen.

Installation super simple‼️ I’ve left home with my garage open a number of times and my neighbor told me about myQ.  I’m so glad she did. I no longer have to worry about if my garage door is closed or not and just look on the app and can see for myself. I can also open and close the garage door from anywhere.

Following the instructions made this a pretty easy install. And I love that the app warns me after the garage door is up for more than 15 mins, or after 10pm.$19.99 over Black Friday-easily worth it. Turns any phone into a garage door opener. And more.

Once I got it to work, its worked great, the problem was the setup. I spent over an hour with Chamberlain support and several resets later we were able to get it to work. When i closed the app, it stopped working, so I reprogrammed again and its working fine now.

This works just as well as the fully integrated chamberlain systems that contain this technology in the opener motor itself. I can easily use this to kick off automation in my house when i return home and get notices when i leave it up for a certain amount of time. Exactly what i needed.

I am always a little concerned when I purchase a Universal device. They usually have issues of some kind but I was amazed by how easy this thing was to install. I literally had it up and running in less than 10 minutes. Amazing, ad it works perfectly. Haven't had any issues since I installed it.

I have left my garage door open a few times so I purchased this and so far I really like it. I have it to alert me if the garage door has been open or closed for more than 5 minutes. I can also check to make sure it’s closed on the app. I have not had any problems. I have not tried to pair with Alexa.

Works as described! Semi easy to install. Had to reset all my codes on the opener, then perform the setup and all went well. Added all my remotes/cars and everything worked perfect. App works well and I was able to setup notifications for multiple times as needed. Very nice add on to an existing opener for the added convince and security to check when it’s open or closed.

I've had no issues with unit. It will work with alexa but u MUST use other skills other than MyQ skill. After bypassing MYQ and using the other setup, it's been working flawlessly. It's a little to setup but heck, it's worth the $20 I paid for it on sale

requires a paid subscription to work with Google Assistant?  WTH?  Granted it is cheap, $1/month or $12 year, but disappointing.  Installation was a breeze.  Works great.  I was conflicting about giving it 4 or 5 stars, but in the end, it is cheap enough and the product is robust enough to keep it at 5 stars.

Twenty minutes or less. If you just load the app and follow the directions you can't miss. Make sure you have enough signal and that you are not in a hurry. Some of the steps took a bit longer than I thought they should but waiting paid off. Works great, at least for now.  A real bargain

Doesn't work. Gives a sensor error almost immediately after setup, which then requires you to reconfigure everything from scratch. After each setup, it will work to open the door exactly once, and then not shut it, or work ever again. That is until you reconfigure everything.Contacted company for support, never heard back. Waste of money.

This would be five, but I just had to reprogram one of the doors again.  It happens to be the one my wife uses.  She's pretty mad.  This thing sets up very very simple.  I have a 2 craftsman garage door openers and it asks two questions, I push a button and it works.  Pretty slick.  However it does not work with wink, but that's ok.  I would strongly recommend this to anyone looking to connect the garage doors to the internet.

Easy to setup and works well, simple interface with app. Nice knowing when door is opened or closed and eliminates the need to drive back and check to ensure you closed the door. Also nice to have the control to open door for someone when not home

I really liked this product, but it didn't work reliably with my garage door and/or home network.  Setup was very easy and it worked initially but always stopped working after several hours.  I found similar reports online that were never resolved, so I decided to return the product.  I have other smart home devices that "just work" on my network, and that's what I was hoping for in this case.  Fortunately, setup and installation was easy enough that I was able to try this product and easily return it when it didn't work for me.

Easy to install and works great with my Chamberlin opener. Now, I get alerts on my iPhone when it opens or closes, set schedules for it to close every night by 10 (In case I forget). Also, I can open it from anywhere to let in family or friends. No need to give them the code anymore. Nice safety feature when you close, it beeps for 10 seconds as a warning it's closing. I can open from my Apple Watch 3 when I'm on the Bike too! Very handy!

The device works as expected with my Linear opener.  The install was super easy and the app is very useful in guiding you through the install process.  The app includes step by step instructions and videos.  I'm not sure why others have had so many problems.  I have a newer home built in 2016 and also have a WIFI access point about 20 ft from my garage so maybe that helped.

Super easy installation. Works well with WiFi and setup using iPhone app. Would recommend to anyone having to let someone remotely into their home. My only problem with it is that there is a delay between hitting the button and the door opening. However it is way more reliable than the garage door remote I have in my car

Installed this to find out it is not SmartThings or Alexa compatible. Installation like all garage remotes was a major pain, it finally said it could only show whether the door was open or closed yet it opens and closes okay. Hint plug this into the ceiling by the opener if you are using a Genie, you need to alternately press the #1 and #2 button on the side of the transmitter when pairing, the instructions on that are non-exist.

Basically, it works.  It is easy to use and very cost effective.  The only thing I REALLY hate is the caution beeping when lowering the door.  I have yet to figure out how to turn that darn thing off.  Otherwise, absolutely love it!!  Would buy it again, already have suggested it to many folks.

I didn’t buy until it was reduced to 29, felt it wasn’t worth more for an old opener that could die anytime.  The following week it was 10 dollars cheaper, ya 19.  Anyway follow instructions and in a short time you won’t have to find that opener anymore.

We have an alarm system in our home, and this product helps to extend our home monitoring to the garage! While it took some time to set it up, I ultimately love how it works. You are able to set different, personalized alerts and schedules as well as how you would like to be notified (email or push notification).  I like how it tells me just how long the garage has been open or shut, as well as a detailed history of the garage door use. This comes in handy on those busy mornings when you leave your home and minutes later question yourself as to whether or not you actually closed the garage door... no more needing to go back to check! There is a helpful online guide for any questions or alerts encountered while setting the system up. I would definitely recommend this product if you are looking for a way to enhance your home security.

I have two Overhead Door openers that are  just a few years old. The MyQ installed easily and quickly and I was managing both of my garage doors in no time.The instructions that come with it, and those that you have access to in the phone app, are fantastic, including even a few videos to walk you through the installation. Overall very good packaging and walkthru.

Where has this been my  entire life?.Our garage door controls never work, unless we are next to it. I can open this from anywhere. My favorite part is the ability to set a close time. My husband tends to forget it is open when we go to bed.Was super easy to install, and easy to use.

I'm an IT person, so I know a little bit about tech... I followed the instructions and the iOS app that it told me to use did not work. After messing with it for 20 mins, I called tech support and they had me go on my iPhone's browser, enter a URL to access the unit and configure it that way. These instructions were no where in the paper work.

Extremely convenient and easy to use. Recently, we went on a trip and couldn't remember if we left the garage door open. Luckily, by accessing the app at the click of the button and without the need of turning around and driving home to check, we could see that the garage door was 100% closed and for how long. Highly highly recommend this product! Well worth every penny spent!

It was a pretty straight forward install but the device itself is finicky. The sensor should have been wired or used a contact sensor instead, it's pretty hard to connect to the base and can lose connection from time to time which will throw an error and give you false report of open or closed garage

I love using this on my phone - I’ve opened up the garage remotely for people a few times, and closed it when they leave. I use it to get into my home and don’t have to carry a key. It’s great to check, “did I remember to close the garage door?” While I’m away. Love it!

I tried to get two of these to work. Each time (even after multiple factory resets) it would say there was an issue pairing with the network and to contact support. But the support button doesn't work. I couldn't even get it to connect to try it out. Returned for inability to use.

Works as advertised! Took a while (29 mins) to sync with home network router because we have two networks and it kept connecting to the wrong one.  I figured out I needed to eliminate one from my iPhone and only use one for it to connect correctly.  I did not need to "mount" it... I just placed it in top of the garage motor to keep it out of sight.

This unit is so unreliable.  It is always something....either the sign on won't work, or the readout is incorrect as to the status of the door, or it just simply will not do its only function in life and open and close the garage door.  Impossible.

This is a awesome product ,and took me less than 20 minutes from opening the package to full installation..just plug and push the purple button on the garage door opener to pair, and stick the other side on garage door, and downloaded the app ,MyQ Garage & Access Control  ,and you are done...Can't get any more easy..

This was a breeze! I set it up within 15 minutes. And it works perfectly every time. I bought a different product that I fudged around with for over 3 weeks, hours at a time. Then I finally sent it back and got this. I'm amazed by how easy it was to set up, and how it works every time.

Install and setup was fairly straightforward.  Had read reviews that said device could be made compatible with Alexa via IFTTT but apparently that's for people who know computer code.  Chamberlain needs to get on the stick and make their products compatible with Alexa without jumping through hoops.

Garbage.  This device does not work as intended.  Install was a breeze, but what good is it if it will not close your garage door?  Neither the app or mychamberlain.com work to close my garage when I'm gone.  The warning light will flash, then nothing.  After 2 attempts, the app will not allow a third attempt. The door is free of obstructions and the sensors are clear.  Works maybe 1 in 20 times.

This product is a nightmare. First, the MyQ app won't allow you to add more than one user, so only one person can open the garage with their cell phone. The system also randomly opened the garage door when I was away from home. What's worse, I always got errors when I tried to open or close the door remotely. So the system would open when I was away from home, and wouldn't let me close the door without driving back to my house. Customer support was no help whatsoever.It's not an exaggeration to say this is among the worst purchases I've made in my entire life.

very simple to install, like 15-20 min really, make sure you use the 2.4GHz bandi don’t really know if is the hub, the wireless router or so many things that could be involved but every day for a brief moment it goes offline (is not the distance) other than that works pretty good
I only wonder, why would Amazon would Deal with and sell, these ‘idiotic products’ from Chambelein ....If not fixed within 24 hours, I WILL SUE THEM.

Extremely simple to set up and use.  I wish the app had the ability to set up a geo fence to automatically open the garage when you are within a certain distance.  The ability to monitor the status of the garage door when at work is worth the $35 price tag.
At first I couldn’t get it to work. I was going to the + button on the top right of the app.I decided to try by clicking on:

I like the idea of this product. I just installed it. Very easy and simple. Does not work for anything. Got to the point where I pair my door sensor to the smart hub and nothing. No LED light up on door hub. Replaced the battery with some form the 3 pack I bought and nothing. I had high hopes for this product and the quality testing they must do is non existent. Will be talking to Amazon about getting this replaced or refunded. Would like this to work but if they can't quality check there stuff before it leaves that's just sad and forces me to go with another company.

I will never buy another MyQ product in my life and I will tell anyone who will listen to never buy it either. I buy a garage door opener that is MyQ ready and then I have to buy a hub to connect it to my phone and now you want me to pay a subscription to link it to my google assistant?!?!  You have lost your mind. I dont care how well your crap works I am not paying a subscription for a feature that every other company with similar technology offers for free. Thats why I pay for the equipment. Total waste of money. I can't wait to replace this piece of garbage.

This product works Great. - The reason for the 4 stars is that they charge a subscription fee to integrate with Alexa, Google, IFTTT and others. That is Stupid!Otherwise, installation was a breeze! Installed and configured in 10 minutes. The most time consuming part is the actual mounting of the Hub. Set up and configuration was simple and fast. Installed 2 door sensors with out a problem.

It is compatible for my nearly 20 year old Chamberlain garage door opener. Easy to install, easy to use. Now I can open and close my garage door while I am out one travel, shopping, in the office or even in my bedroom. Excellent product. Highly recommended!

Incredibly easy to setup, easy to use. The only thing wrong with it is the app only allows one login. I mitigated that by downloading wink to the rest of the family's phones so they could use the app without knowing my login info, saving the login info locally to those phones. Bought this to work with a Chamberlain Whisper Drive Plus.Edited: 3/4/19 - App has be redone to allow multiple logins. This product is first rate now, as far as I'm concerned. Increasing to 5 stars.

Very easy installation and setup. Using iPhone app no problems. Lift master garage door opener Red button. Where have you been all my life! No more waking upIn the morning with my garage door wide open.

The product was very simple to setup with the MyQ App step by step setup. However there are no instructions for adding to HomeKit and support can just send an email to you with Apple steps on how to add an accessory. There is no HomeKit code on the device or the box and the App does not allow the push of an added device to HomeKit which is required without a code on the device or box of the device. Very disappointed. I actually support the HomeKit App for Apple and this device is not compatible.So this does not work for why I purchased it or I would give it 5 stars

The product works as described. It opens and shuts the garage door (Overhead Garage Door brand) and alerts me when the door has been left open. My only objection is it beeps really loudly if I use it to shut the garage door and I often leave the house at 5:00 am

My husband created the account and added me as a guest. It seems to work fine for him, but about half the time when I come back from walking my dog and use myQ phone app to open the door, I get an error that it can't connect to the network, and the door won't open. It's really disappointing.

In my quest to fully smart kink my house, this was my latest must have. Again, my hapless hubby was informed that we (he) had a new home project to complete. His enthusiasm was palpable. But we (he) watched the little install video and we (he) had no issues with the install. I already use the app for my gate control and so was easy to add another device. Have been very pleased with the product, would recommend and purchase again.

Hi,I have been setting up different smart devices at home. Bought this one during the thanksgiving week. But got time to setup only now and found we need a SUBSCRIPTION to even use with Google Home and IFTTT. Now that's a big -ve. I have bought many smart devices over the past few months and didn't encounter this.

Occasionally I would forget to close the garage and it would be open all night.  No more!  If I forget to close the door, it closes automatically.  And, I have a message in my e-mail notifying me that it was done and when.The garage door was my biggest security concern.  It is a problem no more.  The  "MyQ Smart Garage Door Opener" is really my garage door closer.  It is best security investment I have made so far.

Great product! Super easy to install!I have a Craftsman garage opener with no WiFi option. With the app instructions, installation was quick and easy. I highly recommend this product if you don’t have an external way to open/close your garage door. Works great so far. Will update if any issues arise.

Very solid product, and I would buy again.  Very simple to install and works great.  I particularly like how quickly I am notified when either of my two door open and close.  Seems really solid and very convenient.  I am not bothered by the fact that Alexa does not control these devices.  It feels much more secure via my i phone app.

Highly recommend and the installation was a breeze. Past that this was the first non-Nest smart product I have integrated into my home. The MyQ app was easy to install and get working but I'm disappointed the MyQ will not function on my Nest app. Otherwise I love the Amazon prime delivery option and the fact it closes it when you tell it to.

Excellent product,  replaced my nexx garage opener with this. I recently moved and now have 2 garage doors so I purchased 2 thinking I needed 1 for each but quickly figured out that I only needed one hub and 2 sensors. I read other reviews stating that the company charges for integration with Google home and IFTTT however I was able to get both services up and running quickly and free of charge. The installation was almost to easy, App on my android seems to work great. I would definitely recommend it to anyone that wants to control, monitor, or get realtime alerts about their garage door activity.

Product was dangerous. Door opened and closed randomly. Door would open all hours of the day without using any controls. Finally uninstalled after door closed while in car about to reverse out of garage. Multiple attempts to get help or refund were ignored and had to settle for reduced refund via Amazon but better than having the safety and security risk of not having control of the door function

Documentation is all in myQ app. No way to study before installation. Their support was excellent when I finally called. Wanted to rename my door names but I did factory reset and started over. I also added second door sensor and that went smoothly with all my previous experiences.

One less thing to worry about!  If we ever leave the house and have even the least thought about whether or not we closed the garage door behind us, a quick check on the cell phone app clears up any question.  I like the ability to see how long the door has been either open or closed as well.  Installation instructions were straightforward and easy to follow.  It took less time than I expected.
