No issues at all and highly recommended.

The app doesn’t open the garage door every time. I have to manually open the door and then the app will close the door. If I try to open it again within a few minutes, it works. If I wait a day, the app will not open the door.My WiFi signal is extremely strong in my garage. Not reliable. Very disappointed.

Relatively easy to install. I wish you could change the settings for the sound of the beeping and how long it beeps for before it opens or closes. It takes longer than I feel it should and the beeping is incredibly loud but it does the job which is the most important thing.

Best investment for your automated garage door. Always knowing when your garage is opened and closed is great with the notifications. It allows you to have remote access in case you have friends or family stopping by and they need to be let in.The Amazon delivery feature is also an outstanding feature. No more packages thrown on the porch or left in the rain. Amazon delivery services get a one time access code which opens the garage. It is timed as well so they can drop off inside the garage and leave.

There’s about a 10 second delay before the garage door opening or closing. Not Alexa or smart things compatible, my fault for not reading that part. But the main reason they deserve one star is subscription fee? For a garage door opener??
So far 3 hours wasted still trying to connect to motor,Here the deal if you have certain bulbs near unit remove them, will not connect

Despite the number of 1-star reviews I went for it since I already have a Chamberlain door opener purchased 3 years ago and figured it should work well.  So setup was very straightforward with no issues.  And thus far it's been accurate when telling me whether door is up or down.  Fun to control from my phone.  Can't speak for anyone with non-Chamberlain door openers.

This is a great attempt at having a device to help open your garage remotely, however the integration with the app and device are sadly poorly executed. This myQ will only work less than half the times, I’ve been unfortunately locked out of my garage by relying on this device, the app connectivity to the actual hardware continuously fails so with that said make sure you have some sort of backup to either get in your home or open your garage.

Great option for your home. Helps save time, trouble, and remote opening is nice if someone needs to pickup or drop off in your garage. Integration with other smart home devices is possible, but can be limited. Research compatibility and what apps, if any are needed for smart home integration
Very easy to install. Instructions via the app are quite easy. Only took me about 20 minutes to complete installation. Worked immediately. Very nice device to add to my garage for a decent price.

So frustrated by this product. It took a week frustrated trying to get it to link to my garage door opener which is a Chamberlain. Customer service is open terrible hours and had to call a day I was working from home. They got it connected by resolving an issue on the back end. Worked great for a few weeks and stopped working after a power outage. The door sensor worked but could not control the door. I attempted to factory default the device and ran into the same issue as the original install. I have wasted so much time on this device I cut my losses and tossed it in the trash.

Love how easy it was to install. Love how great the myQ  Smart Garage Door Opener works. Open and close your door no matter where you are. My son came home from school on a cold day last week and forgot his keys. He was able to text me and within seconds I was able to open the garage door even though I was two hours away. Also lets you know when and how long ago your door was opened or closed. That alone has made this a wonderful purchase well worth the money. Also, no monthly fees.

Wish I could return this item. The longer we try to use it the worse it gets. Won’t work as claimed about ever other attempt. It just won’t connect and respond. We will go back to the old clickers I guess.

I didn't have any problems installing this at my home.  My Overhead Garage Door (2005) worked perfectly.  My wifi works great in the garage so I'm assuming that was a major reason for the quick installation.  I've ordered one for my friend to install at this house for Christmas.

Product stopped working after 6 weeks; manufacturer says its the battery (which should last 1+ years); manufacturer also said it shouldn't be used to send alerts that inform the customer that the garage door was left open!!!!! Garage is closed yet the product still alerts that the garage is open; if you use the app to close the garage it actually opens it. BUYER BEWARE!
Good product for money.Have not figured out how to set up with Alexa.. not as easy as the smart bulbs, plugs, and switches.

You have to follow steps on the myQ app to go through the installation. It's like you need to register a hub, then add devices (sensors) to the hub. BUT IT DIDN'T WORK! I have tried the installation wizard, the "Device Management" and myQ/chamberlain's web page to register/delete devices and finally figured out the problem: it takes super long time on the server side to have any change reflected.

I bought this after being gifted one by a relative. It’s a lifesaver the family has left the garage door open in the past and this give you the peace of mind that shut just looking at the app. My wife also locked herself out once and I was able to remotely open the garage for her.

Product was dangerous. Door opened and closed randomly. Door would open all hours of the day without using any controls. Finally uninstalled after door closed while in car about to reverse out of garage. Multiple attempts to get help or refund were ignored and had to settle for reduced refund via Amazon but better than having the safety and security risk of not having control of the door function

I have a Chamberlain Whisper Drive and this product is also a Chamberlain.  Sounds like a good combo, right?WRONG.  I spent 4 hours trying to pair this up.  The customer support from Chamberlain was good, but they could not fix the fact that my Comcast internet was blocking a few "ports" that was necessary to connect to my wifi.  Regardless of the wifi problem, this would not "pair" to my garage door opener no matter what we tried.  4 hours of aggravation with no good results.

To many reviews/statements that imply that it works with google assistant.  It does, but only to close the door.  NOT TO OPEN.  I wish I had known this prior to purchasing.  I realize the security concern, but wish it could be up to the customer.

Setup was well described and followed without error.  My opener is seven years old at the time of install and worked without the need of the helpline.  App integration worked without delays or problems and works well with Amazon Key.  One delivery was sampled without issue.

This works as expected via the app and install was very simple - took about 15 min.  The app works and I am able to look whether my door is closed, set up alerts and schedules, which is very nice. This does NOT work with Alexa, as I thought it did.  I do understand why from a security perspective but perhaps then can incorporate a code word for Alexa to open the door.  Either way, I am pleased with the product and features but in addition to these features, I bought this because I thought it worked with Alexa.

I was worried that it may not work with my garage. I bought this house couple years back and it is a very old house. The garage equipment looks very very old. But to my surprise, the whole process of installation and hook up with my garage was so easy! all it took was few mins and I had remote access to my garage.Great product!!

Seems a little laggy/glitchy. Login is cumbersome and the app doesn't integrate with Google home exactly. I have to tell google to tell myq to shut the door.I ride a motorcycle and was hoping this would replace my opener but it's not quite seamless enough with the login and the lag.

I think I was sent a defective unit. The blinking blue light during setup is extremely dim, almost impossible to see. The device refuses to connect to my WiFi and I’ve tried the hard reset troubleshooting procedure multiple times but the device never beeps or gets a solid blue light. Nothing happens at all when I hold the gear button. This thing is a piece of junk and I will be returning it if Chamberlain support doesn’t respond soon and replace it.
Awesome device to keep you informed of your garage door status (open/closed) via text. You can open and close remotely it via the app.The amazon delivery was not available: I’m in a  very rural area.

Easy install. Took me about 15 mins to install and configure. It’s now about a month and no additional problems or maintenance required.Be careful not to erase all programs from the garage door opener. This will cause the garage door open function in the cars to fail.

I had wanted a remote door opener as I have integrated with my home. The one from the garage manufacture was over a 100.00 so this was worth a try for the price. It was not a bad install and the videos were easy to follow. Its up and working great

There is no Alexa integration. Why would it even ask me to rate it?!  Set up was not extremely easy. Had to reset the hub and start over multiple times. Beeps loudly and annoyingly for 32 seconds before and during closing.  Theres no way to disable it.  All in all it's more trouble than its worth!  Not even bothering with the hassle of sending it back.

it worked great very easy install I was not happy that is had been sitting around for some time and it was a older verison however worked great no problems this would have been 5 stars but for being a year or two old

Pairing this was a nightmare of like 30 minutes. Following instructions to the T. Thought maybe it wasn’t compatible went back and looked it up like 5 times. The button on my opener was a different color then all the different options in instructions. Just had to fly by the seat of my pants. Finally got it. Other then that it is a great product. Can double check my door is closed after I left for work. Can remotely open door from app when I’m not home to let me parents or in-laws in.

I bought this product to integrate with my google Home setup.  This does NOT integrate with Google Home.  It does say it integrates with Google Assistant which is an old app and old APIs that are hard to even use on newer phones.  I was able to get it to integrate using IFTTT but that will only close the door and not give status messages.  If you have Alexa then your experience may be ok...But I would not recommend this for Google Home users.

This was a super fast and easy install. I have one Chamberlain garage door opener with myQ built in and a second Craftsman garage door opener. I installed this for the Craftsman and it was paired and working within 10 minutes. Add 5-10 minutes to mount the remote and hub and it was done. Perfect!

Easy to set up. Only tool needed is a Phillips screwdriver. Forgot to close the door once when leaving for work, luckily a neighbour closed it for me. Not a concern with this since I can see open/closed status from anywhere on my phone.
It does what it is advertised to do. Install was relatively painless. After the sensor fell off the door, I used my own Velcro fasteners.Notification app works as advertised.

I live alone, so it's a peace of mind thing.  I like that I can confirm the door is closed from anywhere.  When I leave I get a door closed notification on my phone a couple of hundred yards down the street.  Got this when the price dropped below $20.  Great deal.  I read all the reviews, so there were no surprises.  Installation was very easy  Completely satisfied.

What a great device. Super easy to install and setup. I does not connect to Alexa, but why?  I can view the door status and get alerts if the door is open past a set time. Open and close from my phone.

I had to link to Alexa using iffft app.  The system worked great from initial installation.  All the components integrated easily, including my older craftsman garage door opener.  I really like being able to control and schedule from my phone.
Does NOT work with NEST or GOOGLE home. Does not pair with Genie Mach Force.

This took 15-20 minutes to set up, and was fairly easy to do so.However, my biggest gripe with this product is that if you want to integrate it with Google Home, Alexa, or Smartthings, you'll have to pay for a subscription to Chamberlain. And to top it all off, the integration is barely an integration.

Got this in yesterday and had it installed in ten minutes and it works perfectly. I already had a wifi extender out on the back porch close to the garage as I am streaming music to my Denon HEOS system there and the MyQ hub easily connected to it. Works like a champ!

Don't get why Amazon pushes this so hard. You can't even tell alexa to open or close the garage. And the app fails 50% of the time. Or takes 3-5 mins to load. I could walk up and use the keypad by then.

Easy to install, works as it should using the MyQ app. Google assistant works OK at best, no default Alexa support. You can Set a schedule and notifications from the MyQ app, so the mediocre assistant support can be overlooked for me

The app will not update all the time and will show the door open when it is closed and the other way around.  Most importantly having this has made my house and my security even worse. The delivery driver has left my door open for everyone to see and the option to just walk in and steal from me. I am very disappointed and dissatisfied with this.

Installed it a few days ago and it works great from my phone! Easy install which took about five minutes, and easily linked to my home wifi. Used it last night when my daughter was wanting to get into the house while I was 30 miles away, and it performed perfectly.

It’s easy to install. Setup is a little tricky. Be patient. Once it’s set up, it is soooooo handy. You can let yourself in and out of the garage with just your phone. I use it every weekday morning to open the garage when I use remote start to warm up my car. Love it. Plus, they just updated their app and it’s great.

First review I’ve ever written and the reason why is because every time I open or close my garage from the app it takes me at least 3 or 4 times to open it! I constantly have to “force close” the app cause it doesn’t do anything and I’m just sitting in front of my garage in my truck dumb founded and my neighbors probably think I’m on drugs or something! Lol! But anyways... chamberlain, PLEASE update the app or whatever it takes so I can be super pumped on this item and rewrite this review to a good one cause it’s 2020 and these types of things should just woooooooork!!!

the installation is well instructed with Video -  However, the apps support group are not available to support.  it took me less than 30 minutes to install but it takes me over 3 hours trying to get the things to work .  it won't close the Garage . over all the products doesn't work complete.

Was not looking forward to installing this unit this morning as it was 5 degrees out, but it went off without a hitch.  Took probably ten minutes to install, set up, and test.  Very pleased that I can remotely operate my door and see whether it is open or closed any time.  Will come in handy with a big storm approaching this weekend.

I installed this garage hub about two weeks ago. I am always worried that I will leave the garage door open when I am away from the house. The app allowed me to create a notification that will alert me when the garage door is left open for a specific period of time. Yesterday, this alert paid off. For some reason, my garage door didn't close all the way when I left the house. I received the alert and was able to close the garage door remotely.  Also, if I have doubts if the door is closed, I can easily check the status from the app.

This was super easy to install and use if you were not looking to integrate with other home automation.  In the end, I had to return it because the sensor kept reporting the wrong status.  Although the door was closed, the sensor kept reporting that it was open and sending out notification.  Also, beeping for 45+ seconds when closing the door is extremely annoying.

At $30 it's not entirely terrible.  But I'd say it only registers about 70% of my openings and closings, meaning that the app indicator of the door's open/closed status is often out of sync with reality.  You can control your door from anywhere if you have a connection, but you're not going to accurately know if it's open or closed.  Guess you buy a $20 wyze cam and put it in your garage and for $50 you've patched together a working system.  0 points for Alexa integration because it has none, or wants you to pay an ongoing subscription for it.

Awesome device. Took 15 mins to set up. Now I can get alerts when the door opens and closes and open and close my door from anywhere. At first I couldn’t get it to sync with my genie door opener, but while it was trying to sync I pressed the sync button on the door opener a second time and it synced right up. Great item.

This product does not work with Apple HomeKit. Yes, you can download the MyQ app on your phone but you can't connect it to HomeKit. There is an extra hub that you can get for $60 that you can connect it to and then connect the hub to HomeKit so all is not lost but a very expensive option.

Took multiple attempts to pair the device with my 7 year old Genie opener (listed as compatible), only to to have the app say it would only be able to tell me the door was open or closed. Thanks, but I can do that with my own eyes. Tried install process again after resetting the device only to find that it couldn't pair with the provided door sensor. Online help isn't searchable and is pretty useless.  Very disappointed. Not recommended.

Install was a bit tricky with Google WiFi mesh system. Used an extender to connect to a 2.4ghz signal since the mesh system is only  5ghz. Once I added the extender, connected very quickly. The pairing was difficult as well. The app would just spin for 20min+. I have a myQ LiftMaster garage door opener, so it should have worked easily. I used to pairing instructions on the opener with the sensor attached to the door itself. After that the hub pairing worked. No big issues so far (1 week). All open/close notifications are legit (I have a camera that looks at the garage). Good product so far, install needs some fine tuning

Background, I work in IT. I run servers and computers at home, installing a smart garage hub should be right up my alley but I had to call tech support and the agent had to help me by instructing me to set up the opener as a "Remote LED Light", after I did that it paired with my opener no problem and has been working. Not sure why adding it as a garage door opener wouldn't work... My beef is not with the hardware but with the app.

This is the WORST product to buy if you want smart integration for your garage door opener! DO NOT BUY!! Despite saying our model was compatible, the hub would not connect to our garage door and instead said we could use it to “Monitor” if the garage was open or closed. Aka we would not be able to use it for its actual purpose of opening/closing the garage door. It is a complete waste of money and was returned an hour after being opened!!

After reading the reviews, we were a little concerned about the difficulty of installing it.  We downloaded their app, and it made it very easy. It had step-by-step instructions which we followed and it was no problem at all.The only downside so far is the length of the cord for the hub. It is supposed to be mounted on the ceiling, and  plugged into an electrical outlet without an extension cord.  It barely reached one of our outlets. If we had a longer cord, we could’ve neatly attached  it to the ceiling instead of having it stretch across.

This device works great. Installation was simple but setting up the connection to my Liftmaster garage door opener required contact with their support service. The service person knew just what to tell me to fix the problem. It would have been nice if their phone app would have guided the setup correctly. Once setup properly, the remote works great. Alexa operation is questionable and will take some research if at all possible.
Doesn’t work with Alexa or Siri without purchasing additional equipment. You have to unlock your phone for the Apple Watch app to work and then it regularly gets stuck at “authenticating”.

Awesome garage opener hub if it wasn't for the ANNOYING ALARM! So I figured out how to disable the alarm easily on my YouTube channel AmazonRealReviews. Check out my video if your having the same complaint. Now my hub works perfectly without the alarm.

I would have preferred a manual to read before beginning the installation instead of following along on the app, but the instructions were easy to follow and the videos helped. The MyQ works great with my LiftMaster door opener. I especially like the options for notifications if the door is left open.

This was super easy to install and get working with the app.  I would say the only real negative is how far the receiver needs to be away from the opener itself means that you have to leave the black power cord running across your ceiling

Wow! Received this today and had it installed and up in running with my droid phone  in about 20 mins. I have a Chamberlain 1/2 hp chain drive opener purchased in 2013 (purple) learn button. Will do a follow up review in a few weeks after our 3 family members use it. Able to know if door is open or closed and able open and close the door using the phone app. I also set up an alert to send me an email if the door is open for more than 5 minutes. Eliminates the need/security risk of having a remote in any of our vehicles that may be parked in the driveway.

It was easy to install and operate through MyQ app.  However there is no Alexa integration and connecting Google assistant is by paying a subscription fees and that too wont let you unlock the door unlike August lock integration with Google which lets you open and close the door without any fees.

The installation is quick, but the instructions tell you to plug it in anywhere in the garage to start. I would modify that to say put it close to the opener when linking the motor to the hub. It will connect much easier. Once connected you can move the hub a little further when mounting.

Easy to setup. Worked well with my lift master garage door opener. It took about 10 mins to setup start to end. The steps are miss guiding when setting up Alexa. They need to give easier instructions. The system is reliable and highly recommend!

It does what it says and the stand alone app is excellent in doing what I want it to do. Alexa integration is through another platform and was so convoluted to set up I decided sticking with the standard app is sufficient. I have a tenant who uses the garage as entry so this was priceless for me. Super easy setup.

My touch pad got infested with ants and stopped working so I purchased the myQ Smart Garage Door Opener. Installation was easy and worked following the instructions . it has been over 6 mounts now and no problems works great.

Does not integrate with Alexa, and if it does, it’s not through the Alexa app like everything else I own that says it works with Alexa. Working through ITTT is not integration into Alexa it’s a workaround and it’s lazy and lame and false advertising.

This is a great product to retrofit your old "dumb" garage doors into smart garage doors.  However, the product has one major flaw in not being able to utilizing Google Assistant or Alexa to open the garage doors.  MyQ needs to fix this in order to get a five star review.

Love this last night I would have forgotten  to shut my garage door. With the program feature at 8:pm my phone alerted me that my garage door was shutting. So if you set it for what ever times you want to make sure it got closed. It works perfectly.

Very easy and simple to install.  Gives you the peace of mind knowing that the garage door is closed and you can actually check it.  The only feature missing and needs to be added is “geo-fencing” - where if the app detects that I’m in 1000ft or 500 ft of my home to open the garage door.

Installation was fairly simple and should be achievable by the DIY'er. Setup in Google home was a little complicated but not even necessary unless you want voice command from Google assistant.  Otherwise, just stick to the MyQ app.

I previously installed a wifi extender in my garage and made easy connection. My ring app faces the garage door, so I can see if I  forget to close the door. The settings make it easy to notify you if the garage door is open. But now I can open or close it with my cell phone from anywhere as long as I have data available. No more questioning if you left the garage door open.  Make sure to close the app when you're done, you don't want to accidentally open or close it.

Very easy to install and reasonably priced when on sale. However, Google and Alexa integration don’t allow you to use voice commands to open and close the door. They notify you and you can use the app. At least with Alexa it enables use of Amazon Key functionality for secure package delivery

I like the idea of opening my garage through an app on my phone opposed to the separate remote that I manage to keep losing, and the in garage deliveries feature. It was a bit difficult to set up and there is a delay. I am not sure I trust it enough yet to enable in garage deliveries or open my garage when I am not home to make sure it actually closes. A few times while testing it out, it would open the garage and then give an error message about not able to connect to the base when I would attempt to close it.

I wanted to control my garage door remotely. I have a Chamberlain opener and love it. For the past 4 years, my network ison a 5 GHz band. To much traffic and interference on the 2.4 GHz band. Little did I know that the MyQ only works on 2.4 GHz. The product drops connection from my network every couple of weeks. When it drops it takes hours to get it back online. The worst thing, the company will not stand behind this product. If I would have known this, Amazon would have sold one less MyQ

The installation was very well designed and it works well but I wish that the notification sound it generates on my iPhone were more audible.  Another brand I have is very noticable.  I think the GUI  of the app needs considerable work to make it more intuitive.

I used this for almost 3 months and my experience was good until it opened the garage one night randomly. I setup alerts to send notification when garage opens but I didn't get any such notification when garage opened in the night. I contacted myQ support but  they didn't have any answer. After few days, my garage opened two more times in the night without any of us opening and no alert was sent. After these 3 incidents, I freaked out and unplugged the device.  I'm giving one star because of these random openings. Ever since I unplugged myQ, no more such incidents.

Took only about 5 minutes to install and setup.  Works perfectly, but please check first to ensure you have a strong wifi signal in your garage.  Notifications of the garage open/close happen immediately.  Gives peace of mind knowing you can check the status of the garage door in bed or when away from home.
Be very careful as to what model AND Year of opener you have..Mine was listed as supported BUT no the year of  mine.
Fast shipping. Well packed. I follow instructions , down load the app and it very easy to install.There’s a delay response when using the app to open or close ( especially android devices)

Do not go by average stars. This used to work, but now it is completely disabled by the app being broken. It has been broken and completely useless for at least a month now with no fix. Without the app, the product literally doesn't do anything.

I love my new garage door opener! I don't have to take an opener when I go out for a bike ride anymore. I also love that I can check the status of the door remotely and open and close it when I am away. The only challenge I had was that during setup, the instructions say to press the button on the garage opener at one point when they really mean on the garage sensor box that you attach to the door. Also, I had to change my home WIFI network or password and could not find a way to just change that without resetting everything and setting it up again. Unfortunately, I forgot about the bad instructions and it took me awhile to remember that I need to push button on the sensor box. Once setup though, it works very well! I would give it a 5 if it had better setup instructions and easier transitions for network changes.

Easy straight forward install if you don’t have a fear of ladders.  Just installed and 3/29/18 is go-live date.  Works perfectly with my Chamberlain opener.  Just ordered my second sensor for second door.  We’ll see how it holds up.  Oh,  and I’m on iPhone in case it matters.Installed second door sensor and no issues at all.  Both work as expected.

Very disappointed.  Alexa and Google integration will only allow you to close your garage door.  You can not open your garage door with Alexa or Google.  On top of that, I had to go to the MyQ website and SUBSCRIBE, (free for a limited time only) ,to IFTTT and Google integration, (Alexa connects through IFTTT), which tells me they plan to charge for this feature in the future.  I won't be paying for this feature considering you can only close the door.  My old garage remote is more convenient.  Positives: installation was easy.

Works a charm and easy to install.  Been having trouble using the real garage opener as neighbour has a lightbulb interfering with the signal.  This wifi controlled version beats that issue.Great deal...so happy to have it installed

The unit works very well, I am extremely satisfied with its performance.  The only issue I had was with the set up of the unit.  Following the instructions I was not able to get the unit to connect with my Wi-Fi network.  In the end I resorted to You-tube and watched one of the installation videos which greatly simplified the connection process.  Instructions lacking but the unit works great.

For those wanted to go all home automation but don’t want to break the bank, this is one of the must have product! This is safer than having one of those key pad outside of your garage door! Just follow the app to set this up. Super duper easy!

Works great, installation was easy. I purchased this for peace of mind, to be able to check if garage door is closed, if I could count how many times I drove away, and wasnt sure if I shut the garage door. I also plan to purchase a new garage door opener in the next few years so this was a fairly priced option to get a modern feature, on an older unit
Very easy to set up and install.Very simple to add alerts and notifications, and to setup rules for closing the garage door automatically.

Works great! Setup was also easy! Only con is that you can’t control the garage doors with Alexa. Chamberlain should be ashamed of themselves for it. But, I knew that before purchasing their product so I won’t knock them for it.

Having the ability to know whether my garage door is open or closed and being able to change that remotely is awesome and this works well and super easy to set up although the instructions are lacking.  Once you find the right video on YouTube you see it's just mounting the master unit by the opener, the sensor on the door and then join to your wifi and learn from the door opener and done.  I would recommend including simple instructions to the item on Amazon to know what they're buying.

Not Alexa compatible ... Just be aware before you purchase. So inexpensive it doesn't matter. Took me 10 minutes to install the app, put the sensor on the garage door, and configure. Just follow the videos in the app. Free account, no monthly fee, not sure why folks are complaining. Simple install. Once setup it took 3 minutes to get on a step ladder and screw the hub unit into ceiling drywall. Don't overthink it. The setup is not rocket science. My only ding is the loud beeping it makes when closing. Once installed I can check the open\close status from the app and open\close accordingly. Thumbs up!

Great device. My door opener isn't on the list but worked great. No issues what so ever. Instructions in the app were spot on. Took me about 40 mins to install as I was taking my time. Now I have a way for Amazon to deliver packages without me worrying about them being stolen from my front porch. So glad I go it. Also a bit of security as I know when the door opens and closes. Also will alert if door stayed open so I can close it remotely.

Installation was fairly easy but then came the pairing. Had to spent hours trying it and gave up and called support. First person eventually hung up. Second person was good and found out it won't work with LED bulb, changed to regular bulb and after several tries it paired but only to find out after several hours that it unpaired again. Tried pairing again several times and finally just gave up. Will be getting something else.

I installed these and it worked great for about 2 weeks. The problem I’m having now is when I use my phone to open garage bay 1 both of them open. I tried reconnecting the sensors And I get the same thing both of the bays open at the same time.

I installed these and it worked great for about 2 weeks. The problem I’m having now is when I use my phone to open garage bay 1 both of them open. I tried reconnecting the sensors And I get the same thing both of the bays open at the same time.

The only complaint I have is the beeping warning that happens too long for my taste when closing the door.I bought this because my garage remotes kept acting up.  This was easy to install and gives peace of mind when you get the notice on your phone of the door being open or closed.

Once stationary and auto remotes were programmed, it worked fine. Nice to look at my iPhone to be sure door is closed. Has a neat safety warning system when closing it remotely. Light flashes and it beeps.
Doesn't work more than does. Keeps losing touch with the door sensor.

The system works great with the MyQ app.  I switch cars all the time and almost never have my remote with me so this has been super handy.  My only real disappointment is that to make it work with apple homekit you must buy another add-on hub (G0303) to the tune of $70.  Setup is quick and easy as long as you have a good wifi signal in the garage.

Easy to install and link to app. Been having issues with it however opening my garage door at it’s scheduled “close time” if the door is already closed. This is frustrating since if I’m not paying attention the app is actually leaving my door open all night. Seems to have connection issues as well. Probably going to disassemble and send back.

Bought this for my husband for Xmas because he, and me as well, question whether we closed the door after heading out.  My only issue with this is that if someone else was able to open the door we don't get notification in a timely manner.  Sometime it is over an hour and by then my entire garage and house could be emptied out of anything valuable.  I hope they can improve this time delay.  Other than that it is wonderful.

Very cool! I left the garage door open one night ... and pretty much let the whole neighbourhood know what was free to take, but thankfully everything was there the next morning phhhewww!  Install took 20 min, but config to my wifi was a little challenging (even though this is my line of work) instructions hav etc be clearer  even though separate instruction sheet for Apple phones.  Really like  the warning beeps and light flashing to warn anyone the door is closing - smart. Especially Learned I have a Lift Master garage door opener (10+ years) and it has no issue communicating. Added bonus is the notifications that I get when the door is opened for more than an hour on my iPhone... going to save up to be able to use SIRI, but I think Ill manage without the HOMEKIT option.
I was so disappointed with my Q smart garage. It was frustrating that I could never get it to connect to my internet, I couldn’t get the remote to work and ugh don’t even think about using Alexa!

I was surprised at the ease of installation and set-up.  I had the app installed, and hardware installed, up and running in 30 minutes, and it works great every time.  The ability to double check on the status of the garage door is HUGE.  The safety features of the flashing LED light and audible beeping when closing the door remotely shows that Chamberlain is serious about keeping customers safe.

This device is awesome and has worked flawlessly.  Added to a Genie door opener.  I love the new flexibility this device has afforded me.  I do have a whole home mesh network with 6 nodes in a 3,300 sqft home (one mesh node is about 3 feet from the MyQ), all running on a gigabit connection.

Not too difficult to install, but that isn't saying much as I have had to set it back up 3 or 4 times in the maybe 6 months I have had it. It loses connection with my wifi often, sometimes requiring setup be redone, and the sensor battery had to be replaced within about 3-4 months. Started out great for the first month or so, quick decent downhill from there.

I’ve been using the hub and app for five months now and love it. Even my wife and kids use it with ease. It’s great not to have to take a remote with us on a bike ride - we always have the phone. It’s really comforting to be able to check if the doors are up or down as well.I had a couple minor issues when I installed it, but I think it was more of me not following instructions. This works great with our Overheaddoor Legacy opener that was installed in 2000.

Super easy to install.  It took 10 minutes, and it the device worked from the start with my Eero mesh wifi.The only issue was I could not link to my Amazon Key app because the new IOS is not compatible, but Amazon support expects that to be a temporary issue.

Despite what their compatibility tool says, this does NOT work with the Overhead Door Odyssey 1000 (7030). I spent a half hour trying to install it myself without success, then spent an hour on the phone with their support who was completely useless. They suggested things like “pulling the manual disconnect cable” and for me to “step away from the hub” as if the blood in my body would interfere with it trying to pair. What a waste of time.

Got this the other day and had it installed in about 30 minutes. Set up the hub with my wifi and Bluetooth. My Chamberlain Whisper drive garage door opener. . . Even set up the Amazon Key app to receive packages. It's great. Everything works and we received our first package a couple of days later.

Works as advertised.  Before installing this I would leave the house, get a couple of miles down the road and wonder, "Did I shut the garage door?"Turn around, drive back, and 99.9% of the time, yes I did.  Made my wife crazy.
The keypad for our garage door opener died. This was very easy to install, Once you download the app, the app literally walks you step by step through the process. Easy to use, and very convenient.

Easy to install but the step to link the garage door opener and myQ was not very clear. I watched several YouTube videos was not clear. But other than that very easy to use. It sends me text notifications if the garage door is open or closed.

the door opener has been a great upgrade to our existing garage door tech.we use this on a daily basis and also to help guests. installation was quite simple. only issue I faced was when the wire is wound around the unit, the closure doesn't work as expected. on hanging the wire everything works perfectly fine.

Super Easy to install.  works great on android and iphone.  I can close my garage doors from another city 1000 miles away or from my bedroom.  We get a notification when they are opened and it allows us to be able to let someone inside our house WITHOUT hiding a key or giving out a code.  They text me upon arrival and I open the garage for them no matter where I am!  Have not tried Alexa integration.

it is easier to install than what I expected. However, the installation instructions is a little bit stupid, it has to follow the in app instructions, but once you pause it and do the installation, the app will restart again. I have to find a separate manual online. Also, when I tested it last night right after I installed it, it always said not responding. But it works ok this morning.
Setup was easy.However hub lost connection the next day. Factory reset was needed followed by setup again.

Awesome!! Easy to use, installed in 10 minutes or less. Don’t know what everyone is complaining about but I use pretty easily. I don’t have Alexa or google personally but works great under the app and I’m sure it’ll integrate via app more in future. I mean I can open and close it from home!

Worked as advertised.  so cool knowing when the garage door is open and closed.  Able to remotely open and close from my iPhone.  If someone needs to get in my garage I have them yell “open seseame “ and then I open it remotely

It was fairly easy to install. It's not plug-and-play, so prepare for getting up on a ladder and drilling holes, but it's nothing a regular guy can't handle.It's very nice to able to remotely open the garage door for a kid who forgot his house key, deliveries, and the like.

Why is there a star evaluation for “alexa integration”. It doesn’t integrate with Alexa!So 2 weeks in and it failed to recognize my garage at all and it had me redo the entire Setup process. It said my garage was open when it wasn’t.

Very easy to install and configure. Instructions were very clear. Got it for 19$ or so..i was planning to buy my garage remote which was costing 45$ each, now this replaced my old remotes and added my wife too, now she can also control the garage..

A great product if you follow the instructions, Good product, good company, good customer service.  I have it for less than a week.  So far so good, I could check if left my garage open, also for Amazon delivery, really I am not good at writing review and I don't usually do that, but since I have good experience with the product and the customer service I felt I am obligated to tell the truth, it's good product, good company, good customer service.
This was exciting in theory...but was beyond frustrating and disappointing beyond measure. Wasted hours in 100 degree heat for nothing but failure. I gave it to my brother in law...it worked great.

Limited utility.  Gets you access to your garage door via a phone app.  Limited utility as I have a remote keypad for guest entry.  Can see if door was left open, but  Battery for sensor goes dead every 3 months.  Not worth it....

Ordered this and my boyfriend and I put it in.  The directions were so simple!  I am a female and live alone.  I like the fact that I can monitor my garage door through my phone and set a timer for the garage door to close every nite in case I forget to close it.  Great product

Once set up it works well. Setup itself can be very finicky, I had to reset the unit 4 times before it worked correctly. However, since then it's been flawless. Google assistant integration is worthless, I was hoping to use it with Android Auto, but there's no way to open the door with voice control (and it's a subscription service).

Install was quick and easy after watching their videos on Youtube. I had purchased another hard wired system with no luck. This however works flawlessly so far. After loading the App and setting up the hardware which was quick, simple and straightforward, this device has performed extremely well and without a hitch. After App setup I have received the proper notifications regarding my Garage door status; is it open or closed the reason why I made this purchase. For the price and ease of installation I recommend this product.

Mine works perfectly as I expected and will give an alarm is sent if the garage is left open for a period of time that you can set. Alexa integration would be great but I knew when I purchased that was not an option.

My husband installed this. I use Google home and have not integrated it. I also don't understand how to get Amazon to use it for packages. It is good for being able to let pet sitters in the house though. No more having to give them a key.
all went well until I tried to connect it to my chamberlain garage door opener, it will not connect.long phone call with customer unsupport, no help

It correctly opens my garage, and lets me know when it’s open. This feature ended my tradition of occasionally turning around to make sure I closed the garage. Worth every penny! Easy to install, no DIY expertise needed. Basically plug and play, as long as you know how to add an opener to your garage. Loss of one star for no Alexa integration, but I knew that in advance.

I love this product! It was exact what I was looking for and super easy to install. I managed to catch it while it was on sale for $39.99 for that price you can’t beat it. We have a generic garage door opener and this work perfectly with it. We don’t Alexa so I cannot comment on that.

Works as advertised, really really hard to get set up..  Didn't come with a real set-up guide, the 800 number for telephone support was closed, and the "automatic" set up on my iPhone was terrible.  I kept getting the message "you already programmed two doors for this hub, please buy another hub"..  Even though the one door I was programming wasn't fully setup.On the iPhone, just know that you can close the (retarded)  setup "wizard" and go into the "settings" menu - then you can remove false (extra) door sensors there by right-swiping on the phone.  Had to watch the YouTube video a couple times & still just ended up figuring it out on my own.

Very nice not hard to setup but use the instructions on your phone. I was looking for written instructions but there wasn’t any. Only the box content. Only wish they would give you an option for another door hub at a cheaper rate but that is the only negative.

Like: It took less than 30 minutes to install & it functioned properly the 1st around.Dislike: it’s a bit slow especially if your signal is weak in the garage area. It also disables the exterior keypad.

Love the product.  As long as you have good strong wifi signal, the product functions exactly as advertised.  We use it to open the door remotely for my son when he is dropped off from the bus.  Installation was simple -- follow the instructions.

Extremely easy installation.  Lets me know when the garage door opens when I'm not home which is ok as it is usually my wife returning from her work.  Also like the integration with Amazon key.  Now I don't have to worry with most Amazon deliveries sitting at the front door all day.
My kids always go out for playing with friends and sometimes they forget to close.this is a great item that lets you know the door open or close.

Game changer for receiving prime shipments and making sure garage door is closed, nice remote also. Install wasn’t smooth as i would have liked, customer service had to update OS and then we had to go by the color of my antenna wire and not the learn button.

Only when I received the item, upon installation the app told me that the hub only works with max TWO sensors! What happens to many many homes with 3 car garages?  Have you done basic research on the requirements dear Chamberlain...

myq customer service is second to none. They never let me hanging until we finished the installation I’m with the customer service for almost 1 1/2 hr just to help me out. That’s why I highly recommend this remote to every person or co-worker I had

Perfect for what I wanted and very easy to install.  Luckily for me my home WiFi strength is very good in my garage - that could be an issue for some.  I wanted the ability to open my garage remotely as we are often away and I may need to give a family member access - works perfectly for me.

I didn’t even want to give this a 1star. Since the night I got it, it constantly lost sync with the door sensor. It would show the door as opened when it was closed. I called and spoke with the chamberlain to get it working. It worked for about 2 weeks and I have been able to get it online since. Don’t waste your money.

I can’t believe how easy this was to set up.  I consider myself a competent user of alexa enabled products and I still have issues getting them up and running sometimes. Not this one!  Couldn’t have been easier.

Bought it based on recommendation of a buddy. I really like this. It was easy to install, inexpensive, and just plain works. Nice safety feature of alerting when it's closing via remote control. Only wish there was built in support for Alexa, but a Simple Commands account resolves that with a little effort.

I bought this for my overhead legacy door opener and works very good. Was very easy to install and setup the mobile application. I have a 2 door garage and i bought the one unit with hub/door sensor and then bought an additional sensor for second door. Their installation video was very helpful.

My issues while installing came from not exactly knowing the model of my (OLDDD) craftsman garage door opener.  I called the product support, and they worked me through the steps with a good understanding of my garage door opener, and completed it. Works very well!

The item was supposed to work with garage door openers newer than 1993.  I have two openers in a new home that were installed May 2019.  This product will not work with the openers, other than to indicate that the door is open or closed.  The app will not open or close the garage doors.  I have two other garages with Chamberlain openers and they come with WIFI built in and work great.  It's extra security for the garage doors and I can close them remotely from anywhere, or open them.  Strongly recommend Chamberlain or Lift Master.

I left the garage open too many times.  There was a great deal on this so I went for it.  Very easy to setup/install.  Would recommend!I don't care about the Alexa integration and whatever Chamberlain charges because I don't use it.  Amazon has enough data on me, they don't need to know when I open and close my door to boot.

No real complaints here, this is incredibly easy to setup and use. It paired with my existing garage door opener in a similar manner to setting up a new remote, you press a button on the garage opener itself and then one on the MyQ remote -- you're done. The door sensor sticks to the door very well -- but clean the spot on the door first otherwise it may not stick as well. App is easy to use and consistently works when I need it. Alerts are easy to set up as well.
My husband forgets to close the garage door often after he pulls away with the boat, this will send a notice to my phone and i can clise it from my phone no matter where i am

talked myself into doing this and glad I did.  it was simple and there's no monthly fee unless you are trying to connect it to another service.  the app is simple and i'm able to make sure all 4 of my garages are closed when I go to bed

Don't be fooled - this does not work for all garage door openers.  Mine isn't that old, yet it's a model that this device can;t communicate with - so all it could do was alert me when the door was open or closed.  It couldn't control the opener.  Had to return it.

Too many mornings I discovered that we had left the garage door open all night...and it really freaked me out.  A co-worker suggested this garage hub and I'm sure glad he did!  My husband hooked it up within a 1/2 hour and fell in love with it instantly.

Great product, makes it easy to open and close your garage with the app on the phone. I didn’t realize I could control it with Alexa (haven’t tried), so I didn’t rate that. I would like to see how that works before rating.

This unfortunately didn't work for me. I needed a device that would close a contact but this isn't capable of that. The instructions that talk about this was confusing. I returned this and bought a Nexx opener instead and I'm pretty happy with it

We bought one a year ago and never worked so I just never returned it.  When it went out of warranty, I bought another one.  It works so great.  It is awesome to see when the door is opened/closed by notification to my phone.  If it does not work, make sure you return before 1 year warranty is up.

This is a great addition to automating your home.I wanted to use the Amazon Key Delivery so packages are left in my garage instead of on my porch. It works great for that, taking the worry out of whether your package will be there when you get home.

its app never worked for me, always errors connecting to their server, so never been able to even install the product,looks like a typical hardware company who does not know how to manage cloud based product, once the traffic goes up, their server will become slow to or just offline.  Pathetic.

Got this cause my wife lost my garage door opener a while back. This device is great. I can be anywhere and open the garage door and make sure it’s closed. The installation process was a lil complex for my opener but i finally got it to work.
The sensor seems to work fine. It knows if the door is open or not. But when this device tries to open or close the door. it bumps and then does nothing. all the rest of my remotes work fine.

Between the installation and the easy in which it connect to everything makes this a wonderful addition to my smart home. Took my son-in-law hardly anytime at all to get it hooked up and running. And the phoe app gives you real time reporting

I ordered a NEW door sensor and clearly received a refurbished one. It’s missing some pieces, battery is already in... I’m not against it, it’s just not what I ordered. Had I wanted a refurbished one I would have save the $5 And been ok with it. I don’t think a new sensor should come with an used battery and missing pieces.

Great quality, works great once setup. Setup takes a few resets and power cycles before communication is established. If it was easy, theifs could probably access it too. Pleased so far with product. Notifications are excellent and quick.

I bought this to control my garage door. I don't use google or Alexa just the myQ app. Can't comment on what others are saying about subscriptions services. I was always driving off and wondering if I closed the damn door. With the cellphone app I can check the status of the door and close or open as needed. Works for me!

This item fit exactly what I was looking for and performs as expected. My only issue is that it doesn't integrate with Alexa without a little bit of work. Had it worked with Alexa (like all other modern "smart" devices, I would have given it 5 stars.

I’ve accidentally left my garage door opened twice due to my forgetting or the door going back up after hitting an object and this product met my needs. On one of those occasions, I had the police close my garage door as I was in NYC. A week ago, my nephew forgot to close the door on his way out.  I received an email alert and was able to close the door using the iPhone app.  Setting up the system was easy. I was in such a rush that I didn’t read the special instructions for the iPhone, but it didn’t matter though. I recommend this product.

The device works great, install was easy. I have an ancient Genie opener and it paired right up through the app.Not a huge fan of the app and "Works With Nest" was the opposite of what I was expecting. You CANNOT control the thing from within Nest's app. It add the thermostat to the Chamberlain app. I have no idea why I would want that. Fortunately I have a wink hub and that can control it.

Horrible.  Great idea, poorly executed. When it chooses to work it is great.  Unfortunately that has moved from not often to never.  App frequently will report no device installed or hub is offline. Was able to reset hub the first few times, by climbing up and unplugging device from ceiling outlet, not easy or convenient. Now nothing works.

Don’t use Alexa so cant give full stars on that. However I would say that this was a very easy instal. Was up and running within 10-15 minutes, it does work great and would recommend this to anyone. Even bought one for my brother Inlaw.

Was really surprised to see how inexpensive this unit is, provided that it's made by Chamberlain.  Everything installed very easily and integrated well with Smarthings and Google Home.  And I can easily switch between our home, and nearby family homes easily.  Apple Watch integration is flawless, too.  Highly recommended!

I like the fact that I get a "Garage Open' and a "Garage Closed" pop up on my iPhone. I paly poker and my wife drops me off and I can tell if she made it home ok. I see the garage open and then close.. Great IdeaThanks
I love the email alerts that I receive  Excellent price includes 1 door sensor--However, to purchase another sensor for the other door cost as much as the entire purchase with the hub and sensor-

Had I known how loud, annoying and unnecessary the beep was every time you close the door I would have never purchased. I high recommend getting a different brand (just check that they don't beep).Otherwise it seems like a great product, just a massive mistake to not allow a volume control on the safety beep. I will either be returning or (since I already have it installed) doing some surgery to disable the speaker myself.

This is by far one of my favorite purchases on Amazon. It’s VERY easy to install and QUICK. I suck at that kind of stuff and I had two doors set up in 5 minutes or so with no confusion.  Now I never have to worry if my garage door is shut or not! This is awesome!

Installed this on my existing 2011 model garage door opener. If you can follow directions and twist a screwdriver you can install  this in 10 min or less. I used a 3rd party app to facilitate Alexa compatibility and voice commands (Simple Commands) Tutorials are available on you tube to set this up. I Set it up to automatically close at 8PM in case I forget to close it at night (which I sometimes do) Works like a charm and  I do highly recommend this product.

I bought this for my second garage door as it was cheaper at the time to buy the whole setup than just buying the hub add on.  Paired easily and worked as described for the second door and now have a spare main unit if needed.

Product states it will work with garage doors from certain makes and models built after a certain year. Once received the instructions stated differently. Mine is a 8 year old craftsman with a red relearn button. It is not compatible

Great product for the price; like it that Amazon deliveries can be set inside the garage door out of the weather and safe from theft.  Only issue I have found is that my iwatch will not control the door if away from my iphone.
It's ok, but works only half way: I get the messages/alerts, but I can't use it to open/close the door. Can't speak to Alexa, but Google Assistant integration is minimal.

This is a great product! I had no problem installing it and it synced up with minimal time. I’ve had no issues with it and it has never lost connection to the wifi. The alerts are very prompt and they come through as soon as the door reaches the top. It’s a great way to keep your house safer and make sure you didn’t leave the garage door open. Would have no problem recommending it to my family or friends!!

I'm super pissed at this thing. Apparently if there is any error with the safety sensor it will OPEN your garage door but will not CLOSE your garage door... so now I am at work and can see that it happily opened the door but refuses to close it. Only solution is to close it from the actual button on the opener itself. Completely F-ing useless if I am 40 miles away at work... at first I liked it but now that it is leaving my garage door open for the next 8 hours I'm definitely going to remove this piece of crap.

I was scared it was going to be hard to install according to other reviews but maybe they are outdated. They offer in app videos that are ridiculously detailed for you to complete the installation, making it extra easy!! No problems connecting with the internet, or having to work with your router, like many mentioned before, and I have an standard Verizon 4g/5g, the whole process I handled with my phone, not unlike connecting an Apple Watch to the network.  I’ve had it for almost a month now and I haven’t had a single problem with it. Will purchase again!

The system integration with WiFi was fine with no problems.  But it could not link with a 2012 Chamberlain door system and repeated calls to customer service were fruitless.  I'm going to try another time and then return it if no success.

Very effective once installed.  Took a bit to select the right manufacturer since the cable color guidance in the app installation instructions were off.  Had to call in to support, but once connected they were courteous and helpful.

so i will definitely recommend this product. it's easy to install and their customer service is also responsive. plus it works. so you can monitor your garage door easily anytime. the reason for 4 start is they definitely need to improve their app. there are minor bugs which they improve it will be perfect. also if they can add future fixed time to open garage that will be best

The product gives you the ability to open and close your door remotely with your phone and you can tell when your door is open.  The hub uses wifi.  It has the ability to work with Alexa but that requires a subscription from Chamberlain.

Constantly dropping offline. Trouble connecting. Often a few minute delay with notifications. No native Alexa integration. If you're looking for wifi control/access for a garage door opener, get one that it's integrated not a secondary unit (hub) required.

This was extremely easy to install and pair with my genie pro garage door opener. The only issue the prevented me from giving it five stars is that if somebody uses one of the other remote to the garage before this one completed cycle, it will freeze it up completely and you have to start all over including removing The sensor from the application

Set up the 2nd door way faster than the first. Easy to set up in the app.Slightly more expensive than the hub and first unit due to recent sales. Probably should've just bought that combo again and saved the extra hub.

Now I can be at ease when I leave for work knowing I can close my garage door if I happen to forget. Installation was was trivial. Their doesn’t seem to be a way to add another user to the chamberlain app so I just installed the app on my wifes phone and used the same creds, not the best option, but works in the intermin. Chamberlain is IFFTT enabled also which is a plus.

Install was easy, pairing was a challenge and the app does very little to assist. The most frustrating thing is that the status of the door will not update if someone uses the regular opener buttons. Also the app takes forever to authenticate you and load to even be able to open/close the door. The goal of smart devices is to make life simpler not more of a hassle.
Works great. Simple to install and with the app I can make sure we/I closed the garage when we left. I can open it when I’m not there so that might be handy when needed.
I love this product - it's proof that a piece of garbage can still be shoved down the throats of the consumer given the right incentives and cooperation with Amazon.

The hardware works great!  The fee based (waived first year) subscription requires that you make a request through a MyQ server. It's like asking to execute a command twice and ripe for error.  No timeline for a fix is available.

The product was relatively easy to install...about 20 minutes or so and watching a video or two. I'm enjoying some of the 'passive' features such as knowing remotely whether the door is open or closed and the Amazon Key feature is handy.Important to me was that I could use my current remotes, which of course you can as the system is basically just that. Another remote, but connected to your wifi so you have remote capability via the app.

Installation instructions are a bit confusing but the fact I installed it means you probably can to.  The hardest thing I had was connecting it to my home network.  Downloading the app was simple.  Attaching the parts in the garage was simple.  (The instructions and videos were spot on). It works fine!  I wish there was an easier way other than having to open the chamberlain app and then choosing the garage to get the door to open.  It's not compatible with Alexa so when you're home you can't just tell Alexa to open the door.  But overall, I still give it 4 stars.  I love being able to let someone into my garage while I'm at work.

Installed very good and easy but due to the interference with keypad or something the connection from phone to this device not recognized very often. There were times I had locked out of garage since I didn't carry my other garage remote. I couldn't return the product as the seller ask me to pay for return shipping which is ~$20.00. I'm not happy with this purchase.

This device is not handy or useful at all. It tells me my garage door has been open for two days when in actuality it has not been. Sometimes when I am away from home it says it is open so I go to shut it and actually have opened it. Then it says I have to deal with it in person. Definitely not worth spending your money on. Don’t waste your time! Just by the garage door opener that has the feature already included. This gadget is a scam!

I had my 2 Door garage made into 1 door 4 years ago. The contractor put a Liftmaster Direct Drive opener. At the time, the hub was about $100. So I forgot about it and moved on. Last month I saw it on Amazon for under $30. Ordered it and installed it. Had a bug in the connection with my wireless. I called Chamberlin help line and 10 minutes later it was up and running. I would always be unsure if I left the door open. Not now! Now I am looking for ways to use IFTTT with it. Great product and service.

This product is awesome. I get txt notices every time my garage door is opened or closed. I also have the ability to get packages from amazon delivered into my garage door. Would recommend this to anyone who has a garage.

I paid full price for this product brand new but when I opened the sealed box it was obvious that it was used. There was no tab to pull out of the door sensor and the velcro stickers were already stuck on it and stuck to the box. Why did I receive a used product when I paid for a BRAND NEW ONE??? The product ended up working fine and so far the sensor hasn't fallen off of the garage door but EVERYDAY I look to make sure it hasn't fallen and gotten crushed by the car backing out of the garage.
After doing a few circuits around the block, decided to purchase this.  Works perfect with my iPhone.  Not hard to install, but probably need a ladder depending on your garage.

When closing using the myq app, there is an 8 second delay with an annoying beeping.  After the door hits the ground  the beeping continues for another 30 seconds.  Very annoying and according to support it is a Safety feature and no setting to turn off the beeping.  Support stated a lot of people have the same complaint but she does do not if there will be an update which allows the beeping to be silenced.  May look into returning if I can find one that does not beep.  Otherwise was an easy setup.

Great product and easy to install and program. Video and step by step instructions are easy to follow on the app and it integrates with partner apps such as XFINITY home security. Make sure you check your garage opener’s compatibility before buying.

This was easy to install and works great. Did one at another house and the result was equal. Nice to see the status of your door on your phone and be able to open it for such things as deliveries when you’re away from home

I don't like the beeping sound a wish if it was only twice or 3 times  I thought that was very annoying and another thing the remote sometimes doesn't work at all I have to close the door manually before that will start working again.

This product does not have support for Alexa. This is no app, it doesn't work with smart things either. It is useful but it would be 1000% better if they opened this device to work with other home automation products

It’s working with one out of two doors. After an hour and half on the phone, tech support didn’t have an answer to my question on how to make it work with the other device. The older version works with both doors but the new one only with one. I’ll likely be returning and buying the older version.  Both doors are liftmasters too and not a year old! You’d think the new version would work with all versions. So far, that’s not the case.

The product was easy to install and worked a few times in the beginning.  But now it only works here and there even with great wifi signal.  Rarely will work when operating the app on the phone from the driveway or inside the house.  Sometimes app says error, safety sensors blocked, even though they are clear and I can close it manually by the garage door button. Not a reliable product, save your money.

After using the compatibility tester on the website and reading online comments I was sure that the "e" model hub would work with the overhead door odyssey 1000 openers. It doesn't.Also waited an hour to talk to customer service and was then disconnected. They didn't call me back despite taking my number. Oh, and they didn't return my email either. Nice.

This was extremely easy to install. The app has videos that walk you through each step. I was worried our very old garage opener would be incompatible but it worked like a charm. We also no longer need to install a keypad for our garage. Great value and product!

Ignore the negative reviews. This thing works. Like most things, I found the installation video on YouTube. Easy to install to the garage ceiling and sensor device stickies itself to the top left or top right of the garage door. Not hard to pair them together. I can open my garage door anywhere via cellular or wifi. I have not tested Alexa integration because I do not have Alexa.

I have two  2 car garage , put a hub in each and a total of four sensors.  Works perfectly very helpful does what advertised. Easy installation. Just follow the directions on the tutorial on your phone. You cannot miss.

Works well once it's installed and operating. We like the option to receive notifications when the garage door opens and the ability to check it from anywhere. We would have given it five stars but the installation instructions didn't work for our Chamberlain GD opener. Fortunately, the telephone support person provided a workable solution very quickly.

Only took me about 5-10 minutes of setup. The instructional videos in the app were very helpful and I got this set up in no time. It also works really well. The only thing I wish is that it had better Alexa integration. There is no Alexa skill to pair with this device. If you messed with IFTTT could probably get it to work. Other than that for the price you are getting a great deal.

Installation was easy though I was skeptical that the unit will work with chamberlain that does not have myQ written in it. Just follow the steps that come with the unit. All in all about 15 mins to set it up.It does need a good WiFi connection though. Does not bed to be super strong but at least 3 bars of it.

Difficulty in setting up app on older android Galaxy Phone, so set up on newest iPhone then added as user on Android. Once that was done, works well.  Have not tried left open notification feature but will update review once completed.

I’d like to because it gave me a piece of mine wondering if my garage door is open or close when I am away from home. My dislike for me was installing the hub you cannot install it close to the garage door opener it needs to be more than 4 feet away for it to work. I installed it on the garage wall instead of the ceiling.

My brand was covered, but the garage door setup has the wrong signal (which started my brand has potential not to work based on frequency) and couldn’t communicate with this device. My friend has this product and works fantastic

I followed the website instructions, the install went flawlessly, and it works like a charm- so far.  Don't buy the refurb. Don't stint the wifi coverage. Don't place the control module too far from the sensor OR the garage opener.  Install the latest firmware. Make sure the batteries in the sensor are good. I have a Wink hub and had no problem adding the Chamberlain as a device.

This is a very very easy device to install. Nice thing about it if you're not home and you have a relative or friend just get in the house without giving him the key or code to your house you can open the garage anywhere.

I recently purchased the MyQ Smart Garage Door Opener and it does not work.  I have had nothing but issues with the entire system.  Set up was a breeze, but after that it does not work...constant error messages.  APP shows door closed with its open and open when closed.  If you use the wall opener that comes with the garage door opener then the MyQ does not recognize that the door opener was used and error shows up on APP...complete waste of money.

This is great for those times you pull out of the garage and after driving away, wondering if you remembered to hit the button to close the garage door. You go to the programs and it shows you when the door was last activated.  Very cool

I like this enough to buy a second one for my second home.  I had significant problems installing the first one to my Chamberlain garage door opener though.  I hope the second install goes better with my Genie.More to come...

Picked it up on prime day after reading all the reviews.  I had some doubts initially but after installing it using the instructions worked for the first time on two Genie garage door openers that are over 10 years old.  But then it would not work properly even after reset of the hub.  I called the customer service and spoke to a lady who patiently walked me through the installation and it has worked well since then.  This thing is amazing and I am glad i picked up one.  Tip: make sure to install the sensors on the top panel on the right or the left, do not put in the middle since it does not work well.  Also you need good wifi in the garage.

Was very easy to install, took me 10 minutes. Connectivity to the WiFi and Garage door opener was simple and easy. Adding a guest for the purpose of using MyQ was very easy. If you want to integrate with Alexa us the SimpleCommands app. In general this was easy and the MyQ systems works great.

I like gadgets and this is a great one. I like the fact I can check the status of the door when I am not at home or I can open the door for a friend needing to borrow a tool; I could go on but it works well and the price can't be beaten.

In the end, a disappointing product. The mobile app often freezes or logs out leaving you sitting in the driveway futzing with your phone instead of the seamless experience it portrays to be. The voice control is a monthly subscription (something I didn't see until after I had bought it) and it often won't close for no apparent reason when the normal controller will.

INSTALLATION:  Directions are clear and easy to follow. I couldn't install transmitter unit on ceiling as directed. I placed mine on a shelf AWAY FROM internet transmitter and 4 feet from door opener. It works just fine.

I have a 13yr old Overhead Door (Python) opener.  This was simple to instal and work wonderfully.  The app, which is free, allows you to open and close the door and will send you updates if you want.  For $20??? Need I say more...

Easy to install. Typical learning procedure like homelink.  After that it just works.  It does charge to allow other devices to integrate with it ( smartthings ) and it doesn't have an autoclose after 30 minutes of being open ( like their wifi garage door openers ), which made me deduct 1 star.

It was easy to install and get it up and running. The only thing I don’t like is the loud audible noise it makes when closing the garage door.  I understand it’s a safety feature but it needs a volume control on it.

It’s been a couple weeks now and I’m still working through the app but this has great potential. No remote to lose or get stolen. Never need to remember to take the remote with you, almost everyone carries their phone now.

Love the idea of this product. It’s great that we can use it on the go and have access through our phones. But the loud alarm and flashing often scares my kids and the app doesn’t always want to work. But overall does a good job of serving its purpose.

I have done a lot of research on smart home devices. The myq Garage Hub is awesome. It was super easy to install and setup. So far there have been no issues. Our main reason for this purchase was so that when we pull away from our house and get down the road, we can check and make sure we shut the door. Before we had to turn around and go check. I highly recommend this for your home!

This product works with WiFi, so I expected it to work. The product was hard to install, and pairing it with my phone took longer than anticipated. After installation, it worked for a few days (however was very unreliable), and then suddenly stopped working all together!! I tried resetting and synchronizing everything again, but it STILL didn't work. In conclusion, this is a time consuming, unreliable product, so don't waste your money on it.

I followed the instructions many times  and even made sure was compatible with my garage opener and  I try and try  but it never connects with it..  i have fiber optics  so  wifi catches  but won't connect to my garage opener even though its on the list .. wish worked easy like instructions stated and  worked with my opener

Super easy to install and use. The most difficult part was finding the adhesive strips/screws in the box (they didn’t slide out when I opened the box and stayed in the box) I eventually found them digging through everything. Minor issue and I should have looked more throughly in everything. Video made it super easy to install.

The first one that arrived was missing the door sensor the second one was complete but neither of them worked. The “trouble shooting” takes you to a website that says they will do a warranty exchange because the item is defective. This was a complete nightmare

Works well.  Installed it myself with ease.  Did have a glitch with the app where I had to manually close the garage door(just not using the app) to reset an error.  Other than that works flawless.  Love being able to see if I forgot to close my garage door.  Also like being able to set up customized alerts right to your phone.

Work awesome for the first month, then said I couldn't get a connection. That was over a month ago and I still haven't gotten it to work again. I know it's not my router because everything else works with the router. Tried to reconnect it multiple times with no luck.
