Even tried to factory reset it but that didn't work either and it won't remove the device from my app in order to reconnect it. So now it's just sitting in my garage collecting dust.

I bought this product and had no trouble in installing. Very easy, clear instructions. Has some hicupps due to my ignorance but when called customer support, they were very friendly and resolved by issues. Highly recommend this product.

This worked great for the 1 week it worked! I've reset the thing several times and it works for about a day and then stops responding to opening and closing my garage within the app. It's actually been more of a problem because it always unlinks my actual garage remotes during the reset process. Pass on this product and look into other models. I bought this on a whim from a lightening deal. It's not even worth the $20 I spent on it.

I wanted a simple solution to have control of the garage door but I didn't want the keypad, I found this hub and I like it better. Not only I can open and close the door with our phones, it lets me know when someone opens it even if it's with the existing hardwired switch. I also setup an action to automatically close it in the morning and in the evening. No more "turn back, I don't remember if the garage door closes", or getting out of the bed to check before sleeping.Very happy with the product and the app. Well worth it.

bought in March, stopped working in August. App went to blue screen. Tried new app. Got as far as rest to factory specs once but wont connect to wi-fi. all of my wi-fi and apps work fine so I can only assume I made a mistake in purchasing this.

It works with Amazon Key, but it does not and WILL NEVER work with Alexa according to Chamberlain.  Extremely disappointed after installing only to find that out.One star because that is the only reason I bought it.

UPDATE - Trying to get this to work through either Alexa or IFTTT but no luck. It seems that Chamberlain has decided to make a money grab and charge extra for a “premium” account but even that doesn’t work. Also, from reading their support discussion boards, Chamberlain is well aware of the issue but won’t fix it. GO SPEND YOUR MONEY WITH SOMEONE ELSE!  Unless Chamberlain decides to stop with the money grab this will be the last product of theirs I buy.Got this a few days ago.  Really easy installation and setup.  Only took me 15 minutes and worked perfectly right away.  Our existing garage door openers haven't been working great for a while now so I decided to add this to our setup.  Now the door is opening right away without any issues.

if you were concerned about leaving your door open before, things have just gotten a whole lot worse. The app tells you your door is open when it’s not . if you then close remotely, guess what, you just opened it. lots and lots of problems

The MyQ smart garage door opener was easy to set up. It took me less than 20 minutes. Synced with the Chamberlain app with no issues, as well as my Wink Hub. Being able to control my garage door with my phone is convenient, and I love being able to open an app and see if the door is opened or closed.

First. Please provide personal information in case someone at MyQ needs access to your garage. Then when you are sent your confirmation email verifying your email address, the link doesn’t work. So you can’t use the app until you verify your email.  And the Chat support on MyQ website is also poor.  I am too busy to be bother.  Should not be this hard to be a customer.

Fairly easy to install and I loved the idea of the product. But unfortunately I’ve had way more instances of the sensor “sticking” or something where it incorrectly thinks my garage door is open. Where this was meant to add peace of mind, it’s just more of an annoyance with at least a couple times a week telling me my garage door is open and I’ve got to go check it. I can’t trust it

Works great. I’m not sure why there are so many bad reviews. I bought this on a flash sale and then read the reviews, something I normally would not do.I’m guessing some people are having connection problems due to a poor WiFi signal.
Followed the appl instructions, easy to install and add to myQ device. Not sure why I haven’t purchase this sooner!  Now I can check my other door go see if it’s up or down

Works great.  I had some trouble getting it to communicate with my garage door, as mine wasn't listed under the approved manufacturers list.  But I did get it working.  Works great.  Nice to have peace of mind knowing the garage door is shut,.  I did add a security camera in my garage, just so I can visually see if it is closed or not.

MyQ works great for me. Installation was quick and easy as was setup. It’s nice to be able to make sure my garage door is down when I’m away by just checking the app. My only regret and reason for four stars and not five is there is no integration with the Alexa app at this time. When they can do that, I will up it to a five star.

Installation was a bit of a pain, to say the least. I had to power cycle the hub a few times to get it to pair with the sensor and then it wouldn't pair with the door opener, which is a newer Chamberlain model. More power cycling and re-pairing with the sensor and it finally paired with the door opener. Physical installation was a piece of cake, but pairing issues were very frustrating and added two unnecessary hours to installation time. The unit works as advertised now that it's paired and I do love that I can tell if I've left my garage door open, which I do often because I'm a space case.

Rarely works. Definitely do not rely on this as your only way to open your garage door. Then doors randomly open in the middle of the night while I'm asleep. Easily the worst software, app, and hardware combination I've ever purchased.

This was money in the garbage,  and I wasn't even able to return it cause I didnt try it but like 2 or 3 months after I ordered cause we were moving to a new house and didnt had time to do it.  It does NOT sink to my garage door. I cant do absolutely anything with it.
Integration with Google Assistant or Alexa requires a $10 per year fee.  This was not clear before I bought it.

MY Q garage door open literally took 5 minutes to install. Great design.I did have one issue where the home square box lost contact with the door indicator, but it was a simple fix to unplug and replugin to reset it. So far, it hasn’t lost connection again.

No issues with the installation, plenty of videos via the app to help you there if you don't want to read text. It works as expected. This isn't a life-changing product but it's nice to know you're garage is down when you're way and nice to be able to open your door if the remote is not available.

(Major Convenient TIP)You can place this between your router(Wi-Fi) and the garage door, even in the home. It can be loud and yet I was able to conceal it in my home out of sight and in a closed container.  Works like a gem!

I've been using this product for awhile now.  It doesn't support alexa which is pretty annoying.  For the most part I haven't had any issues with the product itself.  The app can be finicky sometimes.but always works itself out after closing and reopening the app.

Initially set up was very easy, but I could not get the hub to sync with my motor/opener.. Turns out I have a orange button 3/4 horsepower Chamberlain but I had to use the purple button setting on the app. also... the app instructs you to push the garage door learn button first and then initiate the next step on the app. You need to initiate the next step on the app and then push the learn button. Problem solved.

This thing was a game changer for me. Works just like it said and also use it with Amazon to delivery garage packages to keep them safe. There is also nothing like having the security and peace of mind and knowing that your garage door is closed. The alerts are priceless.

For a device and an app that controls the garage door remotely, it works as described. What I don't get, is there is no Alexa support (or integration) yet Amazon has partnered with them (Genie/MyQ) to allow AMazon deliveries via the garage door.

We have a 3 year old Liftmaster, and it was easy to see which version of the MyQ I needed to buy. $30 on Amazon, maybe 30 minutes to install, software and hardware. We have had issues with our garage door reopening when the sensor detects a leaf or something (I know, this is a setting on the operator) and now I can recheck, and initiate a closing from work or wherever I am. We have had some things taken from the garage when it was open, so this should help minimize that.

Very simple to install. Have not had any issues with it opening by itself. Only wish I could have more control over it, for example if I want to stop it before it opens all the way. But other than that I really like it.

If you have a garage door that is compatible with this package, I recommend especially if you often wonder did I shut the garage door, did someone else leave open or you want to let someone in.  Simple install.  Have not tried Alexa integration.  It works.
Couldn't get it to work... customer service unable to help said it was a problem on their end yo try again in a day or two... terrible

Was easy to install, connected easily (I did this inside my home at my desk and then when I got to the step of connecting the door sensor I went into the garage) works as stated ( I have a pet that goes in and out of the garage when the door is up, when it exits as the door is closing it trips the reversing sensor and sends the door back up, I concentrate more on backing out of the driveway a than watching the door go down completely and this give me piece of mind to verify the door is closed) I'm happy with this purchase.

Used the app to try setting the device up. The app was very user friendly but my device wouldn’t connect to WiFi (no issues with my WiFi). The app instructed me to contact customer service. Called customer service and waited on the phone for almost 30 minutes. While waiting on the phone there was a computer generated message that said they were aware of problems with the device and they would be happy to assist. While I was still on hold with customer service, I decided it wasn’t worth the hassle of setting up and will return the item.

Great product, easy to install and a steal at $20. My only complaint is that to use this to operate a 2nd door you have to buy $25 tilt sensor. So I ordered a returned complete unit from Amazon to save a few bucks and guess what...the previous buyer returned it to Amz after they robbed the tilt sensor....uggg

Great product, works as advertised, sends me immediate text messages when the door opens or closes. very easy to setup if you make sure that you are connecting to the correct Wi-Fi/Internet connection. Took me a couple of tries to get it setup correctly, but again, that was due to operator error of me not choosing the right Wi-Fi connection the first time. on-line instructions are much more thorough than instructions that come in the box. shows you how to reset the hub if you need to. otherwise outstanding product.I have left home many times and wondered if I shut the garage door or not, now with this great product, I don't have to worry anymore.
This has been absolutely awesome! I can now tell when I have left the garage door open (and close it)Plus I have it programmed to close automatically every night, just in case.

Happy with the product. Took 10 minutes for set up. I was keeping my fingers crossed after going through all reviews. Even more, I have just kept it in a corner of my garage and have not even hanged it on the ceiling near my garage opener and it still works. So I did not even use any screwdriver for setup.

Left my garage doors open last week.  Decided that I need a sensor to know if my garage doors were open or closed.  This device and an additional sensor were just the ticket.  Took about a half hour working slow to put up and configure.  No wires required.  Just the plug.  I highly recommend.

It's great to have notification of garage door open/close. Especially like ability to close if open at a specific time. Ability to open the door remotely is very nice. Saved me when I had a delivery while I was away and no neighbors around.

I wanted to have the same app controlled as our cabin, utilize Amazon Key and it needed to retrofit my existing opener. This works great and was very easy to install. Also got a great deal via the Amazon discount for Key delivery usage.

Works just like it should. I like being able to open my garage door from my phone. I also like the alerts when it opens, closes or when its left open. The app could work better. I don't like having to sign in every time I use it. And sometimes it take a few minutes before it will update showing closed

Works very well and is very easy to setup. The Google Home integration has to improve as it needs followup conversations to communicate with it.Have not tried the Alexa integration yet, so unable to comment.

Love it, love it, love it. It was the one piece my security system for some reason couldn’t integrate without replacing garage door opener they said wasn’t compatible. Yes I have to use a different app, but it works great and does exactly what I need.

I needed a way to open my garage door remotely (long distance from house) and this fit the bill.  It works through my phone and Alexa.I had a little trouble installing it (there are several steps to go through), and one of them just didn't work.  So I bit the bullet and called the customer service number.  A pleasant young lady asked me a few questions about my garage door opener, and within minutes solved the problem.  It's been working nicely.

This little gadget is better that I expected and very easy to install. Just follow the directions and everything works. After install I reset my router and needed to re-establish my Wi-Fi connection. To do that you need to take down the send/receive unit and take it over to the garage door opener to reprogram. When I figured that out everything went great.

This is a very nice item to have. Very useful. It works great, easy install. Works with my 25 year old opener and a LG6 smart phone. I think its great! I no longer need openers in each car. I just use my phone.

I had no issues getting this installed to my garage opener. The app you download walks you through the entire process and it only takes minutes from start to finish. It works great, and the app is very user friendly. You can set up schedules just in case you tend to leave it open when you leave for work.
I have 3 garage doors and was worried to find something that I could use for all three.  Although I had to buy 2 hubs to make it work, they all do work!

Easy to install and pair. I don't use it very often but it does give peace of mind to know that the door is closed when not at home. Amazon Key isn't available in my area but I'm REALLY looking forward to that feature.

You can't add multiple accounts or phones to the Hub. Only one person can have control of the door opener, anyone else will have to try and share the same account login and password. 100% non-functional for a multi person household.I only found this out after installing the app and doing some googling.

very easy to install and integrate. no alexa tie-in as for my purpose it seemed a bit excessive. Really love the tracking feature that lets you know how long the door has been left open or closed. fairly intuitive app

My expectation was that this works all the time nit just 7 or 8 out of 10 times. Some times I don't get the notification on the app even after the garage door is closed and other times you cannot close/open the garage door from the app. Disappointed.

we use it all the time when we forget our keys and don't have the remote garage keypads. this also works with Alexa and amazon delivery straight into my garage. the downside is that it charges money to work with other smart things

This is one of those products that I cannot live without. I cannot count how many times I’ve had to turn around to physically check if I closed my garage door. For how cheap this product is and how easy it is to install and use, it’s a game changer. You can retrofit it to almost any modern garage door opener and it just simply works. This is probably the best product for the money I have spent in a long time. I am usually not compelled to write a review on products whether good or bad but this product, was so beyond expectations, I felt the need to do so.

This product work great, but a lot of people don't understand,  that the smart Hub can work with many garage doors not just two. Used the Merlin app. And just add the little mini to the garage door and add it to the smart Hub.

The convenience of being able to open or close the garage is great. I bought this mostly to easily check if my garage door is closed as it’s on the bottom floor of a 3 story house. Everything worked fine for a while then the app mysteriously started showing the garage door as open when in fact it was closed. Changed the battery several times(expect maybe a month or two of battery life on he sensor) and still with brand new battery on the sensor it does not sync with the base unit. Ended up getting an extra door sensor for my Ring home alarm so I can make sure the door is in fact closed.

Was REALLY looking forward to installing this so my kids could open the garage with their phones. Turns out that my Allister opener isn’t compatible because it doesn’t have a learn function.  The description said it was compatible with “most” brands with the safety sensor. I wish they had specifically said which ones they were not compatible with before my purchase. Ironically, after I installed it, their app listed Allister and only then did it say it wasn’t compatible. I paired my opener to my cars without any issue, so I expected this to use a similar method that worked. Just disappointed.

We've tried everything from buying a WiFi extender, giving the myQ a WiFi connection all of its own ... nothing works. Stays connected for a day and then nothing. The app allows you to see if the door is open/closed, but won't let you actually open/close the door from the app.
I needed a second sensor for my second door and this was exactly the right thing.  Works great.  Pairs instantly with very little effort.  Really a nice product that has so far been flawless.
Love this for my garages. Wish I ordered this months ago. Only down size is if you have two garage doors you need to purchase another sensor which cost almost the same as the initial purchase.

I live alone and this is ideal for when I leave the house and can't recall whether I closed the garage door or not. Never have to go back to check, or to worry again. Easy step by step instructions made installation a breeze.

I had a previous version of this that was difficult to install and required going back and forth from settings back to the app and back again. This was so easy to install with the app. Just kept continuing and it set up perfectly. I highly recommend this.

After reading some reviews, I was a little skeptical. I found this very easy to install and connect to the app / wifi.Works as expected and I now of peace of mind that the garage door is secure. Adding a second user was a little vague. You can add as a guest but they get no notifications. So in my case, I added the app to my wife's phone and logged in with my data. Works perfect. I would recommend this product.

Very easy to setup, physically and digitally. Love the scheduled alerts. Wish I could schedule an open time for morning bike rides, you can only schedule closing. Maybe once I setup with Alexa I can make an open routine.

Haven't tried it with Alexa yet, but LOVE that it was so easy to install! Peace of mind knowing that if i DO forget to close it again as I leave (has happened twice over the years...) I can check it from afar. Great product idea!

Mine just doesn’t stay connected. I must have restarted the device tons of times and it goes offline after a while every time. I even have the TP link WiFi extender right next to it, didn’t make any difference. 1 star for a bad product.

Easy to set up but then find out there is no Alexa skill for this opener. You have to go through all kids of skills and set up a skill and blah blah. If I would have known it didn’t work with Alexa I would not have bought.

Works. Be aware that when using the app to close the door the hub beeps loudly in the garage. There is no way to shut it off.  Again it’s only when you use the app to close it. That is my only complaint. Works as expected.

Impossible to install without professional help. The lady I had on the phone was fantastic!  She helped me set it up fir two different garage doors. Without her help I would have sent it back for a refund.

This works fine to control garage door and allow for Amazon deliveries into garage. I don’t understand why you need to pay for an extra subscription to combine with google assistant...also I had some problems linking to Amazon Key. Could not do it on iphone and needed to go to another device.

Very easy to setup and install. Not sure why there’s so many negative reviews... for a week I had the hub installed on a wall over 20 feet away from the opener and it worked well without issues. Quick response to commands and the open/close alerts work well.

Before this, often I would dive away, wonder if I closed the garage and then have to drive all the way back to my house, just to find that I did in fact close it. With this product, I can see on my phone if and when my garage was opened or closed, as well as open it close it at the push of a button.

Installation and syncing with the phone couldn’t be easier. I watched a couple videos on YouTube before starting, made the whole process a breezeLove being able to to program times to close, and the notification of the door opening  is really cool.

I purchased this 30 days ago. I followed the instructions to the letter on installation. I found that, half the time I used the app, the MyQ would show to be offline. I tried moving it and turning it, like the instructions advised and it still does this. My wife was stranded outside because it was showing “Offline” on her app. I logged in on mine and it worked fine. This device sucks. Don’t buy it.

You can only automate closing the door and that's iffy. Sure it has "Amazon key" integration for deliveries. Most precious so far so not qualify for key delivery or will take longer to arrive. Giant wtf on this product.

I thought this will resolve my issue of being able to close garage door remotely if needed...but very inconsistent... 1 in 4 Time does the job...have to override manually Everytime... Not sure what's the issue...

Works well except it messed up our garage door openers.  I’m sure we can reset them. Nice feature for the ocd wife being able to tell when closed and isn’t.  Also nice cause can set alarm on it to notify if garage left open beyond a certain period of time

I bought this to work with two doors. It installed on one door with only a bit of trial and error. The second door, with the same brand opener as the first, will not pair properly despite many many attempts. Customer support had me do a number of actions that made no sense (e.g., moving the base farther and closer to the unworking opener; disregarding that the same distances worked for the working opener). It seemed they were just guessing and really had no idea how to get it to work. The product just does not work as advertised and customer service was unhelpful.

I bought this to work with two doors. It installed on one door with only a bit of trial and error. The second door, with the same brand opener as the first, will not pair properly despite many many attempts. Customer support had me do a number of actions that made no sense (e.g., moving the base farther and closer to the unworking opener; disregarding that the same distances worked for the working opener). It seemed they were just guessing and really had no idea how to get it to work. The product just does not work as advertised and customer service was unhelpful.

Took me a few minutes to install. So worth the money and piece of mind. Originally was going to buy new opener buttons but if I lock myself out of the car it would be useless. Perfect solution. Just waiting for amazon garage delivery to be available in my area.

If you use Apple Car Play to connect your phone to your dash display, this will not work with it.  You can still pick up the phone and use the phone as a remote, but the product manager missed the mark by a mile by not including car play.

I had bought a MyQ to control 2 of our 3 garage doors. I was impressed with the integration and app. I bought the second one so I can use the sensor to pair with the current hub. Then I found that you can only control 2 sensors with 1 hub. I dont see why that is a restriction with the hardware. Seems they want to sell more hubs and have made this restriction. I like MyQ but I wish they could allow more sensors on the same hub.

I decided to add the second garage door opener purchased on Amazon received in one day installed in 10 minutes!And I was pairing it with a genie garage door opener. Super happy with my purchase if you’re thinking about it just do it!

Wanted something to alert me when door is opened or closed and it does the job.  Wish it has a function of progamming unit or adding a motion sensor (non activity to trigger alert) alerting user when the door was left open.

Installation and smart system integration is seamless, took me less them 10 minutes to be up and running. Works like a charm with my  Google Home System and cameras.  The price is unbelievable for what this product accomplishes.

The setup for any smart home device is unclear and requires extra subscriptions. It doesn't work directly with Alexa it Google home. If you plan on only using the MyQ app then it will serve it's purpose but if you'd like to use Alexa or Google home, don't bother.

I’ve had the MyQ for a few months, and it does exactly what I need it to. I get notifications on my phone that my garage is open or closed. I can open it or close it from my app. I don’t have to circle back and make sure I closed my garage door. Easy install as well!

This product did not work at all. I sent it back in for a replacement, and the second one would not connect either. I called support and both of the units were registered to another account, so I was unable to assign it to my account. This could not be reset. The originally owner had to remove the device from their account. These were supposed to be new!

Rating it 3 stars not because this is a bad product. I just think there is a lot improvement in the installment process. I had to redo the process through their app multiple times in order to get it works. After the installment, the garage door opener is working flawlessly.

Fairly easy to setup and install. The app is awkward, always requiring a sign in that is slow to use, so not great for opening the garage if you’re in a hurry. I really do like the notification feature informing you when the door has opened or closed.

Nice product. Have it installed in our vacation home. But the battery in the door sensor died within a week of installing it. And it won’t work without the door sensor.  Odd size battery CR 2450. Which I Couldn’t pick up locally. So I couldn’t use it on my first trip to the house.  Now I have to order a battery and bring it with me on my next visit.

Looks like a great deal but I got a defective one the customer support was excellent after I explained everything they told me just send it back it was defective. So I change my mind or not going to install one.
How many times you're on the road and thinking if you've really closed your garage.You don't need to worry more with this device.
The written included instructions are incomplete and worthless. Watch a video on you tube to learn how to install. Funny , because the official you tube video tells you to read the instructions.

Ordered two of these used. I couldn't get either to connect to my internet. I followed the directions and I have a strong wifi signal yet it could never connect. Avoid buying these used. There's a good reason they were sent back.

The installation was simple. My husband and I installed it in about 30 minutes. The only  issue I ran into was selecting the type of garage motor I have and the color of the learn button. The heat from the motor discolored the button. I thought it was orange but it’s actually purple. I have a Liftmaster.  When I change the color to purple in the setup the garage immediately opened. I love it.

One of the better purchase I got during black friday. Took me less then 30 min to install and setup.Recieving notifications of the door status and never second guessing if I closed the garage is well worth it.
Takes a few minutes to set up using easy step by step clear instructions.The product gives me a huge peace of mind that my garage is closed  & the ability to open it remotely from my phone if needed.
Problem solverI was always forgetting if I closed the garage door, especially when I  was going to be gone a long time

So far so good!  The install wasn't a piece of cake but i got it to work.  I love knowing if I left my garage open.  I recently received a notification that my garage was left open after arriving to work.  I have a camera in my garage and sure enough i did leave it open.  I hit the close button and watched it close from my office.  Awesome!!

This system has worked flawlessly. I set it up without help in about 15 minutes. Being able to have my Amazon purchases delivered inside my garage and being able to view the transaction offers peace of mind for a secure delivery. I highly recommend this system!

I only give it three stars as the feature to work with Google is only half baked.  It was one of the main reasons I wanted it was to allow voice control via Google Home which DOES NOT work.It does sent notices when the door is opened.

Very easy to setup & install. Works as designed. Nice to check if doors shut downstairs when heading to bed, and close if need. No more hiding garage door opener for serviceman, etc.Does not work with Alexa Echo, then again, very little works with Alexa Echo. Highly reccomend with compatible door openers.

It’s only been installed a couple days, but so far works perfect.  Download the app for connections as it walks you through.  I was confused between some bad amazon reviews, some amended directions, the links function that’s provided, and the app.  I finally got it after a few missteps.

Works great with my Genie garage door opener. Easy to install. Great App.  My ONLY issue was the initial setup with WIFI.  After trying 2 hours to set-up from the App on my phone, I was ready to smash it with a hammer.  My last attempt was to download the app on my tablet - connected to my wifi in 2 minutes - problem solved.  After the wifi was connnected, the APP works great from my phone or tablet.  The trick was using my tablet for initial set-up rather than my phone....  Pittsburgh, PA.

Can't believe how easy this thing was to install.  It took me like 20 minutes because I read everything and watched all the videos when really I could have just figured it out on my own in like 5 minutes.  Works great. I like that it'll automatically close my door in the evening if I forgot to close it.

Simple to install and set up but only works with Alexa through other apps which charge a service apparently. If youre fine just using the MyQ app it works great and the notifications can be set up pretty easy. Really looking forward to the KEY function.

Remote control and checking is great.  However, there is one major, obvious feature missing.  It can't alert you when your garage door is left open at night.  That's basically the main reason people need to buy this, so that's a huge drawback.

Very simple to use and installed. Very well thought out solution. Amazing smart phone app. No more Amazon packages delivered in the snow. No more accidentally leaving the garage door open with automatic closing scheduling feature.

Worthless piece of garbage. After several tries to get it to connect with a myQ garage opener. I spent an hour with tech support trying to get it to work. Piece of garbage. Connects to the WiFi but nothing working to open the garage. Won’t even pair with the garage sensor either. Worthless
It looks so flimsy I thought it was not gonna work and I was going to be pissed off but amazingly everything works well easy to install I’m very satisfied

Easy to setup and use battery life is surprisingly long lasting. Purchased based on my brothers-in-law’s recommendation when my wife complained about garage access and the ability to close the garage remotely if left open. Nothing but smiles.
I bought this used via amazon warehouse for $13. It took like 5 minutes to install and it works perfectly.Now my wife & roommates can open the garage.

It works perfect. Every time i leave the house i get a block or two from home and i turn to my wife and say " did i close the garage door ? " now i have been 200 miles away from home and i look at the app for the MYQ door opener and smile.  Yes it is closed. It works perfect  Thankyou.  Mitch :-)

The functionality of the app works great. The problem is that Chamberlain has deliberately limited 3rd party connections to force people to pay them subscription fees or buy additional hardware to work with Siri or Alexa or Google. I highly recommend people look elsewhere for a truly connected garage opener. NEXX Garage is a great alternative.

This unit was easy to install and works great.  The app for my phone works great as well. I'm now able to open and close my garage door remotely.  I'm also able to check and see if I left the garage door up when I leave home.

Installation and use are both very straightforward. My only complaint is the inability to open the door through a Google Assistant voice command. Company claims it's a security issue, but I should be able to override that.

I have only been using for 1 week. I only use to let me know if I have drove and left door open. Some times I check when I am away from home and seems to be working. I wish it could be compatible with my nest products

Added this to my Chamberlain garage door opener and it works great. I am able to see if I drove away and forgot to close the garage door again. I am able to remotely open and close the door, if need be. Good piece of mind.

Husband ordered and easy to install.  We love it. Husband programed it with Amazon. Deliveries are dropped in the garage.  We can see when it opens,  how long it is open and the time it closes.  We always use the app and are able to open our garage from anywhere.

After reading the reviews and with 13 year old openers, I expected a 2 month disaster.  I was already trying to decide whether to return it or throw it in a drawer.  Instead, install was smooth and quick and it works perfectly.  The only caution I have is WiFi range is problematic and usually much shorter than expected especially when passing through walls.

Seems to be an easy to install wireless product. But it has mouthly subscription fee for using with Google home assistant. I hate subscription fee on thing that I own. I ended up returning it for a different product.
Total garbage. Worked for a few months, now won’t pair properly. Will work for a couple minutes, then stop. Completely frustrating and a total waste of money.

Didn’t want to pair. Tried multiple times And different situations to pair and it wouldn’t. It would try to pair and would open and close the garage a few times during pairing but would ultimately fail and not pair.

You would think being the sole purpose to be a garage door opener via Wi-Fi that it would come with a stronger signal.  Once the garage door closes it loses signal every time, even with a signal booster

Couldn’t connect to my “compatible” Chamberlain LiftMaster Professional garage door.  Setup was simple enough but never could get it to communicate with the remote (last step in the setup). Returned. There are better products out there that you can easily hardwire.

This device works as advertised and all I had to do was watch the video and it was very easy to setup. The IOS app is very good and they also have an Apple watch app that works great. I got a good price because of the sale and it works perfectly!
Randomly opens up at different times of day, defeating the whole purpose of the system.I can't count how many times i would go to my car in the morning just to find the garage open yet again.
Bought hub and 2 sensors.  Easy install and worked with 1 sensor.  Adding 2 sensor after 20 mins and 0 luck.  Syncs to hub but will not sync to opener

Remote access to door status is helpful. Follow up door status when entering or leaving the garage is very helpful. Easy to pair to the garage door opener. All in all great features and functions at a very reasonable price.

I bought this mostly to monitor traffic in and out of the garage since it is more convenient for the family and I to use the house entrance through the garage. I got exactly that. The bonus of being able to open the door for friends or family borrowing tools, etc. or delivering items is convenient. Easy install for the technically/mechanically inclined. You can set alarms to send notifications to your phone as well. I set mine to send a notification when the door is opened or closed. I also set one to tell me if the door has remained open for an extended amount of time.

Worked pretty well at first. Now it won’t communicate at all. It probably needs a hard reset, but I’ll have to pull out a ladder to get to it. If the sun beats down on the door all day it sometimes doesn’t detect a status change.

Bought as Christmas gifts for 2 sons. One installed it so far. He said took about 1/2 hour because he had to call for help.His garage door opener was a different brand. He said it is working very well.

Keeps saying my door is still open when door is actually closed. found out the hard way that when it showed door open and i told app to close door, it actually opened door, so after 8 hours at work came home to an open door even though app now said closed.
I am so happy this solves a problem if door is open or closed. I found it was easy to install. The instructions and video were clear to understand.i highly recommend this product

Everything works with Alexa, c'mon Chamberlain!!! Hopefully a firmware update in the future will make this a great product. Until then only 4 stars. The install was easy and it works as advertised, using with a chamberlain liftmaster pro formula 1.

This would be an awesome product if it worked. The installation and setup was easy.  The garage has a full wifi signal but 98% of the team the unit does not open or close the garage.  It just sits there and times out.  It's fruststring because the app times out and has you use the mobile site to open or close and that does not work either.  I would not recommend buying this product.  I have read reviews that this has worked great but it just didn't work for me and I'm returning it.

This would be wonderful if it worked! As I am writing this I am outside with my entire family of six waiting for a lock smith to let me in the house. Yes it is my fault for leaving with out another way in the house, but I guess my expectations were to high. It does a great job when it wants to work, but I would not recommend if you need reliability. Do a little research and you will see this is common issue... good luck

Works great AWESOME Product! Followed instruction and they were simple and easy. Installed the APP and prior to the install of the hardware and had to setup account before everything was working. DONE! Works wonderful...

Installed in my garage, and works well enough for actually controlling the garage door.  The biggest feature I was looking for was the door sensor to know if the door is opened or closed.  This sensor is mostly reliable, but has been wrong.The app on the phone works well enough, but at times will tell me that it lost communication with the device and could not get the door status.

After 1 yr and 5 months the door sensor started giving me false readings. I changed the battery, but it carried on happening. It left me paranoid that the door might be open, which the opposite reason for buying this thing in the first place. I spoke to Chamberlain support and they just said I needed to buy a replacement. I expect something like this to last more than 1yr and 5 months. Do yourself a favor and try a different brand.

Simple to use and install system for remote checking if the garage door is down.  Comments:  (1) Only issue currently is that Chamberlain does not seem to have a lot of direct or associated products that work with this.  If you want a camera system that integrates with the hub, you need to look elsewhere for now.  (2) One review said this doesn't work well if you have LED lighting near the hub.  Almost did not buy this system because of that comment.  However, we've had zero trouble with an LED bulb that is within a few feet of the hub.  Might depend how close your router is to the garage.

Very easy to install. Provides options to have contactless delivery for Amazon Prime members. You can open and close the garage door remotely when you are traveling so that house appears to be lived in, a great safety feature. I love it!!

I admit that I had to wait for these to be on sale. At their original price point they were high priced relative to the price I paid for the MyQ hub system which included on if these devices.Easy to install and setup.

This really does not integrate with Alexa, which is one of the main reasons I bought it. Amazon key is not available in my area. It does allow me to see the door status, and close or open it as needed. Alexa integration would have really improved this product (ie Alexa, is My garage door open?)

This was one of the easiest smart devices to install without any rewiring. It simply gets programmed a another garage opener remote and has a door status detector that simply sticks to garage door. It took me 5 minutes to install this.

It was pretty easy to set up.  If having a hard time connecting during setup, first setup near router and then move it where you plan to hang it.  Also, am disappointed that you can only have one primary and two secondary users.

I gave it a lot of thought if this was really needed or not, but I am glad I ended buying when there was a good deal during 2019 Thanksgiving.Now I can open and close my garage from anywhere. Most importantly, if I have a doubt I can always check on the app and even better is, the app allows you to set up alert if the garage door is left open for more than certain minutes which is a great feature.

I wanted to be able to know when my newly driving 16 yr old was getting home (curfew) :) and let someone in the house when away, if needed.  It does this well for a reasonable price.  Even synch’d up with my “builder grade” garage door openers without issue.  Recommended.

Just one more thing I can do with my smart phone - check the status of the garage door (and open/close it).  Nice for those times you wonder if you remembered to hit the button when you pulled off in a rush.  Also good to have when you take the dog for a walk, but don't want to carry anything other than your phone.

Not sure why there are so many one-star reviews.  It took longer to mount the brain to the garage ceiling than anything else, and I was still done in 15 minutes.  Works well, pairs seamlessly, and the app is very useful and intuitive, telling you the status of the garage door and sending reminders if it’s left open too long.  Very good product.

Mine was super easy to install... limited paper instructions but the app on your smart phone walks you through everything.After reading a review I was expecting an install right, but was done in 10-15 minutes.  Very simple!

Brought this on as a gift, because I liked mine so much. Easy to install and set up. Works like a charm. Haven't had any problems with internet connection. Always resets after power outage. Rock solid. Highly recommend.

Everything was easy to install. One word of advice, do not install the system close to the motor for the Garage Door opener as the electrical interference from the motor can interfere with the Wifi Signal. Other than that, it was extremely painless to install and use.

Worth every penny and more - now we don't have to worry about accidentally leaving the garage open all day.  Took 1 non-techie person an hour to install alone, no real issues, and has worked like a charm for a month now.

Now this company wants to charge you a monthly fee to open your garage door. If you don't pay the monthly fee you will only be able to open it on your WiFi network, so you'd need to be in close proximity. So really if you already have a remote garage door opener, this does not do anything special. It does the same thing! Except you don't have the headache of the set up. Not worth it. Returning the product and getting the Nexx instead.
This was a bit hard to get up and running.Called customer service at Chamberlain and wasn’t helpful at all. We finally got it to work.

Easy install. Easy to pair to WiFi. Easy to link to Amazon Key. You can get notifications from MyQ and/or AZ Key. Haven't used with an AZ delivery yet, but don't foresee any issues. Recommend setting up a bin or box in garage for AZ driver to put packages in.I have already used the open/close function remotely and works great. Works even better if you have a camera in your garage. Not required, but useful.

Wifi and app setup were straightforward, but once the device attempted to operate the garage door in learn mode, the circus music began.  The device attempts up to 4 different strategies for managing the door, so it starts opening, then closing the door 3 or 4 times per pass.  After the fourth pass (and after successfully opening and closing the door 20 times), the app gives up and says the effect of, "Hey that did not work.  We think you'd like to just use monitor mode.".  Bottom line, product did not work for me.

Love it, it works very well. Able to use as expected. You can use, especially if you forget to close the garage door as I have done several times in the past. By using the app you can open and close from anywhere. I also set it up for notifications. I know when the garage door opens or closes  at any giventime! I truly love MyQ smart garage. It is the best investment that I have made as of late. I would highly recommend! Buy and enjoy.
Super easy to install and it works. And it works EVERY time.  I’ve needed this feature for years and never made the jump but now that I have it, I can’t believe I went so long without it.

The associated MyQ app gats stuck with a “Close error” and shows incorrect garage door status. It’s slow for the hub to report the door status and 30% of the time it doesn’t know the door is closed and ends up giving the error which can only be resolved by opening and closing the garage door from the local wall button or remote. I mainly got this unit for the Amazon Garage Key feature, but at this point, I cannot trust that MyQ is giving me a correct door status. So far not impressed with the product, but will give it a few more days to see if it gets better, otherwise it’s back to Amazon for the return

Product was very easy to install and get up and running.  I would like to see the ability to have the app on multiple devices that can use different logins.  Ex. My children should be able to open the garage without me having to use my login/password on their phone to use the app.  Also, having to pay for IFTTT doesn't make a lot of sense.  Agreed it's not an expensive burden, but it just doesn't make sense to have to pay to integrate with home automation.  Most devices include this functionality for free.

Absolutely the worst investment ever!!! This has locked me and my daughter out of the garage 5 times now. I finally had to break a window to get in my house. So what would have costed about $20-30 more for a programmable remote, just cost me $400+ dollars in replacing a glass door.

Product has not worked well. Sensor continues to lose its connection. Have re installed over 10 times only to lose connection each time.  I have one sensor that works and one sensor that just continues to have a problem.  Email to Myq support have not been answered.Product quality appears extremely poor. The hub and the sensors are made of extremely low weight plastic and it has no feel of quality.  I would’ve thought a leader like Chamberlain would’ve done it differently. It’s as if they outsourced this to a third-party and didn’t care how it was done.

I put this in for a neighbor who wanted smartphone control of her garage. Easy to install and very inexpensive. Nice to use when you don't want to take your remote control with you. Also great when you get a loaner car and forget your remote - just use your smartphone app instead.

Well it worked for a week now it won't close the door, did a complete factory reset and set-up, still no close, checked the safety beams and they are good, so who knows, glad I saved my Genie Aladdin, at least that always opened and closed the door, the app was bit buggy prompting me to try this one.

What I like most is that I do not have to alter anything on my existing installation, just made sure that my garage door manufacturer was compatible.The mobile app is great, I have two devices and I can manage them with it, alerting and notifications works great too.

Took a little bit to get it to sync up, but afterwards it works very well. I have mine hooked up to Google home. The only issue I have is that Google cannot open the door. It can only close and give the status.
I was unsure about how this product would work, but today it saved my butt.  I left the house and was able to close the door miles away.  This is a great product!
No support for multiple users!  Total waste of time!!!

Very easy to install, easy to use and affordable. But I do not like the fact that they charge $1 per month fees even though its very low to work with smart assistance like google home. Also integration with them can be better. But in general good for price.

I was awed by the easiness in integrating this Wireless garage opener for my garage. Most of the times I would forget about closing my garage door  and make a trip back or check on the garage mid way of my errands. Now this device tells me if the garage is open or closed from the app and I can control the garage door from anywhere.
I have it installed for  about 3 months. Today it does not work for the second time. Last time it was broken for 2-3 days. They are making updates and do not care about customers.

Complete garbage. Brand new out-of-the-box and it won’t even connect to the freaking app. The app is so bad it won’t even scan the serial barcode. I enter it manually and it sends me on an endless cycle of resetting back to factory default
Doesn't do so well with Google.Me: "Google, tell MyQ to open garage door."

The product works exactly as advertised. Setup was simple and there are a lot of videos on YouTube to help if you get stuck. Simple instructions and the app works well. Now I don’t worry if I left my door open. Also you get alerts if the door is opened.

The sensor and hub were easy to install. Pairing to opener and sensor were easy and went just as described in the online instructions. I had not considered a WiFi garage door opener because of price, but this one is very reasonable - a good value imo.

This unit works great and was easy to install. I only gave the install 4 stars because once I had I up and running I migrated it to an existing Apple Home kit Hub which took several  tries and a You-Tube video to complete. I also love the price I paid since I got this as a Amazon “Key” bundle!

Easy to install on my 8 year old 3/4 hp Chamberlain garage door opener. The app downloaded quickly to my iPhone and the install instructions where easy to follow. I did read the install instructions on line before I actually did the install just to fimiliarize myself with the install. The Chamberlain app is free, no monthly charge and very easy to use. For me all I want to know is when we are not home that the garage door is closed.  I’ve had it now for about two weeks and it’s been very reliable.For my garage environment, the garage door has always worked very reliably with my car remotes and I have a very strong WiFi signal in my garage, also I removed the LED bulbs while I did the install.

Once I figured out that you had to have a very strong WiFi signal, everything worked great.  I had to move the router to near where the unit is for it to reliably stay connected.  I’ve been looking for something like this for a long time.  I’m happy that you can schedule closing the door.

This was so easy to install and set up. Love being able to open/close my garage doors with my phone. I love being able to see when it is open/closed and for how long. Next is getting a camera so I can see the opening/closing.

I set it up and when the app updates, I have to set up the device again. Last time I was out of town unable to control the door or check on the status because it deleted the data and I had to set it up again.

I have two craftsman garage door openers installation was as easy as sticking the sensors to the doors.  Installing the hub on the ceiling, and literally pressing the buttons on the garage motors.  All done within an hour.  App works great.

This took about 10 minutes to install, and it works great! We have an old LiftMaster, it fit right on there and works perfectly. I love being able to look on my phone if I'm not sure if I shut the garage or not! Highly recommend it!

The only two criticismS I have is that this works for one door. If you want another sensor, you can order one... for $32. Or you can buy a whole kit for $29.95 which includes a sensor. Which you can use with the original hub. Doesn’t make sense.My other criticism is that when this got installed, my wife’s old garage clicker in her car stopped working and she wants to have both work so I need to figure out how to make the both of them work.

I purchased this so I could have Amazon deliveries in my garage. My only issue is not all Amazon shipments qualify for in garage delivery. Which is puzzling. That is my only issue. Otherwise it works quite well, and I am pleased.

I walk our dog twice daily and when we return, I open the garage door using the app on my phone. Works great. I also like the notifications when we I forget I left the door open. Once in a while, the app will show the door as open when it is closed and that is the only issue I have with this product.

I like that you can see if the garage its open. We left that garage open and send us a message. We were out. I open the app and close it. Worth expending the money that getting an intruder to robe your place.

Would not working with my chamberlain access master model M150Customer service offered some advice and umtimately they said it was my garage opener but i tried it on all 3 of my openers and none worked...

The new system disables your old garage door remotes.  They don't reference that in the instruction manual in the box or on the app.  Seems like that would be some key info customers should know.  You have to re-program your remotes after installation if you want to be able to use them.  I like to have BOTH the app and the "clicker" options just in case my phone isn't easily accessible.

What a wast of money, there is nothing good that I can say, bad WiFi connection bad customer service no apple home kid unless you invest another $90.00 or around itI strangle with it since first day my advice is do not buy it but because Amazon is giving back $30 and it was $5 off I will just leave it too much work to take it down

MyQ smart garage opener is super easy to set up, took about 5 minutes to sync it with my garage door opener. The app is very easy to use. I can control my garage door remotely, which is great especially if you forget to close it! You’re allowed Up to 3 guest users which is super helpful for family members. Would definitely recommend.

My garage door opener is a LiftMaster brand and compatible with the MyQ network, but is not Wi-Fi compatible. This unit takes care of that problem and now allows me to remotely control my garage door with my smart phone. It also sends notifications whenever the door opens and closes. Installation was very straightforward and easy. Connecting to my Wi-Fi network was even easier. I highly recommend this product, especially if you can buy it for $29 like I did.

This product does not work if you have a detached garage. I have GiG speed Comcast and it doesn’t pick up the WiFi well.This will all be moot when I move soon but the point was to be able to use the Amazon Key and I can’t because the connection is unstable
Works with a simple button push in the app, as advertised. Control over who has a key is easy to manage from the app. Great for renters so the rentee's don't lose your openers.

Doesn't work, never linked. Called the manufacturer who instructed to hit the reset button on the side... but there isn't one!!!  Total junk, which is a shame because I wanted Amazon deliveries to be put in garage
This product don’t work with wink. Chamberlain support and wink support are the worst, they throw the each other. But certainly if you want to use it with wink this will not work at all

Great product only step i got stuck on was when it asks you for the color of the learn button mine was orange ,but that button color didn't work on the app color match .Finally i tried all the different colors and purple worked for my lift master unit.Also don't jump to any step on app until you see the unit # pop up as a new device or you will go in circles resetting the unit and connecting and resetting and so on.
Works great. I like the app letting me know when the door is open and closed.

the only good thing this does it shows you if your door is open or closed. I can open the door using the App but would never close. Had to manually close each time! So if you want to know if your door is open or closed, this is for you. Other than that, waste of money.

I like the fact that I can open/close and monitor garage door from any location. Very impressed with the function and capabilities of the application on my phone. I was struggling with our electronic garage door opener(Liftmaster) as there seems to be too much interference in our community, due to neighbor's lights etc...Had a garage door repair specialist come out in order to troubleshoot range and function issue of intermittent door operation. He said I needed a signal booster and it would run me $140.00. Read the desription on the MyQ and found that it might be a more cost effective option. Bought the unit, installed myself and haven't had any problems so far. My wife and I love it!!!!!

Works like a charm with my existing garage opener (make sure to check their website for compatibility before you order). Overall, it took about 30 minutes to install. Now I have peace of mind being able to check on the status of my garage door wherever I am at.

You will need an additional MyQ hub if you have two overhead garage doors. The price is affordable. Installation is surprisingly easy as the hub will pair with garage door openers made as far back as 1994!

Loved it, I can use to access my garage whenever on my phone, and the fact that you get your packages delivered inside gives you a piece of mind. It also has. Good notification system. I recommend buying the amazon camera as well, not to mention it has good quality
It works 90% of the time!  Once in a while requires a restart, so be sure to keep a regular garage opener in hand to open up the Garage door with myQ.

Easy to install, work great if install correctly - the hub and censor must aligned. In order to connect with Google Home, you need to have paid subscription account. App on Iphone X login process take longer than necessary. Overall, function as intended and convenience.

Easy set up, provided you follow each step exactly as described. Worked from the app flawlessly for me. My only issue is the warning siren overkill when the door is closing. Just like my SUV the dings and the dong noises ordered by their lawyers protect companies in our litigious culture from the judge’s gavel in favor of the plaintiff.

I set this up over the weekend.  Seems to work great and easy to set up.  I had a different brand but like this one better.  It is harder to accidentally open the garage when not at home and easy to tell if the garage is open or shut.

Product works good for single users. Does NOT support multi users which means you cannot share access with family members. I saw a product promotion from 2107 promising this feature. Looks bad on the company that they do not fulfill promises. Easy to install not so easy to get to work with app.  However once you get it working it funtions well.
I paired it with my Craftsman garage door opener (built in 2007) with purple learn button.For the transponder unit, instead of the provided velcro, I used neodymium magnets.

Arrived next day. Installed within 30 minutes. Connected to wifi and Bluetooth paired within seconds. Worked immediately! Takes guess work out of whether door is closed or not.However, I learned that the LED lightbulbs in the opener caused radio interference and when using the app it would show an error. After replacing the LED bulbs with incandescent bulbs, it works with the app.

Love the ability to open and close the garage door remotely. Helps me keep delivered packages safe. It was somewhat tricky to install and use. For random reasons it says malfunction, forcing to operate thru the hardwired opener.

Easy installation and works perfectly.  Bought a separate sensor since we have 2 garage doors.  Able to share it with my wife in her iPhone easily.  Didn't have to purchase a small remote since I carry my iPhone everyday.  Highly recommended!

It's supposed to work with my garage door. And it did after several attempts but it had a several failed attempts before it finally started to work the period so be persistent in your trying to make it integrate and operate.

There was no pull tab to activate the battery on the sensor (as the manual claims) - so I don't know the condition of the battery because I can't test anything - but the unit is unusable anyway. I followed the instructions and got the hub powered up with the required blinking blue LED. When I entered its serial number (no, not the MAC address, the serial number) in the MyQ app and tried to "Submit", it said the hub was offline (still plugged in with its blinking blue LED a foot from the phone) and I should check network connections. Seriously? There is no network connection yet, although I have 4 WiFi bars on my phone next to the opener. I sort of thought the app would handle the WiFi connection. But it refuses. There sure isn't any way to do it on the hub itself. Dumb manual? Dumb app? Dumb hub? Who knows? Who cares? Junk.UPDATE: Spent a half-hour looking around the Chamberlain web and found a couple of sets of much longer, more complicated instructions - the quick-start guide wasn't even close, a complete waste of paper. I eventually got to a point where I could attempt to connect the app or the hub (impossible to tell which) to my WiFi network. It failed multiple times with either the same error message (#309 IIRC) as before or a really helpful one telling it didn't connect to the network. Duh. I thought I'd follow the app's help for this, but that eventually led to either (1) an attempt to connect to the Chamberlian site over the Internet, impossible because my phone was connected to the MYQ-xxx hub's network or (2) an attempt to connect to a web page presumably generated by the hub that failed with a 404 error.
Very easy to install. Only issue I have is the door units battery life. One battery died as soon as I installed and another one month later. Not sure these are old stocks. Batteries not cheap also.

You can only use two sensors per hub so I had to buy two hubs but all three garage doors work perfectly now.  I really like the notifications I get when Amazon comes (compatible with Amazon Key) but also get notified if I left the doors open for too long.

Problem free install. Download app, follow instructions. Virtually nothing to read. Works great. Integrated with Amazon Prime and now most packages are safely delivered to my garage. Added the camera for a bit more peace of mind.

The app is not ready for production. It is inaccurate and the setup process is severely flawed. After I spent 3 hours getting the hub to connect to my garage, I see in extremely fine print that a subscription is required to connect this with google Assistant. I will be returning this $43 product and using a normal clicker and a sonoff switch for $8. Shame on you. 4 hours of my life I will never get back.

Very easy to set up. The hub doesn’t need to be on the ceiling. Mount it anywhere you want as long as in range to control your garage door opener. Important thing is to put the sensor at the instructed location.

It’s fantastic. We live on a busy ish street and knowing I can get stuff delivered in the garage makes me feel better and we even have a Nest Hello doorbell. Tougher to break into a garage than steal from a front door.

Works as described. Easy to follow installation instructions in app. App works well. Can now control garage door from phone app.Remote easier to use, but I no longer want to keep remote in car and don’t want to purchase and carry fob style remote. This is a good solution.
The guides you through the install. The only thing I cannot figure out is what the buttons on the side of the unit do. I like the flexibility very much.

Great product! I'm already forgetful of whether I closed the garage or not and this is just what I needed!It was a breeze to set up and link with my intellilink opener. I wouldn't recommend it if you're opener uses dip switches though

Great product!  Solved our problem of not knowing if we left the garage door open.  Also, solved a bigger problem because it allows us to close the garage remotely if we forgot it open.  Super easy to install.  The videos were great.I tested this product by closing my garage door from Another state, and it works like a charm!!!
It works for 2 days and then you can't open or close your garage doors. Reinstall and about 2 days later not working again! All it's good for is monitoring the status of your doors open or closed.

Took about 15 to 20 minutes to install with a few of those minutes overthinking it. It is a very simple install: pair the hub with the transmitter, pair the transmitter to your opener, mount the hub and the transmitter and that's about it except for getting it onto your network winch works like just about everything else. Choose your network add the password and done. I was a little worried that I wouldn't have great wifi, but at only two bars I have not had a single iasue. Smart and simple product that really works! Highly recommended!

The MyQ makers had Alexa integration built in, as reviews I read before purchasing attested. But at some point the manufacturer dropped Alexa integration with MyQ. There’s a workaround, but it’s not intuitive and unstable.  Next time I’ll verify Alexa integration prior to buying things.

The MyQ hardware works great as long as you can keep a WiFi signal to it.Alexa requires a secondary skill from a third party. You have to ask Alexa to ask the third party to get it to do something. I would think that a company as big as Amazon who integrates MyQ and their own Key app to deliver packages would be able to integrate Alexa and MyQ directly.

Easy to install. Very clear instructions. Works great. Will NOT integrate with Alexa unless you 1. Purchase a subscription to my q, 2. Set up a connection with ifttt, 3. Set ifttt to close the door. Even then, it will only close. No voice control to open. Other than that, decent product when the price is slashed.

I had a Chamberlain myQ garage opener which I absolutely loved in my old place. Unfortunately, the myQ hub doesn’t perform to the same degree at all when I am trying to upgrade an old Liftmaster garage opener (purple learn button). The entire installation process is easy and simple enough but I had to run the code learning process multiple times before the hub is fully set up. Unfortunately, the reason for the multiple attempts is probably the same reason why the hub couldn’t open/close consistently. The signal it sends to the opener was never consistent. The hub is connected and the door sensor is live but the signal simply won’t pass through. The hub would even bleep and blink, meaning it got the command to close, but the signal still won’t acivate the opener. I tried calling for Chamberlain for support but they couldn’t provide a definitive solution.Rather than waiting for a replacement, I just returned it and got a Linear Zwave garage opener instead. Those are directly hardwired into the garage opener (or wall control) so they are much more reliable.
Went through the setup 2 times. Only worked once. Maybe you will have better luck. Remember to read the instructions if you can find them.

I bought this for my second garage door. While the sensor works great you can’t setup the second garage door without it. My second garage opener isn’t compatible with the chamberlain system. Would have been nice to test the pairing ability before ordering this.

Installed & tried yesterday - was fine.Today I tried open/close during outside using MyQ app, but it generated "close error" message, then MyQ app cannot do anything until the issue is resolved - by local remote button (or reset locally).

It just works. Comes with an app for iOS or android and you download it after hooking the smart-box up to your garage and WiFi. You don’t need to be on the same WiFi as your house to open and close said garage. That can be done on iPhone/android cellular through said app. Enjoy!

I'm very good at leaving my garage door open all day. I set this up in my apartment. I no longer leave it open all day. I get notifications that my garage door was opened and closed. If I don't see the closed notification, I know that I need to go in and close it. This has saved me so much time. I don't have to drive home in the middle of the day to check if I left the garage open. When I take my dog for a walk, I can walk through the garage and only take my phone. I close the garage door with my phone and open it with my phone.

Love the remote opening feature. I live in Canada and while I was visiting the US, someone wanted access to my house. I was able to open the garage door remotely and then close it when she was done. It was as easy as that!

It was pretty cut and dry to install and set up. It's been a nice addition to establishing a smart home. Thankfully I didn't have any of the issues with WiFi signals like others have had. I've already recommended it to several people.

Installing and setting these up is easy. I used a second sensor for a second door with the same MyQ smart garage opener. Everything works great but when attempting to close the second door right after the first tends to fail. I have to wait for the first door to finish then press the close on the app.
I love the easy-to-use interface and how easy it was to set up. It works perfectly every time. This product is just great. I can't say enough good things about it.

Love this!  I can’t tell you how many mornings I have woke up to find our garage doors have been open all night.  We have ours set to close every night at 10, and alert us if it’s open after that.  This was done in case something prevents the door from closing with the schedule or gets re-opened.

Setup was very easy.  You will need to verify that it is compatible w/ your garage door opener. I used two of these hubs and two additional add-on sensors to control four doors.  The app is very intuitive. I setup a schedule to close the doors if they are open past 6pm every day.

Great HomeKit integration it works 90% of the time but it goes offline a decent amount which is odd as I have many many many smart home things that never do. Some in the garage/garage exterior and I have wireless velop system with nodes a right by myQ. But over all well worth it!

the installation is easy with all the provided material. it requires some level of skill and understanding of the garage opener and a level of handiness with fixing the main unit in the garage ceiling.Once setup it works great and provides the safety and security you expect.
This was pretty easy to install. I’m very happy with it.  I can drive down the road with ease knowing if I think I forgot to shut the garage door, I can easily check and see if I did or did not.
Love it when it works. Every once in a while it won't open the app correctly or it'll ask me for the password again which is very annoying...

Very easy to install. Bought this to take the worry out of “did I shut the garage door on my way to work this morning?” The only thing I didn’t like was how loud the beeping was if you shut the door using the app. The hub makes a loud beeping as a safety measure, but man is it loud.

Painfully often get stuck waiting for it to open or no response. If your phone gets off WiFi and onto cellular while the app is open then it won’t work. I WISH there was a widget for it too instead of having to open the app

I love this! Setup was easy and I had it running in 10-15 minutes.  It's very nice to be able to open my garage door with my smart phone when taking a dog walk or if a friend of mine picks me up or an Uber night out. I highly recommend it and I'd buy it again without thinking if it somehow broke.

This thing is awesome. Get a push notification if its opened/closed/offline (couple power outages) install was great.I bought a wifi extender just in case but if you have low wifi signal in your garage, you may want an extender as well to use.
Easy to install and seems to work on most garage doors. A great way to check on your garage door at home and away. Can access from your app on your cell phone and open nd close the door as you wish.
Have been very satisfied!!  Easy to install, web response is very good and really has worked wil without any problems. We really like the control. A good product!

Does not keep network connection WHEN other devices in same room do.  Customer service was not helpful. Unit sees network then drops it over and over.  Unreliable which makes purpose of the MyQ of little or no value.

My second one the first lasted three years, was get set up was always a pain, but when it worked loved it. That one died no longer had WiFi. Ordered another no Bluetooth at all (needed for set up) . Returned for a fourth.

Junk! My opener is on the linkable list but, fails over and over to link.  Then to top it off, you need to go thru the extensive start-up thru the app just to attempt to link it again.  Cool concept, but flawed.

Its easy to install if you follow the instructions correctly. very useful to have this as it gives peace of mind.only downside is some time it drops to connect the gate, otherwise worth the investment.

I paired it with a Craftsman garage door opener with a red button. I was under the impression from the directions, it was supposed to connect and add automatically...not for me, at least. I followed the instructions and could not get it to connect with my WiFi. I ended up having to connect to the WiFi that the garage door opener creates rather than my home WiFi, then manually add the garage door opener, then the garage door sensor. After that, everything worked.

We can now reliably open our doors from just about anywhere and know they are open at bedtime via a notification between the hours of bedtime and wake time. The downside of installation is I had to upgrade our wireless system to a mesh. But that also made our WiFi more robust and faster, so it was money well spent. I just wasn't ready to spend it yet :-)

I added these to two garage door openers I abreast had she. I added in to my shop with 2 more bays (with myQ openers).  Now I can remotely open all 4 doors and monitor to make sure they are closed with the MyQ App.When you sent them up, make sure you only plug in 1 at a time before moving on to the next one or you cannot get them set up.

Bought this and an additional door sensor and it works awesome.  Took less then 20 min to install and get working.  Now I don't have to take my garage door opener out of my vehicle when I go for a motorcycle ride.

Easy to install and use. Adjusted the location of the hub to be able to close and open the garage door instead of the initial "monitor" only mode.The product is helpful for me in two cases: 1) check whether the door is closed while driving away from home 2) open the door for family members if they do not have the key with them.

I actually got two of these and love them. Easy to install, easy to control everything with my phone and easy to set up alerts if the door is left up for X period of time. I'm a big fan and have zero complaints.

It went up so easy. Just read the directions for a fast installation. It worked with the very first push of the app button. I didn’t have to pay fee for it to work like some people were talking about I don’t know where that came from

Spent lots of time on support line trying to get it to work. It needed to have updated loaded and we had just bought it. Then we find out that we have to purchase a bridge in order to use it with Siri. Too much trouble. I wish we had tried to set it up ealier. Our window passed for returning product. We will just buy a new integrated garage door system next.

Very easy install (via iOS app) and the product and app do exactly what they say they do.  I wish it: had multiuser capabilities in the app & had native Apple Homekit capabilities (without buying another box). But, I knew this before I purchased and still bought the hub. I am a very happy customer and think its a great value compared to others on the market.

I have to change my review.  Yes being on hold for 37 minute was not pleasant and never speaking to anyone.  They had some great how too videos and after searching through my issue found a solution.  No 5 stars due to the horrible customer service

When it works it’s great. However, out of the blue the app would not connect to the server and just throw an error that it was unreachable. This is completely unacceptable and I was locked out of my house. Not a dependable solution so it’s more of a toy/gimmick.

I just installed this sensor on my wife's garage door. So we have two sensors for one hub. I see there are some less than good reviews, but I think it's awesome. The original setup took longer than I had expected, but I got it hooked up.

Purchased during Prime days for my two garages. Install and set up are straightforward. Really like the push notifications for when the doors open and close and it is quick. I press the wall button to open the garage to leave and by the time I get to the car, the notice has come through. The wireless functions from the app work great too.
