My son installed this in about 15 minutes. He read the instructions and had no problem with linking it to my iPhone.It’s great when I have left home and wondered if I close the garage door or not. It not only tells me if it’s opened or closed but allows me to close it from my phone.

Great Product. Easy to install. Easy to operate. I hate it when I drive off and then wonder if I closed the garage door. I've driven back to make sure the garage door is closed. I don't have to do that any more. I should have purchased MyQ a long time ago.

Great product! Works without issues with my Genie garage Opener. It took my son and I about 30 minutes to Install with the directions provided by the App. The only issue I had was initially connecting to my WiFi. After a few unsuccessful tries and resets, I disabled my VPN on the phone, and after that everything worked perfectly on the first try. Since then, I have enabled VPN on my phone and didn't have any issues.

Read the pros and cons on Amazon review for this product.  Decided to buy it because it was cheap $28 and I needed a way to remotely open the garage door for my second home in Lake Tahoe.  Very easy to install...the app helped walk you through the process.  It came complete with video instructions on how to install the hub and sensor.  Please make sure you have good wireless WiFi to the garage in order to use this product.  The app is pretty easy to use and very intuitive.  Simple open and close commands.

Just what I was looking for. Tells me when and what time the garage door opened and closed. I can close or open my door from anywhere, literally! Love it!Btw, my Chamberlain learn button was Brown, it wasn't an option so I just choose purple, it worked! Try all colors until you find one that works!

It would have been nice but it doesn’t work with Apple home, which is what I purchased it. So. Installed and tried to get it to work. Support for informed me that it was not compatible. So, I wasted m money.
This product is useless half the time it opens the door after it closes and I am miles away from the house. It's a great idea, but maybe a real company needs to make it.

Those with Comcast Routers, you need to open up the following ports after logging in to the Comcast Router. Otherwise, myQ device doesn't communicate properly (or even register) with the router and vice-versa.myQ products require these ports in order to communicate to our server:

Overall, this has been working great.  We've now had this for about two months.  One time we had an issue of false signal that the door was opening.  Other than that, not many issues.  For those who want to add this to their smart home hub, do a little more research.  Many of the hubs and services will incur a cost to add myQ to their service.  As a standalone device, this works great.

Really good product. Works as advertised if you have one of the compatible garage door openers. I found the setup instructions and tutorial process to be one of the best I have seen. Very simple and straight forward with video guidance and instructions. Really easy to get up and running. Only drawback is Amazon Alexa integration which is not out of the box. There is integration with Amazon Key for in garage package delivery which I plan to try on my next Amazon order.
Don’t waste your money, this don’t work as expected. Just stop working all of sudden and again you will have to wait for 2 more days to work. Oh .. bad

This works great when I’m sitting in my living room in my chair.  However, when I’m in my car in the driveway wanting to open the door it fails 90% of the time.  I’ve had to unplug it to reset it several times and it still doesn’t work.  I’m afraid this is going to be chalked up to lesson learned and will end up in the trash....  Save your money on this!!!

Make sure you read the directions! I got frustrated as I was missing a step. There’s a YouTube video if you’d rather someone tell you how to do it. It is easy to install when you follow the directions. I knocked a star off as the MyQ app is sometimes really slow to open and connect. That said, I like the convenience and peace of mind that I can check if the door is down from anywhere. Gone is the question “did I put the door down?!?”

I could open my garage door from a mile away, but closing it too an act from God. This device is amazing for the cost, plus I can create schedules to close the door and works with Amazon Key. This is definitely one of my better purchases.

Did not work well with my garage door opener. App only partially worked worked. App showed if garage door was opened or shut but pressing the buttons didn5 change things. If the app said opened and I hit to close, nothing happened.

This product let's me know if someone is entering or leaving my garage which is a great piece of mind. I also love that I receive a notification if for some reason our garage is left open for an extended period time.

Was a bit of a pain to install and has given me a wrong signal a couple of times. But,... still a great backup if your worried about an open door or if you need to let someone in. No Amazon Access in my area which is sad

I purchased this because I had no opener for my garage, living in Maine is extremely cold and snowy in the winter.  I was tired of getting out of my car to open the door.  This was so easy to install and easy to use.  I highly recommend this.  It has made a huge difference in my day.  Thank you

I had the option of getting remote door control when I bought my craftsman garage door opener, but didn't because I didn't see a need, until my wife left the door open all day recently. This device fits the bill perfectly, as it optionally sends me a notification when the door opens, and I can see at anytime if the door is open or closed, and close it if I need to.

Constantly loses contact with WiFi, even though it's less than 5 feet from the router. Constantly loses connection with the door sensor. I did the complete door install 7 days in a row, it would work for a couple hours, then stop. The software and app is rudimentary at best. Maybe they'll figure it out at some point, but it's not now.

Does not work with Alexa. is supposed to work with Google & I'm still having trouble linking it to the garage.  But overall I like the control of the door from my phone & to know if it's open or closed from anywhere.

Installed easy. I can now open/close/monitor the position of my garage door from anywhere! I love how it pings my Apple Watch and iPhone via the Amazon Key app when my door opens and closes. Amazon key also lets me know right when packages are arriving inside my garage. The MyQ app is straightforward and easy to use.
Look elsewhere, its a piece of junk.

My son and I installed it in about 30 minutes. However getting it to work with Alexa was a real feat. With some finagling though and a Android app, "simple command" from the Google Play Store. All is working well.
Integration is a failure.  I could install with garage door but would loose the connectivity with my integrated car garage door opener.  Everytime I'd pair it, it would drop the pairing with the car.

IMPORTANT: This item is not compatible with the Wink hub even though it's advertised this way. Chamberlain has acknowledged the issue but refuses to provide customers with additional information and will only give a generic "we're working on it" response when reaching out. This issue has been going on for months now. Useless product when purchased for Wink integration and terrible customer service response.

I was able to install in a few minutes and have it working. This one works great! I have not integrated into other home control devices but are considering adding a Cloud camera for viewing what's is going on in the garage before I remotely close the door.

This device was super easy to install. It took me less than 30 minutes to install and I had to call up customer service too for help.Great for anyone who may have forgotten to close the garage or if you can’t remember if you closed it! You can also set up notifications of when the garage opens and closes for extra security.

I got a great price on this Wi-Fi garage door opener. It was very easy to install, step by step instructions are given on your smart phone. The device should learn how to connect to your Wi-Fi easily and how to talk to your cell phone easily. A push of the button on your garage door motor and it learns how to communicate with it too. It mounts on the ceiling near your garage door opened, fastened into place with two drywall anchor screws. Not much more to it then that.

Really easy to install and control through the Myq app. But not easy to integrate with Google Home or Assistant. We've just spent all evening trying to figure out how to do this and haven't found a solution.The description on Amazon said that it is possible to do this, but it's beyond me I'm afraid. We are going to return this and look around for something that's easier to integrate with our Google stuff.
Easy to use can open door before I ever see the door. This is a 1st they updated the program and it made it better much much better now touch Garage it say open touch it again and that's what.

Doesn't want to work with my name brand garage door opener. Also, somewhere it said it would not work with Alexa. At the very least I now get a notification that garage door has been opened or closed on my phone, but can't make it do it.

Too difficult to install. Could not get the hub and sensor to pair. Instructions said to make changes to our Internet router. In app install instruction totally different from app instruction.very disappointed.

My wife constantly has to return home because she thought she left the garage door open. That has ended with this installation. It takes about 30-45 mins. and you have control over the garage door. A piece of cake to install. The App works great and we can see if the door is open or closed and control it remotely. You can set a reminder to let you know that the door is open (in case you go to bed and forget to close it).

So far the MyQ has worked great. I forget to close my garage door or can’t remember if I closed it on my way to work. No longer need to worry or turn around and go home to check. Installation and set up very easy. As of right now would totally recommend
This is a piece of garbage.  I spent three hours trying to get it to connect, no luck.  The instructions are awful, as is the product.  Don’t waste your money!  I’ll be returning this immediately.

Wasn't sure about this purchase but it has exceeded my expectations. I can now have Amazon deliver my packages in the garage without worry of porch pirates stealing them. And if I'm running late I can let guest in with ease.

Works everytime, I got it set to lower my door at 9pm in case it was left open.  Can operate it from anywhere and monitor it with my in garage arlo cam.  I have also received my Amazon deliveries using it, cuts out package pirates all together

I love this product, but occasionally it will think the garage was left open when it is actually closed. At first, I would panic and try to hit the door closed again but instead it would open the door and error out the system so it stops responding altogether. I figured out if you wait eventually the app will catch up and show the door as closed. Other than that occasional issue this is a great product! Super easy to set up!
I must have gotten a used unit.  Had no instructions, could tell it had been opened and not repackaged like factory.I will try to install with manual off web.

Great product. Super easy to install and the schedule function has been a life saver since my kids have routinely leave our garage door open at night. Remote opp via app has also been great to let neighbors and family into garage.

Quick easy install, everything was working great, but they removed the Alexa still so you shouldn’t buy this companies device. I will recommend any brand but this one until they re-enable Alexa. I think Amazon should stop selling this product, until it is reenabled.
I found the instructions very straight forward within 45 minutes everything was installed.It has worked flawlessly since.

I had a little trouble installing it with my iPhone and home network.  The directions were not very clear when I started installing it and couldn't get it to synch with my WiFI network.When I was putting everything back in the box to return it, I found another instruction manual that had instructions to sync with the iPhone.  Once I saw this and followed the directions it worked great.

The purpose of this device is to open and close garage door by phone app, and provide you open or closed status. This does open or close, about 8p% of the time.  However the status reported is nearly always wrong.  Reports as "open"...  often.. when it is actually closed, and if you then select to CLOSE the garage door from the app, the door will OPEN, and then report back a failure and error to the app.  Not working would be useless.  Reporting incorrect information and status is WORSE than useless.
Works great and we love the schedule to ensure door is closed. Would be nice if it also had a Max open timer so it would auto close if left open for 2+ hours or something.Setup was a bit tricky.

I bought this end of November and I am writing this review in the middle of March. Essentially this just lasted me a little over 2 months. The sensor that goes on the garage door stopped working. I first thought it was the battery so I ordered some from Amazon and replaced it. No luck. Now to get this to work I may have to spend another $40 to get a new sensor.
Very easy to install and setup, but unfortuanely thats the best I can say about it.The app shows the unit "Offline" a majority of the time, so you can't actually use it.
Works well.  If you use the Amazon Key app disable the notifications.  The two apps can get the close or open status confused.  Other than that we are happy with this inexpensive and clever device.
I absolutely love this garage door opener. I love the notifications it gives you if the door is opened or closed. I also love the feature of opening my garage door when I'm a couple of blocks away.
Works well when it works, but sometimes just fails to open or close when controlled from the app - just keeps spinning the progress and then gives up.

My wife and I always had a Constant fear of leaving the garage door open. We would leave drive around the block just to see if the door really closed. Now I can just check the app. Works well with the Amazon garage key it seems like the drivers just threw the package in my front yard. Now I have them deliver to the garage which eliminates anyone stealing my package.

Purchased the kit and then bought an additional garage door sensor.  Easy to install and use.  Now I don't have to move my garage door remote from my vehicle to my motorcycle it is all done via my phone app.
Work great for about a week or two and then all of a sudden it would only open the garage door but not close it had to reset the hub and re-configured to work properly again

I had a little difficulty installing but their customer service was wonderful. They checked what I had already done and helped me finish up.One of my best experiences with smart technology. One drawback -  it doesn't work with Alexa.

Product was easy to install and worked well for a few weeks. The other night, I checked to see if the garage was left open with the app and it said it was open for 6 hours so I closed it (again from the app). I found out in the morning that I actually OPENED the garage and it was open all night, inviting strangers and critters into our garage and into our home if they wanted to! I no longer trust this product to be accurate, hence making it obsolete. Will be returning.

I love it, it was very easy to install, just download the application first and follow the simple instructionsIt works great and I get the notifications any time the garage door opens or closes, plus I can check the door status any time from anywhere, I got a delivery from Amazon today and it's great knowing that your stuff is safe inside the garage specially  when it's raining hard outside.

Constantly provides false status of open door. Swapped out door sensor with same results. We have two hubs and three doors. Second hub randomly loses programming and I need to reprogram. Expected it to be far more stability.

What's not to like about this? I have a Liftmaster garage door opener at my place and it paired seamlessly with the MyQ system.Setup to me all of 30 mins and the app worked (and still works) flawlessly. So far so good.
Dont buy turn and run the other way......doesn't work.....should have trusted the other guys review and not brought it......

This product will enable you to operate your garage door from anywhere in world considering you have internet connection. Please make sure your garage door supports that before purchasing. Overall good to have.
Wish I would've checked closer before purchasing. This product does NOT work with Alexa. In order to use it with IFTTT you also have to pay monthly. Look around first.

We needed to replace the original keypad on our garage door & this was the perfect replacement. If we forget if we closed the door, we simply pull up the app on our phones & it confirms & allows us to close or open from wherever we are.

When it works it works fine. Get “sensor error “ a lot. Kind of sucks because then you have to manually reset it and that’s hard to do 1300 miles away but other than that it’s ok. Just don’t expect perfection with this. Also don’t use the schedual aspect of this. Also caused a sensor error.

Entire reason we got this was to have alexa notify me when GD was left open. I cant believe that in 2 years chamberlain can interface with minor 3rd party but not Amazon Alexa. Will be returning. It was very easy to install and did activate our doors.
They'll force you to pay a freaking subscription fee to use it with IFTTT. WTF is up with that? I've never had to pay a subscription fee for any of my other smart devices... and I have a ton!

I set it up and installed it rather easily. It appeared to be working fine as long as I was standing next to it. However, if I leave the area, it does not work. I rechecked the WiFi connections, factory reset the hub, reset it up again following the instructions exactly and I ran into the same problem. The unit does not work from a remote location (more than 20 feet from it).

I wish it would integrate with Alexa but it works as advertized.  The app is easy to use and has worked well thus far.  Super easy to install (really idiot proof)  with an easy step by step laid out on your smart form (with videos).

I had trouble at first getting things to go right.  However, after calling customer support, the gentleman on the other end  made it easy and stayed on the line with me until all was working correctly.  It's a great tool once you get it up and working.
Super easy install with genie opener. Set up with wifi in minutes. This is a great way to get your door controlled without buying a new door opener. Highly recommended.

I rated three stars due to poor instructions for connecting MyQ with my WiFi router. Physical installation was easy. Thankfully there were a number of good YouTube videos that helped. I write another review in 6 months when I have more experience with the MyQ.
Everything worked to my expectations.It was easy to install, between 15-30 mins based on your DIY experience.
easy to install, instant upgrade and works with the existing garage openereasy to set up app, provides notifications to your cell phone

Very easy to install, it’s a little noisy, works but I stopped my garage from closing to see what it would do and it did not notify me that there was an error, it just kept loading like if it was closing it.

Easy to install, had no issues whatsoever, everything worked flawlessly and I was on iOS.  I purchased this because the signal on the garage remote worked intermittently, even after getting it serviced and looked at we would've had to buy a new door opener system. Thought I'd try this first and glad I did.

Works well. Had some initial problems with the installation, but tech support was very helpful and got me up and running. The one issue I have though is the compatibility with other smart home products. It is only partially supportive of Wink and doesn’t have any integration in SmartThings at all nor does it with Ring.
Amazon can place things securely in my garage.  I am notified on my smartphone  every time my garage door opens and closes.  I can also use my phone to open and close my garage.

This product is very easy to install it took no more than 15 minutes!! The opener works great! We love the notifications the app sends to notify you that the garage door is open or closed! I feel this is the best smart garage opener on the market!
Easy setup and works great.  I have liftmaster openers that are about 12 years old and have no issues.  The app is easy to navigate. It will be great if they partner with amazon and the blink camera.
This was super simple to install - but it seems to mess up my Remote garage clicker when it is correctly setup. Overall this is a great product especially for the cost. Highly recommend.

Great product and works perfectly.  Connecting to two garage doors was a bit tricky, but I called customer service.  They answered in less than 2 minutes and patiently walked me through it.  All set and quite happy!

I haven’t integrated with Alexa but this is wonderful addition to my 15 yr old garage door opener. The video instructions via app for installation is super helpful. Excellent product. I just wish I don’t have to login to app every time I need to use remote.

Installed , but boy let me start by saying the smart setup is complicated since you assistant need to talk to "myQ" instead of just accessing straight to your account like any other smart home device. That is just lazy coding.Sensor doesn't know if the door is close and I installed it twice.
Very easy to install. I got it installed in 20 minutes, works great, and the app is very useful. If you don't care for whatever system integration, this is the perfect thing to get.

15 min up and running. Stupid easy. Wifi is a bit weak on the device. My phone shows full bars where the device is placed but the device says 1 bar. The router is about 15 yards away. Overall those who can't figure this out is incompetent

Initial setup with sensor and hub was very easy.  Followed the video and instructions.  Pairing it with my Liftmaster opener was frustrating and took repeated attempts till it finally worked.  Instructions for that aspect were OK but not comprehensive.  Had to invest over 2 hours till it finally worked.  Once it paired and got it working, I love it.  Was very easy to add it to other family members phones.

I don't understand the other reviews. You download the app and in 10 minutes done. It is really that easy. If this takes you more than 15 minutes, you shouldn't be doing anything do it yourself installs.
This device practically pays for itself. I only owed less than $10 because of the bonus Amazon gives you on your first in garage delivery!

When you use this hub to close the garage door, it beeps INCESSANTLY for about 30 seconds. Now, when I say it "beeps", maybe I'm being too kind - it's more like it SCREECHES at an ungodly decibel level. If I were to use the hub to close the garage door at night, I'm certain it would WAKE THE DEAD, along with my kids and the rest of the entire neighborhood. There is no way to disable this "safety feature".

I'd love to give this a 5 star review. It works great like it should. I however is not meant for cold climates. Since installing in October I have had to replace the batteries in each sensor every month. I has been getting colder and have noticed the batteries going low only after being installed for about 3 weeks. I have two sensors and they are both only lasting about a month each.
Great product to have for knowing the open/closed status of your garage door. No more turning around half way to work to see if my door is down. Whew!

The first generation had many issues with connecting to my wifi network, but once it did, worked very well until it died 1.5 years later (i do not blame the device, probably local power spike).The second generation worked perfectly, except for the ability to reset the password on my original account.  Neither the app, nor the website allowed me to do so.  I ended up using a secondary email address i have, and the setup was very smooth and easy.

Easy to install but I needed to get a WiFi signal booster to get the base unit to connect to my home system.  The app is great to use to determine if your garage door (s) are open or closed. Using it to close a door that was opened via a car link messed up the car link and had to be reset.

I checked several times to make sure my Genie model was compatible with this device.  I could not program it to connect to the opener after several tries.  I just spent over 2 hours with support and they weren't able to help.  One person mentioned in passing that Genie did something in 2016 that stopped it from communicating to the MyQ device.  While that may be true, it's been three years. Surely Chamberlain could have either updated their code or updated their compatibility matrix so we don't get duped into thinking this would work.  If I could leave negative stars I would.

The battery life is awful on the door sensor. The battery dies after about 2 weeks, and my garage door opener and close maybe twice a day. Also the battery it takes is harder to find and I had to order it online.
We've been trying for months to get this unit to work.  Hours spent on the phone and reading directions over and over again.  I'm so frustrated because I really wanted this to work.
This device was really easy to set up, and the app is easy to use. Great for peace of mind if you leave the house and wonder if you remembered to close the garage door.
Not compatible with my garage door opener, the Menards brand Extreme.  Wasted cash k. This since they don't tell you up front which openers it works with.

I've wanted smartphone garage control abilities for a while now and the Smart Garage Hub doesn't disappoint. The setup process was relatively straight forward and so far the MyQ app seems very reliable and has a lot of extra features and uses I wasn't expecting. I love that you get notifications when the kids come home from school through the garage.

Set up is a little frustrating, originally it said our opener was not compatible. A phone call to customer service was difficult because of their banker hours. However once we had them on the phone they walked us through the issue and it worked. Great product extremely satisfied.

I read a lot of reviews on this product before I purchased it and was a little concerned that it might be difficult to install. The opposite is true. It took a little more than fifteen minutes from opening the box to completion and the MyQ was working perfectly. Easy to follow instructions and so far the product does exactly as it advertises

I didnt knew i can convert my existing Garage door into a Smart Garage.  This little device is wonderful and it works as described.  Now not just me but my family is able to open and close the garage using an app which is very convenient.  Also one more useful feature is the alerts it sends out when the garage opens and closes.  I am totally satisfied and i recommend.

It would never connect to my internet, while every other electronic device we've purchased has easily connected. We have 150 mbps wireless internet and I probably tried 100 times to connect it since it was a Christmas gift but we had to return it.

Great product! I did the install and setup myself and it all worked perfectly the first time around. I love it that I now feel more at ease knowing that I can check my garage door to make sure it's closed and have the ability to close it away from my home. Works well and seems durable for now.  I would recommend this product.
Absolutely no issues or problems. Works exactly as stated. Very simple pairing to the SmartHub I had already purchased from Lowes. So easy!

I will repost after the software upgrade occurs (if I remember).  The software side of the installation did not go smoothly.  My Linksys EA9500 router did not like adding an unencrypted device to the network.  After muddling through a number of Linksys menus on my PC, I was able to make the WiFi connection through the router to my iPhone 6+.  At this point, I had all the components on my workshop bench and the garage door going up and down.  Then I installed the door sensor on the top of the garage door and the hub on the ceiling using the same power receptacle as the Chamberlain garage door opener installed some years earlier (purple programming button).  The garage door would open, but would only sound the alarm and blink the light when asked to close.  I called Chamberlain technical support.  While stuck on hold, I tested the unit again.  Voila!  It worked.  I still had questions for the support agent.  To my disappointment, this is only a single user system, so if you install the app on another iPhone or iPad, you must log out of one device in order to log into another one.  There went hooking up my wife's phone, too. :(  However, the support representative assured me an upcoming new app release would enable multiuser functionality.  No projected date for the release, however.  My major complaint is that sometimes the unit works, sometimes it doesn't.  For several minutes at a time, the app can tell you that your door is up when it is actually down.  Doing a couple of manual opens and closes seems to reset the hub status a little more quickly, but what if no one is home?  Hopefully, the new release will address the reliability and consistency issues as well.  The mounting bracket that goes on the ceiling is a bit of a challenge to install.  The screw holes are masked from your view by clamps which have holes in them so you can insert the Phillips screwdriver and drive the screws into the garage ceiling drywall or a stud.  They should have provided some rubber washers to grip the screws so that you don't risk dropping the screws on the garage floor and having to go down the ladder to retrieve them.  The door sensor is held to the garage door by double-sided sticky fastening strips.  My experience is after a few hot summers and cold winters, you will be down at the Ace Hardware store to purchase fasteners with fresh adhesive.  The alerts that you can set up (also an opening/closing schedule) are unreliable as well.  So if you really want to know the status of your garage door when you are two miles down the road after leaving the house, you need to pull over and access the app (you can set up touch ID) and then bring up the app to see if the door is down.  Hopefully, it will be.. Better check again after another 10 minutes or so...  Chamberlain needs to improve both the hardware and software installation experience for the user.  They also need to work on the reliability of opening/closing as well as obtaining the garage door status.  That said, this system shows promise if they at least improve the reliability issues.  If the new software release addresses the reliability issues, I will bump the rating to 4 stars.  To get 5 stars, they need to fix the hub and door sensor mounting issues.
Malfunctioned after 1 month. Door sensor connection issues. Reset the whole thing then a few days later sensor loses connection again.

Integration with Alexa or iHome is not well considered by the manufacturer. It’s a ploy to extort a subscription fee just so they can put your data at risk. I’m going to return mine soon, unless an alternative is published.

This thing was super easy to install and works like a charm! No more wondering if You left the door open when you left the house - there’s an app for that. I just wish you could control it with Alexa.

Main issue I  am having is this is in an attached garage but unheated . Battery in door sensor constantly says low on app and this happens every time temp dips below 40 degrees. Have replaced battery still same issue.

The directions are somewhat sparse for installation but calling the customer service folks made installation very easy. These people are amazing. You know when a person is not reading the instructions from their computer and these people aren't. I hope Chamberlain never changes their customer service.
This product series does not integrate Alexa capabilities. Easy to install with the MyQ app and works as expected. Notifications via the app as sometimes delayed by up to 10 minutes or more.

We use it in conjunction with our standard garage door opener. It opens the garage in the evening when interference from nearby home security systems prevents our other system from working properly. Easy to use, not difficult to install,  the app is convenient and the purchase price can’t be beat.  The Amazon Key function is also nice. It notifies us anytime the garage opens or closes. We would recommend it, even if you just install it as a backup system.

Probably then single greatest home automation I have done. I can open my door, on my motorcycle, from a half mile away. Then I just pull in. I do wish I had better intergration with Smart Things and Alexa, but it still works great for my needs
Works well once set up, had issues with the device connecting during initial setup though. Overall great device to make garage opener smart.

Works great. Had one issue installing, but tech support quickly resolved and was open until 9et. Bonus points, they were native English speakers. iPhone App and Apple Watch app work great. Highly recommend.

The instructions were clear and it was easy to install.  Took about 20 minutes.  Love being able to open the door from a ways away so that I can pull into garage without waiting.  Also love the ability to have Amazon packages delivered into the garage.
Would not pair to my garage door, not surprised now that I've read the other reviews.Always consider how many 1 star reviews are left not just how many 5 stars.
I would give it a 5 star but I just cant, sometimes the door opens and sometimes it doesnt. If I could get consistency with the opening and closing the door I would actually give it a 5 star
It was a gift for my neighbor. She lives it as she doesn't have to return home if she can't remember if closed the garage door. She can now look at her phone and close it from her desk.

I had such an easy installation I don’t understand the bad reviews. I have some networking experience so that maybe part of it but all I did was watch the short video and install it. There was only one door to control which helped I guess.
does not work as described, tried contacting tech support could not speak to a human, they bounced me from one voice mail to another

I have been at it a few hours resetting and reprogramming.  So it looks like a need to upgrade my garage door opener.  I will try it again in a day or two but I have moved the hub to several different locations and still no joy.  Can't get a hold of support which is understandable since these openers just took a huge discount.

Super easy to install. I did mess up the day after I put it in and I had to re-link the unit that I put on the garage door and the main unit. But it’s been working good ever since. I like that up to 3 people can use it on their phone!

It’s easy to install and setup. 1 start because it lets the entire neighborhood know I’m shutting my garage. It emits a really loud high pitched beep before shutting the garage door. This should be a setting I can control. It’s so loud you can hear it 4 houses down! In the garage it’s deafening.Also 1 Star because it doesn’t have real Alexa integration. You can’t ask Alexa if the garage door is shut. The integration they have is the amazon key service.
Very easy to install, even after resetting it and reinstalling it, it worked perfectly, entire installation took less than 20 minutesAndroid User
Missing parts no wsy6 to install it..made my own bracket used me own velcro. Took several attempt s to connect to wifi. Requested return immediately..but kept it once retrofitted it

Now I don’t have to turn around when I’m almost to my destination because I don’t remember if I pushed the button for the garage to go down or if it made it down!Easy to install, if you can hang a picture on the wall with drywall anchors you can install this!  The internet/Bluetooth configuration was easy for me, instructions are easy to follow!  Rand had worked every-time as we use the garage door as our main entrance to the house!

I already have a garage monitor and control system I built with a Raspberry Pi. However this was on sale for black Friday and coincidentally we had been discussing the Christmas deliveries and porch pirates. The Amazon Key service seemed to fit our needs, so I went ahead and ordered it. Installation was straight forward and I had it running in less than 30 minutes including mounting and pairing with my home system. We've already had 3 delivered with the Amazon Key service. It's quite a relief not worrying about someone taking or packages.

I wish I could put lower than 1 star. This product is absolutely worthless. I have gone through 2 of these items trying to get them to work properly. The first one would open the garage door but not close it. It also had a hard time connecting to my WiFi which has 3 to 4 bars I  the garage due to my WiFi extender. The second hub would connect to the Wi-Fi but after being connected for 3 to 5 hours would then drop off the internet.  I do not recommend this product to anyone. Like I said worthless.

Installation and setup was easy. The instructions could use some improvements, the text instructions tell you just to open the app and continue with the install, but you have to dig around before you can find the next step to continue the install. Once I found that, it worked as advertised.All the reviews about the monthly fees can easily be bypassed by just using a smart home hub such as Wink. No more fees.

I purchased the Chamberlain MyQ Smart garage on a whim, the price had been reduced to 79 dollars and I had a 50 dollar gift card to use. So I said why not. So very glad I did! I took my time to install it due to the extra steps involved for Apple products. No headaches just pay attention to the instructions. I started playing with the app & settings. It allows you to do some pretty cool things. I like the warning beeps and light flashing to warn anyone the door is closing. Remote open and close functions. I've had it for 6 months and not one issue. Works great. Great refit if you haven't purchased a new garage door opener in the last couple of years with Wi-Fi capability.
This was super inexpensive, easy to install and worked with my twelve year old basic garage door opener.I have also loved the new amazon key delivery that is available with this.
More than I expected. Seamless set up with the help from customer support. Will be looking into soon integrating My!Q with my automated home security system. Great Job Chamberlain!

I got this because sometimes I'm in a hurry and leave the house and forget to close the garage door.  With this all I have to do is check on my phone and if the door is open close it.  Worth the money.

I love that I am notified on my phone when door opens or closes. several times my garage door opened when I was not home because someone in my area has a remote that opened my door.  I now can close it from my phone even at the golf course.

This product was very easy to install and get up and running on my iPhone. Only negative is getting the app to correctly install on my wife's phone. Installation instructions were best I've seen now just need to get additional devices easily functioning.
I bought the MyQ bridge and actually needed the hub as well. After emailing back and forth with Chamberlain about what exactly I needed they were great to help and make sure I had the right products.

Installation is very easy. Surprisingly easy to set up and get going. However, this is a very basic garage door opener. It can monitor and tell you that the door is opened or closed. A more advanced feature might be to auto close. This was not possible even with IFTTT. I have a Genie Aladdin and it has a few more features included.

Love this product! It’s super easy to install! I’ve already left my garage door open a couple times since I’ve bought this product. The app send me notice letting me know the door is still open and I’m able to shut it right from my phone! This gadget has already paid for itself! Would highly recommend!!

Instructions weren’t thorough but the application was obvious enough so I figured it out.  The device synced with my Chamberlain garage opener without issue, however the phone app intermittently refused to connect.

This product is waste of money. I bought it and it worked good for 2-months or so. All of a sudden it started to operate on its own like opening garage in middle of the day or night. I did reset smart garage, wifi. It worked good for 10 days or so and again faced the same issue. After having sleepless nights, I had to uninstall it and better not to use it anymore. I was really shocked, how serious problem it causes when it starts to operate on its own. I will not recommend this product.
Product installation was amazingly simple.  The only reason for not having 5 stars is lack of integration with Alexa.  Product works with Amazon key and should have Alexa skill but it does not.
Super easy to install. Unfortunately although it said it would work I was unable to get it to operate my Ryobi garage door opener. Sold it to a friend who had a chamberlain GDO.

I read reviews before purchasing and many folks had setup issues.  I installed and got it working in about 30 minutes.  I have only had it about a month but had no startup issues and so far it works great.  I would recommend this product.

This product works amazingly well once it is installed. It took about 3 days to get it linked up with my WiFi. I cleared it, re-installed it, reset it, turned it on and off, and was finally able to link it..... I still don’t know how I got it to work lol. After the MyQ was setup; it works like a charm. I LOVE IT!!

When I purchased my home, the seller on had 1 remote for our three car garage. Unfortunately, my vehicle's built in opener wouldn't work with the Craftsman garage door opener and neither would the 2 portable remotes that claimed to work with Craftsman. So my choice was to spend $50 for an OEM Craftsman remote or save $20 and have bluetooth access through my phone.  Took me less than 10 minutes and now I can operate my garage door from anywhere!

Nice.  Open garage door with phone from anywhere, even from your own driveway if you happen to not be in your own car with your normal opener.  Receive emails anytime your door opens or closes if you care to.
Looks like a pretty solid product.  Pairing it with opener took some time.  I am almost gave up, but in the 4th try it worked.  The light it comes with is extremely bright.  App works well.
So easy to install and set up was a breeze and the great price on Christmas sale made for a lot of gifts! just sync to your phone app and place the sensor correct side up and sync it all and done!
Works well when it works. Seems to glitch a bit from time to time and have to reinstall the app all over again. Could be because the way my house is setup though and how old my garage door motors are

I put this on my house and have used it several times to check to make sure the door is closed for those times when I question if I hit the button or not. I also have let my brother in the house while I was at work. Easy install. Will need to replace the battery on the sensor about every 4 to 6 months.
Great addition to my Chamberlain door opener. Very good price from Amazon with free 2 day Prime delivery. . Great to be able to open and close the garage door while away from the house.

The installation was pretty easy and smooth but the battery went low in 15 days this is rediculous i started getting notifications of low battery after 18 days of installation. Please replace my device.

I wanted a product to monitor my garage and be able to open it remotely. I originally purchased Meross Wi-Fi garage door opener but I found that it interfered with my actual remotes opening the garage, I couldn't use them from a distance. Like literally I had to pull up in my drive way and repeatedly press my opener before it engaged.This kit was much easier to install than the meross. I didn't have to connect anything to my garage door opener, or have to run the wire to the garage door sensor(My Q uses a wireless sensor). Best of all no problems with my garage remote control range anymore!
Easy to set up; works great. None of the setup problems some have reported; in fact, I’ve got the hub sitting on my garage workbench,  at least 15 feet from the door opener and the door sensor.
Several people I know have this and after talking with them decided I would give it a go. Glad I did and so will you. Very easy to install and setup.

Real easy to install, but doesn’t really fit in our smart home. Having to say “Alexa , trigger” is super annoying. And no apple HomeKit unless you by an entirely separate and incredibly expensive hub.
I wasn’t sure this would work on my garage door opener from 2006 but it works great. No more wondering if I closed the door. I can check my phone.
Integrations with other services are nonexistent. I cannot make it work with Google Home or Hubitat (except through IFTTT). Installation would be easier if I could hard wire the unit to the opener.

I am pleased with the myq system but during setup, I wiped out the remotes from my liftmaster garage opener.  I had to reprogram them because I didn't follow the instructions on not watching the yellow light when I first programmed the myq device.  It was my mistake.  So, follow the installment instructions carefully.
The perfect addition to smart home. Easy installation. Had a little hick-up during the sync process but tech support was helpful.  I have a Chamberlain/Lift Master . Works as advertised.
Setup was not very easy. I can’t use it productively. Synchronization  is not very good. It takes tome to open garage door after I push the button

Really simple install instructions that break down every step with visuals. Only took about 10 minutes to set up. It makes a really loud beeping sound when you close the door from the app, so be prepared for that.

Worthless POS hanging in my garage. Doesn’t work as described, and yes it was installed correctly. The app doesn’t know when the door is open or closed. What’s the point? Customer service is a joke. I was told I cannot have any led light bulbs in my garage. Who doesn’t use led bulbs now a days. I was pretty excited about this gadget. It’s JUNK!

I have been watching these for a couple of years, and the price was justified until this year. Under $30 is a great price to make your existing garage door opener a smart garage door opener. Definitely satisfied as it works perfect! The only downside is that it does not pair with Alexa (which may be a good thing!).

Works great. Ordered this one to replace one destroyed by lightning strike, did NOT have a surge protector at the time. This unit is easy to set up and use. Many times I forgot if I closed the garage door and asked my son, several miles away, to check for me. He loves it!
It works as supposed to. It was hard to install to Alexa because you have to a add an skill so that means open more accounts besides that it works great.

Unfortunately after going through all the steps of setting this up it did not work with my Genie garage door opener. I was disappointed because the write up made it sound as if it would work with most openers.

Easy to install, I mounted the Hub to the wall rather than my ceiling and it works great. Gives me peace of mind knowing that I will be alerted when the garage door is activated when we are away and that I can remotely close.

Great product,  totally worth the money.My husband use the leave garage door open.  After had to leave work and drive about 15 miles to close my garage door I decided we needed something and I found this product.  It took my husband 30 minutes to install and works just fantastic!!! Don't think twice,  it worth the piece of mind!!

Ordered this to add on to my original purchase of the MyQ Smart Garage Hub.  Both products are excellent with easy install.  But don't make the same mistake I did and order 2 of these.  The Smart hub can only control 2 doors max.  And because this sensor cost 75% of the Hub+Sensor package, I would probably just re-order the Hub+Sensor package again and have a second sensor for backup.  These products are great but the market strategy stinks for the consumer.

This product is quite unreliable. Shortly after we got it, it was reporting false open messages. Per the FAQ on the website, we replaced the battery on the door mounted sensor.  Now, a couple of months later, when trying to close the garage door remotely, it generated close errors, stating that there is an issue with the door safety sensors. Came home and was able to close the door with the wall mounted button without a problem. It’s quite frustrating and doesn’t do what it is intended to do at all.

So far the product has worked great, getting it to work with Alexa is a bit of a pain due to the need for 3rd party app “ifttt” but it works every time. Only issue is the small Transceiver that Velcro’s to the door itself has already fallen off. But I kinda anticipated that because it only uses Velcro strips.

Installation was much easier than I had planned, which was a pleasant surprise.  While I understand it is for security purposes, I wish I could set whether I can OPEN (Close no problem) the garage door via Google Assistant voice command.

Though the craftsman gate seems to detect the remote the app does not.  Customer service tried many times but blamed the circuit board on the garage door opener.  I thought I had a defective unit but the 2nd one ordered behaved the same way.  Three other remotes work just fine.

Works exactly how it is supposed to. I downloaded the app it told me to download and the app walked me through installation step by step. Very simple and straightforward.Only thing I got caught up on was that my garage door opener is a Genie Excelerator and when I was programming the hub to communicate with the opener I was told to choose the brand of the opener, which was Genie, but it wouldn’t pair with it. After trying for about 10 minutes, I backed up a few steps then saw Excelerator as an option for a brand of opener. I chose that one, and it instantly connected with no issues.

Does not allow you to open the garage with voice command. It initially worked with Google but it stopped working within a week after it was installed. Everytime I called for support I was sent to voicemail. DO NOT buy this product. The support is terrible.

Customer service was bad, this system is not fully wired. It has a battery 🔋 so you will need to replace when it is low. I ended up sending it back because the new unit I have is same price fully wired and very easy to install.Customer service of the manufacturer gave me round about reason why my opener wouldn’t work. Returned it and got the Meross, & so happy. I left a 5 star review for this products replacement.

Installation was pretty simple, was able to add two garage doors to one hub in under 30 minutes.  No siri integration with this model, and can't get Alexa to talk to it, but unless I'm in my house and need to open a the garage without being near it (never really happens) that's not a dealbreaker.

Easy to install and use. Haven’t added a “partner”, such as Amazon, and May not. Can tell at a glance if we’ve remembered to shut the door. Love to open it for company from any room in the house! Just what we needed!

Love this!! At times I get in a hurry and run out of the house. I get about a mile away and think did I close the garage door. Turn around and go back and check. Now I just check the App.if it’s open I close it from my phone.
easiest pairing of wifi, to phone, to unit I have ever had.opens door from a block away, haven't tried from across the country yet, but I'm sure it would work

Well done! A few easy to follow steps (on the app on your phone) and this install can easily be done in an hour. We needed a tall ladder to mount the unit on the ceiling of our garage, but other than that, pretty standard stuff. Definitely recommend!
Just the best option for garages now days. I have a used several times when someone at home forgets to close it. I get a notification and with one touch it will closed it

So far has not setup like it is suppose to, must have a very very strong wifi connection in your garage or it's useless. Did not say that on the product review. Setup was not helpful if it doesnt work correctly the first time.

I installed this to control two Craftsman garage door openers that were installed around 2003.  The app walked me through the installation perfectly.  I did, however, watch a youtube video covering the installation the day before.  It helped me to be prepared for the actual installation.  I've had this for about a month so far (now 1/10/2020), without issue.  I would need another device to make it Apple Homekit compatible, as it isn't with what's in the box.

Very easy to install with no issues if you follow the directions carefully. App is intuitive. My biggest complaint is the horrible beeping noise it makes when closing the door from the app. Sounds like a fire alarm or angry microwave. Apparently this is due to some kind of federal safety law, so you can’t disable the beep without some DIY hacks. Just be aware of it when deciding to purchase.

Installed on three garage doors and so far works very well. Easy install, just follow the instructions. I am very pleased so far and would recommend this system. The phone app works very well and is easy to use
Beyond frustrated.  Door sensor constantly loses signal to unit . Going to try 1 more time tomorrow.  If it doesn't work, its going back. So far its junk but I am willing to give it a shot.
It is great product with easy installation and well integrated app. However, it does not support Alexa to control/monitor. I still strongly recommend it to anyone want to make their garage door smart
Came home to an open garage door for the last time.  Easy install and it allows Amazon deliveries to be placed in the garage.

Takes time to get it right and I almost returned until I called the garage door people who walked me through. I’ve had for a few months now and only had a problem once where the sensor wouldn’t open or close my garage. I like being able to close my garage from my phone and get alerts when it’s open
Super easy to set up on craftsman opener. Beeping noise is rather annoying and long, but understand safety. Wish could turn down noise or make it shorter in length

It didn't work for me first, so I called Tech Support and it turned out I need to select Internet Gateway, rather than MyQ Smart Garage Hub on the first screen in the app setup.  Once that change was made everything else just worked as expected.I still would like to be able to connect it to Alexa and/or Google Assistant...  The app still displays options to link to Google Assistant, but I cannot find MyQ in Google Assistant as an option to add... :(

Very easy to install and works great. Bought a second unit to pair with first and it is perfect. There is a very slight delay(alarm goes off and lights flash, but I think it is for safety reasons). Have 5 phones paired with it ( 2 Pixels and 3 I-Phones) and no issues at all.

This is really just an average product.  Following set up on my main garage door it worked sporadically for a few weeks and finally seemed to settle in and work consistently.  Got another sensor to set up on second garage door and it isn't able to complete the setup.  Keeps throwing an Error (0000) message on the app, the three times it's gone into programming mode it's failed with "Unfortunately learning has completed unsuccessfully.  Try again or monitor door only" message, Chamberlain's website is no help with either of these.  When it's working it is convenient to have...but getting and keeping it working is a challenge.

If you’re lucky everything installs correctly the first time. If you have more than one opener then it’s a total roll of the dice. I spent hours troubleshooting and resetting and it still fails randomly, usually when I’m away from the house and can’t do anything about it. Spend your money elsewhere

It would Not connect to either of my networks so I tried my sons home, no luck. We both have several devices such as wyze cameras, Alexa devices, ring and other devices that all hooked up and work perfectly. I am returning it and will not try this product again.

I can never remember if I closed the garage door after leaving.  This provides me of way double checking with out having to drive back.  It was very easy to install.  Just make sure your opener is compatible.  I am very pleased with this device.
Works great with already installed Chamberlain MyQ garage door openers.  Nice to have visibility and crontrol of garage doors with iPhone app.
Occasionally loses connection to wireless sensor and doesn't know door position.  Only controls 1 door well.  If you add a 2nd sensor, things go wonky.

The MyQ is awesome.  My kids always leave the garage door open and it would frustrate me every time it happened.  Now I get an alert if the garage is open for more than 5 minutes and I can close it using the app on my phone.  The set up and install went quick and the free app is easy to use.

This is GREAT! I was having a problem with my garage door opening on its own them friends would let me know it was up when I wasn't home. Once I bought this, I know that if it happens again I can close my garage door from work and don't have to run home. It would have been easier if those friends had just stopped and put my garage door down but hey - we're all busy.

Worked great for 10min... After that kept getting error. Garage open,closed, wasnt consistent. Only runs on 2.4Ghz, very cheaply made, No wonder why its $30 bucks. Too good to be true, Chamberlain support no help just kept telling me it's an RF interference problem, lmfao. I have alot of wireless products from cameras to wireless boxes all been working great. Hopefully they'll come out with a better version... Already printed return label and back it goes!
Didn't like the way how the app strucks when in need

It was very simple to install. Works great. Eliminates that wondering 15 minutes after you drove away from the house, Did I close the garage door? You can check, and open or close from anywhere. I good buy. Recommend highly
It was easy to install; unfortunately it is not compatible with my garage door controller Martin so it only sends an alert to my phone when doors are opened but cannot actually control the doors.

I don't know how many time i left my house absent minded and could not remember if I closed the garage door. with the app always updating me and sending me notifications when it opens and closes its great. peace of mind is peace of mind.

This works great and it was super easy to install. You can set up alerts if your door is open for a certain amount of time, and you can just close it remotely. The instructions are only on the app, but it is really easy.

System works fine and was easy to install.  However, I seem to have lost the remote connection from my car since I installed it.  Don't know if reprogramming the car will mess up the MyQ.  Have to try it when I have some spare time.  However, it is a bit of a pain to remove my phone from my him pocket, open it, start it and then open the garage door.  Haven't tried Alexa Integration yet.

I purchase this because I have an older garage door opener and was having trouble finding remotes that work well with it. I would have both this and the Amazon expert installation and it works perfectly. I'm really glad I did this!
While I could not use this item as it was not compatible with my garage opener, it seems to be a good item. Easy to follow directions for installation and seems easy to use.

Have you ever left home and wondered if you forgot to shut the garage door...well with this unit your worries are gone. Get an alert anytime the door is opened or closed. Open or close the door with an APP on your phone....it doesn't get any easier than that.
Very easy installation witu great how to steps.  2 big cons.1) Have to pay extra to work with Google assistant
My garage opener was listed however it actually did not work.  As with many items that Amazon is pushing sales of, the attempt to add things that don't actually work.

Couldn't get to work at all. Thought it would work with my brand.  Did nothing.  By the time I had tried to install it, the return deadline had passed which i know was my fault.  But didn't rush to install since I thought it would do something at least

A friend recommended this, and I have also recommended this to my friends who have the same problem I do about whether I left my garage door open and having to go back home to close it.I was excited to get it. Then when I opened it, i was surprised to see that the installation was just two instructions, install the app and follow the instructions. It was a bit confusing. Then I looked on youtube for instructions, and it was easy to install. However, when i installed the app, it actually demonstrated the same thing as the youtube video.

Good for the price. Works well with my cheap 10 year old wayne dalton opener. It took app 3 tries in the connection part of the install. It works with my home automation software, which is a big plus.

It worked for a few months then quit! Their tech support is a joke! You spend 10 min getting through their Phone maze (put there to tire you out so they don't have to talk to you) then wait 45 min on hold !!!!!

About an hour to install.  Every time the door is used (open/close) there is a notification that the door remained open.  Trying to close it thru the app cycles out after two tries, and instructed to "manually operate the door".Almost every time - perhaps 75%.
Setting up was good and I'm sure it would have worked but silly me it didn't work for my garage brand was to old. So I had to get awhole new system
Turned my old dumb garage door into smart home device - I had to pay extra to link it to apple home kit but totally worth it

Once I realized that the app walked through the entire installation process, it couldn’t have been any easier.  I bought the add on sensor for my second garage door.  Works flawlessly and automatically closes the doors at night at my set time.

When pairing to a Craftsman opener with a RED learn button, as in the app set up, it wouldn't pair. So I reset the and used Chamberlain, they make most Craftsman,  with a YELLOW learn button it paired right away & all functions work. I guess they ran out of yellow buttons!

Just installed this item.  What can I say.  It opens/closes my garage door using my cell phone app.  It also let's me know if it is open or closed.  I would rate it higher it the app had some more features and you could buy sensors for your other garage doors.  Hopefully that will be soon.
This is one of the greatest technologies I have purchased from amazon. It is so convenient and easy to install and use. I linked it with amazon key for all of Christmas delivered in my garage.
We installed the app on 3 phone & its far more easier to open & close the garage. We still haven't tried giving access to amazon or other drop offs.....someday! :-)

Installation was fairly easy and it works better than I thought. I was concerned since my wifi is not that strong in the garage but it works even with a weak signal. I am happy so far and it serves the purpose I purchased for.

Works perfectly. Easy install. With phone app open/close options anywhere in the world, it is fantastic. No more getting up to ensure you closed the door. Phone will give you real time info at the touch of a finger.
Great gadget. Annoying safety feature. Should be on by default, but have an off switch if customer wishes to silence it. I don't want my whole street knowing when I open and close my garage door.
Due to thieves breaking into vehicles and using the remote garage door opener to gain access to the house / garage, MYQ is a very good solution to use a cell phone for garage door access.

My old outdoor keypad is failing and needing replacement. I decided to try this instead. 15 minutes to install and it works awesome. Got my 1st Amazon Key delivery yesterday. I see a lot of negative reviews but all I can say is I had no install issues. I do have very strong wifi in garage and I think that is probably key.

Well, I got this thing to work ok at first and was pleased. Then I tried to get it to work with home kit and it totally messed up everything. Apparently the apps permissions allow it to delete anything in Home Kit including deleting the home. Now I need to re-add 20 home kit devices and rebuild the home. This product sucks.
Device is working well except the myq app not working well as before. It used to notification me when the garage door is opening or closing but somehow it doesn't work even I set it that way.

I have had this product for awhile now and even got one for my father-in-law. Can tell you how many time I leave and cant remember if I closed the door. Also works great to let someone in when needed....like the plumber. According to this page it works with Alexa...….I don't think so for security reasons but will investigate.

Great product!  love it! Great for someone who is absent minded. WiFi connectivity has been stable and I use a range extender for the same. Extremely happy with this! Great value also and so simple to set up!

Fails frequently. All kinds of sensor errors and connectivity issues. Pain in the @$$ to reconfigure every time the sensor battery dies. That said, when it works, it's very convenient. Just dont rely on it.

thought it would be more difficult.  works great!  a lot of the converters tell you have to run wires to the opener.  this doesn't need any wires. just pairs like the wireless remotes and setup wifi though the phone.

Unfortunately this didn’t work with my Genie SilentMax 1000 that I purchased in 2012. One important item, the board on my opener was replaced in 2019 which might be the reason for the  incompatibility.

Got this as an add on for my main garage MyQ. It installed in 10 seconds and the addition of the second garage door took a other 1-2 minutes. It continues to work great. Only downfall I’d the price. It’s a small lightweight plastic piece that seems like it should be cheaper. Regardless it works great.
With it only being partially functional all it could do was tell me if the door was open or not. I didnt test any Alexa functionality. Returned.

This has made my life so much better...I can't count the times I have left the house before and second guessed myself if I close the garage door or not....Now just look at the app and it tells me....Two Thumbs up!!!

Awesome product! Super easy to install. Had to try a few times to pair the hub for some reason, but finally got it to work. The only downfall is I wish it had direct Google home integration. At this point, there is no way to see your garage on the Google home app.

Works like a charm. Actually bought mine used from Amazon and had issue setting up, but the good folks from Chamberlain took care of all of those issues in less than 20 minutes and had it up and working. Big fan of Amazon and Chamberlain.

I have 5 adult children who are constantly coming to the house and i need to have a reliable way to open the garage door as the outside keypad usually quits working in the cold weather. Bought on sale and installed in 30 minutes works great, i just setup and we all use the app to open and close the garage door.

Chamberlain missed completely on this one. I purchased two, one for the shop and one for the garage and neither will communicate with the openers and one is a Chamberlain. Seemed like a nice addition to the Alexa controlled house but this unit needs additional engineering.
Got overzealous on Black Friday. Do your homework and make sure it works with your door before purchase. Did not work with my Guardian 6000SL. Gonna move soon so keeping it for when that happens.

Followed the directions and had the unit installed and working in 10 minutes.  Push notifications and scheduling are features I was most interested in and they work perfectly.  My GD opener is a 15 year old Craftsman with a red programming button.
The app based install instructions were super easy to follow. It took15minutes to have up and running. I have a 5 year old genie unit, I had no compatibility issues. I would highly recommend.

I use it open my garage when I am not in the car. It really does the job so I can get into the garage with using an opener.  My phone is always with me and it is really an awesome product.  Also can let my family and neighbor install the app to be able to get into the garage

App is unreliable, logs me out and does not allow me to log back in, or app freezes on the loading screen. Makes product worthless and therefore I had to spend more money and buy another garage door opener.

I like the myQ Smart garage as it gives me piece of mind to know that I didn't leave the garage door open as I used to return to the house after driving about a mile to check to see if the garage door is closed .

MyQ occasionally works. We’ve call tech support and tired all of their suggestions. We can open/close remotely a time or two then it doesn’t work again. Just buy a whole new system that had WiFi integrated.

Great addition to make your old garage door opener into a smart garage door opener. I just wish it offered the unattended remote close option that the garage door openers with the built-in MyQ feature offer.
Works well when it's set up.  Not an easy set up.  I followed the instructions exactly but had trouble doing the set up from a Android phone.  Tech Support helped me and we got it working.

Bought the device to help with issues with the car garage openers, it is a great product when it works but tends to be real sensitive, many times the connection the base and the remote does not work and then you have to delete the item and reinstall it
I have one in my main house after a wifi extender into the garage i got it to work and it does the job. Tried at my beach house and would not pair with wifi or my garage door opener.  Sent it back.
This product has made our life much more simple, easy installation. Love the features of opening through phone and connection with amazon, to have packages delivered into garage is AWESOME.
Excellent customer service! I had a little trouble getting this to work with my opener but I called the technical support team and was able to get it to work within two minutes. Bravo!

This garage door opener was very east to install and operate.  Works while connected to my home Wi-Fi and while using the app from anywhere else I have Wi-Fi or data connection, using the MyQ app.  I would have like to link this with my Google Assistant, but you need a paid subscription with MyQ for that.

Set up went fast, precise and reliable. Don't bother with the paper instructions provided in the package.  The paper directions will have you check the connectivity of the door sensor with the wireless hub BEFORE you pair.  Download the MyQ app first and start there.

VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!!  This product does NOT work with Alexa - even though when you search for garage door openers that work with Alexa, this device pulls up as one of the first choices. Bad move by both Amazon & MyQ; very misleading. Further, you don’t realize this until after it’s installed, therefore, returning it requires uninstalling it. RIDICULOUS!!!!

i think it is probably a good product.  was easy to set up and connect to WIFI.  problem was the liftmaster 8500 comes 2 ways apparently.  The issue is the opener comes with MyQ controller.  not much good with out WIFI motor.  i still gave it 4 stars for setup and install.

If your garage door opener has a myq on the side of it all you need to do is program it to the hub. DO NOT TRY AND INSTALL DOOR SENSORS. Just program directly to the door opener, once you do that it will work like a charm. You only need the hub if door opener has myq on it. Door sensor is only for doors that do not have capability built in.

Highly recommend this product. I bought this as a Prime Day deal but would totally pay full price for it. Easy to install and the app is very simple. Love that I can set schedules and receive alerts when the garage door doesn't shut or something blocks it.

The first one I got didn’t turn on at all so I exchanged it. The second one was not compatible with the model of garage door I have even dough it said in the package it was. Too bad. I was really excited about this.

I had this installed and working in less than a half hour.  The install process in the app is the best I've seen so far.  It walks you through the process and includes videos that make it super simple to install.The app works perfect, very happy with this!

Installed it according to plans. Would not open or close. Turns out it wouldn't pick up wifi in the garage. I run computers through the wifi in the garage but hub would not pick up signal. I kept moving it closer until it was right next to the router and it still would not pick it up.I would return it but kids threw away the box. Not worth the money.
Disappointed by the opener's integration capability. Alexa and other integrations can close but not open the garage door. The garage door also inaccurately reports the door is open.

Working good with my second garage door opener.  BUT  for folks still have Chamberlain with CIGBU Internet Gateway, please be aware.  If you have two garage door openers and one of them is controlled by CIGBU then you can get this HUB to control your second garage door opener.  If you would like both of your garage door openers to be controlled by this HUB, then you need to get an additional Add-on Door sensor.

Product went up, in and on in minutes. No more turning around to check that the door has been closed. And if I’ve forgotten to close at night the scheduler closes it for me. I also receive alerts if the door is opened during times that no one should be home.
I have two garage doors. I added this since the original kit worked so well. I can see if my doors are open or closed, even when away from home. I can also close them remotely. Great product

This system works great to you want to pull out your phone to open your garage door or if you want to allow amazon to deliver to your gatage.. aside from that look elsewhere. The door sensor is extremely unreliable as sensing up or down and the system cannot be controlled by alexa which is why I bought it. Alexa auto is just going to have to keep being a playlist instead of a functional system for me.

This is awesome, I recently installed this on my garage and it works great, I had a couple of contractors working at my house and when they showed up if I was at work I could let them in. The one thing I wish it could do is tell you when operating it if the door was up or down. It will tell you its closed for say 2hrs but I would like to know as its closing if its closed at that time.

This product is great when it works right. But since buying it less than a year ago the one sensor has failed. The second one seems to be failing now. I have spent a lot of hours on the phone with customer support.  It’s not a polished product that it should be. The constant need to trouble shoot it is getting on my nerves.
This is just an extra sensor for the MyQ Hub system. Will allow you to control a second door with your Hub. It will not work without the hub. Easy installation and use. Great product!
Very impressed with this product.  Easy to install and the App is easy to use and understand.  I like that I can add my family members to the app so they can control the garage door too.

This is a great product! My kids are always forgetting their keys or when someone else is watching our house it never fails they lock themselves out. This puts a whole new perspective on entry control. Very easy to setup once installed and so many ways to keep your house, garage, shed, etc. protected. Great for families with small children as it can let you know when the door is opening a closing.  Could prevent children from being injured. I love it! Putting in a second unit in about a month!
I got my unit started off great, but we realized it was defective, draining batteries quickly. Customer service sent me a new right away, now it won’t program. Very disappointed.

The convenience of being able to check whether or not the garage door is open or closed- while at home or away offers some peace of mind. And the open feature is much better than my garage door remote.Occasionally I get an error message but if I close and reopen the app- it will clear.
Great price, fast shipping and easy to set up. Simply download an app and go through a half dozen steps and your garage door is automated. Excellent investment.
Like the remote use of it thru phone. It would had been much more helpful if it had real time notifications of opening and closing of garage door. Overall satisfied with the product.
Man this thing works great wasn't sure how good it would work based on the distance from my router but I use it all the time from anywhere and I've never had a problem

NO FEE. Those posts about fees are OLD! This device turns your pre-smart garage opening into an instant Smart Garage system. Installed in 10 minutes. Added a few custom alerts on my phone. Done. Highly recommended.
I used this to replace a more expensive option I could not get to work, so I was happy with the great price, and that this just took a few minutes to set up. It works well from anywhere.

Product works well, had to readjust the remote had problems recognizing the door being closed.  Was easy to install.  Nice able to use the Touch ID otherwise would be a pain to type in password every time using the app
Great product.  Installs and works perfectly when installed per the video and provided instructions via the MyQ App. Follow the instructions and it works perfect with a iPhone 11.
App works great.  Step by step instructions were simple to follow.  Works as advertised and for $30, wow.  What a deal.  Replace GoControl zwave that I had issues with.  This is way better.

These are great, have installed a few for clients. I wish the beeping 30 seconds warning was adjustable. Some people (for example early or later shift) want to leave the house and not wake up other people. Otherwise this is most excellent!
I bought this because we live in the vicinity of a Marine Corps base and the radios frequently disrupt our garage opener signal. Installation was simple and install took less than 20 minutes.

Setup amazon key. Amazon won't deliver to my garage using their own carrier.I knew this before buying but poor home automation support and poor design. Could have used zwave and a better wifi adapter to make conectivity stable.
